9Ut6vqEvmeXmK3QpLUf2Cg.text: We stopped by JC's Steakhouse to ride out the rain tonight.  We tried the charcuterie board, chicken corn chowder, French onion soup and crab cakes...all were amazing.  Definitely will be back again!

loRzOWKjbtA5-FvXX4teyw.text: I've always wanted to come here, and I finally did tonight! Not a good first impression either. The girl at the register was ridiculously rude to me. I can safely say I've never been treated like that before! I'm sorry there was loud music and I couldn't hear, and I'm sorry you had to roll your eyes at me and raise your voice just a little bit louder. Seemed like an intentional rudeness too..maybe it's just me? Mac and cheese is good though.

aRvhtW97VRNkfkESpGydgg.text: This is a cool place to get work done. There are community tables, so you might make a new friend.

hvqFXpA7ccz6wIMma2X17w.text: Have been here a couple of times...normally it is very busy and the workers are not the friendliest. Actually, for the first time, I was not intimidated by the workers there. It was also slow so maybe the pressure to keep the line moving plays a role in the attitude. That aside, the man that helped me was very nice, and so was the woman (red-haired, cool arm tattoo, nice look to go with the shop vibe). Two thumbs up guys :) I will be back and may explore your food options. There are so many and I would ask questions all day, so I will look at a menu.   P.S. Thanks for the pineapple-ginseng tea recommendation! Delicious B-)

Cqf8q75k6mKXThRwUURFsQ.text: This is one of my favorite stops to make when I'm in Phoenix. Their white velvet latte is amazing.

s2aKkzO5xwCa46RQf6tIiA.text: Delia's Cleaners in DC Marketplace, DC Ranch, Scottsdale  Picked shirts up and one was missing, replaced by another which was not ours.  Was told, "sorry, we'll have to look for it and we'll call you." Meanwhile we had paid for all the shirts already. We asked for some documentation that we paid for all the shirts, but one was missing. They were unable to do that and clerk was rude.  They found shirt and called to pick up which I did. When I arrived, different clerk barely said hello, handed me the shirt, when I said thank you, no response. Very rude overall, will not use them again. They send all their shirts outside, risk of losing a shirt is higher than most. Mistakes happen and we would have understood if they had been apologetic and accommodating. All we asked was something saying we had paid for all shirts but received one less.  Never using them again.

0IXTPHgHblWviWJKSkoktg.text: Great coffee, friendly folks, tasty brekky (only meal I've had there) and a cool little bar area in back serving well made cocktails. What more do you need!?

VgQKAQ0YYQbDDQVplQRPpw.text: I love this place! The pastries are amazing the coffee is amazing. Very relaxing and cozy. Great service too. ;)

utZXTZGw6xEc2LYWlH2jUw.text: Love this place! Great laid back atmosphere and service is superb! I recommend ANY of their bakery goods. Haven't had a bad one yet!

P32pGC37G1JLYXlPodVg2A.text: The place was a bit small for my liking and super crowded!!! The coffee was delicious but I wasn't too impressed with the food. Also the customer service was a bit snooty..

UYfB_KempYqDvBMbVorVwQ.text: The name of this place says it all. Such a lux place to sip on coffee, read a book, people watch and study. An even more lux place to order a meal too! Ive been here twice and the drive is always worth it. The employees are super friendly, people courteous of seats, very hip, a great find!

UnhlAGiptAaenPidDKdTKg.text: This place is truly unique, and deserves 5 stars.  I too am now obsessed with this place!  The atmosphere is like no other you will find in a Phoenix coffee bar, people will actually interact and talk with each other, read, study, work, talk, watch television. It reminds me of being in someone's cozy living room.  I absolutely recommend this place!!!

gmzvdyCUC47PxY1SUZnfRg.text: Lux is one of my most favorite local coffee houses. We stop in to hang out or grab a coffee to go. Great place to do homework. We buy Lux coffee to make and enjoy at home too. Great treats. Always different. Friendly.

t_wu315yiRiGYsPhcwCkmg.text: Consistently excellent coffee! Line is almost always long, but moves quickly and is very much worth it. I highly recommend grabbing either a jalapeno cheddar scone or muffin if they have them out. For those craving a rare cocktail, sit at the bar and have the bartender make you something fancy. I recommend a Rimbaud's Left Hand.

IhLzL94u7sxyACDasJOjvg.text: Found this place a few months ago through a friend. Nice, little coffee shop with a full bar as well. Coffee is VERY good. Also open later than places like Starbucks. Weekdays till 12 and weekends till 2, I believe. Prices are reasonable. Atmosphere is cozy. Lots of college students on their laptops. Lots of hipsters. Everyone generally nice and you can overhear some crazy conversations. Smoking permitted outside. Has a full bar, in-house snacks and meals. Also has a full bar. All types of people come through.  It gets busy most nights (or at least nights I've been there) and the only bad thing about it is that there isn't enough seating!

Dizvr3Pruy2wnWv5pI52pg.text: Fun, the hipsterness of this place is a little over the top, but the coffee is great and food is clean, wholesome, and tasty! Much of the food (prep) and the coffee and pastries and prepared in the open, or behind glass, so the main area feels very open and European; with decent art on the wall.

awNjX-BOx_TXyjzli4FhoQ.text: Coffee is on point! Super hyped on their espresso. Can't get enough of the salted chocolate chip cookies. I need a Keebler elf to deliver them to my house. People watching is amazing. I could be a fly on the wall there for hours. I've never seen so much thought go into ones outfit but hey, if you don't look good the food and drink won't taste good. ;)

d5W5pw3es7MjMpBNfHFaAw.text: Great independent coffee shop with really good coffee, great service and amazing clientele.  This, Hob Nobs, Luci's, Urban Spoon and Copperstar Coffee, along with Cartel Coffee Company in several locations, are my favorite independent coffee stores here in the Phoenix metro area.  If your dilithium crystals are running low, dock at any of these eclectic coffee shops to get your fix on.

52Xgq5XV2xMGIlN1GeetoA.text: I went back to Lux the other day and sat at the bar. I told the bartender I didn't want soda and I didn't want alcohol. He made me this amazing concoction of lemonade, a fresh lemon, cherry flavoring, and fresh mint. It was delicious! I told him he should put it on the menu. You should go order one so he will actually do it.  Also the fact that I was doing my college homework at a bar made me laugh, but they said they're used to it and all the med students come there to do homework and drink.

aqHGH6mqGr4pv4T-wxZFKg.text: Ultra hip to borderline comical at times. Which makes me feel at home. What's not to like? Chill, laid back, good coffee & treats, breakfast, made from scratch drinks..,yeah you'll find me there with my love every once in a while.

A-X4N0hu6TpoViHZY9ORMw.text: Great coffee, always a home made vegan as well as non vegan bakery item and usually several to choose from. A menu of daily food offerings as well as a daily soup/ stew. And again always one or two items on the menu for vegans.  Nice place to hang out and socialize. Possiblely get some work done. But every time ive been to Lux on Central its always been crowded. And the music is usually loud. Other then being a bit cramped for space and at times having music too lound. This is a great Cafe.  All the items are house made and fresh.  If your hippster this is where its at.

FfXwp-ryL0T3KEZecp2QJA.text: This is a MUST SEE in Phoenix. A hipster coffee shop and breakfast spot by day and a relaxing metro bar by night. Wonderful food, amazing coffee and the best atmosphere and music. Absolutely love this place, and stays open til 2 am on weekends!!

S8N6MTxcsnJ0WUVpj9htvQ.text: I would have given it a 5 if the service was better. They were just too busy t handle everyone but they tried. The muffins were good and the coffee was strong which I liked. I will come back.

a4i5AkiWFhpBVHJ2TWXOVg.text: Mmmmm....the coffee here is legitimately awesome! So good I bought some to bring home! The food, snacks, and pastries are okay, nothing that really stands out. Always busy, also has a patio area, and in door seating is a little cramped.

UpbS7O80aGKdTHC9LqVZFw.text: It's really hard to beat this place. Whether you are  craving an excellent beer, a good glass of wine, or some delicious Mac n cheese. You can't go wrong here. The staff is super friendly and great on a consistent basis. Sammy, who kind of does a bit of everything creates all the artwork for the place and trust me it's really amazing local artwork. If you catch him behind the bar in the main room, sit there and have a chat with him, he will give you all the ins and outs about whatever beer or even cocktail you are interested in having. If you are an out of towner you have to come here at least once. Cheers!

TLuQaFamnx629Hsm7P2FwQ.text: This place is great for eating with friends, reading, or getting some work done. Their coffee tastes delicious, the pastries and rest of the food are also tasty. They have a lot of cool decor and retro seating.

ajFJN83CPatT8B1TENrdyw.text: I've been going to Lux since I was 17, I am now 26. When they were next door in the tiny shop next to the Pane Bianco entrance with like 5 wooden tables and none of their chairs matched at all. I love and dislike this place and just when I think I am completely done with Lux it keeps pulling me back like an ex that's back in town. Maybe it's the weird electronic music playing in the lounge areas while the employees in the kitchen are listening to  reggaeton/bachata. Or could be the great coffee, drinks and the awesome baristas... I don't know.  I love you Lux.

llv0Gd9Xxm0LVlMFwnd6ew.text: Only area that was available to sit...we had to eat on our laps for a moment because it took 35 minutes for someone to clear the table. Not cool.

tB1f6oyXdLPWBuhhNOAYFQ.text: Lux is appropriate: Daytime, nighttime, by yourself, with a friend, with a group, on a date, studying, working, people watching, zoning out looking at your caffeine, or alcoholic beverage, of choice (they have Henderick's gin btw).  I always get a London fog (earl grey latte with vanilla) and get brunch.  It's busy and loud, but they get through the line quickly and the food and baked goods make for a perfect morning.  There are multiple rooms, benches, couches, cute  !@# chairs, tables for groups, outside seating... you have options! I've enjoyed this place with friends for years and I hope it always remains a happy little part of Phoenix.

UOOCwB7HkT8v4jF9JITKQg.text: Good luck finding this place, but it's worth the effort. Phenomenal atmosphere, coffee, and food.

qz3tY9nlCdH-_wmPswqt-w.text: I used to go to Lux when it was just a little coffee shop next to Pane Bianco.  This was my first time back since they got their own space next door.  I think they really upped their game.  Great craft cocktails and delicious food.  I had the Old Cuban and their grilled cheese and was happy with both.  And our mixologist Sammy was amazing!!!  Great service and fare.  I would love to come back.

brnJ0I6FgVNjIKSl0k715w.text: Great ambiance and coffee...didn't have any food but the menu has a lot of good options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It's a perfect place to relax and enjoy a coffee with friends

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

shGpBYG-dH_W0JT83RNcqg.text: So I want to give LUX Central four stars because it's always so crowded. BUT... I can't bring myself to do it. The reason this place is SO crowded ALL the time is because they're doing EVERYTHING right!  Their food is delicious, their drinks are delicious, their pastries are delicious, their bar is VERY well stocked, their service is outstanding, their ambiance is electric, their brand is SOLID... If not for having to park half a mile down the street then elbow my way through a teaming mass of hipster humanity, LUX could be my everyday go-to.  In all seriousness, if you haven't been here before, you need to check it out. It's the ultimate coffee bar, which is saying a lot since the Phoenix area is host to a whole lot of those (with more sprouting up every day, it seems).  One of my favorite things about LUX is that, despite the constant surge of customers, everyone who works here always seems to ENJOY working here. Honestly, I don't know that I've ever had such consistently positive service anywhere else.  I can't recommend LUX highly enough. And truth be told, there ARE in-between hours where the rush dies down and you actually CAN find a spot to park at with your computer for a while and take it all in. So give it a whirl - you won't be disappointed.

FIHAjXNOMqxaXxi4hWu8qg.text: This place has changed so much since high school. Which by the way I graduated 2006. My friends and I will come here everyday after school. This was the hangout spot. :)   I love how there's different rooms, different atmosphere in each room. I love this place. A really good place to catch up with a good friend. And of course a good place to do homework and such.:))

I can always use an amazing unique dessert like those made here!

bKkgfQesGlu8JgVggMcQvw.text: I visited Lux for the first time with a friend for coffee and breakfast. The atmosphere was great! The place has hipster vibe as well. It is also has plenty of space to sit inside and outside.   The coffee was everything coffee should be. I ate a blackberry orange scone - delicious!   There's much more to be explored about this place, so I will definitely be back to try out some other things!

Q1kq4MfB49AIOY7ofUkNFQ.text: My new favorite spot in PHX. Lux you have everything right..cute, cozy, drinks & food are so perfect. I love it here and wouldn't change a thing

Pc7Vl4g30qFAFsTuJF8KEA.text: Really cool and hip place for a great coffee and snack. I ordered an Iced americano with a sugar donut and was pretty happy with both! Although the coffee was good, the donut was more memorable. It was a sugar and cinnamon donut, but what set it apart was it's use of salt in the dusting mixture. I loved the contrast that the salt brought to the sweetness of the sugar and cinnamon.  I've been here a few times at varying hours but probably wouldn't recommend it as the type of coffee shops you go to study at, because it's always packed and loud.   Other than it always being too crowded I really like this place and would go back, especially for their pastries!

_OZl3PsrihiML4zVp9V_KQ.text: The best lattes I ever had.   I usually go to Dutch bros because they have a drive thru.  But, honesty if I could I would rather stop here.  You can tell it's the best when you can't find parking lol.   If I wasn't a busy mommy this would be my to go.

SkK5AUJCVzLJ4xQ73uLKTA.text: I come from the PNW where we take our coffee seriously, and this is seriously good coffee!   I'm lucky enough to live nearby, so I visit LUX often, and the coffee, pastries, food and service are always consistent. And consistently good!   Ok, it can be a bit confused and chaotic at the register when there's a crowd, but be patient, and I believe you'll  be delighted with your experience.    I refuse to use any variations of the h*p word, because you see all sorts there, and that's a big part of the fun!

10IOnqtN-370fErZzTXFvQ.text: I fell in love and died in coffee heaven. And this coffee heaven has a bar!! YYAASSSSS!  Upon entering, I immediately felt that warm, familiar feeling in my gut. you know, the one with butterflies? Yea...that one. I get that when I'm excited or nervous. We rolled in at around 8pm and this place was busy but not overwhelming. I thought it was just the size of a Starbucks but we kept on walking...and walking... turned the corner...and walked some more! It's huge! To me, it felt like a fusion of a hipster bar like Harvard & Stone in LA and a boutique coffee shop like Urth Cafe, also in LA.  Choices for lattes, coffees, and teas were aplenty, dessert spread was to drool for, and hot diggity, they serve dinner too! AMAZING! I can hang out here all day and night and wouldn't need a reason to leave. And I really mean that because I can grab dinner then stroll over for a drink at the bar! Excellent...  I absolutely love it here and will be a returning patron!

1RYIO_ktsilmKpsiyqzV6w.text: Not as easy to find the front door  Luckily there were two locals sitting at Pane Bianco coaching me through the door. It was pretty busy when I was there around lunch time. Locals love to camp this cafe! The coffee was wonderful. I nearly got another before I left!

zUhu_79EJU90Z58ctdbI_w.text: This review is specifically for the mac-n-cheese with jalapenos and bacon. It deserves its own review.  Every time I come to Lux, I glance past the mac-n-cheese. I mean, how exciting can American restaurant mac-n-cheese be? A customer sitting next to me at the bar ordered up a bowl. It looked pretty enticing. He asked if I ever had it before. I said no, and he looks me straight in the eyes and says "you gotta do it." By the tone of his voice, the mac-n-cheese must have been an experience.  So tonight I did it, but instead it done me...oh it done me. It done me good.  Beatles fans, holla if you hear me!  I learned to make proper "macaroni pie" from a West Indian friend. You slow-cook milk, cheese, onion, a bit of flour, salt, and pepper into a delicious, aromatic cheesy creamy white soup. Then you pour al-dente elbow pasta into a baking dish. Then you pour the creamy cheese soup deliciousness over the pasta. Then you layer shredded cheese on top and bake it all together. That's how you get tender, creamy mac-n-cheese. Lux knows the deal, and they took it up a notch by throwing jalapeno peppers and bacon into the mix.  As a baked mac-n-cheese chef trained under a West Indian macaroni pie sensei, I tip my hat to you, Lux. Well done.  Edited: A tip for Ms. Andrea O. Being a pleasant customer goes a long way. Being not-a-mega-bizatch works wonders for getting good service. It works for me. You may want to try it sometime. If you suffer from perma-scowl, you could draw a smiley face on a paper bag and place it over your head.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac-n-cheese with jalapeños and bacon. Yummy, melty, tender, and creamy with a spicy kick...and BACON.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of Luke&#39;s creations, the Aviator. Refreshing with a nice tart kick. Luke, you are a champion.

lHCU8omzrbOjArpEjtvoJQ.text: *here is the review you had deleted , I stick by it*  yes this place has good coffee, but what a bunch of rude pompous asses. I am just saying I am az born and raised from a hardworking family and back round . When I come into an establishment the last thing I need is for some trust fund hipster know it all to twitch his (or her) handle bar mustache at me with an equally annoying hipster stank eye, when I order my (in their opinion ) shitty cup of coffee. Sorry if i did not hash tag an over price thrift store shirt on my twitter , or order my special decoder ring from some homeless want to be spoiled brat to get the latest cool memo from the wonderful lux asshole cafe . But here is just a few tips that might get you a few stars   1. after you argue with me over an extra shot not being a good idea in your wonderful cup of coffee, dont include yourself in my conversation when I finally get to enjoy it . Just to correct me on a subject in a condescending tone that I am actually quite knowledgable about due to heritage and experience .  2. dont give me shit looks and long sighs when I come to the counter .  3.dont correct my opinion of coffee I actually have taken barista courses so maybe you can dip into your hedge fund and go to a couple yourself before you blabber your opinions all over my good day.  4. dont smack your lips and tell the person behind you in a shit sniffing tone mocking my order.   5. believe it or not before you found your dream job as a barista and wasted all your parents money on a art degree, remember I have worked my ass off to just enjoy one simple cup of coffee with an extra shot , in a fun decorated establishment with a shitty leaf scribble across the foam. So if you gave two shits about the extra dollars I would so eagerly throw into your tip jar, shut the fuck up smile and just say yes would you like anything else? and talk shit about me at the end of your shift like the rest of us.

jUBX8b_UBnmhPkY9efk7tQ.text: One of my favorite places!!  Miss living down on central . Pastries and drinks are always a 10!!

TpNPGuIPuSP1ZK1e6gv2Gw.text: Sorry but we went last weekend to try some delicious coffee. Had heard great things about the beans. When we got there, it was confusing on where to order. The music was so loud my companion couldn't even hear me. We walked past where the roaster was and trash cans were piled next to it, so it just seemed dirty. Too bad. It was very busy, but no one was cleaning off tables where someone had finished eating. Just too unsanitary for me.

zkjVrmVNcNPehHtiQZkBfA.text: Service is great. Servers are friendly. Cool, eclectic vibe. Iced Americano was as good as any I've had. My new favorite coffee spot in PHX.

MSiaZKeksg66g7AXo7ifLA.text: The coffee and pastries are to die for and there is no room to complain about that, unfortunately I could not say the same about their bar drinks. I have had about 4 drinks from the bar in my many visits and each time I regret it immediately.

ETRCDlP7q0eMq3hjzzU_Jw.text: Awkward set up that is messy and unorganized. It's one of those places where you are not sure what to do or where to stand or where to get your food and coffee - and they don't care. They are trying so hard to be hipster and cool that they forgot about customer service. They just need to re-think they way they operate, and I think they would rock, since the coffee is very good. The food is just average, however. My biggest complaint is that there is one dark haired short girl that works there that just seems out of it and rude. She does't look at you when you order, and then end up making you repeat yourself several times. Also - she's not very polite. Maybe I just wasn't hipster enough for her.   I think most people go here b/c of the hype and to scope out others... If you don't feel like getting looked up and down while you drink your coffee, don't go here. Lola or Urban Beans are much better.

wNFb1tTm9MCBErgOxCD4UQ.text: I am very adventurous and I often stop in to check places out first, so I am glad I read the Yelp reviews before I did or I never would have found the place. Sure, you can see the sign out by the road, but the sign announces three separate businesses and there is no discernible entrance. You have to park in the back lot and walk in from the rear. There is no sign above the door. I wouldn't have found it if I hadn't known to look for it, and if I hadn't been brave enough to blindly walk into an unmarked business. You could park on the side, right where you pull in off of Central Avenue, but know that you must go in at the middle point where the two buildings meet, and it feels like a back-door entrance. You must be cool enough to know how to get in the place. (joking).  The menus are shit. Meaning, you really have to look around hard to find the menus--it's not like there is a big wall menu above the counter, which is how it SHOULD be. It makes it tough for people in line to decide what they want, because everyone is craning their necks around everyone else in line just to read the posted menu. It is TERRIBLE. So they should improve on that. However, that being said, the bakery items on display look fab, and to taste them is divine. I wound up grabbing a box of pastries and a coffee to go. Best scones EVER, and worth $3 a piece because they're big.  My Americano was not that good--it tasted like it was made from instant coffee. But at $3 it was big and it was hot and it was coffee. That was okay for me, but I probably will not order that there again. It looks like they have lots of much more interesting choices to choose from, and if I had more time I would have tried something other than my old stand-by.  The food menu exists...you have to use bifocals. But look for it because the lunch and breakfast entrees look WONDERFUL. The seating looks more conducive to coffee and cocktail drinking. There is a big long table inside that looks like you can eat a meal at it. It is community style dining. There are tables in back, and tables outside that look like you can eat comfortably there.  I have to point out that it is the most hipster/pretentious place EVER but in a good way. If you feel uncomfortable being judged by the hipster group, don't go. It is a really cool place and I plan on taking my sister there. She'll love it. My kids would hate it, but they are teenagers and think they're  too cool to be seen there, if that makes any sense. I loved it but in a fishbowl kind of way. I am not that cool, but I liked looking. What will get me back there is THE FOOD!  Oh, and the people are VERY FRIENDLY! :) ...which is always a plus.

e8k0AdJ_aLTKrvub7cXIMw.text: Fun little spot, if not overcrowded. My only complaint was when my order was given to another customer. Twenty minutes went by, so I went to the counter and they said sorry someone else grabbed it. So I said I'll wait for another plate to be made, and of course they were out of what I ordered. So a little disappointing for my fist visit.

0s5uyZ4q6FtGWwKDSsrumw.text: One of the leaders of coffee in Phoenix is Lux. What's amazing: the coffee, the espresso, the baked goods, and the location. The service is always good, but there is little time for chatting because the line is long. What can be a drag is that it's busy all the time, but it's not a fault.

Ciy6q7oG3ysjS0AuZkqbGw.text: I just discovered this place and I live down the street.  I went there last night and have a feeling I will be back many, many more times.  I had the chocolate salted caramel pie and a velvet coffee drink.  Both were excellent.  It was very crowded but the wait was not long to pay and get my items.  My only complaint is that it's very hard to find the menu.  I want to go back for dinner but I literally couldn't find the menu for dinner, so I have no idea what they have.  I saw people eating mac and cheese, so I know they have dinner foods.

dvYzeyy4arlOvoOKoQOqgg.text: Environment looked promising with an almost-filled crowd.  The coffee tasted all right (ordered a latte and an americano), but weak compared to other coffee shops I've been to.  The latte was well-made, for sure.  Received a little bit of a snobby attitude from the staff who were walking around.  The staff at the counter/register were friendly though.

c2GSP5xIMq-f9evNij2Reg.text: Ah... Lux. This review is hard to write because I am so torn!  The pros: *Amazing coffee - my fav is the iced velvet.. It tastes like a piece of red velvet cake *Their homemade whip cream! *drools* *Their assortment of baked goods *Their salads and lunch foods *So many different places to sit inside and cozy up  Cons: *Staff- this is where they lose points for me. I have only encountered maybe 2 friendly people who work here. there is one gal in particular who REALLY needs to freshen up on her customer service skills. I mean really... It's scary how unfriendly she is.  *The fact that you basically have to beg them to put whip cream on your drink. I'm sure a lot of people don't even know they have whip cream. They keep it in this hidden container in their fridge and they skimp on it big time - depending on who is working *If you're not hipster, you are going to stick out like a sore thumb. I usually come in my work out attire and people typically look at me like I have just sprouted an extra head. It's quite comical *They stop serving breakfast at a certain time (I can never remember what time) but they keep the breakfast menu up all day and when you ask for something from the breakfast menu, one of the suuuuper friendly (sarcasm) baristas will bark at you that breakfast is over.. Which you are then forced to go back and look at the small food menu that is printed on a piece of paper and all of the hipsters who are in line get super annoyed at you. I'm sorry I'm not a regular who comes 5 times a week, I guess I don't know the protocol?!!  Anyways, I continue to come for 2 reasons.. The amazing coffee and the fact that it is middle meeting ground for my best friend and I.  If you go, and you're not hipster, just make sure you are prepared for their snobby attitudes and you will be just fine ;)

ITV01wNQzMaZwd7xvzjZhg.text: Great quality coffee, they know what they are doing. Great drinks too. So hipster it hurts. Love them alot cannot wait to go in more

YmyAoBKJC0x3Qaw1zvXH1Q.text: On Saturday, October 18, my fiancee wanted to do something nice for me after pneumonia had confined me in bed for nearly two weeks. After looking up a few reviews, she decided to try Lux, a cafe I had visited a few times in the past. Excited to get out, I agreed to go and looked forward to breakfast, which did nothing more than disappoint me.  My fiancee and I parked the car on the street and walked into the building to find a disappointingly long line. As we got closer, it became apparent that only one register serviced the entire line. While some employees did come out to ask what drinks they could get started, we still felt the line could have been decreased had another register been added. I ordered orange juice and biscuits and gravy, and my fiancee ordered orange juice, a Danish pancake, and a side of bacon.  We ordered our food and searched for a place to sit. After another long wait, our order finally came up. The pancake and the biscuits and gravy presented themselves well on the counter; however, the bacon did not appear anywhere. Thus, I asked one of the cooks about the bacon, to which she answered coldly that the meal did not come with bacon. Considering this cook might have misunderstood me, I clarified that my fiancee had ordered a side of bacon. When given a second opportunity, most people generally take advantage to correct a mistake. Instead, this cook callously answered that no bacon was on the ticket and went back to work.   At this point, I returned to my fiancee and asked her for the receipt, as I had perhaps misheard her order. She did not have it, so we both returned to the ridiculously long line and went directly to the cashier. The cashier commented that the computer system is horrible, did a few things on it, reprinted a receipt, and handed us some kind of card. Not having received an explanation, I asked what the card was, and she explained that it was a $15 gift card. She further explained that the side of bacon would be ready shortly. We finished out meal and discussed how disappointing the experience was.  I have decided never to return to Lux because this company does share the same values as I do. Most of the staff seemed very slow moving, despite a long line and long wait times for meals. In addition, the dis-service offered from the cook does not instill trust in me for the person making my food. The disorganization and rudeness of employees turns me off, and I would rather give my business to companies that offer friendly, prompt service, such as Starbucks or even Dunkin' Donuts. While you may be a local business, that alone does not entitle you to my business, especially when you offer sub-par service with a lack of systems and courteous staff. I would rather stay confined to my bed for another two weeks than subject myself to this poor excuse of service again. All in all, we had to wait in a long line, fight several times to get the food we had ordered and paid for, and be treated horribly all before noon on a Saturday.

KEgbQda5s3e6oGuhtOOjSg.text: OMG the coffee at this place is UNREAL. My first time going i was impressed alone with how amazing the coffee was, then a regular recommended the in-house made whip cream... its now a MUST. I drive 20 min out of my way to get coffee here, the service is always amazing, the food and drinks are amazing and the place itself is so cute and funky. You have to try the whip!

sKbijStBy4T1QDzD-gI25g.text: Can or will be the most hipster coffee house you've ever been to, knit hats, beards, tats, and Macs a plenty. The bold roast is very tasty as well as everything I've ever had there. Some very very good bacon, a la cart with eggs, and some great hash browns at a reasonable price. The people who work there however could learn the menu over. There was a liquor and beer bar there and the don't sell Irish coffee. I asked for French roast, even though I saw it on a menu... They were also clueless. Overall I really enjoy the product, but the atmosphere can be a little overbearing.

D9ZlIPZgNJXjxCjolvgJTg.text: This place is pretty great. Unlike some reviews, I found the staff to be pretty awesome. Even if they are in a bad mood, smile at them and they'll smile back!   Their coffee drinks are pretty legit and the pastries are some of the best in the area for the price. It would get five stars if they had more selection of coffees but maybe it's because I like my coffee black. Overall, best coffee house in Phoenix so far.

ldB1d3xV8R3asObI8l5uAA.text: The line in the mornings tells the whole story. This place is amazing and everyone knows it.

jy0_UlhUnvQm2cLvMFebsg.text: Delicious food and coffee! We had the Egg Sandwich, add sausage for perfection! I ordered the dutch pancake, topped with a variety of tasty fruits. my son and I enjoyed! Large variety of desserts, coffee and hand crafted cocktails that really caters to anyone. Loved the rustic cafe look and decor inside. A unique experience from your typical Starbucks Coffee shops, which is exactly what we were looking for. Music was nice, and the staff was friendly. Overall we enjoyed the experience. A little crowded for my taste, with not many tables to sit a family/child.

RWiBa9rH_l9rKBZYSPO9Kw.text: One of my favorite things to going to coffee shops, whether it's at home or while traveling.  I should qualify this review with the fact I have not visited every coffee shop in the Valley, but I have been visiting Lux since they were in that small space that Pane Bianco took over.  I have always enjoyed the coffee and haven't met one of their baked items I didn't like...a lot.  They are also usually far quicker at getting my coffee drink to me than some other places.  I love the vibe here!

7E-_5q036k0JFWTDAVlB4A.text: I'm so confused that I've never written a review. This is my favorite place for coffee and serious chilling or serious homework cramming. All the drinks are fabulous and the food is also really great with options! The wait is usually crazy long so be prepared for that. My favorite part is the decor and ambiance; I love the old little vintage plates they use and the mason jars full of iced coffee while you sit with a friend in big puffy pink chairs. This place is the best. Thank you lux never change

-8_WUtFV2fulRhmCYlXIqA.text: The coffee is great, but the cocktails are better.  When I asked for a drink menu the bartender told me he prefers to "dialogue" to understand what I'm in the mood for.  I said, unsure of how to respond, "Boozy, with coffee and cream?" OMG.  Best. Drink. Ever.

nrvkk3FKaEgGIG6V83pOeg.text: Lux is a great place to work on your novel, or pretend to be working on your novel while the cool kids watch you. Great drinks and vibe. If you are a hipster that pretends you're not a hipster than this is the place for you!

9AsXUaR-5LYXwhOoV6vGlA.text: Stumbled upon this little gem and had the best experience ever!!! Their caramel macchiato was absolutely delicious. I paired it with the most delicious raspberry cookie I have ever had. Ordering was so easy and the girl that took our order was so nice. I will definitely be back!!

AfFfGVGoAqADW6mfQHzIsg.text: Gave it another try. Coffee was better this time but still tasted sour. The steamed milk was better than last time, but you could tell it was done in a rush.  What was amazing was the Coffee Cake I tried. Crunchy on top, yet creamy in the middle. with just enough cinnamon to not overpower the other flavors.  Based on that alone, plus the ambiance and the crowd I'm awarding it a 4th star.  The coffee needs a lot of work, though. A shame, given that this should be their shining star

tgWElXx8VOZJSxLeSPnVQA.text: Great selection of drinks and food but WAY overpriced. It's surprising to me that this place stays super busy with prices like this. I've been a customer since they were a small place in the adjacent building and the menu has definitely been expanded with the building size. All good things (minus the prices). Ambiance is eclectic and trendy. Can be a little noisy for studying but good for conversations. Overall, I would recommend this place just wished the prices were better.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1bacJUC_wKtUcHtaI1A6yA.text: Lux is a fabulous and friendly place to frequent. Where everybody knows your name, smiles and amazing coffees, pastries and bakery offerings including amazing quiches, breakfasts and soups.   Their single origin coffee is incredible, a firm favorite of mine.   An eclectic feel to the restaurant and bar, various feels to the different rooms and patios, all welcoming and chilled beats from their resident DJ.

pw_lRDsyr0Um7gUO5EsjdQ.text: This a a great trendy place with great coffee.  I was sold on the flavor and the boldness of this coffee so I purchased a one pound bag to take home with me.     The ambience is great with colorful art and lots of outlets for computer geeks who want to camp out and work here all day.  Love this place!

Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lounge Area that faces outdoor patio

V4fizwRhIqjxnAC9ZWXfLw.text: So IDK where to even begin with this dump. Should l start with pissy staff OR the poor layout OR that patio? Jesus Christ that patio... I'd rather drink coffee in the bathroom from Saw. Or that hole in the ground from Silence of the Lambs? Remember that,? Where he put the Senator's daughter. Anywho... this place is just plain terrible. If you're standing in line plan on getting knocked around by rude busboys carrying tubs of dirty dishes. God forbid if you ask a question about the menu. You can hear the eye roll 2 blocks away. I've never seen such a rude staff from jump street. Did you ever see that Pop Copy sketch on Chappelle Show? This place is like that.  But for the life of me l don't understand that patio. It's like a redneck's back yard. Giant wooden spools for tables and the crappiest furniture. I mean seriously,  I've seen nicer patios at 35th Ave and Rosier. That patio is the saddest thing I've ever seen, and l volunteer at a children's hospital.

bfLzX4qlrJI3JxD85Z1wig.text: Ambiance - both down-to-earth and hipster, very unique interior design that feels comfortable yet seductive. Great place to meet friends or do light reading during the day (before it gets too busy). 5/5  Drinks - I got the mixed whiskey drink that was both delicious and not too sweet. Their plum green tea was pretty good too. I would get the alcoholic drink again. 5/5   Service - very friendly bartenders and serving staff. They're open to making conversation when you want it and let you be when you're busy working. 5/5  Yup, I'd be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Thirsty crow&#34; in the middle - delicious mixed whiskey that&#39;s not too sweet. I&#39;d order it again

I6aJKNEfufRn_pUYPMMjxA.text: Hippest place for coffee but what's with the main stream top 40 crap music? Whiny, cloying,  over produced Bubble gum R&B, you know the kind: teen girls stomping around with audio headgear. How does that fit with expertly made coffee drinks, inspired food and pastries and groovy furniture and vibes??

YT_Ai4hNRHBvmZB6V6vkQg.text: TL;DR: the coffee was amazing, but dairy milk alternatives are an outrageous $0,75 surcharge. very few meatless/cheeseless food options, and they're not very good. the space itself is cute but intolerable when crowded. staff are b-holes. - the good:  -the space is interesting and mostly well-furnished: mid-century modern and contemporary furniture mingling with (as other reviewers have accurately described) your typical boring trendy "logs of wood as accent tables" designs. there's a lot to look at while you wait, including the crowd.  - the coffee and espresso-based drinks are really, really good... expensive, but good.  the bad:  -nut/soy milk is 75 extra?! it costs the same as dairy milk and doesn't spoil as quickly, so why the extreme surcharge? Lux doesn't make it by hand. it comes out of a box. even starbucks "only" charges 60. - for some reason, you and everyone else in line to order wait in the exact middle of all the foot traffic in the cafe (???) and the menu (a standard-size sheet of paper taped to a glass wall among other non-menu sheets of paper) is easy to miss.  - even after the morning rush, the inside of the restaurant is always packed and dimly lit, making the space unpleasantly loud and claustrophobic. - all the food i've ever eaten at Lux has been middling at best. the croissants and pastries are nothing special tending toward flavorless, same for the plain bread/toast, avocado toast was unseasoned (ie. no salt)  the ugly: - staff are rude, condescending, aloof. holding up the loooong line to have conversations with customers (wtf dude, c'mon), being disdainfully told to "read the menu" then "just order a side of veggies" when asking about meatless options... ohhkayyee, thanks. based on the reviews of other yelpers, Lux is clearly aware of the problem and have done nothing to discipline or train employees. no it's cool i actually want to be talked down to by 22-year-olds who all seem to follow the same instagram makeup tutorials and shop in the same urban outfitters.

TKGjFzCG7tW2jTFOI3Mupg.text: Heard so many great things about this cafe from a friend who used to lived out in Phoenix for years. Finally got the chance to come out & check it out myself, I have to say the entire concept of this place is pretty badass. The second we walked in we were greeted by a line almost out the door, can't blame them with such great variety of pastries. Had a difficult time making up my mind on what to get since everything looked amazing, staff happily assisted me on how to order and gave me great recommendations of their liking. Pastries were so superb that we stayed for lunch as we were curious to see what the food was like. Even ended up taking some road snacks, I rarely say this but believe me everything here was amazing. I really enjoyed the fact that they had a DJ inside lol Get the vegan donuts! I'm not vegan but they were so bomb.com

GcnwRHu0IyyLieZHvkCNLQ.text: The best iced vanilla latte. I get it half sweet and add the in house whipped cream. A stunning selection of baked goods tempts you while you prepare to order. A selection of fresh fruits and vegetables is pretty cool. Interesting seating with a secret room

uUrdm2vrLKvQXs0AeORzoQ.text: Dude! This place  it's a gem! I have found myself driving 30 minutes to spend my weekend afternoon getting work done here. The food is really good(a little pricey-hence the 4 star) but it's definitely not just you microwaved sandwich type of place. They really take their time making your food. I've indulged in both their yummy coffee and cocktails cause I'm indecisive - and if you like options this is the place for you! You can just come and people watch, watch sports in their large projector in one of the many rooms (which I didn't know existed till my bathroom search turned into an adventure). Alternatively,you can just put on headphones get work done and enjoy the great vibes. Definitely recommend checking it out. It gets quite busy too

YXxrUvzy0PcEg-Y-8fiEig.text: Very popular spot in Phoenix close to the local high school in public transportation a bit crowded in the morning time.  Chai was a bit expensive. Very limited options on gluten-free goodies

Grlv43ilacs6NvMxjj9PZw.text: This was one of the coolest coffee shops I've been too. The staff were great. I'm super indecisive but they helped me find something that was perfect for me. I also got the Blueberry Banana Almond Muffin and it very yummy. Overall GREAT experience. Highly recommend!!

ubejzTd3xpQP8T5ytWCsiA.text: My favorite place to study! I might live in chandler but i still make it down here. It's loud but the coffee and snacks make up for it. The baristas and other staff are very nice always make me feel at home; I just wish they had misters outside and more study tables!

CsT-zZITEOv8ckMJT4G8Og.text: Wow! An incredible place! Full of delicious homemade pastries and quiche. The coffee is excellent and the atmosphere is uniquely casual comfortable and friendly. Customers are conversational, smiling and quite content. There's an open bar, separate areas for computing, reading or meeting. This was my first time in Phoenix  My friend is fortunate enough to be in walking distance. Her boxer holds court at Lux engaging young and old alike.

KhMTFxATyR6J1szT85a5_A.text: Knock a star for limited parking and very limited seating inside especially during peak hours. Yikes! But the coffee and food/pastries are delicious!! Friendly staff and great atmosphere to chat with a friend or work on schoolwork! Go to spot for awesome coffee and a cool vibe.

IYiTYqdHCA3CgA0bO5KbJg.text: Overall, breakfast pastry selection is off the charts and fresh. My issue is that they can't get a $21 steak and eggs right. In the past, I've had my steak and eggs made spot on. On my last visit, "medium" steak was over cooked and dry as a bone, and the poached eggs were almost well done. I also went when there were no other patrons waiting for food and it took over 20+ minutes for them to make my meal.   Vibe is hipster but casual and not pretentious. I will go back for a quick "grab and go" pastry, but I'll skip the wait for over cooked and over priced steak.

ZebkDre2Ixk7vztAvhztgQ.text: Awesome! Delicious late night dessert and mocha. A welcoming surprise to see the cocktail bar around the corner. Comfy couches and tunes to both help stimulate and soothe.

cX6Ssk-NopCsRPenV_-EAw.text: Place rocks if you like coffee and like parking 3 blocks away. Small homey feel. I would love to see some pizza in this joint. Toilets are small and I'm a big dude . A lot of weird people in this place . Shoot your way in and out your in the hood

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EIuzDo6j6zrNGFBvMOPJGQ.text: This place is amazing! WiFi, coffee, pastries, and wine. Cool staff, good vibes. Went here with a couple of friends one night for a late night coffee run. Really cool that they're open late too, I believe until 1 am. I didn't get anything, but my friends did. Looking forward to making this a place I go to get some work done.

OU61dGAksRMOUD9OmCEbrQ.text: Easily one of the best coffee shops in Phoenix. Solid place for studying (good number of power plugs), meeting with friends or grabbing a bite. A little toward the pricy side but it's worth the experience. Staff are very friendly without exception. Their bacon mac & cheese is to die for.

xfpA_gzgQiK0fns-m3vg6w.text: This place is ungodly hipster pretentious. I feel like it should be documented for future film use for some ironic comedy. I used to live at the apartments next door. I went to Lux with my ex BF because it was close and easy but I always just wanted to bail as soon as we got our drinks. It didn't help that some lady who worked there never wore a bra and always made a point of going up to talk to my other half while ignoring me. Nothing says customer service quite like free range boobs hugging on your significant other while people wearing flannel hang out typing on laptops and silently judging the non hipsters. Parking sucks. Coffee and baked stuff are mediocre. Food is way overpriced and they definitely think it's more original than it really is. Lame.

oksDnvR6nNne5o9x4nbiog.text: When I visit a new city, the first thing I try to find is the city's perfect coffeeshop! I think Lux takes it for Phoenix.   Casual, hip, & trendy atmosphere. Their decor was a mix of simple, modern with a vintage twist, I loved it! The workers were very outgoing and friendly which is always a big plus. It was hard to find seats because it was super packed but I'm not complaining.  The noise level was pretty loud so I didn't understand how people were studying here. It seems more like a place for social outings. All in all, I enjoyed my experience at Lux.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JxwL_TWA1bd_2h78CzH_pw.text: My favorite cafe in Arizona! They have everything I want. Wine, salads, deserts, coffee, cozy couches and WiFi!

3gVneGG8JizLK_CX3rM0QQ.text: I was in Phoenix for only a few hours and wanted to enjoy a great coffee. I Yelped and came across this establishment. The space is very enjoyable- from it's rustic decor to its music (a DJ was spinning on the Sunday morning I popped in). Full bakery, wine and beer corner and excellent savory offerings for anytime of the day. I enjoyed an avocado toast, cappuccino and homemade chai latte. Worth the Uber I took from my airport hotel.

WlwGNCxVs0lQHQ-AJNiovw.text: Definitely my favorite coffee shop in the Central Phoenix area. By golly, they even offer dutch pancakes (please allow 25 - 30 mins for this)... wow!! It's pretty fantastic! My drink is deifinitely a hot Black and White which is a mocha with dark and white chocolate... great balance between the bitterness of the dark and sweetness of the white chocolate.   Plenty of parking and seating. I never realized that they actually have a full bar. I may never leave this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black and white

_mLk8qfDnGVcQvTdXyl4aw.text: Super great service. Trendy atmosphere. Went there for first time and will definitely go again. Their expresso machines were down but they made every accommodation with great communication to those just arriving. Despite the snafu the place was packed!

kUVhzaCeCDXZqoMmNnd01A.text: Lux lives up to its hipster hype.  Go here for the hip, bohemian feel you crave from Soho, Central Phoenix, or similar places.    I prefer getting my things to go because this place is always crowded and parking is a nightmare.  This is why I dock them 1star.  However, Lux is conveniently located just off the lite rail.  I am not sure how many times I have stopped in Lux over the past few weeks for a cup of coffee and a breakfast sandwich.  This Friday was the first time I noticed the bottle of Tito's and next to it a bottle of Hendrick's.....  This place has a bar?  Oh, gosh, they do!  Well damn!  Oh, I never envisioned myself as a hipster hanging out there eating at the the huge tables with my laptop on their free wifi or in one of the comfy chairs reading a book, but I see a book, comfy chair and cocktail in my future!  Stumble home....  Repeat.  Lol... Stumble home from the coffee shop.  Funny.  I highly recommend this place.    Return factor 100%.

-pc-RdwogUr-41leAUEyog.text: The place is just awesome.  Great service and nice atmosphere. It has such a unique arrangement of the chairs and tables.  It is a hip place even for an old guy like me.

kfqh0cxVR0dJ4srLGLu7iQ.text: This is a great, novel place for coffee dates, group projects, and studying thanks to some quiet corners around the building.  Their pre-made pastries and coffee were decent, but their dutch pancakes (savory and sweet) and mac and cheese really stole the show for me.  The mac and cheese was creamy and buttery, and their savory pancakes (toppings varied by ingredient availability) had a nice smokey flavor to it. I really enjoyed the food and look forward to trying out other items on their menu.   Concerning their atmosphere and setting, I was a bit overwhelmed by the layout of this place as a first-timer since their kitchen/work area are separated into different locations (bar area, kitchen, cashier, etc.). While I appreciate the modernity and transparency of the set up (seeing workers as they went back and forth through the "customer area"), it can be a bit difficult navigating where things are during the first visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet and savory dutch pancakes with a side of mac and cheese. The toppings of the savory dutch pancake varies by available ingredients.

xdI5ea1r_8FalxbD3a3BkQ.text: This has been one of my fav coffee shops for nearly 10 years. It gets busy but it's spacious with a lot of seating (also some outdoor seating). Their lattes and mac & chs are delicious. They have a bar, food menu, pastries and coffee drinks. There is a parking lot that fills up quickly but there's street parking as well.

Jv8p7QY6lUh1uMejXIkVeA.text: I have been here half a dozen times.  Love the energy, dessert and coffee drinks.  Most important is i love the happy kids that work here!   This is just a great place with an awesome hipster vibe.  Took 4 girlfriends here and they loved everything about the Lux.  The norm for me is start at the Tiki and walk to the Lux for dessert!  Try it a great game plan!!

jCxK0D0UjAIcXN1xQmZ7Qg.text: Love this place! Extremely hipster, if you're into that sort of thing. If not, the coffee and food is still worth the trip!

M0pMCFXKNYnShTfwm-aJuQ.text: Yes please!  Adorably hip vibe with garage sale furniture and accessories that somehow blend together to create an eclectic and impossibly cool atmosphere.  We would have loved to partake in one of the coffee creations but it was evening and we would have been bright eyed and bushy-tailed into the wee hours of the morning.  Instead, we settled on a piece of cake (that was bordering on ridiculous - it was that good) and a couple of sea salt chocolate chip cookies.

PPx04-qvR3MiGuUf4fHCXA.text: Please fix the WiFi. One of my absolute favorite spots in Phoenix, but we won't be able to keep coming if the Wi-Fi isn't fixed. Thank you!

J40IGrI8NN1x4t3kPKgCjw.text: Parking is limited or park on the street.  This is a coffee joint with food, desserts, alcohol, etc.  Came here to hang with a friend.  The place was packed inside and out.  We opted to sit inside since it was a little cold outside.  We stood in line to order and found two spots inside.  the hard plastic hard and a ripped up old couch.  I got an hibiscus ice tea and a cookie.  I was hoping for more desserts to pick from.  The only thing good was the ice tea.  The place was so loud, it was hard to even converse with my friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green tea with maple syrup pecan tea cake
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green tea with hibiscus &amp; Nutella thumbprint cookie

9uiK8f37MzF8DuPy880RZg.text: My college student son brought me here for breakfast one morning. What a funky, cool joint. Very hip. Nice vibe. Excellent coffee and coffee drink selection. I had steel cut oatmeal with fresh berries which was superb. Nice selection of pastries and baked goods. It was a Sunday morning and there was a DJ tending the turntable with an eclectic combo of tunes. Full bar. Just a very cool, hidden away fun-place,to go.

AK2stF0lnEK0r6s4jOqCLA.text: Lux is superb. Best quiche I've ever had! Get there early though, as it sells out quickly. All the bakery items are quite good actually.   The coffee is fantastic - fresh ground, freshly roasted beans are surpassed only by the delectable espresso-laced whipped cream if you are in the mood for something fancy. Try it on a cappuccino or just get a glob on the side. You'll be addicted in no time.  The made-to-order food is also delicious - great place for eggs. To top it off, you can come back in the evening for a drink - there's a small bar that makes really memorable craft cocktails!

7XHFSzSkuV5_ANFmLwX86g.text: Bookings.com is not to be trusted. For a vacation to New York city, I used Bookings.com to book the Helmsley hotel in Manhatten. Unfortunately, the day before I was to arrive, Bookings.com notified me that even though I paid in advance, the Helmsley had cancelled my reservation. Bookings was kind enough to provide a list of hotels for me to rebook, The problem was that all of the choices were substantially more costly than my original reservation. When I called Bookings, I was assured that I could book any choice, and they would assure that the Helmsley would make up the difference. I rebooked and after my vacation, I called Booking to find out when I would be repaid. They said to wait, and would call back. After two years and many calls and letters later, I know that I have been had. Do not trust these people.

3RdZ9-RoyssQ74RxZl5tmw.text: This place rocks. Super casual, hipster, friendly, comfortable, stylish, all without being snobby. Most unique coffeehouse/cafe ever.

6QIEBqKc34C-SwaoLrwe1Q.text: You'll think you're in Silver Lake, not Phoenix.  Everything about it is cool - the DJ was so good I got his card - and the vibe was just perfect for a Sunday morning.  People chillin' here and there, keeping to themselves mostly, just the way it should be.  And I didn't even get to the food:  you must order the pancake thingy.  An A+ find.

6A-08t83vR7jdGy1-r1Rtg.text: Today I decided to take a little light rail adventure, with Lux as the end goal.  I was very happy when I got here to find plenty of comfy seating and a menu with many different options.  I decided on the hot apple cider, topped with whipped cream. It blew my socks off.    I then settled myself in to a supercomfy chair on the wall and spent a while reading and people watching and generally enjoying my surroundings.  Everyone at this place was giving off good vibes, and I had a fantastic relaxing afternoon.  I will be making this trip more often.

6wNiNkOI2KQL3kMuBSb1lw.text: Super busy, but not in a bad way. Awesome vibe. An eclectic mix of people congregating, working, relaxing. Great drinks. Bartender seemed very much accustom to their drink menu only, though. Went in the afternoon. Curious to see it at night.

nXvQBiX99UklLs6MrRn8eA.text: Very cool place. The service was excellent and everyone was so friendly. Haven't tried the coffee but the wine is amazing! Definitely will be back.

nbFKOtH4hekbTT87GpJjfg.text: I hit this place once or twice a week. Food and drinks are amazing. Cool place to just chill.

FFjuzBlhy73f9wttlMDeaw.text: I have been there 3 times and the food has been great. But the one thing that will give it a 5 star rating would be if they change the tortillas. Not having homemade tortillas leaves it without the authentic taste. Change the tortillas and I will change my rating.

3sAMrofg45KvI6eb00cm1w.text: Lux serves great coffee. The staff is a little iffy - sometimes tending to be impersonal or even rude. But I have also had some great staff experiences there.  Usually Lux is busy, so good luck finding a seat. The atmosphere inside is great. Local art on their walls is constantly rotating. There are tons of electrical outlets which encourages using their free wifi!  If you go during lunch time do not miss out on stopping next door at Pane Bianco for some of the best sandwiches in Phoenix.  Lux's pastries are good and they offer a verity of specialty bottled drinks. If you're a fan of iced tea try it with mango syrup - it's wonderful and not very many coffee shops I've been to have the mango syrup. It is my personal favorite. Also I love their soy velvet (a soy white mocha). Their smallest size is much smaller than average coffee shops - probably 8 ozs. But it's great if that's what you're looking for. All their lattes come with two shots of espresso, so you're only paying for more milk and syrup when you upsize, so buy according to how much you enjoy the flavor of espresso.   Their drink prices may seem a little high, but they're worth it. Plus their menu is elegantly designed. Tax is included on the prices listed, which features price points either on the dollar or fifty cent. Purely simple!

qP9HOQKVOvaKHHxyi4cAjw.text: Best coffee I've had from a coffee shop, delicious drinks, friendly staff and comfortable environment. The house coffee was always strong and bold, but has a smooth earthy flavor. The bloody mary was my favorite late saturday drink, it was spicy and perfect. I give four stars instead of five because of the heartbreaking horrible pastries. A pastry should taste delicious and colorful and beautiful. Fuck the fat and sugar....it is a PASTRY folks. The pastries here taste like a bowl of plain oatmeal. Anyway, other than that this place is awesome.

6NoQ_OxOLPhjnp2HEolrpg.text: Love Lux! The best coffee Ever. The wine is amazing and the Mac n cheese is so tummy. Great atmosphere and lots of areas for large groups. I love Jeff and everyone at Lux.

_fEoQAqdAvOSOSbHfT8Vew.text: Okay, I want to give this place three and a half stars. I really wanted to like Lux based on the reviews, but there are things that prevent me from rating it higher.   #1 - I once wondered where all the hipsters roamed in Phoenix. Then I went to Lux and I wondered no more. Pretty much everyone had an apple laptop here. Me and my vaio were the odd ones out. This is just an observation and has not a lot to do with the overall rating.   #2 - It was crazy crowded in the middle of a weekday. The place itself isn't that big, so I assume there's a big following (confirmed by the number of reviews for this place). This made it difficult to lay my things out and have adequate study space.   #3 - Smaller space + people = really narrow walk ways when people are standing in line to order.  #4 - Coffee is good, but not as strong as I personally like.   With that said, the perks here are ambiance (fun art on the walls that I imagine are changed everyone once in awhile), good people watching, parking despite the amount of people here, and the fact that its by the light rail.   So yep, Lux is a solid coffee spot, but I think I'll keep looking for the coffee shop of my dreams.. with table space and stronger coffee.

d3QhJ7jfw0Od_rZcXrmc2A.text: Well I feel conspicuous as well as comfortable. I'm 57 and don't match the average demographic sitting amidst the "Retro" inspired gathering place. I like it.....reminds me of some of the haunts in downtowns of Portland, Seattle and SF. Sandra K had a lovely latte (Sandra K is an artist, so it's the first thing she notices is how it looks). Second comment was "It could use another shot". I stuck with a $2.00 cup of coffee and an elegant slice of Quiche. 3 Cheese and Garlic that looked as good as it tasted. The crust was perfect...this crust could hold anything, Banana Creme, Lemon Curd, or Chocolate Pie, that it contained a garlicky Quiche was fun.  Like the communal tables...hip guy next to me inquired about my journal and that inspired a light and friendly conversation. Lux is demonstrating that we can have a downtown (mid town here) identity. This is great a great addition to our city and I am proud to say that I am a Lux fan.  All the best to the "Luxorians"

B2y7NXCDCJHDoXAg6zevyQ.text: The long line Sunday morning is truly an indicator of how near and dear LUX coffeebar is to some residents of Phoenix, myself included.  As a people, us Urbanites are not generally prone to, well, waiting-- but these guys tamp out a mean cup that's just THAT good.    I live in Tempe and work in CenPho (@ Practical Art & Sack's Cafe), so I'm usually blipping in and out before work at the end of my commute, but I covet those few hours a week I can sneak away from everything, nestle up in a chic designer chair, and click away on my laptop (which--- outlets galore!-- I can actually plug in!).  On occaision, finding space to perch my bum can be a bit dodgy, and when it's chilly out their ample outdoor seating just isn't all that enticing-- but the times when I've been completely stymied have been few and far between.    I'm sort of a plain Jane and generally just order a non-fat latte (don't ruin their great, roasted on-site coffee with a syrup!) from their friendly, knowledgeable staff. And I have to say, I love the tattoos, piercings, and mod-indie clothes sported by some of the staff-- makes me feel right at home!   Last rave-- they support local artists & sustainable practices. I heart them.

5m9sR3131NPEUnzX2PMhJg.text: In the Basha's supermarket, counter/take out only. Apparently spouse and I arrived toward end of day. Most food was unavailable and another couple was arguing with the young lady at counter about getting fresher orange chicken, She finally agreed to swap the portion they got in the foam container for a newer batch, Both the broccolli beef and sesame chicken my wife & I had was luke warm and mediocre at best, Chow mein noodles were also below par. Try another spot, almost anywhere would be better.

gO33DNONAaMRZckz0--u_Q.text: LUX has the best coffee in town hands down. I've been to nearly all of the local coffee shops in Phoenix. I'm a complete addict. I work out of coffee shops and despite what some of these other folks say they observe I actually get more work done here than most other shops. I think the loudness and business of the place does it for me. Kind of like working out of the eXtreme Bean in Tempe.  Any way, no other shop makes a white mocha (velvet) like Lux. Do yourself a favor and order a regular velvet mocha for here with their fresh homemade espresso whipped cream. Additionally, all of the pastries you see there are freshly baked in house too.  So good.

Geuv1kVb2rLKQOvees5NEw.text: great coffee and desserts and a very cool place to just hang and mess around on your laptop

HB2Fu--vG6iGg6Ba2LIvrg.text: Have you seen the Onion video on YouTube about the new keyboard-less Mac laptop where the guy being interviewed says "I'll buy almost anything if it's shiny and made by Apple?" Yeah, that pretty much sums up the Lux clientele. But don't get me wrong, I love me some Lux.   Soy latte with a blob of whipped cream and fun patterns in the foam? Love it. Velvet latte with a blob of whipped cream and fun patterns in the foam? Love it. Croissant bread pudding with a blob of whipped cream to spoon into the fun patterns in the foam? Love it.  People watching, alterna-hip vibing, Macbook-ing...Lux is the place to be for yummy fancy coffee and surrounding yourself with people who wonder, "Are you genuine?" (I was glad to see they finally changed that little message)  Here's a fun game my husband and I played the first time we went there (on a chilly chilly day): watch all the people coming in the door that doesn't automatically close behind them, and try to guess which ones are conscientious and take a second to close it firmly. It's about 70:30 in favor of the assholes. We sat there with our Macs and our indie-band TShirts and smugged it up in the knowledge that we are so much better than, well, everyone.  More fun games to play at Lux:  1)count the Obama bumper stickers on the cars in the lot 2)count the Prius's (Prii?) (OK, one is mine) 3)count the Macs 4)count the non-Macs, then point and laugh at him 5)count the hair colors Oh, it goes on. But I kid. I go there every time I have a day off.

hh7qzS3tLjTtMHFgZSaJ9Q.text: Very comfortable place. Tried the mocha velvet...i like it a lot. Although I enjoyed the selection of music I initially thought it was a little loud.  I got "engrossed" in the work I brought with me so got used to the music level rather quickly. The lady next to me was crunching on a toasted ciabatta which smelled heavenly. Ahhh...perfectly toasted bread. Definitely a simple pleasure worth savoring.   Only wished this place was closer to my neck of the woods. Oh, and no outlets to plug in laptops.

Hz9fIdY2INNp1rIYVucuVw.text: I thought this coffee shop was going to be small but it was huge! Their vanilla latte deserve 2 thumbs up  however I can pretty much say the exact opposite about their latte macchiato. This is such a great place to sit with friends, people watch, or do homework. I will definitely be back.

i4mMUsbu_A7632xAnElB6w.text: Exceptional espresso based drinks from in-house roasting  Great baked goods

U4MPSXZMEMxOm4N8ScMc7w.text: Americano is an espresso with hot water.  Not a brewed cup 'o joe.  But that's what the guy gave me.  After we left for Fez (consistently great and fun since, um many years?) I called Lux and left a message.  She called the next day saying they're getting the kinks out and offered another if my wife and I give them another chance.  So an extra star for that.  Very nice place with oppressive levels of hipsters.  Which is either fun or off-putting depending on how you're wired.  Though it is nice to not have a single Ed Hardy in the entire place.  As other reviewers have noted, the menus & drink lists written on clear glass are difficult to read.  And you have to find where they are.  Food looked yummy though.  Place is so hip it hurts.

FrFXi66RqLH2zPROz3nFRQ.text: Amazing place mac n cheese,pudding burger and coffees are to die for. Good vibes and very relaxed place. Even though it's hidden and a bit hard to get to it's well worth it. For sure will be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yl4oeTmKXXWPRBcTPAEnsQ.text: This place is really laid back. Food selection changes on a daily basis. The crowd/environment is definitely hipster-esque. Went in on a sunday  and there was a dj playing chillwave. The food is alright, the price is not too bad, but what really makes me come back is the ambiance at Lux. Sunday breakfast lines are super long.

Uh1PzzXlL2T2Wq_p63fcRg.text: Chill place with great coffee and fun cocktails. A must hit spot in Central Phx.

zyCs1O7EXWn2z37kgWCErg.text: Beat coffee shop on town, even the iced coffee  is great and has not been sitting in a jar for 24 hours, this place is slammed in the morning for a reason , best place  simply  Put!

sXTCcnNI9xPsW9QrgpxNpA.text: Great coffee shop.  Quick efficient service, outstanding bakery items, great breakfast items, and wonderful coffee.  Lux is a perfect morning stop.  Highly recommend.

F2wk4fsDfafqWgP3OW-yUQ.text: Beautiful, hipster vibe. I haven't tried the coffee but I tried a few desserts (I am unstoppable in any sort of bakery environment) and they were all amazing. It was really busy in the evening (no places to sit inside) but there was still parking available. I'd recommend going in the morning if you want somewhere calm to do work in.

_-qBbaCzmG6HNiTQzmbTAA.text: To keep it short and simple... This place is my favorite. Great coffee, great sweets, great food, great service, great people, great owners, and so on... I love Lux!

W97VOuMKDy5BJAM-Th_cpA.text: The coffee and food are great, and I love the "hipster" environment they have going on (plus there's a lot of cute girls here). I just wish the parking was better, and it wasn't so jam packed all the time.

lN1YTiALm2S-uCegSVybmQ.text: I love this place. Chill atmosphere, really good food and even when they're super busy I never wait that long for food or coffee.

Mxcz7HMRkG6Rnbo1RxTfYw.text: Best coffee in town and reasonably priced. If I wanted to hang out there, I probably wouldn't give it 5 stars as it is often very loud and crowded. However, for my purpose of ordering coffee and leaving, it gets 5 stars.

M-o9X7SgmMqflw7VM3SRfQ.text: If it were possible to give them a zero...we love this place but their "oven" has been "broken" since before Thanksgiving 2015 (first time we went in and had it happen)...they can't make their Dutch Pancake because of it...we were just in Sunday, March 13, 2016, and it is still broken!  Either they have the worst repair man or ...I don't even know why it would still be BROKEN!!!  LAME LAME LAME!! Seriously why does it take so long to fix an oven?  Take the Dutch pancake off your menu until it's fixed, spend a little money on something...

AJpg5VnUnOmWnprUiZITKw.text: I really like Lux Central for a study spot. I'm in medical school and I can come in here, get a cup of coffee, and spend the day studying. The music is a little loud but I bring my noise canceling headphones so it's not as loud. People are always really friendly. The line can be long but it moves fast. I haven't eaten here but I've seen what they serve and it looks really good. It's a pretty hipster place but the music is good and so is the coffee. And I like places that let you plant your butt at a table for hours at a time. Keeps me more alert than studying alone somewhere.

001aIvKzVCWbstrDbo3Vug.text: Easily one of my favorite coffee shops in the Phoenix area. Relaxing vibe with a twist of a busy vibe. Could easily study or go out for a drink here. Best desserts and great coffee. The only thing I'm not crazy about is how to order, where to order. I think they could be a little more clear. Looking forward to trying meals here!

Jd26Im5zg8081VIc4Veohg.text: I don't know where to start with this place. Coffee here is the best!  Smooth and tasty. I've never met a pastry here I didn't love. But if coffee and pastries aren't your thing there is a bar (mmmm lemon drop martinis) and a breakfast and dinner menu. The steak melts in your mouth, the burger is delicious but I have actually celebrated my last 2 birthdays here strictly to get the Mac N Cheese. Add bacon and jalapenos and it is what dreams are made of. Plus it's a very relaxed and comfortable place to hang out at the community table or on a couch. I should probably not say how awesome this place is so it doesn't get more crowded than it already is but it's truly one of my favorite places in Phoenix.

mtCBOr0pZOS3kupgULdo4w.text: Every time I come here,  it's a weekday afternoon.  There seems to be an unending stream of hipper-than-thou types here at all times.  Don't these people have jobs? Lol.

XgKBz1CxWyfA1PhZFJUQ6w.text: Normally, I really like this place. But more recently the service quality has declined greatly. They're unfriendly and they don't make an effort to fix problems. They took my coffee without asking before I was done and didn't offer to give me a new one when I said something. The food and coffee quality is good but the service definitely takes away from the experience.

M_W-R8o7tkm3nnyAvEb9jQ.text: I love the atmosphere here. Even when it's crowded it's great. Sometimes the service isn't the greatest. Several times I couldn't find someone to take my order and then it took really long. Still recommend just be aware

NDuuftEvpKFBN9ehNt31zA.text: Love this place! Coffee is great, atmosphere is great, staff is great! Mac and cheese is one of the best I've ever had and the pastries are awesome. My friends and I came here every Wednesday night last year and we always had an awesome time. It does get crowded here very quickly so don't expect to bring a large group here and find seating. The structure of the building does not provide lots of room, so come earlier if you want seating or sit outside. My group was louder and consisted of 8-10 people so sitting outside was always the best. Quick service and I am always a fan of latte art. My favorite coffee shop in Phoenix to hang out and to study.

_1YZ27pGgWdZ1NZOxAjaBg.text: I really like this place.  The food is good and there are always cool people around.  You can sometimes get work done but sometimes you can get distracted by all that is going on around you.  It's definitely a good place to meet new people, and its conveniently located close to the light rail.  For those who like to bike, there are also plenty of spaces where you can lock up your bike.  :)

coQu5hYtzpVHRHpm92SyHg.text: Love everything about this spot!!! They have that village in the city like feel, that you just don't typically come across in Phoenix. They are opened LATEEEE, another thing you don't come across in Arizona!!  they have free wifi, plenty of seats ( inside and out) and a great menu from fresh squeezed juices to a long list of caffeine filled delicacies!!!! Only problem is finding this hidden gem !

60gZifnjh3PayXne2HC8xA.text: Called for reservations for 15 to 18 people.  They. Told us to call back to find out exact number.  Called 15 minutes later and Spoke with Chris, the manager.  He said they aren't taking any reservations and to haveus walk in with 15 people.  Rude!  I personally can't stand their food but it was for someone who likes their bean dip.  Never will I go there again!

h4HcTOGxEYT9A-25Vr9bUA.text: This place is magical. Super spacious, chill vibe and delicious food. I had the pear and raspberry pie warmed up and the bacon and jalapeno mac&cheese, it was EPIC.!

A-ri6NF4i9Ia300T6S8nNg.text: If you can believe it, a place that gives you quality breakfast, lunch, and dinner with a relaxed,  comfortable atmosphere. Lux has it all!

C87uYV4wdFH4m-0rQoqTyQ.text: Located in the heart of Downtown Phoenix, this busy little coffee shop is sure to please. Drinks ranging from plain black coffee, to lemonade, to alcoholic beverages, Lux has it all. It can get a bit crowded, but I think that's all part of the atmosphere. The only reason I give it four stars is because the service is different on any given day. I've had awesome, friendly baristas before and I've also had sullen, douchey hipster baristas who aren't overly friendly. Service is really important for me. Overall though, I really enjoy the drinks and the food menu.  If you're in the area you should definitely check out this artsy, hipster hangout.

1NVjelCXdlCMF6F4xOx97Q.text: My wife and I finally visited, and we loved it. Its laid back. The Mac and Cheese was delicious, along with the espresso cake. I loved the ice tea. I would certainly recommend this place. Grab a seat, drink a tea, and have a good day.

eyyNchoDrTW_5p0s7wWPIg.text: Solid coffee lounge/ bar! i highly recommend it to any fan of interesting little nooks in a large city. Definitely for those looking to explore the individual unique experiences.

JpcAlobt1bilaw1s8omwMA.text: Anyone who knows me understands that about 97% of my time in Phoenix was spent at Lux. Fantastic atmosphere, friendly regulars and staff, overall one of the best coffee shops I've ever visited.  Right next to the lightrail and in a newly renovated  (and might I add: very nice) spot, Lux is usually extremely busy, but I've never had a problem finding a nice spot to sit. Great location for an exceptional cup of coffee and a chance to make a billion friends.

J8EkqHZmM5ZwdIrTTUCHHg.text: It's impossible to find something bad about this place. The moment I step off the plane at PHX, I immediately crave Lux. The mac and cheese is perfect, gooey and cheesy, not like the stuff you made in college. The ambiance is so unique and the whole atmosphere can't be replicated. Coffee is the highlight though, lattes, cappucinos, iced drinks! They really know what they are doing here. The people are friendly and very very very cheery. A+++

9BCjBgQcUEkK9TaND0tgBA.text: After a long and exhausting day all I want is somewhere relaxing. A friend suggested this place! Which it was a great choice! A friend of mine ordered some dessert and I tried and it was yummy. As I am not a coffee drinker I ordered Honey Gensing tea. It was light but still taste the honey and Gensing in it.
