We were just there to relax a bit not knowing they have band playing for the NYE until count down. We were lucky enough that we found some seats that were on the front row and in the middle. We sat comfortably the rest of the night listening the band playing and was relaxing.

RlKiPgY6cXqZqpF0ftFy4A.text: Always love me a little bit of Lux...whenever I get the chance I will be found downtown in this wonderful establishment. I may just need to take a trip down there today...

su4tjz-o_ZiSCQZ7XBkrNQ.text: This place is ultra cool. Mis-matched mid century modern furniture. Brick walls, exposed unfinished ceiling ( you see air ducts and stuff) and lots of art.  Great people watching place as you have students, professionals, artist, all ages, all ethnicities come together in this hipster joint.  Coffee is great, the dutch pancake that they serve on weekends - AMAZING.   I don't believe they have an obvious sign in front so just look for the building next to Pane Bianco.  Oh and this place converts into a bar at night.  Moscow Mules in copper cups anyone ?

gllzQY2rHPttNQQ62CIbDA.text: This place is a total hipster joint.  Mismatched furniture, trendy people, a very "artsy" crowd.  It makes for an interesting place to enjoy a good cup of coffee and there is always good people watching.  I have eaten here many times, typically go for coffee and breakfast.  The music is a bit loud - but not too bad.  Things you must try for breakfast are the breakfast sandwich and THE BACON is TO DIE FOR!!!  This place is for sure in the running for the best bacon in Phoenix!  The lunch menu changes everyday, I have never been for dinner. I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for something trendy and different than your usual coffee shop.

0XGoBNc2f3asUL8_c9OIiA.text: Ah, Lux. I can't say enough good things about this place.   - best espresso/coffee. ever. and still (a bit) cheaper than starbucks. - homemade whipped cream that will BLOW YOUR MIND. - yummy baked goods. many vegan choices if that's your thang. - wonderful bar with quality alcohol. - wifi - both indoor & outdoor seating - friendly (and very attractive) employees  Lux has been fulfilling my caffeine needs for a long, long time now and I love it more each time I visit. The decor is amazing. A marriage of Anthropologie and DIY modern homestyle. In fact, I'd live here if I could.  I haven't actually been for dinner... I've seen the portion sizes and I can't bring myself to spend that much money for so little food (and there's a lack of vegetarian options sometimes -- I prefer more than just salad) but if I felt like treating myself or went for date night I'd happily give my money to this establishment.   Perfect for a study session. Perfect for catching up with friends. Perfect for a casual date. And it's also a great place to take visitors from out of town - True AZ local experience located in the heart of the city.

3-6HXtqOtSEAYRWAKh-zfQ.text: It doesn't matter if you're going there for the coffee, the food, the cocktails or just for the vibe... You will be amazed by all. This is a great place for people new to Phoenix or for someone just in town for the weekend.

t507w-VnhID6GlVJxkgdPw.text: Great coffee, food, and pastries. I really like this place. It is always packed though, so expect to look for seating. They even have a nice craft beer selection. This is a great coffee shop for hanging out, but I might not study here due to how packed it gets.

8RoGHkx1WOuioedPnH-1TA.text: It is the experience. It is the atmosphere. It is the bartender's knowledge, like when you tell him you want bourbon and organic pineapple from the Himalayan mountains and espresso in one beverage and he casts a spell, twirls three pirouettes, and makes a sacrifice to Chtulu to produce your drink.  Which will be the finest tasting beverage that has hit your lips since the last time you came here. It is the chick sitting next to you in ray bans, red lipstick, and a crop top talking about lesbians and farmers markets and vegan peanut butter brownies. I want to applaud my bartender for being part of such a wonderfully magical establishment where dreams come True and sadness goes to die the moment you take a sip of your drink. This is the sensation called LUX.  Someday, may you join me.

pqKn3L2L8Qh2M6mXP5Xo_Q.text: I absolutely love Lux! It's the perfect place to get work done if you're like me and work from home.  There food and coffee is great.  I love that I can get a drink after slaving away on my computer for five hours.

KkW0BEop8IS9Pos_YvPmrg.text: Awesome food, good coffee, but makes you feel like you're the least hip human on the planet.

L5Oy1ZJTEUbFHeCvUKcQBw.text: Quintessential Phoenix joint. I have been going here since 2007 ish and have never had less than fabulous coffee. There are lots of regulars as well as newcomers. I always bring out-of-towners here because in addition to having great coffee, Lux shares a patio with Pane Bianco, another famous Phoenix place with the best sandwiches in the world. Other pluses: free coffee refills, comfy furniture, good people-watching, bomb macaroni and cheese

lhu_dsO8OE4SAUtsWKAH6g.text: Website is cool, the place is cool, the coffee is great, it's a nice place to go when you want to get some good coffee, and maybe a bite of food.  Unfortunately, many other people have the same idea, and it's always packed.

IhCtvKD3DlzAVKj2fiYOgg.text: I like Lux too.  (for more detail read the 50-some odd other reviews. Didn't wanna be redundant.)

vfaglPCyzp5CeCYIwT_0RQ.text: I LOVE Lux. I know- parking can sometimes be a bear, it's usually pretty crowded, and the ordering line can be somewhat chaotic. But I just LOVE it! The coffee is the best in Phoenix, food is great, atmosphere is artsy and energizing, the new building has tons of room to do work or sit down with a friend... I bring all my out of towners here and they always love it. I brought my Italian cousin to Lux during his first trip to America (he was doing a cross-country road trip and Phoenix was the last stop). He said that it was the best cafe in America and wanted to replicate it in Italy. Lux, I love you. Don't ever leave. Ever.

mWcavP_aVZhp7UwwdkT_lA.text: We have used Pete Kelley's Automotive for more than 3 years and each time the price is right.  The work is done in the quoted time frame and within the estimated price range. They are quick and courteous and if they find something else that needs repair, which is rare (once in 3 years), a call for permission is given.  My sister's family is also is a happy repeat customer.

HBkPfmAc7mvJjRIATsd1CA.text: Okay Lux, I can move you up a star. I'm still not a fan that most of the time it's hard to find a seat and have it be quiet enough to focus on anything. Additionally, I am sad that my favorite shoe chair that was an important part of an evening I had with Tony A. seems to no longer be there.  However, when I came back this past Saturday for a velvet with your homemade whipped cream, you truly delivered. It was the perfect temperature and a million times better than the last one I remembered. Bravo. Now move closer to my house and we'll be all set.

X72HVue4KV6JztYABhL5cg.text: Mountainside Auto Glass...truly one of the most professional businesses I've ever dealt with. I have referred my family, friends and clients to them. I've been using them for over 10 years. Jesse and Debra are wonderful and very helpful. They dealt with the insurance company directly and I didn't have to do anything other than tell my insurance company I needed to replace my glass. I highly recommend them to anyone who needs glass replacement on their vehicle. Call them at (480) 753-5621.

iNUvK58IjEIt3x1wvZ1P8Q.text: So now that I'm working from home amidst traveling, I have basically turned lux into my makeshift office. I just have to say for the record, that i think their espresso gets better every single time I'm there.  Or maybe I just fall in love with it a little more each day! Seriously, shit is good.  I used to not be able to focus in here with all the 'scene-y' stuff (alluded to in other reviews) but now i've found that if i have work to do the noise and the people kind of make me motivated. It can get really dull working at your desk in your house.  I like that people hate so much on the mac-using, trendy people in the shop. Seriously? Who gives a shit? Unless they are mean to you or talk loudly about the previous nights parliament-smoking, pbr-drinking escapades - do you really care what kind of computer system they use and how skinny their jeans are? If so, I think it's time for a little introspection. But maybe i just take personal question to those reviews since i own a mac and am always working there :)  But either way - their pastries are divine, their espresso is excellent, and i have never in ALL of my visits to lux had a rude, pretentious, too-good, whatever barista. ever. they are really kind to everyone that ive ever watched order a drink.  i do get quite pissy however - when people sit down at shared tables and continue to cross, shift, and move themselves inevitably hitting the shared table about 8,000 times and spilling my coffee about 8,000 times. Come on folks, shared table...can i get a little consideration for your fellow coffee drinkers!?  the end.

RGR3R46J6HRugf0trwwS9g.text: Oh Lux,  how I love thee.... I'll start by stating the obvious, the coffee/espresso  is superb. It's within walking distance from my place which is also fab. My favorite little treat is the velvet (which it seems, is some white chocolate concoction). I always feel like I want to throw up about 20 minutes after finishing it... this is a good thing kids, means it's like diesel fuel (or blow)  and I'll have uncontrollable facial twitching for hours without the cost of either. woot!  Another thing I must mention is the adorable inked up little hipster cat behind the bar. This kid can froth my milk anytime. Sure, I probably couldn't fit into his "skinny" jeans or whatever but still..... rawr.    So if you're like me and you have a penchant for amazingly yummy java and pretty, possibly sexually confused, skinny boys that are WAY to young for you, pop in to Lux.  You can thank me later......

drTz6Uz_9v0amcxYzDJcRg.text: We first discovered Lux on a visit to Phoenix prior to moving to the area and it was love at first sip. Lux is the perfect mix of cozy and hip, making it a great place to grab a latte or a cocktail. As an oatmeal aficionado, I am not easily impressed by coffee shop oatmeal. The steel-cut oats at Lux, on the other hand, taste like a homemade berry crumble. The pastries are equally as delicious. Luckily, it is far enough from our house that it can't become a daily habit!

-57ZTy7dD22my9SNYsM0TQ.text: As much as I love Lux, I'm kinda glad that it's not closer to my house, otherwise they might have all of my money. Working from home, I need to get out and set up shop elsewhere every once in a while so that I don't start talking to my houseplants, and more often than not, Lux is my destination.  The service at Lux is always friendly and often funny. And I've sat close enough to the register enough times to hear them being friendly to people of all ages, shapes and sizes. The coffee is rich, dark and delicious. I usually stick with a house coffee with soy milk, so I do ok price-wise. I even buy the whole beans to brew my own coffee at home. I like it that much.  Lux gets packed, but I've always been able to find a space and get access to an outlet for my power sucking laptop (not an apple, by the by). The music is good and mellow--think the Shins or the Stones. They've also got killer pastries, and if you time it right, you'll get them fresh out da oven.  Coffee shops are all kind of a personal preference thing. There are lots of good spots in Phoenix, but Lux is my favorite.

ojhcn8drLDsgOfxlS9QtSg.text: Pretty yummy coffee, with a very personal touch on the cup, as they put an adorable little sticker with your name and drink on each cup.    Fantastic ambiance and decor with Angela Adams carpets, Jonathan Adler ceramic pieces, fresh flowers and affordable local art that is constantly in flux.    Just don't walk in while they're roasting, you'll have to go home immediately and change.  Your clothes will smell like burnt chocolate, or, um roasted coffee beans.  Not my favorite aroma.  The sweets, made with love by the proprietor of 'Tart' are excellent as well!

3VMteKPwBLUZKQTMdKV1ww.text: I absolutely love this coffee shop.  The coffee is among the best and the pastries are all made in the back of the shop and are scrumptious! I'd love it if the chairs were more comfortable, but the rest of the atmosphere  makes up for it! The baristas are all wonderful and are always smiling (another post said the contrary, but it takes a smile to get one)! I also appreciate the hours of the coffee shop---I can stop on the way to work and read there in the evening until late (sometimes I go twice in one day!)  I also love getting a sandwich at Pane Bianco next door and a soy chai from Lux to go with it!  Among the best in Phoenix--keep it up!

WM5QmV14w7BDaG6ImaTo0Q.text: If anyone claims to come here for the food or coffee they're outright liars. It's all about atmosphere with this place. I've been coming here for a few years and it's a few blocks from my house and I definitely enjoy the calm vibe this place sets.  Despite what I said earlier, I'm really not knocking the food or coffee at this place. It's pretty good, but overpriced. In essence, you're paying more for the atmosphere of the place, so it makes sense. It's nice to find a place like this in Phoenix because I'd totally expect a coffeebar as such to be in Silverlake or Manhattan. Lux is a great place to read, share conversation, or just enjoy a hot cup of whatever. That being said, I'm not a die-hard fan of this place like some, but I enjoy stopping by every now and then.  Chances are if you're going to Lux you're one of two people: someone whose friend brought them along, or you want to look cool by going to a hip coffee shop. I've been reading alot of the negative reviews of this place and I don't see how those reviewers didn't know what they were getting in to. Just admit that you busted out your American Apparrel shirt and brought your copy of Wallpaper magazine to read while you sip your chai. It's alright, everyone does it there.

kV9lcLkyRgw7E6ooIxdqCQ.text: I was curious to try this restaurant, as it's right around the corner from my house.  All I can say is what a disappointment! I read the reviews before I went and someone posted that the pizza was like a frozen pizza and I couldn't agree more!  The crust was paper thin and soggy, it was horrible!  When I opened t he box, I couldn't believe my eyes, the pizza was pathetic.  I had called my order in and specified a time to pick up my order, and when I arrived, they couldn't find my order and I had to wait while they tried to find it, which they eventually did.  When I got it home, it was luke warm, at best.  Also, the prices on their website were three dollars less for the size I ordered than what I was charged.  Update your website!  It's nice to see new businesses move into our neighborhood, but so disappointed and won't go back, for sure. I can't even give it one star, but unfortaunately you can't post unless you choose a star.

Trb4jdokAwl2bZ7bz8PyQA.text: Awesome... this place rocks!  It has an amazing vibe.. is pet friendly and is one of the hippest places in town.. you have to try Lux!

Ec1EZ_RdLigkV4MWYdcXRA.text: I love this park but it would be nice if I did not have to pick up piles of other peoples dogs poop when I go in so that my dog will not roll around in it. Why cant you pick up after your pet or just dont take them here if you cant be respectful of the other dogs who go there by not leaving your's poop? It is disgusting and unsanitary. Leave it in your own yard. Other then that, my dog has a great time and the people are typically very friendly. This would get 5 stars if not for the poop leavers.

P82OkkDujAENhGOKK0Himg.text: Lux is scene. I was amazed to see how packed the coffee shop was at 1030AM, aren't people supposed to be at work?! Anyway, the line was halfway to the door when I stepped into the fray but we moved quickly. I ordered an espresso and bought a "healthy" muffin filled with blueberries, carrots, possibly zucchini, an apple slice and covered in oats. It was like a brick in my stomach.   I don't know, I guess I don't get the whole "hang out in a coffee bar" thing. Especially students. Guess what guys there is a great place you can take your laptop and 30 textbooks and study in peace and quiet...a library. go there.   Lux is cramped but everyone seems to love it. I'm all for independent businesses so Lux is A-Ok with me.

rSX3nzxcgq0-WS0YEKh9lQ.text: I think this is the most popular review on yelp phoenix :)  The coffee is just the best... I always order soy honey lattes and damn if they aren't the smoothest, creamiest, most delicious ones in town. YUM YUM!

8aQwGxHnmkR4H6K_oiq1Yg.text: Lux is a place of enigmatic qualities: hip yet welcoming crowd, industrial yet warm decor, crowded yet cozy atmosphere, busy yet relaxing. Tying these together, however, is its straight up authenticity, top quality coffee and baked goods, and friendly service.  Whether you go for your morning jolt, after lunch desert (esp after a  visit to Pane Bianco next door), afternoon work session, or evening meet-up, Lux always welcomes.  Perhaps my favorite part of Lux is it's patio -- one of the best in town, complete with shade and misters in the summer, and , making it a great place to watch Central Ave roll past you.

Q4MZAqmYWNULkeh2e8TB8A.text: Love this place. Great hangout spot to work on your computer for whatever you are doing. The food is descent and the deserts are pretty good. There are a lot of people so be ready for crowds but there  are plenty of spots and comfy couches to sit on so make yourself comfortable and stay a while,

14pl6gI6AoDVSAdKzTLXtQ.text: What a fantastic cafe. Can't believe I didn't know about this place.  Really a hole in the wall place from outside, but the inside is spacious, modern, and trendy. There is a large amount of seating, a bar area, and an outside patio.  Coffee was really authentic. Desserts were fresh. Really awesome atmosphere and good vibe.

TvgBUy5T8kR0BcKlBlnoNg.text: Sense I first day I stepped into this coffee shop I loved it so much, there coffee is AMAZING. I always get the white mocha with an extra shot. The mac and cheese is so good. Definitely my favorite coffee shop.

W76DDXhoP9LaJpCYgTgc4Q.text: People wait in a very long line to get coffee here. The coffee IS good and worth the wait but what is better is the feel of the place. It's great.

nkn-ATqFbbY0P4kLWeZTxA.text: Lux has been a favorite for YEARS! My husband and I had our first date here! The food + pastries + coffee are always incredible!

1iCe2HodOqEznTRIgDLU0A.text: The food and coffee are great, but the place is way too noisy and crowded for my taste. It's a cool place for young people who want to bring their computers and make believe that they're working or studying while actually trying to hook up, but the reality is I can't imagine how anybody can think there. As for the organization at the cash register, well they're marching to their own drummer. Given the numbers, Lux really needs to pick up its game.

ZzOnExfF5SlzQ5JBlptHDg.text: Love the ambience, staff is super friendly and helpful! I love the diversity of drinks from coffee to cocktails.. Definitely a place I will visit again

j010njj74FoiO9rR7EajYw.text: Best cocktails I've encountered in Arizona. Coming from New York I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of service and product I was presented with at Lux. While they were busy on the evening I met up with some friends at the establishment, our bartender was cognizant of the wait and gave us a discount on our beverages!

43YxJ0W7GmoZGaiTmdWwcg.text: What can I say about Lux Coffee Shop, awesome people that take pride in great food and service to their people. I love the place and don't get there often enough due to my schedule but every time I get there it's always a pleasant experience for sure. The customer base is friendly and inviting and always interesting, great place to go with friends or alone to relax and kick back or for a casual business meeting....I love their coffee !!!

8P6WNZDGoQmxeNg3ExV9-w.text: Second time that I get to enjoy this wonderful spot in Phoenix. Only about 10-15 minutes away from grabbing the rental car at phx airport. Coffee would be enough to satisfy and make u wanna stay here for hours. Add the killer selection of pastries and protein rich hunger busters... and you have near perfection. So how do they achieve that perfection?? Having some of my favorite tunes playing loud enough for it to feel fun. But not so much that u can't talk. A must visit whenever in Phoenix!

1bDQtIMTuLxg9_8DFLTKJg.text: Really great place I had the steak and cheese sandwich and a mocha latte. I liked the did and the atmosphere, it's very friendly and a great place to read or do work on a laptop!

0LMqarvr8f8C2TlxxienWg.text: What a cute spot! This place is very unique and has a hipster vibe. The employees were very friendly and accommodating. I got an iced black and white with the homemade espresso whipped cream which was so yummy I felt sad once I drank it all! First, I said no to whipped cream, but when I saw how good it looked and was told it's homemade I was sold! I also got a croissant and two slices of their bacon which was awesome. This is a great place, so glad I went!

MianStFWjnEkKZ-qhY5VPA.text: Great vibe when you walk in. There could not be a cooler coffee house anywhere! That being said, the staff needs to work on their customer service skills. I think they have forgotten they are not as cool as their paying customers. This morning I was scolded when I enquired where to pick up my coffee and was treated as an annoyance when I asked for some food recommendations.  The coffee is good. The food is ok. The egg and vegetable scramble was bland with mostly cauliflower a just a tiny bit of spinach. The pastries are gorgeous to look at - things I had were good: bread and butter, croissant with ham and cheese and chocolate chip cookies.  Maybe if the staff had been more friendly I would have felt less critical of the food?? The manager could walk over to Clever Koi to see what fantastic service looks like.

_k8EmFW7Tmn8BJipb4rJaA.text: Central Phoenix's living room. Great diverse cross section of he city. Great coffee/food/drinks/people.   Come here for the excellent bottled beer selection.   My favorites for dinner or lunch are the pulled pork and the Mac and cheese with jalapeno and bacon.

AJV7e0l_ADct32n2Nb6jVg.text: This place has one of the best coffee in Phoenix, their Dutch pancakes are delicious... You come in you forget you are in downtown Phx.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dutch pancake and latte

ZNjxF9pDgwbb-p61yG2Xdg.text: Lux is my Sunday morning tradition. It's timeless. I've been going to Lux for years, and it's always been consistent. The service, food, drinks - all of it.   They play great music too.   Try the strawberry cornbread pastry, you'll be glad you did. Or the lemon cake!

zc_6Ynmq6dxDiVb3CcfD0g.text: Great brews and vibes all around. Perfect for those have to be hipster nights and while it gets busy there is always place to sit and chill outside (could be literal depending on temperature of said outside) my Wife had the chai latte and I had a velvet latte and both tasted great. We both also tried some pumpkin whoopie pies that were also great. Our party tried a mix off their menu and even a large coffee mug of Mac n cheese. Everyone seemed to enjoy what they ordered and no real complaints. The restaurant and restrooms were clean and the staff was quite friendly as well. I would recommend lux to my yelp friends as well and it's worth a try. From what I understand they do have wifi available and showcase local art on their walls which is always a plus. Check them out !

-hOwggdsKMvRpQud2OtKVQ.text: One of my favorite hangouts in Central PHX. Always busy and happening, so I'd definitely find a spot to sit before you order. I often come alone, and I've never worried about my computer/belongings getting stolen; all of the other hipsters there already have a macbook covered in stickers. My drink recommendation: hibiscus lemonade-delicious and tart! it's a pretty color too I love coming here with friends and just hanging out or playing a round or two of bananagrams or cards against humanity. They always have good music playing and something interesting on the TV in the back room. Overall, I think Lux is the perfect place to get out of the house/office and get some work done during the day or have a quiet night out with friends.

nDFu9DqgyVTt4QWdu_rwhw.text: So disappointed. Honey Almond Latte served so sadly......in the am's usually get amazing service by Tim. Tonight service disappoints. 1/30 11:05pm

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So disappointed.

v7L82IHWJxriRxWREnLwSQ.text: Sorry, it's just not good enough for me to wait in line with a bunch of asshats wearing tights with twisted mustaches that were popular  a decade ago in California.   Plus, I recently saw an article and it was all about how this was the place to go to be "seen"... spare me. I hate that pretentious crap. Like I need to be "seen" at a certain coffee house in order to validate my coolness in society. I'm all for quality, but when the line is out the door and the coffee doesn't taste much different, I don't get it.  Meh.

rRSYnce6gbtqdXyWYWBhsA.text: A little disappointed. I have been a Tarbell's diner since he opened .  A friend gave me a gift card, we had a nice dinner, and with the leftover decided to go next door, a few weeks later. Why can you not use a Tarbell's gift card at both restaurants?  It's Tarbell's?  Maybe our server was misinformed? Fox gift cards can be used at any of his venues.

FnL05TKR2mqOWho6fdyp3A.text: The Internet SUCKS!  I've been here several times and the Internet is very intermittent.  If they fixed it this would be 4 stars.  If they didn't charge $1.50 for a single normal sized cookie it would be a 5 star review.  Otherwise the atmosphere is pretty great (though a bit on the hisptery-side, nice selection of food, variety of seating, and the mac and cheese is fantastic.

ZhmDWCJFscISPFZVoUb7nw.text: Love the espresso here. So fresh and perfectly brewed. Great breakfast items and also a great spot for coffee or breakfast meetings or study sessions. :) I only wish Lux was closer to my house because I would be there all the time.

jx-qHeOO3Y-hqE38VcsKkQ.text: Nothing beats good coffee, homemade pastries and breakfast dishes.  Everything tastes fresh and delightful. The best yogurt parfait I had ever eaten, smooth, soft with balanced crunchiness from the granola.  Not too sweet, just right!  Wish I could have this everyday.  Will definitely come back to Phoenix for this place!

wOYCfl-H37EYjYsdMXL8HA.text: I can't recommend Massage Envy in Ahwatukee highly enough.  It's easy for me because I can walk there from where I live beautified from that every time I get a massage there I come away feeling relaxed and refreshed.  There are so many great massage therapists there you simply cannot go wrong.  Treat yourself to an hour or an hour and a half massage and renew yourself

ipFZYJ4_ksCeyquhT2cRhA.text: Cute place with a nice vibe but littered with want-to-be homeless pretenticons.  Lots of seats open but this troll is using it for his laptop bag or ratty jacket. Kind of like a small version of the Seattle airport terminal. Hey, he's paid his $1.75 for an Italian soda, he got a right to loaf across the sofa for a couple if hours to read Kafka. I'll give them credit for not going to Starbucks but they probably tried and the furniture was too hard.  If it were in a real city it would be regular, because it's near this lifeless cluster of buildings called "downtown" it appears to be avant-garde.    Great music and great coffee.  Clientelle, not so much. Will try again to compare notes.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pretentious un-pretentious

WKHPXA5BBW-f9RzeSZDW3g.text: Love LUX!   Their coffee is bomb! I'm not much of a coffee drinker but I LOVE THIS PLACE!  Friendly staff, and very nice set up. If you want to enjoy a good cop of coffee this is the place to be.

EGg21Y31PdzOOnSs82OeIQ.text: The cappuccino was exactly how I ordered it--perfect. All the drinks we got in the group (5) were great. Next time will come with more time to kill. Love the vibe, lots of seating, great music. Well done!

6t6tA4ST8Xb3gHZLCMFcpw.text: Terrific, fun place that gets better all the time!

yXOT0OY-BOf6KMbfmvVfWg.text: I was so surprised to walk in and see the place packed on a Sunday afternoon, when it looked so sleepy from the front. The Cafe Americano was solid, and they have a great assortment of baked treats. Good vibe, just wish we could have found a place to sit with SO many people camped out with laptops.

-54I19Fk6zkx-LLoHtYy7Q.text: Overpriced with fair food. My tea was good and the atmosphere was great but my wife's coffee was just far too bitter for iced coffee. In general, the location seemed disorganized to me. Baked goods were fair, but nothing better than what we could obtain at starbucks for a cheaper price.

Ocr1v-DK0xZTSrzoIDiz1A.text: Cute breakfast place & coffee shop. Very laid back atmosphere with a unique character.

aNDixqiIeHmUmnQbznTx8Q.text: The best coffee cafe I've ever been to, ever.  I love this place.  The decor and ambiance is top notch.  The food is good and breakfast comes out quickly.  All the different areas are unique and one has a projection screen.  Fresh squeezed juice is a nice touch.  Serves alcohol.  I could go on and on and on but I'd give Lux six stars if I could; and this is saying a lot considering that I have an east coast bias.  Lux would kick the ass of any of the hipster coffee shops in Manhattan or Williamsburg any day.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ifMfNcwn909gqkp97ZFYQA.text: I had tried several times to patronize Lux but the decibel level always exceeded my tolerance.  I had written it off for just being too loud, until I had a meeting there the other day.  The new, improved, Lux on Steroids is wonderful, with enough nooks, crannies, and side rooms to allow you to adjust the volume to your eardrums' delight.  I am definitely returning, and since this last time was way too early for an adult beverage, am scheduling my visit so that I can try an adult beverage using those homemade sweet preserved lemons the bartender was telling me about...and that will be very soon!

mqa6ey5EnBkZTJoW3EwcAw.text: First thing I need to say is...To all the douche bags that left one star negative reviews about this establishment.  Do us all a favor and stay your ass at home. Assholes like that have no right to be in public. Now on a positive note me and my husband came here for our Sunday morning breakfast. We got the pumpkin choclate chip muffins, the fruit and granola yogurt cup. Also got the oatmeal with seasonal fruit and walnuts. For drinks my husband got a medium dark roast coffee and I got the medium black and white mocha. Everything was great including the service. The place was very busy and the service we received was fast and friendly. They had a dj playing music and the atmosphere was pleasant. I highly recommend giving this place a visit. I know we will be returning again in the future. Thank u lux for the awesome experience.

o0bhGqz9zVeVm5AA85DGrQ.text: Their baked goods are made on site, and the food is very good and always fresh.  Coffee is roasted on site, too.  Organic milk available for coffee drinks.  This is one of my favorite coffee shops.  They do get busy.

tp_bStjF2dnqwLNt6ZvZdA.text: I'm being generous with the 3 stars simply because the coffee was great. Perfect flavor, perfect amount of froth. The atmosphere, however; was unimpressive. We came here on a Sunday evening and I felt like I was in Tempe. It's a college hangout, to say the least. We sat outside to get away from the noise, only to be surrounded by obnoxious conversations outside. Also, my girlfriend asked for a glass of dry Cabernet...they gave her a red blend that tasted like Arbor Mist.   We expected a mature atmosphere based on the website and reviews. Clearly that's not the case.   If you're early college age, you'll probably love it. Otherwise, get your coffee to go.

zr0LfJfVDxtVzU7N2-0R7w.text: Favorite coffee shop ever! Such an amazing energy, atmosphere! They make homemade whipped creme and their Vanilla Latte with almond milk AMAZING! The atmosphere is like no other! The Kale Salad was also delicious!

0L7SceJtaugdYa75DMC0zA.text: A great place to lounge by yourself. The coffee and teas are great. I love the White Chocolate Mocha; your taste buds will love it, your hips may not.  Don't go there expecting people to be friendly, it feels more like a library. Everyone generally keeps to themselves with their eyes glued to their various screens.

TNPSMMwhySUUorJW2ucmgA.text: Thank you Lux.   Perfect in house roasted beans to make my iced coffee. Amazing baristas. Cute British girl at the counter was a bonus.   Solid baked goods. Great decor.

Wrwfaer7YKhACBE-qwLetw.text: The best coffee and pastries in town. The place is always packed- like literally every single time I have been here. The employees are hit or miss- have had a few borderline rude customer service and also some very friendly, inviting interaction. Overall, this place is worth it.  They also have the BEST salted chocolate chip cookies. Worth every calorie.

JWDfVxAONbkNmbJcErxysg.text: So, yeah, sure, Lux is a coffee shop. And a bar. And kinda-sorta a restaurant. But coming in the door, you have to walk right past the bakery case and OH MY GOD THE BAKED GOODS.  You know how in Raiders of the Lost Ark you have to close your eyes so you don't see the Ark and die? Same deal here with the bakery case. Your vegan, vegetarian, or full-on animal-fat-loving self will leave Lux a hundred pounds heavier (and a hundred dollars lighter) if you stare too long. I don't know how their baker does what she does, but it's a rare day the whole damn spread doesn't just look totally amazing.   I think she make actually be a witch; I once resignedly ordered a gluten-free vegan donut and it was somehow perfectly tender and delicious and an exact facsimile of an actual cake donut. Gluten-free alone and vegan alone are enough to stymie even the best pastry chefs, but she checks off both boxes at once and it's not only edible but totally delicious? Witchcraft! Delicious, satisfying witchcraft!

kUZECWhfkT59RkIfAhbfrw.text: What the heck is this place.......were my thoughts while parking, while trying to find the door, while waiting in line, while ordering, and while sitting.... Hidden but unexpectedly large space and extremely cool with stuff literally everywhere. You will not be bored in here because there is so much to look at....people and decor. Anyways, the coffee was outstanding. The oatmeal was maybe the best oatmeal I've ever had in my life. Seriously. Organic steel cut oats with candied pecans and blueberries. Really, it was outstanding! Served in this giant mug that makes you feel super warm and comfy. Also, like I mentioned before, the place is massive and the space was filled in with people sitting, chatting, working, etc. Thankfully, finding a seat is not difficult. Some are communal. Definitely would come again if I find myself back in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal with pecans/blueberries

kR-TjTHmJhCrQykzEKKpsg.text: Stopped by after Undefeated next door. Front door is little hard to find so keep walking around. Place was jam packed!!!!  Interesting layout, stuff is everywhere so you don't know where to look. Who is working here and who are the customers?  After semi-orienting myself, ordered tropical iced tea + Chipless cookie. Both were on point. I think this place appeals to hipsters but the best thing for me were the perfectly formed square ice cubes.  Will be back next time in Phoenix.

fXkADHM4Rv82bEftYWkLrw.text: This is an absolute must if you are in the Phoenix area. They have lots of seating and a very fun atmosphere. They have very good baked items and coffee. I always get the Black and White latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hg8ey5pZwmwwqgKA84sUZA.text: I go here with my friends to do homework. I like the ambience of this place even though it is always packed. It would seem like it would be hard to concentrate since there are so many people and noise going around but it was not for me. I think it is because they're are others around you focused, which makes you motivated to. Lux has a lot of things on their menu. I got a Carmel latte and a Pastry. I forgot what the pastry was but it was quite good. It went well with the coffee as it balanced each others taste. I am normally not a pastry person but their pastries looked good so I wanted to give it a try. I definitely will be trying other things the next time I come here. They have a lot of seating, but it is quite tight in there. They have an outside seating as well. They have their own parking, which is nice because it can be hard to find parking in downtown Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

j0l068Tuj4ND-BPW4fd_dQ.text: I only went for a cup of tea and to chat with a friend.   I have to admit I was pretty impressed. Granted all I had was a wild berry plum green tea..... it was delicious and I was grateful my tea for there was in a teacup (sustainable! Yes!).  My friends salad look delicious. The staff was friendly, music was dope and environment was something I could tolerate again.  A bit out of the way to make a regular stop in but certainly a place that I would invite a friend to meet at.  Shoot, if I were in the area again, I'd even stop by and try one of their tasty looking treats.

gJPPV8JOlQnhgJlbgEAp2Q.text: Love this place!  Discovered about month ago have been here at least 10 times - great Mojo and incredible food.  Service is terrific  -

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll and great coffee!

2FjQWF7lZOQYQKq7gNPfTw.text: We come here after hikes and the coffee is great - I don't drink coffee but my girlfriend got me hooked on their iced vanilla lattes they're that good. She's boring and just gets an iced coffee #health. I get their breakfast sandwich and attempt to force feed my gf until she gets mad and swats my hand away and tells me I'm annoying. Whatever they do with this sandwich, they're doing it right.   We've been meaning to try their homemade pop tarts. My gf comments on them every time and never orders one. JUST GET IT is what I tell her. One day I'll get one and crush it up into her basic bitch coffee.   Order their whipped cream with your  coffee - it's homemade and so good. I also try to force feed this to my girlfriend and she just about moves tables to get away from me. Our dog gets a puppuccino - Lux has the Rolls Royce of puppuccinos but now we've spoiled her and our dog refuses to eat puppuccinos from Starbucks.   We've been meaning to come back for cocktails because they look like they do some artisanal type shit there and I'm sure they're amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

u3INLJGQFrMKXSAYVGjBDg.text: I've been to Lux a few times since living in Phoenix and I kinda just think this place is a hype to be honest. It's not bad by any means I just don't see why it's always so busy and popular. I came in today an ordered a cold brew and I was told that they only serve their cold brews in these glass bottles that cost $6. I honestly didn't want such a large amount of cold brew, I just wanted a small one. The gentleman did tell me that if i bring the bottle back then it will be a $3 refill which is nice but I don't frequent Lux that often so I probably won't get much use out of it. I think there are some better local coffee shops around the Valley.

dOl5ATc9AFeA3TE4V7svKg.text: Best latte I've had in awhile! Great environment and cool atmosphere! You can play games have coffee and a treat and just work or chill with friends and open late!

LfFCh-zSxsaf6sSJnu3qog.text: Fantastic coffee, great selection of food items, and a friendly staff. If you have time to hang out, they generally have a relaxed feel with great music.

AczK1EfqrhgB_XTFHF_KrA.text: I came here before a morning hike, at around 7am on a weekday. There was no line whatsoever.   I ordered the coffee cake and a cup of iced coffee, and in the line with me was the former Mayor of the City of Phoenix. He was kind enough to buy me breakfast! He was raving about the place to me, telling me that he enjoys everything they sell here.   The coffee cake definitely did not disappoint, it was a decent sized piece, that went amazingly well with the cup of delicious iced coffee which was perfectly made.   The interior is adorable, with options to sit on a couch, chair, or even at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7DG8n7H3UzuHKCX1VvyKAw.text: SOOO hipster. but in a good way. people from all walks of life are hanging out in here getting work done, studying, or just eating.   they have different menus for throughout the day (breakfast-dinner) and they all look pretty lengthy. we came at lunch and i had an iced coffee (with not 1 but 2 refills at $1) and a grilled cheese, add jalapenos, and tomato soup. all tasted fresh and newly made which i was happy about.   overall, cute atmosphere, pretty good parking options, cool clientele, and yummy coffee and food.  i would recommend this place to people living or stopping by phoenix! other reviews say they had a wait or rude staff, but we came for lunch on a friday around 12 and experienced to wait and an awesome girl (black and blonde hair, docs) took really good care of everyone. front door is a bit hard to find, and we didn't really see any signs that said lux, but a short walk around the building and you'll discover a door right next to the outdoor seating!!   10/10

fv1p1vYVizTagc65lZHq_Q.text: What a great spot! It's a little tucked away but once you see the line of sneaker heads snaked around the shop two doors down waiting for the latest release, you'll know you're in the right spot. The energy at 8am on a Friday was palpable- they even had an actual DJ spinning tunes to warm you up for the day. I ordered a hot vanilla almond milk chai, and a slice of quiche. The chai was delicious; carefully brewed, and on the spicy side. The quiche could have been a little warmer, but was pretty good as well. The atmosphere and delicious drink combine to make this a spot definitely worth a return trip. Be sure to walk through the whole shop if you're looking for a quiet spot to post up with a book. There are a couple of rooms in the back that are separated with the potentially overwhelming hum up front near the counter!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_9tyuqgbur4pE_h9uWAOrQ.text: I'm not in Phoenix very often despite living not super far away in Tucson. But I was in the area for work, and was trying to figure out a quick lunch spot to grab something to eat in between. I found Lux, which is a solid place. Was lucky to grab a spot in their smaller parking lot and ordered the grilled cheese w/tomato soup for lunch, which was quite tasty. The staff was also really accommodating and friendly, which goes a long way in my book.   Lots of other folks were there, many of whom were also studying/working, but there still seemed to be a number of places to sit. I didn't have much of a hankering for caffeine when I was there, so I didn't get the chance to try one of their many coffee offerings, but I'm sure they are also delicious. Would recommend for a quick and tasty bite if you're in the area!

xXyEwQapoJ2DJIqJZjJo0g.text: This is one of my favorite spots in Arizona. The coffee bar is great. SO many pastries and delicious coffee options to choose from. I would recommend the banana bread and cappuccino. The bar part of the place is my favorite. The bartenders are super crafty and produce insanely delicious cocktails. I usually just tell them what I'm into and let them work their magic with the fresh ingredients. The food here is super good as well, love the mac and cheese. Couldn't recommend this place more, love the vibe!

PxgckndF5vnycM5uHr5Jmg.text: Nice staff behind the counter. I might come back for the atmosphere, coffee, and coffee cake. This place it totally serve yourself though, so I won't eat a meal here again. Our patio table was covered in crumbs and cinnamon when we sat down and didn't see any bus staff on the patio for over 45 minutes when someone came to clear our plates. However, he didn't remove the old dishes from previous people or wipe up the crumbs, which I had mostly brushed to the side with a menu.   My dining partner told the bus person her veggie hash didn't have any veggies (except potatoes) . He told her she could go back inside and tell them and they would give her more. She did. They gave her money back for the hash, with kind of a deer in the headlights look. Cook was sympathetic and helpful. We do recommend updating the menu, changing "veggie hash" to "potatoe hash"... ;)   I did inform the busperson  that the crumbs and dirty glasses were from prior guests and we'd been here a long time. He said "OK", wandered way then came back a few minutes later and brushed the crumbs onto the ground with his hand. On closer inspection, there are hash browns strewn about the ground as well so the crumbs won't be lonely.   My dining partner speculated that maybe everyone was stoned. Maybe not everyone?

tKdQMvr8mCiXB3FL_QLrow.text: Coffee is good. Not the best. Cool place though.... for phx. ;)

J-YyfwRvUG_MzP0QoAaEqA.text: I come here a lot for the natural lighting and workspaces. The drip coffee is good and the food too. Otherwise their speciality drinks are overpriced. The service is inconsistent - some star players, some lazy ppl, some who don't care.   There have been a lot of times where whole tables have dirty dishes scattered across and crumbs everywhere while they have a surplus of ppl working the front. Pretty much every time I come here (2-4x a week). Generally, the place is not clean.   I'm sure ppl would be happy to move the dishes themselves if there was a noticeable sign or something.  They've also left my food go cold instead of coming to the back to just let me know it was ready (as they normally do but sometimes they just don't feel like it). Seems unusual to me that a "cool" shop doesn't have the most customer-centric culture.  I come for the workspaces and it's close. But if you want another shop with good space and better service, go to Sip Coffee and Beer Garage on Indian School!

GLl6TUAagl9JlIBjsm26hA.text: So, positive things first. The pesto mac and cheese hit the spot. My hot americano was great and I love how this place looks. We sat at a picnic table outside and the waiter came out hollering my name which honestly kind of cracked me up.  As for  negative thoughts, the line to order is a little confusing if it's your first time here, but it's okay. I was a little disappointed and was hoping they had alcoholic coffee? That's just me though.

mLhaywYZ-ATrhl7ZGiJBOA.text: Nice place to relax and do some reading.  Line can get pretty long at times to order. Good restaurant next door if you are looking for more than the side dishes that Lux offers.

T_7VlAClR9rKim8vc-ksIQ.text: This place is great. The food is amazing, coffee is adequate and overpriced. They have the most spotty WiFi in the valley which provides the perfect excuse for not getting any homework or business related matters done.

xR2lPyWIi_PfQZd1WLCwlQ.text: I love the vibe of the shop. It definitely has an eclectic yet homie feel. I tried my usual as a first-timer, a medium caramel latte with skim milk. Art designs are always a nice touch. I took the first sip and my brain told my tongue thumbs up... or maybe it was the other way around. The espresso had a pretty strong flavor but it wasn't overbearing. The Latte wasn't as sweet as I would normally prefer but that's nothing that can't be solved by a little of Sugar In The Raw.  As a non-resident I admit that the place was a little hard to find and I clearly arrived too late because there was very little open seating left.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

37XFdVsOPPkBrJY25JOF3A.text: Me and my wife love coming to Lux not only for their pastries but mainly for the coffee because the taste is like no other.  You can't find flavors like this in any other coffee shop that I've seen. And coworker of mine is in love with this shop as well. Great crowd of coffee drinkers and relaxed atmosphere.  For sure a must see for anyone who loves coffee and pastries.

CUMbBlt4a_46ApraVTaDAA.text: Love the food and drinks options here. It is open late night which is also super nice. The ice coffee is fabulous and I'd also recommend the blueberry scone with berry drizzle and the chocolate vegan donut with sprinkles (can't forget those ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vvQNCh5P3-rOD8IKCf8wMA.text: Local coffee house that also has teas (free refills on teas ), large selection of drinks, food menu, pastries (they even have vegan pastries that are tasty ) , free wifi, plenty of seating , open early to the midnight hour & music has got to be my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix!! Its busy here but they have a pretty quick system here ..

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tropical herbal tea (iced)...they usually have around 4 different flavors.

o0OLPsYY9lt9VOaLZsyRDA.text: the food was good but the place is small. Been here twice and each time it was packed, which is cool but not my style. The coffee was tasty and the atmosphere was relaxing.

zVaOXufNKXH_dxBJKGaEZQ.text: What We Ordered: Espresso Quattro Con Panna, White Out Cappuccino, Chocolate Chip and Sea Salted Cookie  Service: Friendly staff, order up counter  What We Liked:  -Atmosphere: trendy, industrial, eclectic, good environment for studying (which many people were doing - I would as well). Unusual open concept kitchen with basket of food along the counters which worked with the atmosphere. -Espresso: smooth espresso! The Quattro con panna was delicious with the smallest hint of sweetness and nice smooth espresso. Made me want to try all of their coffee concoctions.  -Options for coffee and wine: I like this combination and it was executed well in the building itself, being somewhat separate from each other -Baked good: a good ol' choc chip cookie. Not much more to say about a cookie. :)   What We Disliked: -Not much. Just maybe the cleanliness.   Overall, a hip "young" place packed with 20 and early 30-somethings. Most people were studying with their laptops at all the eclectic tables. It seems like a place to meet new people and the vibe was casual and friendly. The tables, seating and building itself is certainly rough around the edges but it works for this place. The chairs and tables are not very comfortable so I wouldn't come here to chit-chat for a couple hours with a friend at the tables but I would come here to study at them. Although I didn't sit at the bar, that did look inviting. I would come back to try the wine, more coffee, and their other delicious-looking baked goods.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

r_-JSDcKiwe-JMQ8oIKH7g.text: Not sure why this place is so hyped up because the reviews say it so hipster but Arizona hipster is a bit more southwest colorful style vs the minimal hipster coffee shops we have in Seattle. This place had a good bakery selection but not a great place for lunch. I was starving so got a date bar which was huge! And I do like that their freshly flavored iced teas are bottomless :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

V9u9q5hP4cdPUm9zraS35Q.text: If I needed to plan a meeting for my philosophy class, this is the place. Finance, not so much. Place is dimly lit- I'm here at night. Totally agree with the urban vibe others have said. Place seems like it gets a lot of regulars.  Don't go expecting a fancy coffee or lunch place. Furniture all seems "reclaimed" and floors are cement.  Perfect place for a clandestine meeting across town. Desserts in the cases look fresh and delicious, but the only thing I had this visit was a decaf tea.

BTaX_tcCk1ByODlizk0rYQ.text: By the coolest breakfast joint in Phoenix, AZ. If you're visiting be sure to stop by this hidden gem. Cool atmosphere they even have a live dj which is super cool. Fresh pastries, overall fresh everything! The only thing I would recommend them doing differently is having some sort of speaker or way to keep track of your food so you don't have to keep coming up to the kitchen area to keep track of your order. Other than that this place is solid!

qVFt0FPLJxt1j66vXXuj-w.text: This place makes 1 of the best Old Fashioneds I've ever had. Chill environment. Staff is always on top of it and super friendly. Wine selection is good, mixologists are on point and you can even see all the fresh ingredients they use. It's always super packed and annoying to try and find a spot. I am not a fan of the hipster crowd so the "ironic" decor and pretentious "artists" I could do without but it does allow for people watching while you enjoy an excellent cocktail or top notch coffee. The Mac n cheese is heavenly. Fight through the regular patrons. It's worth it.

S4Va0tNeGBNKAVRmGEXzVg.text: Loved this place!  Sammy is the consummate professional.  Only had a wonderful blackberry shot...but, already have plans on next time: The Last Word (watched presentation next to us and awesome), Mac n Cheese with Bacon/Jalapeno, and the Black & White coffee.  We go for Sammy!

UvG1ubPQm8zka09WTvAjVA.text: I must admit up front that I cannot rate the coffee. I don't like coffee, so I didn't try any. I simply got a water. However, my companion did get coffee and liked (but not loved it).  To me, this coffee shop gets four stars for the super unique vibe and the excellent service.   The one thing I would change is that the music is too loud. You can't really talk to the person next to you. Regardless, it's a good place to hang out.

DvYxPROZUscMEPcNbA047g.text: staff is rude and pretentious almost every time, cashier practically threw his change at me. the mac and cheese is the only redeeming quality

-N-qzvmCIJ_mcSEaPY6StQ.text: For the life of me I do not get the appeal of this place. I suppose the food is good, if you can get past the rude and inattentive staff with the painfully loud music to make things worse.

wJnL1OW6fh_LfUpOSmNNVw.text: Coffee is very good as well as the baked goods. Their vegan products are great. I'm not vegan nor need to eat vegan. The stuff is just that good.   Atmosphere is not desired by myself. Very crowded and it's a community sharing type of environment. Nothing wrong with that, I'm just more of a "need my own space" kind of guy. So I just stop by for coffee and leave the hangs to everyone else.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hanging with the crew

kboFdXZ4D2IksVbsoxwMbg.text: We are visiting from NM & wanted good coffee, brkfts, & baked goods. My husband lived in Seattle when you know who mermaid logo was just getting started. He's been a coffee aficionado for over 40 years so he knows coffee. We found Lux on Yelp & we are sitting here having had a delicious breakfast, sipping great coffee & enjoyed an excellent lemon bar for dessert.  We are empty nesters who have enjoyed this place. Highly recommend this stop & we will be back tmrw!!

LIwhSpbHxeO4YeUtE2aezw.text: Super cute place, great coffee, food and vibes. Hip spot though so there's usually a lot of people so it's hard to find a spot. They do have an outdoor area but it's kinda meh. It's all rocks so it gets dusty and there's no lights or music out there. I think if they just got some string bulb lights, some speakers and maybe filled in the dirt and rocks with all sidewalk it would be a perfect patio   parking is usually tight in the back and it's kind of a hard place to find cause there's not a sign but it's awesome I love coming here to study or hang with friends

QQTgWZAvfT-sXfrauuJlsw.text: What a fun place with great food and awesome service. I LOVE it.

gJETfct81QoG9q4-3Qm_FQ.text: Since my bf needs caffiene to function in the mornings, I took the opportunity to drag him to Lux to try out somewhere other than Starbucks. We normally grind beans and brew our own coffee in the morning, and rotate between Starbucks beans and beans from specialty coffee roasters. I wanted to try a latte or macchiato, but since we were in a hurry we went with the Large House Coffee (yelp.com/biz_photos/lux-...), which was a very light and drinkable coffee. It wasn't as flavorful as the coffee I had later on from Cartel. I regret not purchasing beans from Lux to bring home and try, but will have to make sure I do that on my next visit to Arizona. Lux also sells a variety of baked goods, and I purchased a slice of the Raspberry Almond Buckle (yelp.com/biz_photos/lux-...) which was DELICIOUS. I loved the almond-y taste of the buckle, and the fluffiness of the cake. The raspberries also added a slight tartiness which was really nice. Lux also serves breakfast (along with lunch and dinner), and the menu looked really good! The majority of people in line were ordering breakfast items, so I'm assuming they have some solid dishes. There was a line when I first entered, but it moved pretty quickly. There were plenty of tables to sit at, and it seems like a great place to relax with friends, study, or browse the internet. The staff was really friendly, and the prices reasonable. Parking might be the only drawback, since they have a lot, but it's narrow and doesn't have that many spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raspberry Almond Buckle
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Large House Coffee

0EwdFo19pw7oh2M0CmaPbQ.text: I'll get the bad out first then move on to the good; This place is swarming with hipsters and the employees can be a little uninterested when taking your order. Their coffee tastes like dirt and their bakery items are a 3/5, but their food is incredible. Their chefs are on point, their steaks are better than any steakhouse in Phoenix and their grilled cheese is the greatest thing in the world. Their bartenders are great and they have a huge drink selection too.

IzOaobA9rvrEIxGwCIn_ag.text: Quality, ambiance, and good selection.   Staff is attentive and respectful, and the prices for a coffee or pastry are comparable to surrounding places.   Only bad part, parking is tough and I'm totally not cool enough to frequent it.

iBxLuW1v2ni3rKwtCTWlKw.text: So Luis at Lux took it upon himself to specially make this black and white marshmallow cake just because I asked if they had any desserts with marshmallow tonight and they didn't. WHAT a GUY - so special, so unexpected and SO delicious!!!  Thank you Luis, and thank you Lux for yet again another great experience!  Until next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Nbmmv9JpfS_3NJ_VxxZmiA.text: Great place to go hang out, have a coffee, or a cocktail?  Yes they have booze, and good libations can be had here.   Also try the food, the baked goods are exquisite and you cannot go wrong with the jalapeno and bacon mac & cheese.

OasmR72A9UmTiEmXXJVWTQ.text: By far the most hipster cafe in all of Phoenix. A great place to get a tea and get some work/study done. Always incredibly busy, so good luck getting a seat! The food is yum, but nothing to write home about. The drinks are great and are the reason that I keep coming back. Such a great artistic and urban atmosphere. Some of the conversations that you hear in this place are quite amusing and interesting!

BpprfHIWzDxss00H_AmqWQ.text: It is already so crowded in the morning that another Five Star Review might only bring more Yelpers into the fold, but that is what this is - a FIVE STAR REVIEW.  From unique seating to incredible baked goods (have tried a dozen different ones and each is WONDERFUL!), to great coffee (I prefer "Dark" at $2 and FREE refill) and NOT TO BE MISSED hot breakfast entrees (BEST Gravy and Biscuits I have had in Phoenix - I prefer Sausage - Dutch Pancake, where I prefer the sweet).  There have been occasions (rare!) where I have not had to wait, but most times there is a line. Worth whatever wait is in store.  Great place for Breakfast or just coffee and a newspaper!

rcdrWlW2ZJFb2qwveo73VA.text: A very cool hipster style place with great coffee and  food.   There is a bar as well that serves amazing cocktails.   The service is  good and everyone is very friendly.

wLcyOOy-2cpRphfKeexV5w.text: I'd visit Lux every day if I lived closer, but I'm a little too far east to do so.  Nonetheless, this IS my favorite coffee house in the Phoenix Valley, and I could say that its one of my favorite locations to get a drink after work... and I could also say that their baked goods and dishes are so yummy that its one of my favorite little restaurants as well.  Its eclecticness is much of its charm, but everything is also so very well done.  Upon my first visit there -- as part of an eclectic, hardworking group of maybe 10 activists, academics, and lawyers at the end of a very long day -- our group stumbled in to Lux, which was a little disorienting having never been there and not knowing what to expect (its a very unique but comfortable environment).  Almost immediately, we were welcomed in by someone (an owner?) who found us some seats, made us some drinks, talked with us for a bit... showed me around, explained the menu to me and, despite the crazy frenetic buzz of that evening, in very short time we all felt really comfortable, a part things (for lack of a better description), and had a really nice, memorable evening.  In the mornings, coffee & espresso drinks are simply wonderful... the various freshly baked things are just wow-good.  I love Lux (see you in the morning!).

gV6h6lIn_i1wFGfo38gCdA.text: Quality is great. The coffee isn't watered down. I drink black coffee so if its too light or watered down it's a no-go for me. But this is phenomenal! It gets crowded at times, so it's hard to find a place to sit. But the coffee is worth it.

4QGovscUdu5sg2s6DLXDuw.text: Ive always heard good things about this place and im glad i gave them a try! Great food and service,if you love coffee you have to try it here atleast once

OY90Y7BOTy01a6ToAKylog.text: WOW...    I find these few negative reviews rather funny.  I will comment on them after the more important stuff, like the actual quality you will find at LUX.  I have been coming here since 2003.  It was a tiny box back then, but one of the first and only places one could find a Dirty Chai.  In fact, it was one of the only places you could find good coffee or a barista in Phoenix back then.  Sorry, starbucks is NOT good coffee, so that doesn't count.  That being said, it has grown, expanded and pretty much delivers one of everything you could want.  The ingredients are always fresh...  baking goods constantly.  They do not EVER skimp on quality of ingredients.  The prices are just ridiculously UNDER priced for what you are getting.    The mixology bar or "bar" if you will is LOADED with top shelf booze and fresh ingredients as well...  I know this because every morning when I go to get my coffee, the morning bartenders are squeezing fresh juice from just about everything you can imagine.    The breakfast items are amazing and consistent every time...  and again, totally affordable.  Coffee for a cup is $2?  Where do you even get a $2 cup of coffee anymore?  Here.  So do the baristas a favor and put that extra dollar you just saved in that ceramic jar just to the side of the register, they will appreciate it.    Dinner is equally fresh.  They offer a spartan menu of gourmet items made with FRESH ingredients handled with care.  Mac N Cheese is always on the menu for $5 - it has almost made me a fat kid it's so addicting and good.  It seems most people complain about it being too crowded or overly hipster...  I mean seriously folks, it is good.  It is popular.  So there may be a lot of people there. You might have to park on the street and walk 500 feet to get there.  You aren't going to die.  The hip people, the yuppies, the business professionals, the bohemes, the families, they aren't going to hurt you.  You don't need to waste time criticizing people, that is just too hypocritical to your point.  Just be yourself like everyone else is.  and to the service...  they hire awesome people here.  They are are highly skilled at what they do.  I find them a pleasant bunch.  Most of them are young, so things like fashion and music are important to them...  maybe that is why you think they are overly hip.  They are not uptight or mean by any measure.  If you get bad service here it is probably because you are being an entitled asshole perhaps.    Bottom line, it is pretty much the first and best in Phoenix and still upholds the quality it started with.  It has grown just as much as Phoenix has.   Cya tmrw.

5NoKbS20S8N1tQwO8V_bTw.text: My new favorite coffee spot in Phoenix!! Absolutely the best coffee and pastries to get your caffeine and sugar fix all-in-one!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Honey Vanilla yumminess!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Honey Latte

WiI9aFWt2e3M4HIEGs5hNg.text: Coffee is great and the atmosphere is awesome glad i listened to people and tried this place out its worth the drive from Chandler!

SZ-b6ZSNvSyoG5SdCbHvIQ.text: Great place to get your lap top out && kill some time  get somthing to drink and hang out. W/ somone or yourself. Weather you are meeting up with a friend or getting away from one. Blind Date? no Date.  Doing your home work ? or working on somnothing and doing nothing. I like coming here For whatever reason I Do enjoy The ambiance its pretty Chill kindof Hipster college local phoenix crowd. i like the Vibe. The WiFi ,Coffee, Tea or Custom Spiked Beverages will hold you down untill your Next Mission. Check out the menu or Try The "Mac & Cheese" if you have not yet it is good, much like the service cant go Wrong when @ LUX  i love coming here for Any reason.

6DMGTaRT7AyT5mP9DKhqjQ.text: Love their mocha! Make sure you ask for their homemade whipped cream on top! They used to add it automatically, but now you have to ask.  This place is really cool and has a great atmosphere. The only downside is that it's usually pretty packed and can be hard to find a seat, especially on weekends.

WGQLLPwdv97HHUCeIfiW0w.text: You must get the espresso chocolate cake! It is my favorite and when I'm feeling depressed and want to eat my feeling I always come here for delicious treats and a chai tea latte.

OiuQ87uxB3U8nzbsNxgAhg.text: Great atmosphere, and delicious coffee. I got a dirty chai and a vegan cinnamon sugar donut here, sat with them for two hours and read a book and it was perfect.  Always crowded. I took the day off work for my birthday, and was surprised to see a line to the door at 9:00 am on a Monday. The line was rarely shorter. Nothing against the establishment, because this obviously means that Lux is doing something right, but who are these people? Who has the time and money to get a coffee from Lux on a Monday morning? Just wondering. Maybe everyone else had the day off, too.  I'll be taking out of town friends here every time they visit, because the drinks are good and the location is great.

HkIij4SUJXdelvNgWFpWeg.text: Want something other than the corporate espresso bar?  Go  to Lux!

5-mn15yBbd9qXkzbz6jjzQ.text: I've had the coffee a few times now and it is truly Devine!  Very smooth, without the bitter aftertaste that sometimes happens.  Yesterday we took family there for breakfast and the food is just so good!  I had eggs with vegetable hash, and several people in our group had some of the amazing baked goods they had on display.  Everyone was delighted with the food and no one went away hungry!  I would have given 5 stars just for the coffee and fun atmosphere, but the food is the clincher!

TqFHiNmzSGzHoNff4p_xcA.text: Its so hit or miss with Lux. Either my experience is WONDERFUL or its absolutely TERRIBLE. Honestly, when i first started going the service and products were perfect. Now? Im usually disappointed. Most of the time my order is wrong (seriously wrong. Not like "whoops the wrong milk." but like "I order hot chocolate and you gave me a chai" WRONG.)

j0uGs0Gmf1Kyy067H0lQZw.text: 5 STARS for: -Awesome straight-up coffee -Great coffee drinks -Fresh brewed iced tea and... -Atmosphere plus!    This is a great place to meet up with someone, or just to take some time for yourself, grab a beverage, read or get some work done using the free wi-fi, people-watch, etc.  The staff is always friendly, and there's never a dull moment once you're inside. So much to see, from the eclectic decor to the eclectic clientele.

JTc3hbLbUfq0uK1ihgteow.text: My whole family loves this place!  My recent discovery was a macchiato latte which was fabulous!  Daughter loves their pancake with fruit!  Everything here is good. We're certainly not hipsters, but feel very comfortable here!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Macchiato latte!

nm8l3TTEW44WgRj4L-9-7Q.text: HARD TO FIND!! It's like hidden behind a non-descriptive building. And once you get inside, it's like a maze, you really have to snake your way through these sectioned off rooms to get to the counter and order. The decor, layout, the people there...really hipster for Arizona. I had the chicken tortilla soup (wasn't impressed) and some squash and risotto (that had no risotto in it because it apparently was reduced down to nothing) so it was basically just squash. Trust me, I asked.   When you line up to order, someone takes your drink order first and starts making your drink.....and then you order your food separately. That sounds great...because it seems like it's more efficient, but then when we paid, we realized that the person that took our drink order didn't communicate that with the person that rung us up, we ended up not paying for the drinks, so we didn't get any drinks, and we only got our food. Hmmm...maybe efficiency doesn't always equal accuracy.   I think if I was younger and more hipster, I would like this place. But I wasn't super into the vibe here and I was really not into all the sectioned off rooms that made the whole place just super confusing to navigate.

13NcXG88vtpcd2v5bVIZOg.text: Great coffee and friendly staff!  Much better than a certain chain most people go too....

NZcksQiR42bClgIBGFatUQ.text: This place serves up a good cup of coffee and I LOVE the cheap refills on my Americanos. They also serve a lot of yummy looking pastries and other goodies. One of my top three coffee places in Phoenix. Has a real cool vibe and they are always playing good tunes.  The interior is a mish-mash of ultramodern furniture, some long benches and some old hand-me-down furnishings. Somehow all these incongruities add up to something unique and cool. I also LOVE the hours they keep. I can pop in for an Americano (decaf after 6:00pm) at 9:00pm and hang out and chill for a while. Just beware, this place (rightfully so) is ALWAYS packed and parking can be tough. But don't let that deter you.

cVCZ7d7QeJ8ABjRH4A_Lww.text: The atmosphere is great as well as the coffee. One of my favorite independent coffee shops.

-ndsPrERwxjpondXVhIHnQ.text: It such a cute and cozy cafe to hangout. I will definitly come back next time when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gDjy2OU-Z5JQmqUzbMM7Zw.text: It's one of the best cup of coffee in Phoenix, if not the best.   Their coffee is always fresh and DELISH.  They have some very tasty baked goods as well.  Their lemon bars are fantastic, sweetness with a lot of tartness = yumfest!    Sure, they seem to be busy all of the time but there is always room for a few more people.  The layout at Lux is surprisingly more spacious than what most people think.    This is a great place to meet up with some friends over some fantastic coffee and some goo eats!  Looking forward to seeing you there!

eoD5Zlc8ZUrMxGbFRjPuPA.text: This place is great. Picked up a dozen pastries for an office and everything looked so good. A staff member said the quiche was really good. Unfortunately I didn't stay for breakfast. I saw a plate while I was walking out and I was so jealous. The next time I'm in town I'm going to stop here!

1mm1O1tcmgTczWUhKSfqxw.text: This review is primarily for the coffee side of Lux:  Lux has so much going for it. Location. Reputation. Vibes...  I've been many times, and visited again today. My husband and I ordered iced coffee. It's always good, totally solid. Just the right amount of acidity, just the right amount of depth. The lines are long, yes...but this is some of the best coffee in town, so IT'S WORTH IT. Also, the staff is great about having the drinks ready shortly after you pay - they take your drink order while you're still waiting in line to reach the register. They've got their system down to a science.   Also, once upon a time (in March 2014, maybe?) I had an espresso with lavender, agave, cinnamon...maybe some other things. It wasn't amazingly executed, but it was incredibly imaginative. I still give them props for taking this step.

mOsdV-whQyvgOHXFi8N8ZQ.text: Parking can be a real issue. The hipster vibe of the place is certainly not for me. My goal is to get in and get out ASAP. The place can be packed and chaotic but they do get you through the line fairly quickly. BUT--you'll be hard-pressed to find better coffee anywhere nearby. There are VERY few places within a half hour drive from here that has espresso this good. This is one of my go-to places for espresso beans.

C6GZNiQe6TbaVshK9-4mLQ.text: Absolutely love the atmosphere. They obviously have put a lot of effort into the interior design of this place. The style is modern and casual. You will immediately feel comfortable here. The front room is usually crowed, but there are two more rooms in the back. All kinds of people hang out here. Young or old, rich or poor, professionals or house wives/husbands, dark or light skinned.  The coffee is reasonably good since they roast it on site. I also like their fresh squeezed juice. I haven't tried the breakfast yet. It seems pricy. The lunch menu changes daily. They post it on facebook. They offer organic dishes. The portion is very small and expect to pay twice as much.

bM7IMOm5vcJR22YxYjadFA.text: The only great thing about this place is the ambience and atmosphere. Coffee is average, staff are rude and appear displeased and unhappy to work there, at least that's what they radiate to the customers. Just because the place is always full, doesn't mean they shouldn't appreciate customers! Isn't that business 101?!  Occasionally they have a live DJ which lightens up the place and adds a nice East coast flavor to it. Pastries are good and of satisfactory variety, but they keep them out in the open and I have seen fly on them frequently. I advised the staff and they simply ignored and said nothing they could do about it and I shouldn't order if I have a problem with it! Wow! I liked them more when they were in the next door lot and were much smaller.....it seemed they appreciated customers' business more and valued customer service more. My friends and coworkers have the same opinion, btw.

JMg4Ujhe-D88zsgideiMUQ.text: still dreaming the quattro espresso con panna...those whip cream was so rich and dense that the whole thing tasted more like affogato...i was tempted to have another one... :D  the pastries looked sooo good that if we hadn't already had a big breakfast, i would have totally ordered a few...well...def next time!

bQfL6zraZO2A3VZ3vDAXQg.text: Finally had the opportunity to visit Lux after such a long time of trying! Wow I can't believe it took me so long. This is such a cool concept and I'm so glad that it's here in DTN Phx!  From when you walk in you can see this place is a coffee shop, bakery, beer and wine bar, and restaurant all in one. Oh almost forgot, just 1 huge hangout spot! I felt totally relaxed talking to a group of friend over drinks.   I specifically ordered the green tea and it was suggested I try the pinnacle mango flavor and I'm glad I ordered it. Very yummy. Wife ordered the six shooter which she could only finish half way, talk about a Jolt!! Basically coffee with 6 shots of espresso! Might be good for late night cram or a cross country road trip.lol.  I got a chance to walk around and there are lots of rooms where you can study or meet with people. Plus I saw a bar where you can sit in front off as well as a few couches. Overall this place rocks. Soon my favorite coffee shop in Phx. Reminded me of a modern day Willow House from back in the day!  I just wish I lived closer so I could actually call Lux my neighborhood coffee shop.

DdEn6xG30tcRGqBpub1Chw.text: It's a little disorganized. Ambiance is nice good people watching. The brownie was awesome.

BassYssNeZqaWEoAAxjpzA.text: Overpriced coffee for hipsters. Bad coffee at bad prices. I've had a few drinks and my last was the Americano which was way over priced. Watered down coffee with no flavor.

PfBTcoIY1mfxTvHUPFJc_A.text: Lux. If you've tried their coffee, pastries, or other assorted goodies then you are likely  a believer. Yes they are are always busy. You will likely have to wait in some sort of line, depending on when you go. Your patience will be rewarded by your taste buds singing praise for a job well done. Most of their drinks tend to run less sweet (which isn't a bad thing) but they provide a variety of sweetener options to enhance the flavor to your preference.  I recommend picking up coffee beans if you have a grinder, or alternatively, I believe they can grind it for you.  This is truly a gem in Phoenix and without a doubt, my favorite coffee joint.

-c1aVelKdkSXyVNesbvpnQ.text: Such a fun and great place to grab a cup of coffee during the day and a cocktail at night. It's always busy and buzzing with a great vibe

X3-oOC0Ua92p4jmOYpX5QQ.text: I've been a regular at Lux for the past 5 years. I can't believe I haven't written a review! Over the years it has been a great place to mingle, kill time, meet new people, study, eat and drink! All the workers are very friendly and most of the time they will remember your face. I love ordering the honey velvet with almond milk. It's a great way to start my day. For breakfast I usually get the egg sandwich with bacon cheese and tomatoes. Delicious! It has been becoming more popular now which is awesome for the business. You kinda have to dodge the times people get out of class or work, if you want a peaceful study session.
