But I always enjoy my time here. Thank you Lux :)

SW7oAwRyvI8tX3yif3yfng.text: I totally love every single thing about this place, coffee, cocktails, pastry, and dinner! the atmosphere and the place are cozy, hipster and contemporaneous.

wO7TykZfyn3nc30WO9VMVQ.text: I love it. music is good, people (workers and clientele) are great, the food is the bomb. Ive had the risotto which is so so good (no meat and still amazing and light), also the bacon and jalapeno mac n cheese is so yummy. I love these two so much I havent even ventured to try other menu items but im sure they're good as well.   My ONE caveat is that the wifi is so SLOW. Most likely because they always have a full bustling house. If they could fix this, I would be there much more often. I work from home/am mobile with work, and would love to work here more!

VfLEVM5VRrsmBw5Ymt2iWQ.text: There are very few good coffee shops in Phoenix, this is one of them.    It draws quite the crowd and seating is eclectic.  Once you understand the intimate and friendly environment of Lux, you get hooked.

QWJQFZ6YXOT6FPNRXZxWvA.text: What a fantastic gem in Phoenix! Yummy coffee, awesome "soundtrack", super delicious food and scones, and the atmosphere is inviting and fun. I'm visiting here from San Diego, so I'm used to good coffee and have become somewhat of a coffee snob, this does not disappoint.

zcE6u2SS2yOzZGqSFpvgGQ.text: Great coffee, great place / space.  But unless you walk in with black horn rims, laceless chuck taylors, and a plaid shirt with a macbook pro in hand, you'll get eye judged from everyone... Including the staff.   If you visit this place casually, and not exclusively to the point the staff doesn't know you, they act annoyed that you are wasting their time. So what if i like a little sweetener and cream in my iced coffee, I don't need to be eye judged by a twenty-something making $9/hour.  However, I'll just say, it's still my favorite coffee house in Phoenix Metro....just wish they were more accepting of non post-hipsters.

lLrzYXGRFkIIVnZfIO6WCw.text: Seriously the best! Lots of room and outlets for your devices to charge. Great selection of teas, coffee, and pastries.. I think they have other food stuffs.. But had just had dinner and wasn't hungry but for a snack.. Great atmosphere.. I have never been to a coffee joint that had such a mixed crowd.. From young college students to high schoolers... To 70 year olds with canes, to on duty, off duty officers, professionals, students. Whatever you guys are doing at Lux keep it up.. A very welcoming place and a very come together and be comfy place. If I lived in Phoenix I would be here everyday.

2aXAV17g-6mStNvzI_4c1A.text: want the best coffee in town? how about the best cocktails? GO HERE!!! everything is pure greatness at this place. everything from the pastries to the steak dinner!

AfOEkVDeqnr1ofkGUh5zBg.text: They are the best hipster cafe. Best Mac n cheese and they are really chill. It's a really warm environment for doing hw or socializing and I would recommend a VELVET DRINK!

v2QjiJBBCcz-SSV98NBDnA.text: This is a great place to study, get work done, meet a friend or grab coffee to go. They always change their assortment of baked goods and everything is phenomenal - you're not allowed to have a favorite, because one new thing will always trump the old!! Would highly recommend.

-002f7lZZorMYWQZ0SN99g.text: I have been going to Lux for years now. Love the laid back setting with all the different work areas. Even when it is really busy I can always find somewhere to work or meet with friends. Coffee is solid and pastries are inspiring. I really like the lemon bars when they make them!

XLgC1Um0S0im_VDcPNSgpg.text: Fantastic coffee shop! Super adorable and the staff are so friendly. Whenever I go downtown I make sure to stop by, they have an excellent red velvet latte(hot and iced). Sometimes it can get a little crowded but hey who can blame them when they have such great coffee and service. Highly recommend if your a coffee lover

4L1ykg4iusCKibKoRriAjQ.text: You have to get an iced latte with whip. You also HAVE to get their Mac and Cheese! So good. Favorite study space!

bXwXqIQVbSczWnB2hfB_Dw.text: Lux is a solid go to whenever I'm in Phoenix. Delicious pastries, breakfasts and solid baristas preparing solid espresso drinks; the last of which is not easy to find in Phoenix (my guess is due to the heat and locals' preference for cold bevvies). Normally a place this good I'd give 5 stars to. I'm a regular when in town, the service is excellent, the space is cool and for a more food centered establishment they make great coffee beverages. My issue is 1) the price of their coffee drinks. I am sympathetic to the rising costs of coffee but given the cost of living in Phoenix (and rents) combined with the fact that their coffee drinks, while good, are not top tier: $4.50 for an 8oz latte is way above the market. In San Diego, where all costs are significantly higher in running a business, I can get the same drink for $3.25 to $3.75. That's a large variance percentage wise. Issue 2) throw me a bone on some healthier options. Lux has the capacity to make healthy items but just opts to generously use oil, butter, or what have you. I frankly find this is a Phoenix phenomena, but would have expected a place like Lux to offer some slightly lighter food options. Even if it is just one for each meal of the day. And vegetarian doesn't automatically qualify as light as an aside!   My nitpicking aside, I highly recommend Lux, but know your wallet will be lighter and you will be heavier.

rF7eCB4Fg2z2yi7ZsXQt5g.text: I am a recent Lux convert.   I was dragged here by a friend a few years ago, before the remodel/expansion, and I HATED it here. The girl that took my order was snobby. The line was long and awkward, and I wasn't impressed by the drip I received.   Over the years I'd get pulled here by various friends, and it never failed to piss me off. There's no sign. It's difficult to find. Where the DOOR? Where do you order what? I didn't understand the craze.  Lux is esoteric. It's snobby. It's hip. And it has grown on me.   The quality the last six months or so has shot way up. Rumor is they have a new roaster, and goddamn, GODDAMN, if he isn't good. When I buy beans to take home, my entire kitchen is swallowed in that sweet smell.   Vegan donuts? Pimm's cups with real muddled fruit? Much, much better customer service, attention to detail, and expanded food/bar options? I'm impressed, Lux, I really am.   Good job.

H9pIRLPM6SLG4KdG6fE_SQ.text: Love Lux. Great place to go for some coffee & chill with friends. Usually busy so plan to parallel park on the street (free) but luckily there's usually a seat available. If you're coming with more than 3-4 people plan to search for a seat. Free wifi & hipster-gazing. Also has food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RyUb_Dz88fVi9sylGWNSoA.text: I already rated lux before, but I hangout here a lot more now and thought lux deserves a better rating than I have it. The only cons is it is expensive, but it's a very popular and crowded place. However perfect for studying. Dim lighting, a lot of outlets, good coffee, and the food is really good. The people who work here are friendly as well, and service is fast.

kKZpnZkB6byXRxBTDMRrfQ.text: This is one of my guilty pleasures in Phoenix. The coffee, staff, atmosphere, daily food and pastry selection is absolutely amazing. If you haven't tried these yet (for those of us who love our strong coffee) I would recommend you to: Andy's 6-shooter and Dr. Lux:)

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Powering up on 6 shots (now why is the pic turned this way?!)

D9JzZN_nSryh4qTzwqSvmg.text: I have been coming to Lux for the past few months. As a recent California transplant, Lux reminds me of home and I enjoy that fact. Obviously the coffee, food, and atmosphere are all fantastic given the posts.   I came in yesterday and mistakenly left my bose headphones behind. I returned this morning and figured they were long gone. If this were LA they would be long gone. To my surprise when I ordered my coffee and asked the barista if she had seen them, she knew what I was talking about right away and went to get them from the office. I really was not expecting that to happen. There are many reasons to come to Lux.

wwxPdx4zwuZTi7DOmiEhQA.text: Coffee was good not great. Very I'm a hipster this place is apparently delicious.

O1YLgPu4cMYx3GFFcWGe3w.text: Cool place, good ambiance, fast wifi. Coffee was good with nice latte art. Pastries were ok. Beware of hipsters.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

05PfzO3Im8zo-wwwLnfo4A.text: The coffee is good .....the pastries are good ...the staff is friendly .... but it is always crowded. I guess most people like it that way. Having spent so many years on the NYC subway where personal space is not a possibility, I prefer coffee with a side of quiet.

ELJI2Qz-mcGqAvlSX1-rYA.text: I like Lux, I like their coffee and their food. The main reason I do not like to come here a lot is because it is always so crowded and it is often difficult to find somewhere to sit, especially to do homework. There have been many times where I have walked in and immediately left because there was no room. However, I believe that Lux has a large space and much seating, they are just so popular it is hard to find room.  If you end up finding a seat, I highly recommend ordering the velvet latte, it is by far my favorite, I got it once a few years ago and have not looked back since.  I still come to Lux sometimes, but usually if I am picking up to-go.  On calmer nights, it is nice to sit at the bar and get a drink, as their bartenders are more than that, they are artisans and they take their time to make sure your drink is perfect.

urtIr3E5Dc-a1RByc0tMKQ.text: No no NO NO! I've been here enough times over the past couple of years to refute the hype, players! Yes this place is tragically hip and over-crowded like a b. But so whats?  Coffee and tea: good, like most specialty places that serve it (Cartel, Echo, Urban Beans, JoBot, etc etc etc). But let's talk about the REALITIES of a trip to (not)Lux.  There are many parking spaces that are usually taken. My guess is more than 70% of the crowd here are students who spend all day working over a cup of coffee and maybe a sssscccccooooonnnneeee. The "Order Here" counter is placed right along the entrance, so when lines back up, they are backing up into a seating area. God help you if that mommy with her two toddlers are seated at an entrance-area table. Good luck getting past that, boss.  The employees here are beyond obnoxious. Gave 'em multiple chances to be cool. They ain't. The baked goods are all pretty much blah/dry/not good. On our first visit to (not)Lux, we sampled much of the pastry menu to-go, because we had heard good things. But much like Cartel, Lux is all hype and not comfort, goodness or fun. It's pain. Pain to find parking. Pain to wait in the interminable line. Pain to deal with the 24-year-old baristas and register jockeys. Pain to find a place to sit. AAARRRGGGHHH!!!  If you're young and down to study and stare, this place is for you. If you aren't 18-25 and wearing flannel, jean shorts, Converse All-Stars, hipster glasses (prescription or otherwise), really wanna live in Portland, have iPod earbuds soldered into your head.............move along, because there's nothing to see here.

ergWkUSz3gLGAeeQ5tTXig.text: Good coffee, food and vibes. Will continue to go back. Espresso is top notch, pastries are great as well.

dK66y71iHQKUcC_1mj-L3w.text: The music here is too damn loud.   Seriously, this is a coffee shop, not a bar. Look at the crowd here -- it's all people doing work buried in laptops. It's impossible to focus when some shitty French indie rock Smiths wannabe bullshit is playing in the background.   As I write this, the volume went up. Ridiculous.

XGNgD0-YEC0i19joIaqW0g.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Lux Central yet. One of the best coffee/cocktail/baked goods/dinner establishments of ALL TIME! I've been coming here for years for the welcoming atmosphere and the delightful service.

hbEPmKkrLO08BzWyg-0Y6g.text: This is advertised as a dog friendly place but it isn't.  Amazing place for coffee and treats. However this place is advertised as dog friendly and they are not.

B-SknUIqahRS123GUBOS8Q.text: My fave coffee spot in Phoenix. The vibe is very chill. The service is great. And the coffee..... Very good. A++!! I highly recommend!

G3GRp-A42Wgtvfhz6EZcmw.text: Who called this place super hipster without being obnoxious about it was spot on. It's a great little spot with a lovely menu and absolutely fantastic coffee. Wow. I forgot how good coffee can taste!  Loving my eggs and bacon - high quality ingredients. And the hash is surprisingly delicious although I'll remember to request it extra crispy next time.   I would come back here in a heartbeat. And you should definitely check it out if you haven't already done so.

T6PHaRMvwjWWKM0cByAUzQ.text: Met some fellow writers here for a drink. Fun place, packed with people. Very noisy, music loud, sunlight powering through the small windows high on the wall - my kind of place.   The staff is courteous and eager to serve. Everyone is chill and I can't wait to return!

yRY0lEGTEemumYoDTEgAww.text: Recently moved to Phoenix and I'm happy to say this place is a stone's throw away from my location.  Great atmosphere, welcoming staff and enough caffeine to make the procrastinators in all of us at least check our email.  I have been recommended the Mac & Cheese (with bacon & jalapeno) by numerous other Mac & Cheese enthusiasts.

AxfEKcxoRh1VnwkGY17N8A.text: I love Lux.  They roast their own beans, make their own pastries.  And the breakfast menu is fantastic.  I am a devout devourer of Aunt Gladys (with avocado on the side).  And for a bit of sweet and savory, pair it with the Belgian pancake with mixed berries!  The DJ is a nice touch.  Everyone can do with a bit of mood enhancement in the morning.  I complained once... and the manager responded.  He was attentive and earnest.  As for the hip vibe... yes, it's all that - so the hipster admonishments in the other posts are a bit gratuitous.  If you don't like hipsters, go to Starbucks.  But, that is more about personal choice.    If I have one ongoing peeve, it relates to the made-to-order food ordering.  I don't get the concept of running coffee orders before you reach the register - so that by the time you pay, the steaming brew is at the counter.  Why they don't extend the same service to food ordering is maddening.  The line can run out the door.  So, one stands in line for a good 15 mins to then have to place a food order and wait another 10-15mins for it to be ready.  PLEASE change that process.  Otherwise... LUX is my favorite breakfast spot in Phoenix!

z-AZB3Jw9Dy_o_1V9BKTEg.text: I have always avoided jumping on the Lux bandwagon. I used Lux the way I used most coffee shops, as a place to study or work-- chores that I don't particularly cherish.   Tonight was the first night that I went to Lux with the purpose of relaxing with friends. I can't tell you what a completely different experience this was! Blaise, the bartender, blew me away with his delicious and hand-crafted drinks. One drink literally had a arrow, craftily cut from the rind of an orange; and all were delicious.   I can't tell you how relaxed I was sitting at the bar (where they serve drinks and food). It was a 180 from my experiences using Lux to engage in less fun activities!  That's why I'm giving Lux five stars--- I have always loved their coffees, teas, baked goods, salads and entrees, but I was stressed for my own reasons. Now I see the versatility of Lux-- that it can be a place to get work done, relax and have a drink with friends, meet new people, or celebrate! It's truly the venue for any occasion!  -- The staff is also incredible!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from bar seating

rIfbGuz3PVtPRpOSwRjncA.text: Favorite Chai Tea to this day! It gets pretty busy there but I love the ambience. Very hipster!

Og4U3espwEAdssIn0c4wQQ.text: This was my 1st time here. It was very busy! I ate a savory, Dutch pancake for lunch, which was just ok. It didn't have much eggplant on it. It was mostly just squash.  I liked the atmosphere / ambience and music, but the servers were not too friendly. No one asked me if Iwas enjoying my food. But overall, it's a hip spot.

jCK7OBsK3UafuHdr0yq5Ag.text: While trekking across the western states and stopping in Phoenix for the night, we decided to stop by Lux for a breakfast on our way to California. We arrived roughly after 9am on a Monday morning. Lux appeared to be nestle in a cool and hip part of Phoenix as there were some interesting shops and restaurants in it's proximity. Lux has it's own parking lot, which I'm not sure that is shared with the other business,but when we arrived there was ample parking spaces.   On the exterior, there is a somewhat spacious patio allowing patrons to sit outside when weather permits. On the inside there is an eclectic array of mix n  match furniture which gives it that cool vibe. There is a small kitchen open to the room showcasing their variety of baked goods. It was very cool to see the employees working as we were waiting for our food.   I ordered my usual breakfast when I'm in a rush or wanting to eat light, a butter croissant and glass of orange juice. The croissant was very good, very airy and decent flakiness. The orange juice was freshly squeezed. My friend ordered the quiche which was warmed up in their conventional oven instead of the microwave. It appeared they put love in their preparation of the food.   Lux also serves lunch and dinner, and has a bar.

hZ5QrGCz1Wm0Nf2dS_t6WA.text: Great coffee, I recommend the excellent Yorkshire pudding burger that is steady on a daily changing evening menu.  Cool atmosphere (multiple rooms with tables/chairs) with free wifi - when you need to spend some time doing research or work.  I've been able to catch parts of a game on the large screen room (just a plus).  Its usually crowded with a never ending amazing mix of people - so if you like to be "alone" - maybe not your place.  An unusual mix of music - which I enjoy.  Nice outdoor seating as well.  Parking can be limited, though can park down the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yorkshire Pudding Burger
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MiSTnm0gG-l-1Q0m6oO4IQ.text: This is a review of the Chai. I had high hopes. Over a thousand reviews and still maintaining over four stars - somethings gotta be good. Unfortunately it isn't the Chai. The dominant flavor of said Chai was the milk. That's a bummer. Couldn't really taste any tea, honey/sugar, cinnamon. Just kind of a watery, milky drink. I've very honestly had better Chai at a QT - at least its cheaper.   I'm sure they must do other stuff well. They seem to be well-loved. The baked goods look pretty good, and I assume the coffee is good, I just don't drink coffee.   The Chai is really one star, but the place has a nice ambiance to it, and the soap in the bathroom was actually quite nice (lol), and so I compromise at two stars.

fZtiw8f2Ch0IVjbkEF9Vog.text: Been here a few times and each time I enjoy it more and more. Went to get some work done this past Saturday. Love this cafe as it reminds me of home (Chi town). Nice big cafe with lots of indoor seating and they have a smaller outdoor seating area also. Food is delish and service is on point. They even serve alcohol for those of us who are of age. Wifi is good too.  Great vibe with a very diverse and hip crowd. You will find students to folks who plop down to get some work done. Oh and music flows throughout the whole place. I really enjoy it here. If you are looking for quiet this is not the place to go. If you are looking for great service, good food and a place that is buzzing then this is your spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Always fresh, always good
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummmyyy

1lSVF_dLQFdUqfbnJjSeBg.text: My favorite spot in the city. I'd tell you my favorite deserts, but I don't need any competition. But I'll say this, you can't go wrong with many of the options. Coffee is great, the Lux roast is delicious and a great base for lots of yummy drinks. Food is great as well.   That said, the vibe is the best part. Most people that end up there with me tell me they no longer feel like they're in Phoenix. I understand what they're getting at, but I disagree in that Lux is the epitome of the new Phoenix, with great food, great art and a vibrant emerging culture all our own.   Lux has won 3 years in a row as my favorite place to sit on a pink leather couch. And after spending some quality time people watching and enjoying the food and drink, you can wander on over to the bar and cap off the evening with some of the best bar work in town.   What I'm trying to say is I need to figure out how to live within walking distance so I can spend even more time there.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brownie and a breve. Breakfast of champions.

F_oKTYxGdk1jMMWNi5ebdQ.text: That moment when you order your "favorite" thing... when you taste it, it's so delicious you get angry at all the impostures that made you order it to begin with!  This happens to me anytime I adventure away from my usual order at lux.  This has happened to me here the first time I've ordered the americano, the yogurt parfait, and the scones. The bakers here are legit le cordon bleu graduates from what I hear (and taste).    The brown sugar macadamia scone is this glistening golden glimmer of a pastry with a crumbly biscuit texture on the outside and gooey butter cream in the center.  When I first laid eyes on the one selected for me I actually thought "she gave me the good one!" It had me asking deep questions about the universe.    At times, the line is long but no worries the staff actually is efficient and gets through it in minutes.  The only downside is the coffee condiment area is booty to booty with the people ordering & paying.  No worries as everyone moves through pretty quickly.   The decor and art at lux is perfection: hip coffee atmosphere achieved.  Literally, the best people watching with 2 outdoor areas.  Usually I'll eat inside and then enjoy my pastry outside because I like to bring my Jack Russell terrier and tie her on the bench in front of pane bianco.    My final tip- if it sounds or looks good definitely order it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best local roast
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak sandwich and the best iced coffee

zk0cX-hLqqF8rMQjx0NBAw.text: Delicious simple early Saturday dinner. BLT, risotto, and vegetarian soup were seasoned beautifully. Expresso cake is amazing.  Sammy was awesome welcoming and made us feel at home. Will return!

ek5MIr3g6z012bI0R-gzUQ.text: Cute spot for breakfast and lunch. We came for breakfast early when it opened at 6a. Unfortunately we came earlier than when their full kitchen opens at 7a, so we weren't able to order a made-to-order dish, however there were some bakery items fresh out the oven available. We both got fresh squeezed grapefruit juice. I got a quiche lorraine and my sister got a danish. The prices are high for the portion. The atmosphere seems to cater to both older and younger clientele. Great for chilling over coffee with friends or putting on some headphones and getting to work.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiche Lorraine and Grapefruir Juice

__-0pHwOQPJgXO0uipkxXQ.text: Cool vibe/atmosphere but poor service. Everyone's friendly but they're slow and very inefficient. No organization behind the counter and they get frazzled when there's more than 4-5 people in line. I ordered a slice of quiche when there was no one else in line and it took 15 minutes and still wasn't hot. When i took it back and told the employee, she simply said, "well we heated it up". Ok...  You just lost a customer from coming back.

GrCem9yuXJJw6m6RWbGc1w.text: Lux has always been one of my favorite coffee shops. It's hard to compete with such great coffee. The white velvet (hot or iced!) is my favorite.  They infuse their whip creme with expresso and it's heaven on earth. Very very busy place.

WT8GSaWOBFD3yiJe-Yk5Ow.text: Oatmeal cream pie is a must. It melted in my mouth and was gone in about 1 minute, washed down with a nice iced latte. Plenty of seating and great vibes - you can watch the staff baking and cooking in the back!

2ZMmuhmJHAWzqNTGjo3JpQ.text: One of my fav coffee places!!! There open late and have lots of space to hang out with friends. Try one of there daily homemade pastries!

VEW9GSR_AtCDyCed7SKkAA.text: I hadn't been by here in awhile simply because they've grown to be so incredibly busy! I used to hangout whenever I could, back before they had a bar or served food. I'm happy for all the amazing success they've had but it's just become too hard to get a seat let alone parking! Regardless of all that though, they have some of the best coffee in town & the most amazing baked goods! Everything is made fresh in house & you can tell! Their food is also always delicious & reasonably priced. The bartenders take their jobs very seriously & will gladly pour you a drink or ask them to make something custom & you'll really see their skills come out! This is definitely still the spot to check out if you want a downtown experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Latte
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lattes

URUr2Kt5J8zp2KXKP4YptA.text: Meh. Nice atmosphere. But over crowed. Not impressed by the staff. I prefer Panera Bread over this place any day.

n6CgAJtd5hJU258N-dZghA.text: Didn't have a positive experience during our visit, and perhaps they were just having an off night? My BFF and I were in town, and I was in town for a work conference. When I travel I usually visit a local coffeehouse and support small local businesses. When I saw that Lux was nearby and had outstanding reviews, I told my BFF we had to come after our dinner. We drove to Lux, and it was packed. There is a small parking and then street parking. We luckily found a spot in the lot, and inside we went.  We were a little confused as to how to order. There seemed to be a couple lines or just people standing around waiting for their orders ? I do appreciate that there was an employee who were taking orders while people were standing around so that people had less wait for their drinks. My friend had ordered a house drip coffee, and since I can't drink regular coffee at night, I asked the lady at the register if they served decaf. The lady gave me a dirty look and said "no!". Talk about attitude! I know this is a coffee house, and perhaps you may not serve drip decaf, but no need for attitude! Even my BFF mentioned that she had attitude and wasn't professional. Since I didn't get any coffee, I ended up getting a cookie to go.  We were considering eating a light snack, but after our customer service, we decided to just leave. There were lot of people studying in the coffeehouse and the tables were filled. Seemed like a nice place to hang out, but based on our experience, we aren't coming back. Very unfortunate.

TL3aTthR5Srr8n9c3PlOYQ.text: Despite getting there pretty early on a weekend morning, it was packed (as per usual of course).  I seem to be the last person in Phoenix to have wandered in here to try coffee and a bite though!  I can't get enough of the feel inside Lux with it's mix of decor (straight down to their plates and cups).    I ordered their biscuits and chorizo gravy and all I have to say is...all gravy poured on top of biscuits should be made with chorizo!  The extra flavor and slight kick to it made this way better than I've ever tasted elsewhere.  I recently had biscuits and gravy in Portland (at a very delicious breakfast spot) and it didn't compare at all!  Sigh.  I did have a mocha and didn't quite prefer it at all.  It had that super burnt coffee taste to it, even with some honey and sweetener.  Blech!  My friends have reassured me it doesn't usually taste like this...however, I think it's honestly not my style of coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

No8He-AbrTjbvXNZlF3T3w.text: Please don't come here! We are too many already lol Black & white mocha please  My favorite place always.

Ni30ZhE7lGzJEy4HXM4iww.text: The service here is always awesome, and the drinks are always delicious. They roast their coffee in house and make their own whipped cream which is to die for. I love going here to read and hang out, there is typically always space. Love this place.

C1dtFLsfyC3FiWiA3JQmAQ.text: My boyfriend and I have made this a regular place. We enjoy the easy going atmosphere and most definitely love the bartenders. Sammy and John make you feel important and always offer suggestions if you're choosy about your alcohol. They have fresh herbs which make the drinks that much better. They have delicious comfort food and it's always hot and fresh. We love Lux!

lWA_Vh97BlyjtNzcIUQFHg.text: Great place to get work done if you are ok with a noisy coffee shop that also serves liquor! They use Luxardo cherries in several or there house drinks that put them over the top! Very hipster and forward thinking in their drink options that are for more a refined pallet. But they still have home made baked goods throughout the day that are irresistible!

U3KGYJim6wwuFja0YcHJcQ.text: I had heard it was one of the best breakfast restaurants in Phoenix-well they weren't far off at that. First it is hard to find-never saw a sign outside but went by my GPS-which worked well. Went inside quite early in the morning-just a few people there,mostly employees. Was greeted, looked around & settled down to await my friend that was joining me. No one mentioned to me that one has to go up & order what you want-essentially you wait on yourself. They will call you when your order is ready. They have fresh squeezed O.J., Grapefruit juice & homemade lemonade.  I'm a juice junkie & tried the O.J. Yummm! It did not disappoint! My friend arrived & we checked out our selections available, settled on two different quiches-one Quiche Lorraine & one 3 cheese Quiche-we split both between us & they were excellent! We also shared the Dutch pancake with strawberries & blueberries & homemade whipped cream-it was a delight. We had coffee-which was made all the better with steamed cream in mine-an unexpected bonus! While we were eating, we enjoyed watching all the goodies coming out of the oven. The staff was great about explaining what everything was. All in all it was a great time! More of a gathering place with great food & drinks! We'll be back!

NC9ypX8mi0tGtJNUuDKMPw.text: Good food, easy to meet and work here, and a friendly staff, however the furniture is very old and it's typically over-crowded. The "trendy-ness" of the place doesn't make up for the fact that I feel slightly uncomfortable sitting in some of the old, torn chairs. I've had various meetings here, which it's great for if you're able to find the space and don't mind raising your voice to speak to whomever you're with.  That all said, the breakfast sandwich is ONE OF THE BEST in the whole valley.

abjbVeIdXwaUYaCjaptkFg.text: I have really tried NOT to like this place. Its busy, its almost too hip, and it can be quite loud at times. But every time I get food, a cocktail, or a coffee drink, I am just won over by their top quality stuff. They are all well trained in their craft and never disappoint when it comes to their food and drinks. A lot of people are thrown off by the long line, but even if there is a line to the door, you usually don't have to wait for than 9-10 minutes. So it really isn't too bad.  Their classic drip coffee is also really good! Usually premade drip coffee tastes old, bitter, and gross. But they have an excellent drip machine and a great blend that is bright but still balanced and that's often hard to do with pre-made drip. Definitely try it when you are there next. Also... no brainer... get the whip cream on everything. just do it.

0S8YouT3l0TwlneHQEjCzA.text: Delicious iced coffee! Lots of pastries to choose from, and they change everyday. A bit crowded on the inside but good for meeting up with someone for a short coffee date. Wouldn't recommend it for working if you like quieter environments. Coffee is great!

s--f3TyKW9vqxN40M6U4VA.text: Really cool cafe with baked goods and a full menu for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. They accidentally made me a cold latte so they let me keep it while they made me a new, hot one. I appreciate the latte art! The broccoli quiche was warm & flaky. The atmosphere is unique with like 3 different sections: the front by the cashier is louder with a DJ, the back is chill with a projector TV, & there's also a back patio. The bathroom is harder to find since it's tucked away by their storage. I'd definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Broccoli quiche with cold and hot hazelnut latte with soy milk

XfIg1zLP2Z0_9wX10k3__A.text: Hipster watering hole! Lux was my neighbor growing up but since I grew up "poor", I only discovered it's existence as a young professional. Slightly salty. Objectively speaking, the open kitchen concept, raw ingredients and urban clientele makes it a Phoenix hallmark.  *ENTRANCE is not on the Main Street.  They offer a wide variety of food (breakfast-dinner). Also have a bar in the back!! I love going to chat with a friend or for solo studying. Mainstay are their quick bites, Mac and Cheese for $8.   If you want to visit, I recommend.  1) flexible schedule especially peak hours, after work and weekends.  -long lines & order wait times, time prowling for prime seats.   2) headphones, always either at a hum or loud.   Entrance:  very easy to miss. It had a modern flat design with a main entrance facing the parking lot NOT the main street. Parking is free- also street parking since the lot gets packed.  Clientele:  Best part of Lux is the ambiance. It's a hodgepodge of urbanites; students, young professionals, intellectuals.   Space: One main room, two smaller wings and patio seating. They have a variety of seating options; grouped tables with chairs (study friendly), non traditional benches and arm rests.   Guesstimate interior seating alone could fit about 80ppl.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rum drink! Like $10
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac &amp; cheese!

gaZSk2P4h5tAoEt7F3W75w.text: Where to begin? Such a mixed review! I gave Lux a 4 star based on the incredible coffee I had.  I'm not kidding when I say I'm a coffee snob. Living in pacific NW, where brews and coffee houses are planted on every corner trying their best to out-do, out roast, and out do any Italian espresso machine on the market, I've had my fair share of coffee! And I'm not a stranger to hip coffee houses, I've seen it all in Portland Oregon, and Seattle WA.  Lux provides an incredible balanced coffee of richness to the point "just touching the bitter notes" in all the right ways. I'd go back a million times over just for the coffee alone. What didn't hit the mark for me was the interior. It honestly stressed me out. It's definitely not my ideal coffee house setting. But obviously, not bothered by others. I just didn't understand the concept here. It's almost like being in someone's dis-functional house.  This is a very hip, communal, messy, and dis-organized environment, id say even a bit hazardous, especially for those who may be disabled, there's no way a wheelchair could ever negotiate the interior here, or EVER use the restroom! The crowded place is taken up by couches that are torn to shreds? Did I mention they're vinyl, and equipment and supplies pushed along the walls. The four of us, fought our way to a back room, to a painted black ceiling, to black walls, not the most cheerful room. We ordered  some breakfast, veggie scramble, hash, side of bacon and a couple egg sandwiches. All done perfectly! Delicious a matter of fact! But, can I go back to sit and relax? Got to say no. Will I go back to order coffee to go? ABSOLUTELY

g9w_vJwdyVNulvBCvEu0Bw.text: HARD TO FIND.  Great place for coffee and a bite but if you are looking for a sign outside, no dice. We drove right past and had to U-turn.

GjLzjfVz1wmmGROKzyE49w.text: Insane place dude. Service was wonderful. I came here to get some coffee and then I sat here for 5 hours straight on my laptop to watch anime. The anime went crazy. Perfect atmosphere to chill out and engage in some anime marathons. Then a cool guy came up to me and we watched anime together. Now we're hanging out tomorrow and getting lunch. I think I just made a new best friend I'm so excited. I've been so lonely and this new friend will improve my life so much. I will be returning soon and bringing my new friend. Can't stop thinking about how sick my experience here was. Coming back here often from now on

V5w_k0duehD_RTTd4FZIrw.text: Fun ambience. The average age of the clientele is probably 30. I definitely know their niche market.  There was a long line of people ordering food, but the line moved quickly.  We look forward to coming back to try other items on their menu.  It was a fun experience, and we look forward to the return

1W_nO1z00x6Pd5T9D1YdPg.text: Lux Central is a cool place. Very hipster and trendy. Lots of seating to sit and work. There is a bar area and a coffee/kitchen section. Coffee is fine. I haven't tried all their drinks so I can't complain that much. The Americano I had was pretty good. A little weak in my opinion. The staff members were not all that friendly.

hJb-qy9l3_BhPY3pjF53BA.text: I've been going to Lux for 5+ years (hanging out with friends, studying, etc.) The drinks are good, as are the pastries when they're fresh (they sometimes sit out for hours, and I've seen flies buzzing around them before...yikes!) I am a big fan of their dark roast and the free refills it comes with. Entrees are a overpriced but usually good if you're willing to splurge. However, I was a highly disappointed to find out the mug of macaroni and cheese doubled in price to $10. What?! It's literally a mug of pasta and I sometimes think a box of Kraft tastes better. Looks like I'll just be sticking to coffee from now on.   More than anything, Lux is about the ambience and environment. It can be stressful and overwhelming with its crowd and the music, especially for a person there for the first time. You're usually responsible for claiming your food from the counter and cleaning up your dishes, even though the bin can be tricky to find if you've never seen it before. Seating can be awkward and nearly impossible to find when it's busy, so I do NOT recommend large groups. Employees are hit or miss- either really friendly or really antisocial, as other reviews have stated.   I recommend Lux for the experience, but make sure you're in a good mood and have a healthy mindset- just a few minutes there may trigger agoraphobia and drain your funds.

YMzIsN3ns248PLo0uQC27A.text: The food was pretty good, nothing spectacular. It's also pricey, but that's to be expected for a trendy Phoenix coffee shop :) Be prepared, though - this place is PACKED, like no seating available at all packed! I went at about 11am and there was literally no seating. The coffee was pretty good, even if I thought the cups were a little small for the expensive price.

ekUbPhgAakn0ZWlzMvjJGA.text: Been going here for years but today I had an experience with the employee that rang me up that made me not want to come back. I've attempted to contact lux through other means but they did not reply. So here it goes.  Me: Can I have a quad shot of espresso. How much is a small cup of almond milk?  Her: 75 cents  Me: I'll take that and also can I have a tiny bit of chocolate in my quad shot?  Her: Are you sure you don't want a latte?  Me: (thinking what?) ::: Laughs::: oh no, my wife doesn't drink coffee so I'll usually just get her a glass of milk.  Her: ok  The other barista serves me a hot latte with my name on it. And the girl I've been talking to fills a small cup half way with almond milk.  Me: ::: looking at the late::: umm, I just ordered a quad shot  Her: oh that's on me (other barista starts to remake it)  Me: Also, how much more is it to fill the cup up to the top with almond milk? (Again, it's for my wife. It looks like a sad 1/2 cup of milk. I'm prepared to pay more.)  Her: It was just 75 cents  Me: :::confused:::To fill it all the way up to the top? (Thinking, Okay, I can do another 75 cents. No prob. But I'm not quite sure what she's saying.)  She's stops everything, angrily picks up the cup of almond milk turns around fills it up and throws it in the counter, never looked at me once the whole time. Clearly she's pissed.   I'm angry she's angry. She got pissed I was gonna pay more for what I originally asked for? Not to mention she got my other drink wrong. The other barista gives me my quad shot. I loudly asked if it had chocolate to other barista because first girl is not looking at me. I leave angry.   Guess I just took too long at the bustling counter with all my crazy drink orders. C'mon guys.

-uSjSspWPjqM8wad4ml0Lg.text: Are you new in Phoenix?  Are you a coffee lover?  Looking for a Cali vibe place?   then Lux Central is your place   I heard lot of good things about this place. Several people has recommended Lux after I moved to AZ.   I went early morning in weekend, central Blvd was empty but the parking lot is full. I was surprised that so many people are already there.  It was super busy and so vibrant. I love it. The bakery items looked soooo good. And they have so many options of foods. I took breakfast yogurt with fruits. . I also took regular coffee and it was also remarkably good. They provides free refill, decaf refill will be $1.  I met some good people there.  I have spent 4 hours and it was a great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bakery items!

7_RYqI-2g_T9OA1_DRVvsw.text: My boyfriend and I always make Lux a stop when we are in Phoenix, but sadly this will be the last time.  Customer service is definitely taking third place to being cool and socializing.  The order taker/cashier was cold and unwelcoming.  Sorry to take you away from your chatting and posing.  The cooks had a little incident with a lot of smoke and their co-workers just stood around watching and smirking.  The owner or manager, not sure which, is just sitting in the back with a couple of off-shift employees having loud, dramatic phone calls about e-mails that shouldn't be sent and his hot water heater.   In the meantime, the two slices of bacon that cost an extra $3 on my baked eggs were burned black.  Wish I'd taken a picture.  The place has obviously become a too cool hang-out for the staff, and too bad they have to tolerate those annoying common customers to keep their club going.  Food and coffee is still good, but there are other good places in Phoenix where I don't get treated like a second thought.

xsYBViHnbAhR_t_BNI8DTQ.text: This cafe is probably the most eclectic cafe I've ever encountered - and I sample cafes everywhere I go, around the country and abroad.  I think the vibe is very tough to describe, but I will tell you that I loved it! We stopped by around 8-9 pm on a Saturday night and there were people of all ages from children to retirees. It was also fascinating to see people of all ages working side by side on their laptops on long tables. I guess Im used to seeing college/grad students to young professionals who choose coffee spots as work places, but it was fascinating to see how well all the age groups blended here!   The seating is super fun aside from the long tables - there are couches spread throughout the cafe and people were just meeting up and having an awesome time. It's basically divided into a main hall and then there are a few smaller rooms with couches and tables, on of which you can actually reserve. In one room, old TV shows and sports were playing off a projector on to the wall.   The unique thing here is you can order a full meal (breakfast/lunch/dinner), get dessert or baked goods, coffee/lattes or a drink from their bar. The kitchen is open, and in fact, barely separated from the seating area so you see people working away on your food and drinks.   I got a velvet latte which was a white chocolate latte - done very, very well with a strong hint of coffee in it and the taste of white chocolate was subtle but recognizable. From desserts, I got a Nutella thumbprint cookie which was super tasty, especially with the coffee flavored whip cream that went with my friend's flourless dark chocolate cake (which was also excellent!)   The wall art is super random and fascinating! You would have to see for yourself to know what I mean, and it does make you think.   The place is VERY hipster, and people come here totally casual, and it sounds cheesy, but it is definitely a spot where you are welcome just as you are!

6zRc4ISvirFY_OdAPzP4Ew.text: Super chill out vibe!  Love this place, great coffee and desserts. Fantastic lunch and dinner menu great cocktails

RFZrw59KMYiwn4mtWTPs9g.text: I study there all the time! I love the noisy & busy environment. It helps me focus and stay awake in the late evenings to get my work done. If you are like me, I view this as a great alternative to a very quiet library that not only closes early but you can't eat.  I like the idea of a place like home but not like home. At the Lux Central, they have healthy delicious simple foods (kinda pricy), cafe drinks, and alcohol, too! I can do my work, study, eat, & drink in one place (like my home, just better, you can also socialize).

-oRIahJTDqaurZZcW69imQ.text: If you can navigate your way around the sea of hipsters, this place is magic! The coffee and pastries are on point, and the food is just magic. I had the biscuits and chorizo gravy with two over medium eggs and damn near finished in my pants. Thank you lux for that experience, it's been a long time since that has happened.  After you order however, you're right back in the thick of hipster-ville. Literally everyone looks the same and if you're not wearing an exaggerated deep v or some vintage clothes, some heads are gonna turn and the "music" is gonna scratch when you walk through. Either way I'm going to tough it out for this amazing food and coffee. I'm hooked on the product that lux offers.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iq_yH6vImGDuFlVTa6xCpA.text: Zero originality. Think high school girl wearing everything she thinks is trendy all at once. No service. Maybe when giggling girls are done gossiping about their last date they will take your order. Stand and wait exorbitantly long for adequate food you chose from limited menu. Overpriced coffee in pretentious atmosphere. Man-bun clientele who are desperately seeking an identity. Come here if you are a sheep. A truly creative, original, self assured person would not be seen here. Don't come here and have your self respect diminished.

Ao74NxazL6yiYrY9E3unxg.text: Go there now! Great service and mixology (if you enjoy a mixed drink or two). Super reasonably priced and the smell of coffee in the background whilst drinking cocktails is empowering!

h0hc2II14O5IuVHQJKuGOg.text: Went to thus Phoenix coffee shop to grab a cup of my morning coffee and loved it. The coffee is good as is their selection of pastries and breakfast stuff. They also have a bunch of chairs and old couches here to sit on. It was busy when I went and I imagine it to be that way regularly since thus place is hip and trendy, but their service more than made up for this inconvenience. When I'm back in Phoenix ill definitely be coming back here.

HqvvtbM2CqzFOXYRVZQSNQ.text: I love LUX's everything! It's a great place to enjoy a cup of coffee, study, or simply just hang out with friends for a chat. Their music and atmosphere is very hip (which I love). I go at least once a week for my fix. I love it here!

EZux1zlxIb8uT7OMj3CMVg.text: I love this place... Mainly for the coffee and homemade whipped cream. I've had a cocktail here once and the girl was snobby when I asked for recommendations. I literally feel like there are two friendly people that work here and the rest act like you're a pain in their ass. It sucks because I enjoy coming here, but I find myself going to other coffee shops in this area simply because of the service here. There are two guys on the register that always get tips from me simply because they smile and are friendly while I make my payment. They need to be the ones greeting guests - they would make every one more money.

lkfwsgSmJowTk9o8pQONmw.text: first of all, if you're driving at night and over 20 mph on central ave, you're probably going to miss this place. and when you miss it, you're going to have to take a 10 minute detour to make a u-turn because that damn light rail makes it impossible to maneuver quickly in downtown phx. but if you find a way to make it in, you'll feel like you're in a posh pee-wee herman's coffee house. the furniture is unique as the crowd. they have good baked goods, and i guess now they serve dinner as well. didn't try the dinner, but people were eating it, so that probably means it was edible. if you want coffee and a snack or a place to study, make the trek, but bring a taser in case someone tries to rob you. shady area, but if you travel with a friend, you'll have a great time.

HnwY9llmxZUWtRgHIVpfVQ.text: Great coffee. Cool hipster vibe. Yummy breakfast items. Service is excellent.

8cH0SiPUKHQTNCyofJep-w.text: Bad first impression.  Not easy to find - hard to spot signage when coming from the south and no sign visible from the west parking lot, but we trusted our navigation.  Sparse menu, very few options for non-meat and egg eaters (hot oatmeal in the summer - no thanks), and totally unhelpful staff.  We met family there for breakfast and ordered a vegan donut, a whole grapefruit, iced tea, and a latte.  The area to pick up orders is kind of cluttered, crowded, and disorganized and there is nowhere to stand while you're waiting.  The only seating we found for 4 was in the back room, which was quiet and filled with people on laptops (one was kind enough to share his table with us) and we tried to be quiet and quick.

Tu5bYnBnx-DMOyjXJX3smg.text: I am horribly insensitive.  I've been loving Lux for over a decade and never wrote a review?!@?  Anyway, it changed hands and even changed locations [across the walkway] a few months ago.  The coffee, while no longer the best this side of Flagstaff is still really good and the home made whipped cream is always delicious.  A prior reviewer lamented that it turned its back to the street and is now open only to the rear parking lot.  In Phoenix-speak that is a betrayal of right-thinking anti-sprawlism. I agree.  Maybe a small point, maybe not.  It has a menu now!  The food keeps to the same standards as the pastries and beverages, which probably explains why there's almost always a line at the counter and rarely a 4-top available.  One thing this place has always had is a distinct personality, which changes in a big way with new ownership and many little ways with staff.  I've always loved that about it.

GIzEh7yFFU-YGvQGNKn5fg.text: Like the coffee but actually never has the food. I like the atmosphere but also feel like t can be weird from time to time.

3Ch3DZLM39j5MXQUEWyHFA.text: I ordered a latte - which was delicious albeit a bit pricey. The barrista made a fun pattern in the latte with the cream though, so I suppose that's where the extra cost comes in.  Great atmosphere, but the music was a little loud for conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Large Latte

rzfjJZVnLtxEvKlEMQzu9Q.text: Best Coffee in Arizona!  Love the staff, the baked goods and they make the best latte on the planet.  Now if they would open up 2nd one in Prescott, Id be in heaven!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VbXpc-hrTK7cYSO_PgHf0A.text: Have been going to the old location and just checked out the new place (right next door) a couple days back.   Definite improvement. The problem with the old location was size and that has definitely been resolved with the new place having tons of tables and good elbow room.   The coffee is good and the whole place has a great "roasting" aroma. I could even see some beans being attended to in a side room.   The wi-fi is free and this is a great answer to those who are sick of the other chain places.   The only issue I noticed was that it can get a little cramped at the counter, where the orders are taken and drinks delivered several minutes later. Not a real issue - just needs a little adjustments.

wv8VOgCW8e1-pLb6FhXuAA.text: The staff is friendly. The room temperature is always perfect -never too cold, the music is pleasant both in choice and volume. The coffee is very tasty. And the wait time is never long.

z0pVRzfwwPtXY6_n4aOZKg.text: Loved this place. Super chic and quaint. Yes, there are many college kids and lawyers there, but, I kind of liked it.  It reminds me of a cafe one might find in San Fransico or Brooklyn. The place is huge, so, it isn't that hard to find seating, you just might have to spend a little effort looking (there are nooks and crannies everywhere). The coffee was excellent, loved my latte. It's so awesome they have such an assortment of home made pastries; there is something for everyone's tastes, I'm sure. I only wish I lived closer.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soy latte and vegan pumpkin doughnut... Life is good
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh house made pastries

yd7z1NgDZtrf8A9xQiwh7Q.text: Lux = quality on all levels. Java, juice, pastries, breakfast quiche is yummy,  art work, clientele, and especially the wonderful staff. I'm a regular here and have never had a negative experience. I'm very much looking forward to the new Lux opening just next door!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lovely latte just as yummy as it is pretty

kuDuR6AWmhiVtvEoh58dXQ.text: Awesome, made from scratch food and hand roasted coffee. The place is eclectic and crowded, but the Sunday morning DJ makes up for it. This place is cool.

N5jYj-MZT49rNysMKuN9oA.text: The new Lux is amazing! In addition to the aspects that haven't changed, like serving the best espresso in the Valley combined with one-of-a-kind baked goods and the best quiche I've ever had (in the mornings), Lux has a brand new space and now serves dinner, wine, bottled beer and some pretty amazing cocktails from scratch (my margarita was made with egg whites!).  The other thing that hasn't changed is the friendliness of the staff and the welcoming atmosphere.  Lux feels a lot like home to me, only the food is better than anything I've got in my fridge and the people give me something really interesting to get distracted by!

6YhuhLKWI6G9A0ALxXJ2fw.text: This place is bizarre, but the food and coffee is great. The only reason I docked a star was because their seating options were really weird and the way you order food was strange. We sat outside because it was really busy, but the tables they had were made of warped plywood and the chairs were really wobbly. If they just figured out a better way of ordering food and worked on their seating arrangements, I'd give them 5 stars.

cd7zlS-r-JYYZ68Qy1zIyA.text: Good coffee but too crowded. Food tasty but pricey. The staff is decent and professional. the white dude with the glasses is super friendly. The customers seem more self conscious and less diverse compared to jobot but they're not bad. Very nicely dressed clientele for a coffee place. Drip coffee is single origin and amazing, espresso drinks are overpriced, tea is bleahhh.

5G83arSeCUGvSTwkZNgWgg.text: My favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. Step into this joint and you feel like you have been transported to a more cultured and diverse place. Its the first time I saw an Asian Barista in Phoenix.   I usually come here to study and truthfully it gets a little loud at times so bring earplugs or anything else to plug your ears with. And on weekends you may have trouble finding a seat cause the place is packed. This place needs more outlets and the wifi can be sketchy at times. That said though I have a lot of love for independent coffee shops this one included.  They make pretty good white hot chocolates here. If you get a chance try one of their italian creme sodas ( i like peach). However, good drinks is only half the battle for a coffee shop, the joint also needs good bakery goods. Now the great thing about Lux is that I am pretty sure they bake most if not all their goodies on the premises. Hence, sometimes when walking towards the bathroom area your nostrils are greeted with whiffs of deliciousness. (theres a joke in there somewhere) Their Mexican Tea Cookies are always a good bet, and are reasonably priced. What I also like about this place is that they have rewards cards which I made ample use of. The Baristas in general are pretty cool laid back folk.   So if your looking for an awesome coffee shop experience look no further then lux and if you don't have a car don't worry. Theres a lightrail stop right in front of it.

WBo0amszTQ-DtPIsGsAl9w.text: my daughter choose Lux for us to reunite after being apart 8 full months.it is the perfect place for goodness to bloom! oh & yummy too

aMj-BdeJD_S06v5jq9ef-A.text: WOW.  That's all that I can say.  I've never been here before despite living reasonably close, and when a friend suggested it I jumped at the chance to try it after the reviews on here.    I'll be honest and say that I'm not a huge coffee person....well, I am huge (tall), but I stick to energy drinks for the most part (less scarring of my tongue from boiling hot temperatures).  I had a black and white latte here and it was ridiculously delicious.  I'll definitely be back!

2omb89ZX21X0IfOlXgnx0g.text: Best of everything, -honestly. I consistently get treated well by the amazingly talented staff, and their service is unprecedented. You'll know that every dollar you spend here is well earned. I just had the best burger in my LIFE!!! The wine is great, and not over priced... but the experience... priceless! !!  Been a fan for two years now, and haven't been dissapointed once!!

pveoNMJ23SEzKOo2i1NOdw.text: What great coffee? Come here.  What a nice atmosphere to study or chat with friends? Come here.  I really enjoyed this space & will definitely be returning.

SH4vZFztmIO9WwUlzWprkw.text: Went here with my boyfriend for brunch on a late Saturday morning. The place was packed! I wanted mac 'n cheese with my order of sweet pancake bowl, but unfortunately, we came 15mins early for their lunch menu. Our order came up around 30mins after, just in time for lunch, but I held off ordering extra. Overall, the food was good. The fruits on my bowl were fresh and the boyfriend liked his breakfast and coffee. Oh, and I would literally come back just for their freshly squeezed orange juice!  Definitely a new brunch spot for me and the boyfriend.

5OZ0uU66QUEYmZPGx6o4Ag.text: I can't even begin to describe my love for Lux. I'm fortunate enough to live walking distance from there and it has become something like a second home. It's a coffee shop mixed with a wine bar, what more could you possibly ask for in one place?  Yes, parking is crazy, and yes, it is always packed, but once you find a seat, you often get lost in the people watching and the free iced tea refills and end up spending hours there. The reason it's always so packed is because the desserts are divine, as well as the breakfast, lunch, and dinner they make. Not to mention iced coffee refills are only $1. I've never not enjoyed whatever I've ordered there.  I've always noticed great service from the employees. Whenever I bring my cup back for a fifth or sixth refill of hibiscus iced tea (it's somewhat of an addiction), they gladly refill it for me. Although it's always packed and there's typically always a line, the employees keep their cool and try to serve everyone in a timely manner.  Whether you're looking for a place to meet with a friend, to study, to do work, or just to decompress after a long day, Lux is the place to go. I'd give it six stars if I could (mostly because free iced tea refills are awesome).

J3v69Wnli8YmApzUmaFrrw.text: Great coffee house with all the fixings including coconut milk, almond etc. and very gluten friendly . . . However let's chat about their cocktails with fresh squeezed juices and garden fresh ingredients . . .simply fierce mixology! And then there is the jalapeno Mac and Cheese! YUM!  Top it all off with the fresh sweets and you have simple perfection. This is not for the healthy conscious seeker however splurge and enjoy the best naughty of all the drink and food pleasure!  Always a great late afternoon hot spot to finish out some work and wind down.  The staff are top notch!

8VFqZ5xtlpkZ1oOaejv2mg.text: Best coffee shop in Phoenix, probably in the state, but I haven't tried them all... yet lol. I don't know what else to say that hasn't been said already in 1500+ reviews. Starbucks is good when you're in the mood for a sugary frappuccino thing. But if you actually want espresso drinks like a latte, come here, they aren't even comparable. Bakery items are also as good as you'll find anywhere.

0U_HkpCiDUe-UOCEoVgK3g.text: Went for the BEST coffee. That's what I was told. It was good, Really good coffee. We also had a snack and the whole experience is what it should be. Nice relaxed vibe, people on their laptops sipping way too slow and friendly knowledgeable staff willing to assist you in your choice of brews. Then, you too can sit for way too long and check your email on your phone while you isolate from the world. Or better, bring a friend and chat.

iYaXMo9K1MMCDG-bqTuL8A.text: This place has it all-great vibe, interesting space, but most importantly tasty food and sublime coffee.  Parking is the only real challenge.  I am a bit sad that I don't frequent the establishment as much as I know work in and live in Scottsdale.

6eNjG2Jcj2De1KxI9F24-Q.text: Really cool hipster coffee bar! They have an amazing breakfast menu and the food was delicious! For the price and quality of food, I was so shocked at the amount of people in here on a sunday late morning! This place is packed and people really love this place! I come here quite often for some cold brew! This place has amazing pastries, hot breakfast and coffee! Definitely come by and give this modern cafe a try!

Qt6HR3QuxBvm36JT83Y2MA.text: Awesome cafe! I have loved everything I've ordered from here from the drip, straight espresso, to the mocha. I didn't have a good experience with the chai, but they promptly remade it and it was much better!  Good product, good customer service!  FANTASTIC atmosphere! I have written many papers here this week.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced mocha at lux

aklcqcen_X0yWVPM_-__KA.text: Love Lux! Fresh juice, coffee roasted on site, a variety of pastries made fresh daily. Urban scene, great music, cool art. Perfect for morning, afternoon and evening!  Katie whips up some of the best pastries and lunches in town. And the Croissant's? Better than Balthazar in NYC. Seriously. I mean it. The Croissants are to die for, but they don't come out of the oven until after 6:30 AM.   During the summer, what is better than Iced Coffee? Hmmm.. the way Lux makes it- every Iced coffee is an Iced Americano with an extra shot of espresso. Couldn't get better.

-Dr2XUlhn-fwBp-ObvIuMA.text: This place is very trendy and typically crowded. If you're looking for a social interaction or to be left alone, you can do both here! I give it a 4 based on the fact that they are typically out of a lot of food and drink choices(due to being so popular) and I haven't come in contact with a friendly staff member get. All around I enjoy it here and it really does have that coffee shop feel. I love going here for homework, reading, or writing!

mWWJRMp03B5FVcg8PEbwlA.text: I feel like I'm not cool enough for Lux, but occasionally when I'm there I feel a little bit cool. It's incredibly busy every day of the week, but for good reason!  They're got great coffee, great pastries, great atmosphere and great people watching. I've heard they also have great mac & cheese.  I'm a huge fan of the Americano here, not bitter at all and the espresso is pulled nice and strong.  Chocolate chip cookie sandwich to die for, but get a beverage to cut the sweetness. I've had brownies, cake, lemon bars and cookies. I haven't encountered anything at Lux I haven't loved. WAIT THEY ALSO HAVE COCKTAILS. Where else can you get coffee, pastries and handcrafted cocktails? Huge fan of the manhattan.

sKsybx22PSvQYrqn2aT2rw.text: absolutely perfect evening with excellent staff. They really love there job and thats why i only shop here.

71aiaEDo109oyCJ6vK9oYQ.text: Lux hardly needs my vote, as many, many people LOVE Lux. Even if it may have lost some of its hidden gem vibe, it traded that for super-delicious, super-fresh, and super-different. Still a fan.

4iLt8-qlfJRgAOit7lXE5Q.text: When you think of the great coffee shops of Arizona one name sticks out above the rest... Lux. The word lux actually refers to illuminating light and this place just lights up central Phoenix like nobody's business. So it seems that when naming this grand coffee shop, the owners knew what they were doing. Now in order to have a successful and popular coffee shop, many aspects come into play. First and foremost, the coffee must be outstanding... you could have all the other important parts such as great ambiance, food, space, parking or free wifi... but if your coffee is no good, the people will go elsewhere.  This place happens to have it all! from the moment you either park on the street or on the lot, you know you're headed to the gem of the neighborhood. There are ALWAYS people here... that is the first sign of feeling the reassurance of going to the right place. as you walk through the entrance, the aroma of the ground coffee beans just invades your senses and your body just feels that "I am at home" comfort level.  The set up in this place is pretty sweet. Spread all throughout this coffee house are seperated rooms full of varried couches, benches, sofas, chairs, tables and work areas. This place is suited for everyone from the student to the professional and from the reader to the social butterfly. In one of the rooms, there is even a tv which they play sports on for the hipster fan :)  Straight back from where you walk in, there is the barristas' counter joined by the small exposition kitchen. They have fresh pastries available as well as fresh fruit, eggs, etc. They seem to have a bit of something light or heavy for everyone. As for the most important part of this venue, the coffee, they seemed to have come close to perfection with their blend of beans. Whether you order it black, mocha'ed, latte'ed, iced or hot... the flavor is never disappointing. What is also nice, are the variety of mixers for your coffee. They have soy, almond milk, low fat, skim, whole, etc. You name the drink and they shall make it. A traditional espresso drink has two shots but if you need that extra boost, they will happily upgrade you to the quad.  Now, in addition to the cafe part of this place there is a bar nestled in the back corner facing the entrance. If you are just not feeling the mood of coffee just the coffee house, one can order wine, boutique beer or even a refreshing cocktail. Not many modern day coffee shops have this additional amenity. It's nice to have the option when you are in a bit more relaxed and or social mood. The bartenders seem to have enough knowledge to concoct most drinks the average person can come up with, so don't hold back!  All in all, this place is doing it right. It all started with an idea that sprouted into this diamond in the desert. My only criticism is that this place is becomming SO popular, that it is almost losing that comfortable casual feel because of the crowd. My suggestion... open another location!!!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. People watching from the corner bar

Uq5X7gqxgBZ5hcwaF_gDiw.text: This was my first time here and I loved it. It's hidden away with no sign out front because everyone already knows about this place. If you want to be a pretentious Macbook Pro hipster to write your next novel, come here. If you want to chill out with friends and talk, come here. The atmosphere is dim and chill at night and they have inside and outside seating that's always bustling. Parking can be hard sometimes because this place is so good.  I had an order of hot chocolate and it was creamy and delicious. The barista drew a beautiful leaf design in the cream on top; if they day is slow, they'll take their time to show off their talents with detailed art that makes me not even want to drink it because I'll ruin it. I love details like that.   Their mac 'n cheese dish is made and baked perfectly and everything is served in big coffee cups that make you feel at home. The music they play there is very different and not Top 40 which is something I always appreciate. The experience is delightful and I would recommend this place for sure!

aqPSiFcyfiLaISebxTS7vA.text: Awesome place to study and hang out! The tables are large enough so you could throw your backpack's whole life on it! I love that there are different environments all in one spot. The ambiance is quite attractive! So far I've tried their soy dirty chai, soy vanilla latte, chocolate chip cookie, and the jalapeno Mac and cheese! Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1_t_ZrMYGSO88fZ-Fg1Q3A.text: Excellent service by Sebastian! He gladly swapped out my drink when the original wasn't to my liking. He is an asset to Lux...I'm not sure what happened but the coffee here use to be amazing!! This time, the regular coffee both light and dark were not the greatest. Just one man's opinion.

YU4ZUjzb9EWRWDoIG5EXzQ.text: This place is a great hangout with awesome choices. Get the macaroni for lunch, your mouth will thank you. From one coffee snob to another reading this, their espresso drinks are so good.

tmvgOdxYdZk8CwR7P8wUbQ.text: Best coffee in town. A+ for atmosphere and always friendly service. One of my favorite places in town.

k75hboOSAJCwrcbbSf9Tcw.text: Stopped by this indie-chic coffeehouse while in the PHX. Instantly I loved the vibe as I walked in the door, as I realized I made my way into a very unique establishment. As I made my way past the vast selection of baked goods, I was greeted by a friendly barista. I'm not sure where all the negative buzz regarding employee attitudes came from when reading previous reviews, as my experience was great. I ordered the house dark roast coffee and breakfast of eggs and bacon. Coffee was perfection and breakfast didn't disappoint. I will make a point to visit again when I am in the area.

3oAlW4MX0OwNL0Nqevua7A.text: The place is like an underground bar but for coffee. All walks of life are in this place, from business men to hippies all kinds of people are in here. Coffee is at okay price. The Carmel was heaven but I've only been here once so there is more to try.

9jMxWykTsI3Aq4k2aJ_yFg.text: (And update to a brutal review I made about them before- they're better now) First, Lux desserts are painfully perfect.  I've had the carrot cake, choc chip blondie, m and m cookie, etc etc. apple something, salted caramel something else...and each time I make the remark.. "I could literally crush every last one of those f-ing desserts and never look back".  Scary good.. Soft... Insane.  Second, the sugar free caramel latte iced or hot with the dope leaf design in the foam- thumbs up.  Sizes are one stage smaller than most places but I'll take it if it lets them stay open and profitable.   Oh ya open late!!!!! Till midnight thru the week and 2 on the weekends.  Finally!  Xtreme bean is the only other contender.   *Evolve  *Be happy  *Don't tell people what to do or how to feel at the end of your posts

1hujkS8VvT5pKTKahcsb2g.text: Lux has mastered the amazing way of combining happening, yet slow paced; friendly yet quietly independent; trendy, yet relaxed. Go to Lux for the amazing coffee and wifi, but come away with an appreciation for great spaces, new friends, and a quiet buzz that'll make you want to come back again and again.  The "new" Lux is a great space: once you think you've found a quiet place to crawl into and observe the crowd, you'll discover that the building just continues and continues! There's a spot to people watch, enjoy the football game that's on, or power through your emails at a large table. If you're not in the mood to stay inside, hit up the small patio and listen to the chatter around you.   If coffee isn't your thing, order wine or beer! I haven't tried their food but just from the looks of the dishes that friends have ordered, I don't think you can go wrong. The only thing that keeps Lux from getting five stars? It's crazy overpriced! Their cheapest glass of wine is $9.   All in all, go to Lux just for the experience. I promise you won't regret it.

ZJQxHODRwdMSybMK99plMQ.text: Not that great of coffee at all. Coming from LA I've had way better. My latte tastes burnt and they take no care or time in presentation.  Ambiance is awesome, I'd come back for a drink but that's about all.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hmmm...?

38eV6qpYu7DgVjte2Jui2A.text: Best coffee in Phoenix.  For me, it's all about a shop's product. You can have whatever decor, or be a douchebag, or overcharge for your wares, but if you can deliver on what you sell, then you're alright.   That, is parallel what Lux delivers. They are are, first and foremost, a coffee shop. And, time and time and time again, they deliver a premium, tasty, excellent cup of coffee. Whats more? it's 2 bucks. 2 american dollars for a - get this - endless cup of brew. And that's all I ever really want, a quality cup of coffee all hours of the day.   That being said, it's can be difficult to get past the occasional worker who seems to be unhappy all the time, or the barista who doesn't seem to have enough time to even look you in the eye.   But damn, that coffee.   The ambiance is good, with lots of different seating inside and outside, and they serve not only coffee, but alcohol and food as well. Croissants are delicious, albeit overpriced, and the cocktails are varied and well mixed. Four stars because while a the staff can be hit or miss, they deliver on their staple menu item at a great value.

NxnaSmgXcXWkk_QXRIRbKA.text: The service was friendly, the coffee is great. I did however chuckle to myself because from the out side of the building it looked like a abandoned building with a super small sign in the front, but when I finally found the entrance business was booming! Although the building looks like a perfect place for a police drug bust or a Vampires den it is truly a hidden gem!

MFGiFDMO-D7IpXy4PsaLvg.text: My favorite coffee place.  Love the furniture,  perfect for people watching, great music,  delicious food,  amazing coffee. You can do homework,  read, catch up with friends... The staff is nice,  most of the time.  Try the macaroni and cheese with jalapeno and bacon.

_sJ1STCvhr0kATn_DSvoaQ.text: iced dirty chai, comes out to 5 dollars even (medium size). It was good, i think i read that they make the chai by scratch, so no concentrate. thats a bonus. I really like this place, but its a little far to be my local coffee shop. I really like the decor (not sure what it would be called), but the place is a little confusing at first. I saw the sign/billboard, but only saw the italian restaurant. Thankfully i wandered the correct direction. I walked in and the entrance is actually the side of the shop (if there is another oops). i was a little confused but made my way through, knowing i was in the correct location because everyone had coffee cups, iced and hot. I found the "menu" on a glass written with liquid chalk (love it). and pastries all over!   The pastry choices were plentiful, finding where to order a little difficult, because it looked like it was part of the pastry "display table". i'd come back i like the atmosphere a lot + it's next to slippery pig bike shop!

9uKnBFrR-YP4AYWHqAWTUA.text: Lux feels trendier than I'd prefer BUT their Mac-n-Cheese is to die for.  Go get some!  You won't regret it.

vL6FFo6mhlGbsKlfGy6HOA.text: Loved it!  The atmosphere, concept, the coffee and the yogurt!  Keep up the good work.

E7K5DGnTRgLwsuQnjN5dDA.text: Hidden treasure on Central Ave.  Authentic, local, Phoenix culture.  Coffee and pastries are fairly priced and very good.  Cocktails in the evening are unique but a little pricey.

whbQ827ipt9oDwH5NZedWQ.text: Went here for a brief impromptu work meeting. Simple. Varied theme hipster coffee bar. Nothing too special here. I can find plenty of places to overspend on a breakfast sandwich. God forbid if youre really hungry! Coffee was excellent. Everything else about that place was kinda ehhhh. I felt like everyone in there was there to be seen being quirky. I can totally understand why people can love these divey, retro-ish (can we say typewriters), off beat pretentious type coffee houses. I'd give it another try maybe.

FEIYle6ghlY5XzSoKxT0MA.text: Awesome service, good vibe and I love the distance from the light rail.

a0wWj1zhGM-WzPk9fyDqhA.text: Great place to grab a snack or pastry and study. I come here often and their does seem to be a regular woman that comes in by herself and harasses or creates uncomfortably distractions with customers. Let's weed out the weirdos for five stars.

XeLvUZrwFH9j_cC4Ob7kTw.text: Regularly visit, morning and night! Check out this Post! stephangcalizona.wordpre...

z7YcN8desovSiHrkkzDXSg.text: Awesome little shop for morning coffee and fresh backed goodies. The perfect place to meet up with my girls for coffee and catching up before hitting Sweet Salvage and the antique shops of the Melrose District. Excellent coffee and service, though the baked goods are a little pricey.

SLPJixpp5mUGx4Gscy09RQ.text: If you're looking to get some serious studying done, Lux is not the place for you, lol.   But if u want to hang with your friends, do some light work, or people-watch, then I would definitely recommend!!
