Great coffee, fun atmosphere and Lux never fails to entertain when it comes to people watching.   I've only been there 3, maybe 4 times, but every time I've been there i was very entertained lol. My first visit included a large group of rowdy, and slightly racist, santa clauses. And every visit since then has been just as entertaining.   I know some people who go there often to study, and I could never see myself doing that because there's just so much going on around you that it makes it a little hard to concentrate, but if u prefer that kind of environment when your studying or need a spark of creativity for your writing, Lux is a great stop!

iAMSLVl7bqLIrpLmVfU0Mw.text: Lux is a rare gem in the otherwise homogenized coffee shop scene which permeates the greater Phoenix metro. A haven for the "hipster" and "indie" crowds, it is frequently populated with would be iconoclasts who, if you move past the stereotypes usually cast upon such people, are largely friendly and unpretentious.  The service is earnest and talented producing some of the best cappucinos, americanos and other assorted caffeinated beverages in town. The various baked goods are reasonably priced and obviously crafted with care providing stark contest to the mass-produced crap most coffee shops sling with something like disdain for their customers.  I only hesitate to award the fifth star for lack of experience with the other offerings of food and drink they offer. An omission to my experience I hope to soon include.  EDIT: Since I never got around to posting this review after my first visit and subsequently visited numerous times I can confirm this to be a five-star establishment. In addition to the quality coffee beverages they offer their bar was (and likely still is) quite well stocked and competently tended. They offer a very solid selection of quality liquors and beers (can't speak confidently to their wine selection, I'm not much for the vino). Their meals are often exquisite and understated, though not exactly cheap. All told I definitely consider this and Copper Star to sit alone atop the Phoenix coffee throne.

n76zzTonGsC6N-JAGFwo_g.text: The Velvet coffee with their homemade whipped cream is so good!

uN9-NLNAYyKeAeBWzbdauw.text: Things I like in a coffee house...  1. Oddly, not coffee. I really am not a coffee person which leads me to...  2. Tea. I like tea. Tea and me are friends and when the barrista/o knows just as much about his teas as he does his coffees, then I am always impressed.  3. FREE wifi. I've been traveling a lot lately and I never really appreciated the beauty of free wifi til recently. You get ripped off at hotels, airports, etc, so when a place like this doesn't charge you to chill and enjoy your time here while surfing for midget porn, then I am very grateful.  4. Good people watching. Let's face it. I observe people for a living. I don't technically get paid for this, but I do it and so, I require a nice amount of characters to check out. Last night offered a dude wearing sunglasses...at night, along with two gay guys on a first date. Always VERY entertaining to watch someone else's awkward encounter unfold. "So, where did you go to elementary school?" "I hate when coffee is too strong!" "yada yada yada." (PS, they left to go for a "walk" so maybe it did go well)  5. A cool bathroom. I know this may seem odd, but I love cool bathrooms and loathe gross ones. There is no middle ground for me. Sadly, Lux falls into the latter and it was guuross! The attempt at art is...interesting though, and by interesting I mean, not so much, but hey, at least it distracts you from looking around at the wet floor and paper towel explosions and dirty counters.  So how does Lux weigh in on my 5 list. I think at a solid 3.5. Overall, the atmosphere was a tad sterile for my taste. I generally prefer really cozy couches and warm tones and cool lighting instead of white walls and somewhat fluorescent lighting. But the white tea was damn tasty, so I gotta give it up for that :)

fbc355_iGyEbYpYfcOlCCw.text: First up, great coffee. It's a shame they have such tasty mochas, because here is a place you can get a solid cap or espresso without fear. Just too many decisions. Their homemade whipped cream is amazing, so I often open for the quad-shot con pana to light me up. It's fantastic.  Next up, friendly, smart staff. They always seem extra happy, which may be the constant buzz from the espresso and whipped cream rushes I am sure they cruise on all day.  Cap it off with tasty pastries, nice vibe and decor, and it is one of my favorite coffee shops in town.  The only downside at all is that it's popularity can make it crazy busy, so if you're looking to sit and relax or work for a bit, get there eeeeeeearly.

sVrDaCGC6hcfyMeCPSfcfQ.text: This place defiently projects the "everybody is welcome here" vibe.  You walk in and the place is always packed with every kind of person imaginable.  Every Friday we meet up with friends for our weekly coffee date here and I couldn't think of a better place.  Try the mocha... hot or iced.  And make sure and get whip AT LEAST ONCE, delicious and home made!  The only negative... when it is packed it gets a little crowded and backed with people waiting for their coffee from the barista.

LMfqw47wgSaEUq_9odHJ9g.text: Sunchain Tanning-  First visit to a tanning salon and awesome experience.  Receptionist was so  excited about her job-  great experience and great tan.

FR7bX0Jf_bMoAxnKHXLQgg.text: So it may or may not be normal, but I had an incredibly inconsistent experience here the other night.   Lux has a primo location, next to Pane Bianco, just off a train station, and in a great neighborhood. They have a great patio which they share with Bianco, that even though it is loud, it is a nice spot to hang out.   Their coffee prices are more than fair, $2 for a large coffee, and decent tasting. The biggest thing was not having to pay additional tax, as they have worked it into the prices. I never realized how angry it makes me when something is like $2.03 and I have to walk around with a pocketful of change all day. So those are all the plusses, but I've had a few negative reports as well.  This may or may not be normal, but on my visit, it was a like an akward library. They did not have any music on, there was little to no conversation between customers, and it was very quiet. I also couldn't get past the blatant violation of fire code on the way to the restroom. They had piles and stacks of dishes in the hallway and I almost bowled one of them over because someone decided to try to pass me while I was next to one.

-YdZKsRxccZb6Mwoi41mNg.text: Alright, so I freakin love lux. The mac and cheese is literallly the bomb.com but like bomb.com from the early 2000s aka FREAKIN FIRRREEE. You have to add the bacon and jalapenos, otherwise you're just doing it half assed. Big fan of the velvet latte, but tell them to make it extra hot cause that drink gets cold so fast.

iDrmtgjoSUMu7b-_o-6gUA.text: Having lived in Portland for years, I consider myself to be a bit of a coffee snob. I have a very distinct opinion of what a coffee house should be! This is it!   Quality Coffee  Free WiFi Drinks offered in real dishes not just to go cups Comfy seating as well and great work spaces Yummy baked goods ***extra points for fresh organic fruit being offered***  While I'm not a regular here this is clearly the spot of the neighborhood locals. The staff is super friendly and remembers all of the repeats by name. When I'm back in Phoenix I always try to stop by Lux!

MfqLz86Mrb8bbaksuxe-1g.text: YES, the coffee is great.  Though each time I go there, the service is different.  You see, sometimes I go in and ask for a soda from the fridge in the back.  They usually pretentiously tell me to get it myself, as if I'm the only person who forgot to read the LUX Etiquette Handbook, Vol,4.  Im ok with getting it myself, thats all good.  But then the next time I go, i try to get it myself and an employee cuts me off as i attempt to open the fridge and says:   "Uhhh, can I help you?"    I say, "well, last time they told me to get the soda myself?"     She says, "Only when we're busy"  Yet it was more busy then than the previous time.   So to all the lux regulars, how many people is considered busy, or is there some other way in determining this.  Also, i always ask for whipped cream.  Half the time they put it on, half the time they don't.  Thats too bad because the whipped cream is amazing.  Last note, the arrogance, pretentiousness, self-obsessed, elitist vibe is uncanny.  Not the physical place, but the people.  If you don't walk in with a with that certain "I know good coffee and I'm special"  attitude, they stare at you like an alien.  Oh, and you have to have a mac laptop too.  But i will still continue to go here because they have the best coffee.  Oh well.

-NYFJU7JYkoSooV-YjexIw.text: Lux is one of my favorite businesses in Arizona.  I think Lux is an amazing example of authentic excellence. Whenever I think about branding, Lux always comes to mind as a great example. They know exactly what they are. They don't try to be anything else. They do an amazing job of executing every part of who they are.  First of all, the coffee rocks. They roast their own beans and are our favorite in town. Then the drinks they make are not only delicious but also beautiful. So many nice touches. Latte art. Homemade whipped cream with a touch of  honey. Sugared rim & slice of lemon on the lemonade. Fresh squeezed juices. McClendon Farms honey as a condiment. They serve their drinks in china & glass (cool non-institutional mugs & glasses) if you're drinking there. They even have killer lids for their to go coffee. Their straws are super thick & you never have to worry about them getting crimped.  If it didn't all taste good, I guess it wouldn't matter. But it does & every little aspect adds to the experience for me.  Same with their food. Great snacks. Served on china. Heated & served with a slab of real butter if it's supposed to be.  Cool decor. Changing local art on the walls. Great music playing. Free wifi.  The only thing that bugs me at all about Lux is how crowded it's become. In the scheme of things, I guess that's good because we know Lux will be around & it also says a lot for the taste of Phoenicians.  I have heard one other criticism - that the folks there can be snooty. I myself have never seen that & experienced the absolute opposite time after time. I often come with 2 little kids too so I'd expect if anybody was going to get the snoot, it'd be me.  I just plain love Lux. If it were closer to my house, I'd be there even more.

QD86QDNiNNdsGVyQZzkAmw.text: I'm definitely NOT a hangout at a coffee shop kinda girl, but if I *was* this is the place I would set up shop to read, write, draw, browse a magazine, meet a date or just people watch.  I met bonnie here pre-Chez Nous HH (that turned into evening since I got off work late) because my coffee shop connoisseur friend was posting up there until I got off work down the street. I admit I am directionally challenged to degree that is not only embarrassing, but debilitating. If you feel for me, take heed - I drove past it not once but two times. Add to that the light rail construction (it is right on central) and my post-work brain just about exploded. Poor bonnie had to take three calls from me before going out to the street to wave me in like an airplane.  But, once safely in the parking lot, there were ample spaces and I was surprised to see that pane bianco was right next door! Then it all made sense - why that phoenix cool-baby marketing rep asked me a date here, why so many people that I would not imagine know about these kinds of things seem to love talking about lux. It's right next door to prob one of the busiest/coolest places to pick up sandwiches for up-and-coming downtowners (uptowners?).   Well, although bianco was long-closed, lux was happenin' at 7 at night. there was plenty of comfy seating (two couches, and easily 7 or 8 arm chairs) plus a long table seemingly designated for setting up laptops. The staff seemed friendly and nice, and I really liked that the shelves for placing flyers was inset into the counter where you order - still visible but not at all the messy eyesore they inevitably end up being.  Ok, now for my favorite part - the clipboards that hang on stings against the wall so that patrons can hang their own sketches, drawings, paintings - whatever. (miss bonnie herself added a RAD sketch of a sexy bunny-man, I suggest you check it out).  Sorry to say I did not taste the coffee or the treats, so I can't speak to that. But, I would most definitely go back to do so.

4ufGP5nQycp6ygwcnoLwEQ.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Lux is a breath of fresh air in a city cluttered with boring chain coffee joints. From the modern, eclectic aesthetics to the masterfully prepared drinks (including the yummy homemade, scoop-able whipped cream!) and the laid-back staff, Lux is always a treat.   A life-long Phoenician, I've always had the "stay away from strangers" mentality. When I first went to Lux I was dismayed that even at a "slow" time I was forced to sit either on the same couch or at the same table as a stranger. Now I have assimilated to the environment that provides ample opportunity to easily strike up a conversation with fellow Lux-goers. Thank you Lux for melting this cold-stranger-averse exterior!   The only reason I cannot give Lux 5 stars is the lack of outdoor comforts. The picnic-style tables stand in stark contrast to the comfortable seats and atmosphere found indoors. On a beautiful spring/fall night (which I can only dream of at this time of year), I want to sit outdoors in comfortable seats, with a good cup of coffee and enjoy great conversation. Work with me Lux!   In summation, if you like great coffee (or yummy baked goods!) and a fun, energetic atmosphere, Lux is the place for you. :)

WYnPnhX-cAtkB1jhzpqDfg.text: I am shocked----could it really be the case that service here was once less than friendly?  I've only been going here for about a month, but everyone is super friendly, in the everyone knows your name sort of way.  This place deserves somewhere between 4-5 stars.  I just can't bear to give a coffee shop five stars---the coffee itself must be absolutely perfect for five (which it is not).    My one complaint is that it is slightly too uber-cool for me.  Definitely bring your laptops if you want to fit in.  PS: I find some of the pastries dry.  But, the pies are quite yummy.

1eLWChPkApetxNl7an04BQ.text: I love this place! Since the first time I walked into this deliciously urban coffeehouse, I have been greeted by name by Jeff, and his awesome staff.   Last Tuesday, I stopped in to get snacks for a Birthday Brunch at the office at like 6:30 am. I purchased an entire quiche, just out of the oven and it was the hit of the party as this quiche was ridiculously FABULOUS!!    Just say yes to this place!

DOT5eDiOpxdXxJJcNkfdiA.text: Took my atlas bipod and other gun items related to Wright Armory to have them cerokote and barrel thread.  The guys gave me a quote..Next day he called back and wanted more money.  More specially example...Atlas bipod was quoted $120...Next day they wanted $250 to cerokote it.  The Atlas bipod is bout $200 and these clowns think im gnna spend $250 to cerokote it?  Stay away from these clowns.  If you guys need quality and friendly gunsmith service...Check out Phoenix Custom Rifles.....

ad07m8i7uMCFkJWbz51kLA.text: Luxury Link a company that offers luxury travel at discounted rates may be in bankruptcy because their site is not operable and they are not returning phone calls.  Moreover, a hotel that I prepaid for a reservation has not been paid and is going to cancel my reservation unless I secure payment directly with the hotel.

UNIAAiR6uMMByHnzgCRvmA.text: My only four star review for a coffee house, This place pays great attention to detail. One can't deny the cool looking flower in the middle of each cup.  And the pastries that are made in the back make every trip memorable.     a.a is right bring a laptop if you want to be one with Lux.    I found the service to be very friendly and there is not a high rate of turnover, the baristas know what their doing.    Don't let the light rail construction stop you from a visit the place is worth it.

7vqGH4n12eTuuJqGFPzNyg.text: Great place to sit with your laptop and drink coffee.  I luv Lux Coffeebar!  I would walk to this fabulous shop at least 3 times a week.  Its a great place to meet friends for coffee or to sit on the sofa with your laptop.  Awesome atmosphere.  I could sit there for hours listening to the music.  They offer an assortment of delicious baked goods.  On the plus side Pane Bianco is right next door.  Best place to grab a sandwich.

lKBKLxNombLUwu8SAX518w.text: Lux remains, hands down, the best coffee shop I've found in Phoenix.  The coffee is great, the service is quick and unpretentious, music is (almost) always good, and there is just no better place to settle in with a book or laptop for an hour or two.    They also always have the most delicious pies/cakes/muffins.  The only complaint I have is that it would be nice if they carried some "savories"... breads, rolls, pasta salads, or maybe even sandwiches.

4ZQ0fnvxlw4RWYrGbj25YA.text: I come here every year to meet my good friend for coffee as it's between our folk's houses. i have many fond memories of jamming a years worth of events into 90 min conversations over tasty coffee and chai.  everyone who works here is awesome and the drinks are good. i never see a crowd but i go at fairly off hours - i could see it getting crowded as they have it set up more like a living / dining room than a restaurant.  my favorite place to sit is at the giant light table. can't wait for the next time i am back in AZ so i get to go back!

yqxXt-7jG0xogKHHffrxyw.text: love this place for baked goods, ambience and art, and did I say baked goods?  I have a small child and its not great for him unfortunately, so only 4 star.  Most places have a kids corner or high chair and on my last visit they didn't.  But I can go alone and do and enjoy it.  LOVE THE URBAN VIBE, and the local artists.

HkXuke9F4vRjVlQuylYMpQ.text: This is now my favorite place to get coffee in the Phoenix area. The brew tastes great and is fairly priced. A large latte is 4 bucks. The best part about this place is the atmosphere. There are a lot of 20 somethings that regular here with their iBooks and headphones, but there are still just as many people socializing. It is crowded, but with lots of good seating. There is an area with great comfy chairs and leather couches. There are also ample tables to keep your laptop on. The walls are littered with interesting local, contemporary art.   Half the time I'm here I take my headphones off because I enjoy the music they play so much. They even have a pitcher of free lemon ice water. :)

ovyIrHRfWX-Pn8PPZ1uLNA.text: What I like best about Lux is the excellent coffee and great music/DJ.  I used to enjoy the interesting and happy, laid back crowd of people that tended to flock to Lux to sip a coffee while working on their laptops or chatting for a while over a dessert.    For some reason- is it the larger meals?  the alcohol?  the bigger more comfortable seats?  the typewriters?  the extra bathroom?- the new Lux draws a totally different demographic... mostly over 40 and under 5.  Think yoga pants or church dresses... with a bunch of poorly behaved kids yelling "Mom, Mom, Mom, Mom.... DAD!", running, and twirling around in a crowded space with adults carrying full-to-the brim coffee cups.  Or worse, the screaming infants of hipster (or used to be) parents who can't let go... they honestly think they can remain cool by sitting on the couch sipping Velvets while the entire place is subjected to their bawling infants whom they expect everyone to find adorable.  Really??!  It IS mildly entertaining to watch the interaction between the burgeoning "family"/senior citizen/Christian Sunday morning crowd ("Liam, sit down, honey.  Liam, Liam, Liam... stop that, Liam.  Stop licking the nice lady's scone.... it's not yours. LIAM!") with the fit, handsome gay men, the brilliantly overweight and pierced/tattooed lesbians, pseudo business people, and liberal graduate students.    Younger/trendy crowd seems to get drinks to go now.  Those who stay are ogled by mid lifers who want to know all about your computer or your cell phone and have no qualms about interrupting your work for a free tech lesson.  You also run the risk of toddlers sipping from your straw if your drink is left on the table.    Or maybe you will enjoy being pushed out of the way by a 40 year old woman in yoga pants who simply MUST get her iced mocha right this second?  If not, you may want to get that coffee to go... quickly!    The Sunday DJ is amazing.  His music could be my "church".  So, it was sad that today I could only hear toddlers, soccer moms, etc. yelling over the music about nothing of importance or interest.  :-(  Lastly, the internet connection comes and goes, mostly goes.  I have to tether with my cell phone because the wifi drops every hour or so.

CwgUfjIQOE3l30YwYpeKlg.text: Love this place.  Great coffee, fabulous, homemade everything.  Can't beat it.

t2L1ifHc_NBWvd4fIqICtw.text: excellent coffee - blew blue bottle out of the water and easily stands up to la colombe. add to that, great customer service!  we'd be heartbroken if they stopped shipping! thank you lux!

EfyCdZ5ILZZapiJZxQVTCw.text: What a lovely way to spend the first Saturday of the decade...sitting sipping succulent saucers of sugary non-soda sustanance while staring silently at the sills saturated in satin stained suggestions. Still stalking the scenario, suddenly it seems our shouting shook a local without solicitation to solve our sight-seeing saga!  Sensational.   And the coffee and company are good too.

hEAAoxj39xS0iGW6Je60HQ.text: Best Soy Latte in town, with a great foam design, Muffins are not very tasty, hard to find seating, but if you do, great items to read and fun people watching.

5m5Rwdg8Bx92ZncJx6T9bQ.text: Lux is the hipster spot for sure. I am glad a friend suggested this place, only because I was happy to go to a cool place in Phoenix. This place looks cool and the baked goods look amazing! Unfortunately, it was so busy that by the time I got to see what they had to offer, I had to order right away. I didn't have a chance to decide, since most of the stuff is right before the register. The line was enormous and therefore, hid the items up for choosing. It's a spot where you must be a regular in order to know what to get. The chai was good and the quiche that I had was also tasty, but pretty small and not filling. I was still hungry after I ate it and didn't want to wait in line again. Overall, this place is really cool, but I don't feel like I got the full experience, since we were heading back to CA shortly after out visit to Lux. Maybe next time.

UzmF43O0--tgl5LwzGrj-g.text: Sometimes you just need to say ,"eff the environment!" and drive 25 miles for a delicious mocha.

jGJA4K0ZDC9VzZX7JvMFHQ.text: If you like pretentious, pseudo-intellectuals who have not bathed this year yet, please, check out lux. if you like overly loud, poorly thrown back hipster groove music, please, check out lux. maybe you like to watch a 60 year old dj spinning "music" from his laptop in the back on friday mornings at a decibel louder than your neighbor's new harley that was purchased to fulfill his midlife crisis. if you do, check out lux. the reason for the loud music? the dj forgets to bring his hearing aids. the music is made by people who listened to the beastie boys' check ya head and thought they could do better. it is possible the bands thought they could outdo music from "santa claus conquers the martians."   if you wish to have some sort of conversation with anyone in which you would like to hear as well as be heard, do not go to lux. sure the patio is nice, but that only lasts a few weeks in the year. the "art" on the walls, and i use that term very loosely (the only thing being looser is my ex), is boring, amateurish and made by someone who feels that they are the stand-out prize in their community college art class. evidently, the artists find that one effect on photoshop that they cannot do without. it is called solarize and it went the way of the shampoo that the patrons have long since forgotten.   on a bright note, and there is only one, the pastries and food are amazing. everything is made fresh daily and they are exquisite. it is this single reason that this place gets one star. she alone has earned that.   bring sanitary wipes in case you decide to go and try this place out. i have seen dogs cleaner than the pants on some of those who frequent this place.   and before anyone gripes -- why don't you just go somewhere else? -- i respond, i no longer can stand this place. i tried, i really did, to like it. i wanted very much to like it. but, sad to say, i have moved on to greener pastures, one where bathing is not something considered taboo.

Gjfs-g9r1Ogg4Pg59hX07Q.text: Lux is the bomb, plain and simple.  Amazing coffee (both drinks and beans). (My 3 favorites- Cartel, Stumptown and Lux.)  Delicious food and pastries.   Fun, stylish and comfy atmosphere.   My family and I are frequent Lux-goers and love it just the same, every visit.

Mn5mZ-VM0X-wbHpbtFhU6g.text: Super busy...kind of a cluster-F even..but cool environment.  Food is solid.  Expresso is very...bold.

2bwa7atJiQREa-LL5hBzVA.text: You have to try the velvet!!! Lux is so to die for, we actually had a meeting at my office that it is ok to go during work hours without counting it as a break as long as you bring some back for everyone. (no joke)

SdhAjwvYQ29GiKj2HFmZlA.text: Wow! My favorite people took me here knowing I would love it! Hey- this place has the ambience of Seattle. And the coffee to rival It. So when I am homesick.... This is the place! Lux ROCKS!

1wxjeDHVdzduiwIlaYuUGQ.text: I really debated between a 2-star, 3-star, or 4-star.  If this based soley on their coffee drinks then they would be a 4, if based on their pastries a 3, and if based on their non-coffee drinks (ie chai, apple cider) then it would be a 2.  The espresso machiattos are extremely tasty.  I usually end up leaving with quite a good buzz because I'll get a few doubles.  The customers can be kind of bothersome with their macbook pro's staring at you as you try to find a seat, but all in all, I think this place is pretty ok.

z1t7NyEhiRSF9IiqCyANFw.text: I have liked Lux the most of all the coffee shops I've tried in Phoenix so far.  I should have gone here months ago!  It was just lovely on a July day.  Interior has a fantastic, simple feel.  The temperature was refreshing.  My iced chai latte was delicious.  I'm going to change that to five stars.  :)

1axTzZJWShEkValzTPKHUg.text: Lux is the place to go to if you're looking to experience Phoenix. You'll encounter a varied amount of individuals that inhabit the midtown area! All of the food I've had so far is great, although it is a bit on the pricier side. I also suggest pre-planning if you are going to study. The internet isn't the greatest  so download any books or articles you need ahead of time!

4Pn8lMn7lenT3XkcZq1x8w.text: Cute little spot in Central Phoenix. The coffee and lattes are amazing. The baked goods are good but nothing special.

Pk1BYwNLCPqDgQUuCBh06A.text: Like everyone else has said, this place is fantastic. I wouldn't exactly call it a 'hidden gem' as it's jam packed at all hours of the day - or so it seems. The environment is pretty laid back and relaxing if you can get passed the fact that they need to consider relocating to a larger building. If you can't get over how crowded it is, there's always the 'to go' option. The Lux experience offers great prices, delicious drinks, and a friendly staff.

noC4IuJ8UAmjo6iqYT8PPQ.text: Remember that time you knew what a Dirty Chai was, Lux?  Remember how it was perfectly mixed, chilled, sweet and delicious every single time?  .... remember that time that I couldn't find a place in NY with a decent Dirty Chai (assuming the barista knew what I was talking about)?  Oh Lux, I promise that I will sit doing nothing with my Macbook, a trusty Pane sandwich, and the deliciousness that is your Dirty Chai come December.

kCLYZDtEhkTl3fLYtxNqmw.text: Love, love, love this place. So why am I not giving it 5 stars? Just a few picky things. The coffee line can be so long (worth it), but also their creative cocktails can break the bank. I went in on a Tuesday early afternoon doing some work from home and had two drinks. I didn't realize they were each $10. That with some mac and cheese made for a more expensive lunch than I expected. Other than that, they are awesome.

8qR3GCUaiMGL-p-aRNELlQ.text: Delicious savories, and high quality coffee. I love the goods and the creativity that infuses their offerings. Take away even 1/4 of the hipsters and posers that literally jam every nook and corner, and I will be a 5 star fan. I live 2 blocks away so I just take my treasures home, but some days I'd love to hang out there. Someday.

KYIjizWcd9x4QThUP6ycow.text: Coffee and espresso are nothing super special the atmosphere is great some of the baristas are stuck up. Delicious Mac and cheese !!

GaEBGAo_aONLQazz5ctgYg.text: While at a conference downtown I hopped on a GridBike and road the 5 miles to give this place a try.  The place was surprisingly full for a Tuesday night.  I had asked for a cocktail menu which they don't have, but the bartender was True mixologist.    She made me a wiskey cocktail the was perfect.  This is where I lack the vocabulary to properly describe the drink but it was just as I requested.  Alcohol forward not too sweet.  Without measuring or testing it she made a well balanced cocktail wirh no one ingredient overpowering any other.  We'll worth the pedal.  Should have had another and Ubered back.

qN9VZkyissyfibQcUEq5ww.text: I'm updating this review after Lux has expanded into a location at least twice as large, and is now offering way more than they offered before! (not that it was bad before). There is a full bar, a lunch and dinner menu, delicious pastries (savory and sweet), and of course, amazing coffee. There are lots of partitioned rooms now so you can explore and see which room fits your mood best for the day. There is a quieter "study" dark room in the back, but attached to it is a large "TV room" where it seems more acceptable to be loud and to...breastfeed your child. I'm down with that...I guess.  Perhaps my favorite thing about Lux is the aloof personality of the owner Jeff, who is an actual genius underneath his outer layer of quirk, and one of the bartenders whose name I wish I knew...he wears glasses, is has brownish hair, tall and slender, and makes a mean cucumber lemon cocktail. LUUUXXXX.

Wey8u6MoToYAdMYSFNWNog.text: Love the Lux!    This is my go-to place for:  -first or second dates  :-)  -hanging with friends socially -studying/working with friends -solo study/work time  I'm not a coffee drinker, but I consume my fair share of tea and really love the wide selection of tea options found here.   They also have some tasty treats that will certainly satisfy your sweet tooth and are great to share with your sweetheart or friends!   Great drinks/snacks, nice tables and comfy chairs, study rooms, couches, good music, a non-smoking patio (woo!!), a smoking patio (eww! but recognize some like this) this place has it all.   Plus, my favorite part of it all - it's downtown in the heart of Phoenix in a great building and easy distance to all the wonderful places to explore and things to do while you are downtown.  Love, love, love Lux!

jpILV8AdYp1Zcm0_IPI8lA.text: I love this place. I wish it wasn't loved by so many people because it's always hard to get a seat and a seat next to an outlet, even more difficult. The coffee is great, any food choices I have had off the menu have been fantastic.  I love the hipster vibe, and there is always Plenty of parking. I don't live close by, but stop in anytime I'm in that part of the city.

KfmpzkAFuYmNQe9QXoUBEg.text: This is a great little "internet" cafe/bar/restaurant, conveniently located in Central Phoenix. Good food, pastries/desserts and drinks. If you want a "local" alternative to Starbucks, this is a very nice option.

2OIaScVGb8CCguv8sS3dLw.text: Great coffee house. Amazing vibe. Food is really good. Coffee price is a bit high I think 4.20 for a small iced latte but it was worth it. I got the Mac n cheese and it was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arugula salad
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac n cheese for lunch.

QpstiA1MQkHzfsdtmsvszQ.text: Jalapeno bacon Mac n cheeeeeeez. What else is there to say, really? I love everything about this place. Food is ALWAYS fresh and delicious. Chai tea latte...on point. And the fact that you get to tell them what drink you want and they make it with fresh fruit and herbs, ummmmm YES please more please. What a gem. Oh, and don't even get me started on their baked treats...

VY-UBaeZ0LNwvK6VHsa5MA.text: I came to Arizona from Washington and was shocked at the lack of good coffee shops. When I walked into Lux, my desperate search came to a halt. The coffee is spectacular, the people are down to earth, and the bar-area has a great selection of beer!   Basically, if you come from anywhere outside Arizona and are used to great coffee (and the thought of Starbucks appalls you), this is your place. Yes, it is packed and it takes a while to get your drink, but if you can go in an off-hour, it's the perfect place to sit down and enjoy a cup.

Ds2-e7K0iWKMNxk24olpTw.text: Very hipster-centric place. Never had a bad experience.

4WXfnqAHDmkxb5_4aB6Mzw.text: Amazing coffee and food!! I love to come here and study or hang out with friends. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars, is that it's sometimes hard to find seating inside because it so busy. But overall, a great place!!

-3DXUwCFGrpwlGBa-XBiuQ.text: I walked around the building 3 times before figuring out the entrance was in the back. Then figuring out where to order was a challenge as there are 2 areas that look like they could be ordering stations. Terrible service. The people that work there have an attitude. I ordered a coffee with whipped cream. They put maybe less than a tablespoon on top. So I asked for more. The woman looked at me and disappeared. I assumed she was getting more whip, she comes back and calls my name for my coffee. I'm already standing in front of her and I ask again for more and she leaves again this time comes back with the whip and puts less than a teaspoon on. Needless to say the whip was amazing but why be stingey with it?! The coffee tasted watered down.

gkkl27sBzCJVcPdC786LdQ.text: Good coffee. Good ambience. Easy parking. Lots of long tables which suited our group of 6. Employees were friendly. Had the quiche lorraine which would've been better if it were warm rather than room temp but it was still tasty.

MqW44Lsi-t3kS95lh6bfWQ.text: Lux is a wonderful place to meet up friends and waste some downtime however their products are not to my liking. I love the staff but it's just not my place.

KopZGqqoZuXhUIuaUkDEew.text: Great food! Got the macaroni and cheese one of the best I've ever tried! They're coffee is delicious they do tend to make it a bit stronger than other places but shouldn't be an issue if you like coffee strong. You've got to visit this place just for the atmosphere, incredibly cute!

5g8XgzzLZTpIhI63hXn7nw.text: Came here for first time during a weekday morning...Busy but flowing I had there cheesesteak sandwich and iced coffee It took almost 20 minutes to get food but the employees recognized the error and promptly fixed it and after all said and done they appoligezed again and gave me a free coffee for my next visit. The building can easily be missed kinda got to know about it which is neat also inside is very eclectic with typewriter s and antiques kinda hip and urban feel live music playing smells are great. Definitely glad it's near my home its diffrent..

7aFBerxJrhfJNeojaWYvMQ.text: Worth the wait in line! All fresh, organic ingredients and food prepared with pride and love. The Baker gave us two free morning buns when she learned we were visiting from out of town. What a way to feel welcomed! Really enjoyed the laid back ambiance. Decided to wait for the bartender to arrive and enjoy their fresh fruit-inspired cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grapefruit gin cocktail topped with champagne. Refreshing way to start the weekend.

P7V5Hoh9DyeOe0-fF76uLw.text: Cappuccino was delicious! Cool place to listen to good music and work.

cT3gDesxngLD79J3YkSuNQ.text: I went to Lux about 4 years ago and it was awesome, staff were friendly, the Mac and cheese was great, and coffee was also very good.  Over the years service has been garbage.  Last night I went and the female that took our order was out there and drinks that they had listed on the menu were not available.  Then I get to the register and I get some punk who is rude AF threw the receipt and my card to me and never engaged at all with his stuck up demeanor.  The majority of the staff are a bunch of stuck up rude youngsters that have zero manners and don't have a clue about customer service.  So go ahead and pay almost $6 dollars for coffee for some rude punks to serve you coffee.  Hope the owners see this post and give their staff training in regard to customer service and how to treat customers.

7zbNfbg_cNgZfA5YLaUYGA.text: My new favorite coffee drink. A Lindsay with 6 shots! Yum! It's like the best Vietnamese coffee I've ever had.. with flavored whipped cream

f3hrE_Mj5_NL1E4AirocBg.text: I tried this place for the first time last Sunday.  I really loved the food!!  I had the bacon cheeseburger, and it was out of this world!  We also showed the sweet bartender a picture of a drink, and he made it for us!  I was so impressed with him.  I will definitely be back.   It's such a cute, quirky place.

WmgPZe-LWndfu_-Ja_SSqg.text: Sunday night and almost all the other coffee shops in town are already closed so we opted to try Lux. Even though it was late, the parking lot was packed with only one space left for us.  On entering we were hit with the wonderful aroma of coffee. After fighting our way through the crowd we were able to join the line to order. Fortunately it went quickly and when our drinks were ready, so was a couch so we were able to sit and enjoy the experience. You obviously go to Lux for the experience as it is a perfect people watching place. There is an eclectic mix of young adults who are either studying or using their computers or phones to stay on top of the most recent social events.  And, by the way, there is also a bar crowd as well as Lux also has a full bar. If this is your type of establishment you will love this place, if not, just enjoy your coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A yummy vanilla latte.

vl-_bgK9Xvi4wzSRA3b0LQ.text: I usually stop here when I am traveling for work they have amazing coffee and a great atmosphere but on a personal trip I took my wife there for breakfast and she was floored it was the most amazing breakfast she said she's ever had thanks for doing what you do so well.

eP-7iVdxXnO58tLo8U1Ngw.text: Best coffee in central phoenix. Their ice latte and americano are superb. I don't really like their pastries even though people seem to love it. Seats are plenty but it is usually packed with people. I never tried their orange juice but I really want to recommend to anyone since it looks so fresh and everytime I go there, they are making fresh OJ.

mI0EtePNM15EmOVJly2Vew.text: Pastries  are   great  and  are tenderly made  by  a beautiful Italian/Hispanic   baker. Don't  hurry in and out  but  enjoy the  vibe and  the crowd.   Great  for a   date   or  lunch

7nq-3QkpUtOEcDuR61wZlw.text: Everything I've tried at Lux has been incredible! I personally only drink alternative milk options, and they're almond milk lattes are some of the best I've had! The whipped cream is to die for! Be sure to try it! I've had multiple food options, and everything has been delicious! Try the loaded grilled cheese with jalapeno for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Almond milk latte and quiche

qNPl0HjstSPrzxs8Pu5QxA.text: Lux on Central never disappoints. My boyfriend and I have become regulars here. Great place to hang out with close friends. Or if you prefer to be solo and focus on getting some work done this place provides the perfect atmosphere. With multiple outlets throughout the lounge you will be able to get a charge without being secluded.   Recommendation: Jalapeno mac and cheese  Bacon cheeseburger on english muffin   ANY of their hand crafted cocktails.

35WT5NCCG5G7xZJWU_m9_w.text: When I moved to Phoenix two years ago, this was my number one place for coffee and morning treats. However, over the past two years, something has changed. It is always busy, and the parking is terrible. It is also sometimes hard to find a seat. Their mochas also got less creamy and chocolatey for some reason. Their food is still great, but not sure it's worth the wait and the parking nowadays with other great options popping up in Mid-Town Phoenix. It's still a great atmosphere, and I do take out-of-towners here, but it's not my go to anymore.

wzHgzGY2V-jN9LO21hzUnA.text: Out of all the coffee shops I've been to, and trust me I've been to way too many, this remains my #1!! Great coffee, great food, great ambience, and great music!! A lot of space to study!! If you need a quiet place to study, then this isn't the place for you. But if you need a cool place to study that stays open late, then this is your place to go!! Coffee is amazing here!! My go-to drinks are Iced Black & White and Vanilla Lattes. And don't forget to add their homemade whipped cream for free!! It's heavenly  In regards to their food, everything is amazing but you MUST try their breakfast egg sandwich (can get the bacon exchanged with avocado), regular mac n cheese, pesto mac n cheese, and mashed potatoes & broccoli!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. You need to try their homemade whipped cream!!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Dc9-NnU3NqcKk7CgvdNrCA.text: So I definitely feel old AF when I come here. Weekends have some great music & prepare for it to be packed! Super indie/hipster vibes. The pastries are just okay to me but the shining star would be their cocktails. My friend got their espresso martini & I couldn't get over how amazing it was, I almost wanted to go cancel my order & switch to that instead. I'd like to try coming at a less crazy time & checking out some of their food as the reviews all seem to say it's great!

Bi_ZGLYqbxpMh23RN3KPhA.text: Lux's luster still shines on, it's my go-to cafe to frequent, it's almost a problem how often I visit. I still ultimately love most things about this cafe and have probably been here more times then I can remember.  The reason behind the dropped star is that I've noticed that the workers can be a bit short and the food a bit too salty. Heavy seasoning hands on the chefs here. I ordered the Yorkshire Pudding Burger with Beet chips and though the Yorkshire pudding, aioli and beet chips were tasty the burger patty itself was too salty. The Yorkshire pudding seemed a bit too tough, kind of expected a more flaky texture and the patty cooked a bit over to my "Medium Rare" preference though stated during my order.  Alas, if there's one thing you should order here besides the pastries and other dishes on their changing menu it's their Mac & Cheese. It's not the nostalgic bright, orange Mac N Cheese that comes in a blue and yellow box ... but it is definitely next level. Perfectly cooked macaroni, creamy and gooey, melty cheese sauce. I also got mine with bacon and jalapenos, which gave it a bit of heat and a smokey, saltiness from the bacon.  Other than that, the drinks, pastries, well dressed folk, sociable people, table space, fast wi-fi and late hours of operation are still a win in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small Iced Americano &amp; Croissant
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steel Cut Oatmeal with Pecans and Raspberries &amp; Nonfat Iced Latté
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MwaDMvjNtiPF_JkBIGThjw.text: I would never go here again.  It as suggested as a meetup place for coffee with 2 other industry  colleagues .  At 10am yesterday--Friday--it was packed and cacaphenous, so noisy and crowded.  We waited in line that moved quickly for just coffee and a latte.  It was crowded and everyone swuished up close.  Tables I side were all full but it was too crowded and loud in there anyway.  It's too rustic outside and please replace those tables and chairs and put them in tradinable places to sit.  I had on white pants and tables and chairs were not cleaned.  Very dirty in fact, if that is what one calls rustic. I take it this is a local hangout place.  No thank you.  Not teturning ever .  We'll hope the food and younger folks gave this place the high ratings.  Just say no

7QELLm5N7mHmcrLn2BXVlA.text: I have been here several of times and I love the environment. I like to study here but the employees are not welcoming. I always have a bad experience when I purchase food. I asked if I was able to purchase the Lu baked potato during lunch not knowing that's only for dinner and the employee rolled her eyes and said " did you read the top of the menu?... it says dinner only. " I felt embarrassed and honestly wanted to leave. She remained quiet and handed me my change after purchasing a tomato soup instead. She said not a word after that. ... This isn't the first time employees have been unfriendly because of this I will give the place a one star.

Q5eK9NqPaik4lvoXZ_dDIg.text: Your new favorite coffee shop (: Great if you're younger and looking for a place to grab a coffee with friends or read a book

TciYQbiYGyQXcUz5oNgpWQ.text: Stumbled on this little gem in the middle of the night on a Saturday. The coffee was delicious, and we ordered a dessert, s'mores cake of sorts, ridiculously sweet, we couldn't finish it between 3 people, but we also ordered "dessert" coffee(white breve mochas extra sweet, so it may have been excessive just because of our beverage choice). It's hard to find signage on the outside. Makes it feel like an underground New York coffee house. The music was RAD and fit the ambience.  And it's super cute inside.  If you can find it, check it out. And don't order melted ice cream coffee if you're getting a dessert. I felt like I was testing my fate while aggressively flirting with diabetes.

FxuUnWIMMg-tDIGSa9CNEQ.text: I finally made it here, after it being on my "to breakfast" list for months. A mocha was quite nice, and the chorizo biscuits & gravy were out of this world. The layout was a bit baffling for a n00b, and I'm thankful I had a veteran Luxer there to guide me through the food and drink-ordering.

g5b0mIP5ZVYH4BRzEmadIQ.text: Amazing atmosphere! Great ambiance and a good amount of sitting areas. Coffee was good and a great selection of pastries. WiFi and a good amount of outlets. But small place and lots of plp, if you do find a place to seat most likely your neighbors will hear all your convo. Other than that a very cool hip place

SSX_l9Awo2GTWaIYJqPhpg.text: My favorite place!  Delicious everything!  A can't miss if you are visiting Phoenix!  Still love it here!  Wish I had more reasons to be in the downtown Phoenix area!  I would come here every morning!  Simply delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything is delicious!  Coffee, pastries, dinner, cake.....Always so good!

6GhQ1NFILseT9QKEMJpyJA.text: Lux is, according to my 28-year-old daughter, THE place to have coffee.  I like it fine, but don't feel as positive about it.  Lines can be long, service can be impersonal or slightly surly (which I prefer over the Dutch Bros overly friendly, chatty manner), it can be very crowded.  But it's A-OK, which is apparently what 3 stars means.

qNqfFtJno_m0kpDJXW2aRw.text: Gets crowded so come when its not breakfast, lunch or dinner. People tend to hang out for hours here because it is so inviting and fun. Space is tight but the coffee and mac n cheese is amazing! Great place for meet ups and students. Indie music blaring with young folks getting their caffeine on. Love it here!

JzyahPsHqlrm2ZNh9Dm4uQ.text: I had a good time here but that had as much to do with the company I was with for Smunch.  The coffee was good.  I had biscuits and gravy which was pretty good.  I think the best way to describe the place is organized chaos.  The place was packed on a Saturday morning which led to a lot of people milling around waiting to order or waiting for their order to come up.  For me it was a case of the place just isn't me.

wMIDq0eG2zH4MWd7NEU40Q.text: A lot of people say this is a hipster hangout for pretentious people. I wish it was. It's just boring to me. Their coffee is alright and fair-priced. Their baristas are sometimes nice to me and sometimes they roll their eyes at me. It's nothing I wouldn't expect anywhere else. So if it was a little more pretentious, that might make this place at least more interesting.

ugTf8GEbH4yCNoquRZcVYA.text: I'm not going to lie- I'm a hard woman to impress with coffee.  It's good, definitely not burnt or weak, and more flavorful than Starbucks.  Did it blow my mind?  No.  I did get a raspberry thumbprint cookie which was REALLY good though, and all of their baked items looked delicious. I highly recommend getting something with your coffee, even if you have to eat it later. The atmosphere was as described - 'cozy' and with lots of character if not a whole lot of places to stand while waiting for your drink.  It is a good place to sit and chat, as there is lots of seating alcoves.  It was little crowded when I went (Thursday afternoon), but the staff had the flow down and the wait wasn't bad. I won't be driving cross town just to get a cup though, but I might stop in again if I'm in the area.

QDoOCwWsSSgR-PTFeLyCpA.text: Coffee is still incredibly expensive. If I had unlimited disposable income, I would go. Atmosphere is wonderful as well, great place to take people who are new to downtown. Service is hit or miss -- barista lady's are either incredibly nice, or have way too much attitude. Open up another register, sometime? no?

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lovin the drinks! One dollar iced coffee refills

nNzgGNI9Rgq44YReGV3TeQ.text: I've been here several times for coffee, alcohol, and dessert. I've met old friends here and have been on casual first dates. Sometimes, parking can be a challenge and it can get crowded...and, therefore, loud. If it's cold,  the constant in & out makes the seating areas near the doors uncomfortable. People who patron this place look about 18-45 years old and most could pass for Hipsters & Millennials. Personally, I like the place and can't believe it gets such poor reviews.

EgZZ6Pp2QGHhohNPO2mvUw.text: Very different type of place. Not a restaurant, not a coffee shop. Cool hipster place, open floor plan, avg food and drinks

Xsyg3cqr5Cu_j_A3ztysyQ.text: Great place to go socialize, work, or just relax. With a friendly staff, and lively atmosphere Lux knows how to keep people coming back. I go there to work on papers/projects as well as lounge with family and friends. It's an enjoyable place to be, no matter the occasion.

YqhOnsQR5LnBEaNh7MUBLg.text: Good coffee spot, and the Mac n Cheese is on point!

qo5FbUvg5kukpPaiMeOJ_w.text: Very trendy. Great place to meet up or hang out with friends or do "work" or "homework" and enjoy the atmosphere. Always semi-busy but plenty of places to sit and move around. Menu works just fine. Staff is very friendly. Great place to hang out and read a book and enjoy some coffee.

jO3W2LgVZIVkEG1IsU4mVA.text: This place is my favorite coffee spot in Phoenix. It's also pretty cool you can get alcohol here if you want as well.  Also their Mac and Cheese is to die for ._.

IvpBsd3lwiCL37RknwCJ_A.text: Very cool establishment.  Service is quick and pleasant. Food is amazing although the portions seem to be getting smaller.

3DSBrT5cfRp_4CYeRFh_Vg.text: We just had a lovely lovely Thanksgiving at Lux. We LOVED the new drink menu, art work and black manhattans from Sammy. Our meal was thoughtful, nostalgic and all of the best Thanksgiving flavors. We were tired travelers and this was just perfect!

NV_P8tIRmkqwyAnUWlucJA.text: One Guard Home Warranty I am a Realtor and have recommended One Guard Home Warranty for many years.  It is all about the terrific service my clients receive plus I can always call the Rep, Camille, for answers to my questions. One Guard technicians are prompt, courteous and knowledgeable and appointments are scheduled quickly. My clients are all very happy with the great service they receive.

E6Kz8ItRnhEQfdEjr6Rz-g.text: I like it, good food and drinks. It seems like they are often under staffed. Fun atmosphere.

OtzgpArmX1JZaGYBJa2oUg.text: Great place to find a seat and a java of your choice. I met a friend here during the weekday in the late afternoon; seemed like everyone had the same idea because it was extremely busy. I liked the space, it seemed very private in some areas for those who wanted to work and concentrate on their work (1 star). But it also had the buzz in the air as your typical vibrate coffee shop (1 star). I had a cold mocha, and it was served in an environmental friendly cup (1 star). The mocha was delicious and made to perfection (1 star). The seating was abundant, with many choices (couches, long tables, community tables, bar seating, etc.) (1 star). 4 stars!  I'm deducting a star because of location and when I initially walked in I had my heart set on a cold berry green tea. They didn't have anything similar on their menu. They recommended an Iced Tea or lemonade ---umm, not the same.

e5gPZ9TiPv9A5ysrhlnVGA.text: Lux Central is the place we mostly go to on Saturday night before taking the bikes downtown. The ambiance is very warm and the personal very friendly. They have good choice of drinks and food. Pay them a visit and you'll keep going

Afjb05eTipc8MeDf1iOzgg.text: I've been coming here on and off the past 8 months or so, and although there's been some strange and not so nice experiences, it's gotten a lot better. I go because this is the only coffee place that has a somewhat urban feel to what I'm use to at home. I sew and like a space where I can get some nice drinks and pastry while I get things done. I like the decor, the music is usually quite good as they play mostly indie, and the patrons who come here have been quite nice. The silly, trifling, pretentious goons aren't here anymore, or maybe they've stayed away. The servers are nicer and more helpful, and that's pretty important, too. I've worked at restaurants and bars for most of my adult life and I still do- being concerned about customers is important...even if that seems "uncool."

HSRDRDvi5riTOBbtDFaFhg.text: After wanting to try Lux forever, I finally stopped in on a perfect Arizona Sunday Morning.  I like the set up as they have a table, covered with pastries and employees waiting to take your order.  Everyone was friendly and service was quick.    Previous reviews talk about how urban, trendy, hipster this place is.  While that might be True, I found Lux to be confortable and friendly.

1tX9Hn4TSWEe6PS8OfkBDA.text: Register girl with the short hair working right now, January 2nd at 9:30 pm is a freaking jerk.. like seriously? Because you work at a coffee shop does it make you cool to show no amount of attentiveness or decency to customers ? I'm so pissed that I even went out of my way to tip $2 on my $3 drink. C'mon Lux it's not cool anymore to employ complete assholes it's 2019 get with the program

GIw36QX-JmVKLYlFmqKFkg.text: This is such a cool place to hang out with friends! It's totally hip&happenin. And they have really super good treats.   It's crazy because from the outside you can't tell it's a thing. But when you walk inside there are people in every corner, either chatting with friends or hanging out on their Macs.  This is the best place we went to in Phoenix, by far.

nC13JNEbzgwKj3MhGqHEEQ.text: Eh?  A little too hipster for me.........2.5 stars!   I had been to Pane Bianco about a dozen or so times, and had never walked next door to Lux.  The other day, I decided to check it out.  I needed some caffeine and an iced coffee sounded good.    I walked next door, got in line and placed my order for an iced coffee.  My total was $4.50.  Meh.  A bit small of an iced coffee for $4.50.  I know its "higher quality" made by an "artisan", but I much prefer my Dunkin Donuts iced coffee for under $2.00.  They give you your cup, and then you have to cream and sugar it yourself at their little table.  The coffee was pretty tasty, but it was skimp.  I took about 5 or 6 good strawfuls, and it was pretty much gone.    The service was friendly enough, and the joint is ALWAYS packed.  It's a bit too fancy/hipster for my liking though and I don't think I am coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced Coffee- Decent, but pricey ($4.50) and skimp for what you get.

2_lFA1GYHCM19U4HKCKS2w.text: Funky downtempo Berkeley-esque coffee house built into an old house with rooms and a patio. Morning DJ spinnin avant-garde sophisticated tunes creating a cosmopolitan vibe. Excellent coffee and baked goods. Full meals available (at least for breakfast).  Establishment open till 2am and has full bar. Would like to return sometime for the evening scene where Lux becomes more like a night club.  Delightful!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo eggs biscuits and gravy.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool vibe

cqyGmA_lWx446UXe5sNu8Q.text: I know I'm in the minority here, but this really isn't my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. It's always super crowded and doesn't have the relaxing vibe of others for this reason. The baked goods look great, but I wished they had something vegan to indulge in, and there are plenty of other coffee shops that do accommodate that need. They may have had something that was vegan but they were so busy and rushing me to order that I didn't feel comfortable taking the time to ask. The coffee itself is good, but overall I just wouldn't go out of my way to sit amidst the huge crowd that is always there. But hey, huge crowd means tons of other people love it, so to each their own!

RvtGb9dklZLCNH4Kb45-Cg.text: Updated review... quality coffee and great environment to hang especially to people watch. Only major complaint, prices do not include tax anymore. Taxes are now passed on to its customers without lowering prices to compensate for the newly added tax. Why not just call it how it is, Lux raised their prices. $6 and some change for large iced mocha is becoming a little excessive.

LK2PLJ6zASVnRRrAnkKjYQ.text: What an adorable local coffee shop! Love the atmosphere, the menu and the great friendly service.  Got in line and we ordered a huge cinnamon roll. Which was so soft, the cream cheese topping was so creamy. The roll to icing ratio was perfect. We also ordered mac and cheese and the bacon cheeseburger. The food is made to order, and very generous portions.   For drinks, we had a dirty chai, chai latte and the arnold palmer. All three drinks were awesome, flavorful and made to order as well. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a good local shop, with great food and a chill atmosphere. Can't wait to gl back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Cheeseburger and mac and cheese! Soooo delish!

a2Giyf9FLjUjK4SZDdof2g.text: This is not a relaxed environment that I would recommend to someone who is wanting to get work accomplished. Come prepared with over-ear headphones - because earbuds won't cut it. The music played in the space is more like club music than it is study music. And boy is it blaring. The food looks good, but don't be fooled. It's very expensive. Drinks are good but comparable to others in the area. Ample seating at least. Plenty of places to recharge your electronics (but mainly your headphones because you'll need to use them at full volume).  The music has got to go. Once it does, I'd be happy to post a more positive review.

w0mCF0NyPzOUVP2tIVGzDw.text: Let me first say that I love this place. The food is amazing and most of the staff is great. We come here regularly to get breakfast and brunch. We've been here on weekends and during the week. The low rating is because of one particular employee. I don't know her name, but she's tall and has light hair. Personally, she is quite rude to put it nicely. She ignores you when you ask a question, acts annoyed when you order something, and seems to prefer to stand there with a blank stare while others are working crazy around her. Maybe she's a supervisor, but if so, that makes it worse because in my opinion good customer service starts and stops with good leadership. Again, their food is amazing, but she's making it so that if I come in and see she's working, I likely will turn around and take my business elsewhere to not have to deal with her.

BPudmD4paP9IkIifRy8nDg.text: This is a happening little spot on Central that serves the best coffee plus they are open until midnight weeknights and 2AM on the weekends. Mornings are usually quite busy but still doable. We came about 9 in the evening this past weekend and it was still packed with nowhere to sit inside. There are benches outside to protect you from the desert sun. Try the velvet and make sure to ask for a dollop of the homemade cream on top. Drinks are a little pricey but worth it.

mH4XvdFwozAkFzSzWzMLNg.text: So unique with options galore! The baked goods are so plentiful it's hard to decide, but choose any and it'll be just FINE

4rFo7E3rfQJRDOx79e4rgw.text: I really don't know what to say about this place I arrived here because I type Bakery in the Yelp search. It's definitely not a traditional bakery. The ambience has really a interesting vibe. It's like a Bar and Coffee Shop had a baby... Cool definitely YES, but not a bakery, in my mind bakery has bread and a extensive selection of pastries good family ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

B6SQDrbYzcMlEC1cmNiYwQ.text: Fabulous coffee! They roast the coffee beans on the premises. You can buy the blend to take home as well. They will make your coffee your way... foam, how hot, ceramic cup.   The food is cooked to order and there are homemade goodies. There is a line sometimes out into the street.   The owner, Jeff, it there most weekday mornings. People are friendly.  Definitely check out if you want a great coffee!!!

YSNs66KA9XXGP-9zt28SzQ.text: I'm generally not a fan of businesses that don't bother with the convenience of posted signage. I came by and nearly left because the posted address goes to an office and the entrance around back appeared to be for another restaurant. Eventually we found our way, but it's a douche move to intentionally limit your patronage to those "in the know".  But goddamn if the coffee and desserts aren't the best I came across in the greater Phoenix area. The Lux salted cookie sandwich and a cappuccino made an incredible dessert that had me eating my words about this place being a bunch of pretentious, artsy bullshit. I mean, it is, but I guess if you have the skills to back it up, you can get away with it. The barista who helped me was friendly enough, but some sort of organization to the ordering system should be appreciated, as it was mostly a herd of people standing in front of the registers until they were summoned by staff.   Great late-night stop to catch up with friends over drinks or sweet treats. Snag a copy of their cute-ass menu with vintage drawings and old-school dining specials. Outdoor seating available, since indoors is limited and smoke-free. Were their holiday hours not limited, we would have made the 10 mile trek out of our way to visit again before leaving town. Will make a point of returning when I'm back in a few months.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Booooomb cookie sandwich
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cappuccino and cookie sandwich

dpk8zxGHr4odUmXPiAWYrg.text: "I'll take a hot cocoa with almond milk and a slice of cake. It has peanut butter frosting on it, right?"   "I don't know. It's peanut butter something."  Okaaaay, we get it. Y'all are loved by all and so indie and hipster, it hurts. Lux has 1,500+ reviews with a high rating but I'm keepin' it real: You guys need to take it down a notch with the attitude.  Oh, you guys are artsy? Well I graduated from the Art Institute. You don't see me being all pretentious. You guys are being extra and without the delightful service.    They made my hot chocolate with regular milk instead of almond and instead of apologizing and making it right away (come on... it's heated milk and pumps of Ghirardelli chocolate syrup here. You're not exactly melting chocolate bars!), you give it to my friend and made me wait while you prepared other people's drinks that were ordered after me.   The hot cocoa was some standard Ghirardelli goodness and my peanut cake was pretty good. Sadly my gal pals' cupcakes were as dry as the air.   So whatever. Scorn me all you want, Yelpers. I'll only be back in if I'm in the neighborhood. I do appreciate the late hours of operation.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cupcakes, hot chocolates, cake, and a latte macchiato.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ghirardelli Hot Chocolate and a peanut butter crumb cake.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior shot and my bae, Jannette L.!

fCvzlRYJxIUN35XlWzA9Qw.text: I don't understand the hype. I really don't. This was the first cafe I visited when I first arrived to Phoenix on a weekday and there were no seats available. The second time I came it was on a weekend and of course, it was busy. The only seats my husband and I found were these beaten up lounge chairs in a corner with holes in them. We were sitting next to these speakers overhead that was blaring Spanish music while we could hear indie music simultaneously blaring in the next little room over. I sat there waiting for someone to move so I can relocate.......but everyone here seemed to be college kids with their laptops and books, hunkered down for hours upon hours of studying. The bathroom is located in a weird nook where they store things and the bathroom was always busy. On the bright side, the soap in the restroom smelled very good. The layout of the cafe is very confusing. I didn't understand the distinction between the different rooms and felt like space could be better conserved with an open concept design. The entrance is kind of hard to find, but this doesn't prevent the large crowds

5OOgGHUOcaxZVAtSkm09Tw.text: It would be a cool environment to hang out in if it weren't for the pretentious vibes and rude employees. I'm also not sure if their prices are ridiculous or they charged us wrong but we paid $16 for a double espresso and a plain hot tea. There are plenty of other coffee shops and bars in the area where your money and time will be better spent.

cYst33UQNDuv2eLvO0kcPg.text: WE WANT LATTE ART!   My sister Jannette L. and I have been on a coffee shop kick lately and she digs latte art, so we were recommended to come here! Hearing that it has a lot of great tasting options we decided to come here.   I must say it was quite hard to find since we didn't see any logos or anything that suggested this building was Lux, we kinda went in blind.   Coming in, you definitely get the hipster vibe, which is cool, everything is esthetically pleasing, the atmosphere is chill, just meant for you to relax. I dig it.   Coming up to the counter, the gentleman was nice and made sure to greet us, we ordered 2 Ghirardelli hot chocolates (yum) and a vanilla latte (also yum). We picked up 2 cup cakes as well, vanilla vanilla and chocolate espresso. The barista  got my friends hot chocolate wrong, whole milk instead of almond -1 star. I saw a peanut butter cake and recommended it to bestie Joyce W. (Queen of PB). So to make sure she asked the cashier if it was peanut butter cake or frosting, the gal replied with "oh, it's peanut butter something". -1 star, woah girl, you should know a little more about your job and customer service.   The drinks were delightful, keeping us warm as we chit chatted and caught up. The pastries on the other hand, were dry and crumbling to touch. The treat were displayed open on plates behind a glass, no covering or anything preventing them from being exposed to air. I'll say it's fair game that it was 10pm and end of the day so I'll let Lux keep that star.   It was a fun and popular place to stop by, and try out, but I definitely think I can find another spot with equally delicious drinks, less of a crowd and hopefully better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot chocolate with a thick spoonful of whip cream, quite delicious.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nom! I didn&#39;t know they sell food.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spacious but crowded.

8M64-Bw1sXJHkfg-6v-GCQ.text: Lux Central is by far one of my favorite places I have ever been to in the Phoenix area. I did not expect it to be so cute with such great vibes instead. The staff there are hilarious and the drinks/food there is amazing. Good place to hang with friends and do homework! Would recommend to absolutely anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qhshMOmeoz3o-gcSvg1XRQ.text: It's kind of an overwhelming experience at first, a lot hits you at once with the amount of people, tight space, DJ, and food all around -- but once you get settled it becomes a nice place for a morning brunch. We had the farmers market vegetables and egg, vanilla latte, apple spice scone, and oatmeal. Overall the food was good but the oatmeal was dry. The servers were incredibly gracious and friendly and overall we had a nice experience.   Hope to come visit this place when we come back to Phoenix.

-2NMZAcqBk2KJ-aq8eMzug.text: Awesome joint, Think coffee shop meets lounge with good food, beer and cocktails, with a cool cafe vibe, great music, lots of space, mid century furniture and good crowd.

_IQhst64ygbMimrol5rW1Q.text: Small, Quaint, and trendy coffee bar. Long lines indicate popularity. Lack of parking due to area. I sure was a bit too noisy for studying or intimate conversations. Coffee and asiago bread was a bit overpriced. It was a bit unorganized in such a small space.

bzEuhG7_f_KB0GsdRepbhg.text: Really tasty food. Everything is self service which isn't really clear if you've never been here. Other than that, I'll return

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dutch pancake and side of eggs

lLDBOgnDI1BFIgaZ7d8I4w.text: Good place with great coffee. We had a piece of chocolate peanut butter pie and not sure what it was but something set my wife's and my throat on fire. Maybe an ingredient? Anyways great little place and very busy. Lots of people who appear to be living there on laptops. :) great date stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DAvUEdgFp9okZ6jV7q5nlg.text: Chill .... enjoy the casual atmosphere, surprisingly good food, and always enjoyable pastries and coffee.

maPmGAgvmRQTJyHX1nOTOg.text: One of the best coffee shops in Phoenix, Lux is very hipster-chic with old mis-matched furniture and colorful decor. Their coffee is incredible, and while there isn't a ton of variety in their allergy-friendly food options, they do have some baked goods, and many of my friends love the food!

dWCrj_thUMNQoZ6lwxfXaQ.text: YUM! I had not been here in a long time. I was surprised at its expansion. The coffee was lovely as was the food. Great place to meet or get work done.

gFPv73onrXF6Bo5u1DEJPg.text: Love the coffee and the mac and cheese, obvs. The atmosphere is cool, but can get really crowded which might be overwhelming for some.

wawWcHor70NYnLsJNh1c6w.text: tions.  Never wanting to see a pet suffer and having to make that final decision is not easy, so using an in-home service like Happy Endings helps.  Both my dogs left this world with my arms around them, with me whispering in their ears and their passing was so peaceful I wish I could provide this for humans in my family too.

RNP1nBHv2NO7aozBBALz0A.text: This is the best coffee bar I've ever been to, and I've been to a lot of cool coffee places. First off, the coffee is really good, which is obviously the most important thing you look for in a coffee place. But Lux was so much more than that. They had an incredible baked goods selection (the apple tart was delicious), a full menu of interesting foods, a mixologist on staff, and even a live DJ. That's right, a DJ, and I went on a friday afternoon.   I went for lunch so I got the dutch pancake with potatoes, broccoli, spinach, cauliflower, topped with cheese. It was one of the most unique meals I've ever had but also one of the best lunches I've ever had.   There was a good amount of seating, both outside and inside. Was the place hipster? Of course. Everyone had been mentioning that in their reviews. I haven't been able to figure out why white dudes with dreads and gauges makes coffee and food better but it does. That being said, Lux is not in short supply of said hipsters. And everything is unbelievable.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dutch pancake with a half full (or empty?) iced coffee.

CMuMtWRbatOIoVqnNA36Dg.text: Great food and good service. We enjoy this wonderful neighborhood place.

zKBTwGI99zCZRXcwVFeRQw.text: Cool place with good vibes and plenty of seating. Coffee was good and some of the food menu items looked delicious. Be prepared for a crowd because this place does the business.

PYTfeYvThRqr-m4pvbip2Q.text: Best coffee shop ever! Love this place! Food and pastries (paleo cookies, what?!?!) are exceptional! Wifi is fast and place is fun. LOVE IT.

SS3FePn2VJu4GWUjbmycoA.text: From the morning to late at night, Lux covers it all! Simply one of the best for coffee, cocktails, beer, and food. I've actually been coming to Lux for several years now, but just now getting around to write a review. If you're in the mood for something sweet, they will have something baked that will hit the spot. AND if you're in there later in the day, and need something filling, order their mac n cheese, and you won't be disappointed!   It does get crowded in here, often, which can make finding seating a bit difficult, but don't let that sway your decision to come.  I highly recommend coming in if you have never been.

5rO2q1sDOtnwZm-bk19D3w.text: I absolutely love love this coffee shop...i had the privilege of being in AZ for a short amount of time and this place makes fantastic coffees, hand crafted cocktails with a mixologist, great sweets- cakes and desserts!!! the ambiance is also amazing...its always busy but i feel like theres good turn around and you may have to wait a couple of minutes to find a seat! definitely recommend for coffee lovers :)

4MyaWFPYN4736svGoTQ0dw.text: Lux is a super trendy Downtown Phoenix coffee shop. I love coming here with my friends after a long day of class and enjoying some of their mac n'cheese (served in a coffee mug!) and sipping on one of their amazing cappuccinos. You can even tell them what you want in a drink, and they'll whip something special up for you!

F0yzgPnQKP6IMSexshk_QA.text: Overrated, trendy. Trying to be more than a coffee shop.   A bar, really?  Shitty parking. Crowded. Annoying. Ok coffee, but since everyone in AZ thinks Starbucks is good, go figure.  Unimpressed.

frGppMrTiqNCFIgpsMMn7Q.text: Went to Lux on a Saturday morning for the first time. It was packed and the line was from the counter to the door. Lucky for me, I was in line in front of John a frequent customer who told me that during the week there is not usually a line and he is usually in and out. I ordered the Egg sandwich and a caramel latte both were very good and the prices were not bad. I was very happy that they offer both almond and soy milk as an option. I look forward to returning during the week  or on a weekend night and having a more relaxed experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg sandwich with cheddar, tomatoe and bacon.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carmel Latte with Almond milk

TLFsbluwKV162obZiFLlbw.text: Lux has come a long way from the tiny coffee shop it once was. The new place is really fun with a cool vibe but beware of the packed factor. It is pretty ridiculous making me hesitate to go back. There is always a line out the door, parking issues, and nowhere to sit. If you can snag a seat it is on a couch or hanging off a bar stool so rather hard to eat and awfully uncomfy.   Today, I ordered the Dutch Pancake. I did not like the burnt top part of the pancake. My friend says the last time she ordered it it was not burnt like that and tasted better. The unburnt part was Delish though but at 10 bucks it should be perfect! You can get it with fruit or veggies. My friend got the biscuits and gravy which I loved. Not too heavy or salty with a hint of Sage.   Pros- Good food, fun vibe, cool decor, music, friendly folks, best coffee drinks in town I dare to say.   Cons, Wowza this place is expensive, packed to the gills every time I have come, and Panne Bianco is right next door causing an eating choice dilemma -lol   I am sure there must be an off time here to go to avoid the crowds. if you know what that time is let me know. Also, I can always solve one of the dilemmas by eating here and getting Panne to go when the weather cools off. Granted, this could only happen if the second mortgage for food cost that day comes through, ha!   ;)

wtDVyn52TTzK5MNVLz6Wvw.text: Busy lunch time which I usually take as a good sign. Didn't get food but wanted coffee. Coffee was pretty standard. However, something went wrong with the almond milk. It was all very syrupy at the bottom of my cup. Not sure if it was the brand or of it wasn't shaken before. Otherwise it was a pretty average coffee shop experience.

SzgQXT4TCX7JWGmzXXr5sA.text: I finally had to check this place out because everyone raves about it. I got a mocha and a banana nutella muffin. They were both great! I'll definitely back!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mocha &amp; Banana Nutella Muffin

yAfw3qw2gPDMvh_r1DKU_A.text: Love lux always a great vibe here very friendly staff ! MAC & CHEESE IS THE BOMB ! Pesto Mac & Cheese with chicken is the best highly recommend!  today sadly they had no whip but also recommended the whip!
