XgFDfnGwXZOqWcoEVi4J9A.text: Loved this place...  very relaxed vibe. Great music..  fantastic service...  and the desserts, oh my!!  Good place to bring a laptop or a friend or both!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Beautiful glass of Rose&#39;

ot81rT-Bl3kfAcCr6z4klQ.text: I've been going to lux for years now, I've never had a bad experience. The food and coffee is delicious, the staff is friendly and the place itself is unique and perfect for studying or getting work done. Definitely recommend!

wiAIxkaHLrsquNHV8itotQ.text: Came here for breakfast on Sunday around 7ish, as we were finishing up it was starting to get pretty busy as a long line forms to the door. For once their oven was working so my boyfriend was able to get a Dutch baby. However after we ordered they had to check with three or four people to make sure the oven worked. We have been there two previous times when the oven was down. It's a neat spot, order at the counter and find your own seat. The only downside is checking back to see if your food is fine as they leave it on the back counter and it gets crowded and loud there at times. They have amazing pastries, breads, and cookies tho!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M3QU-0uzrlf3VVNd5mTW5A.text: I've been looking for a place that has latte art, my niece and her boyfriend goes to Lux quite often so my friends and I decided to give it a try one night. The place was super busy. Seating was hard to find because of how busy the place was. They do have an outside seating area  but it was too cold to be sitting outside. I asked one of the guys if I can move one of the chairs so that my friend and I could sit together, but he was no help. He told me he don't know and moved on. The latte was good and even better because there was cute art to go along with it. That made me happy. The muffin I ordered was a little dry but the peanut butter cake my friend had ordered  was okay. This place is a good place to hang out with friends on a late night and if anyone who wants to try latte and see some cute artwork, try this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jgbSRKp7sbkv03utclMZMg.text: Been going here since high school and now that I'm in college it's even better, love it!

oj0tsv4Su4yDAeCENytgHA.text: GOD... if you want electica and Amazing Coffee with Sweets this is Fabulous !  AND next door to Pane Bianco if you want or need more...  Great Space Great Vibe

JrX41NM0TA7GbZ63Kj_xLg.text: We came here on Saturday night around 8pm for dinner with a large group of friends (10+). There was a long wait on the coffee side, but you can also order food and drinks at the bar side. We really wanted to try the Yorkshire pudding burger but they were out! Instead I ordered a brown rice dish with chicken and vegetables, jalapeno bacon mac & cheese, and a squash soup. Even though there were about 10 of us, we were able to find a spot on one of the benches.   The interior design was really trendy, hipster and retro. It was as though I was in someone's basement. The table was adorned with baskets of oranges and functional  old-school type writers. You can also sit at these chairs with tables stacked with books. A very unique vibe. It reminded me much of Valley Bar.  The food came out fairly quickly. I ordered way too much food, but it was really tasty and delicious like comfort food. Everyone that works here is super friendly which is a huge bonus. I also enjoyed watching the cooks prepare their food right in front of everyone. Totally candid, unfiltered.

cXBbtIxoheqRUb3qGYVTEw.text: Hipsters = a subculture of men and women typically in their 20's and 30's that value independent thinking, counter-culture, progressive politics, an appreciation of art and indie-rock, creativity, intelligence, and witty banter   Lux = Coffee house hipsters like to visit  I personally do not think I am a hipster, but when I walked in Lux, I thought wow if I were to open up a coffee shop this is exactly how I would want it to be, Coffee, Wine, in house pastries, plenty of seating, sofas, back room, outside seating, art work hanging, Yes this is the set up I would have, only thing I would change would be the music, I'd be more jazz and blues.  It's close to Midnight on a Sat night and I'm a coffee drinking fool and am always into finding a local coffee shop, found out Lux is opened to 2am on Friday & Saturday nights, that's pretty sweet to me.  I read the board and saw espresso macchiato so that's what I ordered & asked if they could add caramel to it and she told me I will get a caramel latte.  Ok I'm getting the caramel latte then.   My coffee order was up, and I have to say I'm pleased with the presentation, very swanky, and the latte itself was good, the creamy froth stayed though out the entire drink, you know how sometimes it fades away, not here, it was frothy creamy all the way to the last drop.  I enjoyed it very much.  Now I just wish Lux was closer to me, I could see myself coming here often if it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caramel Latte

qPKDyHPfn_L8Ni5oGZcqLw.text: Love this cafe. Had great coffee and baked goods. One of my favorite places to grab a quick bite when I am in Phoenix. Everything you order is great, you can't go wrong.

7-JFItuMTmoATvoOkgwd8g.text: I got to Lux around 8:30 am on Saturday morning and it was already packed with people. It was so packed that the cashier did not see that I was in line.  After I ordered they told me to go find a seat and they will call my name out at the counter when the coffee was ready. It was so crowded that it was difficult to find a space to sit, however, I finally found a seat near the bar at the high tables. After waiting for about 7-10 minutes for my coffee (while going back to check every few minutes), I found a cup of coffee waiting on the counter. I had not heard my name called because it was so crowded and loud inside. I actually ended up spilling my coffee when going back to my sitting area as it was so crowded. At that point I decided to pack up and leave as it was too loud to do any work. By the time I left (a span of about 15-20 minutes) the line to order was almost to the door.  I do have to make a note and thank the woman who worked at Lux who helped me clean up my spilled coffee and gave me all of my to-go containers for my scone and what was left of the coffee I ordered.  So as you can see, I was not a fan of the atmosphere. As for the coffee, I was able to salvage some of it after I spilled it. I had ordered a medium latte and it wasn't too bad. Not the best I've had however. I also ordered a bacon cheddar scone. That was very delicious.  Overall, I was not impressed with this coffee shop considering all of the high reviews it got. I will not be coming back.

qvtksgYDD9FYXh7EFT2q8A.text: Food great. We have been going quit often, we love  the food. We don't love the music that they play. It feels like your in Acid in a 3rd dimension. Everything else is good.

cLKXoyWY79v09PyJj_xCNg.text: This place is literally my favorite place to eat and drink in AZ! Sammy the bartender is always fantastic and sweet and the food is delicious!!! I will always recommend this place to anyone that loves craft cocktails like I do. I'm pretty introverted as well and hate big bars so lux is perfect because they will make you feel so welcomed and the bar is smaller than most.

b_ZSp-c6RY0iIyZnKZWOtg.text: This is a great fun-loving place to relax and do your homework. The coffee is great!!

F_qfir_LGGKY_GU0krdwfQ.text: Great atmosphere, nice people and good home made feeling food. Their cafe mocha ruined me. I can never drink another one from Starbucks ever again.

y5VMbZfDIfDf7-QnzhsYwQ.text: It's a great place to go and study, or go, relax and have a cup of coffee. The coffee was excellent. I would recommend this place to someone for excellent coffee and excellent service.

aRBskvyJjc1q8MyQWdZVNA.text: I'm in town for work from Atlanta, and my first thought walking into LUX was "why don't we have one of these on ATL?!"  It is a bit hidden, there is no large indicating where it is, I just happened to follow the right person walking into the coffee shop.  As soon as I walk in, I noticed the large display of baked goods. I wanted the mixed berry muffin SOOOOO bad, but I am trying to stay away from sugar right now so I passed :( I ordered an Americano and it was quite delicious. Wish I could've stayed to lounge around a big on the big comfy yellow couch, but I had to leave for work.   High recommend! I want to go back for more hipster yummy goodness!

BuE3XXGgFCm7sSEDI4hDsg.text: What a great local hang out. This modernized bakery has tons of space to hang out with friends, relax on your own, or even have business meeting. The menu is as vast as it is unique, containing original drinks you would expect from a traditional coffee shop to diverse creations that seem to be as one of a kind as the venue. Wether you are just passing through the area or you are a regular patron, you should check out Lux Central for their hipster vibe, great drinks, and awesome food.

nIUUvlTh8VVlNkJ4dLAd6g.text: Environment is super cool! Lots to look at and comfortable chairs and seating area.  Hipster-like and very industrial looking as far as decor.  Would be great to come and do some homework or meet up with friends- not very quiet though If that's what you're in to.  Got a medium almond milk latte and it was amazing with no flavor ($5.50) and my sister got the medium hot velvet (5.50) and we loved both! Get the homemade whip cream it was amazing!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot medium velvet (whip on the side) and medium iced latte with almond milk!

5Ki2Q0XbOCXy2kf9wWDOCg.text: Don't get the cookies. That's my main advice. I have been going to Lux quite frequently since they moved to their new location. I love the layout, the decor, the staff, the coffee and bar drinks, their baked goods - at least I did until I tried the cookies. They were not cheap ($1 a piece and not particularly large), but I believe in spending a bit more for small business's sake and good quality. That's why I was so disappointed. The coconut macaroons were so hard that they completely crumbled when biting into them. I am still not sure if they were just old or just poorly made. The pistachio divinity on the other hand so sweet that even I, who has never met a carbohydrate she has not liked, could not eat them. I picked out the pistachios and threw the rest away.  I still love Lux and I will be back - I just won't get the cookies.

B8PrfBviDyAapXILTmy6cg.text: Busy atmosphere with great coffee and snacks!

_m_4fiM-mSuDTqVtIvbVNA.text: This place has a really cool vibe and very tasty food.  Lux is a winner!

UUoDjAAnA4RStVrzpxh6Pw.text: Great stop in central Phoenix for some great coffee. I've been coming to Lux for a while now and have been pleasantly surprised with great coffee, food and customer service.  If you haven't been to Lux yet, please do so. Hidden away, it brings Phoenix phenomenal coffee. For breakfast, I recommend getting the quiche or the egg bake. When fall comes around make sure to get yourself a pumpkin whoopie pie (you'll thank me later).   Every time I have been it has been packed- yet all the staff are friendly and very accommodating. But the biggest reason I decided to write this review was not even based on the iced-coffee or the yummy pastries.  Yesterday, after leaving Lux I realized I had lost my set of keys. I decided to call Lux to see if I had left them behind. Elena answered the phone and I told her my situation. Not only was she kind, she also went around Lux while on the phone with me to search for my keys. She even went to the parking lot and tried to find them there. I was pleasantly surprised with her thoughtfulness to search for my keys for me. Though she wasn't able to find them while I was on the phone with her-she assured me that she would call me back if anything came up. She also proceeded to tell me to have a good day and good luck finding my keys.  So thank you Elena, for restoring my faith in humanity and for being such a kind individual. Make sure you all leave a tip for my girl Elena!

sQWso6zMDfQ_EDCNOo_dyQ.text: Pretty awesome place.  Casual Hipster friendly coffee shop with great food.  My only complaint is it is always super busy on weekend mornings.

OgJeCg-FuuuBR7VvegU-_Q.text: Tried this place today on the way to the dog park with a friend. It was crowded and I felt a little out of place since I'm not super "hipster." My iced soy chai was super bland and watered down. I will probably stick to my usual coffee joints from now on. 3 stars for a cute location and decent price.

6LghEHWLyd8whr9Cj2Z_fQ.text: I LOVE this place. I wish I could go every day. I wish the space was bigger with more seating but this place, the employees, the drinks, the food, and the atmosphere is amazing.

-PPbb8yH4vn2fONK4DjErQ.text: It's been nearly 9 years, but the coffee was good and the atomsphere was cool (for Phoenix), the company on the other hand was shit.

Bysf4YmSpGR2pTxnMBs1LA.text: I've been going to Lux for years.  It's always been #1.  It is terrrribly, painfully hip, but somehow it isn't uncomfortable there, and there really isn't a snide vibe that I have detected in my billion visits (oh and I would have).  I stopped going for a while prior to the big move because it was constantly packed, with lines out the door and internet speed that was reminiscent of mid-90s dial-up.  I rediscovered how much I liked making french-pressed coffee at home.  I've been around, coffee-wise, and Lux is always the best.  In fact, I'm so used to Lux, that when I get a crappy drink somewhere else, I assume that something out of the ordinary has happened, because it is so bad.  Repeat visits to offending spots (Lola, Lucy's) has confirmed that, no, they didn't make a mistake - they just suck.  Also, Lux's whipped cream is TO DIE.  I don't even like whipped cream, but you should see what happens when they forget to add it.

cxB1IaD17gN5nXVn6-MLWg.text: Black n white latte and peanut butter cookies........I'm in heaven!!!!!!!!!  Walking into this place I was immediately impressed with the decor.  I love places that look cool without looking like they tried too hard.  I was actually concerned because places like this usually have baristas that think they're too good for you.  This place was different!  The cashier immediately sparked up a cute witty banter and suggested their house specialties.  We went with one vanilla latte (my standard) and a Black and White latte which mixes dark and white chocolate.  Both were really amazing.  Another cool aspect is their little in house bakery.  On your way down the hall to the restrooms, you can sneak a peak at where they smelt up their decadent baked goods.  It looks so fun! I wanted to ask her if she needed any help!   Well, at least I got to take part in eating the final product...Peanut Butter Cookies!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vanilla latte and peanut butter cookies!!!

kWo_KcRhPkeg_7YmkjQYcg.text: In house roasted beans!!!  First time last Friday night.  The espresso is great!  I enjoy high end beans like illy etc.  This place is cozy as well. Get a beer or wine or food and hang out.  Next time i gotta buy a bag a beans and see how it taste in my home machine...  Highly recommend!

TtanYGAUEKZSQx-5S7YcUw.text: Awesome array of coffee, teas, wines, and food. I live close to the location and frequent it with my closest friends. Only complaint is the lack of shop label on the building and the unaccommodating atmosphere for physically-disabled customers.

CKhtoG6neG9JqI5UeiP4GA.text: I love it. I am sitting in here while I right this. I really love the coffee. I am a college student and this coffee is nice and strong.I also got a lemon bar which was the greatest thing I've had here in Phoenix. My friends are regulars at Lux and I will be one to. Good place to come to do homework. The parking isn't the greatest but the service and quality is worth the bad parking.

UeE6xOzR2S6MKJIerWUsRg.text: Awesome place to get whatever fancy coffee or pastry you'd like! Small breakfast menu makes the choices easy. I've never had lunch or dinner there and to my understanding the menu is always changing. They have a full bar as well! I always get the bacon, egg and cheddar sandwich and it never disappoints. My husband always gets the sweet Dutch pancake with their homemade whipped cream - also very tasty. Prepaid to to be patient as the lines are usually pretty long and seating difficult when it's too hot to sit outside on the patio. Employees are all very friendly. Definite hipster hangout - so be prepared for some interesting conversations and facial hair.

J2EZeFn6FOFAolO3RDaNPg.text: Today I road bikes with my girlfriend to this little trendy coffee located in Central Phoenix that I quickly fell in love with. There was a variety of choices of drinks, breakfast sandwiches and pastries to choose from and everything looked and smelled delicious. There was plenty of parking and seating both inside and outside. The service was very good considering the place was packed with customers, which speaks for itself!  I will definitely be back again to support yet another great local spot:)

ZuNmhBRk06sUYbsBzWU6tw.text: Full bar full of connoisseur spirits. Coffee bar on point... And the food is always tasty. Shout out to Phil, JT, Ben, Sasha, Christian, and the rest of you awesome hipsters. This place is rad, and weather day or night, you are sure to enjoy yourself. Love everything about lux. Get the egg Sammie on a croissant... Iced black with espresso shots...and they have an impressive absinthe collection...awesome craft cocktails and craft beers...see you guys real soon....

aqBRVlbA3lOtXtuudNiUFg.text: Hands down the hippest coffee shop in Phoenix. With the recent expansion - it's HUGE now - there's tons of space to spread out, read the paper, work on your laptop, or simply enjoying amazing coffee, teas, cocktails and food with friends. I spend a lot of time here during the day and it's got everything right. Always great music, fast wi-fi, I love the $2 hibiscus iced tea, the pastries and now the drinks! It's a wonderful urban feel and such a breath of fresh air for the Valley.

rjbz-4z-ADBqdTn_rYXy3Q.text: My friend said this place had coffee 100X better than anywhere else he has ever been. Of course being curious I had to check it out. I was pleasantly surprised to have experienced some of the best coffee I have ever had. Lux has very friendly staff and unique atmosphere.

2nSS9XBH7XXW4sAehsiaRA.text: Tried the blueberry corn muffin, the corn bread part was super dry and the blueberry part was super soggy ! Also the grill doesn't open till 7 and I came in at 630.

UnrIcmSmqTog3j3ia6gqow.text: Very cool place, solid service, kind staff with ready smiles.

amoKpZF-T8uxBfU35Q7aWw.text: I'm a Phoenix native who has since moved to the east coast, and one of the perks of going home is getting to go to Lux.    First of all, Lux is gorgeous. Industrial decor with local artists' work somehow manages to be welcoming and not gritty, as can often be the case with indie coffee bars. It's not extremely bright inside, for those coming with books in hand, but it's a great space overall.   Secondly, the coffee is great and the pastries are fan-freaking-tastic. Just the thought of the sweet (cupcakes!) and the savory (feta and sun dried tomato scone!) options makes my mouth water. Sometimes I wish that they ventured into sandwiches, though they don't really seem to have the kitchen space.   The service I've gotten has always been friendly and impeccable, and I've gotten into conversations with the baristas many times.   I often go there to work on my laptop because working remotely in your parents' house isn't entirely productive. The music, yes, can be a little loud, which can impede productivity, but it's generally good music, so thumbs up overall. The wifi is free but on the slow side, so don't expect blazing speeds. I've never had much trouble finding a seat, but I only come in to sit during afternoons and evenings. It's a pretty good place to meet people, too!  All in all, I love Lux and wish it were still just blocks away.

5m2zRO4zcdP_qDhIGfjqoA.text: HIP ATMOSPHERE, HEALTH CONCERNS - Just for me to say it is has a "hip atmosphere" should tell you how unhip I am. But the folks who frequent here, self excluded, are right out of central casting: if you wear disc earlobe rings, a sleeve tattoo, a retro t-shirt with a Tarantino movie poster en espanol and checkered pants, you will fit right in. Coffee was bold and served on real china. Unfortunately, one concern tainted the experience: I witnessed about 30 to-go paper cups be knocked to the floor by a clumsy employee and be picked up and set next to clean to-go cups ready to be used. They should have promptly placed the fallen cups in the recycling bin, but I guess that would be unhip. I alerted the same employee who knocked the cups down in the first place but she said "don't worry, but thank you for your concern" shaking her head in a most sarcastic way. "You're welcome" I replied with equal sarcasm in my voice. I'll just share this with millions of Yelp users, I thought. Lux management  - last I checked, sanitation in a restaurant environment is still so hip.

YgsILUN7ZPb8073dSa-KWg.text: Ok...if this place was in NYC, I would literally walk MILES to get to it every single day. It's THAT good. I'm not even anywhere near Lux when I do stay in Phx, but I make the 20-something mile drive out there just to enjoy their iced lattes.   The prices are right in line with what I'm used to in NYC, but I suppose some in AZ might get sticker shock. It's SOOO worth the price though! I always order their iced soy latte with just half a packet of sweet n low, with whipped cream on top ($4.25), and HOLY CRAP, best thing ever. No idea how they do it.   The whipped cream here is prooooobably the best thing I've ever tasted, like, ever. I can't rave about it enough. But when you put it on top of a perfectly sweetened, creamy, icy, doesn't-even-really-taste-like-coffee beverage, it's heaven.   I asked the staff how they make their espresso so damn good, and they said they don't do anything different; they say it's most likely the roasting machines that have been "seasoned" with so much use that makes it so good.   Also-pastries are great, never had a bad one. The cookies are soft and chewy and yummy! Love the vibe of this place too, very loungy and laid back, with lots of people working on their laptops.   i almost always combine a trip here with one to Pane Bianco, and you're allowed to eat your sandwich inside Lux which is awesome. I'm not sure if they force you to buy something from them to eat in there, but I can't resist either way and always end up buying something anyway.   If you live anywhere NEAR Lux, you need to get your butt over there and try their whipped cream and espresso ASAP!

pWH-6TheVgdgUfDirJCBpw.text: I have been a long time frequenter of this amazing coffee house. I don't pretend to be a coffee snob but I am an addict and this place makes the best lattes and coffee of any place I've ever been. The pastries are unreal and baked in house with love.   They recently opened their new addition and restaurant and I have to say that they have made a True iconic mark in downtown Phoenix. The menu is limited right now but everything we were served was great. Of course they still maintain their coffee house vibe and have sacrificed nothing in that area with the renovation.   This place is a must visit in Phoenix!

Y6lmkJ53_1nshPlW4iijTQ.text: Visiting my buddy in Phoenix, this place is down the street from his apartment. Had a red eye and a maple scone. Pretty damn good cup of coffee. Pretty solid scone. I've never been to Phoenix as a grownup but I was super surprised at this place. Feels like a top shelf coffee joint out of any number of hipster neighborhoods I've been in. My opinion of Phoenix has been swayed by the existence of this place alone.

zIO-4Gxe-o02PqXZVjKPcw.text: This place was great, we actually went to lunch next door, and noticed several people sitting outside enjoying various beverages.  I loved the place, the moment i walked in. A busy urban coffee shop, lots of people chatting, working, studying,  a display of pastries. They even serve lunch/dinner, a bar.    I got the white chocolate latte,  my husband got the caramel latte, and a chocolate chip cookie, and an almond raspberry pastry i believe. The lattes had beautifull art on them, were serverd at a perfect temperature,  were smooth and delicious. The pastries were also great.   I wish they had another location  in scottsdale, however i will return to their current location.

siSUdfLnPXR4Miol6S4Tjg.text: This is the best cafe ever!!! It's a really nice laid back atmosphere. The drinks and food here are pretty good as well. A lot of young people come here. Lots of eye candy and the service is great. I would definitely recommend this place.

jsVPQvQl-E0rv5o9W8JoYA.text: What a genius idea - half coffee shop / half bar! Nice place - fast, friendly service  - fancy looking cocktails (haven't tried yet) - coffee is organic and tasty.

YS49Kgx3-Pc5ZkM31WQMIw.text: An awesome vibe and delicious drinks and pastries. What more could you ask for?

LgFBwdivOn3eh_2C6xh_sg.text: I've been here once and absolutely loved it! Nice place with an awesome ambiance and the latte was to die for! It is a coffee shop/restaurant/bar! I can't wait to come back here again and try other items on their menu. I noticed a range of ages from 20-40. Definitely a hipster spot with a twist. Although the place was pretty packed, I found seating and relaxed the whole time I was there.

D6DmghCqgdgTofWgWi7bfg.text: come on, more then 200+ reviews and almost everyone loves it.  Stop debating and give the place a try, you won't be disappointed. The coffee is great, the whip cream doesn't come out of a spray nozzle and the atmosphere is very lax, just how a coffee shop should be.  I recommend the Velvet mocha if you're like me and like your coffee to taste like a dessert.

rg-UBZzGM82ZudRunu-oNQ.text: THE Best coffee spot in Arizona! They have awesome coffee and it is way better than any commercialized coffee such as Starbucks...I had the cappuccino and it was perfect right on the dot! This place is kind of hidden but once you find it you'll keep coming back for more!

cJDUgpK7d96D1dkMf3IFiQ.text: I've been coming here whenever I'm on this side of town, for years.  We all know the coffee and sweets are great but my real reason for writing is that I started eating the food recently... and it's phenomenal.  Obviously, not a huge menu, but there are only a few places in town that make really great inventive salads, and I'm kind of a snob.  I don't need a lot of choices as long as they're all good.  I have had 2 salads at Lux now and both of them were THE BEST.   My friend had the steak and it was better than the one he had ordered a couple nights prior at a steakhouse.  Almost silly.   PS.  I've got quite possibly the lamest (non existent) sense of style ever, but I'm not sure what people are talking about when they speak of "hipster sneer".  I get it... people who take their hip fashion trends seriously make you uncomfortable.. that's ok... just let them be, I promise that if they're being rude to you it's probably because you seem like a jerk and are giving off a bad vibe, not because they are super angry that you would step foot into their favorite establishment.  Like I said, my style sucks, and I go there all the time.  Stop caring so much what people seem to think of you.

qKYON0YJqhhzl0TUBBH2tg.text: One of my favorite places near home. Great for any occasion.  Excellent coffee, drinks and food. Great atmosphere.

hqvSQoKsiZdJ_2bVTeZHhQ.text: Incredible food, whether you just grab a fresh-made scone, or order a full meal. Good coffee. It can get crowded, but it is a fun and eclectic atmosphere. I definitely try to bring out-of-town visitors to Lux to get a good feel for urban Phoenix culture.

3bPKv7SKTP_ma3yKFjSkVg.text: awesome coffee shop. open till midnight. loud music, great atmosphere. try their Mac and cheese!! it's amazing. also, they always have different pastry offerings so that's a plus!! the staff is nice and they keep the place well kept. good for a coffee date or a drink on the way to work!

hzWvGgqoZ_hvMkylvGahXA.text: Coffee.  Good Coffee.  Right next to Pane Bianco, which has the best sandwich in Arizona (if you ask me).  I visit the Lux when I am at Pane Bianco, and not the other way around.  Deeply sunk into modern furniture, patrons sip coffees, eyes tranfixed onto Macbooks.    The place smells exactly like it should, an aromatherapy most of us only experience in the morning in our kitchens.  Just walking in will put you in a good mood.  The staff is helpful.  Good spot.

uNpI1VLvSa1MK4aw9oSwGA.text: I called George Brazil for a plumber. They said tomorrow at noon to four. I said ok . They called at 11:00 AM the next day and said they could not make it to my appointment. I said I have no water. They adjusted their appointments and showed up at 2:30 PM He was here twenty minutes and charged me $296.87. WOW To put on a new shut-off valve which means he sweated two fittings. and put on a new flex pipe. Little pricey.

BIZTj7SeO1Cw3G_cCGA7nw.text: Great environment great  staff,  boring People... You will only feel welcome and feel that you can fit in if you have people you know already that you bring in there with you to drink coffee

4fHUhESYG3zTQYBjjOWtLQ.text: I used to go almost every day when I was in high school.  I got back this summer from school and tried it again a couple times.  It was not as good as I remember, but they still serve amazing espresso.  I love their whipped cream.  The lines are always long, which is a good thing, because it most likely means people are willing to wait for their coffee/food.  The line goes quick too, and no one really looks irritated waiting, like some people do at Starbucks.  I would have given it one more star but my 16oz vanilla latte was 5.00 before tip.  That is more expensive than Starbucks, and I am not a big fan of that.

cY-JSGR_krKKAYOUIQHMbA.text: Really good food and fun place, but it's always annoyingly crowded and it's really tough to find a place to sit, but the food is great and the people try to be helpful.

52mmceeOcp7Drre-0Cqvqw.text: Best iced coffee in town. Rather than cold brewing or chilling hot coffee, they add two shots of espresso over hot coffee on ice. I've been coming here since 09' and remain a daily visitor. They have expanded on their coffee by adding a bar and full kitchen. The owner, staff, food and drinks couldn't be better. There's a reason this place is always packed despite the lack of signage.

T7SFR1TUhETpFdia7x-FmA.text: Really nice place with good vibe and really good food. I was traveling and needed a good breakfast place when I stumbled on this gem. Walked over to find a very busy place. But I was not ignored. Received help right away on the menu questions and placed my order. My breakfast and desert with tea was delish. I would totally recommend this place. Wish we had one in California. Yamm!!

ls_nnOGicefX3reumqXMAw.text: Always an amazing assortment of baked goods!  Great vibe, fun staff, coffee is amazing!  Can't wait to try a real meal here.  Saw the mac and cheese being prepped and it looked fabulous!

8T3O_9gkEfbHo1AFF40W6w.text: This place is incredible.  The pastries and coffee are delicious.  The oatmeal is one of my favorite things here. Creamy steel cut oats with freshly sauteed apples and almonds on top. You cannot go wrong here and the atmosphere is really cozy. I also love their tropical iced tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious pastries!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful coffee art!

GdE33GquvJ-CRYWquuvXxA.text: Had late lunch and breakfast here on two separate occassions. If you hate hipsters, don't approach. You may spontaneously combust.  Had a cookie and a latte here on first day. Excellent cookies and great latte. Also had an iced tea, which was average.   I came here for breakfast with my sister. She had an egg sandwich with avocado, which she said was great. Not too big though and doesn't come with anything. I had the scrambled eggs with a side of bread, which were a bit pricy. The portion was small as well, although the eggs themselves were tasty.   It is pricy a little pricy here, but they do stress the whole organic things so I guess it's understandable. Pleasant service and we didn't wait long for the food. Tons of hipsters here though, so it was crowded. Be prepared!

c51qia5CZHfV6jQD5zGxVA.text: Nice hangout, yet they refrigerate their red wine. What gets annoying sometimes is that other customers are quick to take your drink when it's busy. They were cool enough to accommodate after the third time someone grabbed my coffee though.

9PEobDwGpvaACO8KP-n2bQ.text: Great coffee and a fun place to hang out. Busy place too.

Nc4H_h8zpG6pxBJgJzcNuA.text: Aunt Gladys, you cut to the core of me! Lux is always my go-to when I want the perfect breakfast. Make sure to try the Aunt Gladys omelette along side a flat white coffee (:

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

26DQs6b6Q1NSHN1fewAHfQ.text: Love love love this place! Great drinks and food. Cool vintage vibe. Nice place to chill after dinner or for a date. Can't wait to go back to Phoenix just to hang out at this spot.

MRf3fHI9GESOK_mmYujzhA.text: I finally made it here a few weeks ago with a friend. The place is obviously very popular, because of how hard it was to find parking. The cinnamon roll was AMAZING- you could tell it was homemade. The coffee cake was dry and definitely would skip. I got an iced coffee and it was ok, nothing special. The cashier taking my order was super sweet, but I wasn't impressed by the food or prices :/ I opted out of ordering lunch, after I saw a small bowl of Mac n cheese was $13..... Fun to try once, but I won't be a regular.

L6gXCHdJF-thJ5LWPm5SBQ.text: I love this place. The food is always so good and they have a fantastic selection of beers. I hear their bartenders are really strong at making cocktails, as well.  I generally come for breakfast, but have done dinner once and it was spot on. I had the burger on an english muffin. I was very impressed with the presentation, as well. The macaroni and cheese is spectacular. My girlfriend raves about the bacon and jalapeno mac, but all I can speak towards is the pesto one. Go try each. The menu doesn't say it, but they do half orders, so if you're vibing mac as a side, you can easily do that.   For breakfast, I've had just about everything on the menu, but the biscuits and sausage gravy are some of the best I've had in Phoenix.

etT34iN_paRJIfM_8umwlw.text: This place is great! I love coming here to hang out and grab a coffee. I usually bring my laptop and music and zone out to get work done. I've met some really interesting people here. I really love it and go often

NMpumKVy_vE9PuzE5ZW4qQ.text: Hey, I'm a former hippy who had hair down, down down close to his waist. So, I appreciate a nice hippy joint. And that's what this place is. It's a nice vibe, young people primarily - I'm in my 60's now - and I thought they served us a fantastic cup of coffee. Looked like a lot of nice treats there behind the bakery counter as well. I'm going to knock off one star, though, because the place was a little on the grungy side. Tables with messes, stuff on floor and so on. Yes, it was a weekend mid-afternoon, so that's a busy time, but still . . . us older hippies, we kept things clean! Kids these days . . .

IlDpE9fyFrKWp3a9DFbMqA.text: I ate here twice while on business in Phoenix. Why just go to Starbucks when you can visit a local place? The atmosphere is relaxed and laid back... the first time I went with my co-worker we were greeted with "what's up, guys?" It's a cool place. I had an Americano both times and it was excellent. We also indulged in a different quiche each day we visited and both were the absolute best we'd had. SO GOOD.   If I had to give any points of feedback, I'd say make the order/pickup process a little more structured and clear to patrons. It tends to get busy and there's a clear lack of instructions (oh, hipsters) from the cashiers. I'm all for laid back but not when it causes chaos.  Overall, it's a great place and I would come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

J9JsErrGeTopmblT4Ey8AQ.text: When I walked into lux I must say I was mesmerized by all that was going on. There was so much to see that caught my eye and many choices of food, drinks, pastries etc. that I could have been overwhelmed but wasn't because I was so excited! I am visiting the area for two weeks and I was already there three times and it is only the first week. I will certainly go back several more times.  Super excited I went!!!

_oidmkZbsT5BC-AxvQGFAQ.text: Wonderful place :) Its my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix, by far.

7F8juC_sY0fGdZgUEXkmOw.text: Coffee wasnt spectacular and was over priced, but i would come back for the atmosphere. I came to study and had to do so outside because the music is pretty loud. Service doesnt really exist outside. Staff was friendly and i didnt get to try the bar, but it looked small but good.

FxCpGq04JybxigEKJUmbkA.text: I do like Lux... good luck finding the entrance if it's your first time there.   They are a little overpriced but definitely have quality drinks and food. The bartenders are (almost pretentiously) good at making drinks. The cashiers are very nice.  I really like the iced tea. It is refreshing and you can tell there aren't a lot of preservatives. Decent sized cup for $2.50 + free refills = not bad.   Sometimes it can be a little too hipster  but great place to go every once in a while!

ZYm4bB8DjhAwBfAmlSP5hg.text: Stopped in one day to have some of their famous mac & cheese and boy am I glad I did! This place is sooo cute! I ordered the mac & cheese plain and also had a birthday cake cookie and found a seat. I was anxiously waiting for my mac & cheese and once it came out and I had my first bite I knew I was HOOKED! I usually try mac & cheese at every place I go if it's on the menu so I've tried my fair share but OMG was this outstanding!!!! The creaminess and cheesiness was PERFECT! No dry mac & cheese here! Can you tell I'm craving it now! LOL The cookie was also perfect! I am a HUGE fan of Lux and cannot wait to go back as I certainly know what I will get on my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing Mac &amp; Cheese!!

Vyl4JgJamkWlplMrlwWUCw.text: The coffee and food were great. Didn't love the scene, incredibly crowded with hipsters...... I guess that's not their fault but it stressed me out.

d57hfWMMQblJw5NxXmbE6g.text: I have a serious thing for hipster coffee houses so this review might be slightly biased. Inside Lux it's loud, busy, chaotic, and so wonderfully fragrant. The line is confusing, but just follow everyone else's lead and you'll figure it out in no time. I'm not usually a latte person, but I quite enjoy them at Lux. Maybe it's a psychological effect of the cute latte art. I love their hash with poached eggs, and I'm pretty sure there is crack in the bacon. You can sit inside or outside in front of Pane Bianco next door.   Last time I was in there I ordered a latte and espresso cupcake and instead I received a latte and espresso. I told the barista of the error and she didn't even bat an eye - acknowledged the error and quickly got me a cupcake. No harm, no foul. I don't want baristas who are sugary sweet and ooze with typical fake customer service. I can get that at Starbucks (along with burnt coffee, but that's another review). We're adults here. Just do your job and when mistakes happen quickly fix it. So while other people may complain that the baristas are rude, I quite appreciate the honesty.   Yes, there are tons of hipsters. But there's also tons of nerds, businessmen, cougars, and regular people like me. If you enjoy people-watching this is a great place to go.

-LNYjcQvQ8kMraECWX386w.text: I've been coming to Lux regularly now for about 2 years and generally really love the place!   Coffee: Really pretty good. I'd been to some pretty good places back in CA, so have some pretty high standards regarding good coffee. I think Lux does a pretty decent job. The drip coffee and iced teas have free refills.  Food: A little pricey, but the food is always pretty good. Their macaroni and cheese is cheap, though, and awesome (5 bucks). You can get it with jalapeno and bacon (7 bucks). Sometimes, they even have pesto and chicken in it. They start serving dinner at 5:30. Their breakfast is always pretty good, too, and they always have a variety of different quiches.  Staff: All pretty nice and the more you come there, the more social they will be with you. If any even minor inconvenience arises, they're pretty good about spotting the charge, but it rarely happens that they have to do that.   Environment: Yes, there are a ton of hipsters there, but that's kind of to be expected with good coffee shops in any city. There's a lot of people studying, but there are people meeting socially throughout the coffee shop, as well and especially near the bar area. Plenty of outlets exist for you to plug into. They have a projector in the backroom and there is usually some sort of sporting event playing on it. The only con is that the internet (especially lately) has been somewhat spotty as the place is usually pretty busy and everyone and their grandmothers are trying to connect.

5Kl7pIuvyyGO_clBxC-DQw.text: Had the iced caramel latte and it tasted too milky..was not impressed. Haven't tried any of their pastries but they visually looked good. Maybe JUST maybe I'll give them another try but the parking is way too crowded.

0SDm08_yRxTRMLwLI97y1w.text: Fun place to socialize or to meet up with a friend. Love the furniture. The coffee isn't that great, but that's not really the point, it's all about the atmosphere. My biggest complaint is that it definitely has an air of pretentiousness about it - the staff can sometimes border on being a bit conceited and snobby - but that's to be expected, it's unabashedly hipster. If you absolutely can't tolerate that sort of thing, you'll want to avoid this place like the plague; but if you're like me and can take it for what it is - and laugh a bit, in the meantime, at some of the feminine-looking twenty-something-year-old boys wearing handle-bar mustaches - it's honestly a super chill place. Plus, if you get tired of it, you can always walk just a block down the road to the almost infinitely less pretentious British pub. That said, Lux is a wonderful place, and I strongly recommend at least checking it out once (just know what you're getting into)

0wMheg9eF0a-TUCjCEcqtg.text: I love Lux. The only resaon im giving this 3 stars is becaus i can never find parking there....ever. That having been said. Great food great coffee great music.

0wWmr7xSfceuZmpBRvswEQ.text: Tonight was my first time there. The atmosphere, the staff, the quality of the food and the coffee... It will most certainly NOT be my last time there! That place is incredible. It's no mystery at all why it is so popular.

NEY9-5OWkEuHGA25JiJTww.text: Ahhh, the aroma of coffee and house-roasted bean. Iced coffee. Lattess. Pastries. Breakfast sandwiches. Yum.   I wished this place was in the Bay Area. Seriously, there are amazing coffee places (Philz, Blue Bottle, Catahoula, Farleys), but the pastries and baked good there are lacking. Then there are great, awesome, wonderful bakeries (La Farine, Tartine), with meaty-oger coffee.   This place is wonderful and derserves 5-stars because they have the AMAZING coffee with house-roasted beans AND AMAZING pastries and sweet treats. There is also other 'real' dinner type food and wine, but alas, I didn't have the time on my short trip to try those menu items. If I take another trip out to Phoenix, this will be one of my first stops.

PIItU_qwt4XuU8pCAM8NvA.text: It's not that the food isn't good, but the prices for what you get, in my opinion, are way too high. I used to adore this little coffee house, but now as I get a little older, it just feels somewhat pretentious, and like you need to be a hipster to feel comfortable there. It's worth trying, just don't worry about dressing up, unless it's in skinny jeans that are waist high with a free people cut off shirt, and the infamous hipster glasses.

3nJjy93wZWOZ1C9etjGFDQ.text: Sooooo busy. I could hardly find a place to sit when studying at 9 PM. The baked goods were tasty and I enjoyed my drink, but just be aware it will feel more like a concert than a study space.

1Y9t9nwujqzctsexdp4yWw.text: Whenever in Phoenix, this is a must stop place for coffee, breakfast, even a cocktail or freshly baked items. The vibe is very welcoming and lively. The DJ plays a good mix of music, that fits right into the environment. A great place to study or chill with a group of friends. Five star!

Jyn1CSOznJMBTL_Jc6FmFw.text: This place has an awesome Portland Oregon feel to the inside. Their menu is always different when I go, their souls are incredible to eat during the winter and I REALLY enjoy their tasty coffee drinks while hanging in their atmosphere. It's easily a place to go study, get some work done, read a book, or watch the football game in their tv room. Very cool and unique spot in Phoenix. :)

8dkS6xpbrU4td5hIaONAlw.text: I love this place.  I have become somewhat of a regular there.  Everything is good--the beverages (coffees and booze), the food and desserts--all very, very good.  The service style and format is very unconventional.  I happen to like it, personally.  That aside, the quality of the food and beverages is consistently high.  Great place for a custom-made cocktail.  The desserts are phenomenal--best in Phoenix.

Ukcbx-lCoBL4e95gTwf9xg.text: Espressos and cocktails. For the win how about that? Jeff is a gentleman and a scholar and has created something that Phoenix needs more of: a stylish place for hanging out and being creative. There is a hipster vibe but it's not clicky. Be comfortable with who you are and be ready to interact with other people and you will have a great time here. Wifi is good and if it seems slow try one of the other two access points. I hope to one day get the password to the internal network. Rumor has it that Jeff knows the google fibre guys and is secretly testing it out for the Phoenix area.   Finally if you see a hairy guy having a blast with his wife and the bartender buy him a drink. It's the desert by the way. Hydration is important.

GD4BaXiLY_ByWJezs0MAqQ.text: KATIE CALLAHAN AND JEFF! Nuff said. They made Phoenix cool again with this spot.

bsU_8jevl8ISnOgyRCT6-A.text: They took my drink order while I waited in line... A good thought but with a line so long my drink had been sitting out for several minutes by the time I paid and was cold when I finally sat down with it. Even Had it been warm, an unimpressive cappuccino from a place that seemed more focused on image than serving a good cup of coffee. Great scone though

WcgGgE8vfjxYplibupLRpw.text: Not a fan.  It is too crowded, too loud, and not enough of what makes a coffee house cozy.

NG_gqX90bceXJVB5PrdXaQ.text: One of my favorite spots in town, great craft cocktails and coffee drinks with good selections of food and goodies, its a bit of a hidden gem no sign from the street, lots of people studying and drinking ample amounts of coffee gives a good vibe to get inspired, I can hang at this place all day long from coffee to drinks in the evening.

D84-zNGjMdLAUu8Ith-JJA.text: Lux regular. Yeah it can seem vey hipster or pretentious but if you're brave enough to tread the super hip hipsters and break a little awkward sweat for $2 endless refills for the dark or light roast then you have made it my friend.

MUHmVHP1tp1iaHA6CapAng.text: I love the food and coffee at Lux. It is my favorite place to work when I am feeling uninspired in my home office. Thanks for the good vibes!

4bHNzyIYdJYEyVlDrK-A6w.text: Lux is popular for sure - but it's not my cup of coffee.  Tough for parking, tight spaces on the interior as well and average products.

thGCvOSnjz8ps1QE4w2Khw.text: Espresso is rich and DELICIOUS, scones get 2 thumbs up. Lighting is not the greatest for reading at night. Can be a bit overwhelming for first timers--figuring out the system (lines/ordering) because its so busy all the time. prices are fair/competitive. Wifi is spotty (also likely due to being so busy)

DDNgNJY5ewz8aKm3jOdEuA.text: AMAZING! Love love love this place! There is not much left to say that others have not... Consistency is always key for me when were talking about coffee and I can say that I have never had anything less than perfection every time I've visited. Love the iced americano...the espresso is delicious! :)

hEfDeHEQ-UtvVSK70Jmwtw.text: Been going to Grassroots in Scottsdale since they opened. Food has become inconsistent, wine pours are short & pricy, cocktails are all shaved ice, & what passes for background music is nothing but noise. Owner needs to spend more time there & get his act together. There are lots of better places in the area to spend your hard earned dollars.

pGPDS123FAfa7njhTseWfQ.text: Super cute and the quiche is scrumptious. Went for a layover, not too far from downtown and fell in love with the awesome vibe. If ever I'm in Phoenix, I'll be coming back for sure!

7MF740rcSorZkINoPeNaKw.text: Lux has the best coffee in town, hands down. They roast the beans on site, never bitter like that overdone Starbucks stuff. My penchant for sugar-free vanilla latte's always satisfied here. Free wi-fi. The staff do some jedi mind trick and always remember my name. I can bring my dog, they remember her name too.  BOTTOM LINE: Sometimes I dream of this coffee

vYMyJFdtYb-4V3P5uE99oQ.text: Not much new to say about Lux that hasn't been said already. Hipsters love it, but so does everyone else. This place has great coffee and breakfast offerings, but the lunch and dinner menu is on point, too. There are also a ton of delicious pastries. The bartenders are very talented and can whip up a bunch of custom cocktails, though they can be pricy.

yZCPxjoU0CY_XNaNUu2w6w.text: This cafe is SO COOL that I kind of hate it. I want to hate it, and I do hate it, but I absolutely love it. I want to have sex with it, mainly. I think that's why I felt so frustrated when I paid my visit.   After driving around and finally finding the sign for the place I had a hard time figuring out what building it was in; there was no sign indicating which of the two buildings it was in. After I tried opening a locked door to a restaurant, I realized it was the other building. I walked in and saw academic hipster chicks and dudes in square black rimmed glasses studying on their MacBooks and listening to their iPods. They stared at me as if I was disturbing the some silence. I knew it was this kind of place. It's why I came here. Hipsters have good taste in cafes.  I made my way to the counter looking for a menu and was distracted by the glass window of mega pastries, all of which will make your ass so fat, so you will have to run a marathon after brunch otherwise. I still didn't see a menu and I was famished. Looking around I noticed a dude dandied up in his tucked in red flannel, combed beard and slicked back hair pressing orange after orange into a giant, clear vat, and girls sitting at the mimosa bar in front of him watching the show. "How Portland!" I thought.   Finally, I saw a white piece of paper taped to the glass window. one font. one menu. no categories. beans. espresso. cappuccino. eggs. oatmeal. hash browns. etc. I just wanted a coffee and food. I couldn't read it fast enough to decide what I wanted, and I didn't want a bag of beans for breakfast. I ordered oatmeal w fruit + nuts because apparently Lux isn't hipster enough to add anything vegan to the menu. My total: $9. Coffee and oatmeal anywhere should never exceed $5 and should never be cheaper than $3.  I turned to find a place to sit and confused as to where I needed to pick up my oatmeal order when I saw a man smashed between some speakers playing music without words from his laptop. Some of the sounds relaxed and hypnotized me, while others caused me anxiety so much that I had to pee. I found the bathroom after I discovered there were other lounging rooms to eat in, one of which resembled an administrative office for an art school complete with projector and typewriter. Everything was color coordinated in turquoise, white, and accessorized with wooden "coffee table" stumps.   I sat down in a corner on a pleather couch and tried to slurp my steel cut oats  liquified in a cappuccino mug with a giant soup spoon. In the other hand I'd swap the spoon for the other cappuccino mug with coffee. Double fisting cappuccino mugs was my performance art for the day. Men stared.  I felt increasingly uncomfortable. The history channel was playing on the wall where my head was. Families stared at me as they walked by. I had to move, so I stood up, walked around slurping oatmeal, and watched the people on the back patio speaking with their hands. I felt as if I had to walk around and look at art and enjoy the hip design of the space instead of sit, which also seemed inappropriate as it distracted other patrons. I tried reading a magazine, but I was too distracted by others' movement and the music, so I felt I should just leave. The dark blend coffee was perfect. I poured it in a paper cup.

7b--pQLK48_zW-SL9_xgog.text: Easily one of my favorite coffee shops in the country & i don't say that lightly. Especially after going to Washington & Oregon, i'd still say Lux beats everything ive ever been too. & i always take my friends here to experience the goodness of Lux.  Something else i'll say - i work at Starbucks, so if it tells you anything, i'm a coffee snob. i've worked for Starbucks since 06 & i would still prefer a lux coffee over Starbucks any day.  This place has charm. The people are inviting & great. Very raw atmosphere. Expect to get great coffee & great food. Everything is baked fresh every day with their cute little bakery in the back. Its worth the time to stop by!

avMjtVHNvjrd1Sl_iOsVig.text: Latte was good. Latte art was meh- Lemonade was good. Good place to chit-chat inside or out on the patio.

Tqn4uHZi3rwMU68xGPKeuQ.text: Industry Standard home inspection has an inspector Eric that is rude, totally unprofessional, has no common sense.  I would not recommend this company.

EgtPfUW56Up3J7UuWNvfIA.text: Dear Seattle Supersonics and Howard Schultz,  I have forsaken Starbucks coffee since moving to AZ.  For one thing, Mr. Schultz, you suck (for selling the Sonics and for making a Grande latte $4.50).  I have moved on.  I am now--not so secretly--in love with Lux.  I get a "medium", otherwise known as grande to you, for $2.75 AND......ANDDDDD.......and my barista free pours the vanilla syrup.  I mean, it also tastes orgasmic, the coffee, that is.  By the way, I think their pastries are homemade.  Either way, their pastries are a DELIGHT!!  I always get the mixed berry corn bread muffin ($2.75) to go with my latte.    Sincerely,  A serious coffee addict  On a more serious note, they have outside seating with misters when the weather is scorching hot.  Since it's fall, the weather's been a lot nicer and this is a great hang out spot. They have their own parking and accept all major credit cards.  Their baristas are friendly and remember your name. This is a great place to get coffee and breakfast. No, they are not a franchise so you may have to drive a ways if you don't live in central phx...but hey, this is what makes their coffee affordable, orgasmic and worthwhile.  You should try them...at least once.

U3c7R-uyimSvhTPvby8euQ.text: I have to update my review. After moving downtown, Lux has become my new favorite coffee shop, breakfast spot, dessert spot and dinner spot. This place is ridiculously good. Their coffee is on spot and consistent throughout the day. Their egg sandwich is inexpensive (5$), yet super high quality. They actually make their food in *gasp* pans! No microwaves here. The egg sandwich is an over medium egg on an english muffin with cheese, bacon, and a roasted tomato. So good. Now, as good as that is, the biscuits and gravy are even better. This is what the BF gets for breakfast and what I eat off his plate when he's not looking :-P. The gravy has chunks of delicious sausage (and I don't generally care for sausage). The gravy is very well seasoned and full of flavor. Then, this week, we went to Lux for dinner. We had the bacon/jalapeno mac and cheese and the yorkshire pudding burger. The mac and cheese was creamy, spicy, salty and delicious. The burger was a knife and fork burger that had very flavorful meat (almost meatloaf ish) and a really good horseradish -y sauce. Finally, their desserts....I crave their desserts, especially their peanut butter brownie. That brownie is so awesome because it has the saltyness of the peanut butter and a rich and sweet chocolate flavor of the brownie....it's like magic. Brownies are never my first choice for a dessert....except here. This place continues to impress me and I will continue to frequent Lux at all hours of the day...

N0CUisi5NUBdDjlwLMf2Ww.text: This place is amazing. Came here to study with my fiance, and we loved it. I got the hibiscus iced tea (which comes with unlimited free refills) and my fiance got iced coffee. They have free wi-fi, and we never felt like any of the employees wanted us to leave or move from our spots. Got a solid 4 hours of studying done here. Would highly recommend.

3quRTIMWnlwOo-w6ThBBEw.text: I hadn't been to Lux since they expanded. I have always loved the coffee and the pastries but my favorite has always been the quiche. I went in today in the afternoon and was very pleasantly surprised that the atmosphere hasn't changed, it just has so much more room.  I didn't get a chance to try food today but was very happy with my soy latte with the beautiful art in the foam.

ENSQWFqZMWD2UNevNlcfog.text: Line up out the door, packed like crazy. So many people go here. The vanilla latte is pretty good. Not as good as my Vancouver and Toronto favourites but up there, definitely. Service is friendly. Nice coffee art. When I was in Phoenix I tried this place and Lola's and both are pretty good, though I like this one a bit more as I find there's more flavour in the espresso.

WDUlNHMllUn1W5BPXLmMOA.text: My head is still spinning. I will write a better review later.  They are doing it right on so many levels. Phoenix needs more stuff like this. Totally unique. Personality-driven, friendly and fun and welcoming. I love it.  The food and drinks were awesome.

ifdF7w6W5ORpLreStNvmYQ.text: Six dollar for a cup of half coffee and half foam and to be lectured by the employee early in the morning for where to line up.  This is robbing, right?  Take my money and punch me in the face.

cJZWhr1E9UtzhYP7N2n5Iw.text: Waiting for family to land @ Sky Harbor ... great place to hang!

rqvmfVJR6rZqUgwGaBLa3A.text: What a great cozy place.  Early morning to late evening you can find a little something to eat or drink.  It feels like you are in your grandmas house on a holiday with laughter people conversing and eating the day and night away.  It caters to singles and families alike with friendly owners frequenting their establishment often.  I have not been here yet where they are not busy, but the jam thru without skipping a beat with a smile on their face. I have been to several places in the surrounding area and as I walk to Lux I bypass a couple coffee shops that process 3 people slower and with lower quality products then Lux can with a 20 foot line out the door.

B42XEeMI7JLVSOZNiVRgvg.text: Sammy at the Bar serves up the most amazing toasted Rosemary Red Pine! He loves what he does so expect unique crafted beverages. This is my second favorite drink in all of Arizona.

7E-UwldPISbeRumY559kGQ.text: The cafe is eclectic, and the kitchen is completely open which is interesting. Now if you're not a huge fan of communal seating like benches and couches then head down the middle hallway to the areas with more desk seating. It's past the restrooms. There will be two open areas you can choose from and a patio.  Also, parking - there is parking off of central in the Pane Bianco lot if you follow that alley straight you'll hit a fork, turn left for the Lux parking lot, you can also get into it from W Turney Ave.  Had the Velvet Latte which I was surprised to find had a lot of foam as well, like a cappuccino, yum! It was rich and creamy as well which was wonderful.  Ordered the Nutella Banana Braid which I wasn't a huge fan of, not enough Nutella or sugar, it just felt like bread opposed to dessert.   However, the Kouign Amann was amazing! It's a French pastry that tastes something in between a Creme Brulee and a Croissant. I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My order, Velvet Latte, Nutella Banana Braid, and a Kouign Amann.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Only half of the displayed goods, nice selection.

Np7KpcxV9Cr2Y-VS76ZNXw.text: How to lose a long time customer in 10 mins.   1. Give the owner's buddies preferential treatment 2. Slap a sign in front of paying customers saying "reserved" (What does this mean?) 3. TELL the brown folks that they have to move (Should we just leave since there are no open seats?) 4. Say no such thing to the white couple (I guess they can stay, why interrupt their nice outing?) 5. Offer to make it better and then ignore us (How long should I look at this empty glass?) 6. Create such a crappy vibe that we feel we should just go (Feedback is clearly not welcome) 7. Do all this on our anniversary!   We've been coming to Lux for years. My wife and I actually had our first date at Lux and it has always been a favorite spot for us. So much so, that we decided to celebrate our wedding anniversary here. Years of loyalty and THOUSANDS of dollars spent here mean nothing when the priority is the boss's accountant (who probably got the meal comp'd).   The worse part is that even after we brought it up, the staff did next to nothing to make it better. They halfheartedly apologized and justified their actions by saying that this was the owner's request. I guess we know where the rest of us stand.

ByvlebW5B3r6L4x2R2OSjA.text: When I first moved here, I used Yelp to find at least one new local coffee shop every weekend. That's how I found Lux! Its' great reputation is obvious by the amount of reviews, and its rating, but I'll still rave a little.   The coffee is wonderful. My first time there I got a hot latte, and I swear it felt like it was hugging me. I ordered breakfast (two eggs any way), and it tasted...clean! Bear with me on that adjective. The food was delicious, but it also felt healthy and fresh. I felt light, but still fulfilled afterwards.   The vibe/decor in this place is one that I personally love. It has that industrial yet warm feel, and it has plenty of places to sit. I mean they try to offer as many options as they can, sadly (happily for them obviously), every time I've visited it's been packed. I've had to sit outside a couple of times, which isn't the best during the summer, so make sure to arrive early if you're going on a weekend.   All in all, I dare say it's one of the best coffee shops in AZ!

8zOcsRAhmtK2Kl3Mhiak1g.text: The best coffee I've had in a while!! From their espresso or plain black coffee to their iced lattes, you cannot go wrong! It is a bit over priced for my college student budget but definitely worth it when you not only get an amazing cup of coffee but a very fun and upbeat ambience. For other college students trying to find those cute and trendy coffee shops this is the place to go!

o0-7kAlV4LBKeguWS3P0Nw.text: It's not what it looks like from the outside.. you enter the doors and it's always crowded with an eclectic group of people sitting, working, studying. Most people seem to stay awhile and get stuff done or just kill time.   As far as food and drink, everything is amazing. The pastries are fresh and impressive, the coffee drinks are always good. They have a full menu with breakfast lunch and dinner. Never had a bad meal here- finding a table to sit and eat it is the challenge occasionally. The have a little boutique style bar in the back with knowledgeable and friendly bartenders.   Definitely my go to spot when I have some time to kill and want to people watch and have a great meal or drink.

Dynp9m8-84lN7RihRg23tg.text: Sammy at Lux was fantastic! His red pine was exquisite!! We loved his expertise in cocktails! We loved it!

bRwez12nrdIng-blfc8Gsw.text: Ohhh Lux how I love thee! Our family's Sunday morning ritual is to usually roll out of bed and walk over to Lux. Now I will not lie, I always feel completely out of place when I come here. Am I cool/hipster enough for this spot? Absolutely not. Is the coffee amazing enough for me to continue to come in? Most definitely. My go to is the iced white chocolate and listen, you HAVE to add them whipped cream. It is most certainly made their and omg is it yummy. There is of course a ton of other drinks but I am boring and stick with what I like. They offer pastries, a few of which we have tried and enjoyed. There is also a full menu of food items and even a bar. The atmosphere like I said is very hipster and you feel like people are staring, but like it's all about the coffee so who cares. The staff ranges from fairly nice to "why are you here". There is a parking lot in the back, but it fills quickly. There is also a decent amount of street parking available. Regardless of the weirdness of this place, the coffee is the bomb and I'll continue to feel awkward to get a taste of it.

j6oKD54NstlzQhucjKreSg.text: Let me start by saying, getting to Lux, inside of Lux is way to confusing. I was meeting a friend who was already inside and it took me about 10 minutes to find her. By the time I got inside and seated I was so frustrated that I didn't even feel like trying to figure out what to order. The layout is super weird, especially for someone who has never been.  I even walked out to the street(sidewalk) to find some signage to verify I was in the correct place but I didn't even see a sign. She finally came out to get me lol  Once inside I decided on just the house coffee. The baked goods looked yummy but the cashier seemed rush & not friendly so I just wanted to order something and go sit down.   I will say the atmosphere is super hip, cute & comfortable.  It's a super causal place and they play really good music (not too loud).  I ended staying for about 3 hours and overall enjoyed myself.  Funny FYI...I had to use the restroom but was too afraid of wondering around getting lost so I held it LMBO!   I will go back but maybe when it's daylight and less busy so I can explore, get to know the place and take it all in.

UvmLX_9K9YZsNX32sIH0Og.text: It's my to go to spot whenever I'm in phx, great coffee, nice crowd, and lit vibe.i also get the beans to grind home !

_SLNMDj_6cBcG5YkT74cfw.text: What a fun find in Phoenix! After dinner, we were all in the mood for something sweet..and found our way to Lux. When we pulled into the parking lot we were unsure if this is the spot..because it looks like an abandoned warehouse from the outside.   We got a slice of the dulce de leche and vanilla cakes to share. My friend paid for the dulce de leche and said she was charged about $8? based on only getting back $2 from her $10 bill. I think maybe the cashier didn't know she gave her a $10..?  We found a table outside and dug into the desserts. That dulce de leche cake is something out of a dream. The toasted coconut. The creamy topping. IM HOOKED. And hopeful its not $8 for a slice..  The vanilla cake was good, the chocolate frosting was a good balance for it. I think the other cake just stole the spotlight for me.  We enjoyed our time chatting and meeting new people and having obnoxious conversations. It seems like a lot of people come here to do work and it has something to offer everyone.   This place is not for you if you need quiet, comfortable seating in a mellow coffee shop.....

ucOezTKMov0aB2aduaYzSw.text: I'm not sure what the hype is all about.   My husband and I are out of towners, we came to visit Phoenix for a long weekend, and I had read and heard from people this we should come here. So... we did.  The interior aesthetic is super cool. If we lived in Phoenix, I'm sure that this place would have been our go to coffee spot just based on the style and atmosphere.   Unfortunately, service was terrible. The cashier was not friendly what so ever, especially for our first time being here. It was so off putting that my husband and I talked about how we wouldn't come back after that interaction.   We were also VERY confused as to where this place even was. There wasn't any signage that it was where it was. I had to refer to photos through Yelp to figure out where the heck it was.

WKItC4pObcGHrFC6FYdhTg.text: I like a lot about this place.  Coffee and Pastries.  The End.....  Seriously, I need one of these - I just don't want to overhype it and blow this spot up.  Our local host says it can get crazy busy already.  So if you have gotten this far into this review, the secret is out.  Coffees I tried: Iced Caramel Black and White, Hot Caramel BW, and Iced Velvet Almond Milk BW.  Pastries I tried: Ginormous Coffee Cake, Lemon Poppy seed Muffin, and Strawberry Pecan Scone - they were all fantastic - My favorites of that bunch - Iced Caramel BW, and the lightly sweet crumb layer through the entire coffee cake.  It's really one of those places that just makes you want to come back... coffee/food addiction much?  The cooked food looked amazing coming out of their small kitchen - and all of the staff were all smiles.  The location has hidden dining spots with no real consistency or order to the layout - it's awesome.  Parking looks pretty limited here so beat the rush, and ask google for help finding it!

Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior

7u6yl44UQNMXxBZIblJL9Q.text: I tried this place on a whim while out with a friend. I was very surprised. The food and atmosphere were great. The big impression came from the bartender. Watching him mix drinks from scratch was so cool. Definitely a place I'm going back to.

BKnN3lX0PxxhEcEpSgK9UQ.text: tl;dr This is a loud coffee shop with great drinks and food but limited parking and seating. A little overpriced, but not unexpected.  -- It's typical for coffee shops to have coffee, tea, and pastries, however this place also offers breakfast, lunch, dinner, and alcohol menus! I got the "Two Eggs The Way You Like 'Em Bacon Or Tomato And Hash" for $8.50 and a "Black And White Iced Latte". Both were delicious and I recommend them.   There is a small free parking lot with 27 parking spaces plus a little bit of street parking right before turning in. During non-peak hours, the parking lot was full and there were 2 street spaces left.   In theory, there is a lot of seating at Lux Central. However because the furniture around each table is bulky, if you're there by yourself or with just one other person, you're forced to take a whole couch area that actually fits 4-5. When I arrived there wasn't any seating available. Luckily as I was about to walk out without ordering, a couch/table area opened up. If you're planning on bringing guests here, prepare to take them somewhere else in case there's no seating.  There is loud, upbeat music playing. It's not as high as in a club, but it's definitely louder than background music. If you're going to have a conversation, you'll have to speak up. (Side note: Huge shout out to Saturday afternoon's playlist! Top 40 from the 2010's was amazing!)  I'd go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Two Eggs The Way You Like &#39;Em Bacon Or Tomato And Hash&#34; for $8.50.

LmZzHKUZ2JbYKkmBsLfVOg.text: This was my 2nd visit to Lux in about 5 years, and man...it just keeps getting better!  We stopped in for a quick kick of caffeine, and this time I was driving without my local friend to help guide. As an FYI - the entrance is at the BACK of the building, on the right side. (if you're looking at the building from the main street running in front of it). We may have circled it once trying to get in... :S There is a parking lot situated in front of Pane Bianco - we parked there without issue.   Who doesn't love a cafe that serves quad shots in a cup and calls it good? Although I was super tempted to try the Andy's Six-Shooter Iced Coffee, I held it together and ordered a Quattro Iced Espresso and DA-YU-MMMM, that black gold did not disappoint! They roast all their beans in house...hats off to the baristas who know their beans well enough to serve quad shots that taste heavenly...Lux is only the second of two coffee shops that I have ever tried who have truly mastered that art! We tried the strawberry cornbread muffin (a to-die-for pairing!) and a banana sumthin' sumthin' muffin which smelled heavenly. All the coffee and treats. All of them.   The second delightful part of this particular visit was the middle-aged DJ chilling out playing coffee shop tunes on a Friday morning. I can't remember exactly, but I could swear he had Simon & Garfunkel on the go... it was a fabulous, funky atmosphere!   Lux has officially become a coffee must-have every time I'm in Phoenix, and I'll be sure to return!

iU0ry5VN7PoOz7pcQfdjgw.text: A hip, modern, eclectic coffee house that serves breakfast plates with craft coffees and the gamut of espresso drinks.   If it's your first time here, the entrance to Lux Central is hard to find. You can slip through the crack alley in front of Pane Bianco to get to the door or you can go in from the side street and hit it from the back side. Another way to know you're in the right place... It's in the building next to Undefeated.   The line on weekends is constant but moves quickly. We were near the door when we started and were at the register before 10 minutes were up. Someone will come up to you in line, take your drink order on a pad of paper, then you stay in line to pay at the cashier. A minute or two later, your drink is ready.   Lux Central to me is like a hipster version of the Friends' Central Perk. Exposed wood beams, grey brick walls instead of red brick walls, couches and weathered wood tables. The seating consists of chairs and couches of various styles and upholstery with people eating, studying, talking or playing board games. A fun, vibrant place that has a constant buzz but no annoying loud noises or people.   I ordered their iced coffee which is more like an Americano. Two shots of espresso over ice. You can get it with two shots, four shots or six shots. They use and roast their own blend of beans that are sourced from Ethiopia, Nicaragua, El Salvador, Panama, Sumatra and Brazil to make their espresso and coffee drinks. They even make their own chai! For tea, you would just picking from a selection of Republic of Tea offerings. They did a great pull on my iced coffee. Just tell them beforehand if you want to leave room for cream or not. They do not make a cold brew here.   They have a considerable assortment of pastries and breakfast menu items but I didn't have any so I won't comment on those.   If you are looking for a good cup o' joe and want a fun place to hang out with friends, study, or break the awkwardness of a first date, Lux Central is super stellar for all of that!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Standard Iced Coffee with 2 shots of Espresso
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmm... Espresso

6Kpa-A76nMgCuPAMNS7WEQ.text: This place can be a little crowded at times but please don't let that turn you away. Once you find a spot to seat it will all be worth it. Took a friend of mine to get some breakfast and coffee. I am not much of a coffee runner but he is and from everything he has told me they have serve a pretty tasty cup.   I came for the food and there they did not disappoint! Every dish looks amazing and sounds like they are tasty. I got the Aunt Glady's breakfast and devoured every bite like it was my last. The tender belly bacon was my favorite, it was crispy but not burnt which some place seem to struggle with.   Overall it was a great place and I will for sure be back some time soon and suggest you come for a visit as well.

xqZ8--SDQFrxppuCbIByRg.text: A very hip and cozy but busy place. They have good coffee and really good quiche. It's very busy on weekends so it's hard to find a place to sit. Will be back here for lunch and dinner since I heard really good things about it.:)

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiche and a hot latte

N0P2R4Kbi9z764oQZnfktg.text: Favorite food and coffee place in Phoenix! Always bustling with happy customers. Amazing music, incredible artwork. A wonderful place

uyoXCoQyj0yp2Zq3AomsYQ.text: Great ambiance. Hipster hangout.   Good, no great, coffee  Breakfast baked goods and vegan pastries.  Sofas chairs cool spaces and a projector hangout room in the back. So good.  I wanted mac and cheese but not lunch yet

6uD1hVP_MvIQvrHs-u2Qig.text: i am not much of a coffee enthusiast but the whole atmosphere at LUX is different compared to your other coffee shops around Arizona. Parking is very small because of the amount people that come here but it's well worth it. Once you walk in, you can see the diversity- your average college student to your friendly senior citizen.   LUX offers a variety of foods, hot meals to bakery products. the coffee and teas are well made and presented with excellence. if you can't find seating, i would recommend walking to the back hall and you'll see a whole new section to have a seat at.

CJvwsqers2kXkumsMdk28g.text: Amazing staff selling amazing stuff. Gorgeous ambiance,  good food and drinks, relaxed atmosphere.  Just an amazing end of nigjt

wA1I4LYgjMZ-CMazDuEv9g.text: Coffee & atmosphere are both amazing!  Haven't tried the food yet but their pastries look delicious.  Lots of nooks to work on the computer or study.
