x2Lr8MYDoCykdRhAE-mbXg.text: Lux is one of the busiest coffee places in Central Phoenix. Parking can be difficult to find as the lot is shared with Pane Bianco. There are also street parking available on the right side of the building if the private parking is full. Be expected to wait in a long line that moves rather quickly (less than 8 mins). Bring your A game if you're planning to find a seat around peak hours, e.g. noon on a Saturday. There is a lot of hustle and bustle as you will find students studying with their books/laptops, coffee lovers getting their daily dose of caffeine, and hungry people grabbing breakfast/lunch. Planning to catch some sunshine? Have no fear as there is outdoor seating to the rescue. While waiting in line, I often look forward to grabbing one of the postcards on the counter. The Lux postcards are different every time I come in, which keeps it fun.   I love the coffee and latte art. My all-time favorite is the iced hazelnut latte, a smooth drink with the perfect balance of creaminess and sweetness. The velvet latte also hits the spot. All of their freshly made desserts always catch my attention every time I'm waiting in line. I really enjoy getting their package of 3 chocolate chip cookies that is cutely packaged and convenient for on the go. They have a good selection of breakfast/lunch that is popular amongst the regulars. I have yet to try their food.   If you're planning to study there, plan to bring headphones. It can get very distracting and loud with people conversing and walking in & out. They do not have a lot of single tables. Plan to get comfortable and meet a new friend on those long group tables. Wifi is available.   I will continue to return for their awesome coffee and mouth-watering sweets.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced hazelnut with whip cream (left) and iced velvet (right)
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Desserts!

lONjJ8yBnNa40qfR1XhBzA.text: Went on a little date to this over packed jewel.. Very downtown atmosphere, the decorations all the out of it people on there laptops and phones. They have music in the background, felt like it was my Pandora. Had a caramel latte it was delicious. Like a little piggie had the macaroni and cheese with BACON. It was the best I have ever had. Told my co-workers about it and they went the next day. They have alcohol aswell a plus plus plus.

iYPVEUVtS_203Egd8FDeCA.text: So--their coffee is ok, not great, not bad. 3 stars.   ...but those pastries...oh man those are some good pastries. 5, easy.   It's a bizarre shop with an organization that makes no sense, but I think the mild chaos works for them. Great place to chill and chat.

j0_H6qxXMJot8sbtC1iCtA.text: I am a faithful Lux customer.   The food, pastries and vibe are great.  But I have assigned a poor rating because of a very negative experience I had this evening.  I ordered the Arrugala salad which is $10 on the menu.   I was told that tax is now added and that my bill was $11.95.   I told them that would mean that the tax was 20% which couldn't be True.  I was then told that the price of the salad was really $11.00 although it was shown as $10.00 on the menu.  Give me a break.  Lux should be ashamed of itself.

3PMyZXaNvuR9dz571d8ysw.text: Some of the best espresso I've ever had. Busy, but worth it. Tasty pastries, cute hipster vibe.

S5ztOnIw6JsZwxEh1I8KgA.text: Such a pretty cafe with amazing desserts, a must-visit for coffee when you're in central Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Us3_19WGrjeesTgjsv6EBA.text: I love Drake as much as the next person, but please for the love of God, stop replaying the same songs over and over again. I was planning on staying here for a few hours and reading but I feel like I'm being tortured. Never coming here without headphones again.

NIfphn-8K7remTHhM_QuPg.text: Beet latte I've had anywhere! My first visit and already sold. I was at copper star for a latte earlier and it was just flat! This one made my day. I'll be back!

vvjG2Nj_Kj3DAhVXDWzldw.text: I really enjoy the food and drinks here but the staff is just soooo effin pretentious and rarely helpful. Maybe everyone who works there is just too cool???    If I couldn't walk here from my house and the grilled cheese wasn't so good I would probably never go here, but who needs customer service when you have grilled cheese sandwiches and tomato soup.....  Edit: I'm glad the staff can sit there and text and chit chat with each other while customers sit and wait for service. Must be a cool place to work and not do anything.

1qX5xIQZjJaLa0TDRx6-Bg.text: Fun, fun, fun!!! This is a trendy place that boasts healthy juices, great coffee, fresh baked goods, and gourmet food.    The place is located near the busy Phoenix downtown. But it looks like it is well known among the locals.  We went around 11am and it was  packed of young professional and students working on their laptops.  I love the artistic handmade, dark wood furniture.  Very homey.   We ordered ice coffee, Mac and cheese with bacon and jalapeno, egg cup with zucchini and mushrooms, and hummus dip.  Love the flavorful adult version of Mac and cheese: salty bacon and spicy jalapeno made the simple dish really fun. The egg cup was the best of all.  It was soft, peppery, and flavorful, definitely worth a try. Note that this is a breakfast item and takes 10 to 15 minutes to make.

0EQB3vZeRFYTmmHudoI_NQ.text: I heard of this place 8 years ago before I moved to Phoenix. I have been a happy patron for all 8 years. Get yourself an espresso martini with their homemade whipped cream!

xhoXNJTZzEEQYA1j5FjkRA.text: This is the scene-iest coffee shop I've ever been to. Like, did I even have enough cool points to enter? Like, I'm surrounded by the most beautiful people, and also the most hipster, and also the pinkest leather couches and chairs, and it's some old industrial chic thing, and no real sign on the building, and seriously, I do not have enough cool points to enter.  And yet, I did enter.  And I sorta loved it. Ya, it's a bit of a scene. You just kinda crowd the barista area and get your coffee (drip only) and some kind of pastry or scone. Then you camp out on the sofas, the tables, the big communal tables in one of the back rooms, or just sit and soak it in. On this particular day, one of the back rooms had a news feed projected on the wall, showing the big political event of the day. No idea if they always show news/tv/whatever, but that could be interesting too.  There's a small menu of prepared dishes as well, but I didn't grab one. It looked to be like small comfort breakfast foods with an elevation. The ambiance is quintessentially hipster, but I actually love that in this case. Why do some people think that's a bad thing? Well dressed dudes with beards and dreads, and delightfully modern women with vintage dresses? Ya, I'm down. I'm not cool enough for that crowd, but I'm down.  White chocolate apricot scone is a hit, as was the quiche lorraine. I'm not a coffee dude, but caffeine snobs might not love that you can't get a pour over. Get over it. Pop in, join the army of laptop warriors, and stay a while. Are you cool enough?

gQTSgD7Qv6EeUm_HXd-zPw.text: This is the mother ship of all coffee shops if anything is negative is it's own success  Flat out busy 1800 plus reviews and this tough Phoenix crowd gives you 4.5 stars  It's going to be good Latte of course was perfect Breakfast sandwiches perfect It's unfortunately worth the wait

zgElLmOwiTg3gztJMeGrCw.text: Good coffee, great food, and amazing atmosphere. If you're an east coast hipster then you need to see this place.   At first I was frustrated with finding the door. As dumb as it may sound, it isn't as obvious as one would hope. It's right there but there's no obvious signage telling you where it is. I was about to leave but then read the reviews again and I really wanted to see it. For tourists: it's to the left of the green restaurant.   First thing, the atmosphere both inside and out was great. It was a little steamy inside, but I got accustomed, plus it was busy. So I understood. Easy going staff that didn't judge me for not necessarily knowing how the place works.  Simple and straightforward. One sized coffee, free refills. Amazing, I wish more places would do that. It makes things easy and to the point.   I ordered the Dutch pancakes with fruit. It was wonderful. The dish was sweetened by the fruit and whip cream. So slightly that I was able to enjoy every bite. Fresh fruit, and the mixture of the hot pancake, cold fruit and sweet whip cream created many different textures and feels that were delectable.   Music was a little too loud at moments but it quit down after a little. Plenty of space and room. If you're in Phoenix, give this place a visit.

eDzkrW9cfXCoTeldkcocYQ.text: Drove across town because pictures of pastries and cakes look amazing on IG. When I got there, selection looked like it had been sitting for a long time. Selection was poor at best, There are other places with a much better selection. I would not recommend this place! Just my opinion.

4Lkj11MLJVeXN1fk7G-vkA.text: Items Selected: Cold-brew Coffee Lux Friand Strawberries and Cream Scone White Chocolate Raspberry Muffin Blueberry Corn Muffin Cinnamon Coffee Cake Pecan Banana Nut Bread Dutch Pancake with House-whipped Cream and Berries  Recommended by a well-traveled Las Vegas Chef, the hip vibe and Coffee program cited in addition to a substantial number of house-baked goods, it was just past nine on a rainy New Year's Day that three visitors settled into a couch of pink leather at Lux Central, the house already more than 3/4 full with a growing line as a middle-age DJ spun shoegaze intermixed with other mid-tempo tunes.  Generally open 6am to Midnight, the late night leading to 2017 allowing staff to sleep in a bit, those arriving at 4400 North Central Avenue on 01/01/17 consisted of all ages and genders with a lean towards Millennials, a hirsuit young Barista taking orders from the line and passing them on to a colleague in order to expedite traffic while a team of clerks gathered pastries and generated tickets for orders requiring preparation from a postage stamp-size kitchen in the back.  Focusing mostly on Quick Breads and American classics, glamour-shots of David Bowie and Chewbacca contributing to the decor, it was after slow perusal approaching the counter that a sizable order was formulated, a total of six pastries presented on five plates with twenty-minutes quoted as the wait time for a $9 Dutch Pancake.  Not in any rush, the leisurely morning a welcome change of pace from days prior, it was with self-gathered silverware that a tasting got underway, first bites of the Strawberry Scone trending sweeter and softer than the British staple while the Raspberry Muffin was minimally different in texture, the small chunks of White Chocolate simply replacing pockets of melted Butter in the former.  Smiling at the $1 Friand with a cursive "L," essentially a Hostess Cupcake made dense with better Cocoa, Lux Central's Coffee Cake as well as the Banana Bread do an admirable job of negating Phoenix's dry-air by dialing up the wet ingredients, the Blueberry Corn Muffin also showing well with what seems to be a 1/3 each ratio of Butter, Berries and Cornmeal.   A bit compromised by crowding, a lack of table service requiring diners to be attentive to their name being called out from a kitchen nearly 30-yards away from the door, it was precisely nineteen minutes after ordering that the high-walled Pancake was collected, a crisp rim surrounding no less than four types of fresh Fruit plus a sizeable dollop of hand-whipped Cream that made any thoughts of Syrup unnecessary.

Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Y1L8dRxjACFs3g-4zzVdqQ.text: I moved away from living right next to it and miss it every day.   The Egg Bake is amazing!

vHNLt4zi52ni6RUQWVKWww.text: If you're out of town visiting and wondering if phoenix has good coffee, they do exist, and this is one is them.   A bit on the pricey side, but nothing obscene. Tons of seating, even a quiet room to study and another room with a large TV.   It definitely caters to the indie hipster scene, staff and customers all look the part. But did think it was a bit much when their menu says things like, "mason jar of fresh squeezed OJ," as if I would drink my beverage from any other beverage vessel.   Plenty of parking, which felt luxurious.

LiLrdAJkkEvURUW7MackfQ.text: Their coffee is great but their cocktails are amazing! I love how this place is somewhere you can bring your family during the day and at night enjoy a date night or meet up with friends.

hU4OI7iX2mW6a27v47Jb2A.text: Great coffee, and really excellent pastry and food selections. I love the expanded space. I think sometimes service leaves a bit to be desired, but it's not enough to make me refrain from going back.

RkPYuJAfby74I9rXiojxLg.text: Good lord are they good or what ! WOW ! I just love this place ! the coffee is sublime and that alone is worth the drive ! I think I may have been here three times this week and that is saying a lot! I havent tried the food yet but at this rate it wont be too long!

Kiix8HCisuvVnKptHdhGeA.text: Their pastries are my absolute fave. Their iced teas are good too, but I wasn't very impressed with their coffee. The pancake I had was absolutely to die to and way too big for me... recommend and visit when I can.

eH9gFmgPxnwx-GA9nbUZew.text: Favorite spot in central phx for breakfast, coffee, pastries and WiFi. Nothing is bad on the menu.

QYgD6xtjnvVr4ccUf96wPw.text: Delicious food! very hip! Good coffee! great place to grab a BLT and Mocha and do Homework. My go to Study place.

jItdv0uMTrf8pRUcC3qhOA.text: I love the soups at Lux. Different every day & served with the most yummie bread. However, the last few times I have been here including today, the soup is completely blended. Didn't see a soup spoon & I feel like a baby feeding myself liquid food. If it was on the menu that this was yet another texture- less soup, I would have ordered something else. I usually look forward to coming here & when the food is disappointing... It's an extra bummer.   Please Lux! At least let us know on the menu that soup is completely blended. Ugh

j2a9TvD9heVaVNOkS019FQ.text: Just about the hippest coffee spot- so much more than a coffee shop. Great food and service, free fast wifi. Excellent place to study and meet someone, conduct business. No wonder they named it Lux Central!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qCTWLyjUBGSrlaSaDTjnqg.text: You'll probably age a year before you get your food but I wouldn't know because after waiting fifteen minutes for food I gave up. The atmosphere made me angry and I let everyone know on my way out that they'll be waiting a fortnight in the line they're in.  If you are not hip, don't enter this place.   Be sure to have HOURS of time to kill. HOURS.   Oh and stand along the glass, that's the line. But they don't let you know that and they are really rude about it.   Screw this place.

QA0z2ZD-w54y9JT4U2wtCg.text: Love this place. I like how they turned an old building I to something fun.  Line was out the door but the wait was short. The staff was so efficient and I loved how they remembered the regulars names and orders.  I had the steal cut oats and an Americana and it was wonderful. Would recommend this place to everyone.

FiMVnHSULXs_gBBhL8ai5A.text: I was recently in Phoenix visiting some friends and they took me to Lux, as it's a favorite of theirs. I'm not familiar with the area, so I can't say much to the location, but it is a cool little spot! Well, no exactly "little." It's a little crowded when you first walk in/wait in line, but I was shocked to see how much seating/space there was!   The service was great, everyone was friendly and very helpful. The food was good, and my chai was decent. Not the best I've ever had, but with this atmosphere I would definitely do my studying here!  I wish I had gotten the chance to come back in the evening and check out the bar! Next time...

r_j5_MOfSJvEHeoLmBfDlg.text: Bar none, the best coffee shop I have ever been to. The coffee, the bar, the music, the ambiance, all excellent. Truly well done. If you haven't been you should go, bring your creativity, have a coffee and interact with some people.   (This is coming from a guy who grew up in Seattle and has had coffee at Cafe Greco. However in fairness, the deserts are not even close to what Cafe Greco has..... they would have to be seriously earth shattering to be better in that department.)   Don't let that detract you. Go to Lux. It's spot on.

sbze-WWTQ3MOoUUpps5XRg.text: This coffee bar has a lot to offer the young professionals and hip kiddos.  It's a little awkward for older generationials. The bar top is low and there are multiple places to order at which causes them confusion. The drinks and snacks are amazing. You can easily flutter around 30people on macs doing schoolwork, lifework, or artwork.  Get comfortable and hang out. Doesnt matter if you're loud either because everyone's listening to their headphones. I also love the staff here. They're helpful, friendly and clever.

2Yg2Twu8Bys1BD6suacRPw.text: 4* for a coffee shop.  If it were my local I would not be disappointed.  Great service and staff, cool vibe and I like how there is lots of seating.  And the coffee was great, I like that they roast their own. They even took the time and care to make me the craft espresso which they weren't serving that day.  Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The craft espresso.

RwzsCoZGbjzCi7hP_yQAsg.text: Best coffee place ever, has coffee and boooooozzzzeeee. Love the art, love the vibe it's a great place to hide and work.

gSwyi3UFrYF3UlWqRIW-ZQ.text: My favorite place in Phoenix!!  I love the decor, ambience, music, the food, bakery, and hibiscus tea (free refills!)  The staff is amazing, especially Sammy/Sammie. He will give you GREAT recommendations on other places to go in Phoenix!   They also have a full bar that I have yet to try, but this is really a cool place to hang out solo, with your boo-thang, or group. I've even seen people with kids here; 3-year-olds vibe-ing to A Tribe Called Quest.  Don't miss out!!

5HH2BIeVZDNWbE4QhzoVtg.text: This place has ruined us!  We live in LA and the best breakfast place we have ever been to is in freaking Phoenix?!?!?  Debating the merits of driving 5 1/2 hours for good steak and eggs and Dutch pancakes.  The owner is also super personable!  We will be back!

WQlps4WFNfZ3SQZggDElZg.text: I'm from Seattle, and I stay amazed with the espresso here! I really love Lux, it has some really delicious pastries! The ambiance is awesome, very modern and trendy. It is definitely worth checking out whenever in the Phoenix Area! The only thing is parking is very limited.

ff8oRY2E087IPSH78Ux6EA.text: I really enjoyed the overall atmosphere of this coffee shop. Very laid back and relaxed, a variety of people come and go. I wouldn't recommend studying here as they play music but hanging out casually with friends is a great option!

XMhtToGwrZhtfqPN0Zdkng.text: There has been a line out the door each time I've been here, but there is actually enough seating in different nooks and areas that they can accommodate a huge crowd.  There are tables big enough to set up a laptop, eat a full meal, and be comfortable.  The pastries are great, and with so much variety that you will never try them all.  Tea or coffee is like $2.50. The line is long but it moves fast, because the employees are proactive and work as a team.  They have ample parking to accommodate their crowd, and outdoor seating too.  I will make it a regular place in my coffee rotation.

I3YKSB2VqMfKm8JyZmnj0w.text: This is my original review from 1/16: "Cool bar except service is exceptionally horrible. My friend and I waited at the bar for FORTY minutes and not one bartender spoke to us. After we asked to be served, they told us to hold on and then spent 15 more minutes intentionally going out of their way to ignore us. We eventually left because the bartenders were much too rude and pretentious to justify spending my hard earned cash there. Such a disappontment."  Since then, I've gone back numerous times and actually love the place. I still hold to my previous sentiment that the staff could not seem any more bothered to help you, though, with that said, it is a pretty rad place. Their desserts are bomb, their coffee is really good, and the ambiance is really ecclectic. I would go there to study, hang out with friends, or have a fun and chill night out.

GB85Mk4npWRzYioV-XmKvQ.text: Great coffee and food!!!  I enjoy being able to sit outside during the cooler months.  However, too many "hipsters" at this place. I feel like they are great as a coffee shop goes.   Too many "too cool for school" customers for my taste.  If that doesn't bother you, they are worth checking out.

HGRtpeSOJ7pXIpHr06S1rg.text: Coolest coffee shop I've been to in Phoenix so far! Definitely not your average coffee shop! They have an extensive menu with lots of fresh and local products they cool with. The menu changes daily too which is so much fun. This place is close to school so I can see myself spending lots if days studying on their comfy couches. Their long wooden dining table was perfect for us nursing students to spread out million books out on! My iced skinny caramel latte tasted like it was full of cals and goodness! The coffee beans they use are sooo much more tasty than Starbucks! There's also a bar on one side. We saw oranges being squeezed into champagne and the drink menu was something special! Will have to test it out in a day I don't have my nose in my books! Brain has to rest, right?! This is one of those hard to describe places, so you must indulge for yourself! Most definitely a place to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Afternoon snack! Latte and a graham cracker white and milk chocolate cookie :)

BCff9Go-5bhOsH1PUUkDyQ.text: This little place is really cool if you need to study, meet with friends and/or need a quick bite! It always pack. I think they are a bit expansive and this is why I gave them four instead of five stars...but you should absolutely visit and decide for yourself. I absolutely recommend it!

G-zWwFHSaku1jP432oO1QA.text: This is my favorite coffee place because not only is the coffee so amazing, but the food scene that hey provide here continues to blow my mind every single time. I drive 45 minutes to visit Lux and I am never disappointed. I feel that their prices are an absolute steal because the ingredients they use for their coffee, pastries, and meals are so fresh that it's unlike anything you've experienced before. However, I will warn that it is almost ALWAYS busy. And I mean like line out the door busy. So plan to try it out when you have a little extra time on your hands!

yQ2gNc0Lk1w9g_LWbx29IA.text: Yeah, it seems a little pretentious but the thing is that the quality backs it up. There's nothing worse than a hip spot that is all about image and can't back it up with good product.

F4BaMh8JYTyxtxKaseYCew.text: You really gotta be either insane or an idiot to mess with near perfection, and that's exactly what Lux did when they moved next door and added liquor to the mix.  Well that is unless I guess you really know what you're doing ... and the owners CLEARLY know what they are doing. This place is bigger and better than the old Lux and I never expected to say that.  This place is a diamond in the rough. There is no coffee shop within 300 miles that is this hip, this cool and this awesome.  Oh yeah ... the coffee is damned good to!

KnUHdaTZnXjDqIBrLxOrXA.text: Lux is my fave place for great coffee! The staff are very friendly. Lux is a half coffee shop and half cocktail bar. The cocktails are amazing as well. If you don't know what to get ask the bartender what they recommend. The best item on the menu is the grilled cheese. Hand down! It was recommended with avocado and boy was it good! Try it, you wont be disappointed.

ShW6C6KdaLLYzskN5MtU4Q.text: This place has an awesome eclectic and hipster vibe. The way that you order here is kind of weird and throws a lot of people off. They definitely seem to have outgrown the space but also seem to make it work. They usually have a great DJ playing there. A great place to to meet friends for a latte and breakfast. The prices are definitely way too high, a cup of oatmeal costs $7 or more. This would be a great spot to go to every day for a pick me up cup of coffee however the pricing keeps us from going there many times.

qZnTjJeduYkQwJt4WsfyXg.text: This place is a maze inside... And they kept changing up how they were taking orders so service is a bit confusing, but still friendly and quick.   I tried this sort of crepe with mushrooms, butternut squash and arugula, it was savory and delicious! The coffee was great too.

hWQygovwYgiNBCMg1BIzYg.text: Lux is a great place to meet with friends, do some homework, all while enjoying a creative beverage or item from their bakery. I love the environment, the music, and the food they offer. Definitely try their velvet (beverage), black & white (beverage), mac & cheese with bacon (amazing), oatmeal creme pies! Anything you choose will be awesome!

fNPIB1STyJ8CbPAV3r-jnw.text: I live right around the corner and love to walk over and get coffee. This place is amazing, the coffee was a strong and great.  Every single staff member that i came in contact with was fantastic.    I have not had a chance to eat anything at Lux but i am sure that it is going to be great.  There are a couple negative points about Lux.  The lighting inside is rather dark and makes reading while there kind of hard.  The only other negative aspect is that sometimes there is a long wait for your drinks and people who order after you get your drink long before you do.  But i know that those small negative points will not keep me away from Lux.

aEqZzIfU0ViNyMJ0cqL5zg.text: LOVE the decaf americano with a splash of steamed almond milk. I've tried ordering it elsewhere and it's not the same.  Plus, nothing beats the mac n' cheese OR the delicious cookies and cakes.

Lc4OkBRp4RTMvMU1jwm6SQ.text: True baristas. Artisans. I'm ruined for life. Can you come to Montana?:) pastries and the cappuccino were absolute perfection!!!

X9WMPamSa2syk0sQcT8Oog.text: This place was fantastic!  It is open late which is always nice.  They have a full bar for those who want to continue with the nights festivities but they also have OUTSTANDING coffee!  It is the kind of place where you can hang out for hours and go back for a few cups so come either with good friends or a good read.  I plan on going back to try the food but unfortunately, only went for late after dinner coffee this time around.  I love that you can see them cooking right there in front of you.  Can't wait to go back!

wD5LBGHxDAVKP5An-iEviw.text: Amazing find on our vacation, great coffee, ambiance and food choices. I had the black and white and my bf had Lindsey ' s 6 shot velvet .  Both were amazing. Forget Starbucks and the hype and actually go to a place that has great coffee worth actually bragging about !

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1o6uTVMcpcZYdqNOxs3-IQ.text: Face it - modern life can be lonely. And Phoenix can feel like an odd, random place to have landed when you are 58 years old, as I am - how, precisely, did I wind up on the searing desert, and how did it happen to all of these other people who I see sweating on the street?   At Lux, however, the existential depression shuts off, and its polar opposite flips on - how delightful that we've all come together into this cool, noisy, crowded, friendly, interesting space to have some coffee! If life is indeed random, let's all be randomly happy together!   I have written parts of two books here, and the energy of Lux is on every page - it's a good place to do the difficult business of writing readable prose.  And no one here is a "hipster," a word that does the world absolutely no good. They are young, for the most part, and enjoying being with their friends in the wonderful, intense, lovely way young people have since the dawn of humanity, and they are doing it a nice place in the middle of an awful, hot, barren desert, because young people are great and resilient and clever and wonderful. Old people are too, for that matter.   The whole place, the whole thing, is a testimony to just how fantastic people are, from the people who built this place to the people who come here to the people who smile as they hand over your coffee and ask about your day. Relax, smile, enjoy - it's a little easier at Lux, and when you leave, maybe you'll find it easier to do these things elsewhere.

9Do3uyR6008U9f1DMAAxVw.text: For the lack of parking and long lines you have to wait in, LUX more than makes up for this with their great coffee, food and desserts.  I would say this is my favorite coffee lounge in all of Phoenix.  Now, if I only lived closer,  I would be stopping by everyday.

6raIhl1tuJlPZaPjBh3-Kg.text: Their pastries are consistently amazing and drinks are always unique and delicious. I miss living close to it!

iRPhoDl3yUn5pKhJXSpdfA.text: Lux is one of my favorite places in Phoenix.  All the pastries are made in house and so fresh and delicious.  Coffee is great. Design is fun. Customers are an eclectic mix.  Phoenix needs more great places like this!!

8wVpJaz3lECa2H2xRNmxKA.text: Coming from Portland, Oregon, I know a few things about coffee... and my addiction to not only the flavor but the buzz. Lux is an Oasis in the Desert. After moving here, we found Lux, thankfully. This isn't only our go to coffee in Phoenix, it's the very best in town, and could hold it's own with some roasters in the NW.

96-QwJfThL0G39zXINe9vA.text: I came here once and won't ever be coming back. The staff was extremely pretentious and quickly became annoyed with my sister and I because they couldn't hear what we were ordering over the loud music! The two of us became extremely uncomfortable instantly and then to make it worse, had to wait 20 minutes for our drinks because they were both made incorrectly and our orders kept getting pushed to the back of the assembly line. Our finished drinks were hardly worth the wait, the espresso was average at best and (petty complaint incoming) our very normal names were misspelled! How do you mess up Amber and Gloria? Needless to say, we did not finish our drinks and left quickly.

fOujDZbY2BylP1dd-YK4tg.text: I like Lux because it is good for studying or socializing, there are lots of nooks and crannies to hang out in, they have real food as well as pastries, and a bar as well as coffee and tea. They offer almond milk and make good chai. Good people-watching. They score cool points for being open on Christmas and having a Christmas dinner there. I love that. I am a little disturbed that the pastries aren't covered in a glass case, and it is more expensive than other cafes, but I just love that there are alternatives to Starbucks, so I will support them.

aJVDLst81cngk3Rdip5llA.text: Rad vibes. Good coffee :-) I always come here to get some homework done and I end up meeting new people

cH-5bF-nqoXp_Bcsw3-D0A.text: I was in town for a meeting and needed coffee. I yelped and found this place... I asked the guy what coffee was strong but a bit sweet and he suggested a vanilla latte. I also ordered the egg sandwich with bacon on ciabatta. First, this place is super cute! The employees were nice and really sweet. Most importantly, my coffee was great! My sandwich... I wanted to eat this every morning for the rest of my life. So delish.... If I'm back in AZ any time soon,  you can find me there!

ekVK5_eNcdbvXzTcT1GmRg.text: Parking was easy enough. If you can't find a spot in the lot, there are plenty of spots on the street! Very busy place so I'd never find myself studying there (I need quiet to very minimal background noise--just to give you a reference). All the baked goods were on point! My boyfriend tried the espresso bundt cake which was just fantastic-- excellent frosting! I tried the paleo cookies they had for sale at the register, very soft and delicious. My friend who has been a long-time customer had me try her black coffee. I have to tell you that I am a huge creamer-in-her-coffee type girl but the black was smooth, slightly sweet, and not bitter AT ALL. Win. I liked the atmosphere! Very fun and there's tons to look at. Our seats were comfortable and we had no trouble finding one for all three of us at about 5 pm. I'm definitely going to be back!

MCFqNtocA1QVhpi9EJYnjQ.text: I've heard about this place before via other Yelpers, but have never really thought about coming down here to check the place out.  After having a wonderful lunch with a girlfriend of mine, we decided to come check this place out.  I probably would have never found this place by myself.  its in a little yellow brick building, and I didnt see any signage.  I pulled into the parking lot, parked the car and went inside.  The place was packed!  Its small, and it was wall to wall people. Some on computers, some just hanging out, others were sitting outside socializing amoungst themselves.  There was really no where to sit!  I guess thats a good sign!  :-)  Anyways, from what I could see, the place was nicely decorated.  Went to the counter and placed an order for a cafe ole, and the girl kind of looked at me funny.  I guess she didnt know what that was?  (its half coffee, half steamed milk, FYI.)  A girl behind her told me that they make it different here, or whateves.  ugh, so I ended up with a slightly different drink then I had anticipated.  Slightly dissapointing!  Anyways, I dont know that I will be back anytime soon.  Why? Because this place was to small, to crowded and I would have no place to sit and and enjoy myself.  I know, I know, dissapointing, but for as sheik and as cool as this place is, I usually come in tow with my computer, or at least the intention of spending a while (like an hour) here doing something.

0KE19GfyC2tk93SWW5EL4w.text: They do a lot right here. The only problem is, is that everybody knows it! The lines have started finding their way out of the front door! I'm definitely not faulting them for being great at what they do! The only reason this is a 4 star review instead of a 5 star is because a good handful of the staff can be a bit pretentious and disinterested with you. Not everyone of course, but shouldn't the staff at least seem like they want your business?

0iW0CLhY1tA19rdxI-WD8Q.text: man I love this place. good spot to sit and do homework or sit and spend time with friends, or have a meeting for work. There is also a seating area outside that is dog friendly. the kale and spinach salad is my favorite, and the mac and cheese in the best in town.

QMHBVjslMdByxrNz7EZeog.text: Great spot for brunch, gets pretty busy if you're not there early on the weekends.  Aunt Gladys plate was delicious, the biscuits in gravy looked great as well.  Would definitely revisit when I'm in town next.

UkPw3KCnCdJ6M3CBw2ft7A.text: Lovely atmosphere, creative space to study, food and coffee. What more do you need to keep your mind alert and in joyful spirit?!

CxI_JAaP8v-lD_HKLS3J8w.text: It a hipster place for sure, but all types are welcome.  I think it is the best coffee in town and a great place's to hang out with friends.  And lets not kid ourselves, all the people on their computers are not working nor are they studying.  House music play on!

7LAnHS2KlGLpktsCW2H9NQ.text: This is one of my favorite coffee shops in Phoenix. The atmosphere of this trendy cafe is a little more upbeat than most and offers a very unique experience. On top of that, Lux has some of the best mac and cheese ever! I definitely would recommend it.

wLIN6IcGVuPuDxvy6TcPQA.text: Cartel is better, the service isn't very good. Even though the atmosphere is nice and great decor they are secretly lacking in service and courtesy

UFFICWYjUbPd4CesYd0Y0Q.text: My favorite coffee place by far. The iced velvet (white chocolate latte) is so tasty, especially when paired with a cup of the pesto mac n cheese. Seating is hard to find inside, but the benches outside are lovely and they always manage to find me when they bring my food out. Definitely worth the thirty minute drive. I also love the oatmeal cream pies, but they haven't seemed to have them in a while :(

lF_T-cBv3sWAEkc6-e9n2Q.text: I really love this coffee shop. My only quip is that there's never enough parking, BUT I'm happy to drive around so I can go inside. Plus, that just means its popular! Great coffee and atmosphere.

6qjsNIrO5j7tzPjNTybyCQ.text: Really good spot to get some work done, if you can find a spot. It's not that bad if you are going alone, but if you want to meet a friend there, finding a spot for two can take some time.

sMaWAfWncQ9Q3KtznCd6Mw.text: I've been saying for a number of years that Katie & Jeff at Lux have the magical combination of outstanding coffee AND fabulous pastries... never disappointed.... love the variety of scones & muffins, the consistency of excellence and the friendly baristas and employees.  David is a top notch roaster for a smooth, creamy, rich latte or cappuccino.  I left for a year and a half and SO glad to be back in Lux-Land!!

FRsdxt3THPjEJqD9thHlNw.text: Amazing iced coffee. They don't have cold brew but they pour espresso over hot coffee to make their iced coffee. Really hits the spot and gives a serious jolt.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing!

CQH7HiBnW11n0XvTAD7ozw.text: You pay for the ambiance here, which is really pretty cool and worth going to the store just to experience, but the coffee is only good, not phenomenal, as the price should indicate. Food is also fairly expensive for what it is. Employees' etiquette could be described as buddy-buddy, so don't be surprised if you hear banter, or are recommended a drink other than what you order.

GSjk4_yXZqRzOXWDSdZuOw.text: Here's what I like:  The coffee, the breakfast sandwiches, and the bakery items. I had a bacon butterscotch scone which was a first for me and quite good.  Here's what I don't like:  This place gets crowded often and seating can be a pain.

Q2flH7dGpGardgzjbfgECQ.text: love the morning coffee.... great selection of morning pastry and breakfast selection .   the staff is awesome and friendly and could not more more helpful !   Great service Lux !

N1KqtN7GkNONSrIV9CniIg.text: This is my favorite place to get coffee in all of Phoenix. It's cozy, yet full of people to meet and the staff is super friendly. I always order a flat white and  it's truly the best one I've ever had. They have amazing treats and it's a great spot to chill.

5CB5NZ25lZV5ixGV1KuFMg.text: Love the drinks and the food.  The velvet is my favorite drink and the jalapeno bacon Mac and cheese is undoubtedly delicious.  However, the workers aren't usually very friendly though.  They are pretty snobbish and rude so I try not to go in very often.

raIez8yz2sGFqkbXg0qhHQ.text: Definitely the best coffee bar in all of phoenix. No other place matches the coffee flavor and the ambience. Truly unique

-6NJlnBnzDm8NtGasT5qcw.text: This place was very hip and very crowded on a Saturday early afternoon. I def would go there to meet with friends but not to do work just because it's so busy. I heard the food is good I only got a chai latte though. The line also moved fast so that was nice as well as the staff.

14yj72AUUucr3mhH6y9iiA.text: I went here last night for the first time and it was so cool! I had heard of it before, but had driven right past it not knowing it was there. It is kind of tucked away. It is a neat coffee shop/bar. It was pretty crowded on a Friday night which I did not really expect. We ended up having to sit outside because inside was so packed. Also at one point it got so packed that strangers joined us at our table because there was no room anywhere else haha. However, it is packed for all the right reasons haha. The baked goods looked so delicious. I was not hungry when I went, but I really want to come back and try something. This one person had like some kind of fancy looking pie cake thing. I also walked past a few people eating some sort of mac n cheese I think? Whatever it was, it looked amazing. The laid back atmosphere is great too, it was a nice place to hang out for a bit. people were playing board games and stuff near the entrance which looked like fun! There are like different sections too which I liked. A room that kind of looks like a theater, I thought that was an interesting touch for a bar/ coffee shop. I just came for a drink and had a glass of malbec, which I really enjoyed. They served me a pretty large glad of wine too which was great for the price I thought! They have a pretty good wine selection which is awesome. It looked like they make good mixed drinks as well, I saw a bartender pounding and preparing rosemary for a drink. I would totally come back to try a drink like that the next time I come. The service was good too which is always a plus!  I want to come earlier in the day and get a mocha or latte or something. This place was cool, I would like to spend more time here! Only complaint is how ridiculously crowded it was, I will have to try to come back at a time where Lux is not quite as busy as it is on a Friday night. Overall, I left impressed and happy with my visit!

7K3khWng3Lq-6mPh9ODBEw.text: In the Phoenix hipster scene, there may not be a more important place to see and be seen than Lux. And I have mixed feelings about that.   Coffee:      Delicious. They roast their own beans and their baristas are well trained, even though there seems to be a different crew each of the last few times I've been in.  Iced Tea:      Strong but delightful, however no 32oz teas here. Less bang for your buck.  Alcohol:      Never had a drink here, but their menu can seduce me from across the room. Also, its a separate bar from the barista station, so a bartender is totally devoted to the cocktails.   Food:     Pastries, YUM. Macaroni mug, DOUBLE YUM.   Wifi:     Consistently good.  Price:      Sometimes it feels like I'm paying for the product + a cover charge for being allowed to be here.   Service:      Unsure? Like I said, I've seen a slew of different staff here so I'm not sure if they have a huge crew or high turnover. Regardless, when I suggested to a friend that she should work here, she said, "oh I'm not cool enough to do that" and we both agreed that we would have a hard time competing with the persona embodied by the staff. They are what you think of when you think of 'indie', and along with that comes a certain attitude that I find welcoming when I'm donning trendy and standoffish when I'm not. "Customer first" is not a mantra I'd expect in their training, but I get that that comes with the territory of being 3rd wave.  Ambiance:      As I opened, this is the scene to be seen if you're trying to be included in the PHX counter-culture moment. With that comes some skepticism on my part as to wether or not Lux even fits in to 'counter-culture' anymore. Most everyone working or patroning is dressed for an album cover, so much so that it crosses the line from being a place that simply attracts that kind of person, to a place where people dress up to attend. Lux has become a pretentious venue in my mind, and I only come in when a friend wants to meet here or I am in the area needing a late night fix (they're open till midnight during the week- much later than most in PHX).      Also on 'ambiance', however, the set-up of the coffeehouse is completely unconventional, which is awesome and part of the draw. Mostly quirky, in some parts awkward, Lux is essentially a collection of rooms each with their own design elements. The interior layout is incongruous, which is refreshingly disruptive. There are plenty of wide tables for studying both inside and outside, as well as a large number of different lounge setups. But, I will note, finding a place to sit can be difficult, no matter what time of day you come. Because of this, I will finish by saying that the study environment won't work for everyone. Tonight I'm here to finish a paper and debated for a long time if that was a realistic goal given the crowd and noise. The Music is louder than other places too. I think for today, this is conducive to some good flow, but most of the time I turn elsewhere.  Check it out if you're visiting town, or if you and your friends need an after-activity when you're in the downtown area. But for a traditional, welcoming coffeeshop, keep looking.

2P1UyY2dbrP3LJe8egXIfg.text: Came here to have breakfast. I had the dutch baby and it was so good. The place has a cool vibe a lots of seating. It's definitely a good place to park and stay a while.

cdVsLmkCDabFSsn7NA_vrQ.text: Incredible place. I can believe I've lived in Phoenix forever and only now had the pleasure of experiencing Lux. It is such a unique atmosphere and the coffee I had was perfect. I would recommend this place to everyone!!

Ki8JxNyJ2zv0Vlqnf_JgYQ.text: High quality eats and drinks. Can get a little crowded in the walkways. Great place to go to feel social and be productive all at the same time. Rotating art and the occasional local DJ holds the attention of creative minds.

nhNgE-8umJ6yIFsxBhwEqw.text: Tips: Iced coffee here comes with an extra shot of espresso Mac and Cheese served dinner time 5:30pm and later. To die for!  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  The atmosphere, coffee, and food here is amazing. There is a lot of space for anyone wanting to hang out here as well as outlets and wifi.  I got a pork vegetable lentil soup with a biscuit and it is AMAZING. I would highly recommend getting this if it shows up on the menu. The biscuit is delicious.  The mac and cheese is very cheesy and the past cooked perfectly. I would recommend the mac and cheese as well.  Overall, a great place to come any time of the day.

5w8VkDjCCHhUCTgbx9pgrg.text: Has become my favorite place to visit in the central Phoenix area, and the fact that it is walking distance from my house, yes I live at the pavilions. The atmosphere is great the music is always different any day you come in and the bartenders are by far the best in the area. Great for that kick back and have a beer, drink or wine kinda place. For me it's just the staff that make it so much better than the rest. If anyone gives this place less than 4 they need to STFO.

tdHWJvjqjtTI15RUocQymQ.text: Went to this coffee shop seeing the great reviews. Good coffee, friendly staff and thoughtful seating & interiors.   Finding the coffee shop was little difficult though. No signs anywhere around the building or even at the front door.

juAlI_eOf1aRM3vEq_36FQ.text: If you are a coffee snob for  espresso like me, this is definitely your place. Lux has the best espresso I have ever tried in US. The service is always great as well.

nFpya0_b5FnYJeo_LesxiQ.text: A great hangout for pretentious people who think they're really "deep". I waited in an extremely long line for a chai tea latte and the latte sucked.

da9rbrF3GjOUK8pww6X7og.text: If you like unique, fun, hipster coffee places, this is your spot! I like it cause they have different tastes than the usual coffee shop and it's like a mini restaurant. They have breakfast and lunch menus. I really like how there's 4 different sitting areas, 2 in the front where there's music and then 2 in the back where its more quiet and a big screen that usually has a game on. It's a nice place to meet up with a friend but a little harder if your goal is to do homework.

l3gDtR4B1kEoDoqGQcEqaw.text: I always frequent this coffee breakfast hipster place. They're open late, too. Whenever I eat and hangout here, it always reminds me of San Francisco Bay Area ... So diverse, so hip!!!

2WItIuwF4UWreMIrxbIC5A.text: 1. The honey latte here is the most badass mofo of a morning drink. The last sips are the honeyest.  2. If you eat bacon like I occasionally do, bear in mind it's really fatty at Lux. I'm not into that sort of thing, because I prefer a bacon bits texture, only hot. So I have to ask for them to make it extra crispy. When they comply, it works, but I do still visualize clogging arteries. I consider what cholesterol looks like, and fatty liver disease in non-alcoholics, and all the other things I research on the internet because I consume information even more voraciously than food. I also think about how pigs are as intelligent as dogs so then I engage in some mental self-flaggelation and ultimately proceed anyway and just promise I won't do this very often and that I'm going to go vegetarian for another 5 years to fix things.  3. There's a scene in Lena Dunham's Tiny Furniture movie where her crummy old high school friend, the one with the British accent played by Jemima Kirk, whose character is a questionable ex-heroin addict who's so self centered and unhelpful that she's seemingly bent on keeping Lena Dunham down is trashed in her mom's house in the bathroom with her while Lena Dunham's little sister is having a totally-not-allowed party in their NY flat while their mom is out of town. While Lena Dunham's character is totally worried about what to do regarding the high school kids party going on in the house, her British friend is like, "Yeah, they're really being bad. Do you want something to eat? Listen, I want something to eat. Let's go into the kitchen. Let's scrum into the kitchen and get a crust of bread or cheese."  When I heard that line, I thought it was so odd and it really stuck with me. I mean, why would anyone have a craving for a CRUST of bread?  Then I went and ordered the baked eggs at Lux and it came with sliced thick pieces of french bread on the side with huge crunchy crusts that are totally amazeballs, and especially so when you're basically done with the baked eggs, but see that there's actually still some baked eggs left, stuck to the sides of the big mug that they bake them in, and so you use the crust of bread to clean out the inside of the mug, which is so much more effective a utensil than a pathetic fork, plus it's an edible utensil, and then you learn how completely right on that British ex-heroin addict friend of Lena Dunham's was.  Even friends who are mostly totally wrong are totally right about some things.

QMYcsSnq6_8NHMPB3IvynQ.text: I spent three days in Phoenix, which I was not thrilled about until I discovered Lux. I then proceeded to go to Lux three times in three days.   Obviously this place doesn't need more good reviews (lol), but the coffee is stellar, the vibe is rad, and the food is more consistently delicious and unique than it really has any right to be considering how great everything else is. Even better, this joint is open LATE which is ideal for night owls and students alike.   I am DISTRAUGHT to leave it behind. I nursed my very last iced latte sadly on the freeway back to my town. So my real question is: what does a girl have to do to get a Lux in Tucson, Arizona?? (I'll be waiting.)

iUwz-QhGPxWUXzlJyJRDVw.text: Forever will love Lux. Coffee is delicious and rich while the entrees are fulfilling and worth the money.

Dbzhd_tssl4BHHo77nUMaA.text: Lots of vibe, lots of quiche and pastry choices. Bad shot both visits, though that's not the draw apparently. It's more of a bakery.

xHDRnY1pMCpKTaE4XC3E7Q.text: Oh. My. Goodness!!!! I have been going here for years. My mom and I go when I am in town as a treat. We LOVE this place! Everyone is super super friendly and even the wine is good! No matter the time of day it has a great atmosphere. Don't be intimidated by the hipster look! Everyone is awesome here, I assure you.   Recommendations- order the morning bun! It's soft in the middle with cinnamon and sugar... AND it has a little delicious hint of lemon.  -whip cream! It's amazing! It's more than you can imagine. It's homemade and they just plop a big spatula full into your cup!   -look for/ask for Cheryl! She is awesome! She's taken my order multiple times. Has a great sense of humor and is super sweet. She's one of the people that you ask her to change your order last minute and even though that's an annoying thing to deal with, she makes you feel like it's not a big deal and not to worry about it! -great service!

nMPKeL-xngiwCQ6CSLgTuA.text: Absolutely one of the best places for a cup of coffee. Scratch that. It's amazing for the coffee, snacks, meals, and of course the atmosphere. I'm not a hipster. Many of those who are deny being hipster as well. It's not hip. But Lux is a hipster hangout to be sure.   Why? Because the staff are friendly, the food is of the best homemade quality you can find, and the drinks are very well crafted. The coffee roast and grind are perfect. We ship bags to our daughter living in the UK, where the shipping cost double the bag. It's that worth it.   The pastries and small plates are amazing. The Whoopie Pie is incredible. The breakfasts are filling and VERY well put together. I favor the biscuits and gravy with eggs....amazing. Overall the place can't be beat for a 2-3 hour stay. Get there early.

3S83HSw8KdCOyRIJ8nvQjA.text: Super cute place with yummy food and drinks! Long line, but moved pretty quickly, and really crowded so we had to take our stuff to go. Nice Patio out back that was also full. Didn't want to wait for hot food, so only got coffee, quiche, and a scone. All of which were delicous!

c7HdfTP82wdWdQlzVOHdTw.text: This is an semi-decent place to get coffee and hangout with friends. The reason I am giving this place a 1 out of 5 stars is because of the following: (1) this place has HORRIBLE customer service- In all the occasions I have been to this place I have not once been treated respectfully. They are constantly in a rush since it's always packed and obviously customer service is not there priority. (2) The products that they sell are definitely great, but the prices are way too expensive (They make Starbucks look cheap).(3) They have horrible internet service- I've brought my laptop to get some work done in numerous occasions and due to the horrible internet service they have I was not able to get the things I wanted to accomplish done. (4) They do not fill up your drink all the way to the top of the cup. I am paying over $6 for ice coffee I should definitely be getting that shit filled up to the top. Although, the coffee and pastries are pretty damn good they have several improvements that need to be made in order to get 5/5 stars.

I_VImrq_LSZ0swHp688ejw.text: Found this place on yelp when looking for a place to study. Really cool inside and  lots of seating which was nice since it seems to be pretty popular. I only got an iced tea which was pretty cheap plus it came which free refills which was great. However the service when I was ordering was very mediocre. The girls were too busy talking with each other and couldn't even acknowledge me saying thank you. If you want me to keep coming back, good customer service is a must. I didn't order any food but it all looked and smelled delish. They were playing great music though and it was loud enough that I couldn't listen to music in my headphones. I didn't really mind though because I like music when I study. Overall, just an okay place. I might head back with my husband for him to check it out.

AYUYCISX6kkECIWbpT2iHQ.text: Had breakfast, espresso shot, and black and white.  They were all pretty good.  Nothing shocking, but I really liked the vibe and they live up to a spot Having 4.5 stars.  Would go again.  They serve fresh squeezed juice and beer as well.

F06VozsBoxiJZ6qSS7acNQ.text: This place is super cool and chill.  At first the menu didn't convince me since I love white chocolate on my coffee. While trying to order I ask the lady about something smiler to my taste and they happen to have my favorite white chocolate ice coffee!  The coffee it self was delicious. They had music going on in the inside which was pretty awesome. The place it self it's kind of hidden but I'm super glad I found it. I will definitely be coming back.

SNiuk_4wzDYtjld6g5PaRw.text: Great coffee, great food, and a great environment for all types of occasions. Work, study, or hanging out it's a great place!

VaBk6MbAIC2DgDEov5EbOg.text: A hidden gem! Love their coffee their lattes are well made along with their ice teas. I recommend trying out their mac n cheese it cheese galore!  Their pastries are really good I've tried their apple pie, cherry pie, croissants, and maple donuts. SUPER TASTY! This coffee shop also has a bar yes a bar that serves alcohol! From what I hear their cocktails are to die for! I haven't had a chance to try one yet, but when I do I will definitely come to let you know if it's True! The deco in this shop is very unique very urban industrial with a twist of vintage. Love it! The staff is super friendly. The 2 downsides of this place is 1 the menu as sometimes I find it hard to look at and read as it is posted on computer paper I don't know if they do have other menus anywhere else though. And 2 how extremely busy they get, which is a good thing for the business side of it. It's just a tad bit overwhelming specially when you're an indecisive person as i am. Overall I love lux and I highly recommend it!

nBgILparYQoADeysmmkbhw.text: Best whipped cream on a latte, awesome coffee beans, expressive art, home made pastries, steak & eggs.  This funky coffee Shoppe is best described as "old school vintage" meets "techy wired computer peeps" with fun funky musical beats to enjoy your experience.

g0VFXYl0_9gyeYkTGb-Q5Q.text: Surprisingly lives up to all the hype. Food was delicious and coffee was even better. I liked the unpretentious atmosphere and community tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ST4SSmzeWZsQ0XOMbRwH9g.text: Located off of Central Avenue in Phoenix, Lux Central perfects the essence of what a coffee shop should embody and strive for in today's modern coffee culture. The ambiance of the shop lends itself to a study and work atmosphere. In this same breadth, it simultaneously offers people the ability to converse with a group of friends. In my humble opinion, the musical selection is on point and it reminds me of being in Portland and Seattle. This in and of itself is lofty praise from a snobby coffee drinking individual from the Pacific Northwest. As a transplant to Phoenix I would not say that this shop is a breath of fresh air, but rather a ray of light in a city devoid of coffee shops that offer quality service and goods. Even on a lively weekend where customers are spilling in and out of establishment the coffee served is always fresh and smooth. However, it is my recommendation to go during the week, as the coffee is not always as warm as one might come to expect. This is of no fault of the barista staff as they do not have an iota of downtime between orders. It is also worth noting that customers have access to a patio and a delicious selection of sweet and savory pastries. Although I may long for the coffee shops of Portland I believe that Lux Central is deserving of lavish praise and regular visits --especially for those who appreciate the way a cup of coffee, latte, or mocha should taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xG_8BMbcsbkjs-6olXMaLw.text: I went to Lux to do some blog updating and graphic designing.   Pros: large tables, lots of sitting options, yummy looking pastries, bomb Mac and cheese, good choice in music, sweet decor and cozy lighting, nice baristas   Cons: crowded late at night  Ordered: almond milk chai, too spiced for me

Nq9w7BNvkaiYe7Y0SZJy0g.text: Very cool vibe. Nice selection of sweets. I love how it's non existent from the outside and rocking on the inside. Definitely my favorit cafe in Pheonix. Free wifi too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very eclectic vibe, reminds me of cafes in Melbourne Australia
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ultra cool interior
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilled atmosphere

dXVUkWZ4nupx0DlHFLSoRw.text: The awesome thing about Phoenix that even most locals don't know about is how the best food places are discreet and tucked away. Lux is one of those places. I drove down Central countless times and never noticed it. Now, I can't stop pointing it out to others!  I LOVE the vibe there. As soon as you walk through the double doors, people are scattered throughout the numerous couches, chairs, stools, tables, and futons they have, each with their own story. You have to seat yourself after you order your own food, so if you want a sit down dinner with some peace and quiet, maybe this isn't the best place. I still go on date nights because I love the atmosphere and the energy. Sometimes it's so packed that you have to sit next to a perfect stranger, but that's never bothered me. Going to Lux means being open - be open and you'll get the most out of your experience.  The only grievance I have is that I wish they served breakfast longer because their menu is perfect! I swear by their biscuits and chorizo gravy, it is to DIE for. Their bacon is great by itself, too. Their black cherry Italian soda with cream my choice of drink, and their pastries change from day to day. I love being surprised with their choices each time I go. Place your dishes and cups in the plastic bin near the kitchen on the way out - clean your immediate area, place everything in that bin, and they'll take care of the rest. Again, some people hate that part of it, but I love it. I feel like I'm part of it all.  Maybe it's "hipster" to some, but to me, it's a great representation of Downtown Phoenix: cool, relaxed, independent, yummy, colorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some of their seating (all very eclectic)
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The ever-changing menu of desserts and treats, made fresh. :)

pyUJqnGmGgfi8doeu-I4Cg.text: Very poor service.  No one explained that you have to keep checking to see if your order was ready and that you have to pick it up yourself from the cook.  Mine sat for a long time because I didn't know.  Same with my beverage.  Was  asked for my beverage order while at the back of the line.  1st time there so I didn't know what they offered.  Biscuit was so hard I had to cut it with a knife.  They have some nice offerings but it desperately needs some organization.

SYmPmgsz9HMHXWMKr9cTXw.text: Neat little coffee shop with a bar how could you go wrong? I do wish the bar had a drink menu.

4485EYy5AbWotJvLX5cKJQ.text: I enjoyed the coffee and the breakfast. The first time you go it's a little bit hectic, and it might just be a little to trendy for me. I'll probably be back at some point but not in the near future. The prices were fair, it was super busy when we went but we didn't wait long for anything.

ZvlP4JlKQufb5Ed6Mjegfg.text: Overall great place to come and relax, whether it be to drink coffee or get a couple of cocktails with friends. The food and pastries are also great! The only con to this place is how packed it can be at times but you just have to come in at the right time. I would recommend the sweet dutch pancake and velvet coffee, both are very amazing together.

P4YEyE1zWSpccZSIApb9TA.text: This is a great place for business or pleasure.  If you are one of the brave souls that enjoys going out alone, Lux is wonderful for people watching.  Excellent drinks, tasty treats, and prompt service.

8mSnuzXvLqHNdzyGc-PpsQ.text: The honey latte is amazing! The atmosphere is a bit too hipster for this dad...but the java keeps me coming back whenever I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #honey #latte

9iMPNkUk__NTtGYlmby9kQ.text: I liked the vibe of the place and the layout was nice to go hide and do some reading while enjoying your coffee.  The only real drawback was how busy it was the few times I've been there. A bit more outdoor space would be great due to the overcrowding on the inside.  Overall a good spot in central Phoenix to meet up with friends or get some reading and relaxing in.

ncy-82bjeooguwRMOXENTA.text: Best medium roast coffee I've ever had. I'm not really a big coffee drinker, so that's impressive to me. 4 Stars is a really good rating, and it would have been what I was going to give based on the hipster vibe at Lux.  But I had to give 5 stars because all my friends like it too and some are hipsters. So, hipsters can be sorta cool, but I still think showering at least 4 times per week should be mandatory if one is going to wear the hipster label. The people who work at Lux are really nice too. :-)

sn1ybUEdrK-V3qjy7pNtlQ.text: I love this place. The sound of grinding roasted coffee beans and the sensuous smell of this dried fruit the whole world is addicted to - priceless. The people hovering over their Macs and the buzz and the hum. A perfect place to do anything from relaxing, breakfast, lunch, stopping by for a cappuccino or what have you. Flip up you laptop and do what you gotta do - that's cool too. What a way to spend the afternoon as a local in Phoenix. I'd give them five stars if a variety of sandwiches, salads or cold pasta dishes where on the menu. Awesome.

ccXmBazBLEKlJ-WvfEhrJQ.text: Whyyyy did I come here on a Monday? Well, it was *supposed* to be to study so I can kick ass at finals... that didn't happen.  I drank way too much of their delicious coffee... and the fabulous bartender convinced me to add Baileys - bad idea.  So, study session goes out the window. Music + drinks =  a social gathering with fellow lushes, such as myself... and now I'm posting tipsy Yelp reviews. Thanks Lux Cafe!

CdCadURy3rbHDR-OtiMbng.text: You would get more stars from me if you would clean up and nicen up you patio. Foods good. Coffee is fine. Often very crowded. Old broken down patio tables and furniture. Not everyone wants to sit in the dark . . .

X8ob0h4LxFouGwP6Jy87gg.text: The coffee is good, love the presentation and the pastry I had was delicious. Later I tried the savory Dutch pancake which was pretty good.   However, the music at this place is too loud and horrible. I went there for a few hours and eventually got a headache listening to their obnoxiously loud and annoying music. Nothing soothing about it. Please change it up or lower volume next time. I'm into all types of music so it wasn't the genre or anything, it simply was not good and too loud.

Rx-2lfj4TfyM0uFWpT0gbQ.text: Staring from the incredible interior this guy's always nail it with the variety of desserts. I had this time the mac and cheese with jalapenos so delish. The camel latte is from another planet. I always came here to relax and enjoy a great coffee.

iDrS-1aTPf1m_Vz1st2KMw.text: I absolutely love relax! It has this ever been vibe and quiet ambience. Their drinks are delicious and I will keep coming back to this place I recommend.

H73L9MjDiMPrkB0IsmAYkA.text: Love this place! Staff is very polite, yummy coffee and pastires/cookies, free wifi, and cool people hanging out! :)

7mYMOPC-VNDGlnu0wjLMxA.text: Lux is my lover. This is one of the few places I've found that really helps me get into the "zone" come crunch time, which is surprising considering all of the people watching, tasty dining (bacon jalapeno macaroni please!) and delightful tunes it offers its visitors.  Yes it gets crowded, but I've never not been able to find a seat, as there are plenty to be had inside and out. The ambiance is amazing and might almost make you forget where you are from time to time. I've literally spent an entire day here on more than one occasion without even realizing. I'll refrain from saying just how many times so as to avoid potentially being charged rent, but the answer is a lot. It's that cozy.  Come here if you want to warm up with some chai, plug something in, absorb productivity juices, or just plain enjoy life. 'Tis a swell place.

06bqQPtgtUR7rW9AtCHODg.text: This place is fantastic! Had their delicious fresh roasted coffee at a local restaurant and had to hit the cafe itself.  Just looking at their amazing baked goods display would prompt a celiac sufferer to hit the depression meds. I mean their stuff looks Fantastic. It's hard not to get more than one thing! Best flaky biscuits ever, great croissants and scones too. Their breakfast hash is also quite good (especially the crispy bits) and thankfully it's veg- friendly but won't disappoint the meat eaters.  The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is comfortable for a long drawn out cup of coffee or meal. The decor is an eclectic mix of designy and vintage objects (you can show your kids what a real typewriter looks like), though it's a tad forced.  Come for the coffee, stay for the baked goods! You won't be disappointed.

UbvNl0Xz8cQ6DmYTrFMo7Q.text: Their iced coffee is good! I love the food here because everything is made from scratch! The desserts are almost always yummy! The wifi is great too, awesome place to do homework. But do not come on Friday's or Sunday's to do homework! It's busy busy busy!

vgheHCmrfF7P4lMRCh8dAQ.text: I love this coffee place, It's usually very fast to get service and I love the free refills on their Iced Tea and reasonable prices. I enjoy the atmosphere whether I'm there hanging out with friends or even when it's a little busy and I'm try to do homework, they have a quiet are in the back that is just perfect.

QiklH_5xFKbaitpCWSmbvg.text: I love the vibe, love the aesthetic, love the crowd. Also, free WiFi, which is always a plus for me. The one thing I don't like - the staff can be rude and curt. I've heard this from several friends as well. Other than some members of their staff, can't complain.

j-8dA424M5LIQTFxf7npqg.text: I have been here multiple times during nursing school and I think it was such a cool place. Pretty good place to study at, depending on the time of day and the ambiance is good.

us7MAwOGrzIWqx1DNWHkHA.text: Lux has some of the best espresso I have ever had the opportunity to slurp.  However, I'm sucker for the hip atmosphere and good indie music.  What I'm saying is, even if the coffee was not top notch I would probably still visit.  I know people make fun of hipsters who sit around on their laptops and write wrist slashing poetry, but there is just something about the atmosphere here that helps me think a bit clearer.  Like I said earlier, this isn't just a hip place to sit.  The coffee here is splendid, and the froth designs on the top are always a welcome addition to my the rich coffee goodness.  It is expensive so I don't go everyday like some of Lux's more affluent customers, but luckily Lux sells their espresso for me to take home and brew myself.  After I brew a couple shots, I sit at my dining room table, blast some indie music, put on my black framed glasses, read a Chuck Palahniuk book, and think about how cool I am.

-zxqNKVubxEsAEEwl71Qhg.text: comfy, awesome, cheap, free wifi that never shuts off, outdoor seating, funky setup, interesting magazines, right on the lightrail route.

R7aczuBzWCYRBfdYqDGx5w.text: this place was a horrible experience all the way from the customer service to the coffee. i went here about 3 weeks ago with two of my friends who also were first time customer's, im not sure where to begin, its small, crowded, with uncomfortable furniture. all 3 of us got something different, my coffee was nothing but a cup of iced milk with sugar on top, and my 2 friends cups tasted like burnt coffee beans, yuk, when we waited in line for about 15min and reached the counter we had no greeting from the woman behind the couter with the fake english accent, she just said "what do you want?" i asked what their most popular drink was and she sighed as if i was an inconvience...wow.... we barly paid and got the drinks then noticed the awful taste... i walked back to the counter to ask if this was the correct drink and that it didnt taste like there was any flavor or coffee, instead of apologizing and re-making me a new one the woman responded "thats the way we make it"    again wow... so at that point we threw are full cups in the trash and walked out, never again will i back - i recently found out lux was owned by someon else previously and then the owner sold it to open a coffee bar and resturant called "lola's" -- im sure its was 10x better when the prevously owner had it because i just went to lola's 3 days ago and let me tell you the best coffee and the best service i was looking for, so if you don't like lux go to lola's ...... lux rhymes with sux

VWAOqPzJC6-OO7Kk38KVhg.text: so you'll have to get over the "i'm important, got to work, really busy, snappy dresser, too cool for school (see the old barista "B"'s photo for reference)" type of people that occupy most of the seats at this coffee house, otherwise you will miss out on the best people watching of the valley. if you have been out of touch with society for a while, ie.  been stuck in kansas, under a house; stop in and cop a squat for about 2 hours and i'm sure you will see many a people you thought you'd never ever run into in your life again. they all stop in, if only to be seen. the coffee and the service is not that great, but it beats the last owners crew. about late lunch you will run into lots of overweight men, who are trying to fake business deals with beautiful models, before lunch you will run into the younger crowd trying to get into those fake business deals with overweight men. its a riot what you might see out there on the patio, but at least you will have a big f-ing table to do it from.

yH3igCyvbv5FH4AgFtS1Mw.text: I live in the area and have been coming here for years (or at least used to).  I tried really hard to like this place, but the staff treats the majority of their customers like they are lucky to be allowed in.  They generally act like their customers aren't cool enough for them to be worthy of their respect, and they would rather have customers take their money elsewhere.   It's infuriating to me as someone that worked in the service industry for years, and I had to stop coming here because of their general disdain for the customer.  They would definitely rather be considered edgy than customer friendly.  The quality of food and coffee is above average (especially their bakers) but their inconsistent menu is almost as annoying as their website, which is just further proof that their focus is more on appearance than substance.

0XLkFK3toUL4R-C21WENnw.text: This place is always incredibly busy, but that's nothing to take stars away for. I come here a lot late at night to get work done and never have a bad time - especially when you can get unlimited coffee for $2. If you're here for breakfast, you'd be doing yourself a disservice to not get their sweet dutch pancake. Holy Moley that thing is worth wrecking diets over. Their homemade whipped cream is to die for.   Anyway, check this spot out. Great location right on Central, cool vibe, great food and drinks, and everyone who works there is nice. Never a bad time at Lux.

KmJk6ZRcRn6mK00ZCEQfWg.text: Most people come here for coffee, but this place draws me in for their bakery, kitchen (yes, their dinner is fabulous), and their cocktails. I have yet to be disappointed in a drink here (other than their coffee, haha!)--it's my favorite place in PHX to have a drink and people watch.

y3OwGWTGmwogeFdwxVTP3A.text: Lux is by far my favorite coffee shop! I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I love their mocha latte!   You have to try their homemade whip cream! Out of this world! They make their coffee with love!

4VeR9kB4RitCJrZM2s5hHw.text: Lux is a nice place for coffee and desert. The coffee is always good. The dinners are okay but a little to expensive. The deserts are hit or miss. Stick with something familiar, I've experimented with deserts that  sounded interesting but unfortunately didn't work for me. I go there every month or so. It's a fun place to people watch and hang out with a friend or two.

oGHaeQgueR_MK0QVU-dXSQ.text: The coffee is awesome, the food is delicious! Plenty of table space for getting work done, but very loud so if you need quiet to work not a good study spot.

FCCS4az3PgTwHUfhJFKIxg.text: A cool cafe/bar for meeting up with people or studying on your own. The setting is great, the ambiance is relaxing, love the music (not overly distracting if you need to study), and there is a good selection of sweets/drinks.   I wish they would have a larger menu, though. At least the last time I went, they had a list of food you could order on a regular sheet of paper tacked to the wall. And it was difficult to see if the line is long or if more than one person is crowded around it.   Overall, do go visit!

gxnqNGFq0BaRgDG7pwmUrA.text: Love this place!   Local, diverse, hip, and most importantly it has the best deserts and Mac and cheese!   Did I mention that they also have a full bar? Lovely!!! Their mixologist is are awesome!   I highly recommend it!

dKGjDX3wv9ag7-MO4IjD1Q.text: Uber hip coffee joint. No obvious entrance, haphazard decorum comprised of mixed patterns and conflictingly bright colors, Urban Outfitters-esque transparent acrylic furniture, cat art, and pallet wood trim cumulatively coalesce into a statement that screams "THIS IS THE PINNACLE OF COOL, ALSO IT'S PROBABLY NOT ENTIRELY AUTHENTIC".   However, I will submit, the framed photography peppered around the establishment did make me swoon. And, the almond milk latte I had was supremely delicious. I went back the next day to get another latte and buy a bag of their coffee beans, and although I haven't brewed it yet, the coffee smells excellent. I actually think I'm going to preemptively buy a second bag to bring back to Boston with me. Both times I went the service was very friendly and fast.  If walking around an unmarked building looking for an entrance while a gaggle of hipsters quietly get off on your not-in-the-know-ness doesn't bother you, it's a good place to drop into, especially if you're checking out the Phoenix Art Museum or otherwise in the area with some time to drown in a vat of frothy cafinated goodness.

s1y08DJW8KUYtau3tBmolg.text: Great coffee shop, even better pastries! They have at least half a dozen different types of scones to choose from, amongst other things, and the size of the scones are huge!! We got the strawberry vanilla bean scone to share, and the SO got the espresso macchiato while I got the chai latte. It's a very hipster vibe and the place was packed and overflowing at 1030AM on a Sunday, but the staff are super efficient and we got out order in no time at all. The scone is moist and very flavorful, and I wished I had gotten a few more to try. The SO liked his macchiato, I thought my chai was just standard. Overall, a great little spot for Sunday brunch or a meetup with friends!

pGhzxyuPzCfwCaIAregf-g.text: I have no complaints for this place. They have ruined me for coffee anywhere else, they're so delicious. I have yet to try the food, but I have heard great things from many people. I had the Velvet and they can serve to go or in a ceramic coffee cup to stay. They had a cute design waiting for me. The line setup was confusing, but I eventually figured it out. They have delicious looking desserts that I must try next time in!
