Ln2EWmiNTUNiluVg1gO8Aw.text: If you want the best vanilla latte and chocolate croissant in the morning you'll go here, and if you're craving some delicious mac and cheese while sipping on a drink at night you'll come back ;) My go to every morning!

FISziHyXgjzBPVu99bXtKw.text: Place has a chill vibe inside. Kinda creepy and dark outside in the parking lot. Gooood coffee

_ePDXFpLbsO5pEjLGpQmqg.text: de LUX! I come here for one thing and one thing only, Lattes! Alright, fine, I come here for their baked goods as well. An eclectic crowd assembles here drinking their coffee and conversing, or deep in their computers. Lux is a very cool coffee house that you can relax for an hour or so or grab a joe and go. Definitely one of the top 5 coffee houses in PHX!!

oCchz7MW14Cl5LfMIGPjhA.text: 1st time here but will return if I visit Phoenix again.  Fun hipster place.  Line was out the door for service and it's basically self serve & self seat.  Inside is a trendy atmosphere with good coffee, homemade scones, danish etc.  They have omelets and kitchen offerings.  I had the veggie omelet with extra salsa .......yum.  They even had a dj here playing some sort of fused jazz.   Nice place to hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hey its the bartender with Detroit&#39;s truckmaker.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool vintage glasses creating warmth in the sunlight.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cat art.

hlnKTLLIOZHHgV4j25IbSA.text: So I am not in a good percentage of the demographic that frequents Lux, seeing as I am a Black corporate professional nearing forty.  However, I frequent Lux because its truly one of the best coffeehouses in Phoenix.  Reliable wifi, lots of seating (though good lord, good luck getting a seat during their busiest times), delicious pastries, drinks and foodstuffs.  I like to swing by on a weeknight if I need to focus on a project due at the office or sometimes for mornings that I telecommute.  Full bar, places to plug my laptop in and generally a nice busy, lively vibe.  I will say that occasionally the evening music is either too loud or seems inappropriate.  But maybe I'm just getting old and not used to hearing a full Method Man\Redman album played at a coffee shop...  BTW, did I mention the mac and cheese w/ bacon is out of this world??

jFLXm6WuVf0xOfAHWAHQ7g.text: Hipster. coffee. Those two words pretty much sum up any decent review of this place. Everything else is just details. So...the details. This is a nice coffee shop in Phoenix. We drove around the block a few times before finding it since there aren't any signs anywhere. You basically walk into an unmarked door and...hipsters. everywhere. We went here on a Saturday morning while we were out exploring, and it was pretty crowded. This is a get to know your neighbor type of place. Unless your neighbor is set up at a table with an iMac, in which case don't get chatty. Still the coffee and the pastry were good and I could see this being a nice place to hang out as long as you don't mind people and noise.

EWiLZd6e361XPwcP23bmsQ.text: Chester came in around 7PM and the place was hopping. The experience started well when Chester was greeted by a svelte strawberry blonde. She sold him on a vegan cookie. It was made of oatmeal and surely some secret ingredient (CRACK) that made it taste so good. The adorable brunette with bangs got the drink out FAST which was good because there were a lot of impatient coffee "connoisseurs" waiting in line behind Chester.   Chester thinks the adorable baristas made a poopy day much better. The girl up front gave him such a nice complement and didn't rush Chester like they do at Sh*tbucks. It's amazing what a smile and good cup of coffee can do for Chesters' mental health. Thank you, Lux lady.   Iced coffee, service, people watching, and vegan cookies are very good in Chester's humble opinion.

ZLEiUhAA4jfECpUqZ9188g.text: Great place to get some coffee and hang out with friends. Highly recommend to anyone who is looking for a hangout spot to catch up with friends or just have some very delicious coffee.

IXSa5pNS81h8lX7t2w8AJw.text: Lux is by far the best coffee I have ever had..  I went on Mother's Day with a mother to have a yummy breakfast and a cup of coffee and was not disappointed. My latte was probably the best I have ever had and my biscuit and gravy was awesome! Service was great, they were all friendly and helped us with what we needed.  As I mentioned, the staff was amazing. Some coffee staff tend to be a little hard to get used to but the staff at Lux made you feel comfortable and were very friendly. Unfortunately, I was very displeased with the manager. I went in a couple days later to ask a question and he was horribly rude to me. Honestly makes me want to question returning to Lux.    And that is why I give a solid 3 stars.. Out of all people you think you may have a horrible experience with, the manager is always the LAST on my mind.

fuK39COFXxeJ-yNw-V7W9A.text: The yummiest of yummies in all of yummville.

2F2rRJINlFoLqvrvJf8xUw.text: I die!  I am so excited to have this gem of a place here in Phoenix.  From the eclectic vibe, fresh food choices, and delicious chai tea lattes, this place is my favorite wind down spot.  Love the extended hours and it makes a great late night hang out spot, when almost everything in Phoenix is closed.  I had the special mac and cheese smothered with cheese, jalapenos and slices of crispy bacon.  delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. special of the day: mac n cheese with jalapenos and bacon

sdvemzZoQBptBuTnMRZQcA.text: Best almond milk latte ever.  No need for sweet.  Love this place,  for coffee or wine or good local grub.  But what made my day was the apricots! You can keep your spotty, sad bananas, Starbucks!   I'll take 5 apricots,  please.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gbLbDiTpWs0ktRIzWEGwuw.text: Even though I had to give this place a few tries, I really do love it! I just needed to get over the whirlwind of what happens after I walk in until the point at which I get my order. I can never tell if people are in line, looking at the HUGE display of tasty pastries, or waiting for their drink. There is often so much going on in the small ordering area but after a few visits, I see it more as a small space that builds connections/community.   Normally, I order a regular black coffee or iced coffee. It's good here, but what really shines for them are their espresso drinks! The black and white, the caramel, the velvet...all sooooo good! They have alot of different choices too so make sure not to miss their menu board, which, unfortunately is kind of easy to miss. Don't be shy, just ask! It's easy to get scooted quickly in and out of the ordering mix, but just be confident. Everyone's super nice and willing to help!   The atmosphere is really hip and trendy too, so make sure to order your drink to enjoy on the premise. Enjoy your drink with friends, or a really good book, or meet someone new!

2sMntJXR_lUFeP0KANNx4A.text: I just love going here to get my favorite drink look at the hot bartenders and listen to good music.

ufEGSpsg7pV5c4dVNToU9A.text: Wow-A-Palooza!  Talk about a metamorphosis!   Jeff, you had the greatest coffee joint in Phoenix... now after this move/renovation you may have the coolest joint in the country.  Talk about hip, cool, and perhaps the warmest most comfortable place to hang out.  Nooks and crannies, little rooms, sections, all with their own vibe, feel and energy.  You have completely outdone yourself and everyone else man!  If you are someone who either has never been to Lux or haven't been in a long while, then you MUST GO (and go again and again and again to take it all in).    And oh, by the way... besides the comfortable atmosphere, both the coffee and food is over the top.  Katie (the chef), you're talents, passion and energy are appreciated by so many.

WvwfnKS2D_ocA6_tnVB-YQ.text: I have never met more kind and helpful people serving and educating their customers. At first I didn't feel cool enough to be there but felt so welcomed! Also, the coffee was amazing.

PGbiN76D4d4K8rGT93eRDw.text: One of my favorite places in central Phoenix. Here is a review I wrote a while back: fatesjoke.com/main/index... I've been to Lux for Christmas, New Years and multiple other special occasions and have never regretted the choice. The staff makes you feel welcome and the food is not to be missed. Ask for a craft cocktail and you will get something that you've probably never heard of before, but it'll quickly become something you are ordering at the next place you have a drink. I try to take everyone that comes from out of town to visit here, and I have yet to hear someone say it was a bad choice.

gfENEuKbaVBTyamok2pZyQ.text: I'm sure you've read all the other comments in here about how great this place is so I'll add a new thing they have done.  And I'm talking about the expanded and more regular kitchen.  Before you could only order cooked food for a few hours a day.  Now, it's basically always going.  and the food is as good as ever!

OfJt1e3P3p1baBjXr7BRNg.text: Super cool laid back coffee shop they have soy milk! They have a good variety of food its a bit pricy but real good!

X81aBt-qyOf_RvtKPnO6Vw.text: Best coffee and cocktails in the downtown area! Great study place or meet up with friends. Plus the manager is awesome  I've been going here for years.

OyF93kkJ_vsDBWTHmVIUag.text: Slightly chaotic for this first time patron, but the egg sandwich was AWESOME! My friend talked it up last night and it totally delivered! The roasted tomato is definitely the best part ;) #nomnomnom  Despite living a little while away, I'll definitely be back again! #happygirl

CBEkDSu97VdkBeyaZg02Pw.text: Parking was difficult to find, there is no sign from the road that indicates where this place even is. They rush you in line to order your drink and/or food. I paid almost $12 for a coffee and breakfast sandwich and the sandwich wasn't even really that great. It was greasy and looked messy.  This place is pretty small so I can understand why it is packed, but it was not comfortable to sit and enjoy myself. The tables are super tall, so I felt like I was reaching up to type on my laptop. The coffee was  at least decent. I got a caramel latte, except she made it iced, but it was still OK. I probably won't return to this location ever again.

yrUGSVIzUaulyJDj5RHKxg.text: Delicious coffee, beautiful atmosphere. We are on a girls road trip from NM, stopped to refuel and stretch. There were a few other spots with more 5 star reviews close by, but the pics and the back patio sold me- stop for your one break on a twelve hour drive here. Totally not let down, Phoenix has never felt so relaxing, breezy or better for road trip picnic with STELLAR coffee. Thank you Lola's!

ERRPFwNHilQ3uL-HLc0Tcw.text: I started coming to Lux in fall of 2014. I will admit, it took me a cool 5 times coming here to realize there was a back, I thought it was crowded and didn't even care because of the vibes this place has. I left AZ on and off over the next few years and rave about this place to everyone I have an encounter with that the conversation of coffee comes up. Now I am back in PHX, and my girlfriend left for Cali early for Thanksgiving; I have been here every day since Saturday and for almost all day each day. I sit, I do my work, I drink coffee, eat my meals here; I don't even know how much I have spent over the last 3.5 days and I don't even care (probably close to like $80 once you include tip). The environment makes me feel at home and as I get to know the staff more I'm more excited to come back. Having met the owner I see where the place gets it's chill from. He's cool as hell and wears sunglasses indoors. If you didn't know he was the owner you'd look at him and just go "yeah he belongs here", Which is cool because the attitude of relaxed, focused and productive bibes radiates through the place. I use to not even think the coffee was that great, but it's even improved significantly. the food is prime and I recommend anyone try anything on the menu, you won't be disappointed. The Mac & Cheese is yes the most popular, but venture because the entire menu is great and I'm slowly checking item after item off (like I said, I eat my meals here).

9wToR6t-pw2BbmPBWtpTBQ.text: Such a trendy atmosphere and great coffee/food! Got the honey vanilla latte and lemon bar.. absolutely delicious!

O6v01aMerrO2MSnrRWrTUw.text: As good as it gets for an eclectic atmosphere and great coffee.  Their grinder is on the premises.  I always bring home a bag.

DCKrdOIxBN3Wd2eSiXN-bQ.text: What a cool, swanky little place. From the surprisingly high end good to the mixologist liquor bar. This is a wonderful place whether you need a coffee shops to study, meet a friend or have a wonderful first date. Talk to Sam at the bar. Great server who will never leave you hangin'.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside seating

6VoXc8Tm9s4PqGIS-aaOvA.text: What a cool spot! Tons of seating! Pastries and food galore. Wine, coffee, tea and hard liquor which you can have mixed in your coffee. Baileys & coffee anyone?!  I will definitely be back for a study/work sesh soon. They are popular so I can tell finding seating may be difficult during busy hours but totally worth coming in!

TTwFEwUL5KkIXlDMy7OyKA.text: Amazing!! Uber cute. Hipster shabby chic. Great mellow background music. Good energy. Wonderful service and staff. I got the maple granola yogurt for breakfast with a latte almond milk. They serve it in a cup white cup with a heart shaped design milk pour. Then I order to go the lemon donut , blueberry scone, and brioche. Yum!! Warm and made fresh with lots of flavors. This is a must stop place. Bring your friends. Great place!!

rTvBEZ8ctgia9DqKdC1pqw.text: Seriously. I come here so much for a good couple hours to study to abuse the real value of the Hibiscus iced tea with unlimited refills and munch on some home-made pastries, cookies, or whatever they make. I like to think that their food is home-made food, but with the slight disadvantage of missing the comfort of your PJ's. I wish I knew about this place before when I went to a certain girls college prep near here...  Here's some hacks:  It can get crowded, especially on Saturdays and Sundays for brunch. Come super super early (the ARE open a at 6, but 8 is a good time) for fresh-baked goodness. You can also come later, from 5:30 onwards night to avoid crowds and delicious options for dinner.   Lux is open till 2AM on Friday and Saturday, and on every other day of the week, it is open till 12. (The bar is only open from midnight to 2 however, not the main stuff.)  You can ask for a dollop of Nutella with their fresh baked croissants. Perfect little breakfast. Also, their whipped cream is unique, dense, rich and amazing.  I sometimes get a white hot chocolate, usually during the 'colder' months. It isn't on the menu, but you can ask for it. It's a delectable sweet treat, with perfect foam. :)   Their hot teas really aren't that good, but their iced teas are great. You can get refills for their simple coffees, tea and their iced teas. It's probably a sin that I haven't been as interested in their coffee, since coffee gives me tummy aches. Alas.   HOWEVER, PRETTY MUCH ALL OF THEIR FOOD IS GOOD!! Their food changes daily, so my rule of thumb is, if you see it and think you'll like it, get it, because you might not see it again for a while. Their delicate honey lavender shortbread haunts my sweet dreams...  Go into Lux with an open heart and it will never fail you.

2FzbEe9thU7c0etw9Yd-7Q.text: I love this place. The line moves quickly even when busy and the coffee wait isn't long. The food and coffee is delicious. The atmosphere is great, but it can get busy at times with no space to sit down and enjoy your coffee.   P.S. The whip cream is amazing.

KYUWP5YNHsxvHbWQFD8A-w.text: Came here with a few friends one night for drinks and a bite. The first time going there can be a little confusing as its a cafe, bar, and living room rolled into one. After a run in with the brusk bartender we were immediately met by an outgoing employee who helped us find a spot and got us going with some craft cocktails. A couple orders of mac & cheese later (get the one w/ bacon and jalapeno) we were some seriously satisfied customers.  Seems like a really cool place to hang out and study. If only it were closer to my house...

WVZaxuUf4FGsdIb45z_NEQ.text: My favorite place in the whole entire Phoenix !!! Love the b&w, mac&cheese, brunch, everything!

DX4AXu1lXFH1BPi25-yE_g.text: Environment-  Great coffee house hangout with a large interior.  Lots of space to chat with friends or work on your laptop. It can get a bit crowded, despite all the space, but it's a friendly environment.  Not stifling like some crowds can get. 5 out of 5 stars.  Service-  Always fast, friendly and ready to engage in conversation while your order is being prepared.  I'm not sure how they manage to keep it so clean during the busy hours.  5 out of 5.  Coffee- The coffee scores 5 out of 5 stars, and I'm tough to please when it comes to coffee. I haven't tried the food, so I'll have to update my review when I do.  $- Coffee shop prices.  More expensive than coffee should be, but the market is what the market is.  Expect to pay what you would for any decent latte that you didn't make yourself.  4 out of 5.

ZvrxJUEW6lVit0ooLjcEdA.text: The coffee... I've one had the coffee... is to die for. The prices, OMG, will kill you.  I'm hoping she made a mistake.  I'm not going to be one of those people who bitches about price, but what I will say is for that price you should do a whole lot better. I was in Vancouver, BC. The Canadian Loonie is worth 0.75. So, I could pay 5 Loonie (approx $3.75 USD) for something that was a 5 star drink. I paid $6 for a 4.5 star drink at Lux. A great drink, but not worth it to be frank. I'm splitting hairs because of the high cost of coffee.  I compare it to the cost of gas. It seems to be going up and up.  I stopped drinking coffee about a month ago, but I had a cup on a recent trip to Vancouver, and because it was so appealing at this one shop.  Looks like I'll be stopping again as to not get hooked back into the cycle of spending so much money on the luxury item and the people who charge this amount because they can.

uUtlmL5CO3J9GzU_-0V6ug.text: Lux is my go-to coffee shop whenever possible.   My only complaint with this place is that too many people love it as much as I do and I have to fight long lines and plan accordingly ever since I moved  from uptown. In addition to that, seating is sometimes hard to find like many have mentioned in previous reviews.  Obviously the coffee is great, but their breakfast is amazing too. My personal favorite is the egg sandwich. A dash of hot sauce (or a drench if you're like me) and it's my favorite easy breakfast in all of Phoenix.

e0zwsz1GgmVWF3APwkEarQ.text: Really cute hip coffee hangout. Most of their pastries are gluten free. The place is always busy especially on the weekend but its a great place to meet over coffee.  They serve basic breakfast options and their service is fast and friendly.

8fEWvGhZQS29XETpDNZBwQ.text: Probably one of my favorite spots in all of Phoenix. I've been coming here since I started school at GCU and it is my favorite place to study and socialize with friends! I always get the iced black and white and it is nothing short of a treat! Highly recommend to anybody.

fDuQ_Sp74AAxUGRoigb1cA.text: When I moved to Phoenix, this was by far the number one and most recommended coffee shop to try out. I love to try new things but this is one place that I have only ever had one beverage and love it. The espresso is delicious and I stick with my iced almond milk lattes.  There is plenty of great seating but parking can be pretty difficult to find.

e2JU3Y1r1AmA094DxbL5FA.text: Really enjoyable  coffee but extremely tough to get a seat.   I felt like we had to lurk around for seats like the old lady at a casino (yes, that is a friends reference) looking for the lucky slot machine.   Came around dinner time, and the big table in the back was reserved, which is perfectly reasonable.  Even though there are multiple nooks and crannies in the establishment, many of the seats were occupied by non-paying customers on their laptops. We were trying to figure out where to sit, but kept getting angry glares since guests are pretending this is a silent library and not a business.   Okay college students, we surrender.  We were forced to enjoy our hot drinks in the outdoor patio, and with the 100 degree heat & second-hand smoke...like the place; hate the patrons.

7sv7r6ZxGiZw7bZeMvXncA.text: Awesome drinks with a great view   Also, is there a fairy in the kitchen? How do they make vegan pastries so delicious!?

THdByMl2SquYHl3V2SaTyg.text: Lux is a fun environment, with decent coffee and good tea. I have not tried any of their beer or drinks.  If you want a study location, this is a busy place; if you like a lot of noise and lots going on around you then this is a good place to study, but if you are one who needs peace and quiet to study I would not recommend here for that.  Overall, I think its a fun place to hang out and chill with friends, not necessarily great for studying

e6W0TXF1iaqE-NB3Dj-DDw.text: Dope ass coffee shop/bar/cafe.  The only thing it's missing is an abundance of power strips.  The macchiato I had seemed a tad small for the advertised two shots of espresso though.  Maybe they just forgot the second shot?  In any case I was too intimidated by the barista's hipness to say anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmacchiatto

fUO6e0QsiR4sOmUZ1hp84g.text: This place is a delicious gem in the middle of Phoenix. Everything from the fresh squeezed orange  juice to the delicious pancakes. Looking for something different go to Lux for brunch. Next trip we are eating through the bakery too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M-6vgJ3qeX0Hf0KvxvG2-A.text: I'm going on a coffee tour of Phoenix and the surrounding areas.  So far, I've been to 6 places and this has been my favorite in terms of the coffee taste.  My drink of choice is iced mocha and it was delicious.  It was very busy and loud (there was even a dj in the middle of the morning ).  Not an ideal spot for reading or even conversing easily.  But the coffee was delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SU9m_Q3cE_r24nPX_zgf6w.text: One of the best coffee shops in all of Phoenix. From the outside it's a bit hard to notice with the simple grey brick and tiny sign, but from the second you walk in it's awesome! Cool chairs, couches, and art everywhere. I love going right when they open in the morning when I can sit, relax and just enjoy the surroundings. Then walk around a bit across the street at Agave Farms with all the flowers. Always great service and fairly priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ow_FSQsCaWVQNY9uv6BmIA.text: Do yourself a favor and order the mac & cheese with jalapeno & bacon.

_wm0ZDX4_-6ntiG2M6oneg.text: I don't know why it took so long to visit Lux. It has been on my bucket list of coffee shops to visit and I finally got around to it when my husband and I stopped by twice in the past month. The parking situation is a mess, but all parking downtown is cramped so I can't fault them for that. The outside is rather inconspicuous and has a small but decent sized patio. The inside is a little deceiving on space as there are two sides of the place. If the front is super crowded, swing around to the other side where there is more space. The line sometimes goes out the door but it is worth the wait.   The first visit, we both ordered iced vanilla lattes. We sat at one of the communal tables and enjoyed our delicious drinks. It was fascinating to simply people watch and see the delicious looking food the kitchen was pumping out.  Everything looked so good, we decided we had to come back for breakfast. Thus, a few weeks later, we came back for the second time. This time we both ordered hot vanilla lattes and two orders of the biscuits and gravy with a side of bacon. DELICIOUS! The biscuits were fluffy and carried the gravy perfectly. The gravy was the perfect thickness, both flavorful and peppery. The two eggs were cooked over easy (as ordered) and the side of bacon was just so good! It was thick, cooked perfectly crisp, and so flavorful. It was a little spicy/peppery, but I loved it.   Overall, we had a great breakfast and the coffee is fantastic. I would highly recommend Lux and will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artwork in the front
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy with a side order of bacon.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy with a side order of bacon.

n887toBKyhQM6z_htvSMRQ.text: Can't believe I've never written a review for Lux. I guess it's because words can't even begin to explain this sweet little gem in the heart of Phoenix. It's an experience from the moment you open the door. Their staff ranks #1 on my list for best service from an establishment in the valley.    Best way to put it:   We travel here EVERYDAY from Scottsdale JUST to get coffee!   TRY EVERYTHING!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THE Iced Vanilla Latte
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hibiscus Arnold Palmer
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken Sandwich

iOi7mgeWaF1guNIreUs34Q.text: Great coffee and cool ambience. A lot of young people here studying or connecting with friends. Their desserts were decent, too.

Nz4H6Qv2DguA8A5np7jeJg.text: You ever have that one day your wanting to try something different, your wanting a different routine?! I have been to Lux a few times over the years and every time it never disappoints. It's not your average coffee shop. The parking can be congested but if you don't mind walking a very short distance you should be fine. When you walk in there's not really a sign as to where you order but almost always you will see  a line next to the amazing array of pastries so that's your clue. Lux is your hipster, chill and sit together as a family with strangers you don't know kinda spot. You will find yourself wanting to order all bad things for breakfast, just do it! Breakfast at Lux I recommend it all, honestly. The vanilla iced latte was perfect and beats any coffee giant on flavor. If your wanting to stop in for a light dinner and bottle of wine, I recommend ordering the Mac and cheese it's a must! If you happen to go to the bathroom don't be scared by all the graffiti on the walls, most of it is inspirational.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vanilla iced latte

oP1dzkAzvOZp7XfdHYry2g.text: Good but not worth the exceptionally long wait for your food and coffee.   They have a good assortment of baked goods to choose from, but again you have to wait in the very long line.

2d6KMYCQGpisFxHLadjmww.text: Oh how I love Lux.  I discovered it years ago when I lived about 5 blocks away.  Their staff is always upbeat & groovy nice.   but the coffee is sublime.  I change my drink orders from time to time, but regardless they are on point.  I no longer live in Phoenix, but I make sure to come here every time. Be patient if they are busy and plan on a bit of a walk.  However, that's not a big deal as their location is in a great neighborhood.

tbhtQGN3cSg4RC3UIjfXiw.text: Must visit! Lux has such a unique atmosphere (great people watching), it's always busy, great pastries and real food, great coffee (love the bottomless coffee). They oftentimes have a DJ, but it's chill. Great place to meet friends for a cocktail in the evening as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich, fresh-squeezed orange juice, chocolate espresso scone, and Aunt Gladys&#39; Breakfast. All delicious choices!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The breakfast sandwich...SO GOOD!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh orange juice

-xWqGDvrkxsAJV4-1MwMVg.text: Sometimes I forget I'm 30 until I walk into places like Lux Central.  It reminds me that there is nothing 20-something or hipster about me anymore.  Still, there is one thing the younger hipsters and I have in common: we both enjoy damn good coffee.  Lux roasts their beans in house, and because of that I got to enjoy a cup both on the shop's patio and back at home.  I'll savor this fresh bag of coffee beans as long as I can!

H_-jebhNAwy9C9NPTpK_aw.text: One of my favorite coffee shops on AZ! The vibe here is so full of energy and the coffee is AMAZING. I've never been here when it wasn't super packed and bustling but have still always been able to find a quieter spot to study or get work done in one of the back rooms. They have a huge case of treats with a few vegan options and sell homemade granola and protein bars if you want something healthier/gluten free. They also have a menu with brunchy type food which is really good and reasonably priced for the quality.  For drinks, I usually just get a latte with almond milk since the coffee is so good here it doesn't even need syrup or flavoring but I also really love their dirty chai lattes (they make their own chai blend and it's super spicy with lots of cinnamon!).  If you're looking for a trendy coffee spot, this is definitely the shop for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nvRQrY206WGbTlCpPSWTaQ.text: I miss the old lux before EVERYONE knew about it. You used to be able to sit down and enjoy the quiet ambiance, just relax, enjoy their AMAZING coffee maybe get in a little bit of good people watching. These days it is something else entirely, its a place just to go to be a part of the boring mainstream crowd full of its crass individuals just vying for the attention of their equally dumbstruck peers. This is fully evidenced by the mere change that any time I have ordered a macchiato their server feels it obligatory to ask if I "know they don't make it like starbucks". My god....what has the crowd become. Fortunately their are still coffee shops around that have a more dignified atmosphere worthy of the fine brews within. I know this is no fault of lux itself and they truly brew a great cuppa' but still, stars down for the loss of a once great spot.

XLmvy6BKrVnGPW7dW44dmA.text: This coffee shop reminds me of pretty much every coffee shop in Portland Oregon. Which is probably why like it so much their pastries are amazing the food is great and the coffee is equally as good. The line goes fast they make every effort so people aren't waiting in line for a long time.  It's pretty happily have a good choice of seating throughout the restaurant area they even have a TV room or you can watch basketball and sports they have awesome culture. All different types of people calm located in a great area my only downside to this place is the parking. I literally almost got killed by some lady who thought I was taking her spot but I was leaving the parking lot and people are nuts about their parking in this place there's maybe 15 parking spots for the entire place. And I think that might even be shared with another place. anyways. That's the only downside I can think of other ways I highly recommend this place bring your coffee connoisseurs because this place will definitely meet the mark! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Different pastries

WTXz_l-m-nlpJDkghJRH4w.text: I know Lux does great coffee. It's a cool hang-out. The pastries look awesome, and the whole place has a great vibe. But some things from my 2nd visit in 5 years. 1) I walk in, clearly looking like a fish out of water (couldn't remember how to get in) - you're on duty filling bags with beans looking super mad you have to do it. Tip: everyone can see you're mad. No need to make me feel any more awkward than I already do, and continue to ignore me whilst continuing to look fabulously vexed. 2) When I ask what's on the coffee bean menu and state that I have my own machine, just no means to grind the beans, that YOUR cue to tell me what you have. Not look disinterested and brush me off so you can go do something, anything else. I pick-up the ONLY bag of beans I can see on the counter (single origin stuff), besides the espresso beans being bagged by the aforementioned disgruntled staffer - "are these the only single origin beans you have?" Yes. I mean, hint hint! Tell me what else you have!!! I know you're fairly full-up, most seats taken, work is hard, long day, blah blah blah, but come oooooooon. I get ripped for drinking Starbucks; first time off the Corporate Reservation and I get the faceless face palm of 'not interested'. Worse. I was too embarrassed to ask the price of the beans and got busted $20 on the Zampian (I've had Kopi Luwak for only a little more expensive). Just put the price on the bags (please). Of course, none of this would have been an issue if there had been some semblance of customer service present. Depressing :(

AlUNHPDdB_6iREZTI3R7bw.text: Good spot. I can't say I make it a common theme to come here due to how cramped it all is, and how many people love this place. I'm all for coffee shops but it's definitely surprising how many people love Lux. It's definitely awesome, just also very busy. More of a place to meet up rather than study, IMO.

jZhJUBSgDJtrRBXjeXVp7A.text: Overall this place is overhyped. Prices are high and it's very hard to get a seat. $4 for a donut. Parking is a pain also. I have only been in the mornings.

6hBr3MtLtV6sHxTVxF-69A.text: In Phoenix, where decent coffee shops can be rare, Lux does it correctly. Your drink will taste like a proper example of what you ordered, and the way you ordered it. I've drank a lot of jacked up Americanos in this life, and to be handed a drink that's rich and satisfying and distinctive is a rare treat. For this and this alone, it gets five stars. I've heard that the food is good, but I wasn't interested.  DOWNSIDES: crowded as hell. Parking is insufficient. Music is loud, and combined with the people, it forms a incoherent droning sound that can make it difficult to understand what's being said. If you were looking for a meaningful place to have a conversation, maybe skip it, because you'll frequently craning forward to ask people to repeat themselves.   In a different town, I might call this 4 stars. But it's the exactly what it needs to be in the place where it belongs.

XEqxCfr9CDZBrRpH6QPxBQ.text: Interesting place however if your going to have free water try having it free of dirt and floating particles. Atmosphere was good. Needs to be deep cleaned. Old is cool, dirt and sticky stuff is not .

Yzw412uaHFcndheAFmX5Sg.text: Awesome coffee, awesome atmosphere, if you really want to wake up, ask for the Lindsey. You'll be cleaning your keyboard with a q-tip and organizing your whole house in no time. They make a bunch of goodies and pastries from scratch that are yummy. The home made whip cream is d-lish!!!!

f-YJPYdBZqG4qeSJVKkwWQ.text: Cool, hipster vibe, which is great, but if you're over 30 (which I am) you might feel out of your element.  The coffee and the food were spot on and a foodie's dream.  Good stuff!

z67A6r84nMPyxqp_tdZgvg.text: If you like busy, crowded coffee shops with friendly employees then this place is perfect for you! I always get their oatmeal which is a little pricey but well worth it (steel cut with a variety of fruits and nuts in a giant coffee mug). Coffee refills are free also!

xMbCuYiv7sSXn6yi2zWiJg.text: Love Love Love Lux! Its like the smallest corner of California just planted itself in the center of Phoenix, palm trees on the street and all! They have the best latte's and homemade treats that vary as much as my mood & are always delicious

XuswVKaL09hzVJD2U8T09w.text: I have heard great things about Lux and was looking for a breakfast place so my boyfriend and I went over to Lux for a nice starbucks/First watch breakfast feeling. However, there was no place to sit inside, so we sat outside with the dirty, old tables and half working chairs. I tried to not pay much attention to that and see how the food was. When I got my breakfast I was expecting a well presented dish but instead I had a burnt, McDonald's looking McMuffin and to top it off I got a small cup of coffee with the coffee splattered all over the cup. I gave it a 3/5 because I liked the environment and the music that was playing, Lux is probably a nice place to gather with your friends for a dessert.

kWouqG3zTevOrDmcChH_eQ.text: I love this place! Always a good place to have a chat with someone over coffee. The ambience is awesome! It reminds me Seattle. Such a hipster place. I love that they have a bar and are open late too.

RTfRDlY6b-8Y7MxH0py29g.text: Just get their pie. I don't care about coffee but get some of their damn pie and ask for extra whipped. Why are you even still reading this when you could be enjoying pie?

3xyTQYGwo_mp71xlWEfr8A.text: Good coffee....just tough to wait in the long line to get it. Place was packed, but I expected that on a Sat morning. Cute ambiance and friendly staff.

qGFTpr6jEOmViEY9xRQM_Q.text: I love this place.  I come here for meetings and to study.  Very cool beer selection... which always ends up cutting my study short.  You'd think I'd fix that, but , eh..

f4QWAhkkw8KMC6dwx5UXzA.text: Good coffee, great treats, quirky hipster atmosphere.   I like it; my teenage kids love it.  Something for everyone.   They serve full meals too.   Overall a way better experience than one of the chains.

y5a335ao9P4sJPAeax18Cg.text: Ok. This is the spot! Been going here for about a year. Never fails. Macaroni and cheese, and a large velvet. What more can you ask for. :)

7G1bkeA42hNCPyaDPKnFgA.text: Holy mother of Jesus....This places eggs and hash and coffee is stellar.  It was crowded for sure on a Saturday which doesn't surprise me.  I wish they had a bigger patio unless they have another area I totally missed by chance.  I like to enjoy my food not so close and compact to other people I don't know it just doesn't comfort me in that sense.  My boyfriend on the other hand loves that type of thing being all close to a million people at once.  Anyways all I have to say to make this short and sweet is Tomato hash/eggs & White chocolate mocha with whip is definitely a new staple until i try the steak.

IbqQPoMEaOrTCpEO16dSpQ.text: Awesome.  Service is friendly, food is good, beverages outstanding.  Always a great place to people-watch too.  :)  See Jake at the bar.  The kid knows what he's doing.

m5hiNdVbC-PjE3OZr6zzyA.text: There's really nothing else in the area that's comparable, meaning, You don't have any other choice, and I wish you did.  Lux is too small, too crowded, too loud, and the coffee is mediocre.  The food is fantastic though.  So, three stars just because it's there.

NBjg5GJg-jc-ZpSIYs4Wjg.text: The atmosphere is pretty nice, but the food is only meh. I found everything to be overpriced, and the tea that I had was nothing spectacular.

OepnUZRmcsHyM9RmbVDQoA.text: Should you be sensitive to loud noises, fear crowded spaces, or cringe at a sea of be-speckled people sitting in front of macs, Lux may not be the place for you. However, if you enjoy a busy slice of downtown Phoenix, delicious espresso, tattoo watching, eating pastries outside, and freshly prepared breakfast, I would suggest you try this place out. The traffic flow of this place drives me insane, but then I have some coffee, maybe a cookie, and calm down to watch the word move by likely to a DJ-spun beat.

NVefW5BcmV5oSre3SCGGKQ.text: Last Thursday, November 5, I took my 2015 Chevrolet Corvette to the Classic Car Spa on Scottsdale Road north of the 101. One of the attendants left the trunk lid ajar and the resulting damage to my car, (the trunk was like a bathtub full of water and soap suds) was close to $2800. But of course, the car wash will not pay for the damages to my car.   I guess it will soon  become incumbent on the consumer to take before and after photos of their car to prove who is at fault and who is not. I did not drive into the car wash with the trunk open.

bPNQmkkmy4br_IQ4Owhr_A.text: Visiting from California, and refusing to drink Starbucks because I'm a complete "Coffee DB." When traveling, I try to find the local coffee gem in the barrage of coffee houses.  This place is great, just how I like it.  Smug employees / clientele, and fantastic coffee.  Better than Bluebottle, not as good as FourBarrel.  For those of you know what I just said, I raise my cup from my saucer in your general direction :) .  The edibles looked amazing, but was a little disappointed with the chocolate and cinnamon donuts I picked up for my family to try.    I ordered a double cappuccino, as it's my go to, did not sweeten it as it was easily enjoyed by itself.  Love seeing these small companies roast their own beans on site.  Love the fact they are taking great care with the roasting process.  Thank you for not burning the bean and making my beverage it so enjoyable.  Kind regards to the Lux team, I will certainly visit you tomorrow, provided you're open on New Year's day :)  Yum!

62LJ8HS1bu7WHN22Z9DCIQ.text: Came here one morning for a chai tea and enjoyed what I ordered. It wasn't the best chai tea I have ever had, but I did think that it was pretty good! My brother ordered an iced coffee and he also enjoyed his drink as well.

hbhBVStPNi-qfHh_IE6DhA.text: Terrible.  Dark drip was neither rich nor bold. Had a distinctly acid after taste.   This is wholely inexcusable for a coffee shop.  You'll get better coffee at circle k.  The toasted marshmallow pumpkin cake was cloyingly sweet and had no toasted flavor.  The flavor was strongly vanilla without pumpkin.  Try Starbucks

j_v7NXMSwaUiCEVDpcbaCw.text: Hipster coffee shop with everything you need. Coffee bar, fresh in house pastries, food, live music(some nights) and full bar.  When it's busy it can be hard to hear and hard to find a seat. Workers are generally nice but have experienced unfriendly encounters. Comfy coffee shop which is always busy; must be comfortable sitting close to others. Cinnamon roll was delicious and of course the inside was the best part. The outer layer can be dry because the pastries sit out uncovered all day.  Mac and Cheese is so amazing! Completely opposite from out of a box Mac n Cheese. Great option to add chicken.  Coffee is quality and I've never been let down.  There's a nice out door area to sit at when the weathers nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GgLwPfn9PvMvcz2FK3lH3w.text: Apparently if you're white and straight you will not get asked to move for the owners friends, but if you're a gay minority, you will. When the staff is called on this fact they will say, "I'm only doing what the owner asked." When you try to move to a different place you will be ignored and made to feel uncomfortable until you leave. Hard lesson to learn on our anniversary after us and our children have spent thousands of dollars in this establishment. Racist behavior is racist behavior. We gave them ample opportunities to fix it and were met with indifference.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White, straight couple not asked to move, while my wife and I were despite being told that they&#39;re seats were also needed.

RxREc_21CsNRf9JjJoBWHw.text: Lux is too cool for school. I really have to return to soak in the aesthetic. We went on a busy Friday morning and would have loved to enjoy a cocktail or two, or three but we had the kids and that's frowned upon. We ordered the best coffee drink which was recommended by the cashier and OMG I can never drink coffee again unless it has homemade whip. Everything was incredible and tasted insanely delicious, my only teenie critique of the place is the seating.... there's not enough  which is cool if you own the place since business is busy but totally uncool if you want to sit enjoy breakfast with a high chair cus that would be impossible.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The daily assortment

b3nu9sZvT3UjMXrnewkr6A.text: Such a cute cafe located in downtown Phoenix! I dropped twice, once to just grab a quick latte, and the second time to grab some food and caffeine!   First off, I had a bit of a hard time finding the entrance the first time after parking in the front. The second time, I parked in the back and was able to walk to the door more easily. Once inside, I was met with a line both times, but was happy to see that it moved pretty fast. During my most recent visit, they also started grabbing drink orders while people were in line so that they could get started on those more quickly. I settled on a black and white with whipped cream and a savory dutch pancake.   Now the black and white was deeelicious, especially the whipped cream! The savory dutch pancake was super rich and buttery and made me really want to try the sweet version next time!   Overall, such a cute cafe with a really unique interior -- drop by if you're in the area and want some coffee/pastries/food/cocktails!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Savory dutch pancake!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small black and white with whipped cream!

CcjFwYjJpHJ1ObevbrBccQ.text: This is one of my husband and I's favorite places. One of the mixologists, Samuel, is always on point and is just the nicest person. We are always excited when he is working. Lux on their own has a great list of libations, but my favorite thing is to ask Samuel to create a beverage based on the drink profile/flavors I am wanting. Every drink is crafted with experience and intense flavors. Simply amazing.   For food, the Mac and Cheese with Jalapeno and Bacon added is one of my favorite cheat meals. The cheese is so creamy and rich, it's just delightful.   Lux has a fun, busy atmosphere. It is not uncommon for this place to be packed so know that if you have to wait, it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Craft Cocktail by Sammy, vodka based
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Espresso Martini
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Craft Cocktail by Sammy, vodka based

SYj0zZJdJgCSlm0CjfIJ7w.text: Wow, I really enjoy the vibes at this place. I hear the coffee is great and I just had 2 of their desserts yesterday and they were both amazing! The vegan donut was super fancy and just the right amount of sweet. The real winner was their mixed berry bar with a hint of tartness and varied textures. I highly recommend the desserts.  They even have lunch and dinner menus. I love that the place is open from 6 am- midnight. It's kind of a place for early risers and night owls. The servers seem friendly enough and though the pricing is a bit on the high side I found that the quality of everything was worth it. I really love the different seating areas all over the building. It looks small but that is deceiving. The eclectic array of chairs, tables and couches will be sure to let you find your own space. It definitely feels like a slice of Tucson in Phoenix. I missed the slightly hipster vibe and I got it here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Berry bar
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Donut
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Desserts

xqdvBvsZM8DUgqJHgAr4tg.text: I've had coffee here before and it's been decent. However, I was in there yesterday and ordered one medium  ice chai tea latte and one medium dirty iced chai tea latte. I spent over $14 for both (that's with standard milk, nothing fancy). It was the biggest waist of money. I've never had a worse chai tea, it was watery and had no flavor. I threw them both out. Starbucks is cheaper and taste much better. I won't waste my money here again.

Hq-xzh6rp5fduqjNF_JukA.text: I love this cafe! It's super busy, and full of people working. I like to come here when I need to study and want to be out of the house. They have an awesome menu and all their food is delicious. The coffee is also amazing. Great place to be if you're gonna be studying in a group or for a long period of time. 10/10 would recommend.

Z1M8yqf5vLFVQ4dlaVt5DA.text: Cafe. Lots of room for doing work or studying. That's the population here. Students, working ppl or meeting up with friends.  Hipster vibe.  They have it all from meals, to baked goods, Cafe and a bar!!  Funfetti cupcake was delicious and was topped with glitter.  Zucchini walnut cake was a little dry but not bad.  Service is fast and friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left funfetti cupcake and zucchini walnut bread right.

KVLt3ODO8IWTQYiiiij3gA.text: I've been coming here for a few years to study and it has always been a great place to go to get a lot of work done. The coffee is great, the pastries are great, the tea is great, and the food is great. They're known for their macaroni and cheese, and you can never go wrong with ordering a pesto mac and cheese with bacon and having a cold iced tea on the side. Or if you want alcohol with your mac and cheese, they serve that as well! Different beers and cocktails to choose from at the bar area.  Overall this place is great and has always been there for me when it came to studying for finals, midterms, and the bar exam. I am definitely going to continue coming here. They close pretty late which is a plus!  Only downside is that it can get crowded, and parking sucks. Overall if you can come at the right time, this is the perfect place to be if you want to get work done, or just relax.

UXDFwghYJIQQKkzFsPRHkA.text: LUX RUNS MY LIFE.  No truly, I lived in Phoenix for five years after moving from Seattle area... aka the mecca of all coffee, and home of the legendary mermaid logo coffee we shall not name. I had the hardest transition finding a quality local coffee shop, that I actually enjoyed and didn't feel like I was "settling" for. Most coffee in the Phoenix area is watered down, acidic, or underwhelming. After over a year of searching, and an upwards of 20 coffee shops, I found the gem that is Lux Central.  Not only is their coffee just the right balance of flavor, it never gives me that dreaded acidic coffee stomachache - AKA True craftsmanship and quality. Not to mention their food is serious drool-worthy!   I highly recommend the black and white coffee (white and regular chocolate mocha) iced - even though I don't love sweet coffee this drink has a place in my heart. Their whip cream is in-house made and unlike any other I have had... and like I said, I don't do sweets but I'd order a full cup of this whip cream.  For food, I cannot sing enough praises of their mac and cheese, and also their chorizo biscuits and gravy! GIMME THEM CARBS.  The ambiance is hip and trendy, with ever evolving art - but expect a NY vibe. This crowd isn't here to be your bestie, and the wait is long! Get in line, be ready with your order, and most of all ENJOY! Have a B&W for me, as this spot as my most missed place since I moved away.

mQyeilEBkluQzXLxOuAJ8g.text: Love lux. Minus one star for having the worlds most uncomfortable chairs. Lol. Amazing selection of baked goods. They really should expand this place.

8CmTiCDKuZVLGdgCUY-GXg.text: Super cute coffee shop. Lots of rooms so no problem with seating. Food is surprisingly good and not just baked goods and such. The drinks were good, tried the chai and the tropical tea. The BLT sandwich was excellent. Def recommend for some studying or hanging out. Not quiet though FYI.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

voNtaWU5sNe9BIAvxrC0Rg.text: Great costumer service. They forgot to do my drink, but when they made my drink after I reminded them about it, they gave me a stamp card all signed so next time I can have a free drink.

4vvuzJeu_vCOT6lUlvby0g.text: Cute hipster cafe with really yummy coffee and pastries.  Loved their iced americano and pecan blueberry bran muffin.  The maple bacon scone looked tempting. My friends ordered the breakfast sandwich and they said the bacon was exceptional.   Seating was unfortunately limited and the line was somewhat hectic.  We ended up sitting outside because a lot of people were taking up space with laptops and such.  Staff was nice and parking was easy.

W0r6YB62IwZi7RA8APWhdQ.text: This place has the vibs to feel good, merry a little bit, feel the beat, wifi, great coffee and ambiance inside and out as well. I ordered white mocha with extra shot of espresso and a hazelnut latte. I love the flavors n the blend. Muah..

CQwPK-47ofbfbD453oFMsQ.text: My wife and I decided to go to Lux Central for our monthly celebration. We had heard good things about it we thought we give it a try. Everything was fantastic from the moment we arrived. We were seated immediately with no reservations.  The food was really good. I mean, my expectations were exceeded. The price was right, and the service was good.  I cannot wait to explore more of the menu.

qcnZd0YPSE-HszU52Bx0mg.text: Danika B and L.V.  one star reviewers: I was sitting next to you. That's not what I saw happen. Perhaps you were just having a bad day. No need to take it out on the fine employees of this friendly establishment. Also I saw them comp your bill which is not the same as a 'half hearted apology' honestly, I wouldn't have been as nice to you as they were. Being asked to move down one seat for the nice lady who was being treated to dinner during a time of crisis is hardly a big deal. Get over yourselves. Really.

BhWNMpw9OZ5zJwH1iSIfBw.text: NO GLUTEN-FREE pastries!!!!   I read other reviews and came here looking for gluten-free options. They are helpful if you want eggs and bacon. Not if you're looking for unique gluten-free options! They have one gluten-free cookie made with almond flower. Not super helpful if you're allergic to almonds, too.  Coffee was good and staff was super nice.

4fXaFEPSJrmMi60bp4-Pww.text: If you ask me, this is THE coffee spot in Phoenix. It has such a unique layout and vibe to it. Plenty of areas to hang out inside or out. Couches, arm chairs, tables big and small, super cozy. They even have a large projector screen that big events are usually played on!   Amazing pastry case, always filled full of yummy options. My favorite cookie is their paleo almond chocolate chip! I got so excited when they started offering paleo treats. They even have a breakfast and lunch menu with different specials daily. Really quality food you can tell they put love into everything they make.   Of course the coffee is great! I typically order a dirty chai latte or a matcha latte with almond milk.  There is also a bar where cute cocktails are served. I usually choose this place when girlfriends ask to meet up for a coffee date. It can be a bit noisy up front with the music level, but head towards the back and it gets a bit quieter.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paleo almond chocolate chip cookie and an iced matcha!

LCDfe62D3_mq-KCYHUdmKw.text: This is a very cool place and great coffee and pastries. The bad part is the music is way too loud that its sorta irritating.

aVgoaT-7EmOoYpCYeWst7w.text: Best coffee that you will ever have! They also make their own pastries on a daily basis. Must try at least once and you will be hooked!

k6ngt6tKDTUSmW90Mcyj7g.text: Solid iced coffee experience. Tastes like coffee :) High octane stuff. Food offerings are fresh and unique, I can see why it's always so busy. Parking could be better, but it's kinda right in the middle of one of the largest cities in the nation, so who's complaining?

Zgf9azG1BsrnzfxCE9T2Cw.text: Awesome latte! I ordered the iced Black and White latte which is basically dark and white chocolate topped with their house made whipped cream. Delicious! Didnt go there for their breakfast or baked goods but everything looked good. It's a small place so i imagine it can get even more crowded than how it was when we went there.

Pa_wDaQ5roTM2z4mxKV1tg.text: my favorite coffee shop and place to hang out on the weekends. The decor is amazing! open super late and the pastries are unique and delicious! definitely a hidden jem.

T4dDVLJ18CDu2_ee0WEt2Q.text: I adore this place. The music, the people, the ambiance. It's the perfect place to meet up with a friend or catch up on work. The chai is incredible, as are the baked goods. Pane bianco next door is the cherry on top. :)

ZZ6URsVnABJ8vrTAdMbyww.text: The Velvet coffee drink with whipped cream is the most amazing coffee I've ever had in my life.  It made Starbucks look like 7/11.  I also had a peach upside down muffin which resembled a piece of pineapple upside down cake.  It was also really really delicious.    I love the mix of modern, antique, and industrial.  I was there on a Saturday afternoon and there was a lot of seating available. The ladies room was clean.  There were some dirty dishes scattered around the place, but it was busy and I didn't really care- they were all picked up by the time we left.  There were a few hipsters in there, but my conservative suburbanite parents felt very comfortable in there as well.    My only qualm was the lack of a menu and pricing.  If my friend hadn't recommended the Velvet I would've been totally clueless, and possibly disappointed.  While I was waiting in line I even pulled out my phone to check if their website had a menu, but couldn't find anything.  In the restaurant I could only find a list of teas (on a small piece of paper right by the register), and alcoholic beverages (on the glass wall).  Maybe I just wasn't looking in the right spot.  I will be back!

NUL8pk5jioQfG5okTmsfrQ.text: Amazing food amazing music amazing staff...lots of room to find the perfect spot that works for you and your party. This is a place to go and spend hours at because everyone is friendly, artistic and from all kinds of backgrounds. Great for STUDYING also, if you enjoy somewhat busy and loud places to study...I know I do

beuLCDO6Z89foa7_bBu1Mw.text: Love this place morning and night!  They have some of the most delicious pastries and breakfast, not to mention their lattes! I love to get a honey latte early in the morning.   Went here the other night for the first time to check out their cocktails and it was a little strange at first to order cocktails without a menu but the staff there ask you what types of drinks you like and then just make something for you. I had two cocktails, one called the grapefruit (the had absolutely no grapefruit in it.. but tasted just like it!) the second cocktail was a mixed berry mojito, both were very tasty. The jalapeno mac was outstanding as well. Can't wait to go back.

_Hr9VyD9XnDQ9B6bFGOaVA.text: Good coffee and good atmosphere.  Ironically pretentious clientele.

VWqcph_MDK-YgVv7CmWrqg.text: Every time I visit this place it's always busy! But it's still really chill, not loud typically- maybe on the weekends; they do have a couple rooms, just in case you want to have more privacy. They also have a coffee bar, a full bar and a kitchen that does a wonderful Risotto! The vibe here is always chill as well, from the patrons to the staff. And it's nice to know that even if you are coming in late (as long as it's before 12) you can still get quality food, and they are happy to bring it to you! Always a favourite, thanks guys!

BVWftgw_p7IVxKDzPQVzGw.text: Little did I know, they have an area around the corner, past the bathrooms that is much more calm!! I am now a fan :)

iP4_dFdRt0UUDemr2BVuDg.text: The Dump .... Awesome  service today.. thx Robert Baranel we were in and out in 20 minutes..got what we were looking for..will continue to shop here in the future..

lcyv2BDrI3_W4GWVPQtC2g.text: Great coffee, great atmosphere and really good food / baked goods.

aaxmzPUsDQrqM3Kkg9qaow.text: wanted to try this place after reading a long article in the AZ republic about the place.  My only initial concern was is this going to be an authentic place or some hipster wanna be establishment. In the article the owner wanted to expand (money) but talked about knowing all his customers in an intimate way. Kinda had me worried. dont really like talking to people unless they are authentic about it.  The place looks great, real industrial feel. lots of room and different decor which is probably by design. Variety of people too from tree huggers, businessman, moms with tots and a gay crowd. Pretty cool.   Good coffee, very average scone. Great service. enjoyed hanging out for a couple of hours. Even saw the owner and he didnt approach anyone. He's hard not to notice. He's got the cool guy glasses and hipster pants on. Must have read some serious shakespeare that day.  looking forward to checking out the drinks and food at night.

OKjKNu0NGlo9exBTYtzy4g.text: Think i would have liked this place better if i didn't go during it's busy hours....8 in the morning!    Parking is a dive, had to park infront of the pawn shop--wishing the owner wouldnt come out and smash up my car!!    But overall, the coffee(iced) was amazingly good and stronge!  Which i love, makes for an interesting work day that's for sure....  Will go back, but during slower hours.

57oaQ08ZNhlhScx2bdY7nQ.text: Great iced coffee, I liked the setup a lot, but it was very crowded and it didn't flow well.  I would really like to go back and try the weekend breakfast, everyone's food looked great. The customer service was a little akward and less helpful than I like, but they were not rude or anything.

13z-KXzOVOhrWeKt07xmuw.text: Just visited Lux on Saturday night. I was a bit apprehensive to try it based on  its 'hipsters-only' reputation, but I was pleasantly surprised once I entered. Yes, there was a couple of clusters of iMac-bearing-no-eye-contact-having folks but once I made my way to the bar, the crowd got more social. Young and old, everyone seemed to be enjoying their artfully crafted beverages and eclectic atmosphere. The music was good, the food was delicious, and in addition to all their fancy, herbal-infused mixed drinks, they house a wide variety of craft beers. Overall a great experience. Looking forward to trying out their coffee & breakfast next time.

99Rd3R4RIYMrM4eQ_lmQvQ.text: I got the fennel and gruyere scone and an iced nonfat latte. The latte was so smooth and flavorful! The fennel and gruyere scone was such a treat too! The layout of the place is really confusing though, and it took me a little while to figure out where the menu was (clipped to the glass by the pastries), but I think the scone and drink were both very good and I would come back.

IkQ5QiReNtcx6aD9LaREAA.text: best lattes ever!! the food is all fresh and always really good! great place to knock out some homework or chat with a friend

jhXPXpO54zxPL8kkFWDrWw.text: This place is the perfect meeting spot to catch up with friends,  and relax on a Sunday morning. The lattes are delicious, the Sunday dj plays right into the chill vibe, and there is always a spot to sit and chat. I look forward to my visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunday morning at Lux.

Zm_ZBTQY6fmnIxYNMSRTow.text: When I first walk into Luxe I think New York underground.   Its kind of dark and they're are a lot of people studying. The layout of the store is kind of confusing but over all its a "hip" place. Their espresso drinks are solid but their CHAI??!?!?!? its not sweet.... just warning you....   I wish I could have gotten something to eat because they had a whole bakery in there. Its probably a college students dream.   Overall I'd say : Solid... I'd be a regular. (and I didn't give it a four since I didn't try the food but it may have changed my rating.)

FyPShfaO1gHrLuLHCx3EVg.text: Really good pastries and drinks, but I'm really confused about the service ??? Both google and yelp say that the place closes at 2 AM, but I was kicked out around 12:15 AM. The staff were all cleaning and one guy started playing the song Closing Time over the speakers and turned the volume up until it was so loud my ears would've hurt if I had stayed in there any longer. The employees didn't even say anything. They just kept doing cleaning and expected everyone to walk out. There were at least 10 other customers inside at the time.

Eutb13ofiMMc8oOGlNkaJw.text: This place is my go to coffee shop whenever I am around Downtown Phoenix. The coffee and food are great, the staff is great, environment is great, music is good, and an overall relaxing place to catch up with a friend.   Whenever I go there, I order a medium mocha latte. Very reasonable price since it comes in a large cup. They also add latte art, sometimes making hearts or a rosetta. Which is a plus for me.  I went here with my girlfriend for our one year anniversary breakfast. I had two eggs scrambled with bacon and hash browns. The bacon was amazing. It was THICK with that crisp and flavorful addition to it. The eggs were seasoned with peppers and salt to perfection. The hash browns had the right amount of fluff and crunch. My girlfriend had the egg sandwich bacon tomato cheddar and egg. She enjoyed it. It was a tiny bit messy because of the egg, however satisfying overall.   Sometimes it can be crowded, with people on their laptops studying or relaxing. They have a large projection screen in the back that usually has a football game and extra table seating nearby.   Overall, I recommend visiting Lux and enjoying their selection of coffees and teas. They also serve some alcoholic beverages at the bar, if you prefer that kind of drink. They have multiple snacks, like muffins and cookies you can munch on as well. My experience is always great when I come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg Sandwich Bacon Tomato Cheddar and Egg,  Two eggs (Scrambled), Bacon and Hash. Two Mocha Lattes

wQfmFJQrm_3jnLh3uIk9WQ.text: Lux is the best!!  I have found that I will go out of my way to drive to Lux as it is consistent and dependable.  Great ambience in this place.  I love relaxing on the couches and enjoying perfect expresso drinks with friends.  Lux is definitely my go to coffee spot in Phoenix!

J7BE3Nph9qePZAJHywUR_g.text: Words cannot describe my love for this eclectic place in a cup! This gem will give you better vibes in life just with their coffee! Their bloody Mary's are Devine!! Especially the bear claw crystal glasses add a magical, royal touch! And the Dutch pancakes are to die for!! You will not be disappointed. Lux is the heart beat of down town and worth the drive every single time!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BqxeBImAoe-zFzjRDcOs9Q.text: This is my go-to spot when I want a perfectly made latte. Even though it's kind of getting hectic and crazy....I still love to come here. The atmosphere is relaxing in its own way.   I visit lux very often to get studying done. My favorite spot is the dark room beside where they have the projector. Although, there are times when people come in and talk, but most of the time, I can get a good handful of studying done.   Their bar is amazing. You can simply just go up to the counter and ask them to surprise you. They take great pride of their art in alcohol lol.   Overall, would definitely recommend this to anyone.

QSB7QXGvNicbT2GiTl--UQ.text: Food here never disappoints. The baked goods here are so good, and despite how busy it is, the employees are always very cordial. We try to avoid coming here on weekends as it's packed, though we do get lucky with seating and parking.  One criticism I have of the place is that the layout is pretty chaotic. Sometimes you're literally stepping over other people's babies in their baby carrier trying to avoid them, or bumping into people holding plates and hot drinks. That, and despite being crowded, people just linger and sit around for long periods of time.   But for the most part, I love the food, drinks and ambiance. And I love that it's a more youthful crowd. So despite a few things that are a bit annoying, we keep coming back.

PISmwc54Sx8d2QXe_5F7Sg.text: What I like about Lux is the open inviting space for people to co-work while enjoying a brew of the alcoholic or the coffee variety, order some tantalizing grub.  Great place to get some work done, and bump into some friendly like minded individuals.    The reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because the coffee that I got on my second round was not the best and there is no cover on the patio.    Today it rained all day and as rare as that is, I feel a covered patio is even more coveted in the hot summer months.  I believe a coffee shop should have a covered patio.  As a coffee bar, I wish the coffee was better, not saying it is bad, just not the best.    Overall, liked Lux and will definitely work here again as I just relocated to the Downtown Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate cake with espresso icing
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mocha cappuccino

MSskU0DJElt-9JEYiNj-ew.text: Delicious coffee and food in a friendly warm environment. Our favorite is the Dutch pancake (savory) and the lattes are great.   Gets busy at times but only because the place is so good!

UCjkkSFaItTXtK2PacUvtA.text: This is such a cute and hipster coffee spot in Phoenix! I love that it's open very late and also offers food and drinks (alcohol included).   I think the only thing that is a little harder is that it is somewhat difficult to find because the entrance is on the back side, not facing the street, and it looks like you're going nowhere because the street side looks closed, and also looks like you're going into the restaurant next door.  Once inside though, it's cute, but a little dungeon-ish. Not too much natural light in this concrete cave of a building. Their americano is pretty bomb, I haven't had any of the lattes but people seem to like their tea based drinks here.   They also sell roasted beans, and the staff is very knowledgable of all of their products. Recommended!

FApFxpnF-zVrqPrJ4uYlZA.text: Nice atmosphere, and a good variety of coffee-house food and drinks, the only real problem is they are so often so busy, so there is usually a line and not necessarily a place to sit. Definitely skews younger.

-wagFf6GKt4nG2JnwuyobA.text: Always a great place to go and do either your homework or whatever studying so you're doing. It's a great atmosphere of all kinds of people on this Earth. The different coffees and pastries are very delicious. The staff is wonderful.

xBEc0BLIE_atMwajWZBZGA.text: This is a fantastic local spot! I love the coffee/wine bar combo concept. I guess that's a thing in Phoenix. I had an almond milk chai and spinach, tomato, garlic, cheese quiche. Quite delish. The service is a bit slow, but masterpieces take time lol.   Apparently every ASU student comes here to study so there's a buzzzzzzz of youthful energy and learning in the room. Each room has a different vibe and feel, pus you could sit outside if you wanted to since the weather is BOSS this time of year. Awesome spot to chill, study, chat, eat, drink, people watch....whatever!

At5JgfVJpQbNsSA_ZWp2xg.text: Great place to hang out with friends or even study. I didn't try any of their foods, but it definitely smelled delicious! It was a little somewhat pricey though, and when I had gone (noonish on Friday) it was very packed and hard to find a seat. But honestly it's worth it. There's a great environment about this place. Would definitely recommend!

Cw6vs29GCMmVPgbM6BUK8A.text: Came here around 1pm on a Monday and my friend and I couldn't even find parking! Good sign, but annoying too haha Nice vibe inside, but I was a little confused on who's exactly an employee cause it seemed like there was no set uniform. Anyways, pretty good coffee in Phoenix... Thanks Lux!

FUbaQv3VGig5k3lUCXjN2Q.text: Have never had any issues here. Nice little spot to bring the lady. Parking can be a bit of a challenge some nights.

rn5pFSpAPgKQl3_YtlE23w.text: Absolutely love"D" this place  Unfortunately, the last time I was there with my father I was very disappointed. My father has been coming here for a few years here and there. I, myself, had been there almost twice a week since I moved to the downtown area in January. My father and I had been there twice previously together and had a wonderful time, although this time was different. My father is a deputy sheriff in a different county and was in town briefly for a class he was taking to become a better peace officer, he just happened to come straight from class and had his county polo on as well as his firearm holstered. The whole cafe, including the staff gave dirty looks and multiple rude comments were made, one, as we were leaving being "Oh, is she under arrest." Completely opposite from the other million times I had been previously, Not one person greeted us positively or flashed a smile back. I have never before in my life felt so sad and disrespected AND I WAS NOT THE ONE WHO SHOULD HAVE EVEN FELT SO. My father never once said anything or engaged. Sad to say I will not be going back to this establishment

WoPz3ShJw_2mnwiWBIrzpg.text: A cool and unique tea/coffee bar with a nice relaxing vibe and great decor. Service is great, teas are good and food options looked nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tea time..

oVLXxit_rkAMCm6fgey5sQ.text: I love going here. I really, really do, just to have that said off the bat. But there are some important things to understand about Lux.  1) Seating is always limited. Not even on a Tuesday night in July will this place be quiet and empty. Own that fact, love it, and keep looking.  2) The cocktails are phenomenal. There's no list of specialty cocktails. They go by requests for what you like, and make something that percolates in their brains all quick like. They also use beautiful glassware, which is really nice when you think about how rare that is.  3) It's actually kind of unfortunate that the cocktails eclipse the food. Lux is probably some of the best food you can get at its price point. If you think $19 for a steak is too much, just order it and keep in mind you'd pay $25 for cooking on that order at any other establishment. The same goes for literally everything else their fabulous cooks prepare. You can't go wrong with the soup, and I assure you the mac & cheese is a full meal.  4) They actually have newspapers! Real ones that you hold with your hands for the patrons to enjoy and leave behind! That basically makes Lux one of the most active town halls in the city of Phoenix.  5) They play full albums of good music, and not just rando indie bands people brag about having heard of. This is a place that appreciates Beyonce as much as all those weird bands whose names you can't remember.  There are a lot of things I don't understand about Lux. I don't get why people take selfies with their lattes. I don't understand why they have a DJ, but I'm glad he has a regular gig. I don't understand  why there are non-functional typewriters strewn about the place. But you know what? I keep coming back. We all keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fancy bar with custom cocktails and beautiful cut glass. The hot toddy is the best night cap in Phoenix!

q4zt3ponUXtzjfoIPfjhyw.text: By far the best cup of coffee I've had in the Phoenix area! Way to go guys, and there is a really neat atmosphere at this place, but Pane Bianco is right next door.

rdJ4Z0uGCzPNiMvs_sQvrg.text: Well thought-through details make Lux amazeballs.   The espresso is good. Really good. Like, I need to order an espresso along with whatever else I'm ordering just because it is so delicious.   The food is beautifully presented (little light on the gluten free snacks, but there's fruit, so no one is starving).   There's plugs all over.  The furniture is mostly easy to wipe down.  The bathroom door has written out instructions so no one is confused on when the door is locked. It also has nice smelling soap.   The patio is really pretty.  The clientele seems ridiculously cool. I kind of feel like maybe I'm going to be cooler by association if I hang out here. I'M GIVING IT A GO. Let me know how I'm doing.

9fsZq7kpXRPVsg8ScD78bg.text: I really enjoyed this place when it was a smaller coffee shop.  Now it has grown too crowded and the lines are too long.  I primarily drink black coffee, so imagine my surprise when after waiting in line for awhile they put my cup in line after all the other specialty drinks.  Just too much time for a quick cup of coffee.

n6_HuVcgyh2dhjYG-wJ-4A.text: Fabulous food!! I too am not a coffee drinker,  and I come for the real food. They serve fresh, tasty, imaginative salads, and wonderful soups. I've recently been here twice and had the spaghetti squash entree cooked in two different ways, both incredibly delicious. I dined with someone who ordered a fantastic steak, really tasty. They have a large selection of wonderful pastries.  They actually provide service after one has transacted their purchase at the counter. We felt like there was wait staff, and because tips have already been placed in the jar or added to a credit/debit card, these people aren't  just hoping for a bigger tip.  The ambiance is pretty close to perfection. Patrons working at a table make room for others, background music is nice, not annoying, the dinnerware is beautiful. (I just dined off of a plate from Anthropologie.) Close to museums, near the light rail ... My favorite place for any meal or beverage in Phoenix.

75Q_x92spxLdeWxxwX7rCw.text: This is my first ever Yelp Review. I came to the Lux to drink some coffee and get some work done. the coffee was great, treats were delicious, and there was plenty of sitting space for working on a computer. There were many people getting work done and everything was going well until they suddenly decided to put on some loud rock music and you could see the people one by one closing their computers and leaving.  I'm still here and the music is driving me crazy. the ambiance was perfect until they switched the music and turned it way up.

Y0scaJdSQeS1zwBVhZWB7g.text: Recent order from Newegg.com. Power supply missing one of the power cables and also supposed to have a $20 rebate. No info on rebate was included in the order. Trying to contact them regarding this is a joke. They simply do not respond. Buy from them at your own risk. I won't be dealing with them ever again.
