EX35W0LI0xxkmqunjvRJAg.text: Lux has become too overly crowded and their music is too loud that I can't even hear myself think.  Half the time I feel like I have walked into a  music concert .  Oh! wait it's a coffee bar?!  And I had to squuueeeze myself to the back hallway to get to the bathroom.

fMRLLSYD-rbKwCufxybNNA.text: Great coffee and food. Open late, which is great for those late work/study nights. Very hip and busy place, so finding a spot to park and sit can be difficult. If you need a quiet corner to work, this is not the place for you.

WSjig6ni607bmUqtxlOhAA.text: WOW, READ THIS. Been going to lux for a long time now, I spend around $200 a month on food and beverages at this place. I also always recommended this place with my entire network who also consistently started going as well. Unfortunately, today when I asked to get an ice tea refill (which is free and I have got one before from other employee) one of the employees shouted and asked if I have the receipt and disrespect me in front of all the people in line. I usually don't get hurt from things like this but this time it seemed like she had some kind of HATE towards me. She later pulled me aside and mentioned that some of her coworkers said some more things about me whichs why she was heated. She made up some rules who are written nowhere and were never mentioned to me about "ice tea refill", she apologized and offered me a free drink which I refused to, u don't buy me with a free drink after you made me look like an homless. I should also mention that I have an accent and many time when I go to order some of the employees there behave in a very RACIST way towards me and laugh at me. It's a shame that she treated me like I'm inferior to her, I left the store and will probably never go back.

vy04uHPiauL8_dv3fGJvQw.text: You can smell the roasting coffee as you approach.  It's a bit of a run down looking place, but once you get inside, you're in hacker heaven.  Macbooks everywhere.  And good coffee.  Lizbeth Salander would love this place.    So come out, get a break from the desert, have a cupcake, don't look at the prices, and enjoy the free wifi.

CCgGTfUSQW_orXPjsulIlQ.text: Food is amazing. Desserts are great. Coffee and drinks are as good as it gets. The only down fall to this place is the seating and the A/C. It is always packed and tough to find a seat. With all the people in a small area, the inside is usually pretty warm and not comfortable.

ao-Aykr9Z2TqKpXYY3g4EQ.text: Lux is a great place to meet a friend for coffee. Super hip and fun vibes. It can get very busy on the weekends so I would recommend a weekday visit. Pastries and drinks are all delicious. I haven't tried their other food offerings but those look great as well. Baristas and staff are pretty friendly for the most part. This is definitely one of the best coffee shops in Central Phoenix.

0Pa4BQldcSWOoApb-5tx2Q.text: If you are looking for a unique cafe with a touch of a trendy look along with incredible cappuccinos and deserts then you have found your place! It does get pretty busy after 5, so get ready to wait in line.

jF9QU2Tj1_Fjx80mCE2GUw.text: READ EVERY PAGE OF YOUR LEASE AGREEMENT THOROUGHLY. DON'T RELY ON ANYTHING YOU ARE TOLD OR YOU WILL LEARN THE HARD WAY THAT NOTHING AT VASEO IS AS GOOD AS THEY CLAIM AND THEY ONLY ACKNOWLEDGE WHAT IS IN WRITING!   I moved my family to Vaseo after taking the nice tour with a very friendly woman who told us about all kinds of amenities and activities that Vaseo had to offer. In our move,it was most important to us that we find a place with 24 hour pool and gym access because we work odd hours and we were also looking for a place that had a pool that was heated in the winter so we could exercise all year round as we had both of those things at our last apartment and they were on our had to have list. We were told that there were 4 pools at Vaseo and that one of the pools was heated year round so we were sold. Then, we tried to swim in the pool in October, it was bone numbing cold, my skin turned beat red, and my body movements slowed. I called to ask about the heat in the pool and they originally told me that they don't start to heat the heated pool until November. Went back in November and there was no change in temp and then I was told they only heat their pool to 70 degrees (actually about 60-65), which in no way can be considered a "heated pool" because a heated pool standard temp is 85 degrees None of the employees know where the temperature switch is and they have no thermometers in any of the pools. I don't think the heated pool even has a heater.They have several hot tubs at Vaseo but they only heat them to around 80 degrees when the standard hot tub temperature is usually 100-102 degrees, so there's usually a ton of unsupervised kids jumping in and out of the hot tubs because the hot tub is more like a warm bath. Oh ya, as it turns out, the pools all close at 10pm instead of being available 24 hours as we were told, and this is the only thing the security squad seems to enforce like Martial Law.Very disappointing since all the things we moved here for were promised and never delivered. One good thing about Vaseo is the Happy Hour that they host about 8 times a year and welcome everyone to come and eat and drink and meet their neighbors. Its usually free and its a pretty cool thing to do. It doesn't quite make up for all the problems they create and the poor management of the complex, but it is something.

p9XeSoLCkT2WWM2J7-H3RQ.text: ONEDOGFASHIONS selling on Etsy is a wonderful place to purchase tee-shirts and sweatshirts.  Andrea has 1000's of designs, many that are her original designs that she will add embrodery to and personalize the way you want it.  I have purchsed both tee-shirts and sweatshirts and the designs are beautiful.  She takes great pride in her work and she is quick! Her prices are excellent for the beautiful work she does.

wR-YpiUvPTdE5KBFK-tBAg.text: It's a nice place to relax and chit chat with friends, or just come to enjoy a nice cup of coffee and a good book. I will definitely come back and try their latte :)

Fzao-M8rVUzAUnZvIf37Mw.text: Amazing coffee and awesome baked pastries.  But it did not start off that way they really messed up my order and I never got my food but management took care of me and provided me with a gift card that I never asked for but appreciated it. Staff was professional and friendly it had a real nice cozy comfy feeling the art on the wall, the large flat screen with plenty of seating space and even a private spot for the Internet junkies. I highly recommend this spot daily at least I will be back.

HYXfJ-E3pY3y6zS9J6UsvA.text: I love this place! I either get the latte macchiato or an Italian soda.  Both are great.  One of the best coffees in town.

xKY1JbaFOwqHxB3XQ3PZsw.text: Lux is a great hipster style coffee shop. I used to be very in love with is and it seems like everyone else is too considering how busy it has became. The coffee is great, the food is AMAZING, so why only 3 stars? The crowd is much too over whelming. I used to love this place to do homework and get my things done however, now it is nearly impossible to concentrate. If you are looking for a place to hang out, yea its still a good place. If I can suggest one thing to the owner, it would be to open a new location. They have obviously done an amazing job with Lux.

OVAE4jClyaema9Z9E5yl6g.text: I. LOVE. LUX.  They play the best music (The XX tonight). Their coffee and tea is always the best (my personal favorites are quattro con panne and the "velvet"). Their baked goods are so genuinely great. And now the new food and atmosphere are simply making me want to live and die here.  I wish it were closer to me since I live in Tempe, but I'll gladly make the Lightrail trek at least once a week for my fix.

Y4Mj8zezr1viScOG0DqICQ.text: The Good *Great coffee *Awesome cocktails  *Tasty pastries  *Fun staff *Good atmosphere  *Free WiFi  The Bad *Can get overly crowded from time to time  The Bottom Line Lux is fantastic coffee shop / cocktail bar that offers great food and drink.   Review The owners of Lux seem to have found the perfect balance between local relaxed coffee shop and fun vibrant cocktail bar. Due to this duality Lux always seems to be a busy place, allowing guests to work on their laptops or chat with thief friends. Durning the morning they offer locally baked goods and a small breakfast/brunch menu. Their coffee is well brewed, roasted on site, and seems to be the coffee of choice for many restaurants in the Central Corridor area. In the evening the bar area comes to life and offers a wide variety of delicious cocktails served in original old school glassware. In addition to the cocktails the bar also offers an interesting selection of craft beers by the bottle or can.

yl8RFvTNgNxW3sC_-3QFXA.text: This place has amazing lattes and a warm, eccentric atmosphere. Great to meet up and chat with friends or a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vanilla lattes are delicious!

NTuXrUHjT3MIoUlTomCWzQ.text: Great cocktails, Great coffees, food is delicious! Love this place! The scones are to die for!!

o3CSakFfe9BlCnQb1pMuZA.text: I went to Lux for brunch with some friends and the food was pretty good. First off, the line was REALLY long, which is both good and bad. Bad, for obvious reasons, but good because it tells you that they are popular, which would usually hint at the quality of the food you will eventually consume.   Second, they are kind enough to get drink orders while you wait in line so that you can start having your coffee, tea, juice, or whatnot, while you wait for your food. Third, the decor of Lux was cool enough to distract me while my friends and I waited for our breakfast to be prepared. Lots of retro-looking lamps on the tables combined with art from local artists made for a warm and welcoming atmosphere.   When our food did arrive, we were all satisfied! I got the Aunt Gladys's homemade salsa over four strips of tender belly bacon, three scrambled eggs, white cheddar, and hash, which was pretty delicious. My two friends also really enjoyed their meals. I'm giving them 4 stars because I did think that their food was a bit over-priced for what you got, both in portion size and quality. I mean, it was $5 for a glass of orange juice... Other than that, I was very satisfied with the experience.

xIyjxab3av3iQ7ivrSVd9A.text: What a great family-owned concept! This is my first time dining here and I'm very impressed. From the pride that shows in the service and the great food and coffee, I will be recommending this restaurant to friends and family.   The staff was so friendly and very helpful with me. If it's your first time, it can seem confusing but they quickly noticed I was a newbie and walked me through.   The atmosphere is one that meets the needs of many; business meetings, school work, social fun, etc. They've done a fine job making this a unique experience making me look forward to my next visit..of which will be really soon.   The menu looks incredible too. I started with a caramel latte which exceeded my expectations. So I couldn't help but order an odd combination of food; bacon and jalapeno mac and cheese, quiche, peanut butter cookies and corn bread/berries muffin....I had company. All of them were fantastic.  The mac & cheese is amazing!   I'll be back for sure!

Rapz5oV3KYb8MSfKoCjmEw.text: Oh Lux, my biggest enemy. Every time I go I cannot help but get 1 or 2 of their delicious pastries. How can one place be so delicious?!? Oh man and there Jalepeno Bacon Mac n Cheese is insanely good! One of the best places in Phoenix in my opinion

BFcgDLOSZgIdM_YDTkHSpA.text: Lux is very cool from top to bottom. From the ceiling to the floor and everything in between. I even feel cooler just being there.  I've been about five times now and can't wait to take my wife. She's already cool but I digress.... It's creative vibe is unmatched anywhere else. I love to hang, do my design work on my laptop which is sitting 6 inches away from a typewriter (a clever little table center piece). I could go on and on about the superb food and coffee but I'll just touch on one tiny little detail that sets Lux apart. They give you a tiny little spoon with your cafe latte. Love it!

Ry_OpAMGC2_Mrp2vdPUHfQ.text: Really cool shop with pretty good coffee and hit and miss service. Some people are super friendly, others aren't. Overall a great place to hang out.  Worst part: some pretentious hipster baristas and broistas who seem intimidated by people who have achieved a higher level of hipsterdom than them. Best part: open late.

JnABevsb2AYlvL4XIdzWNQ.text: Lux is the grande dame of Phoenix coffee houses with wonderful coffee drinks, a nice bar, and a full dinner menu. Dinning there can sometimes be a challenge as the tables occasionally double as the embassy of Laptopistan but the food is first rate. Well worth a visit.

oQREgm-iGDcc5uN8Fmg0hg.text: They have really good coffee and whenever I'm not being too lazy, I make it here for breakfast- so good! I've never had anything I didn't like. The vibe is a little hipster but it's unique and has its own personality. I also really like the different stickers that they draw and change pretty regularly! I have a cool drawn yoda sticker from one time that was stuck on my pastry bag!

X9O0X6aGfAoO-HRWb5YIIg.text: LOVE this place. Great coffee and pretty pastries as well. Love the environment and decor. It is great for just hanging out or getting some group work done. I love that they have a room where its noisy, a room with a TV and a quiet study room. In addition, there is a little outside seating area. Not a big fan because you are just looking at the parking lot, but it is Phoenix, so I didn't expect much. Usually I can't study when there is a lot of noise, but for some reason I was able to get a lot of work done there. AND there is a lot of outlets and FREE fast WIFI.

aotX-uKWKdaqJtmqr4e_Fg.text: Food - 5-star Vibe - 6-star Drinks - 5 star Concept - 10 star Typewriters as decor - 10 stars  The wait in line and fighting to find a seat to eat blows and Lux, you can do better.  Fellow Yelppers there is a line for a reason....it's mostly because the food is awesome but it's also because the set up is probably the most inefficient set up you could have.  This is a popular joint and if you have all the time in the world by all means....give Lux a shot.  However, if you only have 1.5 hours to kill for breakfast head here.  Lux, do your fans a favor and give us table service.  Don't make us wait in a 20 min line for a coffee refill.  I did not mind the wait on day 1 because you were new to me and your space is interesting. However, after 5 solid days of coming back for your crack I began to resent how much time I was wasting on my vacation.  I also had plenty of time to think of ways you could do crowd management differently.    I loved your DJ.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

R8bBzLfZIpLD5Tov4eG6JA.text: Please get some new furniture and new bath remodel. It's looking a bit neglected and soiled. Food still good but I don't go there much anymore because of the above comment.

NX5ZYwod-WDwklgrQWgp3A.text: This place was not a favorite of mine.  I was hoping this was going to be a great coffee joint.  It looked promising.   There was a line, a long line,  which shows that Phoenix is desperate for a place like this.  They had a good selection of baked goods (quiche and pastries).  They have other items to order, but, according to the person taking our order, the menu changes and they did have one to look at.  She had to tell us what else there was to order.  This takes time and holds up the already long line.  If I was just stopping in and did not know to ask, I would not have ordered anything.  I ordered a mocha, the quiche and a scone.  They offered to heat up my quiche... mistake and I will get to that.   The place to pay, pick up and fix up your coffee were in the same 5 or 6 foot square and with a line this long it got crowded quickly.  The other thing was that if you were not paying close attention you could miss you order.  They put the order out and call your name and that was it.  You then had to look over several drinks that look the same trying to sort out which is yours.   My coffee came out quickly.  Then my scone a few minutes later... not sure why it took so long to get a baked good from a plate to the counter.  My quiche was warming and took much too long. I was with my wife's cousin and his made to order breakfast came out just as quick as my scone and the quiche was almost 10 minutes later, it was only luke warm.  The scone (lemon poppy seed) was a little bland.  The quiche was... well see above and was only so-so.  The coffee was fine, but nothing special.  They want you to bus your dishes, but don't label the place to put the dishes.   They had a DJ for on a Friday morning was a bit much.  The music was also too loud for a morning coffee joint.  I should not have to tell a DJ to turn the music down at a coffee joint in the morning.  This was a place where people were working, reading and socializing... it is not a night club, even if it was jazz.  Another thing about the line... I actually saw several small groups leave after waiting too long.  The people who started Lux saw potential, but I don't think they know how to run a coffee shop.  Unfortunately this is the only True game in town and people are going to put up with this until someone opens the competition.

v923KHUna_gbbF2cBvtC7g.text: Excellent.  A fun hipster cafe.  Full bar.  Full menu.  Delicious food.  Awesome environment and they're open long hours.  They have wifi and some very eclectic seating arrangements.   Truly you can't go wrong going here. It's always fun and alway a treat.

VstANmqsWv4Grs66b-5buQ.text: Lux,   After our squad stopping in before work, for breakfast number 4 billion and 5, you're amazing treats are still as tasty as ever...   We miss Alexa! And love you! Now bring us americanos! Kisses!   Loving from Postino Central Squad

hhoycs1UQl_Sary8BfKM_A.text: Love this place! Roast their own coffee and the sweets are all homemade! Cool couches and little nooks you can get on your laptops and do your business. Fri & Sat nights can grab a few cocktails and mingle a little before hitting the town!!!

moTda0rIUYzgeBLXYjEExw.text: AMAZING. late night menu is incredible, bf got a NY strip that was cooked and seasoned to perfection along with veggies and potatoes that I could eat my whole life.   I got a perfectly dressed salad with chicken that had been seasoned with some delicious spices, cauliflower that I could eat every day, spinach, arugula and nuts. Never have I ever liked a salad more than steak, but Lux managed to convert me!   Staff was so friendly even tho we ordered food so late and the bartender gave me a drink that I didn't even know I wanted and now it's my favorite beer.   Please go, but not all at once bc it's almost a secret I want to keep to myself!!

DGFlJmetEhUgDy8RupV49w.text: This is THE place to go for a quality coffee drink and experience from the serious devotion to roasting their own beans to the unique vibe that almost seems effortless. Someone may happen in and have an almond milk latte, enjoy the leaf poured into the foam and maybe even let out a little hum of approval on the first sip. What they, and many others might miss is the subtle attention to what's important. Jeff, the owner, doesn't miss an opportunity to utilize premium products from the pastries to the furniture.   His kitchen staff works to provide sublime breakfast dishes, decadent pastries and savory dinner plates. Even with the constant line out the door they will do their best to remember your name and drink of choice.   I have been going here for years and with that experience can vouch for the most important achievement for any service based establishment. Consistency. Lux understands and executes the task of providing a premium experience and never lowering the bar. I give them 5 stars simply because that is all the stars I am allowed.

RfCQ_zwh3CzN3A5qqJ6MUg.text: People! Stay away from this place so I can get a seat here.  There is simply NO reason for all of you to enjoy the atmosphere of this totally hip and cool place. And, if you go somewhere else, I won't have to worry about bumping anyone in the back or head as I make my way around to get coffee, find a magazine, power outlet or simply leave for the night.    Oh, and despite the excellence of the food - there's a Carls JR down the road. Save yourselves the wait and just go there.  Ya. So there's room for the rest of us.  Trust me, it is almost as entertaining to watch the short-order cooks of McDonald's chaotic endeavor to make your burger vs. the smooth staff here cook from scratch in their front-of-room kitchen.  With the bowls of fresh, organic vegetables. And happy dispositions.  Yep. the experience here is completely overrated.  The fact there are fun mis-matched chairs and unique tables can be sat in at any thrift store, just bring your own Circle-K coffee and you're almost close to an attempt to recreate the Lux experience.  So...go there instead.   And the bar? Well, despite it being awesomely stocked and super cool, you can get almost, if you pretend hard enough, the same experience in your local dive bar.  You know, the one that stinks and provides the singular experience of having your shoes stick to their floors.  You certainly will not experience that at Lux, and that would simply be a shame.  Robbery of a unique cultural experience. Similar to getting stuck in an over-the-border brothel.  And if you are a creative, or a thinker, or are otherwise of any intellectual capacity, you will find LUX a redundancy of conversational inspiration.  It will provide zero challenge for you to gaze upon. There is simply an overload of sensory happiness at Lux. It could quite certainly and seriously be dangerous to your health if you have a pacemaker or are otherwise easily over stimulated by goodness.    ...in all honesty, this venue is the perfect place to go and be alone with tons of happy people all around you.  Get there early and camp out for parking and seating. It's worth it.  Thank you, Lux staff. You guys rock.

UJESumopMCHbGFPVeKTskw.text: I'm 90% sure that the sign outside Lux is small enough to be nearly illegible because they want to keep it exclusively patronized by those "in the know." Now that I am among those people, I have to say that I kind of like that exclusivity. As far as the coffee, I got my old stand-by, iced coffee, and found it to have a certain something to it that I couldn't pinpoint but thoroughly enjoyed.  I also enjoyed the brightly colored BENDY STRAWS they offer. It's the little things in life.

D9vyry3LsS4iosn0K0VJJw.text: Lux is my favorite, everything here is fantastic. All the barista's know your drink and have a welcome smile to see you. Pastries are made on site, ample in selection and are delicious. If you think you're too chubby for cake there's usually fresh fruit hanging around and yogurt in the mornings. Free wi-fi and free people watching are a bonus to this dimly lit and cozy atmosphere.

dHjirBfkvnn4jIsWhTSimQ.text: I didn't care for the atmosphere of this place, they are trying way too hard to be hip, but I must say it was some of the best espresso I've had. By far the best part about this place is its proximity to Pane Bianco (a great place for lunch right next door). If you wake up every morning and say hey "I'm fucking chic!" then this is your kinda place....other wise go get a great sandwich next door, grab a latte, and get the hell out.

-RACjW7c2gZNNIO9e0ZJPw.text: I don't drink coffee but my husband said it was great.  I had a breakfast sandwich that was pretty good and my husband had a blueberry muffin.  I like the idea behind the seating and cafe but it was easy to feel like an outsider.  I would like to go back again and try some of their other baked goods that looked delicious.

mPM3eNDFeonlpfepT4Pk6Q.text: I wanted to add how great the pies and quiches are to get when you order in advance.  Always made deliciously and makes all the guests happy.  its a must for holidays or special occasions.

xsufnheOkinZGAgeAWgz2Q.text: Great everything! Love the pasrtries, the coffee, the people, great, just great!

Ly6Wm7bdP3vG-_5WSSv4IA.text: Cool place - "strange tasting" expresso - good coffee,  however the barista, (midafternoon on Nov.23, 2012) after knocking out the grounds from the previous order, cleaned out the residual in the wand with his finger, (not rinsing it out) refilled ground expresso and once again leveled the new espresso in the wand  with his finger.  Not sure that the food inspector would approve of this method of fingering!

rxm1EKdkjTaFEmKFHDo1-Q.text: I just had the best mocha in my life! Great location off the light rail near Campbell. Unfortunately my first visit was during finals week and the place was swamped. I waited 10 min for my mocha and then found that no one knew of my order. But they responded well and quickly brought it right out to where I was sitting.

sA6pAnfq3eUGDZ2bq6wxTg.text: Best coffee in Phoenix!  I love their vanilla lattes and mochas.

J7O5Dd3tFfqMc8JPvCPcQw.text: i like lux- there's something about getting my foam in the shape of a leaf that makes me giggly and feel fancy. i also think it's cool that they have a bar but other than that, i can take it or leave it. there's not enough seating and why am i going to sit ouside all year if i can't smoke? i know that's my issue but there are plenty of other coffee shops in phoenix and tempe that have impressed me with their actual drinks and atmosphere

M2Zrzef0hCNE0r8BOqqowA.text: I had an iced americano and a cookie with jelly on it that was amazing! I liked the crowd and thought the inside looked awesome! I would definitely go back!

Yi9cxqwlEeDp3KjTICD8Zw.text: Upon entering this coffee shop immediately your senses are awakened to the smell of the many varieties of fresh ground coffee, your ear drums dance to the sounds provided by a techno DJ with a mixer linked to his laptop and large LCD display mounted over the coffee bar.  Take a look at the walls and let your eyes be guided by the abstract paintings, continue your scan as you find yourself among a unique culture of coffee drinkers interacting with their Apple human interface device.  After allowing my senses to take it all in I carefully sip the hot, steaming, light brewed coffee, "Black".

sNw0ajHjkfv64s44G7J8tA.text: This is a great place to meet up with friends and just chill out, especially in nicer weather! The staff is always friendly, and the outside patio is awesome to watch people and also check out Central Avenue- which always holds some fun entertainment!

KLgv9zVTZ5B9ppH-JGTnag.text: What a cool little cafe, with a DJ playing early in the morning, delicious berry corn muffins, and good coffee. A little loud for my taste at that hour, but quite a popular little joint, and lots of regulars. Cool artwork on the walls. I was staying nearby for a few days, and for me, this was definitely the best part of this neighborhood.

iG5kaX7ku2ngnIxnQj1-bQ.text: This is my favorite coffee shop.  I drag my friends here almost every weekend and they tell me I'm obsessed. That's fine with me as long as I can have my velvet latte with, wait for it.... LATTE ART!!! As an Arizonan, I have never had a coffee place make me a latte with foam art until this place. Seeing it in movies and on tv has always made me crave it along with the cozy little coffee shops it's featured in. After finding Lux, I've tried a couple other shops that make my beloved designs. Terra Java is a close second, with Cartel being third, but Lux is number one. It has a good mix of people. Old, young, eccentric, run of the mill and yes, hipsters. But not as many as everyone states. It could be bigger and it gets packed. Music is often too loud and the food menu is something you have to hunt down, which I'll never understand. But the coffee is what makes this place. And it's open late which I absolutely love!

4L8Y4A8HVXbZ3IFwR5QERA.text: Great coffee spot!!! But the service during the day is a lot friendlier and reliable then night service.

KcIvQXfnmxmFu5zaBPWFwg.text: okay. wow.   wow!   great house-roasted coffee and fresh assorted treats. lux gets a rarish five star rating from me. if all independents did product and service like lux, starbucks would be out of business (but then again, it would likely lose its charm, but you get the picture).

93FgN5focwT-nudTisLRlg.text: Being from SF I know Blue Bottle, so any place that serves Blue Bottle I have got to try and gets 4 Stars in my book just for serving the coffee.  Being a recent SF transplant to Phx I am starving for a taste of the city.  I will go to Lux as soon as possible and file a review.

jwlWT82JI0Zlk_drpZgbhA.text: i went here for vacation with the boyfriend.  we actually found this coffee shop on here since we were craving some coffee. we came here at night since Arizona in June is HOT HOT HOT!!  the patio had a bunch of picnic style wooden tables n' benches.  they had the misters around the patio to keep us cool.   the drinks? they were pretty good, i asked for a iced white mocha and asked if it was sweet. the guy was pretty nice and had a chill attitude, he suggested to put less chocolate in it to make it less sweet. i got the drink, but regretted getting it the normal way, i think it wasn't sweet enough..but the coffee taste was really good. made with real Ghirardelli chocolate! i had fun relaxing there, i would definitely go back for misters.

4aIG1f4_tbToj7jIUu1KEw.text: This place is great, very different then your usual rush-em-in-get-em-out coffee house. Interesting furniture pieces and art. They gave me a cappacino in a glass highball looking thing. She said, "Have you ever tried our latte?" and after hearing the explanation I opted for a cappa--Still came out in the same glass she mentioned earlier

slgeWNGZ1TIRdAvTgcPJcQ.text: I luv lux!!!!!  + The coffeeeeee The chai The scrambled eggs The hash The lemon water jug The furniture The music The croissants  - Sometimes hard to find seating Need more salt shakers (lol but I am serious)

IRcyI1k9s-7dM0x3ea6lWg.text: I have came here once before, late at night to have some tea and the first time i loved it! Everyone was so nice so i thought i would bring my roommate the next time. Worst idea ever. The girl at the register was so rude. She messed up my order (which i didnt even care about we had all the time) and when i asked her they my chai latte was supposed to be to go she gave me this look and gave me a different coffee that was a small and i had ordered a medium. I really dislike going some where to pay to be treated like crap. Definitely not okay and wont be coming back.

y_W467oIvAWDGR4ZM0qwFw.text: Was kick in it waiting for my sweet. It's HH and coming around to dinner time. As I'm waiting for my date I have a sharing beer. Tripel Karmeliet $15. This is a 94 point, golden beer with a two finger head poured in a clean Unibroue Tulip Glass. Belgian yeast front with a nice intermingling of spicy clove. An earthy, boozy tripel for sure. Superb bargain. yelp.com/biz_photos/OgJ0... Katie is workin her oven at Lux this afternoon. I ask her what is for dinner. She says "do you like meatloaf?" I think to myself of Michael Lee Aday, an American hard rock singer and actor that played the character Bob in Fight Club, a big man in search of a life, at a self-help group and turns up as one of Ed Nortons most trusted lieutenants. And then Katie said "mash potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower. $15." oooya the Katie Meatloaf Recipe sounds savory. yelp.com/biz_photos/OgJ0... We sat at the 4" x 12" x 8' rough sawn pine timber. The coolest table, I believe, I have ever had a meal on. Dinner was enough for the two us, and was a great recipe with lots of flavor. Just like Mama used to make. To finish our meal, Katie cooked an apple bar pastry with cinnamon, ginger, and the surprise ingredient everyone loves, apple-wood bacon. Plus an after dinner luxury gin and tonic. I'm not sure how well known this restaurant is for dinner, but there was a good crowd and we loved our stay.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. meatloaf, mash potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower. $15
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sharing beer. Tripel Karmeliet $15

lSKaQgLV7Md1mwtALox6bA.text: This place is always busy! Especially in mornings. Expensive but in central Phoenix hipster area so that's expected. Service is great and quick.

DHZcRxkngQ2zGJ0oXl1S3A.text: This was one of my favorite cafes when I lived In Phoenix. Definitely lives up to the hype. The location is very suttle and hidden so it is easy to miss which is kinda cool and part of the experience in my opinion. The interior is massive.. they have about 4 or 5 sections of rooms all connected and also a small outdoor area as well. One of the rooms has a giant projector playing movies or sports. There is a bar area as well where they serve up excellent and fresh cocktails.. the coffee is spectacular and they can serve up just about any type of latte/espresso drink and they also happen to cook up some very hearty and high quality food for fair prices (try their mac n cheese and you can't go wrong with all their other food as well). Their baked goods are heavenly as well. Everything is fresh baked and the food is cooked to order. Amazing ambiance, coffee, booze and food.. what more can I say? Give this place a try if you live in Phoenix or are just visiting. Sometimes they'll also have a low key DJ spinning some cool tracks too, but it's never too loud or obnoxious, so it works perfectly!

3i0X3a--7OMwo1l1S38ZBg.text: The coffee is just alright. The baristas are not consistent and pull shots that taste awful some days and decent another day. The food is pretty good but there I typically nowhere to sit and the service is terrible. Any given time, the workers make you feel like you are inconveniencing them. There are two guys there who are very nice, other than that, I've had awful experiences with the lux workers.

OFeOtCZFCnJ44AozWnn2Ug.text: Holy Smokes! This place sets the bar high for what is cool. Any other establishment would be suffering from a major identity crisis if they tried to simultaneously function as a coffee shop, bakery, restaurant, and bar but Lux somehow does it all and does it right! If you are someone who likes working at a table with strangers (as most tables or couches will be full by the time you get there), loud music and the temptation to drink booze rather than coffee, Lux is the place for you!!  I love showing my friends from out of town this place in hopes they will fall in love with Lux, quit their jobs, leave their families and move into Phoenix!  Personally, I am nowheres cool enough to hangout here on a regular basis. The DJ plays his music too loud, I can never find an open table, and I always fall a fool to the temptation of to sipping down the nectar of me people, Templeton Rye. Iowa Represent!! But even with all that up against me, I still stop by at the Lux very so often to remind me how much of a basic b*tch I actually am. LOVE THIS PLACE!

kUVVBo23ziS2hRHOnSNP1w.text: I usually opt for a scone, the bagged trio of peanut butter cookies (or other baked good) and Lindsey's Six Shooter (white mocha with six shots of espresso). Always tastes amazing.  Those peanut butter cookies are my weakness. I'll try to stick to ordering coffee, but their yummy, sweetness usually persuades me to get them too!

9araP_5NZ9eoH_l-dCgKaw.text: What a cool spot for grabbing just a coffee, and although I didn't get food to sit down to eat here, it seems like a great place for that as well (seemed to be very popular with regulars and looked pretty busy for breakfast). I asked for an iced coffee with a little soy milk, but I'm pretty sure I ended up getting an iced soy latte (based on how it tasted and what was written on my cup). I didn't realize this until after I'd gotten back to my car and started driving away, but at least it was one VERY delicious iced soy latte! Yum! I'll definitely need to come back next time I am in town.

OZ3zhZHhRIvcwEfokKLYMg.text: Cool vibe. Urban feel. Delicious drinks. Coffee is always on point. Just a tip to Americano drinkers, they charger their Americanos the same price for whatever size so get the large!   One of my favorite study spots.  Had their jalapeno and bacon mac and cheese the other night. It was served in a massive mug, and it was delicious!

oKqXlFSVu50lup7oy0Pdgg.text: The pancakes are amazing. Iced soy coffee and the sweet berry pancake is my new favorite breakfast! (See pics).

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Savory

eLS5sod1zSP51yqpwy-zdA.text: The place is great, plenty of room, one of my favorite places to do my work. It's always filled with guests because it's a cool place to go spend a couple of hours. The food on the other hand is not worth it. They try, but it's not worth the price, I've tried a few things on the menu & I'm convinced their drinks are far superior.

eqTquIaRA8tCnvfUp-rrXQ.text: Great, casual place for coffee, dessert and breakfast/lunch meals. If you see a table take it right away, this place is almost always full. The cafe functions like a shared work place with free wifi and the crowd is mostly on laptops, tablets, meetings etc. Try the oatmeal creampie, vegan orange donut and chocolate cake with espresso icing - all good. Service is good i would come back

Rb7uz84IvPtXzxxX_GERqw.text: Like most of the reviewers I really wanted this to be a great start to Saturday.  Hip local coffee spot with potentially good food.  But the voyage to the food requires enduring long lines and rude staff.  Once your order is placed expect another long wait until your order is up!  They do call your name when your order is ready but they  make no effort to find you (there are several rooms) if you don't hear your name called. This morning even though I was hovering close to the kitchen my eggs were cold.  When I asked they to please re-do the order I got pushback from the staff !  I guess they feel their popularity trumps customer service.

tAg4FNIT1Ed1c2eMIha0MQ.text: I'm not like crazy in love with this place just yet. I'm big on coffee. But I used to be big on Starbucks and now I don't care for them anymore. Then I fell in love with a coffee shop called Crossroads Bookstore and Coffee on Olive Ave and 83rd ave. This place is still my favorite though. But I don't live nearby so I don't really get to go as often as I used to when I had the time freedom. I've also never been much of a fan of Dutch bros. I tried them a couple times. But then I worked for a new and uprising company who became their competitor called Desert Eagle on 51st Ave and Bell Road. Their set up is just like Dutch bros. Menu and the way there is two drive thrus and a walk up. But I like the coffee better. To me it's roasted better. The owner himself roasts it in the back of the building just about every day if not every other day. But I don't go there for personal reasons. So I've never been here a couple times. I've only had one specific drink and the Mac n cheese. But let me tell you, the Mac n cheese is the best Mac n cheese you'll find on earth! You can get it plain or with bacon and jalapenos or just one of those items. And the drink I got, it's either the red velvet or just the velvet. And I like my drinks iced so I get that as an iced latte. It's not too sweet but not too bland. There's 2 annoying things about this place though. It's ALWAYS packed and the parking lot is ALWAYS full. Sometimes you'll get lucky and drive through the parking lot hoping someone is leaving and then you'll get their spot. Otherwise you have to find parking near by on the streets. Oh and there is inside seating too. But that even gets full too. My friend and I had a hard time finding seating. But that's okay. I want to try other drinks too. And they also have other pastries.

9X3xcz9NCwVIzkeB3FCU9g.text: Lux is for hipsters.. but for hipsters that enjoy coffee. Here you can come and sit alone on your laptop, taking up a table for six - while looking sad in your solitude. Because that what I found. College hipsters that wanted to sit in their loneliness, but at the same time being seen - because whats more important than being seen right? If you just wanted to be alone, you could go to a dive bar.. but today's ideals thrives on attention.   It is almost that if there was a coffee shop/laboratory where you could enjoy your beverage alone but in public display.. I am not even sure where I am going with this. It is sad though that people rather text than interact on person.  The coffee bar has interesting elaborate concoctions with more or less actual coffee in them. You can have your coffee with milk, flavors and/or soda. That's how it is, and I had myself some nice big flavory cup of something that was sweet and caffeine laced. I would come back here, even if I do not understand the hype. here comes those who wants to experience the act of breaking the mainstream, but joining another mainstream movements that is almost as big as the original mainstream - but with even more rules and expectations. Complete culture fail - but you can bear witness of the unedgy alternative neophytes with their beginner beards and nervous lackadaisical doe eyes.  Again coffee was nice. I like coffee. I hate mock cultures that is nothing but a fashion statement. I also am very skeptical against mixing coffee with root beer. That's just wicked and gnarly. But as its stated before, they have something for everybody and they realize that coffee is also for evenings and not just for the early pick-me-up. Kudos Lux.

YmMFYbTYg3e2mKhK1KgnIw.text: Stopped here to pick up a gift card and a coffee on my lunch break and I have to say, I was majorly (and pleasantly) surprised!   It's a coffee bar. Like literally a coffee shop WITH a full bar. Ample seating/ lounge space, unique and comfortable decor, welcoming staff and quick service.   Yes, Lux appears to be a trendy haven for hipsters and pretentious d-bags...but that couldn't be further from the truth. The crowd is a mixed bag of students, working professionals, old yogis and kids. (All of which I saw within my 10 minute visit). The only negative part of my experience was leaving to go back to work.   Most important: The coffee is good and refills are free.

3oNv3QG106FeilocPlEG3g.text: I used to love this place before it became so popular :/ now it's overrated. Still an okay place to catch up on homework when it's not super packed. One things for sure is that their mac & cheese is still mouthwatering delicious!

2M2NNsLQ4gnFuqDMW3i-vg.text: Very crowded on Sunday morning. No surprises there. Nice staff. Delicious biscuits and gravy. Very nice place to meet a friend for a cuppa.

XRToxLsEwKilEHCsYOe3mA.text: Pretty much THE BEST PLACE EVER! This is my happy place. I go here all the time to do work or relax. The red velvet latte is TO DIE FOR. Especially iced. The healthy muffins are amazing and so is all of the food and baked goods! Hand crafted cocktails are so yummy and it's such a comfy environment. I just moved to Arizona from Chicago and needed a happy place. This is it and I hope to meet lots of friends and new people there and I get used to living here. Such amazing and kind staff and yummy yummy yummy coffee (the iced teas are great too!).

U6TXLmQ8TEjXaZgSbxjJwQ.text: I was recommended this place a while ago and I have loved it ever since. The coffee is always perfect and the staff are so awesome and nice. I love coming here when I just want to read or have to study or just honestly to enjoy being outside of my place.

xaQcq90cGmLn6VkEtGgzMA.text: I've recommended this place to people about the Bloody Mary's. I hate Bloody Mary's but this place does it the best. It does take 10 minutes to get it, but if you see the work they put into it, it's worth the wait.   You know what's not worth the wait? Apparently me. I know they are all earthy n sh*t. Stacking their carrots n sh*t. I hate the word "hipster"; I hate the categorization of any persons. Perhaps that makes me a "hipster". Well, this hipster was waiting at the bar for 15 minutes to even be talked to. When I finally spoke up to the woman stocking the carrots, she just gave me a "whatever" look. I didn't get one word out of one person there.   I'm at home, eating McDonald's now. I haven't been there in over 10 years. I called them to tell them about my experience but no one answered. Not a big surprise. I left a message "F*ck You!"   Perhaps I ain't the classiest of honkies, but from Honolulu to Paris, Spain, Germany and Britain; this is my one and only bad review. Check my scorecard. I depend on Yelp in my travels. I never give bad reviews; especially since I had good experiences here. But this outweighs it all. The bad service previously kicks into your mind and you finally say "F*ck it", I'm not begging them to take my money anymore.  I've got a MacBook too btw. I keep it home and use my phone like a normal MF. This restaurant and whole clientele can implode into its own asshole for all I care.   Keep stacking carrots.   Peace,  BTW, that was me on your answering machine if you put down the carrots to check your messages.   F*ck you, Not your friend, Ty

ABQE5G6ZY1PI6HWcACjWxw.text: Great food , cool space, but wouldn't want to work here. Seems extremely cramped for employees. Slow moving pastry lady's work station is the end of customer picnic table, produce/eggs stacked along walls on your way to bathrooms. We liked our food but our experience ruined when we asked snotty counter girl if could get our egg sandwich cooked over easy. She immediately copped a huge attitude & acted as though we were asking for free food. Obviously this gal shouldn't be working in customer service. Just a simple request, we thought, ruined a nice meal. Lots of swearing going on between the staff right in front of looks like some sort of manager, drinking coffee & getting in the way of staff members behind the counter.  Maybe this place just a little too hip for this non-hipster customer.

izqpDc0rf6WU_yPmKS3_hg.text: Fantastic professional staff. Welcoming to all people regardless of race. Jeff especially is warm and welcoming.

twbWjVU9v7h5SZEzVS25hw.text: Their hash browns are a mix of shredded potatoes, a touch of shredded carrots and enough thinly sliced red onions to round out the flavor.  The bacon was very thick and DELICIOUS!  The 2 "eggs over medium" were cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lQ8IHc1KnRpCshUkPhVkoQ.text: Amazing coffee! This is the place you want to go if you want to have an urban feel to your day, I always get the caramel latte and they are pretty consistent on making a great coffee every time love the vibe and their pastries are definitely something you should grab with your coffee. I haven't had any of their food menus yet I've tried only the Mack and cheese with jalapenos from a friend and it was pretty good but their plates look amazing whenever people order I'm always like ooooohhh I should get that next time

VrKJZflvtn5PrbDP8kr6Dg.text: The breakfast here is phenomenal!!! Pictured is Aunt Gladys' s Breakfast and the breakfast sandwich. All produce is fresh, the orange juice is fresh squeezed every morning, and they roast their own coffee beans. They do lunch and dinner items as well. Psst they have am amazing steak dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VXiRsntS70FTk5VEKQ-rZw.text: Loved my experience at LUX coffee, always appreciate a great latte and I found one here. I was visiting from out of town and was so impressed with the latte and delicious baked good that my sister and I started every morning of our trip at Lux!! Will be back in several weeks and know where I am headed every morning.

0w52hve5Pi3GIl7B0E0Mig.text: It's usually full but I like the vibe and the coffee as well. I've been here a few times on late nights when most other businesses were already closed.

bZBlljBrvIoikY4O5pmjCA.text: Cool place with great coffee and food. Ordering set up was a little confusing and menu a bit hard to decipher on the first visit but will be much easier next time. Definitely worth a visit.

WBZxXoNmK1--UL-rO3eR1g.text: One of my favorite coffee shops in Phoenix area so far! A little pricey but it's good!

GBIITOFGHFUN_IOdvMGVlw.text: Ok this place has A LOT going on. Its a coffee house, a bar, and a Restaurant. Its also more hipster-ish than an episode of Portlandia so brace yourself. If you get anxious in crowded spaces stay away because you can't turn around without bumping into someone. Having said that, they do a great job of keeping the atmosphere very chill. They even had  a freakin DJ In there spinning coffee house music! The pastries are great but every time I found something that looked good it said "vegan" or "gluten free" so you have limited options if your one of the few people left who still appreciate butter and flour. The espresso is fabulous, but I honestly could not find a drink menu anywhere so I wussed out and just got a latte. I'm not sure if that's a hipster move- I know they don't like signs on the front of their buildings so maybe they're moving on to not having menus either??? It's also very tough to find so set aside some time to circle the block. But in the end I give this place 5 stars for killer coffee, awesome atmosphere, and succeeding at being three concepts in one.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese danish

YXTO1DG6OKjbVaTLQXb40A.text: I have been going to lux for over 5 years now and it remains one of my favorite places in Phoenix. If you love great food, amazing pastries, great coffee and tea, and a super cool atmosphere that stays open til  2am on the weekends, lux is your place!   They have an amazing coffee bar and their pastry case is always full of different pastries everyday. I have also had their dinner menu and I would recommend the burger and the chicken with risotto.   Lux also has a full bar with craft cocktails and something called 'lux punch'. They don't always have it, but when they do, it's amazing.   Lux is a great place to come eat, drink, hang, and get some homework done.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vanilla bean brown sugar buttercream cake
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. NY Strip with broccoli and mashed potatoes. Perfect.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Infamous Lux chai

ESSlIPjl1TSYk8YF_DK1XA.text: I have been going to Lux for years, and I find it to be one of the most soothing and hip atmospheres in Phoenix. With great music, unique art, and a diverse customer base, it is definitely one of the hottest spots in Downtown Phoenix.   However, the drinks are never exceptional, and they are always over-priced. With a reduction in prices and increase in quality, this could be the best coffee shop in Phoenix.   Regardless, if you're looking for a fun place to hang out with friends or family, Lux is your place.

HVPY3F24kgHhuGioo5ZeRg.text: Eating breakfast with a DJ playing indie cuts is quite a unique and refreshing experience. . . Plus the food is tasty.  The belly bacon was incredible!  The next time we are in Phoenix, we will be back!  PS order a mimosa.

Y_t3dBNqt4Az7u5mzjAPXw.text: Stoped by today on 3rd of May with a friend. Place was a little crowded. But still we're enough space to find a seat. Got an iced tea and  fresh OJ.  What I liked about Lux Central is music . It was so atmospheric with the design of the place. By the way it has a huge parking place and there is no sign on the building. But You have to look for the one right on the corner. Because next to is bread store.

Z_BnYt28rZ-CuXYesl2VaQ.text: Good coffee and great food and atmosphere. It us a really, really busy place and so if you're planning on studying I'd suggest going early or somewhere else.

8OSs1V_oyYLkzB-yqcPdtg.text: Nothing compares to this place. I have never seen so much efficiency since In & out burger. Quit reading Yelp and drive past 25 coffee shops and go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QHfEinW5iS_OkA9xV-Uuog.text: Delish! Coffee was amazing & the ambiance is great for meeting with friends etc! Plenty of food options also that I plan to go back for

AcumBm7Dr-zWn_leVo1OBA.text: Best place for a date or to study. Gets a little loud but with headphones or ear plugs you should be alright. I mainly get drinks at the bar and the drinks are really really good because the bartenders know what they're doing; my old fashioned drinks have the huge ice cubes. My one little irk is that they don't have copper mugs for the Mules (or at least I haven't seen them)

1EwVcjZzjr69bGcYogOe9A.text: Good Wi-Fi, check. Great coffee, check. Friendly staff, check. Fast service, check. Great ambient environment, check.  There's only one, in Phoenix? Yeah that's too bad.  I've been coming here off and on for the last several years, and wow Lux has really evolved into more than just a coffee shop as it features lots of food for lunch and dinner, a bar serving drinks, wine and beer, not to mention their popular homemade baked sweets cutely presented behind glass panels while you wait in line. Now thinking back, I'm sure these were always available -- I've only just noticed now when I'm not bleary-eyed with lost sleep. Whoops!  The various coffees are really tasty if a little pricey (this is coming from a Starbucks-or-Dutch-Bros two-party loyalist here, haha) yet given the casual student atmosphere and the friendly staff who craft your drink really fast, you're hard-pressed not to pay the extra money and even leave a tip. Highly recommend everyone in Greater Phoenix to come see this gem of a restaurant!

8Q3oc71d9hPFfCNhiYX41A.text: I have mixed feelings about Lux.  It was my first time and sure did mention it to the person that took my order.  It wasn't busy ... but what a bitchy attitude.  The place is eclectic and hip but the staff don't match up with it. I even made a comment that this is a cool cafe, and she replied with disgust saying "it's not a cafe! it's a restaurant, wine bar and cafe".  Seriously though, if you want this to be a hip place ... hire staff that are hip with friendly attitude not bitchy attitude. Nothing ruins customer experience than negative staff attitude. The menu is also confusing and no sign outside that says Lux.

eVO4uKMmW8hKLVg12HX5qA.text: This is my HOME coffee shop. I've been going here for years.   True story: I used to live in Scottsdale, Arizona and I would drive all the way to LUX to work. I live in Phoenix now and now, I walk to Lux at least three times a week.

3_wwXJvtMnHAu9XDFPfBPw.text: I stopped into Lux between meetings downtown. I ordered a latte and a blueberry muffin. The coffee was solid, but the muffin was insanely good. I seriously would have licked the plate if I hadn't been sitting at the bar.   Lux is hopping. You may have to look for a seat and share a table with a stranger. Also, the door to Lux is at the back of the building--near the door for Pane Bianco.  I will have to schedule more meetings downtown so I can come back for the pastry.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ib-lCHaqDkQlGTU1qTaQZg.text: Lux is hands down my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. It's usually pretty busy, so be prepared to wait in line.  I always get a vanilla latte. I wish the Arizona weather would allow me to drink the hot version all year long! It's also good iced, but there's nothing like that beautiful mug of hot coffee. You can always opt for a dab of their homemade whipped cream if you're feeling crazy.  The food here is also great. I've had pastries, breakfast sandwiches and the best mac n cheese ever. I just wish the mac n cheese was available on the weekends!  Lux is the perfect place to meet up with friends or grab a spot in the corner and get some work done

tOMGorEGcktM3T_eVDTLbQ.text: We live within walking distance of Lux, yet I've maybe been here 2-3 times. I really want to like it more though! There coffee is very good, and quite overpriced. You should also be prepared to wait, regardless of the day or time I've been here it's always packed! There's always people studying, relaxing and or hanging out.   The space is very cool, and open. The vibe is definitely very hipster and a bit pretentious, and a bit un-welcoming. The few times I've been here I've not received the best customer service. This seems like a common complaint unfortunately..  Otherwise, they have delicious pastries and desserts. We had them catered at work and they were amazing! I just wish they had more gluten free/dairy free options. They also have some breakfast and lunch options and a bar.   Lux is definitely worth checking out!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Almond milk latte

jdTLVVAZcaHyhn2mZWXN9g.text: This is my favorite coffee place. It has just a smidge of all the things that make you keep coming back for more! First off the coffee is delicious! They have good options for those who like sugary decadent creations, and the taste of their coffee speaks for itself.   The service is always smiling and quick. Rarely is there anything wrong with the quality and if there is they are quick to fix it.   The atmosphere is fun and perfect for a coffee shop. If you like finding hidden nooks for reading or sitting with a group of people you don't know they have places for both!  They also have a bar if you are looking for a different kind of experience .

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee and croissant for a perfect Sunday start!

yRT3Ju4qnSUSFDPwwuhg_g.text: Great vibe. Music is good, upbeat, but not loud making it perfect to work on your laptop.  Coffee .. prefer the dark. Food was excellent. I wish they would serve breakfast longer on weekends.  Tons of tables, chairs, bar to seat and share the space with others. Perfect to do business.

juWOMwYY_ZF43p65UOpNUA.text: Moved to PHX from NYC. This is our favorite cocktail spot. Mixologists Sammy and Allie are insane - we have tried every speakeasy in this city and none can compare to the stunning creative inventions they came up with. Desserts - DELICIOUS. Those paleo cookies are indescribably delectable. Mac and cheese is ridiculous. Insanity. Clientele is awesome. Everyone is friendly and smart. Lux is a hidden gem. Don't ever go there, please, because we want to be able to get our seats at the bar and not have to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HXF04ksGNOEhd1Bz9rJbCg.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place because I'm here... at least... 3 times per week. It's become sort of a problem. The lines are long but they're super efficient and drinks come out super fast (food other than pastries takes a little longer). Honestly, I love all of their coffee beverages. Even just the plain straight black coffee (which typically isn't my thing)... so it's sort of saying something. I've also tried to iced latte (whipped cream is amazing here, I think it's a cold brew infused whip) but haven't tried the velvets or mochas because chocolate just isn't my thing (but hear they're amazing)!  They also have fresh-squeezed juices which I have a deep love for. I haven't tried their lunch or dinner but frequent around breakfast time to get some work done here and there.   Food wise: all of the menu Items I've tried are awesome, with the aunt Gladys breakfast being my favorite. The pastries I love. I've tried the cookies and muffins. I honestly prefer the standard muffin over the corn muffin, but both are great options. Really I haven't found anything you can go wrong with here!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aunt Gladys breakfast-- my favorite!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh squeezed orange juice
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

afBSZwgHDvwgN5gz5EYFBA.text: Pastries are great but was super bummed to find they don't have stevia or truvia or any of those derivatives so bring your own if you like those in your coffee. Also, no breakfast menu available until 7. Though they have quiches in the pastry area.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastries to go: blueberry scone, blueberry muffin, paleo pecan chocolate chip cookie
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spinach broccoli cheddar quiche

BRCUWOK6gLcqNu2nhMCy-g.text: The pastries and food are delicious! I had an amazing cappuccino! The WiFi is also amazing and works well without lag or buffering. There's so much seating inside and out ! This is the perfect meet up spot for a meeting, study group or to just chill with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0e5e4CtjX-WWYJZQWBR_9A.text: Lux central is easily a top three coffee shop in the valley. The coffee shop is so unique. There are tons of different seating options for those who want to study, converse, or just hang out. During the evenings, the mixologists come out. The drink menu is incredibly extensive and unique. The espresso martini is bomb. Lux central is worth a 30 minute drive. 5/5!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

j1rNKnzs008YSFDFQyhMBw.text: Never a dull moment here. Whether you're quickly stopping in for a cup of coffee. Having a lunch meeting. Catching up on school work. Or meeting friends for drinks. You'll always leave wanting more!  I don't think I've ever had a bad experience while at Lux. The bartenders genuinely care about the cocktail they are crafting as well as the experience. If your tastebuds are off, no worries, they'll concoct something fresh for you. Look for Sammy or Josh. They truly care about customer experiences. Mint Julep, Moscow Mules and Old Fashions will do tight by your side.   If you're hungry you must grab: Breakfast -Farmers Market scramble with a toasted and buttered toast. Sooooo savory.  Dinner -Mac n Cheese DO NOT forget to add Jalapenos!!! You'll cry if you do.  -Grilled Cheese with all the fixings (minus chicken and bacon for me - but do you boo) and add a side of tomato soup. I promise you'll thank me.  -If you're a meat eater grab that chicken risotto.  Desert -Chocolate chip cookies! -Lemon bar, if you're into tart tangy treats that makes your mouth water and cheeks clench. This is the one for you. I seriously can't resist it!!! -Chocolate Espresso cake. Light and very flavorful.   A few notes: -Seating is a bit sparse for such a trendy spot  -It gets loud quickly -Soccer fanatics are frequenters -Music is fantastic get ready to Shazam all night   Be prepared to have a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a classy mint julep crafted by the fun quirky bartender Josh!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. When you need to relax...trust your friendly bartenders at Lux to pull thru for you!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stopped in before work for an iced chai with almond milk and a shot of espresso along side a pastry.

jAFBbQpuIq9_9pHtfhoQIg.text: Really don't understand how this place has high ratings. Many things wrong about this "bar/restaurant/cafe". Their very uncomfortable chairs, dim lighting, and loud atmosphere makes this place a terrible study/work cafe. Their pastries are not covered- saw flies enjoy all the scones, quiches, and croissants before their customers. Their service is subpar. Came during non peak hours and still was rushed during my order. I had a rude female cashier that took the next customers order and payment while I was still in the middle of my transaction. When I asked if I could have my receipt she didn't hide that she was annoyed and told me I had to wait until she finished with the other customer (again the guy who was behind me in line). I asked the cashier to have my quiche Loraine warmed, but still received it cold. Overpriced coffee and quiche (total $13)  Come here if you enjoy mid/lower back pain, being treated poorly by rude baristas, drinking bland coffee, and wasting your money.

24zc4WdppmJE_ys0a_IExA.text: What do I look for in a coffee shop? I'll make a case that it's some combo of the following things, in no particular order:  - good coffee - I wanna sip that drip! From a standard cup of joe, to iced sugar brown water, to the soul-less slag that fuels the internet, to the beverages that are just Instagram accessories, to coffee-nerdness, you gotsta have tasty brew! Lux has it, in all the forms, a plethora of options for both the faint, chill, and intense of heart. There is a whole wall of coffee stuff that is just there to make your Mr Coffee feel inadequate  - seats - give me a place to sit, coffee shops! They have many. Couch seats, bar seats, table seats, inside seats, outside seats, plastic seats, bench seats, community table seats, cheap seats, nook seats, fancy seats, all kinds of seats.  - snacks - I might legit need a quick bite, or a meal, or a guilty splurge, and oh goodie all those are here! I had a lovely breakfast one time, bacon, hash browns and eggs with salsa, but my go-to is the pastry prison behind the surprisingly immaculate, counter-to-ceiling glass sneeze guard - plates of delectable and beautiful gluten-packed products that have been wrongfully accused and are behind bars, so to speak - set those suckers free! (actually they are just being transferred to my tumtum, justice does not previal, the pastry world is a dark place, whaah-whah*)  - bustle - I will make this mean whatever I want it to mean, but essentially, this is the quality that the coffeeshop seems a bit chaotic, but in a neighborhood sort of way. Like, it's clean, but based on the action it doesn't seem like it should be, it's crowded, but not in a noisy way, it's decorated, but the industrial  parts can't help but stick through. You gotta have peppy and droney style music, and stacks of boxed paper goods in a walkway are a 'must-have.' Lux has em.  Plus, there's wifi and outlets, and a parking lot out back and more on the street. Lux, you are my #1 spot for a hangout until the flight lands when I drive in from North PHX Metro to get peeps from Sky Harbor - a big upgrade from the deplorable cell phone lot!   *trombone sound

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice citrus bar area in the back
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big room

mZ58aNIc-IQtjTWq2SVL9A.text: It seems like the issue that I ran in to is not a super uncommon one which is rather unfortunate. I really like the place and they have some really good options I just can't see myself coming back.   I got some pastries and a latte and I got brought an iced coffee and some mac and cheese. So obviously my  order was incorrect and meant for someone else and I pointed it out and instead of an "I'm sorry let me fix that" I got a huge eye roll and an "Are you sure?" I showed the person my receipt and she said "Oh fine" and took the stuff away and I waited 30 minutes. Yes 30 before I was even spoken to again.   It's almost as if the popularity has gone to their heads. In their pursuit to be a little different they have alienated yet another customer which is quite unfortunate because they have a great product. The space is unique and welcoming with a slight hint of pretentiousness.

aFXNeBSoj7aUS7xm8uG_yA.text: If I could give it zero stars I would.   I've been going here for about 2 years, and I don't know what changed but this place has gone down hill. Sat at the bar on a Saturday afternoon, no one sitting there expect for one person. 4 people behind the bar, not one person looked at me or asked for my order. What the hell???? Sat there for 15 minutes, nothing. So I just got up and left.   I don't know if management changed or training got worse, but there are plenty of restaurants in the area like Clever Koi and Fame Caffe that I'd rather give my business to. No thanks.

PdbkR7v49z1g3Oh6F5qi2Q.text: Im visiting from California and I did not expect to find something this cool. It's a great vibe with open/family style seating. The place is like an underground cellar with coffee and a bar.   The orange vegan scone was the best scone I've ever had! Try the chai coffee .... super delicious!   The music is great and really sets the vibe. The espresso martini was really good and strong.

nwUkPTN7gRb_DucmmDU5qg.text: House blend espresso over iced coffee $4.50: A little too bitter for me. Next time I'd ask if they do any flavored ice coffees.   Raspberry Sweet Cheese Muffin $3: This was really good! Not too sweet, not too dry. A great complement to a cup of coffee.   Aunt Gladys' house made salsa over four strips tender belly bacon three scrambled eggs white cheddar and hash $14: The name of the dish describes exactly what it is, and could use some punctuation on the menu. Unfortunately, they had run out of the salsa by noon the Sunday we visited. Still, the bacon was good and the right amount of crispiness. The eggs had the right amount of cheese, and the hash browns were nice and crispy as well. I would get this again, and hope that next time I get to try the salsa!   Final thoughts: Cute spot for coffee and pastries. Savory dish didn't disappoint either, so would love to come back and try more!  *****  My Star Ratings:  1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry.  2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return.  3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to.  4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already.  5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Raspberry Sweet Cheese Muffin $3
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aunt Gladys&#39; house made salsa over four strips tender belly bacon three scrambled eggs white cheddar and hash $14
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House blend espresso over iced coffee $4.50

AQqDelNuFyrNIYGEA0Htyw.text: This is my favorite special occasion coffee shop. I say that because it's so far from home so...I only go when I am downtown...which is usually special. The location is why they do not get 5 stars. I hate that they are far. I want them to be in my backyard....I mean come on...I have a pool and everything.   The coffee and delicious treats are amazing.  Lots of tables to do table stuff. Lots of modern hipster chairs to do modern hipster stuff on. Outside seating is also available for those nature lovers. The art on the walls makes me wish I collected art.   It's an all around good time...so go!

JQzDjE9Q3Sk_Oab6mGFdgQ.text: Oh Lux how I love thee, where do I start? The coffee is amazing, the food is amazing, the atmosphere is amazing AND the music selection is beyond amazing...I want to live downtown just so I can go there every day. I am so over Starbucks and this is much better alternative!

PH9HEPQVy7TNGRuFRW537Q.text: Another gem in this concrete desert-within-a-desert. Trumps Lola on seating/chilling space, although the coffee is not clearly better (or worse).   P.S. (to the management): I'm not sure that the coffee bar is the best place for having emotionally charged job-performance conversations with your employees. Not that it really bothered me personally, I just felt bad for the dude getting called out in public.

tRVdstA-fgkPY_JdPhJk6g.text: Cute little shop with very good coffee and food as well. I liked how quirky everything was and there are many places to sit. I would suggest that they have a form of menu or central area where it's obvious you go to pay. They have a daily menu, it seems like, that is taped on the glass near the display case. There's a lot going on so difficult to see that. From the street, it's not easy to know where the front door is. I would definitely come back but with expectation to pay a lot. It's very expensive there!

A8ltv4hFSJhW9s5FQTXbwA.text: Great coffee, food and the best peanut butter cookies.  Only wish I could sit down and enjoy inside but seats are always taken by those who sit there for hours at a time.

dwywmMzyveYuFlJ1kyJ3Kg.text: It is pretty cool that I have a awesome coffee shop right by my house.  I was so happy that my friend brought me here.  The price is right and it is way better then Starbucks. :)  They have a great variety of coffee and teas.   Wish I could give them 10 star rating.

lvvuK9wId5P-wB1fssih4g.text: This is the coffee house to beat in Phoenix and Scottsdale.  The atmosphere and staff are friendly and hip!   I love the view of the staff preparing the amazing flavorful quiches and baked goods. It has the vibe of sitting in a family kitchen at home.  I buy a bag of Lux's fresh roasted coffee beans each week for my French press coffee. Te staff will grind the beans for you if necessary.  Restaurants like Lux are one of the many reasons I love living in central Phoenix!

zEj8yQKayLbNGy2ZyjeNXw.text: I have been a regular for about about 4 or 5  years now.  Lux is a home away from home. Ambiance, art & a great cup of coffee. Go with friends or go alone its still awesome. The staff is great, i.e. Sammy, Ron DMC, Sara, Lindsay, Jeff, & the list goes on ( sorry morning people I don't know your names :x ). No fancy review, just go in & get a coffee & a pastry, you'll never regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yYiSXBnBGDVHSPds6qnD_A.text: Great vibe but $12+ for an egg mcmuffin style sandwhich w/ avacado & oj is pretty steep. AND no potatoes or fruit. They could thrrow at least some melon on the plate for that price.

_ps8LbaNS9mmUurmMmwkyQ.text: Less than a five star review...blasphemy, I know. I used to go to Lux a minimum of three times a week until about eight years ago, and now maybe three times a year since they moved to the current location. Now, actually for years now, it is just too much of a scene. I'm sure the coffee products are still superior, and perhaps the food as well. Just no longer willing to put up with the noise, the intense crowding, the crazy parking, the...scene

uB8kcMaS1ymoernWvB7iAQ.text: Always packed!  The atmosphere is always better than the coffee or the service but I just can't stay away.

WKq8i1jkeOobNO0RhnFEQQ.text: I have been drinking the same espresso drink for about 6 years now, and Lux does the best job at making it! I found this place when I lived in Phoenix, and I literally went there every morning at 7am. I would order my drink and sit there and read. The coffee drinks are fantastic and it may have to do with the fact that they roast their own beans.  The pastries are also great, and they are baked fresh in the mornings. They have comfortable chairs to lounge on and read a good book. They also have tables that can seat up to 8 people, so it is a nice place to meet up with a group of friends. There is also seating outside under a shaded area.   There is a morning rush, but the staff is quick and there are parking spaces to the north of the building and also to the south. It is a hip, cool place with hip, cool customers.

hF_Y-GC-hBWX3mm9LcUOsA.text: Love this place, the coffee will grow hair on anyone's chest - watch out! The espresso is the best in this town, no contest. I could do without the plethora of iPad, iPhone, iRidiculous toting independent workers that flock in legions to this joint - because it is sooo hard to get a good seat!!  The location on Central works, the design aesthetic works, the baked goods are hard to resist...I took a non coffee drinking friend here for coffee and he found a cheese, ham, and pastry concoction that was topped by a fried egg, then baked....It looked outstanding, if I ate eggs!    More Vegan baked goods would make me smile.

pKoxhFu-cRleT4xBlwiH0g.text: My family and I go here every weekend and most weeknights. We absolutely love this place. Great breakfast in the morning and amazing cocktails in the evening. No other place like it.

0mmtR4CkjFx9NVniomuEfw.text: This place is very cool, but they are armatures! They do NOT know how to make a real cappuccino. It is complete False advertising because the present latte art only on a Latte, which is not how you make a cappuccino. They need to goto Italy and learn what to do. I hate coffee place that cater to the ignorance of America. This place has great potential and is hip, but they need to kick it up a notch. Learn the coffee biz, don't do it half Ass!!

EykRcKSikjo3zvkR7Fzs9A.text: Who doesn't like this place?! Bar drinks are hand crafted/ fresh squeezed w organic fruit. You know there is a God just by eating the Mac and cheese! Love the coffee but I warn you it's strong! They roast their own beans. When you walk in your greeted by the happiest most eclectic bunch in all of food service industry. It just feels good!

rjOMTWqj-_3oQdSf516HiQ.text: I visitied Lux for the first time last night (8/23). My friend came into town and wanted to check it out as she had heard it has some pretty delicious drinks. I've known it to be a coffee bar, but word on the street was that it's a bar by night... maybe I live a sheltered life, I'm not sure.  We walked in through the giant glass doors and my first impression was "hipster central." I don't consider that a bad thing, after all who doesn't like nicely dress hipster dudes? As we made our way through it was hard to decide what we were supposed to do. There isn't much seating and it was a little confusing where we were supposed to go to get a drink. But sure enough we were able to figure it out with the help of the bartender that we knew. I am not sure what we would have done without a little help.   Beside the confusing seating arrangement, the specialty drinks are a little high-priced, but delicious none-the-less. The setting is a little more intimate, so I'd recommend Lux for a quite date night. As for a menu, they have some drinks written on the glass-board, but I usually just ask the bartender to surprise me.

Rhy535qkh0F1OfpQYrKqVA.text: Have been going here for months. Today we had the best experience yet! Our past experiences were off-putting, but we kept going because the mocha is so good. They have finally gotten it right! The greeting was with a warm spirit and smile and the relaxing music lent to a mellow but efficient staff. Much better than the hectic unorganized and chaotic vibes from the past. Keep it up Earthlings!

3ErBpPNLLM7xB90IxqkdSA.text: This place rocks! The cappuccino I got was so damn good. Amazing. They played great music, too. Sea Wolf. I got the egg sandwich thingy, and it was super tasty. Seems like a basic thing to order, but it was so good. Will DEF go back again when we're in Phoenix.

2wOTmK3l1KnU75OOc3TYQA.text: best coffee house in Phoenix!  and make excellent cocktails too!

KgOgRZdEioKRwrRSLuuYmA.text: hidden and delicious! Crafty cocktails. Perfect coffee. Fresh baked goodness!...try Cartel coffee in Tempe as well!

TPD_GrQCDLSBSAcfnkKXmQ.text: Is it just me or is it like a Phoenix treasure hunt trying to find this place?
