Good thing I'm persistent or I would have ended up staying tired last night, or worse, at Starbucks.  So Lux is hard to spot, although it is conveniently located on Central and Indian School, right near a light rail stop.  Great coffee though and worth the hunt!  Walking in I found pretty much what I'd expect from a local coffee shop: trendy, laid back atmosphere, lots of comfy looking chairs, which were unfortunately all taken.  I did not however, expect it to be packed at 9:30 at night, half an hour before closing.  I ordered a latte; it was smooth and rich.  I would have mistaken it for a breve (made with half and half instead of milk) but I watched the barista make it and I'm sure it was done correctly.  I love a good breve but stopped drinking them because of the outrageous fat content.  Is it possible I've found a regular latte that tastes like a breve?  I'll be back tonight just to be sure!  Loved this place, and to top it off, I'm a sucker for a nifty design in my foam.

JELUo0zYLfiZ_G0gJ8aIVg.text: Drifting away from the corporate "Big Dogs" of the coffee world can sometimes seem challenging. After only three visits to Lux, I have found my anti-drug (or should I say anti-coporate coffee shop).   It's True that I have only tried a few things from this small establishment, but when every single one so far has been a success, why wouldn't I continue to venture 35 minutes out of my way to get a good cup of joe? I love almost everything about this place; the atmosphere is so cozy, artsy, and seems to be an awesome workplace for college students. The coffee drinks that I have tried have all been fantastic, but most of all I LOVE their whipped cream.   My one complaint about this simple, yet wonderful establishment is the parking lot. I almost died trying to get out of their the last time I went, although I guess that could be more of a reflection on my driving rather than the parking lot shape/location.

TOVKjXGsHRlwgWO-Dtkutw.text: This place was hard to find, not enough parking, and there's a line at 830am.  They have three baristas and two cooks. from what I see it's not enough.  There is a nice variety of fresh fruit and pastries to choose from including three kinds of quiche.  I ordered a bacon cheddar quiche and dark roast coffee.  Very yum.

MhKxfboIoGW1K_mVrfu2rA.text: This place could be great if the service wasn't so rude. No one seems to care, and they never say thank you. Each time I've been here one of the little girls working at the counter has looked me up and down judgementally.   The coffee was fine, but the cookie I had was wayyy too sweet for me.   If you want to feel good about yourself, don't go here!

8J2LMwVuBk8wuwoe-IHoDg.text: I have only lived in Phoenix for three months and my first priority was finding a coffee shop to embrace and make my own.  Lux is my own. I love the feeling I get when I walk into the place. The coffee is the best I've ever had. The service is perfect. It is a wonderful place to spend a lazy weekend day and I have met more new friends at Lux than I have anywhere else since I moved to Phoenix.  My only complaint is that it's not closer to my home. Fair Trade, Conspire and Lola are all walking distance from my place, but Lux is more that worth the drive.

MNM3SWUkYtudG7-EDaT1Pg.text: Great atmosphere. I love the (fairly) new expansion and bar area. The cocktails are some of the finest you'll get in Phoenix. If you're looking for a good drink, try a Modern Fashioned or a Kindness Yvette. Or just tell the bartender what your favorite liquor is and they'll mix you up something great.

FBLOMm3ZPFdTjJn44CVcrA.text: have jake create you a drink at the bar. i promise you won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hand muddled cocktails! Fresh fruit, juice, and herbs. Huzzah!

3QGHQ4WOoj2sOouBsZixvw.text: A great place to grab a coffee, delicious breakfast, pastry or tea!  Fun to meet a friend or host a business catch up.  Lovely lovely establishment!

Kc85WPV39Ov8l4I3guOMdA.text: I pretty much have no clue why anyone could give LUX anything but a 4 or a 5 star review. I guess we could just chalk them up to someone who must have been having an all around bad day that day, I forgive them.   LUX is awesome because it's not your run of the mill coffee shop, with everyone behind the counter talking in half crazy coffee tongue that no one understand, yelling across the building "JOHN!!!" "EMILY!!!!", and all look like a corporate machine in their matchy matchy green aprons.   The first thing you notice when you walk in is the amazing smell, they roast their own coffee right there in the shop and it fills the air with sweetest smell, Love it! Yes, some people have a problem with "all the furniture" inside. But seriously, if you cant handle being close to other people, maybe interacting beyond your laptop, and possibly meeting some cool people then no, this place isn't for you. Go ahead and take your butt to Starbucks where you can not be bothered, and you are calling me snobby and pretentious? B**** please, get over yourself!   The winter is my favorite time to frequent LUX! Beyond their amazing caramel latte (with the cutest little foam designs on top) they have some of the best pastries and yummy treats. Last year they had the best cranbarry-barry crumble thing, I about died and went to heaven, so good!   They also feature artist from the valley on their walls. It's kind of like a gallery at times, because you can buy the art too. There are some pretty interesting things up at times.   LUX is great! You must check it out. If there is a long line don't let it scare you, unlike some other coffee places (caugh-Starbucks-caugh), they move with a quickness and you never have to wait to long.

6KBWNvFkmGy3FDh8x1_CzA.text: AVC Roofing Repairs and Services of 840 W. University Ave in Mesa AZ.  Contracted for roofing repairs with 2 year warranty/certification. Repairs were completed to my satisfaction: however, repeated attempts to obtain the warranty have been unsuccessful.  Paid additional $200 for the warranty. Repeated calls to the owner have not been returned..

UO9uKH5t2kvpS7Xw4vafRg.text: So in love with Lux! Trendy doesn't quit cover it. People watching is priceless. Chill environment. Great, food coffee and wine. Mac and cheese with jalapenos and bacon is unreal! Sport (football, basketball, ect...) in the back room on a huge screen entertains my son and boyfriend so I can get some chill time in. Staff is so friendly and personable. Thoroughly impressed!

CpogSszbLZcou_SeR5zMkQ.text: Great coffee. Attention to detail in the pastries is top-notch. Fun place to people watch, as well.

M4fSfYVO1LJ_Yce5fWKftg.text: If I was a local, this would be my spot. We sat out on the patio next door with our caps and could not have been happier!

ytx61RuyggrE_Kvp7zOAzg.text: I am extremely picky when it comes to coffee shops because I own one back in Washington. The atmosphere is wonderful and the pastries are amazing, when my husband and I come visit this is our 1st place we come before seeing our son in college..Try this place and you will be hooked.

CSlz-v2bXoWvwyP-ebfwvw.text: Great Coffee, Tea, and Pastries. Horrible customer service. You'll never get a smile from these guys and will take your order with rudeness.

m9zy_Z3LjgYA2mdYsKUyjQ.text: They are not worth it!  Their furniture "leather" wears out after a 1 and 1/2 years!  I am not the only customer who has received shoddy customer service -- This company does not stand behind their products -- even though we purchased the 5 year warranty!  They said leather furniture peeling is a manufacturer's defect that is only covered for 1 year. Really? Leather furniture should last more than 1 and 1/2 years, especially when it's not even used.  Shame on you Mor Furniture!

APvH-gj8gK2P4dh95nG3wg.text: I like come to Lux  and pretend study. I've graduated college already but I like to come here and pretend like I'm doing something important while I sip on some coffee, check my Facebook account, check how many cool votes I got on Yelp and check the movie times using their free wi-fi.   The place gets packed on the weekend so be prepared to have to scope the room out for an empty spot at the table or wait for someone to finish. I never usually have to wait very long.  The staff here is super helpful. If you don't see something on the menu, just let them know what you normally drink and they can make it for you. The selection of treats are amazing. Cherry oatmeal bars, snickerdoodles and diner cake. If the coffee doesn't get you wired, the sugar might.   Its fairly quiet and has some music on but I usually just bring earplugs so I can secretly listen to Britney Spears. No one has to know about that. The guys who frequent this place are pretty cute, except their usually gay. Oh well... a girl can dream, can't she?!

l7n9FtoaHfrBjNbSiDvDSw.text: There aren't many places where you can get a pot of loose-leaf tea all to yourself. There also aren't many places that make their own (delicious!) chai. The baked goods are tasty, the coffee is roasted on-sight and has an irresistible aroma that permeates the whole place. One of the best things is that it's next to Pane Bianco, too!  Only 4 stars because the staff are often too cool for school, and often too cool to give a crap about good service.

befPdQ-kxoXuK3vT0FuNPQ.text: First time ever eaten from Jimmy Johns and ordered the Vito. Said it was with a vingarette. NOT! Had to put Italian dressing on it to swallow. However, the meats were very yummy.

trf9tPZgAm667rhPo15g_w.text: I'm a regular here for a reason. The coffee and pastries are great and service always friendly. Sure the place is full of hipsters on their Macs but I see all kinds of people here, never snobberish. Can get loud and people get way too comfortable at times (get your feet off the table) but overall...great place.

ASGe_kJGq5rxQ9QO9M1i6A.text: This review is for their cocktail bar, not their coffee.  The feel of the cocktail bar is nice, and the throwback approach to classic cocktail making, commendable. However, the execution left us wanting.   I ordered a Rob Roy, but received something with Coke and whisky. Sure, there is a child's softdrink named after another gentleman with "Roy" in his name, but if I had ordered a Manhattan I surely hope they wouldn't pour me a Beam and Coke.  Before they attempt complicated cocktails with St Germain, Aperol, muddled strawberry and rose water, they should learn the classics.  For coffee, they get 4 stars.

jrobKG-XaSahqoPoorQnVg.text: My husband loves this coffee here. We decided to have breakfast on a recent trip. We were seated near the kitchen and we watched food preparation. One employee could not keep her hand out of a tall plastic container of nuts(?), into her mouth, food prep, back to her mouth, and never washing her hands.  The cook at the stove, after she finished with a frying pan, placed the dirty pan on the floor below the stove. Would she use t again before washing since it never made it to the sink?  Nasty!

a8VzK1aOIoHF0jMGsziweA.text: thanks for all your professional courtesy. the service was outstanding. and would refer family and friends, we purchased a cadillic srx and we are so happy with it, no presure selling, it was great customer service,  thanks again!!!!

s1H03tdQSkUb7HiZR7Gr7A.text: After two years now, they've really done a great job at keeping the more annoying music off the playlist... or maybe some jaded hipster finally quit. Either way, I like hanging out there now instead of just getting stuff to go.

AbAaliGXFvZ4zC99vg5PdA.text: This place deserves the hype.  It is a great atmosphere whether you go in the early morning for coffee (or my personal favorite hibiscus Arnold Palmer) before work or late at night for an amazing drink (try the rum-in-the blood, which was recommended to me by one of the bartenders.)  I have never known the staff to be anything but helpful and friendly, despite some comments to the contrary in other reviews.  It's practically my second home because it fits whatever mood I'm in, whether I want to have a relaxed night out with friends or hole up with a book and a drink.  It's rare to find somewhere I feel this content.

GTzCNk3giOtBbZAF-k7cZg.text: Staff seem happy to work there and very helpful. The breakfast egg sandwich is AMAZING and the scones are delish! Get there early or afternoonish to avoid the rush :-)

4QeeDwCEE-TYStx-dTj1ew.text: Great place to drink coffee with a friend or do your academic work and very easy to bring your dog. Everybody who works at Lux is great!!!

Nw86FR7ornZEPuH94Rxhyw.text: this has to do a lot with one's opinion, however the place is nice.  laid back atmosphere, also having a Macbook Pro almost seems like a requirement to sip on some mocha at this place :)  my only complaint is that waiting in line and waiting for my coffee was just plain ackward.  the way the set up is...I'm sure it sounded good in therory

f7Aj7bxjRaXilk1dSDsjOg.text: I love this place. Great coffee and nice set-up to do a bit of work using the free wifi.

gy1UgqZHUTByuwAX7c2hRw.text: Been coming to Lux since before they got the larger building. Coffee drinks have always been good and I have also been enjoying some of the cocktail drinks as well. Not a huge fan of what food I have had there yet. So far I have only tried the breakfast and pastry items. Can't say if the lunch and/or dinner items are any better. Definitely only come here if you have some time and are not rushing to get your pre-morning work coffee drink. I used to come here before work but now it takes too long. Its nice though to come here an enjoy a drink with friends.

FsufjriuQnqxNxHPV3NnBA.text: My friend and I decided to grab some coffee at this place after finishing lunch next door at Pane Bianco. It was pretty crowded and everyone seemed really into whatever they were doing on their Macs. I got an iced coffee with half and half and was pleasantly surprised with how fresh the coffee tasted. We ended up finding a cozy spot inside and our quick coffee run turned into almost  4hrs of "working" and talking. I can see how people can spend the entire day at this place!

s05y3ryI8n2mA_kvw4-IVg.text: Well I love this place, is my fave coffee of all... but isn't great to study or have a conversation bcz their music is too loud, is always packed (bcz is that good) also the ambient and the style of the place is very cool, different  of what u can expect in the middle of the streets in phx central area. also the employees r very cool, know u by name and show u that care for ur order.... i will say is great specially for a weekends mornings or evening... is like a great place to meet somebody by the first time like a "relax, first date" hahaha... check it out

QziN-vczLaZG0d2vyA5l0w.text: After two great visits to Lux, I can't think of any negatives to affect the star rating. Lux has everything I can imagine for a coffee shop. Freshly roasted beans, baristas who know what they're doing, (AND look like they're having a good time doing it), an outdoor shaded patio with funky wood tables and indoor seating with mismatched modern chairs, delicious baked goods (some guiltier than others), beautiful local artwork on the walls (a photography display today), and an actual DJ playing music for the lingerers' enjoyment! It goes without saying that the coffee is delicious.  Both times I went in, the guy at the counter offered advice on my choices (the scone he suggested was indeed delicious, not overly sweet, but perfectly buttery), and no one pressured me to get through the line, as often happens at other places where people have their order down pat. I also enjoyed the company of other Lux patrons both times I went, and savored my coffee outside on the patio with a good book.

B9uBjY61XRrr0CcWJeAc4Q.text: I love the sort of recent remodel. I'm not 100% in love with the high prices for the alcohol and food , and parking can be a bear. There's only one( maybe a couple) glasses of wine that are the low low price of $8.00. I get that it's the good stuff, but, it'd be really nice to see a vibing place have a deal once in awhile.  The food is also amazing, BUT, it's also high dollar. I'm not one to eat where I can't afford, but, some of the items are up in the $20.00 range, and when you lack an ideal ambiance and adequate seating...it's not a fair price in my eyes. Don't get me wrong, the food is great, but, if you have sit sandwiched between a college coed marinated in Curve, and an group of Lana Del Ray wannabe's belting out the lyrics to whatever indie song they recognize...it's just a bit hard to swallow knowing that you paid a hefty price for an atmosphere that just does not deliver on the personal eating space factor. Bottom line, I think this place is great to grab a pretty good cappuccino, solo or with just one other person. If your from the PNW like myself, it's...well, it's still not Portlandia.

5CY3tBBcXn_HSZYB_Qvngw.text: This place is so packed every time I go. It does have a great vibe and the coffee is out of this world amazing! If you do have the time to hang out and do some work or something, you should. It really is an awesome place. Warning: Don't stay too long cuz last time I did, I drank something like 12 shots of coffee and was totally buzzing for the rest of the evening.

bsDQPkHQ_cy7D6r2Sr-4ng.text: I have been to Lux a few times now and it has completely won me over with its delicious coffee and mouth watering chocolate croissants . There always seems to be a line but it moves fast. Among the numerous coffee shops in the area, Lux definitely stands out.

JQFpYn1TUQHD2mZ1GobFBg.text: Everything here is tasty.  They can be crowded, so expect that!  Wish they were open later when my friends want to go boozing and I want an espresso!

oUkAg5GlffFiOfZ1erLFEQ.text: My favorite local cafe!  So much personality!  It has that whole industrial, arty urban chic vibe going on.  Cool local art on the walls.  Always great music on (sometimes a little loud, so if you're easily distracted or trying to chat don't sit right under the speakers).  Amazing home-baked tasty little goodies -- something different every day!  Usually with vegan alternatives, and at least one reasonably healthy choice, including fresh fruit.  Just had their no-bake chocolate-peanut butter-oatmeal cookies -- which were seriously yum!  Still my favorite is the ciabatta-style toasted bread with real butter and Nutella alongside one of their perfect soy lattes...- heaven!  And yes, they do roast their own coffee beans here, so if you come in during roasting time, you may leave smelling like freshly roasted coffee!

TQSMEhM5qvSufgpZMKnDQA.text: Hi my name is Darlene.   On August 6th at approximately 10:30 am I returned my blow dryer to Walmart (located on 59th Avenue and Bell Road, Glendale, Arizona).   On my way to get my new blow dryer I slipped in a puddle of shampoo, I've been walking on crutches for the past 41 years, and never have I slipped or fallen in a store, I am a leg amputee.  Today I received a phone call from Walmart (CMI) telling me that they found no negligence on Walmarts behalf.  So I guess that all the pain I'm in and all the X-rays and MRI's I've had are my responsibility.  I've missed 19 days of going to the gym lying in bed sore and in pain.  At first I thought I broke the top of my arm, which I immediately had x-rayed, and thank God it wasn't broken.  And I had a scrape across my back which was 9-10 inches long,  and my hip and knee hurt.  Till this day I can't get comfortable with my leg on the bed.  Who are they to say that Walmart wasn't negligent for what happened to me.  I can't even get my out of pocket expenses taken care of.

cR53OkoOLTGi-u7sIgvfvA.text: Very impressive space and design.  I attended the "soft" opening and was very pleased. If you like artistically crafted drinks... this is the place for you. I enjoyed a "Black" Manhattan which was made with Rye Whiskey. It was perfect! Of the menu items I was able to sample the macaroni and cheese was very impressive. Completely unique and light, where most mac and cheeses are clumpy, heavy and boring.  The staff is delightful!  I can't wait to come back to Phoenix and get my LUX on!!

o5wLuyhtYt_hBFEGNx9m7A.text: I've been frequenting this place for a loooooong time. It reminds me of the funky artsy coffeehouses in LA, around the Melrose District. Their hodgepodge of furniture - Midcentury rejects line the walls and old backlight tables - complement the easy, laidback vibe of the place. Of course, the Mac crowd wouldn't have it any other way.  I haven't ever had a cup of coffee in my life but they always have juice, Vitaminwater and other non-coffee alternatives to choose from. Plus they have a few treats, like brownies, to snack on. This place is MRB approved!!!

Y1zJhuZ5m-DchdAMuWtRYg.text: The 'N word' is not okay. I must give Lux a failing score from last nights experience. I go there often, and usually have good experiences, but last night was different. While studying in the, what seems to be their quiet room, there was music playing at a fairly low level that was different from what was playing out in the main areas. The sound level of the music playing wasn't the problem, but the words being used by the artist were. One of the artists songs repeatedly used the 'N word'. Lux MUST be more responsible about what they play at their establishment. I am truly hoping that it was a one time mistake.

YpBWUa5wXnUjAEOjWwqwLg.text: I drive 20 miles regularly just to come here! Love the amazing interior decorating and superb coffee (it's the perfect kind of coffee to wash down pastries, especially when it's iced). There are so many kinds of people who come here, but everyone, from the employees to the customers, is very friendly. My cousin and I got a peanut butter brownie (amazing) and got up for a coffee refill a couple hours later, and almost the entire pastry case was different. They're always baking their pastries fresh, but if you have something specific in mind, it may not be there when you arrive because they're always rotating. That's okay, try something else, you won't be let down! The food quality is great, so I don't mind paying a bit extra for it. The ideal student's/worker's cafe - there are rooms that have a tendency to be quiet for those who need them. What more could you ask for in a coffee shop?

8I1gWSmsHdHvL3OZ0MQA3g.text: Food fresh and good for you. Great atmosphere. Didn't get last star only because it was hard to figure out what to order while in line and felt very hurried. Will definitely come back.

O6ZIJUacxS8fRFettyyi9w.text: Great coffee and food. Service and staff are always top notch.  I have been going there for over 7 years.  You may have an occasional wait on busy mornings but they move you through quickly and it's worth it.  All meals are very good bfast thru dinner and the pastries are incredible

zCLW3TTR3gLU_p_7dGInLA.text: Every time I'm in the area I always stop by Lux for a latte. Somehow Lux manages to imbue their espresso shots with a roasted marshmallow flavor that's unique and awesome. Sometimes a good latte from Cartel Coffee Lab will have a similar flavor, but I haven't encountered it anywhere else, including from 3rd wave coffee mecca Intelligentsia in LA. The lattes are the main reason I go to Lux; I've sampled some of the baked goods behind the glass display case, and the pies and quiches are quite good but I wouldn't make a special stop just for them.  I suppose the place is kind of hipster, but I've always found the staff to be very friendly and welcoming when I roll up in my very non-hipster khakis-and-oxford working clothes. Much more welcoming than Press Coffee and Cartel, for sure. Espresso pulls from Lux are also much, much more consistent than either Press or Cartel. A little rearranging of the ordering and pickup area would be welcome - coffees are delivered to the same spot where you order, which leads to traffic jams. But drinks come out relatively quickly so it's not really a big deal.  There is a lot of seating, but the place is always so hopping that you never know if you'll get a good spot to hang out or not. Worst case, there's a lot of communal tables where you can squeeze in.   Bottom-line, go if you're a coffee freak seeking the perfect latte like myself. Their lattes absolutely give nothing away to avowed 3rd wave places like Intelligentsia or many others that I've tried. Kick back and enjoy the vibe and pretend you're in downtown SF or Berkeley while sipping the best lattes in town.

glRIuINYLeMzC8Zw4lNa1w.text: Hippest coffee shop in the whole west coast. Amazing coffee, unbelievable ambiance and decor, great great customer service. Did I mention fantastic brews. Get the Atmosphere. Lux's iced coffee drinks do damage. Must visit even for tourists.

NHJeA3VDNMuuaSv8nISpzA.text: The atmosphere, employees, and coffee are all absolutely amazing! Although they were packed, the vibe was awesome and I plan on coming in a lot more often.

AsBX14temZB5zmD5IXFTag.text: Coffee options are among the best in the area but good luck finding a table. Not the best place to go for a read and/or write: always crowded and long lines. Friendly staff and decent parking options.

lyLQ_Kkh3BIQWpCcbFw5WQ.text: The coffee is superb and made even better by Lux's selection of freshly baked pastries. One of my favorite items on their menu however is certainly their jalapeno and bacon macaroni and cheese. Beyond the "coffee shop" is Lux's brunch selection and cocktails which are both worth checking out. It does get crowded often which means that parking can be a challenge and finding a seat inside even more difficult so if you're looking for something peaceful this may not be for you. That being said, the customer service (and music selection) is  very thoughtful.

IXVDk0MddNPANyBpbfhqWQ.text: great coffee, great atmosphere, but really hipster baristas who possess just a little bit of 'tude.

W5nHqntm_wtPWAMSG7Ytgw.text: The coffee here is honestly unbelievable.  Hands down the best coffee in the valley.  Lux would easily get 5 stars from me *if* they made a couple of simple additions.  1) a vegan pastry option.  I am not asking for 30 options, but a cookie would be nice!  and 2) another "creamer" option other than soy.  I like when places offer hemp, almond, or rice milk.  I just think its a nice option because some people have soy allergies/aversions.   Lux has the best coffee house atmosphere in the city.  Not snobby, but also not infiltrated by gutter punks.

A5Iqjwtoh_fQxl3BcgB92Q.text: Chill coffee bar. That is the best way to describe it. Very unique. All the plates are different. Comfy chairs. Desks. Fresh flowers on the tables. I sipped on hibiscus green ice tea and munched on the best coconut macaroon on my life. Yes, I am willing to go there. Must try. Stop going to Starbucks and start supporting coffee shops with personality, unless your a boring dud.

kP5WVLjMWzgO5f5Pankr8w.text: Nice little coffee place that I would definitely go back to but the only thing is the rude cashier last night around 11pm. Just because there's a big line and I have a few questions given its my first time being at this coffee shop, doesn't give anyone the right to be rude and unprofessional. Asking for a cup of water or where the straws are at doesn't deserve an eye roll. Besides that it was a nice place.

YUWZi0VrpUKCSCp0sLPQ4A.text: This is my favorite cafe in Phoenix to study at...amazing coffee and delicious treats.  If I am going to eat lunch, I prefer next door at Pane Bianco.  And when I went on Sunday there was a live DJ.  Also so much space so you can choose noise level you desire and spread out your books and computer.  Reminds me of coffee shops in the northwest like Portland.

my2M1jhuvntsDXCGo5BLdw.text: Love, love, Love this place. Great atmosphere and the best coffee i have ever had. trendy place, always busy, open late, variety

kjGnv1tsYvVn4BeeHKxyuw.text: Wonderful.  The coffee is super smooth and fresh.  I had the best vanilla latte of my life here.  They make their own whipped cream in house and will add a spoonful to your latte if you ask and it really pushes the drink over the edge into divine territory.  I love the decor here - a lot of hipster joints have gone for the industrial look and just feel cold (looking at you, Cartel), but this place is more of the woodsy bookshop feel.  It was very packed when I visited but  I still received my order quickly.   The pastries are pretty good too.

zLCai3QHx2TDSJvpYMbsng.text: It's crowded, but kind of interesting. I love the atmosphere but don't like the regular coffee. Maybe flavored is better, but haven't tried any.

SR299g-roF2DM79Q83IKTg.text: I want so badly to give Lux 5 stars.  I love the food,  the jalapeno Mac and cheese is amazing.  The coffee is delicious,  the velvet latte,  to die for.  The cocktails,  don't even get me started they're so delicious! But I've been going to Lux for almost five years now and everytime the service is just,  eh.  A little customer engagement would go a long way here.  It really is a quaint neighborhood find,  and you want it to feel special to you,  instead of feeling like you're just feeding the hungry cash register.  I'll still keep going here though because I love everything else about Lux.

3aTV1qNwKtVxTbiQO53cqg.text: Best Mimosa in town, yes, even on a weekday am Egg Sandwich totally incredible. Can't wait 2 try the biscuits & gravy, it looked amazing & I had such food envy when it passed by our table.

N3o8sVw9j1iL56pgFKk-Lg.text: Brought my mom here and I think she felt really out of place, which typically (and correctly) means it was an entertaining experience.  The clientele here make for highly entertaining people watching. At ten in the morning, there was the guy who never took his shades off, inside. His buddy next to him looked like a hired goon from a 1960s era James Bond, with slacks, a dark long sleeve button up shirt and a pony tail. Then in walked Phoenix's Russell Brand equivalent. Clearly either on molly or in a manic phase, homey was just LOVING life. Everyone in his path got a high five or a hug and a smile, with his dreads flopping this way and that. At some point he walked behind the counter like he owned the place, because apparently the baristas needed hugs and high fives too. Then his girlfriend walks in, a beautiful girl covered head to toe in body art. They eventually walk over to Shades and Igor and he introduces her to them. Her name is Goddess. I half expected her to begin an incantation, but apparently she wasn't so moved.  Not everyone in Lux is as awesome as these people, there are a fair share of people who didn't look like they throw their enemies into pools filled with sharks or have bipolar disorder. Boring people like me. Fortunately there will be enough characters who could have walked out of a B-movie that you shouldn't get bored. Suffice to say that you will likely be entertained.  The food was very good as well, and the coffee was perfect. The scene here is so rad though that those come as an asterisk.  No great if you: are looking for a Starbucks equivalent Great if you: need a high five and a hug

poZJpvaZD66j2uaoOnAnTA.text: Sunday brunch time and this place is buzzing with energy.  The food prep station behind the counter has the air of America Test Kitchen in a trendy space.  Pastries and food in abundant supply and they're beyond the standard offerings.  Great for dinner too.  The layout is open and the space is warm and trendy.

wzDgaAozzz2-MGRDM1tRWA.text: I love Lux! It is such a cool place to go to either bring a laptop and sip on some coffee or come to hang out and chat with some friends. Such a cool vibe!

9wObTNWEaREupMWZgIO1nA.text: Black and white mocha is the best. It can get super busy though so late mornings are hard to find a spot and there is a line but it is WELL worth it

cvtNdVlZcZMe9dBK7rF4sg.text: Lux is a place I go to often. They have good drinks, pastries, and the most amazing Mac n cheese (I recommend with bacon). My only complaint would be that the workers aren't always super friendly but Lux is always packed so I think they are just very focused to get everyone's order. Seating is bad during the summer but when it gets colder outside seating is very nice.

3p4XsPh4Eb-3MC2C0T01Uw.text: OMG, best coffee place in Phoenix hands down. Great Ambiance and  a good cup of Joe.  Place can be a little loud, but It's part of the package.  Food is great as well, got the Dutch pancakes for breakfast.  It was topped with fresh berries and coffee whipped cream. YUM!  A great stop after having a big meal in the area I typically come here to polish off the evening.

0jBL2U9zbjk_W--clUoJAA.text: LUX. This place reminds me of an old western movie where a villainous cowboy would come crashing into a saloon and is quickly tackled by the good guy. Now, instead of the cowboy imagine this place packed with mac hackers. Yeah.   Hackers in the middle of the dessert. That'd be an awesome movie. Okay, of course the people in Lux weren't hackers. But when you enter into the dimly lit coffee bar and everyone has their macs up... you wonder if you stepped into a warp hole.  All that aside, they have a good selection of coffees and teas. Hubby got a double shot espresso latte .... with a pretty leaf of latte art! Hubby thought it had a less sharp taste than the double shot we got in New York... but I thought it was just fine and dandy. Really enjoyed it.   I also got a small vanilla cupcake w/ espresso frosting. I liked the frosting...really tasted like whipped espresso but the cake was wanting.   We settled into a sofa seat ...and I took a small nap while he surfed the net with their free wi-fi. There's seating outside with wooden chairs as well.    Aside from this place from being crazy crowded...and expensive ($2.75 for the cupcake and $4.25 for the medium latte). I really liked my stay here.   So long, cowboy! ... and uh... hackers...until next time!. ; )

YxAdkZuKRfDr0J8QX1ym_Q.text: I haven't explored much from them, but I love their atmosphere, chai tea lattes, and macaroni and cheese.

Lbe6T-FXDvWmEky2H-fH1w.text: Bank of America at 4741 E. Ray Road, Phoenix, AZ 85044  I don't know how other Bank of America branches are but this one at 48th St. & Ray Rd is horrible. The only reason I went there was that it was the closest to my home.  They have horrible customer service and awful attitude toward their customers. They always insist that you make an appointment if you want to talk to someone other than a teller. They make it very difficult to make an appointment by posting someone near the door. Once you get the appointment, you get an email reminder, as if to say, you better be there on time!  They gave me an appointment for this morning (it was the only one available so I couldn't schedule an earlier time) but they did not keep it. The woman near the door kept telling me we are "a little late today; please wait". I waited for 40 minutes and complained a couple of times. She apologized but she didn't do anything about it other than saying "we are a little late today".   They had just one person working there, and whoever had the appointment before me was taking forever. She didn't want to disturb them, and she didn't think my time was valuable.  They should never schedule appointments that they cannot keep in a reasonable time. I didn't mind waiting for 15-20 minutes past my appointed time, but when that turned into 40 minutes with no end in sight (I had another appointment at 11 am elsewhere, so I had no choice but to leave at that point, since it didn't look like the only person working there would be done in the next 5-10 minutes), I told that woman in no uncertain words that I would not keep my money in their bank.    I have waited shorter times in doctors' offices. I am very unhappy with Bank of America. Why should I put my money in a bank that does not value my time? It is best to transfer my money to another bank. I know at least one that offers good customer service. In the past I was able to walk into the facility and get immediate attention, without an appointment, and good service too.

juNlkROajUy1jVMozCq6hA.text: Best coffee. Best place to study. Best coffee shop around. There is an amazing mixture of different people that come here which is one of the unique parts of Lux. Can come here for coffee and breakfast or for dinner and drinks.

RFhx4rRjrD82R8mP-G7_vg.text: I eat out once a week, and when I do, I bring more meals home with me to eat at a later time,  I'm a widower, and cooking for one is no fun!   I ate there last night, and for me, it was a Jekyll & Hyde experience for me.  I ate there four weeks ago and it was a wonderful experience.  I had Emily as a server, I asked for a couple of substitutions on the three meals I ordered and she was very accommodating and very friendly.  She even, without my asking, gave me quite a bit of their wonderful pizza bread to bring.  The bread is a real treat.  Last night, however, Emily wasn't working and my server was an older fellow who paid very little attention to me.  I constantly needed to ask for refills on my Iced Tea.  Unlike Emily who was always watching my table and at least three times during my meal, she asked if everything was OK.  No such luck last night.  To top everything off, one of the substitutions I requested was for meat sauce instead of marinara sauce on the ravioli dish I took home.  The server said OK and I thought it was.  But, when my bill came, I was charged $3.50 for a side of Bolognese sauce.  When I asked what that was for, the server told me that meat sauce was more expensive than marinara and that was what the charge was for.  I was floored - Emily didn't do that I said.  But he insisted.  I told him, that if there was an upcharge he should have told me up front.  I left an angry man, and my tip reflected that  When I got home, while putting away my two extra meals, they felt lighter to me.  I opened the containers, and sure enough the portions were about  the size they were on my first visit.  I am really confused about the difference.  But Vivala Emely!!!!!!!

qFV7vtvKpkTz9-gjb9WFkQ.text: This place is definitely interesting, but it's not for everyone, and I don't think it's for me, but t's ok. I'd still recommend going anyway just to try it and see what it's like. Incredibly heavy with hipsters, which is alright if that's your thing, but it's not really a place I'd go to hang out. Still it's fun to see something different. You almost forget your in Phoenix when there. It's fun/interesting/alright/different, but realistically speaking, I probably won't be back.

2GDZk4Ay9MbwMKuYF6nLUQ.text: Really enjoy this place... it's small but quaint and always busy because they're that delicious totally recommend it. Yay

KyIr9lq_RtfhDAMRHQ--Qg.text: My Fav!!! Come Here to study at least 2 days a week. I wish the music was a tad "study friendly", but I understand why it's not

ENloXvcwa_n8aUsmTVnaZw.text: My buddy turned me on to this place, and I'm so glad he did. I have no complaints at all... I like everything and anything about this place. Pastries, coffee, and it's a next to Pane Bianco  Ooooooo!

EU97yZInblhY1BSZVxvBUw.text: Love this place! Great Coffee, pastries and food!  Atmosphere is good, they are always busy, but they have more than enough seats!

Hp9tQgkahVPEFjlfXlv5WQ.text: Meh to the coffee and pastries. The ordering/line system still needs to be refined, especially at peak times. And the whole place could use a really good scrub (the dark and dingy ambiance brings the whole place down in my book).

I know what a good latte is but disappoint to find this establishment to this quality! I like to support locals but with this experience we will stick with Starbuck next time :(

6ydXmsz5R8mLQaSxT_UZMw.text: Love it here. It's as close I can get to a coffee shop back home in New York. I live in the far west valley and it is totally worth the trip downtown just to be in a casual coffee house reminiscent of a different place.

5VlNkSTxN45ly4FiOyAgww.text: Every time I think of Lux, I need to ask myself the who, when, where, how, and why:  - Who am I going to take to Lux today?  - When will I go back to Lux?... Hopefully soon. - How will I go to Lux today? ... Drive, bike, light-rail, walk, etc. - Where? 4400 N Central Ave. Phoenix, AZ 85012  - Why didn't I go to Lux sooner?  Lux is an amazing Coffee shop that is unique, artsy, and a chill place to enjoy delicious drinks/meals, hangout with friends, and a place to study and caught up on some reading. Compare to any other coffee shop I've ever been to, Lux is definitely a one that I recommend to all my friends and family to check out. Whenever I find time, or need a place where I could caught up on my studies, I always go to Lux.  Overall: Tell everyone you know that Lux is one of the best Coffee shops in Phoenix.

bz0ZWzvERaFgO6qHPZ_18Q.text: I'm going to keep it short and sweet (pun intended) if you like all things breakfast, pastries, good coffee and find yourself during the evening wanting to wind down then perfect because they have cocktails too! I was visiting from Seattle and my friend brought me to this place and I'm so glad they did, I loved this place and it was by far my favorite as far as coffee shops go. q4uAjL8_2GJ4wgafxt_jMQ.text: My favorite place ever! Best coffee, food and !!! I even ride my bike there. The  are amazing too. Best place for a date. Pet friendly and huge television screens. Staff is absolutely amazing.

HrqFaKGryXzPvrdhU3xnDw.text: Delicious gourmet food combined with a super friendly and casual atmosphere. I'm from out of town and was pleased to find this great local gem. Spacious with tons of seating, communal and private tables. I ate lunch, so I can't speak for those other tempting offerings, but the steak and cheese sandwich I had was fantastic and I would definitely come back to check out the cocktails at the bar across the room from the coffee counter.

BhtciXXGcb4w10-k3H_xPA.text: I met my husband here, so I'm a little biased :)  ... But that's exactly why I love Lux so much. It's very communal, chill and friendly which makes it a great place to meet cool people. When I first moved here three years ago, I didn't know a soul. So I used to go sit at Lux with my laptop every night. Despite being super shy, I'd always get chatted up by at least one person (many were cute dudes trying to hit on me, but also lots of lovely platonic friend-types, too). You won't find a more diverse mix of interesting people on a weeknight.   My Lux ritual helped me make friends, learn about PHX & break out of my shell.   Also: the lattes and baked goods are bomb diggity awesome. And though you wouldn't necessarily expect to get great eats at a coffee house, dinner is AMAZING too.   Thank you Lux for feeding me, entertaining me & helping me get hitched. XOXO

f-BiOm_Y6z8mHUMxcUT-JQ.text: Lux is one of my favorite places to meet with friends. There is diverse seating and the food and coffee is amazing! The staff there are great and unobtrusive without being totally absent.

ZnBUgOA4rWInu8N_gQoUxw.text: We love this place, every time we are in Phoenix, we stop by this place, strongly recommend to others, especially their whip cream, very good, not too strong and greasy

TIr0A5wsj3CLh4WUwACp1w.text: This is a total gem. It's usually packed, but there are always enough seats somehow. It's a great hipster cafe with really amazing art, a great vibe and ambiance, really nice people, and good coffee. There were a couple flies buzzing around, but they didn't bother me too much. 2RPDG-9xK-tm5NhqfKxvlQ.text: It's hard to find as there is barely a sign, but it is so worth it. This week our air conditioning has been out, so my husband and I have eaten several breakfasts, lunches and dinners at Lux. Not only do they have good A/C (!) their food, coffee and vino are wonderful. I love their salads, BLT and pastries. The atmosphere is conducive to either quiet conversations or getting work done. Good tunes and not too loud that you can't talk or think. One of my favorites in Phoenix!

eDDYkiljLT0SAjXLR5xlfQ.text: Great drinks, cool atmosphere, lots of space - and variety of settings.  The service was good as well, with a server giving me some recommendations without me even asking.  However, they play the music at a volume about twice as loud as any other coffee shop I've ever been to.  It was kind of obnoxious.  Other than that, really liked it.  If I come back, I'll bring noise cancelling headphones.

WSq__LKC5BKZZnAmeCu5CA.text: Still my favorite place to go and hang out... Awesome atmosphere, great staff, excellent food and drinks!!!  Sammy is awesome!! (Ride safe bro!) I would love to see Lux expand to the east and west side... They've done a great job!!  Cheers!!

attDozHwIPDYLUQ8H6S-vg.text: At long last, my first visit to Lux.  Located right across the street from Central High (my alma mater).  I'm not a coffee drinker, but was intrigued by the food and the atmosphere.  Not much for me to add to the numerous reviews about this place, but its pretty much as advertised.  Good food, quirky setup, crazy busy.  Its a coffee house first and foremost, but they also have a wine and cocktail bar.  Its a bakery that serves breakfast, but also has a lunch and dinner menu that changes regularly.  Sort of reminds me a little of La Grande Orange Grocery in that it has multiple personalities depending on the time of day.  Sometimes places that try to do everything well often don't do anything well.  But like LGO, this place is an exception.  I came here on a Saturday morning around 7am.  My timing was perfect as the crowds started streaming in shortly thereafter.  Parking can be a chore as there's maybe 15 spaces in their main lot, so be prepared to park along Turney Ave (which also happens to be overflow parking for the apartment complex next door).  You walk up towards the front counter and get teased by a smorgasbord of tantalizing pastries and can also order off the menu on the wall.  The sweet dutch pancake with fruit intrigued me so I grabbed that.  Also got sides of their bacon and hash, since those also seemed to be feature breakfast items.  Along with an OJ, total price for breakfast with tax came to about $18.  You order up front and pay, then seat yourself and wait for the kitchen to call out your name.  I can see how this could be troublesome when its busy.  While there's plenty of seating in back, the front area can get crowded and noisy really fast making it difficult to hear your order called out or navigate the throngs of patrons.  Fortunately, no such trouble for me this morning as I got my food within 10 minutes of ordering.  Sat down at the bar area up front (which is full stocked by the way).  The food was pretty solid.  The veggie hash was mostly potato, but you could pick up the carrots and other veggies mixed in.  The bacon was fantastic.  I'm not sure where they source it from, but the bacon strips were thick cut and the taste was nothing like your store brand bacon.  As for the pancake, mixed feelings on this.  A great assortment of fruit and they put on plenty of whipped cream on top.  The pancake itself was good, but honestly tasted like an afterthought.  It was super thin almost like a taco bowl and fell apart pretty easily when I cut into it.  Didn't hinder the taste at all, but the presentation was such that it was just sort of there.  Still, a tasty breakfast that left me full and satisfied.  I'll be back at some point for a lunch or dinner go round.  And next time I probably won't be able to resist those pastries.  Overall, I can see why this place is so popular with the CenPho crowd.  You'll see suits, students, and joggers alike in this place.  I can't speak to the coffee, but obviously Yelpers are pretty high on that here.  I would imagine the Brophy/Xavier/Central High students probably frequent this place regularly.  And yes I'm a little bummed this place wasn't around when I was a student across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet Dutch Pancake with fruit, veggie hash, bacon, and an OJ.  You MUST try the bacon.

pkWKoLS32qnlbw95_PLG0g.text: Always different pastries and they are tasty. Friendly baristas. Only been in the morning so don't know how the night crowd is. Is always busy and can be challenging to find a seat sometimes.

x4V9bSMl3MAbjr6B8ZHsbg.text: The food and drinks aren't bad. Cool atmosphere. It just feels like it's too crowded. I am all for a popular place but they have crammed so much seating in a small area it's hard to hear someone else speak. Drinks can be on the pricey side. All in all not bad.

Ta3s7jNPAY65PBZtbaTZqg.text: Lux is a good place for only coffee and tea, or for food. They have a wide variety of deserts and little snacks. I usually go there to study, but tend to go early so I get a spot as it fills up really fast during the weekends. If you get coffee you get free refills. The coffee is really good and people there are really nice.

bPLnuGnCzI3epPmNVON9sQ.text: Lux Central always has a beautiful Mykil Zep painting. Five stars. Coffee whip cream. Five stars.

q57sFV6-Seu-hJ-DPPgfaA.text: By far my favorite cafe in Phoenix - just wish it wasn't such a far drive from me! (Though I still make it because of how good it is). This place is the epitome of a "hipster" hangout, and many people seem to hang out here to "be seen". Their drinks are good, the environment is good for relaxing/doing some light work, and the pastries are delicious - they also seem to have different ones to choose from every day, and everything is baked fresh in-house. There are multiple rooms to sit in, but seating can still be tough and you might be hard pressed to find anything during the busier times (especially on the weekend). The crowd here also definitely skews younger, and most of the employees too. Overall, I'd highly recommend it if you seek an atmosphere similar to what I've described.

n5qClYGwDFz0Xe6pj8NxCA.text: I miss this place allot. I stop going for the reason of bad service .. I came back and found out that my buddy it's working back again !! (Manager) coffee amazing .. recommend !! Good job, great atmosphere and great place!

yhM9No5tfFEyCDsxDOl9Lw.text: I absolutely love this place, best mocha latte EVER! And don't get me started on the pastries YUM!

Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dutch Pancakes and Berries. Exquisite !

uBszPApfhvEW7mvgb76jFA.text: I know I'm going against the grain here, but Lux is just not my scene.  I've attempted to come here twice before, but tables were packed out and I needed to cram for an exam, not chat with some random guy at my table about philosophy.  The third time, I had no studying to do and therefore got to experience some of the "culture" of the location.  That's how I learned that I've been trying to come to Lux for the wrong reason - you don't come here to study, you come here to look and be seen.  You might do some light studying while also achieving the before-stated goals, but it's not your primary reason for visiting Lux.  Lux feels more like a bar than a coffee shop, which might be explained by the fact that they seem to have a full-service alcohol bar as well as their caffeine menu.  Patrons will likely randomly strike up a conversation with you.  They may or may not be on ecstasy when they do.  This place is hipster-center, with baristas who are working frantically to keep up with the large and growing line, and with crowds of people taking up most available seating at peak hours while writing books on typewriters.   That said, the coffee is good, and they look like they have a wide range of food options.  I had a chai and sampled a few other drinks.  The coffee was definitely was better than most coffee chains.  I understand the appeal - if hipsters are your crowd, you'll love this place.  For me, I much prefer a small, intimate coffeeshop where you're automatically greeted with a smile and where you can bury yourself in a textbook for hours on end.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chai. Desserts look great too today.

eh5T7fVGTQ9C8TurLfbP8w.text: I try to go to Lux as often as possible but I still have mixed feelings about it.   The cappuccino is wonderful; one of my favorites! I can't say that enough! I recommend making a trip to try one if you haven't! The food is always tasty and unique. If you can find a good place to sit I would try ordering one of the items on their menu, really fantastic! All of the pastries I have tried have been delicious also! I am telling you, you need to go!  The only reason Lux gets a 4 instead of 5 is because of the atmosphere. When I go its hit or miss, most of the time I get the impression they are way too hipster - bordering pretentious - to care about your experience. The following are just a couple examples:  I wanted to try a drink at their full bar one night, so I asked one of the employee's behind the bar what he had in his hand and he responded with "ice". Yes, there was a piece of ice held in a pair of tongs in one hand, but he also had a cocktail in the other hand... Following his response, he walked away from me and never returned to ask if I had any interest in ordering a drink or to give me any clue about what he'd been making. Most restaurants and employee's attempt to make you feel involved and entice you to purchase something, but no such luck. Unfortunately that experience was followed by another unpleasant one at the bar on a different night, so I haven't felt inclined to drink there again.   I had another recent experience with lux when I ordered a quiche from the front. We waited 10 minutes for them to heat it up but it was never called. So we checked and they said "oh, it must still be in the oven".. Although, didn't bother checking on the item or why this was taking so long to heat (since its already cooked). After another 10 minutes we checked with the front again and she finally went to check and said, "Oh, I guess its been in the oven the whole time". Needless to say it was overdone. The staff didn't apologize or offer a replacement, sadly this didn't impress my friend who hadn't been to Lux.  I still say you should go, the food and espresso are amazing. I just wish they would come back down to earth a little bit.

TFVB8Dy2Ki1QK9mHSVMyJg.text: I've lived in Central Phoenix for over 24 years and had never tried Lux until recently (yes, shame on me).  Tried their black and white coffee with their marshmallow pumpkin pie and both things were really good.  The coffee had fresh made whip cream, which was amazing.  I'm not a huge coffee drinker, but I'd find an excuse to come back here soon.  The atmosphere of the place is pretty laid back in a hipster kind of way.   Looking forward to going back and trying more.

V6ILOmkBKaJ6D8GlICl0tA.text: Best coffee in phx hands down... But it's not just coffee.... The food there is amazing. When I find myself having the late night munchies I always order the mac n cheese with bacon and jalapenos and an Arnold Palmer.  When I'm craving for coffee it's always the Americano.  They have different types of pastries everyday so they always mix it up. It really good, everything and it's a must try.

JQ5Ub69oe9nVtxYpk1l6Fw.text: Indeed the best espresso in town and many places i travel too.... It is located next to Pane Bianco. The people at lux take coffee very seriously, almost to a science, looking at the applied,focused and meticulous moves of the barista. The result is an amazing espresso, thick and oily, an explosion of coffee flavors and zero bitterness....  For those who enjoy, lux looks and feel almost like a 1960's hippie communal cantina except that most the patrons there are deeply absorbed in gazing at their laptops and ipads, facebooking and interacting in cyberspace, certainly not talking to one another. You will find here a hipster ambience, very stylish, very friendly and quite comfortable, as well.  On my last visit there 2 days ago, I was greeted by a charming barrista, but cashed in by a very abrupt, borderline rude young plump woman.... This killed the whole experience for me.... No matter how great the coffee is, the least she could have done is say please and thank you, especially at nearly 8 bucks for an espresso and a medium latte.  Oh well.....The coffee there is still unbelievable, especially if you combine it with the Dutch pancake and the homemade whipped cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dOCrMPik4CKtOsB40le7GA.text: I love their pastries and they always have the most delicious iced tea!  The atmosphere is great for meeting with a few people, or even a small group. I love that there's a room with plenty of tables and space that I can use to work or study. Definitely a great spot, everything is delicious and their food is not to be missed!

ajgDg9ruuncgDb_RNCok7Q.text: Lux is a unique coffee experience. It is very trendy and busy and filled with lots of people of all ages doing all sorts of things ranging from writing novels to playing games to chatting with each other. There are lots of rooms to be in and lots of seating arrangements. They also host various meet up groups including a writers group which is what brought me to Lux for the first time. It is a cool place and you'll feel cool if you go there. And by the way, the coffee and the pastries are wonderful!

P-BE1_kcZZ9eI_ieL_tGoA.text: Lux has a hip vibe with excellent coffee and food. Great mix of people from all walks of life enjoying coffee together. The hot breakfast Elsa's incredible. We had the egg sandwich and biscuits and gravy. Both the Americano and Chai Tea Latte were very good. The Chai was a bit mild. The Quad shot Americano was super smooth and flavorful. Really want to make another trip to try the bakery.

3roUW2LemNXHtfkAH7PWJg.text: I finally got to experience lux when it wasn't way too busy! Yay! It was actually comfortable to be in because I didn't have to sit next to a stranger or crowd around the register while waiting for my coffee. Their coffee is always delicious, I just wish the set up was better and had more seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vanilla lattes are the best

GJkUnMW1JRybOQ6tUnOP6A.text: So happy to have this spot in my hood. It's one of the first places we checked out when we moved here. I'm a fan of the iced coffee (feels expensive though at $4) and pastries, but look forward to trying a cocktail sometime. We're early birds so it's fantastic that this is open super early every day. I like the decor, especially the huge David Bowie wall art.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sitting on the back patio

Fec6F5_yIthWYJqyIZtwlw.text: Gurl I just want more room. I've been coming since I was 16, I'm 29 now. It's hard to enjoy the amazing place y'all have created when I keep getting elbowed by people trying to get in line and having to sit on the laps of stranger practically, when I just want to get a cold brew and a shot of whiskey and a place to feel relaxed

oIrtKzzP906DbzCGV2TFHg.text: High energy, noisy, youthful coffee bar/ cafe with a wide variety of good pastries. Great spot for people watching, not so good for conversation.

Nrttnt0gp1qw9zAyVYrIjQ.text: In Tempe for a month or so and needed to find a coffee place for me to study and to get out of my room.  I've been to several...all of whom were listed in Yelp and local "best of" articles.    This is it!  This is a special place at a USA comparison level.  I've searched for 'my place' in every city I've lived and visited!  Again, this is it.  It succeeds not only as a coffee house, but also succeeds as a breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks place as well.  Think "Friends" watering hole!  It's big because it stitches together several rooms.  Each has a different personality that serve different purposes...study/reading quietly, TV room; then others for talking with another person, and others for meeting with a group of people.      Great, great bacon mac & cheese, lemonade, iced coffee...it's what I tried today.   Great selection of pastry...which I didn't try!  People are friendly.  Definitely a hang out...and worth any drive from all points of the Phoenix/Tempe area.

VhZYEc1HGC94XnRuPspVxg.text: Meh; typical hipster/college hangout in central Phoenix. Not bad, but not great. I don't like comparing businesses, but I would rather go to Fame, just down the street for much better coffee, food, and atmosphere. I came here on a Sunday afternoon with my husband and daughter. Not the cleanest, but they were busy, so I understand. Coffee was ok; too much syrup in my latte. Breakfast sandwich was not good. It was cooked fine, but was lacking in flavor and the bacon was so dried out and hard, it was like a wood chip in my sandwich (ok so I'm being a bit dramatic, but seriously, don't ruin my bacon). No thanks. Will not be returning. Sorry Lux.

Ff3LAiwVNCeDzDu6j22Frw.text: Best coffee and dessert in town! It is a great place to chill alone or with company. The staff is always lovely!

4eAx-_2ZP4ZNEduZ712-KA.text: They are legendary and everyone in the local coffee scene is aware of this place. Food is great, coffee is good, and this is what makes Lux special.   Finding this place can be a bit tasking for first-timers as it is easy to miss. When you do find the place, parking just adds on more stress. The place itself is always exceptionally busy, so expect a wait time to order. The good thing is they stay on top of things so it's not too bad.   The cool parts: They serve alcohol. Food is fresh. Did I mention they serve alcohol? Also they are open till 2a for all those NIGHT RIDERS!!! (I am the Night Rider!!)   The off putting parts: The place is busy which means finding a table can be impossible at times (including the back area). My biggest critique goes to their music. Their "background music" is obnoxiously loud. It feels like you're at a club and that is disappointing for a place like this. I go here to enjoy good food, coffee, and even conversation. Turning it a bit down is all I ask. This may be just a personal quibble, but that's what I feel bothers me the most.  Overall this is a fantastic place, and you haven't lived unless you've came here for breakfast!! :)

GxM-mazfaUF8USH-cNgpHQ.text: Between the vibe of the atmosphere and the people you cannot go wrong ! It's a great place to catch up with old friends, meet new friends , or simply enjoy yourself. The food is up to point and is fresh. Not only do they have pastries, fresh fruit, but their is a FULL BAR!!! While it's conveniently located right off the light rail it's hard to say no! Keep in mind it's such a rad place that it's always busy and filled with people. If you're planning on studying be prepared to search for a place to sit. Parking is limited in the lot with an overflow of street parking. It's well worth a try and I can assure you that you will not be disappointed, unless of Course you're one to just find issues at places. With friendly staff and music playing you can't go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aunt glady&#39;s .
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baristas brewing it up!

_T5oG65FPJgvFDmi-gRv1g.text: Got the coffee at Gallo Blanco.  Liked it.  They said the coffee was from Lux.  We then went to Lux and got 3 bags of beans to take back with us.  The end.

UmWuxyMuRmBdxY-PH-wuKg.text: One of my favorite spots. The mac and cheese with jalapeno (minus the bacon) is THE BEST!

7-8ajK6pymk_gynDXIyo_g.text: Excellent place to be! I love the fact you have the option of ordering food, beer or wine in a casual coffee shop environment. I love it!

Y_elP7qcgpq1P2KwVbJskQ.text: YUM-O as Rachel Ray would say. How have all of these little places popped up in downtown Phoenix? Or...how have I not discovered them all until now?? I  LOVE this cafe. The service is fast, quick, and easy. The coffee...strong and sssmmoottthhh. This place is cozy and laid back. Radiohead was playing in the background. I had their veggie egg bake which was delicious though I wish they gave me more bread! It was so good. Brought home peanut butter cookies for my boyfriend and those were devoured right away. The atmosphere is great, decor is unique and has a slight hipster feel. They serve wine also which I found to be interesting. And the employees were friendly. Try this place out. I could really go for some of that coffee right about now. The baked goods in the window all looked decadent and they have a lot of vegan and vegetarian options.   (tried a bite of a vegan doughnut that my friend had.....did not like. I guess I like my butter and eggs deep fried in oil. It was just not the same.)

Tm3WLJONxZ53JjLga72vOg.text: Lux has a great ambiance and serves excellent coffee. In my experience it is often busy but customers are willing to share table space and couches with others as needed. Definitely a bright spot on the Phoenix coffee landscape!

9sV-63UDAGb1ngitUKDPRw.text: This place is a great coffee shop--great place to work or meet someone for a chat. The pastries are exceptional. They also have booze, and a full menu (I think). Parking is rough, as is getting a place to sit at times.

Jcmqq0_emsm4BFDsZTwEKA.text: I used Adams restoration company to upgrade my electrical.  They installed 12 can lights in the garage.     I only had the light from the garage door so it was very dull.  I can't say enough about them.  Sean and Justin showed up, they got the job done, and they where on time.  Very professional people, they went above and beyond the call of duty.  I will be using this company again in the future.  I will be referring all my friends and family to this company.

hsUBRTA76mhgmYMN6pIGmA.text: Thumbs up! This place is great. We missed it twice while driving, but finally managed to locate it. Pretty kick back. Amazing pastry and latte. It's as good, if not better than what NYC's coffee shops. They have a lot of place to sit inside and outside. Some ppl have laptops and studying/ doing work, while others are chilling. Glad I drove down 25 mins to come here. Must try..

MvyePDDvHLvF4TWS4N_KGg.text: I really, really, really want to give Lux  5 stars.  It certainly has the best selection and quality of baked offerings of any of the Valley's coffee bars.  They do great main food selections, and will even customize.  It is terrifically hip.  But oy vey -- do they need somebody to manage their service lines!  They don't seem understaffed, but the charming, friendly and attractive children who work there are SOOOOO easily distracted, forgetful and just plain slow when the place gets busy.  I return because I love the environment and the quality of their product, but whoever owns this place should really step up the service game.

m1ECtYq9i1JqUCZsvnqzig.text: Love this location. Extremely good coffee and elaborate latte art. I live right down the street and this is an awesome place to come relax. The dinner options are great too. The only reason I give them 3 stars is because it is extremely extremely busy. Very hard to find a spot. Also, customer service is virtually non existent in this establishment. The employees are rude and do not care about the customers. Sure do make a good latte tho!

hp1964aXPFGUdaf8hHqOig.text: Why Have I not rated this place yet?  Probably because I don't want it to get any more people in front of me in line to get some of the best espresso served in Phoenix.  Lux is amazing, no joke without this place I wouldn't of graduated from college.  They hours of operation is incredible, allowing students to crack down on their papers before their deadlines.  The range in menu is pure bliss.  From coffee to alcohol all the way to muffins to Steak dinners, if there isn't one thing on the menu you don't want, it's because you probably want it all.  It's sincerely my home away from home.  I'm there practically everyday.

z3dEvE3et-hReNnSbxNmCQ.text: Overcrowded with hipsters, but the coffee is great! My personal fave drink to order is the black and white.

XxPDHrQvVjkdLK6AB7cEZQ.text: I really love the environment at Lux - it's a great place to study or catch up with a friend.  I got the blueberry scone and the hibiscus iced tea and both were great.  The scone was moist and delicious.  I also had some of my friend's coffee and donuts (Chocolate and Lemon) which were delicious as well.  Overall, it's a great place and if I lived in the area I'd definitely be a frequent customer!

TDPunc7GLU-ixPo_7ivQDQ.text: I am still giving this place 5 stars, as they absolutely deserve it. However, my one beef is that, while the music is great, it's just too loud for getting work done. Trying to listen to my own music via headphones doesn't work at all, unless I crank it LOUD (which is hardly conducive to getting work done either).   Please Lux, can you tone it down a little? At least during working hours?

5ze-wiZNqNCQsNEa-U_8NQ.text: Another little gem I will miss from Phoenix.  Words that describe this place: Cute, unique, retro, fresh, simply (menu's), and lively.    I have been to this place twice on two different visits, both times really packed.  I like this ambiance.  The coffee menu was simple and the coffee was individually made.  If you are looking for a spot to study or relax and people watch..this is the spot.  Otherwise, bring headphones, you'll still enjoy it minus the noise. :) Enjoy!  Oh and btw..i ordered the Red Eye coffee with room for cream and hazelnut (their delicious coffee with two shots of espresso over ice!)

tzO_11FIMWUoP2WMF-FOrw.text: This is about Poindexter Moving Co. I moved twice in the last 3 months and I used the services of Poindexter in both occasions. Before move I received quotes from several moving companies but Poindexter gave mw the best quote. Poindexter was referred to me by Uncle Bob's (Scottsdale) where my furniture was stored. They came to my house to assess the scope of work and gave me a quote with a 'not to exceed' clause. Not only they were the best price wise they did a great job with both moves. They dismantled everything and wrapped them in protected quilts. They hired a staff of six energetic men and two trucks to do the move. Fast but careful they accomplished the job in a very short time. They also followed with me after the move and came down to fix a few items that could not be done at the time of move. I have not claimed any damage from the move.   I would strongly recommend Poindexter - why try some one else and pay more money when you can get the best deal for less.

LtinJt3Vkpr__jdnGI_L4g.text: Love Love this place! Amazing coffee, great service, and great vibes.

t25i2qfhcXkXhJJ6AOpv_w.text: I've had two meetings here thus far. Both were pretty cool - I'll be honest it was a bit pricey but the decor and ambiance more or less justifies the price.

flvMAVAd9Zj2pvX502p5Mg.text: Hip and casual with great lighting for a morning nosh and tasty espresso.

eoaYZrxaqtUut4_M8iHtMQ.text: Say what you will about the overwhelming amount of goofy hipsters at this place, but out of all the breakfasts I've had in the valley, this is my favorite. I get the two eggs/hashbrowns/tomatoes and everything is always exceptional. It can be a bit chaotic during peak hours and finding decent seating a challenge, but I am willing to deal with all of this for their delicious food.

y6mcXtoP37VKf29UUjzmAQ.text: I dug my latest experience here Friday night. I hadn't been by in a few years but Lola coffee had locked their doors at 8:30pm (wtf???), so lucky for me, Lux is right down the street. It wasn't too busy although there was a very steady stream of people in and out. I had a small, non-fat sugar free vanilla latte ($4) and picked up a homemade, oatmeal creme sandwich for $3.   Pluses: I love the msmatched, kind-of random decor that makes you feel very comfortable. Free WiFi, and a wide variety of baked goods. I can ALWAYS be sold on baked goods. This might be a weird plus, but I was totally loving their ice water with fresh oranges inside. I am probably the only person that never had this before, but who cares, I loved it. Totally refreshing on a hot AZ night.   Neutral: The employees weren't exactly friendly but weren't rude, either...just kind of indifferent. Hmmm, correct that, they were very friendly with the regulars but I sort-of felt unwelcome at first but I quickly got over that.   Negatives: The music is too loud. Maybe that was intentional towards the end of the night but I was having an extremely difficult time focusing on what I was studying. Don't get me wrong, I loved the music but it was a bit much. Okay, alot much.   Bottom line, this is still a great little local coffee shop and I might be stopping here instead of Lola next time...

otIIlU-t8uR5SjAMsG7VzA.text: This is my favorite coffee shop. They have free refills on drip coffee iced tea and dollar refills on red eyes and iced coffee. Though the pastries are a bit on the expensive side they are totally worth it. The changing lunch menu is always fantastic!

LRcJarUakEORECWfRfCJyw.text: This is an awesome coffee shop.   So far, my favorite in the valley.  Really cool atmosphere which draws in a lot of people.  Not your average mostly empty cafe.  Nice selection of food and most importantly, the coffee is excellent.

bTaj275t30q75OlDdFuGTw.text: Been awhile since I visited but wanted to give them some mega praise. Best Mac & Cheese I ever had. Loved watching World Cup games there too this summer. Wonderful place. I'll be back for sure.

ZqQwTIx4_Gm2C6jy3AUZ0A.text: First off I love the food, it's always tasty and just as I ordered. And the coffee - delicious, never burned. My only issue with Lux is the staff. Don't get me wrong, I have yet to walk into Lux when they are not busy. How ever, what happened to service with a smile? I always feel rushed once I get to the register to give my order and they generally have a crappy attitude. It's hard enough to find a place to sit so make it easier for me to go back by being nicer!

qdoog-d6TCuOVwxK5pu5rg.text: Really wonderful space.  I love the myriad options...I'll have a brewed, tropical flavored ice tea, no wait, I'll have a glass of pinot noir, no wait I'll have a chai latte with soy milk...um, wait, how's the lemonade? This was me at the counter trying to order (ok, not really- but it's what was going on in my head).  Lux is the perfect place to get some work done while still interacting with the 3 dimensional people.  When I'm reading some clinical texts and I'm afraid I'm going to slip into a coma, I go to Lux.  Somehow reading boring things in the presence of fascinating people is substantially more doable.

TDHvTH92wCg-hzpv9E9m_Q.text: Good place, really relaxing & laid back, the workers are wonderful and attentive as well. Everything is good, the whole setup I like it, only problem is that it is sometimes hard to find seating but I know that is not fully their fault since it isn't a huge building, still a great place to go & eat or socialize!

7zOaxLxFo89Vagl6e62SnQ.text: Great place to kick back in central PHX. Desserts were epic and the food looked amazing.

TBn025L1iA3LAIT7N3dCBw.text: I used to be hater.   I admit it. The skinny jean wearing, mac using vibe used to irk me in ways that I thought only a mosquito could. I would drop in, get every drink to-go and get the heck out of there as quickly as possible. Loud music, fauxhawks, etc...   SIGH.   Oh Lux. You're new space is sublime. There is enough space where I can find a cozy corner, turn on my work laptop, drink coffee, have the 2 egg breakfast with tomato and veggie hash (I opt for the tomatoes instead of bacon. AND. I love bacon, so i think that's saying something about how stinkin' good those tomatoes are).... Where was I? Oh yes, have my work computer on... so Office Communicator is running... ;) ... and I can enjoy breakfast (which frequently turns into brunch) and read the paper, a magazine, a book, make travel plans, etc.   LOVE it.   Also for you futbol fans (that's soccer to you english speaking folks), they will happily play your Barcelona should-be champions, on the big screen in the back room- all you gotta do is ask.   ***Speakeasy bar area. The mixologist takes some serious time and consideration for each adult beverage I've ever had there or seen him make. Delicious bloody mary's, GREAT beer selection (New Beligum Cocoa Mole!), etc. etc. etc.   I feel that I can't run out of good things to say about this place. If you were a hater like I was, go back and try it again. You'll find the new vibe is much more welcoming... OR maybe I've adapted :)

jUbNiER82t3CAJIAqv0rRw.text: I paid for a jar of coffee  and the manager had no idea they were out of jars. He gave me an IOU and told me to return in a couple days. I came back and they were still out of jars. The manager gave me a complimentary pound of coffee for my trouble.  Thank you guys!  You rock and your coffee does too.

ZOn0BOUM8-97W18S33XA_g.text: Love this place!  Great coffee and sweet treats.  I love the funky down to earth ambiance and the crowd is usually really chill.

-WunyT_aeaP3jCv7DAUD1w.text: My iced coffee was really good.  The place was pretty crowded and had a nice vibe about it.  Music wasn't my favorite but not bad.  The only negative comment I have is the furniture is really kind of gross.  It is almost like they got it from curbside on garbage day! lol  I would go back though.

OQBcwBeHLV_sx5QbbBfjWw.text: Great coffee, vibe, and food.   TERRIBLE parking, take the light rail if you can!

Y0u-NKP5e3hnldgMDZ3vhg.text: I was at first taken a back! It was not what I was expecting, a little loud at first. Not the perfect place to have a quiet conversation.  After I was ver my initial disappointment. I was able to enjoy the place. Major complain is that there was no actual menu. It is in a mall glass near the barista and people block it because they are waiting in line to order.

lXhOlRXacCTwC2crHuzNdQ.text: Great atmosphere and environment. Went in to try the coffee. Went ahead and got a flavored latte. Their short fat cups can kind of throw you off on sizes. Paid $5, was kind of surprised at the price so was hoping for something to really to blow me away. It was good but not great. They have a bar as well and food.

sV7ULE1W1i0KOVkKqKO7Bg.text: Seriously? The person that runs this place is genius. I must find a way to copy your entire idea and move it to a beach for myself. I thought I walked into my own dream when I came in here. I haven't been to Lux in about 1.5 years and since then it has moved into the building next to the old one, tripled in size and is the most delicious, eclectic coffee experience I could ask for. Looking for fresh hand roasted coffee on site, check! Fresh made unique pastries, check! Fresh, gourmet-like food, check! Handmade from fresh (and I mean FRESH squeezed juice) mimosas, check! I can go on....I could not ask for a better place to be a part of my life. Thank you heaven for waiting for me to find you.

--B4MfqBxNuXX8ujyh8VXg.text: The coffees are to die for, and the salted chocolate chip cookies are THE BEST! Cannot wait to go back some day and try the rest of the food!

o3uZldxwyL5RN5s9zTKojQ.text: Came here once to meet a friend for chat time.  Had some tea since I am really not much of a coffee drinker.   I think next time I get a chance I would like to go and try some of the food.  The meals look wonderful sadly I was just not hungry to try. Parking can be a bit trying but granted the location I would like to try round 2 in this place.
