It has a calming hipster coolness to it and if it were much closer to my place I would make it a regular hangout when I need to get stuff done.

KLKGVR-hLLCS2OhAxBLKeg.text: This hipster coffee shop should not put anyone off. Coffee was excellent! The lemon cake was a morning favorite as well. It's worth the wait if you see a long line, which moves quick anyway. From the chill DJ beats to the great mix of young, old, artist, business persons. This coffee shop was a gem in down town.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cappuccino + a sticky bun=Good Morning!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmmocha

lwlnkN2O814BnL792MYpuA.text: This place used to be a great place to visit and get a morning coffee. The last time I went in there it was so crowded and everyone seemed like they were giving me dirty looks. I guess I didn't fit in with the crowd that was their or something...

XxPwQJGSISBAtn_gYPpoug.text: This is the place in central Phoenix. I have been coming here for a few years and never had a bad time. It gets busy just like any good place does so prep for that.   Ill layout the highlights:  Homemade pastries always amazing Killer hang out spot Coffee is on point  Cocktails are devine Beer and wine selection is solid Menu is limited and rotating but holy he'll so good Atmosphere is chill and hipster  Music is always good Warm and friendly staff Outdoor seat in if that's your thing  I mean the only drawback I can think of is that it get a busy. But not too busy to not come here. Most people are chilling and doing homework and stuff, so its not a roudy crowd.

pewj8YZvP6EyngQoMdwiEg.text: Usually I'm a huge fan of this place but I came in earlier today and ordered an ice black and white. The girls making my drinks are busy chatting with each other and finally hand me my drink. By the time I get to my car I taste the coffee and all they did was make an iced latte.. that I paid $6 for.

RKWNA9pCbGA3DAyzg-qxvA.text: Hands down, the best place to get a cup of coffee in Phoenix (and I've drank a lot of coffee in my days). Atmosphere could not be better, with funky furniture and art throughout the place. The pastries never disappoint. Tends to be crowded, and rightfully so. It's worth your visit.

n3rjYZIvLk1LNFVo8U5KXg.text: When did central Phoenix become a hipster mecca?! My sister lives in Portland and is into the coffee scene there so she wanted to try Lux based on all the reviews. Upon arrival I was a little confused where it even was - as it's literally a cinder block facade with no signage if you enter from central. As for the coffee, I kept it basic and got an iced coffee. It was fine. Wouldn't come out of my way to come here, but they do have lots of seating options for those that like the coffee scene.

UTTmgxmkchVkNjaKqVsz2A.text: Iced vanilla latte with a scoop of whipped cream.  To. Die. For.  I also had the biscuits and sausage gravy.  The gravy is BOMB.

RPph7Ndl12b5Vuj8iaNj4g.text: Some of the best coffee in Phoenix! They know their coffee! They also have great pastries and a bar. They're open late. Hipster vibe. The only downside is that sometimes it's crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MxMZOQATgphL9H5AR5TB1A.text: As an out of towner I was excited to check this place out. Our dear friends had brought me a pound of their beans which I thoroughly enjoyed. The ambiance is unique and noteworthy. I tried a cheddar jalapeno muffin which was a nice blend of sweet and savory. The coffee on the other hand was underwhelming. I got a whiteout cappuccino and my wife got a vanilla latte. Upon tasting the espresso in both drinks, I could taste an unpleasant bitterness which I describe as chemical or turpentine. This usually means the beans were improperly roasted. I also think the microfoam on the cappuccino could have been prepared better as it was more bubbly than a good cappuccino normally has.   I could have visited on an off day as I know I have had good beans from here before. Off days happen sometimes.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White out cappuccino

TYwyF4cC5WkLdNHEWF482A.text: The cafe that changed my opinion of this town.  Lux is the kind of place middle aged women go to pretend they are hip, the place where you won't find any seating unless you come at an odd hour, and most of all the place where I find myself pretending to study but end up just being amazed at people who are actually studying.  Best coffee in town, considering the size of the kitchen and that they do all their baking and cooking in here, the size of the menu and the outcomes of every dish that I've had in the last 4 years are astonishing, from pastries to quiche, mac and cheese to steak dinners this place can make whatever you're craving with honors. Also probably the most hipster bar I've ever seen, but boy do they do it right. Wonderful cocktails and decent beer and wine selection.   To some it's a magical place, to others it's a over-hyped coffee shop. Either ways this place has established itself and definitely deserves a try.

8dhyHdt5UY0frAx-XdHzUQ.text: Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that they forgot my coffee order on my last visit.  Otherwise it's a great place.  Excellent atmosphere.  Casual laid back hipster kinda vibe.  Delicious food .  Will come here for drinks at some point.    Great art by local artists as well.

tcG5M_IaMIqYom2FWFyI5Q.text: Perfect place to launch into the workday morning! I would totally pass this place up if it wasn't for the Yelp Universe and raves from Cheryl B., thanks, woman! Located opposite Central High, and a bit tricky to get to, but worth the effort.  My dear daughter and I would meet for coffee a few times a month, closer to home, but NOW, we meet more often and drive further just to enjoy the ambiance and perfectly brewed Joe! We usually arrive soon after they open, which we've learned, beats the morning rush between 7:15 and 7:45.  The morning goodies, from what I gather, are made fresh on site and worth sampling every muffin, cake, scone or pastry! Its hard to decide what to order, unless the cranberry orange muffins are available. Not a big frappe or latte drinker, so I get the dark roast house brew in a to-go cup, so when we leave, it's easier getting our refill on the run out the door...don't be shy, just belly up to the front o the line and the great staff will take care of ya!  And remember their tip, they deserve it!  We sit way in the back, past the restrooms, where it's a bit more conducive to conversation and very comfy couches. A great place to study, or get a bit of work done, too...free Wi-Fi. This is our hang out for Father Daughter time, thanks, Cheryl B., and LUX!!.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Boom! My new office space

vvEY_pgDCei9UzJj9CqBvw.text: Right now is 7:46 am 07-20 friday we have been sitting trying to do home work and even talk your male employee behind the counter clapping yelling singing talking about his personal life sorry TOO LOUD ASK HIM TO SHUT UP PLEASE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

C-0pJTjCT6wgq2kVYLPE2g.text: One of my favorite places in the entire state. At Lux you will get: excellent coffee from beans roasted on site, homemade baked goodies, sneaky great food, amazing cocktails, and a family-run business with staff that get to know you. Can't recommend enough!

8EtRvNPWVhvyrZh4QelgXg.text: Sometimes all you need is a good cup of coffee.  Once in a while all I can think of is having "a good cup of cofee" Thnak goodness I didn't have to travel far from work. Lux, simply, has some of the best coffee I have ever had. Lux roast thier beans The beans on site, and the baristas are friendly,  knowledgeable, and accomadating.  High quality products, deliciously fresh pastries and a fully-stocked bar, who could ask for anything more. So if your looking for a great cup of coffee,an inviting atmosphere, then  Lux should be on your list of places to visit while in Phoenix.

of-Q8m8SPXoGznPq4EAupA.text: We kept seeing everyone check into this place and it had tons of reviews, so we knew we had to give it a go - and what a fun place! The line was really long when we walked in, but they whipped through it in no time and the woman taking the orders was really friendly and helped to make decisions since we were first timers and all.  She was very patient and answered all our questions (which we tried to keep short due to the line).  Now, the place itself is super eclectic and there is art and decor to look at no matter where you sit on the inside.  The porch was packed, so we weren't able to enjoy the nice day outside, but the inside isn't a bad backup at all.  We got to sit next to Marilyn Monroe on a pink couch that was comfy and the wood slate table is something I would put in my house in a heartbeat.  Our orders: me - a mocha with a crumb cake, his - vanilla latte with lemon cake.  We didn't realize until we were out of the line that they served full breakfast plates!  That'll happen next time for sure.  The coffees tasted great and the crumb cake was delicious.    Overall: A Fun and artsy with good coffee and pastries galore...yes, please!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crumb cake and Vanilla Latte

nX0DKTjthQ3kLfKMs2Qa-g.text: Amazing coffee. One of my favorite places to go to get coffee and a snack. Amazing snacks and pastries. Great food. The staff is always amazing and can get some very decadent drinks while you either wait foe you food to go or sit down and eat it there and take in the atmosphere.

Myp-2Cu4d_rY8vKNJ3yvZg.text: This is hands down my favorite coffee shop in the Phoenix area! The drinks are delicious, and the employees are always so friendly! Try it, you won't be sorry!

l0xhkw2SghOGrdlDv9tIkg.text: "Hipster" spot with good food ( the Mac and cheese ) grown up drinks order the Last Word, coffee and lots of comfortable sweating to sit, drink, eat and socialize. It's eclectic, you'll hear loud music and see people on laptops building and creating as well groups getting together. Clean, friendly and a fun spot on a Saturday night for after dinner drink on a food crawl.

kd3J5PYA93I6-8XgZlDGJA.text: This place is good, but I don't know if it hangs on the top coffee shops list for me. First off, the vibe is great. There is a live DJ killing it. Love that. Secondly the decor is sort of bohemian hipster meets contemporary flea market. Super cool! Got a macchiato that was tasty and then wanted cold brew, but the best they had was an iced Americano, which is 1 of 2 things that makes this 3 stars instead of 4. I got the chorizo quiche, which was incredibly tasty, but came out cold after the people forgot about my order. So I enjoyed it, but not as much as I could have. Haha. Next time I'm in Phoenix, it's a high possibility I'll return and see if I can give it a 4 or 5 next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Macchiato. Great.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Live DJ killing it.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rad vibes

Le5GeH0NZhp5xDBBIsM3lg.text: Lux is one of those coffee shops in Phoenix that as a coffee lover, you must try once, because whether you like it or not, this is a beehive for people and ideas. Aside from boasting solid roasts, a large baked goods selection, and a full bar, its central location and late hours makes this 'the spot' for hipsters, millennials, freelancers, and students alike. If you like to people watch and engage in random conversation amidst laptop work, or come hang out with your friends, this is the place. I've been approached to be a hair model (not creepy, awesome), gotten recommendations on books, found and returned a wallet, and gotten my laptop work done, all while sitting down by pink Starship Trooper paintings on the wall. Bring your headphones if you want to tune the chaos out, but if you'd rather do that, you should probably go to another coffee shop instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced Mocha and Red Velvet Cake

vunqGyjgTSB3BYEiMZs7vQ.text: Love this place! Fresh, delicious and friendly. The place is very popular and crowded. Nice place for chatting.

oFEk0YUrjCrvVV-IyIeYDw.text: Funky vibe. Good music. A place to go no matter what kind of boost you need. Full bar / fresh food / & coffee!! You cannot go wrong... unless it's a full house.

aLK7pLQAKdIynOf6EPlatQ.text: Yum! This place is amazing and so cute! Great casual date idea.

jUmaCLtF5OeT2qrCQ3lCZA.text: I always ride my bike to Lux Central when I'm craving for a desert, sometimes lunch and sometimes a drink but always this place make happy. Very hipster with fantastic music.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Thirsty Crow (exotic, spicy and a bit sweet)
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cítricos

oEzdA9SzFP1OHr_LGDVRQQ.text: I had heard good things about Lux and headed there from the airport when I landed in Phoenix. Yes, the parking is tough (although I found that to be the case with a lot of popular Phoenix places) and the entrance is a little confusing (the door is next to the sandwich shop door, although it's worthing peaking in there too because the decor is kitschy and adorable). Lux was an extremely well-curated and eclectic experience. There is really cool lighting, mismatched couches, and an older guy behind the giant mod leather couch mixing some beats. I was so enamored that I walked right by the ordering counter, although the service was very friendly when I did figure it out.   I waited barely three minutes for my iced vanilla latte, served in a mason jar (obviously). After scanning the area and considering the table with typewriter center pieces, I plopped on the couch and set my drink on the tree stump table to watch the woman behind the long wooden bar zest pieces of fruit from giant bowls. I was very tired from my early flight, but the whole thing was surreal and dreamy. I didn't get food, although the baked goods looked delicious. Upon trying to find a restroom, I realized that there are multiple rooms to this beautiful place, each with their own style of furniture and artwork. There is even a patio if that's your thing! I had to run to work, so I didn't get to stay and people-watch, but there were plenty of people there- I could see it getting too crowded to be comfy!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lBvrqpMbv--695t3IenDsg.text: I gotta be honest, this place is weird. Every time I go in I feel like I'm having an eerie, surreal dream filled with people I'm pretty sure I've seen before but I don't know how. Especially the employee that looks like Anthony Fantano. I hurt my foot really bad on the step outside their enternece before, so beware of that. But the food and coffee is crazy good. I recommend the pesto Mac and cheese.

rgfLntJTM3xAkzgeE23P_A.text: I feel like it's one of the few trendy places that really lives up to the hype.   You walk in and feel instantly cooler. SUCH a casual vibe, but in a good way. The art on the walls is always interesting. I think it's a little yucky that some of the furniture is so beat up looking in such a pretty place though.   I've had dessert and coffee here. Both very tasty. The service is pretty good as well.  My one thing is that it always seems to be so busy. And by all means, that's great for them. But I'm always seem to be in someone's way when I'm by the counter waiting for my coffee. And so many people have settled in to be there a long time with their laptops and stuff, and that just makes the space seem a bit cramped.   All in all though, Lux is worth checking out.

FNFdaWFTtstZFdw2qSEgRg.text: Comfortable seating and good selection of drinks and snacks. It could be a great place to study except that the music is really loud causing people to speak a lot louder and making it quite noisy overall. It's therefore difficult to be really productive unfortunately

q0LtVREzq_4NVEHO666uhQ.text: My perfect Wednesday is like a Saturday, and this place is perfect for that feeling. This place is awesome architectural and artistic. It reminds me of the Coffee shops in France/Switzerland, my happy places. The Coffee is really good and the Apple Cinnamon Pecan Scone I tried was delicious. The staff is really nice and the people coming here seem all to love it. The only thing I'm afraid of, is that I will spend way to much time here. I think this place turned right away into a new favorite. Love it

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple Cinnamon Pecan Scone with Coffee

Qh7giBYGDRMqZAiY-eWWoQ.text: Good for anytime of the day and into the evening. Love the vibe. Excellent pastries.

EYf460zvKnORr5caAH8c3Q.text: Lots of outside and indoor seating (large picnic style tables with some normal tables). They feature a live DJ so it can be a bit noisy if you're trying to do serious work. Make sure you try the jalapeno with bacon mac and cheese! It is outstanding.   The hot vanilla latte is a bit bitter, but the cold VL is very good (it is on the milkier side). The chai is a bit watery/not very spicy, but is also foamy. The soy latte has a hint of sweetness.  Lux is my go-to cafe in downtown Phoenix and is great for late night hang outs.

gBjRDpLZdzfTLF8w5W3ysA.text: Lux is simply marvelous. I have been going here for what feels like 10 years. They roast their own beans in house so you know they are fresh and top notch and you can literally stay here all day and night since they have noms for all occasions: breakfast, lunch & dinner. Start in the morning with coffee and transition in to the evening with alcohol. They also have one of the best bakeries in all of Arizona.

RWJvNmfiwX48HcvTAJv_Vw.text: Good place to stop by and spend some time catching up with friends. It's is a dim light place with a variety of seating options. It was pretty packed when I went and was lucky to get a spot to sit. There were couches, tables, and table tops.  Got a scrambled egg and bacon breakfast and coffee. The coffee was good. They also have a variety of pastry options. They played really good music and the environment was very cool. If you have the time you should check this place out.

AnQCiooDUN0TFYe_aGrzFw.text: Its a coffee place. Its a bar. Its a date place. Its a study lounge.  LOVE. LOVE LOVE LOVE.  If you are a coffee drinker this place is for you. if you aren't about that.. it may be hard to navigate because they don't really have a menu. its more like you tell them they can make it. They are real Baristas. No posers here.. real hipsters!

7ifF3yPYBYRISkG6-H08qA.text: This is the epitome of hipster coffee shops and I love everything about it. There's 80's New Wave blasting in the background while the dishwashers in the back have Gin and juice on. There's a wide selection of pastries and a full kitchen where you can get real entrees. I can hear coffee beans drumming in the background so they must roast beans here although I can't smell it. There's so much going on, you'll love it. My husband finished his delicious egg sandwich before I could snap a picture. I ordered a quiche and it was delectable. If I'm ever back in town, I'll be sure to stop but again.

AusY49AjUp3lNzsQrp6nNA.text: Amazing Mac and cheese. A chill place at night filled with hipsters on laptops. For the price the meal is sorta worth it. I would go back for a date or something special with friends.

4IPTG69WF2BvBP2TbnT6WA.text: If your in town must stop by and try their red velvet latte! Their interior is slightly strange to me.. However they do have great coffees and pastries!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastries!! Delish!!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red velvet latte

Ovx_SeqdOFBhfgQk3PH8KQ.text: Enjoyed the few times Ive been here. The food is always good and so is the service.  The prices are a little too high fir what you get but there is a fun atmosphere that draws me back.

--Jud58FsHHomDBaiyG-gg.text: I'm pretty overdue to write a review for this place, but here it is. This spot is my happy place when the morning is just a little too rough. I'm usually awakened by the baristas shouting down the long line of people, "Nina! Are you getting 5 Lindseys today?" If you don't know what a Lindsey is, get one. 6 shots of espresso in a velvet. Wake you right up. Other things I find amazing there: flourless chocolate cake, their scones, their quiches, their tiny pretentious, but adorable, double macchiatos with a little bit of whip.  It's a nice place for a first date or catching up with friends. If you need a little more quiet to study, there's a room in the back with less commotion.  There is also a bar. For after you're done studying.

syK-rbo_N18_tIjpdjt70w.text: Very chill, good coffee, friendly service and fast! Definitely will be returning  For such a big, popular place like this they should be able to afford more than 2 stalls bathroom js

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TfC3vN8eJemK_MxknEv8zw.text: Free WiFi and the extensive food and drink menu make this a good place to spend some time. The best coffee house in midtown, though parking is scarce and seating is limited. I'd recommend using the light rail or biking.

wdrxMi0M6_xFUhFsJ9-Hig.text: Great food and coffee. Actually, some of the BEST coffee I've had in town. Love the atmosphere, too.

YSZkPi6NlI-61XQOauRYag.text: Nice place. I like the atmosphere. Food is good and coffee is good. It looks that the place getting good reputation as you eill see a lot of people.

iCo4r63_nvqeO2g190-_vA.text: Best coffee shop in Phoenix I've discovered by far. Only complaint is the music gets loud (vulgar, and annoying) at times, and the place feels cramped when it gets crowded.

HiBzFDr0jRnqrQX6Ihhg0w.text: Finally, a cup of coffee in Phoenix that IS FANTASTIC. SOO FANTASTIC. I'm thrilled! I've been trying to find something comparable to the best in SF, and almost gave up.. but thank you, Lux! Woot.

kstexoke5acAvTXWOm_8mg.text: Thank you, Lux, just for existing! For 40 years, I was convinced that I didn't like oatmeal with apples and syrup until I tried yours.  About your delicious baked goods  and your feisty coffee (hurray for your black eye!), I never had an argument.  It is all the best start to a morning!

IJmaQP7x7UAX-4bv7tAqWg.text: I drove from Tucson to find the two places I wanted to visit closed (next time, I'll really do my research) and ended up at Lux to drown my frustrations in caffeine. This place did not disappoint. My latte macchiato was delicious. The coffee was perfectly balanced by the milk; all-in-all, a great drink.   Good atmosphere and friendly baristas, too. I appreciated the kind suggestions from the girl at the counter. Will definitely return the next time I'm in Phoenix.

1ZM6OyyD7edbvV1hMfFu3A.text: Okay, so I admit it. Sometimes I get a stubborn idea about not wanting to go to a specific establishment due to a fierce loyalty to one of it's competitors. It took me a while to cave on this one. Too long in fact.  Everyone loves Lux and as it happens, they have good reason to! My latte was supremely delicious. The environment is great albeit slightly confusing as far as the flow of service.   I absolutely love the patio area. This place definitely has a Pacific Northwest vibe that immediately resonates with me. The service was really laid back, yet authentically friendly. I was far too busy enthusiastically catching up with a dear friend to take in all that Lux has to offer. There's room in my heart for Lux after all so I shall return. My primary concerns going in were the coffee, service and atmosphere. A+ for all in my humble estimation.   I was a little late to the party, but I had a blast anyway.

lN-enRVu3RJmCQA4OyISeg.text: Nice vibe - cool place.  Great Mac and Cheese

C4LEYd69q_qI_PdDUPfmAg.text: I stopped by this place and it was so cool. The design on the inside is both welcoming and intriguing. There are a bunch of little nooks in the place, some very public and some perfect to hide and do work. The had a big projector screen hung up playing some sort of sports game but I hear they also do themed nights, which I would love to go back to. Awesome vanilla soy latte. And they have food too! Their menu changes every day I think, but if you follow their Facebook they post it! They serve alcohol here too, which is cool, and stay open late! Give it a try next time you're in Phoenix.

jH9Mhir-364_m2fsafosOw.text: I couldn't love this place anymore. The music, the people, the coffee, the pastries, the atmosphere. They blow everyone away and invite them back to enjoy a relaxed productive or chill time. Anytime Any day of the week.   And yes. I'm writing this review right now here. At lux.

dJ7wqGU6cgXPoUoZTAIWrA.text: Jeff, the owner, took what was a great coffee shop and turned it into an awesome destination experience. The place is always filled (which makes for some great people watching) and it is a treat just to kick back and relax. If you love coffee shops, this is a must!

yurFILCygZFZc1dFZh377g.text: I love this place. Great place to work/study on weekdays and weekends. I love to grab a coffee and hang out. Their pastries look great, but I have never tried them.

913NFpiMnCzDNxYbEAuJ9w.text: Just read my tip, and realize the only reason to bring someone here is so they can see what happens when you have a great concept and NO IDEA how to execute properly.

G6r1a45br186jSD8n7rLNA.text: Went there with a friend last night and had an amazing time. Atmosphere is great. Great background music and the coffee and pastries were a winner.

qfrbewjpNBZEgZX7YfRn0g.text: I LOVE LUX! I spend every weekend drinking the weirdest, but most amazing, drink combination in the world--a caffe latte and a bloody mary. Jake makes THE BEST bloody marys I've ever had. Exceptional service, food/drink/coffee quality, price and atmosphere. I couldn't ask for more from the coffee shop down the street from my apt. It's my home away from home--I don't know where I would spend my weekend mornings (which always end up turning into the evening!) w/o lux!  And I used to HATE bloody marys!!!!! Bacon as a garnish?? Pure genius. You get nothing but the best from Lux EVERY time. Everyone I take there is blown away. It's just a pure gem.

lhdwIsmvu--VXYxqJgzpBw.text: I absolutely adore Lux and especially enjoy the new location (don't worry, it moved about a grand total of five feet from the original location). The new location is much roomier, has more seating, and most importantly more table space! I find this to be a great place to study, meet someone or just relax.  If anyone tells you this isn't a hipster bar, frankly, they're lying. However, I find this rather refreshing compared to the rest of Phoenix which can be quite hum drum. And not every patron is a hipster, however hipsters dominate.  The coffee and pastries are excellent and the staff is friendly and personable. They now have two separate counter areas in the new location, one that serves the coffee and pastries and another that serves the booze and food. Also they are now open until midnight, but only serve coffee until ten... which is excellent in my opinion ^.^  Overall, I love Lux and am happy to have them as neighbors! Wonderful place for me to study (especially with extended hours now) and they are certainly helping with my SF withdrawals, being new to Phoenix and such.  Two areas for improvement though... there is NO HAPPY HOUR :'( and their coffee could be MUCH stronger.

m0VxKxz0fn64tlLcNlMkDw.text: This coffee place is great for many reasons; it has a great atmosphere for dates, hang outs, or even studying. Lux has delicious coffee and homemade whipped cream. I also enjoy how they have baked goods and a lunch and dinner menu. Super friendly staff with great customer service. I recommend their iced white mocha, soo good :)

R2-C3NEX054G03x9tnvo5g.text: I've been here on two occasions. The first time was to meet an editor and I had a black tea which was very good. The second visit was because I was in the area and needed to kill an hour before a meeting. On this visit I had Espresso and it was not at all impressive. I give LUX  two stars only because the seating and decor on either visit wasn't very comfortable or, as strange as it may sound, welcoming to me.

e7_fiQiyPReERXscB5jSKg.text: After venturing to the new building i sadly have to knock this place down a star. As others have mentioned, there's no menu with pricing in a convenient location. There was what appeared to be a menu on a clear glass wall but it was hard to read and only had a few things on there. Luckily i have my regular orders that i know by heart.   I really miss the intimate feeling of the original building. Although I'm happy they had to expand for a growing clientele a part of me wishes they kept the coffee shop a coffee shop and had the food/bar in the new building.   I've also been here twice since the new building, both on a Sunday afternoon and it was so packed! The first Sunday i was able to find a spot to do work, but today i was unable to and just had to turn out the door after doing a lap around and seeing no seats at a table open. I never had that happen in the previous building... Perhaps when the weather is cooler this will improve.

KUy2XlNUQ0UqaHdzd2QBUA.text: Such a cool place. Hard to find a seat but delicious food and chill environment.

nCJx5OBe1P8QD-NQMZlnhg.text: I absolutely love hate this place. The velvet is something I wake up craving in the morning. The pastries and food are so freaking good. The location is perfect. If i can swing going super early in the morning then the atmosphere is great. But venture in at the same time as the hipster masses and I feel out of place. The line is out the door and the process is awkward like you need to be in the know to know what is going on because no one tells you! This is where the hate part come from. My husband will not come here with me because of how crowded it is. But the velvet calls my name and I will reluctantlly be back.

LVEK-0slv55Y5Gw75hJCUA.text: If you look up the antonym to hipster you will find my photo. We were referred here by our awesome waiter Matt at the Henry for drinks.  It was a Saturday night, about 10 pm and my boyfriend and I went dressed up (NY standard, not PHX standards) like we usually are to go out and needless to say the minute we stepped foot inside I felt a little out of place. But we forged through the coffee area to the back bar area. We found two cozy seats and were greeted. I have to say although I look very different then anyone working there and most people going there they were all very nice to us and helpful (which I cannot say of all "hipster joints" *cough* Cartel *Cough*).  If you like a great cocktail and even to challenge your palate, You HAVE to go hear! They have all quality liquors and mixers and to make it even better, there is NO cocktail menu. They can make all the classics, but the fun part is telling them what you like and don't like in a drink and they will create fabulous concoction just for you! I am talking rose water, lavender, all kinds of herbs and unique flavor profiles and combinations. To make it better, the prices are reasonable! To get a fabulous hand-made cocktail with all top shelf and beyond liquors for $8-$10 is a great deal and  they don't use ice and "fillers" to cut you short, with a couple drinks you will feel, let's say, relaxed... Now the Mac-n-cheese with Bacon and Jalapenos!!! YES! It is perfect. Great comfort food, you may feel guilty for having consumed all that fat BUT it is totally worth it and you will love every moment of it! Their baked goods and coffee are also great. The music however... I have been there when they played the whole collection of Metallica (Lord, help me)... It isn't always that awful, however I don't care for the music most restaurants play today, so I digress.  I have already brought a few people and suggested it to a few others.... this is a must try! I tell you what, hipsters know their cocktails, coffee and food.

VcClTRHCutjSYzX3CYY7OQ.text: Went here with friend no to along ago. Ambience of this place is on point very indie vibe comes off. Anyways I like this place I got a pastry which was a muffin very fresh and enjoyable have no complaints. Fun and enjoyable place  for about anyone, because it's a place that has a very diverse crowd.

0k6LyekbaCWwtoe_1SZ-fg.text: "YUM! " this is the reaction of every customer that treats themselves to the most wonderful cafe in Central Phoneix. Lux is the gem we all always hope to find, and always come back to for more!  What can be said about Lux, that hasn't already been said in its previous 1198 reviews (how about that I'm jealous my review doesn't get to be number 1200!?) The interior is inviting, and the exterior has a lovely view. Their music is pleasant (and can be found on Spotify). The staff are as sweet as the pastries. Seriously, the bakers, the baristas, the chefs, & the bartenders are all so hospitable and personable, and remember your name if you're a regular.  But of course, the Jewel of the Royal-Crown-Masterpiece that is Lux Cafe, is its food & drinks. Review their customer-submitted photos of their coffee and tea. They have a full bar. Yeah! A bar! And they're drinks are fantastic!  And ooooh, but the food though! The Food Though! They're breakfast egg, bacon, & hash dishes! They're pastries! They're salads! They're sandwiches! ... And they're infamous Mac & Cheese with bacon & jalapeno!  just go right now and treat yourself! You'll fall in love with your newly found home away from home; Lux Cafe!

gMNNl9X7lhTsLuzGut400Q.text: Went for the first time on a Sunday and enjoyed my late and cinnamon roll with my wife. Unfortunately the place is very popular and crowded and the typical hipster vibe is there, but not unexpected.

589L29XipZOiJDZBdpKxsA.text: I've discovered this sweet little gem of a coffee shop from a good friend of mine before heading out of town for the weekend. Not knowing what to expect or what to order, I simply got what they ordered which was a hot black & white. I was blown away and this has been my go to drink ever since. Hot or iced, either way is very delicious. It's never empty that's for sure but why wouldn't it be since it's a very chill spot. I've been back many times since and happily introduced at least 7 of my friends to this place! Highly recommended to stop by for a quick coffee break, business or just a time to catch up with friends. Also, the music selection is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut flavor

N4TP5_AwYqkyA7RD4Z4h9g.text: Great coffee in a comfortable environment. I love the couches and the DJ that was there that day. I have to say this is one of the few places that I have been with a great espresso shot. Many other places I have been burn the crap out of it. The espresso here was amazing!!! I will be back.

eppmfgJ7-FEnw_7suGe3UA.text: The atmosphere for this little shop is great. There is a lot of space to either grab a seat and read a book or work on a project, or you could always sit with some friends and chat. The food is pretty good. Their menu includes a little more substative items than the typical coffee shop items, which I really like. That being said their mac and cheese is the bomb and they also have some really good pastries.

6L-zhrOf-S5hKHKpZyI4Uw.text: A little on the pricey side and always packed, but this place has amazing espresso and whipped cream. The granola and yogurt are the best in Phx, and the baked goods are amazing. I also like ordering a side of veggie hash and their pork belly bacon. Try the room in the back where it is a little quieter once you break they the lines, but anyone who has not been here needs to try it - you will return.

hIc0QtboSBFwSLVuBuf0PQ.text: I love this place and all of it's creativity. They have tons of awesome things, great coffee and food! I come here frequently for lunch as I work right down the street :)

L0mqeEJdC74TPhF1GcsSRg.text: Nice, chill, cozy sometimes a bit overcrowded but enjoy their coffee and nice treatment by the staff.

ePx7ZTOwuGanoDFmCBAyWA.text: If this place doesn't do something about their fly infestation, I won't be back.  It is getting ridiculous.  And if you have this many flies, they must be landing on the food you purchase before you even get it served.

aqYby0iD6yF62Gy09_2ByQ.text: Nothing best praise, absolutely great. Had the grilled chicken pesto mac n' cheese yesterday. AMAZING!

00NP1xs89DYQzHMBWzZRCQ.text: My first time in , from CA originally:)  They asked me what I like to drink, I told them I like cocktails and beer but felt like a cocktail ... I suggested Long Island , even though they don't make them they made there style of it and it turned out beautifully !!! , the atmosphere was cozy and Sheek!! The drink even came in a mason jar with a lemon and metal straw/stir spoon ;) delicious!!

EAualJBQQ3GvAvcC05TxKQ.text: Nice environment with very diverse crowed. Get there early if you are looking for a great seat, also not quite the best place to stay to find peace and quiet. It is more of a social enviornment.

zhUIjlJ-Sdwrbx25GU0vWw.text: I dare you to walk in this hipster coffee shop and not want to eat all their delicious pastries and drinks! However, if you want to get any work done, bring headphones because they keep their music very high to the point where you think your ears might be bleeding. And outlets are sparse.

qvhjfwYKfLBxvHS3Pu-7ZA.text: I think this place is great. My only negative is that they are too busy and seem to be short staffed at times.  But what local business doesn't have that problem? Their coffee is amazing, their baked goods are delectable, and it is so cute inside.  I just wish I could find a seat :)

Q387qtZf85y_ALSO2PPLng.text: This place is notorious for bad customer service but last night really did it for me. My friends and I were meeting up and one of my friends was SUPER hungry. She tried to order 6 minutes before midnight and they told her they couldn't take her order because they stop serving at midnight. We promptly left and went to The Vig. We will NEVER go back so long as the same snooty, shit face, rude, unwelcoming staff is still there.

gNTj05jZFjS4EZHJKol5aw.text: Lux is a cool hip place to relax and do homework or hang out with friends! It is the perfect spot for anyone who loves lively environments. The staff is always very friendly and courteous. Oh, and their iced black and white mocha is the best I have ever had. Never a bad experience at Lux!

lrxb39JICTpB2GwUesRgOA.text: spacious and interesting interior; I liked the ambience more than anything. There were people studying, getting a mid-day drink, hanging out with friends, etc. I ordered a tea and coffee and both were decent. I also like that there is a variety of baked goods. I thought the ripped couch thing was quite tacky and came off as trying too hard to be hipster, so that is one of the parts of coming here I didn't like. Overall, I would recommend this place to a friend.

TCLLSlUygFH7j3RU2JZyPA.text: This place is a bonafide treasure for Phoenix.  If you are looking for authentic, urban and high quality coffee experience this place is for you.  The owner is ALWAYS there and will go out of his way to say hello and treat you like family.  This place is unique enough in that its a True melting pot - gathering place for many demographics.  Pastries were all made from scratch and the vibe is WAY better than corporate competitors.  Keep it up.

dCLGEpbsea96-OaukXDMVA.text: Hipsters!....Hipsters everywhere!!!  They should put up a sign on the door that says "No entry without accompanying iPhone or iPad".  This place oozes emo, beanies, and skinny jeans.

-xSfv9Wi1Up3vqKWDGsIFQ.text: I love how laid back it is and you can sit outside

jImXBNIIhacEpD-zEHEjKw.text: I`m becoming addicted to this coffeehouse! Been a longtime supporter of local places such as Coffee Plantation and Hava Java, as to Starbucks which I am tired of. Being in Lux five times now, love the locally roasted coffee!! Smooth and velvety and full of flavor!  Like the eclectic atmosphere of people, art, music (they have a live dj on Sundays) and the coffee of course! Also they have a variety of scrumptious pastries, scones and muffins!  And free wi-fi another plus! They have sofas, chairs and plenty of table spaces to plug in laptops. And great service from these peeps! Very addictive indeed!!

yv_PPVGeEACU3C0xrfw4Nw.text: It's a quirky coffee house that serves good food and coffee. The service was good, but the ambience is geared towards starving students or supposed "free-thinking" types. I'm a published fiction writer and would not consider working on my craft in this coffee house, too much of a distraction. I have no problem coming back here for their coffee as I'm passing through, I just wouldn't enjoy my drink there.

fOR9TphG1l_APJOZ8RMbGA.text: I met the Pastry Chef (Katie) @ anthropolgie casually talking about  dainty dishes wich lead into conversations about Lux and after hearing about it  I had to try it.  The coffee was FAB!  The cake we had and Pie  Was fantastic *****five stars!  Next time I visit Arizona I am making it one of my destinations for that perfect pastry and coffee combo!  Katie if you ever go anywhere else let me know I will Follow!  Come to Texas!  LOL

Te5aSjtIG0eXdzb88IsXZA.text: Lux has always meant a most excellent experience. Jumping from pure coffee shop to a space with the same 'flavor' that is also hang out comfy with food was done well. If you haven't been there once or twice you really should go. My favorites are the egg breakfast after soccer in the winter and dinner whenever, just because. People watching is always in season. My thanks go to the entire crew. Well done. See you soon.

kS6A0K4kP75QfOIiXG9nSg.text: When visiting Phoenix this last weekend, I hit up Lux twice. First time was on a Saturday and they were slammed. Staff were really friendly, fast, and the coffee was amazing. The second time was on Monday when things were a little mellower. Even better service and coffee. Interior is really relaxed with plenty of space to throw down your laptop and get some work done. I highly recommend the cherry corn muffins. All the bakery items are either done in house or near by. Fresh and so good. Enjoy!

fL-55eMWU_0Jrn4zcRvDEA.text: Wow...I just found this little hidden gem here in CenPho. I'm sure no one's heard of it...hee hee... Lux is like the community center for the hipsters and thirsties. I don't know if I"m hip, but I do know sometimes I get thirsty. For some java. And thirsty for a non Starbucks place to hang. I think the loud DJ music kicks ass. What a great stamp to put on the ever so tiring hip coffee house scene still sprouting up across this great land. Funky art? Seen it. Eclectic rec room furniture. Sat on it. Tattooed and face- bejeweled employees? A must have. But the DJ? That's all Lux baby. My doctor has "suggested" (ok, like he totally insists) that a go easy on the caffeine. So one cup of this sturdy liquid beans keeps me going all day. Muffins and scones are great, especially if you get there real early. The Lux crew is friendly and efficient. It's so popular that navigating the small quarters at peak hours can be dicey. I know I've bumped a few end tables in my quest to get out and hear the slosh of a patron's coffee spilleth over. But, you know. Since I'm so hip, I just keep walking.

ruth2jL85gVSmUJauKuE5Q.text: I have been here some 3-4 times now...The coffee is very gud though the place just seems too crowded nowadays...Its always a full house so if you are ther on a sat/sun evening you wont find a place inside...I wish it were a bit quieter and less packed as it is now so that one could enjoy the coffee better...

Zov_5C8JzGIzJu9_vj6rCA.text: Best coffee in Phoenix.  You should also try Pane Bianco next door.

M25J9bDF8gMXfYMjK_vwwA.text: Now worthy of 5 stars for replacing their toilet with one that actually flushes. It's always nice when a place that sells diuretic beverages has a working toilet.  ---  The baked goods are baked right there in the coffee house, by their employees.  The coffee is roasted right there, on site. Iced tea refills are free, bitches. The baristas are hep cats who ride fixie bikes. Now, I like to coast, but shit...  Gotta give them cred. If you go often enough, the other regulars will be friendly. If you hate Mac laptops, you probably should stay away. The new tables are great. There are power outlets everywhere. It's next to Pane Bianco. I run into my homies there on the regular. When it comes to coffee shops in CenPho, there is no competitor. Jeff, the owner, is a cool dude. The seating outside is nice. I have been known to spend all day there, and use it as my office away from home and my real office. I seriously probably spend about 16 hours a week there or so, maybe more some weeks, working on my laptop and occasionally people watching. Did I mention that I kind of like this place?

0D9CD_Aby9PKcKrx41aA8w.text: coffee is really good but it is packed- hard to find a place to sit, unless you go outside. Nice pastries.

jHrS1wysQMWdIyhiDnwHYw.text: The weirdest thing happened to me here.  An old lady standing by the counter thought I was Victoria from Young and the Restless. What the heck?  I don't look a thing like her- and I would know- I used to watch that show all the time when I was younger.  It was pretty funny trying to convince her that it wasn't me though- I don't think she ever believed me.  The coffee I had was good though- but it was just an iced coffee with a shot of vanilla in it.  I thought I'd try something different, and it ended up being quite tasty.  If I lived closer, I'd probably be a regular at this spot

fWWgRuIZw6wOm4cmPpto9w.text: I must admit I feel so uncool every time I come in here, mostly because it's hipster supreme and everyone seems to know everyone. But I sit in here and work because the atmosphere is both simple and eclectic -- I love the openness behind the counter and the openness of the seating area. Plus, good tunes always seem to abound here. Did I mention the coffee is delicious? Smooth, caramelly espresso; not at all the like the bitter over roasted crud at a certain worldwide coffee tyrant. I also highly dig that they worked the tax into all of their prices, so when I buy an Americano for $2.50, it's really $2.50. One more thing: enjoy the pastries here. They are as good as any coffeehouse I've visited.

D48qKXanOS9Tfq7UgaJuNw.text: Good coffee, good service, loses a star for being too cool.  Also: latte art.  Now that's worthy of the term "cool beans."

h5YC1qYa9JD7RPorRHh_dQ.text: Great atmosphere and music.  I definitely believe that Lux has the best coffee I've ever had at this point.  Screw all my previous reviews - this place has coffee down.  They make damn good toast too.  Mmm.

cqNuTubkSxBU4MhgKPCZUg.text: Definitely  -- great tunes and a nice place to relax. The coffee has gotten even better since the beginning of the year. Play hooky, buy an americano, and grab a sandwich from Pane Bianco!

K3ULknlsJBMblkS8odBqzg.text: I'm sure many are lux coffeebar converts and fans... but I've just recently discovered this little gem. I haven't tried many of the food selections but the lattes are to die for, the music is awesome, the ambiance is delightful and the barristas are eye candy! what more can a girl ask for??

mRdCmk2DYocbDNHP-4PUZg.text: Great decor, cool vibe, but my first visit ended up with a poor macchiato. A little light on the foam and grounds - yes grounds - in the cup. I really wanted to like it since I had heard great things, but that's a pretty bad gaffe. I'm hoping I just caught them on a bad night so I might try them again when I'm in the area.

l03FgNxR3DbMhJvdgg1N9w.text: Been here a number of times for coffee, but never had the dinner options or beer.  Great assortment of independent brews.  The food was unexpected amazing. Try the jalapeno Mac n cheese.  The place has never let me down.

H0OddUgI6nwsR1Cv_RNcGQ.text: Well I certainly agree with the coffee afficionados of Phoenix: the coffee here is damn good, and all the hand made pastries are some of the best I've had. My favorites are the brioche slices with jam and the honey bran muffins....and the mexican wedding cookies.....and the lemon bars. Service is always quite friendly and fast. They have just plain cool people working here. This place runs smoothly.  So then why just 3 stars A-oK? I'm totally on LUX's side! Good service, tasty coffee and nice bites....but here's why:  The computer people. There are faaaar too many computer folk at this place taking up waaayyy too much room. And they're not considerate enough to just go home after three hours. Now, before anybody has a coronary - just know that I'm aware that computers are a part of our everyday lives now (I guess) and people don't have to be confined at home to study blah blah blah but COME ON. This is a social atmosphere - designed to chat and laugh and make new friends and have coffee. If you're ordering one cup of tea and stretching it out over several hours while taking a seat that somebody with a pulse and some social skills could be occupying - that's just rude.  This place needs to 86 the free Wi-Fi and let people pay for limited times of web access. Period. LUX used to be more of a social atmosphere, but they've caved into the laptop "nesters" and set no guidelines whatsoever. So most days you walk in, and the only sound is the music, because nobody is talking. Instead there are over-serious, glossy-eyed lumps of what used to be humans doing their research papers for college or googling themselves or updating their facebook status every three minutes because they're bored and nobody wants to talk to them. And staring you down as you come in like you're invading THEIR space.  Nesters....go HOME. If you can't study without being in this environment from dusk til dawn, maybe you're not that interested in what your'e studying - which might mean your'e in the wrong major. Or your concentration just sucks ass. You can't have your brioche and eat it, too.     Your 1 Computer + Your 8 Binders + 3 Huge Biology Books x  How little you actually study ---------------------------------------- = You're annoying and you need a home office.  other than that, I like going here, but get your frickin' powercord outta' my mocha!!

_nTha5WCgv-mrmf3rv3Hgg.text: This place is interesting, though some of the baked items are gross (ie 'paleo'...did cavemen have chocolate chip cookies?). Staff can sometimes be unpleasant.

eQ52hR0TMErQZIgdvTaCQA.text: I rented a car from Rent a Wreck of Phoenix yesterday and the individuals at this location are absolutely wonderful.  They knew I had just been through a terrible situation with Phoenix Car Rental and went out of their way to make sure I had a great experience with them.  Everyone there is professional and very nice and I would highly recommend them to anyone needing a rental car in the Phoenix area.  You can tell they are really good, honest people.

azuH-zpr4HP-FOUCa0kMwg.text: Absoultely for the snobby coffee drinker. And in a super good way. If you want to be pampered with the best aroma and taste, then head up to Lux. The name certainly does the place justice. Great coffee!!

nH8b7-XqAWKfXmikhsxODw.text: I have been here a handful of times and have yet to recieve great service or any standard of service for that matter. I have no complaints about the coffee or food. The atmosphere is loud and busy but again, no problem with that either. What really bothers me is how rude the staff is. Maybe they don't realize their customers are paying their bills and funding their livelihood. Whatever it is it embarrasses me that the owner allows staff to treat guests as a problem and annoyance. Truly disappointed that my neighborhood coffee shop deters business for their lack of care for customers or service.

CmzogWtXnneohwkqLC0dtQ.text: Just the best. I go here to study with a coffee (with their house whipped cream, 2$, Free refills!)  , to enjoy a cocktail and catch up with a friend, or to sneak a delicious pastry. Great people, unique community environment, just love it :)

FOPIWn8UBQXo-IIzgAqXTg.text: Their coffee isnt entirely convincing, the place is more style than substance (and flavor for that matter). The place isnt big enough and unfortunately I stopped going to this place because it seems to me, given my different experiences at this place, that minorities arent welcome here given the treatment of some of its staff and patrons. Unfortunately, at such time we didnt have any other alternative but Starbucks, until Lola's Coffee opened and welcomed us with open arms. Glad to say I have never looked back.  But putting their demeanor aside, their coffee isnt the best for the exorbitant prices you pay.

wP7fhgKsHlZyoEKKuOYOng.text: A group of us went here after lunch (Sunday, 6/3) - we only ordered coffee drinks.  The drinks were good and the baked goods looked amazing. We also liked the atmosphere.  Too bad we all left with the same comment - The young girl taking our order was down right rude.  She was unfriendly in an almost condescending way.  I might go here again to sample some of the food but if I have a similar experience - i won't go back.  There are plenty of other places uptown where the service is friendly and appreciative.

J226pcTmMQTGoBLrvn_BQg.text: Totally worth the drive from Scottsdale. The food is delicious, and is not pre-packaged, such a nice change for a coffee joint. Support local business, Starbucks has nothing on Lux; other than a million locations. Keeping the service consistent would help. Sometimes it's stellar sometimes it's horrid. Guess it depends on how their day is going. Still was in 3 times today #shameless

J5KXqby5Mg5uJaTTijgrsQ.text: Amazing atmosphere and a great cup of joe.  The food is uniquely amazing and always get in and out in a timely manner.  Really is the best coffee shop in Phoenix.

LjFSaaQL-HnAR6XFbhUOIw.text: I just love Lux. It is one of those places that is an iconoclastic phoenix gem. The wonderful teas, coffees, yummy eats, fabulous music and eclectic crowd make it this the best spot in town. I do wish they did a few more gluten free treats :)

dBmGQKj7s8WNvRMbiLsFzA.text: One of my go-to places when I need to study or write. Wifi is surprisingly fast for the amount of people jammed inside this place on their laptops.   Super cool staff. They accidentally charged me three times and were quick to remedy the situation with some Lux Bux.   Really good chai lattes and fresh baked pastry concoctions. Open til' 10 most nights.

IPAwgGTkguDm5W0lLF91WQ.text: Cool place for a cup coffee or a drink and to hang out with friends for a little while. Food was pretty good, too.

QGv39alfMNk6VFmrOvPdRA.text: Went with a friend. Chill atmosphere and great black chai fresh cream was to die for. Had a real good pastry. Can't wait to go again!

5poQTEfJbhHw-L_o9WMdwQ.text: Great food and pastries. Coffee is nothing to write home about (despite being roasted on-site.) Great atmosphere with plenty of outdoor seating if the inside gets a little busy. There may be a place like this on every gentrified street corner of SF and Seattle, but there are few, if any, places like Lux in PHX.

tXpYbraZsRYWtKpx9m435w.text: Lux serves the best espresso in Phoenix.  The service has always been good and they even have Pane Bianco (an amazing sandwich shop) next door if you are there around lunch time.  I recently moved back to Phoenix after spending a couple years in Oregon and going to Lux was one of the first things I wanted to do (in addition to getting some decent Mexican food).  I am looking forward to many more visits in the immediate future.

nSYTtStohL_OfELe0UiJYA.text: Some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced.  It took them 26 minutes from the time of order to make my cocktail.  I watched the staff stand around and chit chat as I sat there wondering when my business would become a priority.  The atmophere is cute, but I would rather have an ugly environment with quality staff. What a let down.

bDZZxHr6GSTWpwffuYdqRw.text: How do you loose a good customer? At 5:24 tell them that they can not order the Mac and cheese because you do not start dinner for 6 minutes. Really, what are you McDonalds? You take the order and tell me it will be a few extra minutes as they set up for dinner. Why would you turn away a paying customer? It was a to go order so the wait would not have been a big deal. I even suggested that and the girl stated that she could not do that. Major customer service fail. Like any customer I have a choice as to where to spend my money. I assume you no loner want me to spend it at your business. Drop the attitude

3sGehJGkirJ54xUG-98DGA.text: It's on par with Starbucks in terms of prices, but you can actually feel good (and not guilty) about your choice to frequent this cafe. It's a hip place to grab a (delicious) bite to eat and a (refreshing and perfectly prepared) drink while chatting with company or using your laptop. Great location as well.

5j9BFvB7w_TVG1QK5yIakg.text: Been going here for some time, I love it. I love the hours, the food, the drinks, the atmosphere. Recently I had a bad experience, but it turned good. I had ordered a salad that was originally advertised with ham and some cheese dressing, me being a vegan, it didn't work for me. So, I ordered the salad with olive oil and vinegar dressing minus the ham, the server told me it would be made vegan for me. After half way through my salad, I found a piece of ham on the bottom. Oh man I was bummed. But, I didn't make a big deal because you know what, mistakes happen and it's nobody's fault. The server asked me if I wanted a togo box but I said no because the piece of ham turned me off from wanting to take it home. He was so apologetic but I told him I understood because us humans are allowed to make mistakes, right? Accidents happen and thats okay. I got my card out to pay and he brought me the bill... for ZERO dollars. WOW!! I couldn't believe it. Usually it's always the people that bit_h that get free stuff and I thought it was so awesome they took care of my salad for me. I am beyond impressed, such wonderful customer service.

vYU-XmXWAvNtT01lDTwM9g.text: Only had a latte but it was great. It was crowded when we went, but we were still able to find a seat in the back. I want to go back sometime to try their breakfast.

d_ciHxpqItaKQD97wbY0fA.text: Love the coffee and atmosphere at Lux in downtown phoenix. Great cup of joe.

yqO6j9d2UAAJh1Z3_erTOA.text: Amazing Ambiance!!!  Adorable Packaging!!!  Delish Rice Krispie Treats!  Burnt Acidic Coffee.   :( I wish I could have had the time to exchange the latte I ordered, but the line was long and I was in a rush.   I would totally give them another try, if I'm in that groovy part of town and need a bump.

HP_pXOwrCXbGQHBz0DDmlw.text: This little gem is by far my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix! Or at least this is what I tell people when I am actually skipping off to have a Bloody Mary and Mac n Cheese. It can be a little confusing going in for the first time because you can either order from the line near the entrance or you can go over and sit at the bar area and order there. If you choose to sit at the bar be sure to ask for Luke. I don't know much about this tall handsome work of art but I can tell you he makes THE BEST drinks in the area. Just tell him what type of drinks you typically like and he will whip something tasty up for you. Don't expect it to be quick though... remember... there is an art to getting the best drinks in Phoenix. Be patient and you will be pleasantly surprised!!  I keep telling all of my friends to visit this place but I think I am going to stop so I can enjoy my bloody mary in peace with Luke.

RWIZINCWUgv3JIFeXfUe-w.text: As a shift worker, I am always on the look out for a good caffeine fix.  Likewise, I am obsessed with finding the best toddy in town.  With these in mind, I had to try Lux.  The vibe is definitely hipster but friendly and approachable--I hate to walk in and everyone turns to ask who the hell is this guy raiding our shop.  The toddy here was good, slight caramel notes and mildly bitter (in a good way).  I would grade this as the 2nd best toddy in the valley.  Oh, can't forget the patio.  Love it.

P-SZtJbPIUrTblOtOleJ0A.text: Good god lux is good!! When I need a glucose fix I get the velvet, and for the love of sweet baby jesus don't forget the dollop of whipped cream. mmm. It's heaven in a spoonful. Otherwise, sign me up for the iced coffee with the two shots of espresso that come along with, hells yes I'm set.   But you know all those quotes? the ones to the right of the menu?...last time i checked we had this wondrous beauty on display:   "Today will be tied to something  like a bed post wrapping  tree stumps in table clothes  to set the table for supper"   So, THIS is what makes Lux even better! It's that quote and all its precedents and all of its subsequent replacements.   Jeff, the owner of lux and a poet, he's the man responsible for each and every one of those quotes. Simply an extra lovely touch in my humble opinion.  Alsooooooo Pastries = YES!

nNEHFmT6BO4BRXelbEdXSw.text: I've been going here for three years now. Great coffee both locally and origin based and roasted onsite. Coffee is fresh, staff are polite and informational when it come to coffee. Atmosphere is alternatively fitting for a relaxing cup of coffee!

Htnsn8gjwJaJEj-mUNqq8A.text: pretentious staff and mediocrity. Coffee no better than Dutch Brothers and more expensive. A place to be seen in... for annoying self absorbed hipsters. At my age, I don't fit their douche demographic. Been here twice this week, but there's no sense of service with the staff.

KeEqiruSmN16JWbGV89GeA.text: By far one of my favorite coffee shops in America. First off Lux has an ecclectic art vibe which makes one feel right at home in this cozy coffee shop. They bake fresh pastries every day that are absolutely out of this world. Their jalepeno bacon mac & cheese is a game changer. Their coffee is roasted to perfection. Now if you think your heart wasn't already won over make sure you try their delectable cocktails at the bar. I highly recommend the rum in blood cocktail.

vWB4-KT8dQrqN0xFDHO98g.text: Lux is an awesome place to hang out - good wi-fi, lots of space to spread out (when not crowded), awesome food, awesome service and awesome staff!  I take off two stars for the following reasons:  1.  Lack of a visible menu w/ prices.  I know that food/wine menus are visible just next to the typewriters at the bar area.  Unless I'm misunderstanding something or totally blind I see no drink menu/prices listed (like Lux did at their previous location).  Unless it's just me, I find it confusing on what to order w/o a menu present as well as their prices.    2.  On 2 separate visits I was charged different prices on the exact same product!! (for all I know that cashier could be pocketing the difference!!)

_rgVcKOWbaHVhnuG3pQKMA.text: I had been to Lux a few times when they were located right next to Pena Bianco.  Had to see the new place just a building over but a whole lot more space.  The scene is great, plenty of seating inside and out.  The breakfast kieshes are deliscious and the menu is always changing.  Great coffee or if your into Smoothies they have them too.  Also if you wanted to come back later in the day they have a full bar in the back corner!  Its hard to beat Lux!

A2ZU1QSeAY8xJxV8zWijXQ.text: Let me add to the NOISE!  ----Of course, one must enjoy the pseudo-bohemian appearance and the vaguely leftist hippies. What do they really know about art that they couldn't read in any trendy New York underground fashion magazine. I caught you! You prototypical non-conformist  Nothing but vacuous soldier of the thrift store. Lux, you adhere to a set of standards and tastes that appear to be determined by an unseen panel of hipster judges... Giving a thumbs up or thumbs down to incoming and outgoing trends and styles of music and art.  You're so post-modern, It's disgusting, its offensive don't stick your nose up at me!----    +hehe ...totally kidding+   If you understand my reference to my previous paragraph I think you are a head of the bell curve.  ||ANYWAY, it was 2006 when I first visited LUx, "oh this is kinda cool, but not my style." It was almost dramatic irony as I look back on it...that next month I was accepted to a small liberal arts college in Portland, OR...which was totally not my style or element. People "smoking" themselves to cancer right out side every cafe and bar...haha                                                             | ANYWAY, its 2011 when I again visited LUx, "Oh this is kinda cool, but not my style."  It was almost a congruity of ideas as I look at it now. This month I was accepted to a Trauma internship at PCH...which is totally my style and element. People curing others from their "blunt" sudden physical injury...haha||    WHY the five stars, same reason a person looks at the past and smile...because it happened and it was wonderful.  LUx, your weird, but I lov you in a enduring nostalgic way.   --Keep LUx Weird---  R\_    "people like you are why people like me exist"

Tcngadqe0vs4zXY7wyqnQA.text: So I haven't been since Lux moved over to their new spot, and I wish so bad that I could delete my old review, due to new, better employees, a bigger space, tons of selection (literally a full menu from breakfast to dinner, oh and that includes alcohol. Nomnoms). They've adjusted their prices and it's way more reasonable than before. It's more quite so I can get my work done. Seeing more diverse people instead of one group. I love it:)

d1hvJd6Sh73lpM8A_R6v9w.text: Such a comfy spot. Barista are very welcoming and very talented. Baked goods are heaven.

e2RJXccTR4FMiHpxsS-2aA.text: What can I say?  Lux is a good spot with good food and good coffee. I had a salted chocolate chip cookie with my latte last night and it was delicioso.  I frequent this joint at night to work on the computer.  It's comfortable and the people are generally friendly.  A few of the reviews whine about the "fake Scottsdale" people and the "hipsters" that they have encountered at Lux.  Are you kidding me?!  The people are half the reason I go here- sightseeing!  If you're looking for a place where everyone looks the same and acts like a robot you'll be better served getting your caffeine at the ubiquitous coffee shop with the 'baristas" donning the green aprons.

fPfQT2Vn9L-NLdDYp1xQ6w.text: This place is my spot I literally go to almost every day to work on business stuff for photography (basically my office). First off they have the best tasting coffee, from cappuccinos to dirty chai's, they're all delicious. The layout and atmosphere of this place is very eclectic and an awesome vibe. From the different art, music, to styles of furniture like stained wood slabs for coffee tables, massive wood bench in center, and mood lighting, just overall has a great atmosphere. When you walk up to the register there is a massive assortment of pastries that blows your mind (if you're on a diet it'll be broken). They also have the best cocktails, there's no drink menu but they make it fresh on the spot, and best of all...they're STRONG! Not to mention flavorful. It's not overkill by any means but if you want a drink for your money ($8-10 on average) then Lux is the place. The staff there is very friendly and proactive, good to even chat with at the bar. Food menu is high quality and frequently changes, I've had chicken salad croissant sandwich, berry tart pancakes, a chicken cous cos dish with a large english muffin. Very different and overall great taste I'm very picky when it comes to my food. So overall this is my favorite place in all of Phoenix so far for vibe, drinks/food, coffee, hangout, all in one...

dygyzWl447R8oazJ0FQy1g.text: The cinnamon roll was delicious. The white mocha is my favorite. Their homemade whipped cream can be added to any drink and I recommend it. The food menu items change on a daily basis. Wonderful place in downtown. Many options to eat and drink. Friendly staff and great atmosphere. Great place to get work done or just hang out. Highly recommended!

6-09MKxeM9RNrEwGgHwYMQ.text: Only reason i can't give 5 stars is because this place is packed! Only because their food, coffee, and other beverages are the best in the area, along with a very friendly staff making sure you are taken care of!

LURjDHcB7lfyyt06WDaNQg.text: I can't get enough of this place. Love the coffee, the baked goods and the atmosphere. They're open late and if you're not in the mood for coffee, you can take a seat at their bar. Be sure to ask for a punch card. You get a free coffee after ten purchases.

d4GODPW-ON-r-JAENSunYQ.text: So this place isn't all that bad, most of their workers are very nice and accommodating but this is the second time I've had a bad experience here and tonight was definitely not okay. I went to buy an apple around 1030 ish pm and the girl at the register with long hair up in a ponytail, striped tee and nose piercing on the barista side was very condescending and when I asked her what my total was because I didn't hear her the first time, the tone she took was sarcastic and drawn out. I decided not to push it and instead go elsewhere but when my friend who was next in line wanted to purchase something, she took the same rude and condescending tone therefore my friend asked, "Is there a problem here" the worker answered, "we can make it a problem." First of all why? Second of all she didn't have to be so rude and forthcoming, it really did feel like she was trying to instigate something (I don't know what or why). Lastly, as someone who has worked in the service industry for years and never has written a bad yelp review I felt this was necessary. She also continued to be rude with comments like, "yeah, just go elsewhere," etc. I definitely understand she might be having a bad night or maybe she is just rude but it was definitely uncalled for and uncomfortable for everyone there and not just myself. I hope there is a follow up to this review if the if the owners care about the service that is being displayed when they're not there. PS: her name is Sonia

HG_KUWYhIVOPpGcCYi28WQ.text: Welcome to the most overwhelming place in the valley haha! So, this is about my fourth time at Lux and I thought what a perfect time for a review while sipping on a hot Lux Chai! Starting with the Chai, it for sure is not the best I've ever had as halfway through it gets decently water-y but the foam and the first few sips were great! This place is definitely hipster and has a lot to offer. They have a coffee bar with pastries, coffee and tea (I've heard the B&W is great but have yet to try it! Although, I have had the Iced Caramel Latte which wasn't the best..they're passion fruit iced tea was pretty decent, especially with unlimited refills while staying on the premises!) They also have a full-service open kitchen with all three meals and a wine bar! The atmosphere is wonderful, as their is so much seating in such an oddly shaped space! I have yet to try their food/pastries thoe! I keep seeing reviews with issues on parking but I've never had an issue with such! Now, granted, the maybe 15 spot parking lot is ALWAYS full, but the side street that Lux is located on is very easy to find parking on as their is always a space with possibly a very short walk. I would recommend this space to anyone looking for a good meal (as I've heard they're breakfast is great), a place to study, meet friends or have a drink!  Please check out my collection: "The Valley's Best Coffee Shops + Houses," on my profile; featuring Lux Central and other amazing Coffee Shops in Phoenix!

_R2EwcY-K5xQL2ceQxQ4Aw.text: Lux definitely ranks among that best atmospheres of any Phoenix coffee shop. The coffee is always solid and I particularly enjoy the wide selection of pastries/quick eats they have to offer. A must try for any coffee aficionado!

p7hbMaMG5fya_m5YGN6juw.text: Vanilla lavender donuts =   Also, the avocado toast is amazing! The bread is so yummy and soft!!

6kzXqxq37Yfr6n5oDEcEGQ.text: We found our favorite new place!!!! The Dutch pancake and avocado toast- to die for!!! The ambiance and vibe is so welcoming and cozy!!! This place is a must if you have not been!!!

BmMvbyKtGTfuKddfQ--wWg.text: *Definitely not hipster enough to understand the allure of this place*  If you are a fan of order and rules, this place is not for you. I'm still trying to find the line.   My friend and I went after class for coffee and breakfast, so we ordered two caramel macchiatos and two cinnamon rolls.   When we ordered our drinks, which every other coffee place in the history of coffee knows how to make, the barista rudely informed us that it wasn't on the menu and they don't make it like that. If I wanted attitude, I would've gone to Starbucks.   After the coffee debacle, we asked to have our cinnamon rolls warmed up. And OH MY GOD! You would've thought that we were asking her to climb Mount Everest! The barista threw the BIGGEST FIT I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY LIFE.   Long story short, I'm still trying to find the cinnamon for the cinnamon roll and get the burned coffee taste over my mouth.   **Currently en route to Dutch Bros.**

NbpxwC3SamUTFX8zYGpSwQ.text: Love it!! Great food and spirits. Service is great!! If your visiting or live in town I highly recommend it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I love this cozy hip place!

W86A77o9j5DqVdZrNx1T9g.text: Wow! The sweet cheese and mango pastry was SOOO delicious! The crust was flaky perfection and the mango cheese filling was exactly the right amount of sweetness. My boyfriend ordered the chocolate drop cookie. We both had white chocolate lattes. They were really good too. We found a parking space right up front, and a couple of very comfy chairs inside. It was moderately busy, but that didn't affect the customer service. The staff was still courteous and quick. I can't wait to go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet cheese and mango pastry with chocolate drop cookie

5pwfT7kPfXKm0RAB8K5J1A.text: What can I say about Lux Central besides it is freaking AMAZING! I come here pretty regularly to meet my bumble BFF for drinks and some amazing pastries. Definitely our favorite go to spot.

9PbE_ahZLdJ3kRx7GhoSAg.text: Hobo chic coffee shop downtown.. always is buzzing when I come through. Ordered some delicious looking pastries for my customers- a vegan, lemon poppyseed donut, a strawberry, blackberry, almond pie dusted with powder sugar and blueberry corn muffins. Didn't get to taste any, but they are definitely appealing to the eye. Also offer breakfast items to order. Their coffees are beautiful, as they add an artful touch to the beverages with cream or milk added. I opted for cold brew with 2 Espresso shots and was not disappointed!! So yummy! Had a house DJ playing chill music at 10am on a Friday morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Assorted pastries- $3 each.. blueberry corn muffins, vegan lemon poppyseed donut and strawberry with blackberry and almond cake

g1JL0rbuN8MM0qgNumeGuw.text: Look so I came expecting a great atmosphere and all I got was loud techno music that was making my ear drums bleed. The baristas were so rude I could feel the negativity radiating from their bra-less titties. It was so hipster that semi-hipsters felt uncomfortable, and if you didn't order your coffee with almond milk you might as well leave. As I sat down to drink my hot chocolate on the couch, 3 other people sat down next to me and started ranting about plastic waste and veg fest. The only positive thing I can say is that I got high with strangers for free. It was great. Would recommend.

F1or0fhrVB-rtfIE7tUXQQ.text: i've come here many times and surprisingly haven't gotten coffee. i frequently get their mac n cheese, cookies, or a tropical tea. all of which are amazing. i would even say that i think lux mac n cheese is the best i've had. the atmosphere is ultra hip and urban. there's always a ton of people tho so it's hard to find some privacy. it's a fun place to go to if you want to grab coffee with a lively atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7Es2AwE1UxNqWnN5xuZfXA.text: Awesome vibe!  Terrific coffees and more!! I travel frequently, and wherever i go, i always check out the best local coffee i can find and there is no doubt in this java junkies mind that Lux is numero uno in the valley!!

yGpCBBiwEm8ohes3Yj4-Aw.text: This is the best little (big) coffee shop! So many delicious snacks and the drinks are amazing. Lots of hipster vibes here and people hang out and study etc. Would totally recommend. Try the desserts!

m0tfXUQJYU_umgG4uUr7RQ.text: Great selection of beer.  Very quite, relaxed atmosphere with a projector TV playing the latest sports events.   They have a selection of baked items and breakfast.  They also double as a coffee shop. We didn't try the coffee but we will next time.   Alley enjoyed the cool cement floor and all the attention she got from the college students doing their homework Sunday afternoon.  She will be back!!!

JTP6EVtQPRiRNMYG5cVCsg.text: Nice place to meet up. Can get a coffee or a nice mixed drink. There tend to be people studying here and it can get a bit crowded. Worth a visit though.

Dz3ndymS__-d2LuJHmszQA.text: My favorite coffee in the valley! Great spot to grab a cup of coffee or glass of wine (or handcrafted cocktail) and hang out or get some work done.

4uNI5nG6bA0_342s8-5i7g.text: This place was p chill for my first time !! Am definitely coming again!! Although are there any bathrooms because I couldn't find them :((( pls let me know omg.

1hTATxxVJGT-Vb_CBL4pxw.text: Best coffee I've found so far. I buy it by the pound and bring it home to make my own...however while there I find myself trying to decide which of their delicious looking pastries I should get. Doughnuts are good and everything is a reasonable price.  Breakfast: eggs, toast was delicious.

2bepjRRjBAQE911Ir0cNVg.text: I come here for the amazing taste in food and drinks. However I wish I could come here more than once in a while where I have 2-3 hours to spare. I got here at 2:15  sat for about 10 min at the bar luckily I had people I really needed to update and text. It's Monday, not a lot of in and out traffic everyone is sitting and had a drink. It's now 2:25 and I'm greeted said tender will be with me. I say great. 2:30 I get a water and a menu. 2:40 I order the most amazing Mac and cheese that everyone comes for and a cocktail. Cocktail comes ten min later food twenty min later. It's 3:47 I'm still at the bar I left my card on the table to check out ages ago.  You know let someone else take the car seat. Drink empty ready to go. I'm looking at the bar tender here and there but not even any other staff notices I've been waiting. Food is amazing.  Drink is amazing.
