It will still feel like you don't matter Here it's almost 4 pm and I'm sitting here to see if the staff can read my body language or eyes. I could speak up but it's not busy yes I have time.  And I think after coming here since high school I know about this place more than others. It has a space in my heart but I leave  feeling full. And buzzed but not filled with joy anymore.

3NSR6MFqljRiw6FrlERCWQ.text: I'll start off with saying that i think this place is overrated. I don't know what the big hype is. The coffee is okay, the drinks are okay and the food is mediocre. HOWEVER I still gave it four stars because the service is great and the vibe of this place is just overall good. Great place to hang out with friends.

JCts4JaEjVsaddjMaqsi-g.text: Lux is everyone's favorite...which is probably why it is not mine. They are always busy and crowded which means service is rushed and impersonal and sometimes a bit rude. The drinks are always delicious and the pastries and food has been consistently great every time I've been in. I just hate standing in a crowded line, being rushed to order with no eye contact or the employee doing multiple things while I am trying to talk to them (which means sometimes my order is wrong), hunting for a table, and then going back to check if my order is ready several times. No, thanks. There are plenty of other great coffee shops with better service and just as good of drinks and food.

KuTBme2y_HkthS4wDtCwWg.text: Lux. You rock! My friend Michael describes Lux as being "an experience". Here is the skinny, it is the coolest coffee shop I have ever been to, so I would say that Lux is an excellent experience!  It was almost a week ago that my friend Jess took me to Lux and I am still geeking out over it.   I loved my coffee, my berry cornmeal muffin, the chocolate chip cookie (with salt on top) that my neighbor let me try, the drink selection, the ambiance, the DJ in the corner playing the cool music, etc. etc.  Groovy things about Lux--  You will love it the minute you walk in. I don't believe in love at first sight... but love at first entrance to Lux?  It happened.  They roast amazing coffees. So a good old- fashioned cup of coffee tastes Delicious. How much is that big beautiful cafe going to cost you?  $2. Are there free refills?  YES!  That is off the rocker cool!!  I have a local favorite coffee shop in Tucson and are my refills free?  Nope. The selection of quality coffee drinks and breakfast treats is still on my mind.  I also am thrilled that they offer soy milk, almond milk and organic milk.  Almond milk is my milk of choice. I wish every coffee shop had almond milk.  I'm so over soy.  So if I was to have an iced chai at Lux, I could pay an extra .50 and have my almond milk. Next time I am at Lux, which will be on my next Phoenix trip... I am having one of those iced mochas that I saw so many peeps drinking.  They put a dollop of cream in the mochas... I can't wait to have my own!  Cannot get over how rad Lux is!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-C3g0ZBhG7ulKOgHPLUuCw.text: I can't even begin to tell you all how addicted to LUX I am. I wish I lived closer BUT I'm also glad I don't because if I did, I'd be there everyday and eventually I'd go bankrupt. Yes, death to checking account by LUX. My next novel...  The service is always super and the interior is absolutely beautiful. I like beautiful things. I've taken many photos here over our visits (4 times in less than 2 weeks) and posted them via my blog and anywhere else I can show off my delicious brunching events.  Even when they are super slammed busy on a sat or sun morning they have a routine down to where your wait in line is never awful, we somehow always find somewhere to sit (even with a party of four), and the food/drink is out super quick.   That being said, just because the food is delivered quickly doesn't mean its sub-par. It's ANYTHING but that. Every time my man and I go we order the Veggie Egg  Bake, which is different every weekend, and the steel cut oatmeal. The Veggie Egg Bake is the perfect savory meal to accompany our sweet oatmeal! I seriously have dreams about our trips there. We always order iced soy lattes and add a fun touch with a colorful straw.  You need to go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. What I got when I ordered a &#34;side&#34; of toast with my meal :). Very generous and unnecessary.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gotta have my LUX soy latte.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy soy lattes

f6DqUVdSq_7YlPLA99n_oA.text: Always a treat to visit. Love the staff and the food is so good Look forward to every visit

juntQzt9uLKdjDN4Q9ixAw.text: I would give Lux 5 stars if it wasn't for my most recent experience. Don't get me wrong I love this place- from the food to the coffee to the ambience.   However, for my birthday we ordered one of their awesome cakes since it's my favorite. Called and spoke with one of their pastry people she gave me her cell telling me it was the best way to place the order. So we placed the order about 5 days in advance she said everything was good to go. I gave my name, order, and pick up time (1pm), seemed easy enough. Well, my birthday arrived and we went to pick up said cake- well you guessed it, it wasn't ready. The man working the counter looked at me like i was crazy while he went to inquire about my order. We can see him and the girl i'm assuming who took my order, looking around and starting to rifle through things and go through her phone! After waiting an additional 45 min (when i was told they just had to pull it out of the fridge) and watching them slap it together, mind you the man on the counter was the one who actually put the frosting on, not the pastry person, I finally received my cake. No "thanks for your patience" or "sorry about the wait" or for forgetting my order completely.  So, sadly this is why I cannot give Lux the 5 stars I wish I could. I have been here many times and am a loyal customer and frequent, this experience just left a bad taste in my mouth.  Enjoy their treats, coffee, and food,  but maybe be wary of placing a special order even if they assure you it will be made.

jUEeGw6hE4toRd3YT7VnMA.text: This place is amazing. I love the vibe. Saturday's nights are the best, they play music and everyone is having a good time. Tried the oatmeal cookies which were amazing and I'm usually not a fan of those kind. Also tried the macaroni and cheese and I loved it. The coffee had cool designs on it and the place is overall amazing.

xoe-SDIjAtIt3NDkOr3JnQ.text: I went to high school in the semi-neighborhood in the late 90s (damn, when did I get old?), and if my memory serves me correctly, Lux was actually open then. It was very hip, actually too hip for me, as I found the servers and the atmosphere very cold and unwelcoming...maybe even mean. Well, a lot of time passed, Lux changed buildings I think, and I was hearing great things about it from Claire F, who still lives in Phoenix. So ~12 years later, I gave it another try, and this time, it totally wowed me.   It's still hip. Like super hip. But this time, everyone is friendly enough to make you feel really welcome. The furniture and decor are really eclectic and thrift-store cool. The crowd is pretty varied - on a Saturday night there were a few people too young to sit at the bar, mostly 25-35s, and a few 50+ sitting eating or reading or working on their laptops.  My favorite part of Lux is that it has a little section devoted to everything: a to-go counter for the bakery items; a more 'restaurant-y' area with bigger tables for ordering off the full dinner menu which varies nightly; a bar area where you can sit at the bar and converse with the bartenders or at smaller cocktail tables; a back room where you can watch a movie or chat; and a quiet room which has no music so you can utilize the free wifi.  We didn't eat dinner, but the menu looked interesting - the special that night was some kind of steak with veggies. We did have desserts (awesome, especially the salted chocolate chip cookie) and drinks (excellent beer list, and 'collaborative' cocktails. Seriously, you just talk to the bartender about what you like).  To top it all off, the walls are filled with the work of local artists, they have a big patio on Central (near the light rail!) and it's located next to Pane Bianco.  If you think you're not cool enough to hang out here, you're not. But they won't hold it against you.

psHSzBC3OnSPYFlVvShoow.text: Great coffee and cocktails. Endless pastry options. One of my favorite spots.

1vJ5fbXwlZBL5hAvnME51Q.text: I am a fan of this place. There is plenty of space, providing the hipster crowd allows you some space and a plug or two, but other than than it's a perfect day or late night spot to hang, work, chat, or people watch.   The caffeine is strong, tea selection could use some work on, but baked goods and other foodie items are phenomenal.   Thank you for this cave of caffeinated perfection

1RfiHcMmjLnYLl1JPo6vYA.text: Great place.  I've been coming here for years.  Best coffee in town and the staff are friendly and kind.

H-yv6XHqB8N26xoqVAIFJA.text: I love coming here! It's just a chill place to do your homework and enjoy some good coffee and food. Always my go to spot. A little crowded sometimes, but if you come at the right time, it's super chill and I enjoy it!

mPHHlm4dI1D4kv7gJAaI4A.text: Cute little spot to chill. Full of hipsters when I was there. The environment was very chill, and the coffee is out of this world. They have awesome sweet treats too, and their food menu looked promising, but we weren't there for that. I am a coffee fanatic and recommend to my java-lovers out there. Only downside is that it was almost too full, I didn't get to explore the other side of the place. Definitely going back.

X0UDJ9-K75Hb2VNMgL9TLw.text: Okay.  Lux has very good coffee and great pastries and food; however, the place is a cluster-#@ck and for that, I give it 3 stars.  I try to avoid this place; however, when I'm meeting a friend who lives in the area it seems like the most viable option.  The line to get coffee is ridiculous and there is no sense of order whatsoever in the place.  People kind of stand around behind the cash register waiting for their name to be called to get their coffee.  As far as seating is concerned, good luck finding a place to sit down comfortably.  If you find a seat, keep it, don't get up to pee, because someone will take it.  Lux to me is more of a pick-up joint and not a coffee bar.  Everyone in this joint has a MacBook or MacBook Pro or iPad or iPhone.  Everyone here so desperately tries to be different and unique, but when you walk into the room, all you see are black-rimmed glasses and MacBooks staring at you.  Hipsters trying so desperately to be different, yet they all look the same.  Listen, I really like the overpriced coffee here, it's delicious, but everything else about the place is annoying.  Oh yah, parking also sucks, good luck with that too.

x0ktPobT9kCRi7262mC_hw.text: Kitchen closes earlier than they say it does and the last time I went I found 3 hairs in my coffee.

B_5IE8SbCuEEwEVyoco5ag.text: As a driver I took some out of towners to this coffee house and they were so amazed that we here in Phoenix have such a perfect coffee spot.  They visited everyday of their stay.  During their second visit and each time after they brought me a cup of cappaccino.  I am thankful for their generous thoughtfulness and now I know where the best coffee in Phoenix is located.  I make sure to inform all my guests about Lux on Central.  I can't speak about how the inside of the building looks but I can speak about the coffee.  It was great, flavorful and so tastey.  Everyone should visit Lux on Central.

ExwLzbqAjn8KEsIJtTBY9A.text: A must try just for the atmosphere! My husband and I, I would say, have just aged-out of the target demographic of this place. We actually brought our baby (as I said, just aged-out, so new baby must come along on vacations) and it was super chill. While there was no sitting inside, the outside was a lovely Phoenix evening with a lovely crowd of folks.   We tried out pastries and coffee drinks. The pastries--Red Velvet Cake and Lemon Bar--I wanted to love because they came on adorable mismatching china, but at that late hour they had unfortunately staled.   But the coffee! I had a decaf Americano and it was maybe the best coffee I've ever had. And to be honest, decaf is never good. It's just something to sip on whole others have a cocktail. This decaf, though...  My husband waited in the epic cocktail line (separate from the food/coffee drink line) and asked the bartender to surprise him with something coffee-based. He was served some kind of masterpiece of spirits and freshly-pulled espresso, complete with thoughtful aromatic garnishes. Again, rocking coffee.

eQ7-3YAxuUpujVkuujw1Fw.text: Great latte and breakfast breads! Very packed in the morning but it's worth the wait!

5g2wjP2e3_uW3WHuzZfTww.text: I heard this is a recruiting station for those homely American Apparel models. I heard they charge a cover if you don't bring a Mac.  All clientele jokes aside, this really is a place where an average Joe like myself can grab, well, an above-average cup of Joe. And more. This place has some apparently good eats, baked goods (some of which are vegan!), amazing teas, and a groovy beer selection.  I opted for an "Earl Greyer", because good black tea owns. This stuff was dank! The barista took the tiny pouch out of a can, and I could smell the bergamot from pretty far away. "Let it steep" he said, giving me about five minutes to scour Lux for this review. Here are some observations:  -I have excellent vision, but the menus printed on two windows were admittedly a pain to read. Sure you don't want to have some in print?  -The area to order and the area to wait seemed to be the same place. There is no clear line, but more of an amorphous bunch of people eager for service.  -The layout appears to encourage openness. Too bad most people are too busy typing away to enjoy what could really be a bustling social scene. Come on, there's amazing goodies, great music (I swear I heard some Band of Horses), and a bar. Live it up a little people!  -While the cooks were having a great time, I don't think my barista cracked a smile at any point. You have a great job. Enjoy it!   Overall, I just have some minor beef with Lux's interior. A haphazard design that can easily confuse newcomers appears to be an avenue of pretentiousness rather than a chance to showcase aesthetics.   But I'll stop nitpicking, I like this place a lot. Can't wait to try more!

0NC5dsHGqd0qxFMeBpucig.text: Number one: there's too many hipsters, too many old people, and not enough cool people.  Number two: why don't the people cooking food wear hair nets or hats?!  Number three: what's with the stupid maze like layout? People always looked so confused in there as if they've all forgotten how to walk.  Number four: the worst part of all, why do all the employees always look like they're way too cool to be nice and smile? Where's the customer service?  Number five: I don't understand the middle aged bald DJ...  Number six: I miss the old lux from 2006-2009 when it used to be cool.  The end.  UPDATE: the tea is now magically terrible; it's basically water with food coloring! And the employees are as rude as ever.

vxcBPZGwptcPxhy_rJd0oQ.text: I love coming here, food rocks, coffee rocks, even the cocktails at the hipster local joint. Shabby Sheik is a good look. However all the couches and comfy chairs look like they should be in an abandoned building. They are even too dirty and cracked for a homeless shelter. The staff is very friendly too. Time to hit the recycled furniture spots around town.

z_fSWQb4WJ9LbaKWX8Hf-Q.text: WE LOVE LUX!   We've been here just for coffee, a quick bite, dinner + drinks and it's always been delicious! The employees have always been nice and down to earth( never rude) the crowd is diverse, students studying, friends hanging out, families enjoying a Saturday morning, or couples having a date night on a Friday night.   No matter what brings you to Lux, you'll eat/drink something delicious and you won't be sad when you leave.

ffJT3BfckdAdsAGBrqlt2g.text: H-I-D-D-E-N, but loved this place.  Believe all the hype this place is really nice, when you find it.  I had the iced vanilla latte with caramel and homemade whip!!!  This coffee bar has a DJ!  LOL  I've never seen this b4!

TQzJKOpKUl5h1Y8BBoO7oA.text: I really enjoy this spot. They have great coffee, much better than usual food options for a coffee shop, and a lot of seating indoor and out. It has an artistic, industrial, rustic type of vibe that's very laid back. It's a great spot to hangout with friends, to read, to do work. etc.

ieRz__THadf9ZTEKfCciNw.text: I went here a couple times for coffee and breakfast. The coffee was decent but I didn't care much for breakfast. I had heard many great things about here; but for me, it didn't live up to the hype.

_PuGN6EpOI2rfDctnaW4Cw.text: I just moved to Phoenix because of my new job in journalism and one of my good friends (native of the area) recommended this place.  I don't really know how I feel about this place.  The coffee is great! So smooth and velvety; I drink it to the last drop.   BUT. The employees really throw me off.. As you walk in, you get this vibe that is so modern and urban which gets you all excited but once you get to the ordering area, it seems like they try to rush you through it. They don't even smile. And they look at you with this attitude of superiority towards others. I get that you work at a hip place and all, but it doesn't mean that you should act like you're better than everyone else that comes in.   A smile goes a long way, ya know.  Other than that, the place is always busy and alive. They have a quiet room in the back for people that could use a little peace and quiet to study.  Oh Lux, I'll try you out again soon but I hope your customer service is better.

4BPM0z0wB5uSAxxaXdEx9g.text: This place is delicious and if your a hipster you'll definitely love it too but if your looking for friendly fast paced Barista service, stick to Starbucks because the employees here are way to "cool-to-care" that you actually wanted your drink to go. I actually said that to a girl, and she handed me the to-go cup! saying "okay you can just pour it in here"  The food is good, the coffee is great, but you don't go there for the customer service. No doubt about that.

jVTOBlFNtlmWvt9hcz45iQ.text: YES and YES...   Awesome coffee shop. Beautiful ambiance and great tasting coffee. Breakfast was good. Customer service was nice. If you're in downtown PHX.. do yourself a favor and visit!

uqZBcG2pke3_Wf_xFmBoJg.text: If your looking for a fabulous place to have some coffee, meet with friends, waste some time or grab a bite to eat, Lux is the place. This local coffee shop is better than any chain coffee place.  Walk into this place and you will know why.  The atmosphere is a place where you can grab a seat on a couch and relax and enjoy your coffee or meal.  This is a great place to bring a lap top and do some work or play. This is a place that you could visit any time of the day or night.  Reminds me of a little coffee shop in downtown Denver that I used to visit.   The coffee is delicious and they have delicious pastries if you like. The only reason I give this a four star is they don't offer a Thai iced tea. :(

mPMwePF4KaBNC46osxzVxA.text: we come here a couple of times a week even though we live 30 minutes away. I love the mocha and black and white. My husband always gets the red eye. I miss them doing a rotating menu each night but I understand that must be difficult. The menu that they've adopted is a lot of what they offered before and still delicious. Everyone is super nice and always answers any questions you have about the menu. The always changing pastries are my favorite! We especially love the thumbprint cookies and oatmeal cream pies but everything we've had is amazing!

EB8gRV1LpWLv9MQDFYrNCg.text: Well well well.  You sneaky, non-descript, awesome little bastard of a restaurant.  Flipped two U-E's before I found you, hiding in plain sight.  Damn it Lux... damn it.   I suppose I'm easy, but I am freakin' smitten with Lux; beautiful, interesting restaurant with tables full of pastries and derishous foodz pumping outta their neat little kitchen that's in plain sight.     Hipster-ish? God damn right, but I'm the furthest thing from hipster and I felt no less love while I was there.  Seems fat white doodz with their bohemian children in tow (bohemian = I let my kid get dressed in the dark) are just as welcome.  It's nice to be pleasantly surprised by an eatery;  Lot-o-hype seems to be circulating about Lux - possibly because a bunch of  ass-hats were overly pumped about a new 'hip eatery' (entrance is dependent on either a  handle-bar mustache or a 1/4 sleeve tattoo).  Not the case; this place is le-jit.   What did I eat? Biscuits and gravy.  Biscuits and mother-freaking, delicioso GRAVY.  Damn, it was fine.  Not the healthiest thing in the world, but my arteries can go fuck themselves.  Unfortunately, with my dish of choice being so filling, I was unable to perform my duties as 'daddy-disposal' - My child's unfinished portion of dutch pancakes, with fresh berries and what I'm assuming was homemade whipped cream was left for the hungry, more than likely neck tattoo'd kitchen staff.  Vultures.   Can't wait to get at Lux again.  Mmmmmm.

VwqHqn4PnkECLU64XRUkvA.text: Are you a hipster?  Come to Lux!  Non hipsters welcome too. Great cocktails and their mac n cheese is OFF THE HOOK!!  Always have a DJ too, so good tunes. Oh, and the coffee is great too.

dgC07Xi7wzXWJFWEOH0JYA.text: Best biscuits and gravy I've had so far in my life. You have the option of normal sausage or chorizo..... Get the chorizo..  Staff is friendly, atmosphere is perfect. Comfortable and eclectic. Coffee is delicious and as I'm sitting here there are men rolling in huge bags of fresh coffee beans. Can't get much better than that. You can sit at a table or on a couch or outside. Very welcoming and nice. The entrance is kind of hidden but get over it :)

s15x3CvMP6gSSya-G3x3WA.text: Came here to study - because of the music, this place was louder than Saturday night bar even though it was early afternoon on a weekday. It is also full of out-of-work hipsters. Headed for a more coffee-shop like coffee shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Q8z8iHZ1qCjZq_9UNN5IlQ.text: There is nothing at Lux that you will not enjoy. I've had one of the best steaks of my life there at dinner and the baked treats are some of the best I've ever had. Everything is homemade and the sweets aren't too sweet which is why I love them!  The atmosphere is very hip and laid back with lots of rooms with tables making this a great place to get some work done. Just be prepared for a crowd! This place is THAT good!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy Latte!

JBmACamg1egQsqpLwvkbGQ.text: :( spicy bacon and burnt hash browns make for a sad breakfast.

tHF6UyjmlVPp6erMnxp72Q.text: Interesting place!  Order by standing in line, then keep checking back as they do not deliver food to your table. Ordered the quiche which was good, although a small, not generous slice. Noisy, busy and crowded and sort of chaotic, but enjoyed it anyway. Good coffee.

0pWEx0b5bjT0DB_45yp2AA.text: Love the feel of this coffee shop and the pastries are phenomenal.   i get the same cold brew with a splash of almond milk and must say it's a great way to start my highly-caffeinated day.  This spot is mega convenient when I jump off the light rail and right back on again without barely missing a step.   I don't drive but I hear the parking is good as well.   Certainly one of midtown's fave coffee shops.   def worth a try

1uHnYeifJLVpY0VKZonL-Q.text: Favorite of mine, albeit a bit dark inside. Delicious coffee and the food or pastries also delicious and fresh. When crowded they always have someone going down the line to help out, so worth the wait and I don't live in the area. Staff always nice. I usually try something different every time I go and never dissapointed.

e31eUzBX2BSoOstuKHHX5A.text: Remember.  Remember that feeling when Ariel sang "A Whole New World"?    When Aladdin promised Jasmine that he would show her the world?  When Arnold promised his men in the hit movie, the Predator, that "if it bleeds, we can kill it"?  This explains how my heart feels when I come here.  I order the Chai Latte, to which the chai is made in store, and I feel as if I have completed the tri-force.  When I order a moscow mule, they are out of mint, and the mixologist says that he has been experimenting with cucumber and cinnamon blend that he highly recommends and all of a sudden I know kung-fu and I see 0's and 1's, I know that I have hit a special place.    Lux does what you want it to do.  They bake, cook, saute, brew, and mix everything this world has to offer and the next.  They have a wide assortment of beers, make killer desserts and they dinner menu is varied.  According to Ashley N. (2014), they make the best Mac and Chee which I must confess is mad suspect considering the Tuck Shop winter menu exists in this fair city.  Obey your thirst.  XOXO,  ~Mikey  P.S. Dedicated to a special Cynthia I know.

EVhHB1FEELkzNiUIFO1GlQ.text: Awesome staff and awesome drinks! I was here around June and i would say that it's one of the best spots for a very hot night. The coffee crew happens to ride fixed gear rides and asked me if i wanted to do a social ride but i did not have my bike at the time. I would definitely go again when i visit!

9TDtIUAIHGVIQ6Dr96ZyFA.text: I love coming here to hang out, visit, do work and people watch.   The quiche is amazing.  The coffee is great.  I have recommended Lux to everyone who will listen.  I am disappointed in the way I have been treated by the newer female employee manning the cash register the last two times I have been in; she was rude, dismissive and acted like I was inconveniencing her by placing an order.  The owner, Jeff, is so nice and personable--I am really surprised he would tolerate this type of behavior by an employee.  Let's hope he does something about it.

KoU_ppASdzAXWna0fcpBcQ.text: Just tried Lux for the first time today. Seriously! How did I not know about this place? I think I'm a little out of touch with the hipster crowd, so that's probably why. However, I am a creative type and really loved the atmosphere and crowd here. I sipped a carmel latte, which was good, but could have been hotter. I didn't eat anything, but the food looked and smelled incredible. My only little complaint was that the girl who rang up my coffee was lacking in the people skills arena. I mean, we get it, you're tatted up and you don't conform, but it's still a busines and I'm still a customer -- and I'm spending money. I would expect her to at least give the appearance that she likes working there. A smile or a little intro to this place would have been appreciated. I tipped her a buck too, which I would bet most of the hipsters don't do. That said, there are tons of seating options here, all arranged quite well. You can work independently, gather with friends to chat, meet with a client or even go on a date at Lux. You can also meet some really interesting people there if you hang out. Happy to have discovered this little gem of a place. I'll definitely return, and hopefully the grouchy chick will crack a smile this time.

Dz22x0tT7yUeI00J4ArBCQ.text: Best coffee hangout in Phoenix that I've seen. Highly recommended for people looking to hangout, study, or meet-up with friends.

veZCfMeqwUfN6bxwJKLeDA.text: Lux Coffee is a good cup of joe and even better place for creatives to run into each other.

L4KdkxTqG4tKnSCSp89r6Q.text: missing 5 stars because they don't have raw sugar for my coffee

Lf7qvjAFZYf4TiOlgBVC1Q.text: this has got to be the best, most amazing little  coffee place i've ever experienced  besides cafe trieste in san francisco!! wish we had this in boston...

NoU0p9NAXsl5h4cy9Onahw.text: It is nice market, offering unique items and the coffee is fairly solid.  Nice place to relax but the breakfast is forgettable.

i-F0ujoXqM9gF16_Fjpm6A.text: You know you're at Lux when you see about 5 fixed-gear bikes parked outside and when you walk in, don't get confused; you're not at the Apple Store. Lux has great coffee and they always make a pretty design in the foam. Staff is great and environment is conversation-inducing.

mcD_wVmuzCmCvNeZlF_Oag.text: I found Lux on my first trip to Phoenix last fall via Yelp....  and it was definitely a welcomed alternative to the "chain" coffee houses.  ...  Speaking of which, I am quite partial to the Mocha one such chain serves and so I tried it here.  Now I make a point to stop in at least once while I'm in town for Lux's version of it....  ESPECIALLY with the home made whipped cream.  Ooooooo.  Mmmmmmm.   :-p  But seriously, Lux is a great place to go for that cup of "coffee" you're craving, but consider yourself warned as others have mentioned; Lux is almost ALWAYS busy, so seating and even waiting for your order can be rather inconvenient (think Grand Central Station busy on weekends)....    and for that my review would have been for 3.5 stars instead of 4.

eIeJ4vxnPqSsKjlqQ8zeWQ.text: nice place to study. drinks were pretty good. definitely a hipster kinda place.

94blAhchR-V5NWNPYIbRzA.text: Oh yea.  Talk about a coffee house with personality.  Lux is delux!  I love the furniture.  I think came from second hand shops and are 1950's and 60's originals.   Love the DJ in the back. Love the baristas.  Watching them is like watching an artist at work.  Fluid motions tap the doser, fill the portafilter just right, tamp and connect to the, from what I've heard, custom made hand-pump espresso machine, to make the most ethereal coffee experience.  This is not your average joe and you have to be ready for it.  I loved the mix of people sitting at the tables, hanging with their MacBooks and enjoying the morning.  Very eclectic group of people.  Great place to sit and people watch for sure.  Bought a pound of their custom roasted, organic coffee.  Was kind of annoyed I didn't say I wanted the espresso roast, but when got back home, boy was i in for a wonderful surprise.  Even their regular roast coffee is an experience.  I asked them to move to Salt Lake.  They said they would.  Can't wait!

GTunPMafg7BxqbjUW5ivNg.text: We drive from the northwest valley for their heavenly  Black & White lattes with (amazing) fresh whipped cream. And their baked goods (lemon tarts, plum cakes, cupcakes, etc.) are other worldly. Great college town vibe.

oZRc73yt-UkprIoEdRGwYA.text: Lux is a great place to have a cup of Java and work on your lap top. Centrally located, right off the light rail, Lux is a great location. It is always happening. Lux is funky and inviting. The walls are feature ecclectic artwork and the music is great.

J1Oblmzd78dRjL7o5j8emA.text: Lux on a Friday night is just as busy as any neighborhood bar might be.  Instead, you have a wonderful warm beverage alternative to your glass bottled brew.  Lux serves iced beverages too, but let's face it: coffee is best served hot.  I sampled the ice mocha, per recommendation of a friend who's been frequenting the joint for some time.  Amazing!  I did feel a little crampy afterwards, but that could simply be because I don't usually drink dairy products.  The Rice Krispie treat was really tasty, but those are hard to screw up.  :)   The place was packed with some cool-looking people.  Everyone seems to keep to themselves as they work on their respective laptops.  In fact, some people even shared tables yet remained fixated on their own computers.  Really this place has a great vibe, and it made me feel like I was back in Europe.  I'd like to see soy or rice milk on the menu.  Otherwise, great coffee joint!

tyw5KruTmJH7OoFMWwLmrw.text: Peanut butter cookies are dry. Stick with the peanut butter brownies.

Rxky9NjXUI80JUXRQd_7gg.text: i can see why this place is popular. it's definitely hip and in a cool location. their coffee and their service have only been mediocre in my experiences, however. bitter shots and huge bubbles in the milk. even though the place is well known, you can probably find better quality and less of a pretentious atmosphere elsewhere.

K2XLKWIqQzTL2VSPKhNoNA.text: Lux is SO bi-polar. Half the time the music is unbearable- industrial and LOUD and the service is little more than a grunt from the guy taking your order and your money. The other half of the time the music is Jazz and very conducive to drinking coffee and talking and seemingly more appropriate for the environment. Every once in a while there will be a semi-friendly face at the register, but not very often, in fact it is rare- I once made the mistake of ordering a small drink and they snarled at me that they "only pull double shots" which I had read only moments earlier on the menu but had already forgotten (mommy brain) but they definitely could have handled that a little more nicely. They have books and other kid entertainment so I know they WANT to be kid friendly but the loud industrial music has got to go. The coffee is good and the environment is cool. The pastries are heavenly. I would have only given them 2 stars but the owners are pretty cool and I have hope that they will become more consistent with the music and service. I haven't been there in  a while, mainly for fear of a bad experience but I will give it another chance. I hope they become less focused on being "cool" and more focused on giving customers a genuinely well rounded- good experience.

meIfEaAsVmMWj45JaEriOQ.text: best coffee shop and best coffee in phoenix. they do their own italian roast right there. great people and art too. awesome place to relax.

8AO-nPxQpk6jtd8Hq8ZIrA.text: i am definitely a fan of Lux. with their thrifted-looking furniture, their 'home-baked' goods, their mis-matched ornate plates and DELICIOUS homemade whip cream. this is a non-traditional, neighborhood/community centered, laid back spot. plus the people at the counter call you by your first name. you may find yourself sharing a big table or the lounge area with someone you don't know, which is another thing i like about this place. the invitation for conversation with someone new, and a anti-egotistic, friendly, personal space sharing. i love this place and i will go back any chance i get.

t1ZCtCgy7g-falsihULUYQ.text: Very good, Cartel is better by far.

-RyKiTj3ThVVOCr6SfHiyg.text: Great coffee! The outdoor seating and coffee was a perfect way to end a Arizona vacation.  It was crowded on the Sunday afternoon we went, but there is plenty of seating and a variety of rooms and couches to sit on.  The food looked good too.

CqGfhOkqcEBrXiOKPxQQag.text: I hadn't been here in awhile but found myself on a Sunday night desperately searching for a coffeehouse for a guest on a layover from the airport.  Lux is open till 10 pm SUNDAYS!  hooray!    Iced mocha and baked goods get two thumbs up.  Indoor seating is comfy but the seating areas seem really crammed together.  Seems a bit claustrophobic with so much furniture in there but perhaps it's due to the summer heat.  All in all a nice place to spend a sunday eve.  Thanks Lux!

hRSVf50UL6q33k3fh0VShg.text: Wow! Great coffee, Great Ambiance. Coming from Seattle, I always wanted for find a good coffeehouse in Phoenix and this one is the best  I have found so far! It was busy but the coffee made was perfect, the lattes are fantastic. How cool is that they have old fashioned typewriters!  IT's easy to get to and lots of parking. The food was a little bit on the pricier side but really yummy. Will definitely be a go to place! They also serve freshly made cocktails , got to try those one of these days.

hai9CDs8T6yTsLouaUmMmg.text: My wife and I ate there on a Wednesday evening.  The pro's:  Beautiful decor on the inside, spacious and well appointed, very clean and neat.  We were seated right  away and our waitress was attentive throughout the meal.  They have Kirin beer on tap!  The con's:  The food was not good.  I lived in Japan for ten years and I know Japanese food intimately.  My wife ordered a crispy skinned salmon salad (not really a Japanese dish) that was mostly crispy skin and very little salmon.  She says it tasted good, though.  I ordered yakiniku which was not only a very small portion of meat, the whole thing was drenched in sauce to the point that you could not taste the flavors of the ingredients.  The sauce was not even close to Japanese in flavor.  The prices are ridiculous for everything.  The menu is quite limited in terms of most of the things I would normally order, like sukiyaki, katsukare, shabu shabu, katsudon, etc.  Ginbon is far better and cheaper, albeit that when I ate there last they had some service issues.

zuj_XGjs7EHka5qLK9VUYw.text: Lux almost gave us a reason to move to Phoenix.  We have had breakfast in many cities, including such notable breakfast cities as Berkeley, New York, and our own Somerville, but this has to be the best breakfast place ever.  The woman at the front desk of our hotel recommended Lux the first morning and during our entire stay in Phoenix we never went anyplace else for breakfast.  For starters the place has a great blue-state vibe--definitely not what we expected to find in Arizona.  And then there's the food which was truly amazing, especially the veggie hash with eggs and terrific toast and (another morning) the best oatmeal I've ever had.   The coffee was superb as well.  We never did get there for dinner but we're thinking we may have to return to Phoenix just to have breakfast at Lux.

skl1w0uBTXdEqx_9ikMxDQ.text: Man, this place is like something out of a movie, or magazine, or perhaps just real life.  I really love being in their space, and I love that after only three times, Danielle, who took my order, remembers my name, and knew the name of the guy behind me, too.  That sort of personal touch means a lot to me, and despite some of the pretense--like having a DJ on a Friday morning (spinning good tunes, I might add)--it's comfortable and fun.    I like that they serve my Moroccan Mint tea in a cast-iron tea kettle.  I like how they cook all the goodies right there in the same space as the customers, and I like that the people who work there match the style of the space.  Wish they did pour overs and pressed coffee, though.    Their mixed alcoholic drinks have all been excellent, although pricey.  My favorite is the slightly odd margarita they make, and it takes about five minutes to create, so be patient, but it's well worth the time.  Prepared food takes forever, especially if there's a line, so I suggest ordering a pastry behind the glass and a drip coffee if you are in a hurry, but then this isn't Starbucks, so don't come here if you need to rush off.

RPn66Q1hUiFY7JezbcZo8Q.text: You know what I love most about Lux? Their hours. 7am - 10pm every day. I never have to second guess if they're still open, or if this is the day that they close earlier than normal. They also have a killer Republic of Tea selection and make a great latte. Lux is a great place to go to get some work done, or just to sit and relax with friends.

mSGOG2P9X4E6opjKcuRRqg.text: Great Chai lattes and great atmosphere. They have a menu as well as decadent pastries. They have tables in the front with outlets so you can study and plug your laptops in. There's also a back room if the music is too loud, but it's dimly lit. And there's a projector with a couch in the back as well and it's usually displaying football or basketball (depending on the sports season). One of my favorite coffee shops and it's next to Pane Bianco if you want pizza or sandwiches.

X9YjxPrnq44khO3AX_GGRQ.text: I love everything about this place. I feel more at home here than I do at my own place. The breakfast is good, the music's great, the coffee is amyaaaazing and I love the little hearts/hippie flowers they make with the milk. There seems to be a lot of regulars which helps to make Phoenix feel more like a small town community. There is no reason not to check out LUX!

LwVlyjiZWLs94SnMXFrQuw.text: Walkin in the coffee shop authenticates the True hipster inside of you

4Qw7WKCZeZPHXdwp8o5z_g.text: Mmm, Lux. Some of the best coffee in Phoenix. The interior is ever-changing as new artists are featured on its walls and the furniture is rearranged on a regular basis.   Beans are fresh roasted on the premises so you know it's fresh and not vacuum-sealed from some huge faceless corporation. (I think you know who you are...)  There is plenty of seating inside and out front under the covered awning. This comes in handy during the summer months for getting out of the sun, but does that really matter when it's 117 degrees? And why are you drinking hot coffee on a hot day like that? What would your friends say? I suppose you could always try it iced too...

_JqTiyuAb3X2kVYjeZKpqQ.text: Still love the coffee.   For the first time ever, I order my coffee and something sweet - for there. While in line, I eyed the sweets. I wasn't the only one, though. A little fly was having his fair share of sugar, flying from scone to muffin to cake. My heart dropped. Luckily, they had a few choices covered up in glass. I chose the massive, super-chocolate walnut brownie.   Somehow, miraculously, I managed to carry two plates to the "coffee condiment station." I set the brownie down gingerly on the napkins. Then I balanced the coffee cup and saucer in my left hand.... while pouring cream slowly into the cup with my right. I made it almost to the door, when I decided to set the brownie plate down and sip the coffee below the rim - before it sloshed all over the place. It was a suspenseful, long walk and I didn't have a clue how I was going to turn the door handle and make it outside. I stepped aside and asked the people behind me to give me a hand. I don't think they heard me, but they held the door open long enough for me to slip outside... and into a wooden bench directly under the noon-hour sun. Wowza.   Since it's always so hard to find a spot inside, I opted for out. My brownie began to melt. The hot coffee tasted great, but it did little to save me from the heat and the sweat beginning to collect down my spine.   Needless to say, I tossed the coffee back like it was a cheap shot at a club, stuffed my brownie in the to-go bag I requested and practically jogged to my car, where I blasted the A/C and drove away.  Upside of all this? I sliced my brownie into small pieces and shared it with my co-workers, who have not yet been to Lux, although I keep telling them to go... Looks like I brought Lux to them.

YA73tjKwfxNgiu50aLWF7A.text: I like this place. It's pretty cool. My sister took me and I got a chai latte and a vanilla cupcake with espresso frosting. Yum....  The small drink size is SUPER SMALL, so be sure to get a medium.

ltqr9lmQRAD_01D6WKIEoQ.text: Thank God this place exists in Phoenix ... very non-sellout.  I think it's entirely frequented by transplants.  One day we will rise up, but until then we'll be at Lux hiding from the sun.

_OM0KiLt91XOoTkjX8tLGQ.text: I don't really do the whole "hang out at a coffeebar" type thing, so my review is based only on the drink itself, which has been awesome every time I've been there.    Best in the valley.   It's a shame Central is such a pain.

s5y2EA6PSkga-WF4FdXHdw.text: We were visiting Phoenix and found Lux on Yelp, and we were glad we did. Traveling with two kids isn't always easy, but Lux had many wonderful and tasty choices for all of us. The service was wonderful even though they were crowded both days we went.  During both visits we had: coffee, hot chocolate, and fresh squeezed o.j. all were very tasty. As for food, butter croissant, cheese croissant, chocolate croissant ( see a pattern here?), coffee cake, quiche, savory Dutch pancake (amazing!), and biscuits with gravy. Each item was perfect, exactly as it should be. Cannot recommend Lux enough.

2B449uBkmudXsyVXrL3uyA.text: The best feature about Lux is the ambiance, 'feels like home".  On my first visit to Lux I had a Velvet, I drank that one and ordered one to go!!!!  Been drinking them ever since.  The baked goods are amazing.  I have never had a meal that I did not enjoy!!!

kALMi5EthmmzpicnCLNNhQ.text: I have been coming to Lux for years ever since I started graduate school here in AZ.  What is there to say that hasn't already been said other than hands down it is my go-to coffee spot in Arizona.  Such a warm and diverse group of people, rotating artwork, the perfect study music playing in the background (although it is played a bit loud), espresso roasted on-site and baked goods made on-site.  Always find an excuse to end up there for a cafe au lait or a velvet if I have a sweet tooth!

bSKAACOy84gLjDjq1YaEew.text: As a new-comer to Phoenix, two months into my stay I finally made my way here to meet a friend... I wished I had found it the day I moved to Arizona. Great ambiance; fun, adventurous and tasty food (I mean whoever thought of putting jalapenos in mac-n-cheese).  The "Yorkshire Pudding Burger" was awesome.  If I'm ever back In Phoenix, I'm planning on using this as a meeting place for a reunion with friends.

hTzvdFGu9p5hkfRw09L53g.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!   If only it wasn't so far from where I live.. I would go all the time. I do occasionally make the drive because the coffee is delicious! I've had the BEST coffee that I've ever had here. I also get the black and white. It's amazing. I also ordered the mac and cheese!  would recommend that to anyone who goes here! The atmosphere is a bit on the "hipster-ish" side but it's nice.

cB0sONgjkLEMntU-G4hNXw.text: Love this place! This is a quirky spot where young businesspeople and freelance writers and locals who work remotely seem to congregate. They have so-so pastries, but I really like their unique coffees -- like a red velvet latte!

uD-AMq-3GMi-2ShGCoZLJg.text: I am sooooo not a hipster but I loved this place all the same. Staff is friendly. Coffee and baked goods are yummers. And the atmosphere is perfect for working on some school work (which is precisely why I stopped in), meeting/schmoozing with friends, people watching or even a casual first date? Tons of seating.  I've lived in the area for almost 2 years. how could I have missed this place?  Can't wait to try the regular menu.  One weird thing,  which has absolutely nothing to do with the cafe, is that it seemed almost every single person in the place has an Apple-brand laptop. It was kinda twilight-zoney. And the funny thing is my co-worker asked me the next day If I noticed that everyone had Apple Laptops. I DID! I DID!   :) Go and love it!  UPDATE - 10/20/13  OMG! I just have to update with one of the most amazing cakes I have ever had. It is a slice of Vanilla citrus cake with coconut filling. My tastebuds are doing the happy dance right now. Dee-freakin-licious, people! Earlier, I had the NY strip with couscous with carmelized onions and mushrooms and broccoli. I rarely crave red meat but for some reason I was today and Lux did NOT disappoint.   Also, I was getting hangry (hungry and angry) cause this guy in front of me was ordering like really slow and asking too many questions but this amazing, beautiful  lady with long dark hair and a warm smile, who i can only assume is the manager, calmed me with her amazing customer service and awesome chilean wine recommendation. I love Lux!

7J4wIN6qqQOEuJuCLCFe4Q.text: Super cool, chill place. Vegas needs one of these. No doubt a great spot to meet up w friends or to brainstorm. Lots of cool peeps here too. I'll be back. Couches and seats a plenty. Plenty of space. Maybe a Vegas version would be open even later ;)

x-TbsJc8Tt1yfbh9lUtgeA.text: I love this spot. Great food, coffee, pastries and there's a bar! A lot of people come here to study during the day.

1RCB0KxwY6pijg_gn9aVzw.text: Pretty cool hipster downtown place. Good quality products. Too cool for school, but if you don't care about that kind of stuff, it's solid.

sQ_yghN8p18LbuU_YEvoFQ.text: Most conveniently located in my backyard, downstairs from the Pavilions on Central. My favorite place AM or PM for all things coffee, food and craft cocktail related. My most favorite meeting and rendezvous spot!

F56WHBQu0GLZwDLupa9Gkw.text: Good coffee. Great food. Seating can be a bit of a nightmare, especially if you have more than 2 people joining.

GeqVoO-uLSsNbVdU1NR2_Q.text: Can I just say yum!!! I love this place. I wish it wasn't so far or I would make it a daily outing. Great pastries and great coffee. There was barely any seating but it was a nice place to go to and get quality coffee, I usually have to settle for Starbucks basically burnt half the time. At Lux, it's smooth and tasty. Not too sweet and not bitter. The staff is always so nice. Go try it once and you will be hooked.

6ZL_sitBpfI2NMASR2FlJA.text: I was here one morning, and the line was extremely long. All in all, I stood around 30 minutes waiting for a latte. The staff explained that their usual machine was broken, so they were making coffee one cup at a time on a non-commercial machine. No discount on the coffee even (and it's not cheap)! I considered also the menu, but thought it was too pricy. The atmosphere, while professional, is very noisy. This is not the sort of place I'd meet someone for business meeting. As far as the quality of the coffee, it was ok, but if I wanted to go out of my way, I'd probably be better off going to Cartel.

D4iiizmyamX4YhmhNHasgQ.text: Definitely a place to have a chill night or get some studying done. They have a cool vibe there and the staff is friendly. You have to try their Mac and cheese.

rSTJ569GVIACMQI7xjqvLw.text: I went there for the first time this week. It went it about 9am and it was super crowded, no parking and no where to sit. The pastry I ordered was mediocre, but the egg sandwich I ordered was delicious.

uep75a2g3Z0ubxTA4p2Ipg.text: this has always been my favorite coffee shop in phoenix.  the organic lattes are the fuel that powers me through this crazy world!  i love the ambiance, the people, the food, the art, the music, the couches and of course the coffee. (these guys roast their own beans incase you didn't know)  i have not had the privilege of dining here yet, but i'm sure it is a wonderful experience like everything else.  jeff has done an amazing job breathing life into the new location.  i truly feel the heart of my community every time i am at lux.

qULElylWtak43W5HdtiT0w.text: Ahh lux. I love the coffee, I love the atmosphere, the only thing I don't like is the wait. Some times I wait 15-20 minutes, which is typically fine because I'm sitting down to work, but some times I still wait when there's no one there. All in all, the coffee is great, the staff is courteous and nice, and the atmosphere is relaxed.

xJpQfhRjjojPHfZUIfQcZA.text: Nice little coffee shop right here on Central. It has been here quite a while now. It has everything you could want in a Coffee Shop. Great coffe, really good Tea. Nice things to eat. They even serve alclohol. With the weather being so nice outside it is really nice to sit on Central and watch the cars go by.  If you have never been here it is nice to stop in every once and a while. Nice place to pass some time!

MMiiwOgRpWuZdGuWFaoxyA.text: OK, so I've only been here once, and only to shoot a short film in one of the many, many rooms inside the fun and interesting maze that is Lux.  I had some tea and a breakfast pastry of some kind, which were both great.  I wanted to try so much more, but we were on a shooting schedule (thanks for the space, BTW) and didn't want to look like a hog on-camera.  So it may be tricky finding parking, but you can easily take the light rail here too.  And it's worth it when you get inside.  We were there on a Saturday very early when just a few regulars and the staff milled about.  But as it started to fill up, I could sense the community that develops because of the atmosphere.  It reminded me of the coffee houses in the Pacific Northwest; like Seattle, a place I've never been but where I hear coffee was invented in 1991 by Captain Kirby Starbuck (I jest).    Anyway, it is both a place to sit alone and enjoy your breakfast/coffee on a comfy couch with a good to mediocre book, and a place where you go to meet people and talk because you're forced to by the people hogging the nice seats.  Also, you can wear your Matisyahu t-shirt here and people will get it (they may groan, but they get it).  So go to Lux to make some friends, level up on your hipster points, or just hide out because it's probably better than the Starbucks closer to you where all the unfriendly snowbirds hang out.  Oh, and it appears they're open and night too, serving alcohol, which is a bonus.

fYQV6urZs9T2UyPicRRoNg.text: The prices are a little high, and the place can be a little snooty depending on who's behind the counter, but overall their service is usually good and so is the food. The place is always packed, so it's not the best for studying unless people in what I think of as the "quiet room," are all actually quiet, but I've used it in a pinch since they are open late. If you go to meet up with friends the ambiance is nice.

Yp4HGg2pFLemqWWxTYOFFg.text: Looks like I found a great place to hang out in PHX while near BCP in downtown area. I like it a lot.  Great atmosphere, food and workers.  Employees are very nice.

9FYh1M5kqu-EyPFwiuqOBw.text: I've been here many times in the past... No room to disappoint. Everything about them is top notch and on point.

PZACLYX3eFVnKqD-HOKU1A.text: My string of visiting exceptional coffee houses over the last week continues, this time in Phoenix.  Lux bills itself as a micro-roaster.  It is that, as well as a great place to work, network, meet friends old and new.  A great find in Phoenix!  If I continue to travel for work, Lux will be a must-visit stop when in Phoenix!  I recommend the House Special Black & White Latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lux - my favorite Phoenix coffee spot.

rF-kiLZYTmsP-2x2ilzEnw.text: I love this place!!! It's pretty hip and it's got a really good vibe. The drinks are so yum, and the whip cream. Is. So. Good. They are a little stingy on the whip cream, but make sure that you ask for some, if you don't, you will regret it.   Also I had the coffee cake and the breakfast egg cheese, tomato and bacon sandwich. Holy moly-so tasty.

pvRlm5EDG1UCiSjz5jnf3Q.text: Best coffee!!!  How do you say this place is f*ckin amazing. The music is always great, the service is fabulous and the coffee is ALWAYS 100% perfection. The baristas are really baristas making the coffee feel like drinking the best art.

H3UI4WCNSevKW8zwhnufzA.text: Great latte and pleasantly suprising breakfast foods! We had biscuits and gravy and thick bacon, scrambled eggs with garden hash. Perfectly delicious!! It was super busy, but it flowed well! We would come here again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homeschooling at Lux!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful latte art every time!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hazelnut chocolate tart. Holy delicious!

56W-MKnuPTzOx0OQtREmVQ.text: Nice People   Good place to meet for a morning meeting

XA9CjbY0hUG70XNVMLN1AA.text: My new favorite stop in Phoenix!  I love this place -- the iced mochas are spectacular... and so far, the pastries have all been amazing!  So nice to find a place like this here in Phoenix... it reminds of the Bucktown/Wicker Park neighborhoods in Chicago... my old stomping grounds!  Yay!!

jt0OvKuP68ARiUk45zQrdQ.text: Amazing place.  Their food is fantastic and the vibes make it the perfect place to sit down and socialize, chill, or do work.

5Itu8hxS7zlNXvCEw7BCNg.text: Interesting spot. Went here after my friend suggested I check it out. Wasn't impressed. Annoying staff and loud music, oh yeah and overcrowded with hipsters that look like wanna-be coffee shop artists from Seattle. My coffee was sitting on the counter for 5 minutes and when I went up to the barista what is taking so long to make expresso, she told me that they had "called my name." Which they didn't or maybe the music was too loud. They should probably see why I have been standing there so long. Bad customer service. Another thing is I was waiting in line and the barista started taking the order of the guy BEHIND me...he never checked to see if I even ordered. The guy behind me ended up telling him I was actually first. Nice job. I am not returning, not worth the 35 minute drive from North Scottsdale. Pass.

qAfpI1oC5b9fCNV2MxEn_Q.text: -UPDATED-   Great coffee, nice place (call it "hipster" if you want...stupid, made up word...) and an EPIC breakfast sandwich. The egg sandwich is expertly done. Can't wait to go back.  Updated 12/4/14: This has since become my spot. Every Wed or Thursday I go in and get breakfast. Sandwich and iced coffee is the routine. Love it!   I missed breakfast today though so gave their pulled pork sandwich a whirl. SO good! Can't recommend this place highly enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pulled pork sandwich...SO good!

hFb7gcThcD-QrPfn2v3gOQ.text: Coffee coffee cofffee! So damn good. The atmosphere is very trending. The baked goods are all wonderful. This is a must go next time you're in the area.

IXLz8hVbt70Sx4hxh40xpA.text: Currently obsessed with the sweet Dutch Pancake with the homemade whipped cream! So happy they added it to the lunch menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caramel vanilla iced latte and sweet Dutch pancake!

M3g286nTEFkasTdWi9S_nA.text: My sister-in-law says look for a place for coffee and sweets, I get on my Yelp app and Boom I see Lux, it's open late and have a what we are looking for. We walk in and it's pretty full, we sit down at a table with complete strangers which was fine, talk a little and then our order, I say this is my first time here what do you recommend (which I do often to see if the people who work there know what they are selling) the waitress that helped us out was like try this and she recommends my coffee and I go with it...I was like GIRL you know your stuff and I appreciate the recommendation.  I will be back because of you.  SCORE!  I loved this place. Great feel all around, the people who work there are there cause they love to be there and know their stuff.

zVEuad0fJOFgbWucLoLKfA.text: The thing about Lux, is that it's the kind of place you don't realize is amazing until you can't go there regularly anymore.   When I worked in Central Phoenix, Lux was my daily coffee place on the days I got my ass out of bed early enough to stop before work after driving down from the far Northwest Valley. I'd stand in line like a zombie, roll my eyes at all the try-hard hipster clientele crammed into Lux's old space and pray that my coffee would take less than 15 minutes to come out. It was a means to an end.  Then, I got a promotion that put me at work closer to home, in the suburban wasteland known as the West Valley, where the only options for a morning java are the Circle-K on the corner or one of the 50 Starbucks locations within a mile radius. (I'm a VIP gold card holder now. Yay for me. *blows kazoo*)  But occasionally, I do get downtown. A friend might want to meet up for dinner at Windsor or I might need to turn in some paperwork down at the state department, and every single time I'm near, I find myself drawn up Central Avenue toward my old morning haunt.  Now, when I go to Lux, I welcome the cool reception from the baristas. I relish in the fact that the people who come here know what they want and how to order it properly. I enjoy the moment I get to take my hot latte and my carefully bagged pastry and find a dilapidated couch to perch on, where I can listen fondly to the nearby hipsters talking about art, music and other pretentious things, because it's so SO much more interesting than listening to a gaggle of PTA moms discuss "super cute" Pinterest DIY projects to make with their children Braden, Jaydyn and Vadinn.  And let's face it, Lux does make the best latte in town. The temperature and the ratio of milk to syrup to espresso is always perfect and it always comes out with a lovely bit of art on top, even when the line is backed up out the door. The pastries taste fresh, because they are made with real ingredients and served fresh, not made in a factory and shipped frozen across the country to be defrosted the night before they are served.   Joke about the hipsters and the "Great Aunt Susan's rent-controlled apartment in Bushwick" look all you want, Lux is popular for a reason and they don't ride on image alone. The quality is in the food and drinks and they remain far ahead of the competition. You will never be bored here, I can promise you that.

9fSVUAcuO2eCMwsCQhcjfA.text: I love the pastries, I just wish the consistency in the creation of my morning coffee was better.

XUQ6O5OgKZBs7Zjbgmdbbw.text: I am giving 4 stars as a compromise with my wife.  We ate breakfast here because of the high ratings.  The place is easy to find and had lots of seating inside.   Looked like they were remodeling a patio outside which will be nice seating in the summer.     First the coffee is good.  If you are looking for coffee this is a good place.  It is also a decent place to hang out with friends.  Plenty of seating with music in the back ground.  I would have to give 5 stars for this.    The food was ok to me.  My wife liked her quiche and that's where we compromised on the rating.  I thought the food had a decent taste but the portions were small for what the prices were.  I don't mind paying more for food as long as there is some knock your socks off flavor but that just didn't happen.    I had the biscuits and gravy with sausage.  It came with 1 biscuit and runny gravy with a little bit of sausage.  Just didn't cut it for me.  I even ordered a side of hash browns that were pretty skimpy too.    Good place to eat if you like to eat kid sized portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced latte
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiche Loraine
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuit and gravy with hash

C9HE_uoYrOQl91okvIXPzA.text: This place has been here for a long time now. It has a lot of reviews, it does not need another. But, I will just put my 2 cents in. It is a lovely place right on Central. My daughter lives within walking distance to it. So she is the one that had me go there first. Breakfast ,lunch, and dinner ,coffee and even the drink! I have to say my favorite is the Breakfast. Nice little place to go, I do not like it when it is packed and too many people here.   But, on off times it is better. Parking is limited. Very worth a try. I really love downtown Phoenix, even though it is much different than most major cities. They are growing and developing ever so slowly.

ALgaKscNOLe-HYWqSWLpIw.text: This place is pretty cool.  It's a bit overly crowded and trendy for my taste but it's got everything going for it!   The place is crowded and can be really noises.  I do wish they had more outdoor seating.   The breakfasts and lunches are so very tasty!  Great coffee drinks too.   You have to try it.

-xFmWILfD0Ux8qoXeHb19Q.text: Oh my God... Where the heck did this hipster haven come from -- and in Phoenix of all places! Seriously, Polaroids on the wall, mason jar glasses and lots of bespectacled patrons.  I saw just how many Yelp reviews Lux had and had to lay my preconceived notions about people from Phoenix and their snobbish ways aside (I'm from Tucson, can you blame me? We're all a bunch of dirty hippies in Baja Arizona). I stopped in on a recent trip up to Phoenix and enjoyed a croissant and a latte.   I was immediately impressed with the vibe (wait, did I just use the word vibe... I think I did), even though I was a little surprised by it's location -- there's not much around it at all. Great music, great art and a laid back atmosphere that's conducive to just hanging out or perhaps writing the next great American novel.  The croissant was to die for, and the coffee was perfect -- apparently roasted on site.  I sat at the juice bar and watched an impressively mustached man create some very interesting drinks. I didn't stick around long, but I liked what I saw. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.  The only reason I didn't go ahead and give the full five stars was the initial frustration I had when ordering -- I'm no idiot, but the process wasn't intuitive and none of the staff seemed interested in helping me out. They were too busy updating their Instagram and talking about the next greatest band you've never heard of. That sort of bummed me out, but the yummy coffee soon made up for it.

fQNVpKc5cXa0jZHynZAbRA.text: Definitely trendy. The coffee, food and service are good, but not remarkable. As a coffee shop, it does a lot of things right -- there's great music and tables have a mix of people working and people talking. After going to Lux for about six months, I think what keeps the regulars coming back is the environment -- their atmosphere is top-notch and the workers are helpful. It's constantly packed, but you still manage to find a place to sit. The menu has enough variety to keep you interested. I love mornings when there's a DJ around. It's understandably busy on weekend mornings, but there has clearly been some effort to make the process more efficient. I say plan to wait a little bit if you go for brunch; the coffee and bakery are better order options if you don't have much time.

d4wRMBiakz0dXcZOCEF6bg.text: Awesome atmosphere and food. Always a big crowd which is testament to its greatness. I had a mocha and 2 eggs/bacon/hash. Nice place to study, work or just hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced mocha, 2 eggs, bacon and hash

s6TetGHs6HHeeFkYJQLs5g.text: I like this place because it has free wifi and there seems to be always a space to sit down. If I'm in central Phoenix, this is my go to spot.  Coffee is refreshing and the food's pretty good to. I got the Steelcut Oatmeal and they didn't skip out on the Pecans like most people do.   The ambiance of this place is very comfy and there always seems to be a cast of interesting characters wandering around. People in general like to share space or make room for you.   Hit or miss on the servers coming and picking up stuff. Also hit or miss on the servers telling you when your order is ready.

nw-kF4ocLnIA9eltR8odOQ.text: I recently relocated here from Denver and I needed to find a late night Internet cafe and was really impressed. Staff is friendly, good vibes and energies.

p9H-5757JPT91sZ_C308Yw.text: This place is great! Wine AND coffee, lotts of different seating options, food, pasteries etc... I meet people here all the time. Or if you just want to study its good too.

K6OKZHL6OHhUB5QvgCJOcg.text: I looove the tea there! And the place! Recomanded tea is London fog with Earl Grey

PyUnX7Q96M7Fx84OLnl8wg.text: I have been dying to try this place out since high school since I've heard nothing but great things about it! I finally went over on a coffee date with a friend and it was absolutely AMAZING! The vanilla latte was definitely my favorite! I would also suggest you getting the Dutch pancake. It is a pancake with fruit and some sort of coffee whipped cream on top. Heaven on earth! The wait sucks but it's not too bad. I will keep going back

D1ojL5MxnBctfkwVDn5NNw.text: I met up with a new friend from Bumble Bizz here to work on a project and it's the perfect spot to work or hangout! Such a fun vibe

1c7uHb2Xo9hgWjCZwi73og.text: Popular spot! This little gem is definitely a trendy spot as you can find all types of people from different backgrounds. One of the times I went on the weekend they had a DJ set up playing music. It's a nice touch, however a little loud to have a conversation with another person.  They have a couple different sitting areas so take a look around.  I suggest going earlier, because when 9am hits, it's almost difficult to find somewhere to sit. There is a nice enclosed patio as well. Prices for food are on the high side in my opinion, but I'm sure it's due to the trendiness of the place. Food and drinks are very good! I really enjoy the latte as it's not mostly milk like most places!

nHN2oPOLN6Nt7bk4IsGgow.text: Check out my photos. It tastes as good as it looks!  Their coffee is rich and strong. Starbucks is watered down compared to Lux's coffee and lattes. Their breakfast sandwich is awesome!  The applewood bacon is the right cut and cooked just right. Love that they use organic ingredients.  Their baked goods are all homemade and enormous!  One of the best coffee house in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Marshmallow top pumpkin pie is da bomb dot com!

lIvThZywHlpnfZFW6ctvRw.text: Here's the deal. If you are in the age range of 18 to 28, you're going to dig this place. If you are a 48 year old middle aged father, you will probably not like this place. Even if you are in your mid 40s and are experiencing some sort of a midlife crisis, I would ask your hip son or daughter to bring you here. The coffee is above average but the food and the drinks selection are the bomb.com! If you are in college or grad school it is a great place to study and do work and if you are a professional, it could be a cool place to take clients for coffee or a drink! BB's Rating: HIPTASTIC

AjHbbHmCFOZOXD8kt0JKhA.text: We needed a place to chill for a couple hours before a flight, I wanted a good coffee and my travel pal wanted some baked deliciousness. We parked doubting that we'd actually found the place since the front door is dark and unmarked. We rambled around to the back and found another unmarked door, open this time, and suddenly we were in the midst of it. Happy food conversations, enormous figurative painting of the Grand Canyon, and two big pink armchairs just for us. I enjoyed my coffee and stolen bites of super soft and tasty scone thing. After we left and I sat in the airport for hours eating terrible food I'd wished I'd just stayed here instead, getting lost on the way to the bathroom and eating whatever that crispy pizza thing was my neighbour ordered, and people watching in the unexpectedly beautiful oasis in a (to me) strange desert town.

A0EhtAizL4Wbkgmbg5q7Dg.text: Stopped by while visiting Phoenix.  Super fun coffee shop with great breakfast options and coffee.  I got the Aunt Gladys's breakfast featuring 3 slices of thick cut bacon with salsa served over eggs and hash browns.  The lemon poppyseed muffin wasn't too sweet and had a good texture to it.  The space was super fun with hidden rooms and a mix of seating options from couches, bar seats, tables, to the picnic tables outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aunt Gladys&#39;s breakfast, quiche, lemon poppyseed muffin, and coffee
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aunt Gladys&#39;s breakfast: 3 slices of bacon, salsa, eggs, and hash browns underneath.  Delicious!

GdqjiNUI6pOH6l6STyv1rA.text: I love coming to Lux! It's such a random conglomeration of so many things, it's hard to explain. They have a wide variety of baked goods that look incredible. Their espresso is delicious and you must try the whipped cream! I've had several items on the menu that a bomb. I didn't particularly love the pesto Mac and cheese, but I'm already not a pesto fan. There are so many places to sit and there's a lot of communal seating, so it's a great way to meet people. I don't go there if I depend on the WiFi because it never works and I don't know why they don't replace light bulbs, but if you don't need to see anything you're working on then I highly suggest going at night. I love Lux and it's my go-to coffee(etc) shop.

IQ_cdczNgOdSUxCaymVtog.text: My boyfriend brought me here and let me tell you, I've wanted to finback ever since.   We went late on a Saturday night and it was JAMMED, but it's so big that there was still plenty of room to find a table to kick back and have some great conversation.   Their menu is surprisingly homey. I ordered garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli, but they had run out of broccoli. I saw a bowl of avocados and asked if I could just sub them instead. It ended up being one of the most mouthwatering dinners ever. They did something magical to the avocado like grilled it and put some spices on it or something and their mashed potatoes were something out of heaven. Next time definitely trying whatever concoctions they have at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Art in a cup! Mmmmmmm....
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado and mashed potatoes

g38vCQfohfUyzjOexrevGw.text: Great coffee and amazing pastries! Love the vibe. Always so busy and pack every time I go. I like the big tables they have there to do my studying.

lhT25-7mHrgRWuAwX_yZhA.text: I definitely need to revisit this place. It was extremely busy and seemed to be the hangout spot. Across the room there was a full bar that looked like they also made fresh juices or smoothies. The pastries looked great and the chocolate chip cookies were great. I was a bit disappointed because they were out of cold brew!!! I settled for an iced chai that was really lacking chai flavor. It tasted like a glass of milk that someone accidentally dropped a bit of chai into. The baristas/servers were friendly enough but did not show much patience or personality while I considered my cold brew replacement. If I'm ever in the area again, I'd love to give Lux a second try.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VTQJu7-ydJYE1kuZNLYI9g.text: The pastry section was good.  The scone however was mediocre.  The coffee bread and lavender bread was very good. OJ was fresh squeezed so it's ok. Price was decent too, 3-4 bucks a pastry.

4YFK_jJ4C3sr5TfA1wtPBg.text: Came here for a quick coffee/ tea meet up with a friend... place was super busy, but we promptly received or drinks. Enjoyed the outside area:)

P2XU06sViMcTVifpHI644A.text: A great coffee shop should have:   A) lots of space of different kinds so people who go there to chat, meet, study, read, work all can find a space that works for them (with a reasonable number of accessible electrical outlets).  B) solid and fairly broad food menu to sustain those who need to chat, meet, study, read, work so they don't have to leave to find food.    C) excellent coffee and tea drinks, of course.    D) friendly, efficient, aware staff who clearly enjoy being there  Good music and art is a bonus.  An eclectic crowd of people also a bonus.    In my few days in Phoenix I found Lux to have pretty much all of these.  The space is fantastic with six or more distinct areas inside and outside.  Great coffee and food.  What seemed like a broad swath of the community - artists, business folk, educators, coders, et al.   It may be the all around best coffee shop I've ever been to (and I've been to very many all over the world).  Great job Lux!  I look forward to returning.

KWENQbiE018kPTErXDAS9A.text: Great "hidden" place!   My wife and I go to Lux every other weekend to get breakfast and coffee! They serve the best breakfast and lattes in downtown Phoenix in our opinion!   And even though we mostly go there for breakfast this week we stop by to eat dinner and what I had was amazing! A burger on an English muffin that was perfect. For dinner they always change the menu, but I wish they made that burger a constant in their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

M_q9yvmDQQL0y09_OKXW-g.text: Would u like a cup of small frothiness for $4? I was a bit disappointed with what I got. I ordered a small chai tea latte and i believe they forgot the liquid part of the drink.  I have had their mac n cheese with jalapenos and that one was not too bad.    This place is good for studying, eating and chatting with different rooms to cater to those needs. Opens late too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chai tea latte full of 100% froth. All gone.

oSq9pQQUkpLHOKiS1mWf8A.text: the girl working up front with dark brown hair is a bitch lmao, definitely suggest going somewhere else unless u want to deal with a shitty college girl.

IQ_2bHEojE_5-BX0JOeHjQ.text: I have been a regular "Lux" drinker for years, and I stop by there at least 1-2 times a week if I can. I live up in Cave Creek, so believe me...the drive is worth it!  The Cave Creek Coffeee Company near my house has been going downhill fast for years (the coffee now sucks that Dave the owner is gone, and the attitude has gotten much worse. If I see another over- aged Harley biker wanna be... I'm gonna puke lol), and lets face it - when you get past all the artsy visuals, ambiance, wi-fi and the rest...in the end it is about the quality in the cup.   In that department LUX truly kicks ass as the best coffeee in this town on many levels.  LUX is serious coffee - from the freshly roasted beans on premisis to the perfectly foamed lattes with artisan leaves created within the foam (try to get that anywhere else in town, including at the overrated Presse)...the barristas here know their Joe and take no prisoners.   The mocha's have just the right balance of bitter chocolate and sweeteness, without being cloying or over bearing and the result is a nice balance of flavors that flow past your tongue.   I generally drink my espresso straight, and at LUX it is obvious that the perfectly toasted nutmeg colored crema that the barristas pull is long lasting and as good as anything you'll find in Italy or Seattle, As soon as you walk in the door you can inhale the fresh roased beans and the wonderful smells wafting throughout.   The goodies and cakes here have generally been pretty yummy, but I come here for my Espresso fix and so do other serious espresso afficionados.  I noticed a few Yelpers deriding the "crowd" here as pretentious, but I have to totally disagree.Honestly I find the vibe refreshing compared to Cave Creek or Scottsdale pseudo/Harley Davidson chic with coffee that tastes mediocre. Yes, many of the college crowd here have full arm tats or are pierced, and you might even mistake this for an Apple Computer laptop camp. But I have always found the LUX bar staff to be EXTREMELY friendly and helpful, especially a gal named Shadie (probably mis-spelled - from Sounth Africa). The people here are just hanging out, lying on the comfortable furniture, or even falling asleep after a good cup o Joe (figure that out!).  The music and regularly changed artwork is nearly always cool and hip.  There is a reason that the New York Times ranked LUX the #1 coffee spot in all of Phoenix last year - the Espresso here is the real sh@t.

atHjNoNG4z2QrcZq_2iI1g.text: Great place to start your day off, watch sports, play pool, have a beer at lunch, and yes...finish your day off.
