Happy hour repeats itself at this place, you heard me right they've got power hour, happy hour, and one other hour I can't even remember the name of right now! Atmosphere is lite and friendly and so are the staff and you cant beat the prices. Everyone should check out the Well Bar

icmEQtXlqgXXowDglDYsug.text: My husband gave me an early birthday present by buying me a spa treatment at the El Morrocco Inn and Spa. What a wonderful experience! One of the best massages I have ever had! We were invited to stay the entire day and soak in the mineral pools, etc. but we were on a time schedule. The rooms are beautiful and the continental breakfast looked amazing. We will plan on spending a day and night (if we don't bring our four legged friend) next year!! I would definitely recommend the El Morocco Inn and Spa!

fo_Rf6qjzEgv5_rNlpDl4g.text: Simply put... My home away from home. Lux is so much more than a coffee bar...  it's a community.  The staff is great, the owner has an amazing memory for names and faces...  I'm constantly impressed, and the people who frequent this great spot are eclectic, intelligent and friendly.  It's like Cheers... but better.... and without the booze..... *anyway* you get my point... from my first visit here, it has felt like home and over the years I've made more great friends here than I can count. 'nuf said.

3wtqrBLR5NUScbMLDd5oPA.text: Love the Emerald Isle where you can choose the car you want and not get only one choice as in other rental companies.  We had a brand new Impala that had 125 miles on it and was clean and filled up so easy to leave terminal and upon return we were rushing and the receipt was handed to us in one minute.  Great service.

KEzRcPvzvc2EiY4-inHA6g.text: I heart LUX! best coffee house in downtown PHX. Don't you dare ask for a venti or grande here!!! Recommendation: you like sweet stuff, try the velvet w/ homemade whipped cream

kTnzEzf4Ad14s29zzUnu_w.text: Great locals spot, great food, great variety, great coffee, great vibe! Too loud & crowded to relax & read a book but a very cool & consistent place to grab food with friends.

V9jIwNunevqZgrxDiKcG3A.text: I love Lux. I love it. My friendship with Lux has seen me through three past relationships and a current relationship, which is astounding. I would marry Lux, but my life, my lover, my lady, is the the sea (ha ha, I got jokes). I've been going to Lux forever. Sometimes sporadically, but for the past year every Saturday except when I'm out of town, and when I'm out of town and it's Saturday, I miss this g*d*mn place. I went to a sushi place a month or so back and the server there recognized me from when she worked at Lux years ago.   People mention the too-hip crowd, but I have to let you know that they're the kind of too-hip kids that used to be fat in high school. I've never had a bad experience with anyone here except the little kids who make faces at me or offer me their stuffed animals while I'm in line, those d*mn kids (jokes, again). There was, of course, one time this guy tried to take my place and mark it with his apple computer before I even got up from my seat, but I scolded him like a puppy (a strong "NO!") and told him he could have the seat when I decide to leave. You might think, "well, if you don't recognize the too-hip kids, then you, too, must be a too-hip bastard," but let me tell you, I'm 31-going-on-65. My goal in life is to become a golden girl, I am currently really excited that there might be a concert band I can join, and my blood pressure goes over the top when I throw rocks into the ocean. Hip, I am not.  Mad props to the owner and his boisterous voice, Shadi (I don't know how to spell her name but she's there most Saturday mornings), the newish counter lady with the short red hair on Saturdays, the many rotating coffeemaking dudes, and the dude who sits in the corner on Sunday by the roaster room and plays music from a laptop over the speakers. There's also a coffeemaking dude at night whose name I don't know, but he's hilarious. You know it's been a rough day when I'm rolling in at 9:45 pm to get some caffeine, and this dude always makes me laugh. He's one of the too-hip people there with thick rimmed plastic frames.  I just realized I posted a review without reviewing the product. OY! The espresso is great. I've never experienced the drip coffee, but I've gotten various espresso drinks from cappuccinos to dolled-up espresso mochas. They're consistently fantastic. I can think of two occasions I didn't like the espresso, and they were both drinks in which I decided to go with soy milk. Every so often, I pull a hippy move and decide to try soy in coffee. It's horrible no matter where you go, so I don't hold it against Lux.

7iHdiZgmkRqoberEermiLw.text: It was loud and crowded but I enjoyed the mac n cheese I got as well as the latte. so over all it was okay.

ndm8jLvP08ntt6aqtAk6jQ.text: Went to Lux for the first time yesterday to grab a hot tea and get some work done. Overall, it was a great experience and I am looking forward to returning. The people who work there are pretty cool, they made me a couple great big mugs of hot tea and I had a crazy amazing brioche with huge chunks of sweet apples. awwww yeahhhh!  I would give it 5 stars but it is a bit on the pricey side, the atmosphere could be better and there are NO seats at lunchtime. I was standing around for a good 15 minutes like a jerk with my laptop waiting for someone to leave. It seems like they might be able to make more room but its hard to say what the rest of the building is used for.   At any rate, the best thing about this place isn't the place, or even the coffee and food- its the people. The employees are friendly and funny and the patrons are really, really cool. I met 2 people there I knew from Twitter who introduced me to another friend, who in turn introduced me to yet another person. There is a great buzz in this place, lots of people thinking, working and talking all fueled by caffeine. I had a ton of great conversation and thoroughly enjoyed myself. Looking forward to returning.

gFesamLmM-Ubzw9atBJI9Q.text: This place is really cool, but it has a couple problems: 1) its right on central and we all know central is one hell of a bitch to drive, that and its hard to find  and 2) it doesn't have as spansive of a menu as I would like to see.  sorta 3) too dark during the day. The type of lighting's cool in the evening and night, but during the day it makes me feel like I'm doing a drug run type thing (not to to say I've done so, but its how I would imagine it)  I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the music though. The staff was also very friendly.

nNk-M89yfUTWpKnq7AFfKA.text: As the Kaiser Chiefs once emoted:  "Everyday I love you less and less [...] I've gotta get this message to the press"  Hey, all good things come to an end, si?  I mean, The Smiths, the Cubs improbable 2003 playoff run, a pound of extra-lean Rudy's barbecue ...  ... and now, my run at Lux.  Its like reading a bad book past the first ten pages.  There are just too many OTHER good ones out there to waste your time drudging through this one.  This rule applies to Lux.  My Saturday and Sunday hangovers have now come under the authority of Copper Star.  Don't get me wrong ... had I written this 5 months ago, i would have decreed that my first born would be fashioned with the couture name Lux, I'm sure.  But when I took a step back, I realized I was always really uncomfortable there.  The set up is all wrong.  Its brutally uncomfortable, especially perching my fat ass on a 2 foot wide, pine bench like I'm Sean Marks (trust me, he's a Phoenix Sun that never plays) just to smoke a square.  I'm even tired of the uniform: Seven Jeans/Ironic t-shirt -- possibly with a reference to something delightfully obscure like Herve Villechaize.  The drip coffee ... two thumbs 'meh'  The vibe ... cheeky and flippant.  Just to radical for my hang-over necessities.  Okay, I loved their toast and fresh preserves, but that was a product of their friendly neighbors.  Peace-out Lux.  We had a nice run.  Its not you, its me.  Maybe we can still be friends and hang out again sometime.

p-ED4zY7lymq-xPC10PBaw.text: Opening night!  The food was fantastic.  Same great pastries and coffee/teas as Lux. But now with wine and food.  Had a great time.  Ambiance is fantastic.  There are two work/study areas and a large dining area.  Service was great.  Good selection of beers and wines.  Great addition to the coffee shop.  Extended hours - so for all you night owls it's fantastic.  Hope to spend more time here!

5_2q2w2sbb01Mem4V3TuLA.text: I found LUX when I ran out of my own roasted espresso beans  while on vacation here in Phoenix.  The fact that I have my own small roaster at home in Southern Illinois tells you I am a coffee snob.   Jeff was busy but took the time to meet me & make me feel welcome.  He asked me to let him know what I thought of his coffee.  It is a great espresso blend for my daily latte or cappucino.   Stopped in last night for the second pound.  This will be the only place I get my roasted beans when here visiting the kids!

xZrDLQdp25Nb7a4HSyWLhw.text: Truly fantastic coffee, great food, and terrific vibe.

M3yiWILMcOEgie9sD2mtOw.text: What can I say?  LUX has great coffee and friendly baristas, but as one who is looking for a chill coffee bar to chat, read or study; alas, LUX is not for me.    The sweets selection is divine and espresso tasty as all hell. The problem lies in actually getting service since the place is always jam packed. I have on three occasions tried to meet friends to study here (but they all love a loud atmosphere and don't really study, just prop books in front of them in hope the information will fly on a free floating wave length into their brains). Each time I had to excuse myself and go to another spot to study. Maybe if the place were only half as busy?Hmmm, who knows?

EEGHYBbQDDTcFa50AxQRpw.text: I have been to Lux many times for meetings, to kill time, to read a book, to get some coffee before I head to my downtown destination...  I hadn't been in a while and we had some extra time before the play started, so we headed to lux for an Iced Americano, a strawberry italian soda and 2 cupcakes... and then 2 more cupcakes.  The drinks were great and cupcakes... perfect!  I read my book and he did his crossword puzzle and we hung out for an hour and a half.  They were playing Hot Hot Heat and the paintings on the walls were very good.    I need to try to get over here more often.

pQLDgVFH32Pjb_G0PDGChQ.text: I was worried that the "new" Lux would not be as chill as the "old" Lux.  I was silly.  Although the lines to order can sometimes be long, the team does a pretty good job of managing it.  The pastries look amazing.  I LOVE the typewriters!  Lux offers plenty of food and drink options, and is right on the light rail.  It's conveniently located near the shop where I take my bike for service, so I while away the time @ Lux while waiting for my latest bikey upgrade to be completed.  I'm always whipping out my phone to use my Sound Hound app, because the music is really excellent.

AKd8sGaYY7qtbO7H3cOCKA.text: beware folks on a new business name  'insta clean '  same scammers as- ahs floor care- there the same business just  diffrent name to trick u all with all there bad reviews .  dont fall for  the $29.00 for 1,000 sq ft of tile cleaning ,yea right!!    then try to get u to buy acid for the grout that's a scamm!!   you have been warn.

wQGARiDvimp3zG0qC0yBpA.text: Lux rawks in so many ways. They always have a top notch barista working bar, freshly baked goods from their own bakers, nice selection of music, and that overall hipster vibe that keeps things interesting. For those of you west coast out-of-town-ers, they're similar to Intelligentsia, Ritual, and Stumptown.  When it comes to selecting and serving coffee, they strongly believe in getting the basics right (roasting, grinding, extracting, brewing, etc.) before consuming their time with other details (bean purveying, cupping, etc.).  With that said, their whole bean selection is limited, which may disappoint those (including myself) interested in unique blends and single origin beans.  Other notes: Laptop friendly; Busy, even during all the light rail construction; Pane Bianco next door serves amazing lunch sandwiches; They have a light table for you old school photographers

vdqZqexOi05Gsw2-2Imgyg.text: my favorite coffee spot of all time.  i just love this place!  soy lattes-delicious! muffins, scones, baked goods-addictive music-amazing atmosphere-cool  i can sit here all day, have cup after cup of coffee and feed on their homemade goodies.  i didnt expect to love a cafe so much, but this place seriously gives me a reason to stay in az!   they have expanded and serve etoh along with bfast items like dutch pancakes, eggs, etc.  love how they are next to pane bianco too. yumminess after yumminess.

hWcxfWe9yM-j4nz4Rbdx7g.text: Great coffee and food! Relaxed environment but it can be hard to find a seat. Hopefully your ok with sharing a table with others.

JKZluuBy9vBL5i7szwBu2w.text: One of my favorite places of all time for amazing coffee and the best baked goodies!  This is my happy place

KvLRFvEwHjilREiN0kMK5g.text: This is by far my favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. It's got it all: great drinks, good food and an equally cool vibe. I could see some saying that this place is too hipster-ific, but I think it's just fine. It would be hard to get work done in here though since it does get kind of loud.

HoptTiXxKp-ePNi3697NgA.text: Just had Doug with Affordable Pet doors install a Hale Security Pet door in my new home!  He was on time and did a fabulous job.  Very friendly, efficient, and did not leave a spec of dirt behind!  Highly recommend!!

f1cH3-JCBJVWJ3QvlUhvXA.text: The atmosphere(s) (as there are several rooms each with its own vibe), food and beverages are all excellent. So glad I live so close. I just moved here and to have a coffee shop like this, truly one of the best I have ever been to in the U.S., is a huge benefit. The two times I have been I had the quiche which was scrumptious, I did get it twice after all. Come by, you will not be disappointed and you will go away happy.

Yc0rehjoo0EwKRmoRzr6oQ.text: I love Lux. The new venue is great because there is a lot more room. The only problem is that it's still not enough. This place used to be a great place to just hang and spend the morning on a weekend or weekday. Now it's over crowded and doesn't have that neighborhood feel anymore. Some of the staff is super friendly while others have attitudes.   The coffee is impeccable and the food is delicious. That first sip of my soy hazelnut latte is always the most delicious and compares to no other coffee. This is what keeps me coming back.   If you want to sit for a while, make sure you arrive at the right time. And keep in mind the right time is never the same time. You pretty much have to get lucky to find a good spot. I've started getting my coffee to go. Also, they don't open until 7AM. This is when my shift starts, so I can no longer go before work. A great remedy for this was to buy Lux beans and to brew my coffee in a French press each morning. I'm definitely not complaining about the quality. It's still delicious.   I try to make a visit to Lux at least once a week and will continue to do so....

pIRpVaJvmmfLfV_EeoOyVQ.text: Massage Envy in Queen Creek gives the best massages in the East Valley.  Ask for Kender. SM

VhP58HE3-yhT68zg7yOt4Q.text: I had never heard of this place, and honesty, rarely venture West of 7th St.  However, we were having a centrally located, queer friendly group meeting, and Lux was suggested.  I was pleasantly surprised. There seems to be a dearth of cool, laid back, not-too-hipster indie coffee bars in Phoenix, but luckily, there is Lux.  With delicious baked goods (I had a date scone...I don't really even LIKE dates, but the scone was delicious!) including cupcakes and handmade drinks (and you can choose disposable to-go cups or earth-saving ceramic -- love it!), it's adorable. All of it, not just the adorable woman working the register.  We wound up sitting outside, but there was a good deal of room inside too, where people of all backgrounds were busy working away on their macs, with a scattered PC here and there.  Parking was plentiful, something I'm always on the lookout for, and while I did have to wait in line to order, it moved quickly.  I look forward to checking out the Lux a little bit more.  I bumped off a star because my chai was only so-so, but will be back to try cupcakes and a different hot drink

bqLXRxaws6YP9Vj6zHDUmQ.text: I love the fancy cocktails and the Mac & Cheese. Omg you guys, it's too tasty!

rp9UqiKloNxSr1sfaUMBBg.text: I went there with a regular. I got the light roast drip coffee, so nothing fancy. It was as good as drip coffee gets. The atmosphere was great and the place is definitely designed to be the hip place to be. Next time I NEED to order food.

m9NZO1ypkex20rj1Nmj_VQ.text: Been coming here for years and seen them grow. Best coffee in all of Phoenix and great bar. Couldn't give it a 5 because of spotty wifi and overcrowded that there's been multiple times I've had to leave because I couldn't find parking or no seating inside.

_7OynDVaZQGbDyQro5k9tA.text: Hate to say, this is the worst experience ever, I've been here more then a few times, always getting their biscuits & gravy, eggs over easy. The biscuits were over cooked and the cook must not know egg temps, the last two times the eggs were over cooked and the yolk broken. I'm not saying this is the end of the Lux for me, but I will surely look for a new favorite breakfast place, which saddens me, because I love the staff.

xINL4paN0CkCNdc2aYDxdg.text: LOVE this place. Cool atmosphere, amazing drinks/food.

vPeVo1aOLU2QJaVaale2Og.text: The home made food is delicious and the service is always warm and inviting. The drinks are made with love, you can tell. It's a popular place so it's sometimes hard to find seating.

7tzNJAZU8Onsit2gqeYK9w.text: I do not get to visit Lux as often as I would like to because I live in Tempe. However, I have gone out of my way to enjoy their coffee, as well as their cocktails. Very hip atmosphere without being rowdy. It's a trendy spot where you can either enjoy a quiet, comfortable seat while you work on your computer, or go with a few friends to enjoy cocktails from their mixologists. It's worth the drive if you aren't in the area.

1kV7-6IIk9HA-4VsQgcsrw.text: I don't drink coffee but LUX can made me stop by several times. It is because of their delicious desserts.  Starting from carrot cupcake, cookies, turtle brownie, pecan pie bar and much more. It is never ending. I can keep going back there and try new treat every week.

Blh-6W-Nr6TQz3BvWzJ_Uw.text: Been there a couple of times and have had a great experience both times. Both times have had a line and the employees have done a great job with speed and efficiency. The coffee is as good as it gets. The pastries and baked goods are even better. Lastly, the bacon is the best I have ever had! Lux is a treat for anyone.

opq-aPqfQlvMLldtgDRmsw.text: I have been going to Lux since 2006. It has always been and will always be one of my favorite spots in Phoenix. Watching it transform to what it is now makes me so happy. Finally they have my two favorites, Cocktails and Coffee. Fantastic place to hangout, study, read, enjoy music. Whether you are alone or with a group of friends this is a great spot. Don't forget to try the Mac n Cheese.

VaupBOhcqccA2fYFawSuEA.text: the coffee's not impressive and it's usually pretty packed to the point of not being able to find anywhere to sit.

Zc-1Twwb39Ng70ljr8J-IQ.text: I like the venue but the staff is not friendly nor helpful. I went with friend and said it was my first time there but wasn't offered any help or suggestions. There wasn't a line so I'm not sure why I recieved impatience. I've gone back with my sister and we had a similar experience. While the tea and coffee wete fine, I won't revisit.

7dMIYiD4a-ZOpOpX7KuMCw.text: This place is a spot to meet up and hang out. The food was excellent, now it's average. The pasteries are always pretty darn good though. They have a vegan option today which is new and unusual but really wonderful. Other then that expect long lines with a quick turn around. The outside patio is charming, but make sure that you can handle pretty decent sun exposure.

qHIpCgqYDDoxq0LmOusY0Q.text: Love this place. The coffee is excellent, the service is friendly, and the decor is fun! Always try to stop in here on during my travels.

vEqLndC8kYZo7X26lWz96w.text: When planning my visit to Lux, I wanted to place an order.  Instead, I found myself thinking about the song, "Confusion" by New Order.  Their "old" location was too cramped, so moving next door was part of their natural progression.  The new space has plenty more square footage, but the layout of the rooms is a bit of a maze.  It's unclear precisely where to stand to place/wait for your order and there were cardboard boxes and other items all over the floor.  The decor has it's own unique charm with it's mismatched plates and furniture but the furniture pieces are placed so close to one another you practically need to jump over them.  That was a bit much.  What's Lux it trying to be?  Contemporary?  Retro?  It's hard to say.  Even the "front door" we walked in turned out to be a "back" door.  Why would they throw so much capital into the space without some semblance of clarity?  The food we ordered was OK.  I had a slice of quiche (pictured) which I believe had sun dried tomatoes, among other ingredients.  The counter person was friendly and offered to heat it for me.  My friend ordered two scrambled eggs, hash browns and two slices of bacon (pictured.)  We sat a a table in another room not knowing if a server would ever find us.  A server later brought the food over and left rather quickly; too soon for my friend to show the server the bacon which was just delivered was burned.  My friend gave me a look as if to say, "How could the server NOT realize this is burned to a crisp?!?!"  So...my friend had to get up, return the bacon, wait for two more (precooked) slices to sit underneath the broiler a while and by the time she returned, both our breakfasts were cold.  I will say my friend was happy with her coffee and my iced latte was da bomb!  Lux may still be working out the kinks in their new locale.  Once they organize the boxes, furniture and service concerns, they'll be prepped for enlarging their clientele of repeat customers.  If I turn out to be one of them, the path to their small outdoor patio looks inviting and not at all confusing to find.  You may find me there sipping an iced latte and listening to New Order.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two scrambled eggs, hash browns, two strips of bacon and coffee.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiche and iced latte.

vqEyVBeaPdSkCb3S7Inc5A.text: Being from Baltimore, we don't have many coffee shops that serve alcohol as well.  I went with a friend who lived in the area for 6 years and raved about the place.  We didn't get to sit and enjoy the coffees, but we did get them to go.    Service was very fast.  Two iced Americano's were $6 total.  The vibe was very cool.  I loved the old typewriters on the tables.  Space was really big and a lot of people were studying/writing, etc.  The main room had a DJ and again, had a really cool vibe!  Will return if I come back to Arizona!

m3UPjjX8np0Vw4tfsuX_mw.text: Hip place.  Can be busy at times.  Perfect for study and a drink or two.  Lunch is quaint.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #studytime

hdcb2MCbt1dZXsrITPiHiA.text: Stopped by for a few hours to get some work done.  Definitely hipster heaven as everyone already pointed out. Great atmosphere but can be pretty loud if you can't tune out sounds.  Internet was fast. I came during lunch rush so it was pretty packed and awkward to squeeze into an empty chair.  As people left, it became more manageable. Great for people watching without looking like a creeper (I swear I'm not a stalker though).  Sizes of drinks ran a little small - $5.50 for large dirty chai.  The baked goods looked amazing but I was on a diet and a budget. Great to see cooks right behind the counter making fresh food orders and throwing pastries into the oven. My olfactory nerves were in overdrive.   Only one bathroom of each gender so there were waits at times.  Rooms in the back were a bit quieter than the front but still busy. I also like that they have a bar if you're looking for a drink with some extra kick.  Minus a star because workers seemed a bit robotic.  Maybe it's their job to be efficient but a little personable touches in taking orders can't be that hard to add. They weren't mean or rude or anything, just a little stoic for what I'd expect from an otherwise cool place such as this.

DezuCyYOHe__U0UpeRah_Q.text: Chill vibe, relaxed setting, lots of seating. It almost feels like a really big living room where there's food and coffee. Sure, the parking is a pain, but did you see the pastry selection? And literally anything you get will be good (seriously, close your eyes and point if you get overwhelmed, you'll still be fine). The coffee is spot on, both the brewed (go light roast) and the espresso (go macchiato to really bring out the brightness of their beans). It's my go-to for caffeine in Phoenix.

MItSle1SZorh5VVuuPmodg.text: I love their selection but the place is super popular if you tend to prefer quiet cafes. Hard to find seating otherwise this place is excellent.

jqrk0wtW3LyeKdqbqaJr-A.text: Very good almond milk mocha and strawberry lemonade. Love the chill environment and comfortable seating arrangement. Also the store play list has good jams!

UX5BVtibrmqi1y0efNi5Ag.text: I was in town on business and my Airbnb host highly recommended this place. I went my last night in town and could kick myself for not going sooner. I had a delicious dinner and would gladly go back (maybe tomorrow morning?!).

bA7V9E66OyhOXsmIxbf4Dg.text: Don't get me wrong I love lux's atmosphere. Love the lighting. Coffee drinks are mediocre at best. I think you go here if you wanna be "in the scene". Make sure bring your white converse jean jacket and or highwaisted shorts. Everyone as soon as you walk in immediately looks up from their MacBooks (that they got with their student loans) pretending to work and look busy. If you don't get lost in the maze of a cafe trying to find the freaking bathroom. The customer service in the evening is really rude.  They don't care what my name is or when I ask question about which tea is the best they give me this snarky look and make me feel like I'm bothering them. There's this one hipster fat black haired vegan who is the ultimate doucher and this skinny blonde who is extra rude. Other then the customer service it's not a bad place. The bathrooms are pretty dope too.

OWj9DOvxXSGt-VJLvdtbHQ.text: Every time my boyfriend and I go to Lux we get great coffee and have the best conversations.  Part of it is the atmosphere and the fact that we go early in the morning but we always end up staying for 2 hours just enjoying each other and dreaming big dreams.   So this place is gets a cheers from me !

6m9K4aV3g2FoA9Mriyzkjg.text: I have been to this location many times while visiting Phoenix and it is one of my favorite coffee shops in the area.  The coffee is delicious and the drinks are all made.  The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because every time I have been I have had a 5-10 minute wait for my drink even if there is no line.  The last time I went they took my order immediately and I paid immediately and then the wait was almost 10 minutes after before I received my drinks.  Other than that it is awesome and I will definitely return.

ALV6hWkgOkkElJDbs6g12g.text: Premium drinks. Whether I'm in need for caffeine boost or a relaxing personalized and seasonal cocktail. Have always been so pleased with their product!  Food and pastry selections never disappoint.  It's not surprising that this place is busting at the seams busy but I can't say that I've ever felt neglected or that their quality of service/product has suffered!

KhsFJSTJBa0M8lyRbo1swQ.text: I'm not going to lie - what made me go to Lux in the first place is because there is a character named Lux in the online game League of Legends that I'd been playing a lot, and it caught my attention.  Secondly, I wanted some morning coffee on a Monday morning while visiting Phoenix.  If I were limited to rail travels, I'd tout its easy accessibility it is to the rail, but I had a car, and it's in a convenient location that at worst, requires a U-turn to get to.  Parking was a little sparse, but I was able to get a spot, probably because I was hitting it up after the real main morning rush.  The interior of the place was unique, and sub-sectioned to about three or four different mini-lobbies of some sort.  It's cozy and inviting in most of them, but you better like your fellow man if the picnic benches are the last place to sit.  I went for just coffee, so I didn't experience the food, although lots of people attest to it being really good.  As far as coffee was concerned, out of the five, I guess local coffee joints I hit up in Phoenix, Lux probably had the best coffee of them all.  The staff were all friendly and pleasant peoples, and they mowed through the lines of people efficiently and with smiles on their face.  It's a truly good atmosphere there, and despite the pretty hipster crowd, the air of smug arrogance isn't as prevalent from those who lounge there.  Phoenix as a whole has a lot of great food joints and coffee shops.  Lux easily ranks up there with them, and I'd visit again if/when my travels bring me back out to Arizona.

3RxCL0gdjL0V1_clKxh6Sw.text: AWESOME place. love the environment, even though I live a bit away, I still have gone on the weekend and its always a great experience.

NIa8P17YI0SxvuK6eb3bXA.text: I spent a blissful 2 hours reading at Lux today - with a delicious yogurt parfait and an almond milk latte!  Comfy couch, good music, and great people watching :-)

vXdqwYRnQVzVur9PpMydtA.text: The place is hard to find. Entrance is around back. The coffee and cookies were great. The vibe is definitely hipster.

V0L0P38cPXKODIUY1XzLXA.text: There's just something different about this place that I absolutely love. The pictures posted on Yelp don't do it justice. There are multiple rooms with couches and tables, quaint corners where you can get some work done. The atmosphere is to the T, and their coffee/eats are delicious. The place can get a little loud and hectic, so bring your headphones or come at an off hour if you're looking to make some power moves with your work. There's something a little Starbucks about the way they run the front, but the staff is friendly and this place has so much to offer over your typical coffee shop experience.   Overall, if you want great coffee and a lively atmosphere, head to Lux.

XaGVL2Y7P8sfSBBor51uow.text: The furnishings are dirty and torn. My three friends and I met for drinks on Thursday afternoon every week.  Since I was charged between eight and fourteen dollars for the same drink different week I gave up and we went elsewhere.

NFfhwLROk0W3uIHLCZcgRw.text: Crowded but excellent fare and high performing staff. Fantastic atmosphere.  Definitely need to open additional locations.

qkXOPR0Gf82Xp8WrjG33mg.text: Great coffee, great ambiance, and I would be remiss if I didn't mention the great (and delicious) assortment of gluten-free pastries and cookies!   Gluten free is not a fad... some of us are clinically diagnosed celiacs and it sure is cool to go somewhere like this and have great options!  I feel I may have used the superlative "great" a bit too often, but hey, it's what I feel... and my Mom always told me my feelings can't be wrong!

dxKAI9dGDBa-k4DoFJdDBQ.text: This is probably the coolest coffee shop in town. The employees are so sweet and the coffee is delicious. I've been coming here almost everyday for the last year and I have always gotten the best service.

o1Gnf_EvmEVykeM7-XsMOQ.text: I so badly wanted to like this place because of all the wonderful reviews and pictures. My experience:  It was very easy to find and I got lucky and got a nice parking spot in the front as someone was leaving. When I entered, it was a bit intimidating. There were people on their laptops and others just conversing and relaxing. When I finally figured out where the line was, I ordered a quiche lorraine, which was way too costy. For one small slide, it is $5! I can get an entire quiche for that price elsewhere. I wasn't sure which coffee to go with, but the cashier at the front was helpful. I got the cafe mocha. I specifically asked for it to be extra hot because that's the way I like my coffee and asked  to warm up my quiche as well.  In less than a minute,  my mocha was ready, so I doubted that it was extra hot as I requested. Not to my surprise,  by the time they brought out my supposedly warm quiche, my mocha was pretty much cold! The quiche was also served cold, so I'm not sure why it took them so long to serve it to me (they were supposed to warm it up). Quiche Lorraines are usually served hot--not at lux apparently.  This saddened me because I was really craving one. I ate it, slowly.  It was not delicious but it was good. The mocha would have been better had it been hot. Other than that, the vibe and atmosphere was not bad. Just a lot of college kids. I don't mind but.... Anyway, I like the typewriters as centerpieces,--pretty cool. I was hoping to make this place my "to-go cafe joint" but I'm not sure it's my type. A bit too crowded for me particularly.  I like more laid back type of cafes.... That's just me though.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FCu3xBpK1Q1qlUdBpKO-1w.text: To be honest, I was quite surprised to find an establishment like this in Phoenix! Mainly because I didn't know hipsters existed in Arizona! I walked in and thought "Wait...am I in Phoenix or Silverlake (LA)!!!"   My friend who is visiting for a rotation told me he goes here to study for his boards. Love the decor, vibe, but most importantly, the food!  My friend had the yogurt and granola, I had a strawberry thumbprint cookie, and we each got vanilla lattes. Coffee here is smooth, not bitter, and they top it off with a design in the foam! Lovin' it!   This place is HUGE even though it doesn't look that way from the outside. Plenty of places to sit with your Macbook or a novel and Free Wifi.  I went on a weekend so it was packed, like line-out-the-door packed, but I still didn't have to wait too long to find a place to sit and study.   It's about a 25 minute drive from Glendale so I will definitely be back. Very reasonably priced (if you can afford Starbucks then you can afford this...plus you get WAYYYY better quality). Parking is easy as they have a lot and plenty of street parking. Oooh and I forgot to mention Pane Bianco is right next door with delicious sandwiches, soups, and desserts so you should check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peanut butter and jelly thumbprint cookie, Genius!

dnj71StKz3oHy3lTMT5uJQ.text: Been coming here for 10 years,  figured I should write a review about how much I love it here.  It has gotten bigger and louder and always crowded but they have never lost sight of quality ingredients from coffee to food to cocktails.    I buy whole beans from here to grind and French press at home.  The pastries,  I live for their pastries. The breakfast lunch and dinners are always killer delicious.  *pro-tip: don't drive the wrong way into their parking lot,  if you do that and try to act like I'm stealing your spot,  I will laugh at you as I park.

so10uTnq4D0H7VApD_7jVw.text: Simple....Rude pretentious hipsters.   I don't understand it. I was so hesitant on coming here because I was afraid of this.   I walked in, no one was in line. So I walked up to the cash register. Stood for a minute while the girl rang someone up. Finally a young man helped me, but first he just felt the need to educate me at how it works at LUX. Instead of, "Hi, what can I get for you!?" I got a, "Just so you know the line starts back at the glass, what can I get for you?" Really!? Is this real life!? How about the line starts wherever the heck your customer wants it to start, because I am paying your paycheck. Nonetheless, I was now at the cash register and realized he didn't ask how I wanted my tea. I then asked  the girl at the register if I can get creme in my tea, and the girl annoyingly told me I could do it myself. Stood and waited for my tea, and realized they must not call out your order at LUX. I walked up to the register (because why would you have a place to pick up your drinks?) and asked if these were mine, which took 3 tries before she yelled at me, "yeah!"   Now was my drink amazing? Absolutely not.   So with that said, they will never get my business again.

-v9LOBdfK1YR3PUR8wRtaQ.text: I was looking forward to some coffee art, but it was too warm out, so I opted for an iced caramel latte instead. It's hard to describe how deliciously different the flavor was from any other caramel coffee I've had. I enjoyed it so much that I was debating on whether I should grab another before heading back to San Diego. The chorizo quiche was super yummy too!

DKsFLB_3s9ZFYOQRgfUc9g.text: Here's the thing ... their coffee is so good, pretty much nothing can scare me away. I've literally spent all day here working on my computer. The environment is perfect for my creativity, but I do not have ADD. Probably not the best environment for the easily distracted.   The perfect lunch combo is a tomato, mozzarella, and basil sandwich from Pane Bianco, and a black and white mocha from Lux for dessert. Do it now and sit outside at the picnic tables between the two.

XQCDpG9vT6ePiJXZX1lJ2A.text: This is a fun place.  They have a full bar, great coffee and pastries as well as sandwiches.  Great for hanging out after dinner or a stop here after a visit to the Herd Museum, it's just done the street.  There is no signage on the street so pay close attention or you will miss it and you don't want that to happen.

j8ShVCNl2HQQrek9bU8rlg.text: I was really excited to see so many Vegan choices within a 2 mile radius of our hotel, but this L.A. girl was unimpressed by the service at Lux. Was my soy latte delicious, yes.  Was it worth $5...no. It was 11:20 AM when I came in. The breakfast menu was still up, so when I walked up to order and was told they were between breakfast and lunch... I asked "can I still order off of the breakfast menu?" "yeah, sorry... but you can order one of our pastries". No thanks, we needed something that was going to hold us over for a few hours since we were hitting the road for the day.  I then asked if I could see the lunch menu to which I was told I would have to wait 5 minutes. UM... no.  Sad to say, a trip to Starbucks would have resulted in a more fulfilling experience.

vqw5fdQViqYB1JJt7AuK8A.text: I absolutely love Lux... great atmosphere, great energy, superb food and cocktails!!

JMhN7ujqjNpG9cUNNhmruA.text: Lux is right outside of our apartment complex which is extremely dangerous because of how good everything is. The coffee is great. The pastries are all made freshly the day. The breakfast meals are super good. I've had the bacon egg cheese and tomato sandwich and biscuits and gravy. Both are very good. They use very high quality ingredients and you can taste it. They are open late on weekends as well and you can get dinner and drinks. The atmosphere is pretty cool and it's a hip place to be. The outside looks like a place I wouldn't want to enter but it is worth it! Highly recommend!

9uokIQrBtYy64R7LaHgWmA.text: I was wondering what the buzz was about with this restaurant. Went for breakfast and it was okay. The establishment was "vintagey". Definitely a long line, so be ready to wait a bit. Decided to eat my order to-go because it was packed. The to-go lattes are tiny, even the large was smaller than other places. The egg sandwich was yummy, but I can't see myself paying almost 20$ for coffee and a sandwich. Maybe I'll try something else next time.

uglrErjLb-041LqZ2BIRew.text: Super cute cafe!! The latte macchiato was delicious and loved the presentation. I tried the farm vegetable eggs with potatoes and could not have made a better choice. Very yummy!   The ambiance of the cafe is great. Looks modern and feels comfy. Only complaint which really isn't a complaint is that our food took a long time to come out. I've heard of others complaining of this before, but it's not necessarily a bad thing when you are having a catch up date with a friend. Great place!!

LJwis4O1W0wsX1wOyW9xOA.text: I love this place!! I love the atmosphere, the coffee, the food and even the cocktails are fantastic!!! Highly recommend

TlllUKanEeDDT29vRQulAg.text: I am not a Coffee guy, neither am I a cafe guy and oh, this aint the Grand Lux cafe! With that cleared up, lets talk about LuX.   It is my most favorite cafe in PHX. and it has nothing to do with the coffee, in fact I never even had a single coffee here, but its for the plain simple fact that they have "The best Bloddy Mary I ever had". That is simply enough to give a 5/5 for this place, but wait it doesnt end there. What about the ambiance of the place and the setting of a cool-retro-urban-sports-new age-vegan style, that should count for more, right? oh and the food, that's something you cant just push around either. Seem to have a lot of vegan food these days? I had eggs with some tomatoes and veg hash, thats right try the veg hash, its just some good ol' hash with the veggies. My buddy had the dutch pancake, interesting. (check the pics).   All said n done, I am going back for some Bloddy mary, in case i forgot, its the best bloddy mary ever. Peace

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dutch pancakes?
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Over easy eggs with tomatoes and veg hash
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best goddamn Bloody Mary

OLoyoMdkbkBWLKgqkHkqeg.text: One of the many trendy places that seems to have popped up in the Central corridor area. Visually, it's almost overwhelming when you walk in for the first time and to be honest, a little confusing. Even at 10 a.m. on a Monday this place was busy. There's no real signage directing you where to place your order so we had to ask someone where to go. I was surprised at how many employees were working. They were everywhere, including standing right next to our table hugging and talking as if we weren't there. That was a little distracting. Lots of people watching and eclectic stuff to look at while waiting for your food.   The coffee was excellent! The selection of breakfast pastry on display while waiting in line was impressive. The food was good. I got the biscuits and gravy with chorizo and eggs. I asked for the eggs over medium and they came out over easy but I ate it anyway since it took a while to get our order. The flavor of the chorizo gravy was wonderful!   Overall, I would go back again and give this place another chance, now that I know how it works.

_UgAjDPtz6t3l_Nur3323w.text: I love the new location. I know, I know, everyone has been talking about it for years. I live in the 'hood, and didn't much like the old location. Walking into a cafe, only to see a sea of laptops, isn't very welcoming. Not their fault, of course.  The new location offers up some tasty treats. I've had a few of the breakfast and lunch items.   It can be a bit confusing to find it at first. You have to go in the back door. (Hahahahaha you know what *I* am thinking, right?) Picking up your order is tricky, because it gets loud in there and you may not hear your name called.  I prefer the back (front) room. Less traffic, and there's a cool bar to sit at.

gTu0-uTg6HDqmulmOJt2BA.text: Best place for breakfast in the city. Awesome Bloody Mary. The staff is wonderful and very accommodating. The atmosphere is great. The decor is eclectic and entertaining. Tried the 2 eggs any way (great poached), also tried the mimosa with a shot of St. Germaine and fresh squeezed fruit juice. So good. I will definitely be back.

zbsisGkK36cf3pbt1AWllw.text: good, homemade food.  good music and great coffee. regularly crave the breakfast sam with marinated cherry tomatoes and an iced black and white.  quality !

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. coffee cake - yummy

IJV8Zlbu7YV1iNFaXEq07g.text: I am not a regular here and I would like to be but I feel this place never has enough room for me to study. I wish they had more of individual tables instead of group ones. However, their food and beverages is good. This is a very hipster place and their music is great but I wouldn't recommend this place to study maybe for social gathering or coffee time with friends but that's just my preference.

hgFmb78mN4E6CMHXhmVUyA.text: We sincerely need something like this in San Francisco. (Closest thing: The Grove.) this place is amazing. Big, industrial cozy vibe, open lots of hours, diverse crowd, great baked goods (incl paleo cookies), full kitchen, lots of seating configurations, great hipster music, tasty coffee. Total winner of a place.

SVs1Rq1gAmDH1slR6Qirww.text: Had brunch at this place and now I know why it was packed. Ultra cool spot with an urban vibe. I enjoyed the eggs your way with tomato and veggie hash. No food was left behind. It was delicious. Definitely recommend and will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggs your way with tomato and veggie hash! Yum!

nE8S7N3FQx4QI_NY1V9_ww.text: The vibe is very hipster and the coffee is quality. It was a bit crowed and expensive, but it's a great place to meet up with friends!

jhPyWIE3eNBsEa_FbA_D9Q.text: Great coffee, but service is terrible! Has been for years. It's like they are too trendy to give good customer service. They act inconvenienced by your orders.  Disappointed by the service every time.

a2JR_6GJCKJtFF3FhgZ4Sg.text: Great coffee shop best in Phoenix by far! It's right off Central has a good size parking lot and street parking nearby. Also the famed 'Pizza Bianco' is next door if ur looking for some pizza.  As u walk in you have seating everywhere the ordering area ahead of you where they have a large display of baked goods, not a the best sight to look at if you're looking to cut the carbs. Then to the right is more seating and a full alcohol bar. There's even more seating if u go down another hallway which leads to more rooms and to a large outdoor patio. Basically the place is huge for a coffee shop.  I sat at the bar area whipped out my laptop immediately notice very fast Wi-Fi and also a plug power cord below my feet to keep my laptop charged which is key. A bartender/barista came over pretty fast and I ordered a tropical iced teas which was very good.  They also have a full breakfast/lunch/dinner menu. Artwork was plentiful on the walls and the music and ambience screamed hipster cool. Service was fast and everybody seemed friendly. Place itsrlt was pretty packed and I think lots of HS kids come here after school to along out.  Bottom line it's a must see coffee shop in Phoenix I'll def be back with my laptop hopefully to try some other items on the menu..

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice Bar Selection
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lux Bar Area
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lux bar area

VSOjv1K7kazb1f1aYk2HWQ.text: So hipster that you can't find it cause the entrance is in the back of a nondescript building in a funky area - and you might feel shame you're not cool enough to be eating a burger here - but go anyway.  The coffee and the food and the ambiance, of you can get a table, is good.  It's a little Phoenix gem.

QB46ccRUqQbO4eP7VhQyhw.text: Really neat vibes here, but the coffee and the pastries were unfortunately not worth the weight + $$$. Staff was nice.

WnbXTDaExSo3pmb4agrN4A.text: Lux, what is with you reeling me in, then pushing me out, then reeling me back in as if I'm singing "Hot n Cold" by Katy Perry to you?  I love you, then I don't, then I love you again! I went here early in the morning (7am: that's early). I was hesitant, but I wanted to try Lux for breakfast. The place was pretty empty! Like being first in line to purchase the latest iphone, I was ecstatic!  I ordered the: AUNT GLADYS'S HOMEMADE SALSA OVER FOUR STRIPS TENDER BELLY BACON THREE SCRAMBLED EGGS WHITE CHEDDAR AND HASH - Every bite was delicious!  The iced vanilla latte with almond milk - my go-to drink was great!  We were able to snag a table without turning into vultures. The atmosphere was relaxing and lovely. The only con I have is that you have to wait by the counter to pick up your food, then get your silverware, then self serve water if needed. You leave your dishes on the table or drop it off to the counter. I'm no waitress. It can be hard juggling your plate, coffee drink, and silverware/napkins at the same while walking to your table!  Overall, I was happy happy happy. Thank you, Lux for making me a fan again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aunt Glady&#39;s masterpiece!

qX2speweipQBsuGU9QL5gw.text: I have been going to Lux for years and it has always been my go-to coffee shop to work at during summers. I have always had a great experience, but lately (the last 6 mos) quite a few of the people there are just rude and too cool to provide friendly service. Sometimes the music is so loud and the workers are singing and dancing around that it is impossible to even think.  If you asked me a year ago what my favorite Az coffee shop was, Lux would have won hands down. Tonight I literally walked out because the guy taking orders was just so uninterested in kindness and providing a pleasant experience I was almost offended.  TWO stars given (not one), because the coffee is still great.

FbYr-ucZuTR8-1p7XvKGHg.text: This is one of my favorite places in Phoenix.  It reminds me of the coffee houses that I would haunt during my college days.  Everyone looks like they think they're doing something super important.  Exactly the kind of human being I was in my early 20's.    Of course there's never a seat.  And if you were so lucky to snag one, you better hope your conversation is cool enough not to get judged.  Mine never are.    Also, come hungry!  Pane Bianco is next door, and Lux itself has an AMAZING menu.  Their mac and cheese is fire, and don't forget to order a Dutch baby.

6KRk4e6LocPqEk2I1gJS5w.text: This place is a local favorite for so many reasons. Amazing pastries, handcrafted cocktails, coffee, teas, and the best mac'n'cheese around. The ambiance is pretty awesome for chatting and bringing friends and hanging around. Not the best for getting studying or work done. It gets pretty busy and very very loud. The reason it's not a 5-star review from me is that the service, while speedy, comes with a huge side of unwarranted sassiness. It's a busy place and it's the service industry, so to some degree I guess that is warranted. But, really, it's not. You'll catch a huge amount of it from the baristas. And a note on the loudness of the music: they are not subtle in wanting people to leave. They'll crank the music up super loud and it's usually the most obnoxious dance music. Maybe just go during the day.

pgppTK6WflmPuIRvm2OG8g.text: Lots of seating and a cool, funky vibe. I enjoyed my iced coffee and lemon scone. Lots of people studying here or on their laptops. Plenty of parking during the week. A little busy on weekends. Easy to park along the street if the lot is full.

tJiY6K7Jj5b8WTc8Io0JGQ.text: After dinner with friends last night we decided to go for some coffee ans desert. Conveniently located on Central between IndianSchool and Camelback, right in front of the light rail. (don't miss it, its a hidden gem)  My friend suggested Lux and I was pleasantly surprised walking into what seemed to be some sort of old warehouse that had been turned into a fun laid back coffee shop/restaurant. There were so many people relaxing enjoying coffee with friends, people on their laptops studying and working and a bar full of laughter enjoying cocktails and food. I had a vanilla latte accompanied by a tasty lemon bar which is made fresh in the kitchen everyday and the menu is always changing. Lux roasts their coffee in house so the aroma when you walk in is absolutely amazing. This seems to be a great place to go if you are new in town and want to meet new people. The atmosphere is very young and friendly, lots of college students.  I will definitely be returning!   P.S. beware... I am told the macaroni and cheese is to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eQMoCD5kJM2-bl8lixWh0w.text: Cool and fresh spot to get your java and tea on. While I enjoyed my chai there was a soccer match being watched in another side room that many of the clientele were enthusiastic about. I would definitely come back on my next visit to Arizona.

u8LU_ROkciD1rD7AVLIP5Q.text: Mediocre latte, expired, dried out expensive cupcake, loud head banging music in the decor of creepy paintings. The help at the counter seems to have a limited vocabulary using phuck every other sentence. This place should be called "Armageddon Alley".

1r1UR4wpfKceCiiBuvZmcA.text: Never know what to expect when you go into this place. Sometimes you have 4 beers and they charge you $5, total? The bartenders have no clue what's going on. Tonight, after the bartender openly announced that's the 2 girls sitting next to me had "no tab" when they tried to pay their bill, I gave the bartender a $50 to cover my 2 drinks. He gives me $20 and some cents back with no itemized receipt. Pretty sure I either paid his crushes tab next to me or he pocketed the money. Either way, the owner of this establishment should probably be more aware and concerned of the integrity of the employees working here. The owner is clearly getting robbed blind. Definitely won't be back.

LQNSe3eLcO6B4GHE-m_ieg.text: Love Lux, just a bit too packed and not an easy place to get in and out of... You guys serve great coffee! Thank you!

zuRSAHdff-rJgSwkt7-XsA.text: Super chill and comfortable. Ordered an iced coffee with coconut milk and a strawberry cream cheese muffin. Both recommend! My boyfriend got the cold brew in the glass bottle which is $6, and got a refill for $3.  Felt like I was in college again!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pfUcepgybbdaHM6UGe5DUA.text: Good find! This is going to be a new go-to cafe for me. I got the lavender-lemon donut which was moist, fluffy, and lemony. $3 for the donut and $2.50 for a house coffee with unlimited refills. The dark roast was exactly what I wanted alongside a sweet pastry - very dark and very strong.   The ambiance is certainly eclectic, stylish, and unique. While it's stuffed with seating, I felt cozy and at-home rather than crowded.   There's an entire bar and food menu, so I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GIr15_ESJxBigPyloiUEfQ.text: I love the set up and their lattes. Perfect little spot to order pastries and have a nice conversation. I see a lot of people studying inside and outdoor patio. Also, has many IG photo opportunities if that's your thing.   Lux is also near many other shops so feel free to walk around while you enjoy your latte.

c4P4-dra01GT2LGmzPdYOQ.text: I love coffee shops and this one is a popular place to grab a latte and grub, but come ready to wait as well as expect a loud experience. It seems, everyone else in midtown is here too. Still, the pastries, coffee, and menu items are well worth the 15 to 20 minute line on a Saturday morning.

4V9s-Q55FS2W5YHhUBuYrw.text: I wanted to take the time to leave the joint a review. I realized I need to share more of the great experiences I have when Im done being busy experiencing them. First off the playlist is EPIC! I went fairly early, and sat near the bar, the staff was super friendly and the bartender just happened to be muddling fresh grapefruit juice and citrus... I had a mimosa that led to two and a fresh pastry after watching them being buttered and baked, To say the least this place has great seating, its much larger than I realized and it was my second time there. Im a person who stears clear of large crowds but I got a lot of work done in a great work space, was able take calls and even met someone new.! and I got this super cool post card with my tab! Ill def be back to this joint ASAP

IfivgfOMrgdDKQNA47hOhA.text: Meh, is all I can really say about Lux.  I've always heard great things about this place and finally gave it a try for the first time last month. I always heard about great service and even better coffee.  The coffee was better than Starbucks, but how much does that really mean?    I felt the service was subpar.  When I went in for my first visit, I told the cashier that it was my first time in.  I asked if there was anything out of the bakery they recommended, her response was "everything is pretty popular."  I wasn't really sure how to take it.  So I just ordered a muffin and a coffee.  While I was waiting for my coffee, one of the other employees was making fun of another employee, which just made the situation uncomfortable.    I decided to give Lux a second try since, everyone or any place could have an off day.  I would say it was a slightly better experience, but I still got the overall same impression of the place.  I'll keep to the many other fantastic coffee shops in Phoenix.

Xd1VnGXlBI9gDEA7Q_Nqdw.text: My go to, don't drink coffee but love home cooked foods, need to meet a friend for work and must have wifi, place to go.  I like the games they have, the couches are sleep worthy.  I love the food here! It's so yummy.  I like the clever way they arrange tables and you always feel like you have a spot for privacy. I want to go back and have cocktails! I will go back...

Vqg5TCEPJ1nq4hWQcOvysw.text: I've come here for a very long time and always had exceptional service except tonight therefore the one star. I came in around 10:50 pm a girl with long hair in a pony tail and a striped tee was working the register at the coffee side. She was very rude and condescending to my friend and super rude to me when she rung me up, I asked "is there a problem" and she said, "we can make it a problem." As a service worker I understand that one can have a bad night but that was definitely uncalled for, she didn't give me a receipt for my order and basically ushered me out. I never write yelp reviews but this is was super uncalled for and unprofessional. Again, I understand she might have a bad day but the way she acted and spoke was unprofessional. I would never speak to anyone else that way. I hope there is a follow up to this and management takes action.

4zUvcBOFVIlufhH-10My7g.text: Three letters: O M G ! The best breakfast and coffee place in Phoenix so far! I've been to 3 different coffee places in Scottsdale, and the Lux Central is just amazing. I would recommend their lattes..... for those who don't like sweet drinks, but not too strong of a taste, order the hot vanilla latte. For breakfast the muffin egg and gravy and the egg sandwich are to die for. Looking forward to my next visit!

IMo-8sbRwWdVuXMG8UiJ7g.text: Their menus all say that lunch is served until 5. We arrived at 4 and they said they aren't serving food until 5. Note to restaurant: please fix your menu!! All of them said 5pm.  The place was very hard to find, and inside was really loud (music and staff). The only positive was the interior decoration was sort of cool.

CguxxQ5hxIRtvQ1dsnvr7Q.text: Amazing atmosphere! Definitely the go to place if you are looking for a hipster environment, with fun, unique, and urban designs. The iced latte was on par, and the homemade whipped topping was akin worth the visit. The only downside is the breaded desserts are very stale from sitting out all day!

9KT1Vc3Wehf1SmLC9GNOkQ.text: One of the best mixology burger joints around.  Also, don't forget the hot apple cider. Sweet!

Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger and margaritas

qWW0ONJgCsdFpQJs1Y1qnw.text: This was a great spot to spend my afternoon. It's the ultimate hang-out spot in Phoenix. Good coffee and even better vibes. It's busy but you should be able to snag a spot as long a you don't have a large group. I didn't try a cocktail, but they do have a bar. Definitely check out this spot! It's also a great place to people watch and they have plenty of outlets for charging.

-4ocax3SvO5Z7Z3WI4iBYg.text: Just landed in PHX and needed a mid-morning boost. Nothing better than a cup of Joe from Lux! I love coming here since it's very close by the airport and very central. This drink I got is called the black and white, which has black and white chocolate iced latte with cream...so refreshing and delish.

hK61YOcaBobxHtJb3O-pGg.text: Honestly overwhelmed when I come here. It's overhyped and the environment is not at all friendly.

dwh5eJXs1KgMXKuaJeQJIQ.text: Can We say the best in Phoenix.  Fun, Welcoming and Beautifull People. No one knows if I'm drooling over the staff or the deserts.    None the less this place is smashing in every awesome way!  The food is delicious the service is gracious and extremely clean.  Another place to seriously "Be Seen".    One big MWAH to LUX, Your doing it right.  Good Job.

qp_ug1cFo6fjElHJ1svDZg.text: Having been introduced to Lux a year ago, it has become my favorite coffee shop in the central Phoenix area. It can be easy to drive right by it, so be on your guard and depending on the time you go there, parking can sometimes be dicey. There have been a few times I park on the neighborhood street next to their shop and walk a little ways, which I don't mind in the least. They have plenty of out door and indoor seating to suit your fancy. I also appreciate that it's always clean and well kept. The staff has always been friendly and helpful too! Coffee is great! My fave is the Black & White mocha which is a drink from the coffee gods! It's smooth and rich, with just the right amount of sweetness! Btw- try their home made whipped in your drink! Their food is great too! I have had several breakfast items and have not been dissapointed, but my favorite so far is the oatmeal. They top it with a mix of cooked walnuts and blueberries! Yum! Don't forget about their quiche either because it's delish! The other thing I really like is their mac n' cheese, jalapeno bacon all the way! Lux is a great place to go for your morning coffee, or any meal really because it has great food and fantastic coffee all in a relaxed inviting atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black &amp; White mocha perfection!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BJ2hV9xRnmLxvHFcF6RvQQ.text: Actually very disappointed in the customer service here. My husband and I could be considered regulars, we live just down the street and usually pop in twice a week for drinks at the bar. This morning we decided to grab coffee and some breakfast before getting ready to go to work and after spending 5 minutes looking for parking and 3 minutes waiting in line when he asked to order a breakfast sandwich the cashier told him they stopped serving breakfast......it was 11:03....... so after parking and waiting they could let it slide for it being 3 minutes past that? The person in front of us happily got breakfast. Just a shame. Didn't even want food after that. Don't really understand how they don't care for the guest in just the smallest ways. As if putting one more egg on a piece of bread would have been against their policy. Won't be back.

vo3Mqr-au04SQfxiAJvyAg.text: Cool restaurant.  Sat outside on comfy patio furniture.  Stroganoff was excellent and the wedge salad was sublime.  Apple pie and delicious coffee to finish.  Service was spot on.  Highly recommend.

27BwoEStvZA4QAmnLL0Rjw.text: A great place to have breakfast, good ambiance, music, service  I will come here again and recommend to anyone

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Café late
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pancake special sweet with fruits

oHANFBO_qQvGgfPW1ulFNQ.text: Awesome place for a number of activities. Food, coffee, drinks, great  experiences. Drinks are creative, unique, and well crafted. Good place to do some schooling as well. Can't wait to go back. Perfect for rich conversation with a beautiful Lady.

GM4KIjIwc3IuLJWAxzATyA.text: I love this place. Great decor, friendly staff and amazing food and drink. Their coffee is delicious and they make a great Old fashioned. I love stopping here when I am in the area. This place is doing it right and I hope they continue with what they are doing. I am a fan.

C1wXoU2--NvqQx6D4cpM0A.text: This remains the best coffeehouse I've ever been to anywhere. I wish they invited other coffeehouse owners from around the country to come check it out so that there could be a copycat in every city.

mACht2R6LFi178bW2FoZ0w.text: Very cozy feel. Quality products. Quiche Lorraine was perfect and oven heated .highly recommend .

TBzym8NPwk32uAf7k65IMA.text: This place is very trendy and yuppie-like but still attracts a wide variety of people. It is almost always busy and on weekends it's packed with a line out the door and you rarely see people come in, turn around and leave when they see the line.  A few things that are very different from most other coffee shops, is that they serve breakfast (excellent eggs, bacon, and hash), they have a bar, and on the Sunday I was there they had a disc jockey. Oh, by the way, the coffee is excellent.

IQHjz7-Df1asvgfwuc4cIQ.text: Who that within two months of adding a bar & kitchen, Lux could have quite probably the *best burger in Phoenix*?  Green chili cheddar burger: Highly recommended.  The bartenders are great, too. Have them mix you something new.

mpeqD1BJshygoyEIwnG9WQ.text: I've been here twice now.  The first time was in April 2009 on a first date.  I thought the caramel frappe was just okay like the date, but I liked the atmosphere of the place.    I went again last Tuesday on a first date, and the place had moved to a much larger building on the same property.  They needed to expand since the place is so popular and crowded (too crowded in the old location).  The atmosphere is still awesome with interesting seating and artwork on the walls.  But even more interesting was my date.  We stayed for 5 hours!  This was the best or second best date of 2011.   However, on the second date she told me that she wanted to be friends because of her complicated life right now.  I'm holding out hope for something more, but meanwhile, I'm going to move on to other women, who I will probably have less chemistry with.    As for the drink and customer service, my iced chai was great, but not one of the best I've ever had either.  They were quite friendly in there, which I greatly appreciated.  Definitely would come back.  Hopefully, on a date which leads to a relationship.  This place is magicial....haha.

hvyeFmCZO6UUE_eLVcB4rw.text: I love LUX! Best coffee and place to hangout in Phoenix.

7D7E4Aat2MrkN9zSGhaZJg.text: Lux is a weekend staple-- Saturday without Lux would be akin to missing a critical appendage.  Well maybe not, but pretty damn close.   As others have said the coffee is fantastic, actually the best I've ever had.  The espresso is always perfect.  I have a weakness for their iced mochas-- really the only iced mochas I've ever liked. Not too sweet, not too bitter, not too anything... just pure awesomeness.  And their whipped cream?  It took me about a year of visiting Lux to discover this sweet surprise, but it is so good.  Still not sure what the special twist is, but it is goooooood.   And their baked goods are better than any I've had at a coffee shop.  Most are made on-site in an adorable little kitchen in the hallway.  My love of baking tempts me to slip in, tie on an apron, and start baking- but I've held myself back from offering unsolicited help.  At least thus far.     The staff is always friendly and always remembers your name (or at least makes a concerted effort to do so). It's generally crowded-- which makes sense, being as it is, in my humble opinion, the best coffee shop in Phoenix... maybe Arizona... maybe the US. Somehow the crowds and loud music never bother me-- and I can always find a seat.   Lux is one of those places that seems like it would be too hip for my taste-- everything about the decor, ambiance, and clientele suggests this, but for some reason, it still feels comfortable and friendly.  Maybe it's the warm embrace of out-of-this-world espresso and brioche.... whatever it is, it's a fantastically addicting way to start my weekend.

v2pC4HSWvxQtzwrkVm8TrQ.text: Stopped in to grab coffee.  Freshly squeezed lemonade was quenching.   Cute spot with all kinds of hip things going on in there.  Food so good.  Parking is tricky.  Park in the back.  There is an outdoor picnic table area.  I would definitely come back to this place.  Love it!!!

FSYVLhXgiSVNkeNiLOf2Ug.text: Came in here on a Sunday night trying to kill a little time. The 4 of us sat at the bar, and little did we know but we were in for a show. Jake is hands down the best bartender in phoenix. We sat and watched in amazement as he created his masterpieces with care. None of us had anything specific in mind, so all we had to tell him was the kind of liquor we like, he would make a recommendation, and then make it. I'm a whiskey drinker, so he made an excellent (insert name here-because there is no name for it yet) drink, that was definitely what I was looking for. highly recommend coming down here and asking for him!

fV9nhbkjwR1i0AHQwws9_g.text: Hard to find seating when you are looking for an outlet sometimes but overall it is great! Sometimes the cashier isn't too friendly but they're busy and it happens - life happens. Otherwise, it is an awesome place with great coffee. Also, Great mac and cheese

1YtW9zoPFloVByOpwbVw3g.text: Is somewhat of a 'fairy tale' coffee joint - out of a movie/magazine type atmosphere. Kept getting cooler and cooler as I asked more questions about their store, walked around, etc.   Great coffee experience and they were roasting while I was there which added to the vibe.   Only downer is that Biff's (think back to the future with me) run amuck in this place  - I was wearing business attire and you would have thought I was yelling racist remarks with the looks I was getting. Sorda funny to me, just see that getting to me if I was a local.

45zLdnkTJOyM9jfTN_8kww.text: Great little hang out spot. Full bar, excellent coffee & tea, and great food. Definitely trendy. Good location, right off the light rail. If you're in the phoenix area and in the mood for something different, it's worth it!

KeCE_rWf40TgoemW7uhqNA.text: Places like this make me wonder why I ever go to Starbucks. Funky, wonderful coffee, nice people and amazing coffee cake make this a must breakfast stop.

68-lLJ6u9EB7OAIDOnPO3g.text: Wow. Went here for the first time this morning and plan on going back next weekend! We ordered two bloody Mary's and two breakfast sandwiches. Watching the bartender fix the bloody Mary's was entertaining and made our mouths water! It was the best Bloody Mary I have ever had! The sandwiches were a great choice as well, simple but tasty. The bill came and it was only $29 which I was shocked by. The bloody Mary's were only $8! The quality and the price can't be beat in the valley!

SZRVkvJ8A34MnCVXyMfG1Q.text: I love Lux, and now that I've left downtown Phoenix living for good, I will miss it.  I am going to give it five stars instead of four, because Jeff, the owner, more than makes up for the crowds with his great customer service. He gets to know his regulars by name and encourages all of the staff to do the same.   To the reviewer who was bummed out that they didn't know what a "cafe ole" was... I think you MEANT "cafe au lait." It's a French drink, not a Spanish cheer.  Yeah it's crowded. Yeah there are often too many hipsters (my little sister said that she'd have to find some Buddy Holly glasses to wear in next time, so she'd fit in better). But the coffee is great, the baked goods are awesome, and the staff is capable, courteous, and kicks much ass.

ONSsi75HbcUIPksitlBb0A.text: Great place to get some work done, or go meet up with friends. I love the food they serve, and I highly recommend their brownies. On the down side, it tends to get a little bit too crowded. Definitely a place to check out!

1Yh6L7WHVyDlqwXWkH-Tww.text: Delicious coffee & even better eggs! But ladies, don't even think about showing up without your high waisted shorts, your hair in a messy bun or your nerd glasses. I felt out of place a little bit but the coffee and good made up for it!

6HHPKXNkGourdrs1TIT-PA.text: Definitely a fan of the hipster coffee bar. The lines and parking can certainly get out of hand but the product is superb and the energy is infectious!

FjQRXorph0v2eLbXcXdINg.text: This is one of the best places in the US. Seriously- they have the best everything- try the iced coffee just to start! Their breakfast is amazing too. The lines that form for this place look like the iPhone 4 release at an Apple store- but the employees always keep their cool.

-wy8BcWTYmjD0XqoEky2yw.text: I have moved around the country quite a bit in the last three years from Seattle to Hawaii - Michigan and back to Seattle again. Everywhere I go I look for that special place that doesn't scream St#+%%cks and yet delivers great coffee with outstanding service. Here are my findings so far: Maui - Honolulu Coffee Co. Ann Arbor - The Common Cup, Ypsilanti - The Ugly Mug, Bellingham, WA - The Black Drop, Lettered Streets, Firehouse, and Tony's Coffee, Seattle (So Far) - Vivace Espresso and now in Phoenix - Lux Coffee Bar.  Upon entering the coffee bar you greeted with a smooth ultra urban vibe that is not pretentious, arrogant, nor fake. The service is outstanding, the bakery/deli products are amazing and delicious. The beans are hand roasted in the 'Employee Lounge' and are made into the perfect caramel shots poured into the perfectly stretched milk from a very talented barista.   I know the LUX doesn't need one more review, but I must say that the cool vibe, the fantastic coffee, and the great spaces make for a coffee shop that I might just book a flight to Phoenix from Seattle to visit.   LUX has it dialed in...trust me!

XCQImV-NwKY6odkwNl6dKQ.text: I love, love, love Lux.   For some magical reason I get tons of work done here. It is always busy, noisy & crowded, but somehow I am more productive here than anywhere else these days.   I started riding my bike from Miller & Thomas to Lux on Sundays since I need the exercise & I never get work done at home. It is worth the 20 mile round trip bike ride.   I love their cappuccinos & the baked goods have all been fabulous. Please stop eating the quiche people, so there will be some left when I get there.  The people that work there & super chill & friendly too.  Wait a minute, I meant to say Lux sucks...never go there so there will always be a seat for me! ;)

yjKrbO6q88X4Tola-YGC9w.text: Nope nope nope nope nope.  The coffee might be good and the decor may be trendy  HOWEVER BEWARE!!!  HUGE "hip-ster" crowd.  I've never been so amused in my life!!  The crowd, huddled over their laptops mostly "pretend" to be working on them while others scoff at why one wears a Fruit of the loom T-shirt instead of an American Apparel.    Snotty, snobby and downright disgusting "wool cap" wearing crowd who act like wanna be (but can't afford to be) Californians jam the place tight.  But, not my problem that your not "understood" or more obvious unemployed.  If you're looking to go to be "seen" having a cup of coffee I recommend Starbucks on Robertson here in Los Angeles, at least there it's okay and expected.  And you can do all the "freelance" work you want YIPPPEEEE!

2uSbEIQ-Nl8lMNvwWsxWcQ.text: Three words: Best Mocha Ever. Oh, and five more words: Best Peanut Butter Brownie Ever. Now that we know I like Lux, let's talk about some peoples complaints.  Those who know me know I'm not trendy or a "hipster", but I've never had anyone at Lux "scoff" at my Target clothes or un-trendy shoes. And for the most part, everyone I know who goes to Lux really does work while they're there...they aren't just pretending to be on their computer! And if they aren't working, it's probably because the internet is down (which happens a lot more than it should at Lux).   Overall, I really like this place but I can see how one who isn't super trendy or artsy might be intimidated when they first show up. My advice is to go again, a lot of different types of people go there and are really friendly. Plus, the different groups of people will come in cycles...at a certain time it might be inundated with twenty-something hippies with dreads, and another time it might be taken over by 30-something slightly overweight workaholics.   Don't let people scare you from a good place.

0sip60ezU2twut70JlNpTw.text: Love it there, I always feel very comfortable and at home, the pasteries are to die for!

ckJGMYN1SZmZw43pvcZf6Q.text: As a kid I wanted superpowers. I wasn't picky about it; any power would've been sufficient. Super strength. Super speed. I'd even have settled for being able to break things just by screaming. But alas, instead of super powers all I got where good looks and charm. It's not easy, but I try to live with it as best I can.  Yesterday something happened to me, though. Something extraordinary. Something that cannot be explained with science. Or logic. Or even algorithms (I tried.) I believe I may have stumbled upon the secret to my secret abilities.  Amanda B and I came to Pane Bianco after the Anti-Prop 102/Prop 8 rally. I was hungering for equal rights and social justice, but in the meantime I had to settle for salad and bread.  While waiting for our food Amanda turned to me and said "I'm going over to Lux. You want anything?"  And without thinking I said "Sure. Surprise me."  I swear to Cthulu the entire restaurant froze in place. The two girls at the counter, Amanda, even the guy in the make making my salad, everyone, for the briefest of moments, were trapped in stasis by my naivety.   By the power of n00bity, I had stopped time. Fuck. How do I unstop it?  Thankfully Amanda, who over time has built an immunity to my occasional outburst of teh dumb, fixed the situation.  "Ummmm...there's a lot to choose from. Maybe you want to make it more specific?"  "Yeah, hahaha." Oh. Great. The girl at the counter has unfrozen herself too, isn't that nice.  "Perhaps coffee...tea..."  "Tea. Iced. Something fruity." I tried to laugh the whole incident off, but there was no denying it, we all felt it; I almost broke Pane Bianco with my stupid.   Soz.
