After uncomfortably waiting on the patio (my "ironically mis-matching outfit" didn't work out like I had planned and the other patrons let me know it), I went into Lux to find Amanda, where I felt the smallest tuggings of belonging. With an interior this tacky, my outfit (comic book t-shirt, rolled up jeans, long black stripped socks, layers of bracelets, pink  faux pearls and business jacket...yeah...) and I fit right in.   If only I had a Mac and a web design project I kept putting off to look at xkcd.   Amanda got me the peach iced tea which I enjoyed immensely.   Peach is one of those fruits, like grapes and green apples, whose actual flavor has been all but lost after decades of synthesized flavors (I predict that in ten years, at this rate, I won't even know what a real grape tasted like).   But Lux's peach tea tasted like real peach. I can't say if they actually used real peach or if they just used some sort of syrup, but whatever they used tasted delicious.   I keep hearing about how awesome their cupcakes are, and in the future I will possibly order one, but first I have to avoid that kneejerk "Ugh!" reaction I give when anyone asks me if I want the "vegan" option, like that time I giggled and said "Soy milk? No thanks. I just want regular milk for a regular person" to the barrista at the Starbucks on my campus.  I will  admit I have an irrational fear of soy, but I am willing to do the right thing and give it a try.  In the meantime, I'm going to see if maybe I can develop a different super power. I mean, stopping the world in its tracks with dumb comments is nice and all, but it's not going to get me featured in any comic books.  I just realized this is a perfect excuse to get some rope and make some people tell the truth.  Given my readers, even I'm afraid of what I'd find out.

HtxlF94cm_e_fdIJy2JxNw.text: Ok, Lux, you guys rock. If only the food was better, or more healthy oriented, I would give you the fifth star. The lofty atmosphere, the community feeling, good coffee, I could stay there for hours and hours. THE Coffee place in Phoenix, what a coffee shop should be. Kudos.

jJfWsnr3Ddlb9SWW1eYYIg.text: 02.06.10  Is this where all the cool college kids hang out with their shades and their laptops to people-watch?  If not, it should be.  Iced coffee gets the job done.  The restroom stocks fancy products!

W__NfiaBhse0HE715VfjLA.text: Best tasting coffee in Phoenix and their homemade quiche, coffee cake, scones, ect....is all so yummy. I have been going their for years and just realized they have breakfast sandwiches, I can't wait to try one!

B4V3pJf82aehaeBt6uh6Ng.text: I had high hopes for Lux partly because of my desire for independent and unique businesses to succeed but also because I'm an Italophile who loves real espresso and secretly wishes she could wake up every morning in Rome, walk down to the neighborhood bar, and grab a cornetto (Italian version of croissant) and a rich, deep espresso. Since I obviously can't do that, I am always hoping that I can find a place locally that can re-create that nonchalant but cultured atmosphere so prevalent in European establishments and, of course, make some damn good espresso.   Lux definitely gets some points for approximating the refined but casual feel of cafes and coffee shops in places like New York and Paris, and I very much appreciate places that remind us that eating and drinking are just as much an experience as they are about refueling quickly before we go off to our next daily task. However, because "la dolce vita" is not just about atmosphere but is also about taste and quality, I have to express my disappointment in the espresso we were served. It just wasn't that good. It was quite bitter, in fact, and it left a bit of a bad aftertaste in my mouth. I kind of expected more from the hype (and from the fact that I paid $2.50 for it).   To be fair to Lux, I've been back since and the espresso and americanos were much better on my subsequent visits. In any event, it's always nice to take a break from the frenzied pace of life and to avoid the Starbucks drive-thrus as much as possible.

C9B5ZiD0YiYp3aGXmbJDxg.text: coffee and atmosphere is amazing. Employees not always friendly and have an attitude sometimes.

9SwTp12HrjXXOgcszJwPcQ.text: I'm a regular at Lux. Haven't reviewed it out of sheer laziness. And it's usually laziness that brings me here: when I have a major thingie to get done by Day B but I spent all of Day A at the office surfing the Internet instead of working on it, I pay the price with an all-nighter, which I like to start at Lux. (Damn them for not being open past 10). This is usually the story when anyone spots me here.   I'll grab a small table for myself, plug in my laptop (free wifi), spread out my papers everywhere, then go up to the counter for a large and extremely delicious Velvet Latte. When it's done right, there's a perfect swirl of white cream that forms the shape of a leaf on the surface of the caramel-colored coffee. Mmm.  Since I am ADD I take frequent breaks of course. Like every 3 minutes. Whenever I hear a strange piece of music I really like that I've never heard before (this happens often), I strain to catch part of the lyrics, stick it into Google, find the name of the band, stick it into iTunes and download it. I'm not making that up. Like half my music collection was created through this method. The last few bands I downloaded tracks from are... let me open up my iTunes... Kasabian, Feist, and the Detroit Cobras. I'm not even remotely hip enough to have heard of those before on my own.

Od7VxUnMuKZBvPE3vU_poA.text: Okay, so I realize that there are already several reviews on Lux out there and they are all generally great.... but now it is my turn!   I have been going to Lux consistently for the last year. Unless I am out of town or sick I can be found there on a weekly basis. I live in Old Town Scottsdale and I literally drive completely out of my way to indulge in the deliciousness that is Lux!  From the wonderful coffee to the mouthwatering quiche that insists on haunting my dreams, I just cannot get enough!  It is hands down the best coffee I have ever had in the Valley.  Aside from the quality of their food and coffee drinks the staff is nothing short of amazing. Make sure that when you arrive you give Jency, Eric, Noel and Jeff some serious love - for they are coffee Gods!  There is nothing more refreshing on a stressful day for me than stopping in my favorite coffee shop, getting my usual iced caramel latte with whip and a slice of veggie quiche, sitting on a comfy couch, people watching, and listening to the great music. I love that this spot is not overly hipster or "too cool for school."   I highly recommend driving past the Starbucks of the world and trying Lux. Support your local businesses - it is oh so important.

8SxqyQefCIK23TDF-Nixqg.text: Love their Chai iced tea and selection of gluten free pastries.  Very relaxing place to hang out and unwind.

MNAgkKR4_LX3sUBbmwTKGQ.text: Wow, I like this coffee house a lot. Finding it was a bit hard, I wish there was a huge sign to tell you so I don't have to drive back and forth the street.  I like the patio cafeteria tables and chairs outside the cafe. Inside was kinda industrial with arts on the walls which were amazingly talents.   The staff were VERY friendly especially the owner Jeff. We chatted it up a bit. Real cool dude! I like how you order a cup of coffee and they ask if you like dark or light. Dark please. I'll have one of those strawberry pastry as well, mmm....so good! Music is a bit off, it was kinda loud.   I think they roast their own beans which I would love to see in real life. It's like the Krispy Kreme donuts when you see the donut gets glazed!  I would recommend this place to anyone who come or lives here but I would come early or later in the day, they do have a long line of people.

6ZoEAZmntO1vYVO0MOBBuA.text: I've been to Lux twice since they've made the move next door, and I figured it was ok to give a review. I have been to Lux countless times over the last few years. It has always been the place to see and be seen, with coffee service that is definitely above Starbucks, but I will admit struggles in certain areas.   Lux, in its former space, was a small shop, always packed and definitely had its crowd. If you weren't a part of the crowd, you'd receive a "look" of, "hey, who are you?!" Look past that and hop in line for a cappuccino and it would make up for it.  The new space, well... it caters to the exclusivity of the "hipster" crowd. Walk through the door that you THINK is the entrance... and wander around. The kitchen, espresso bar and cocktail bar are all broken up and there is no definitive flow of service. Also, is that a customer wearing the tight jeans and cardigan? Or is that the staff? Who knows? Luckily I have a friend who works there and was kind enough to show me around and how the flow of service works. If you're not that lucky, best of luck to you, as you're left to your own sense of direction as how to order, sit down, etc. From what I gather, you can order an espresso drink and sit wherever and they'll call your name when your drink is ready. However, I'm not sure about the cocktail bar. The only way I think you would order would be by sitting at the bar? Not sure about ordering food from the kitchen.  I will admit, I haven't ordered any food from Lux yet, apart from a pastry for my coffee. I had a croissant, which was pretty good and went really well with my cappuccino. I'm a fan of a free-pour cappuccino, however the cappuccino that I was served on this visit had the foam scooped on top. This confused me, because I saw other customers order a cappuccino and get one free-pour. Maybe it depends on the barista? Kind of inconsistent. I did sit down at the awkward cocktail bar and order a drink. The bar has normal height seating and a raised bar for the bartender. It's awkward when they lean down and tower over you to deliver a drink. Anyway, I ordered the "Number 47" cocktail with gin, Green Chartreuse, St. Germain, lime, mint and cucumber. I'm a huge fan of Green Chartreuse and gin so I was excited to try it. They didn't have any cucumber in house, so they made it without it. Jeff (the owner) commented, "Well today it's just the 46." Hmm... Alright. So I took a sip of the cocktail. It was decent. Nothing exciting at all. It was overpowered by the mint and the lime in the cocktail. It masked the green Chartreuse too much. It really NEEDED that cucumber to mellow out the mint and lime so you could taste all of the ingredients.  Oh well... what can you do when the owner doesn't seem to mind that ingredients are missing?   Overall, props to Lux for being busy at 3pm on a Thursday afternoon and being a successful establishment, which may be from the same established clientele from before the expansion. The coffee and pastry has remained the same, which is ok with me. However, the cocktail bar tries a little too hard, I think. Also, the decor and vibe has definitely turned Lux into the "hipster mecca" and excluded the general public from it's demographic. Which, I can't complain or comment too much, because they are doing just fine. The flow of the restaurant is choppy and confusing and the staff is less than considerate (with a few exceptions). There's my two cents, for whatever it's worth.

SIa10rQnPFY-QexlJzmy1Q.text: Upside: nice-looking contemporary space, great drinks and pastries, reasonable prices, not Starbucks, healthy buzz of conversation, free Wi-Fi  Downside: very hard to tell what it is from the outside and get there accurately for first-timers. (If coming from north on Central, you'll flip a U at Campbell after light rail station, then) turn right on Turney for parking lot.

4zUo6zT5okbmhZEtrHNLFA.text: I am writing this review about the most amazing Freeway Chevrolet.  Anyone who is looking to buy a car, only go to Freeway Chevrolet and you will never buy another car anywhere else.  I can't express how grateful my family is to the family of Freeway Chevrolet.  In specific, John Huggins, Derek Nicholson, Mike Broadway and Jay Zomlefer.  Our family has bought 4 cars from Freeway and they have always treated us like family, honest and loyal.  Freeway goes above, way above and beyond for their clients.  From purchase to service and follow ups, the service is so unbelievably good that I can't say enough.  Thank You Freeway Chevrolet for always being there for us.  Sincerely, The Dobson's

omX1rRJzgoLzLfoAssgXLg.text: I feel pretty good about Lux. I put much of my teeny server's salary into this place every month, but it's delicious and it satisfies the caffeine addiction. The staff treats me pretty well, but I assume this is because I go there everyday. (and because I have really, really good hair..)  i've always been quite the snob, with just the right amount of slumming taking place, but i can't truly enjoy an iced latte from anywhere else now. i don't enjoy their hot drinks quite as much, but iced always hits the spot. soy iced velvet? delicious. delicious. delicious. iced americano? delicious.  and the little quiches! and all of the meyer's cleaning products! lux is pretty much amazing.

LBi9JqotRzW7IsiJrqlCJQ.text: I was looking for a neighborhood joint that wasn't a chain and I found one with Lux.    It's a neighborhood coffee in the Truest sense. You've got all your regular characters - dude who looks like Jesus, hippie chick in her cool hippie skirt, aspiring artists (one overweight hipster even wearing a beret), couples pulling up on bicycles, old guys reading the paper. Truly local people with a sense of silent comaraderie - you just KNOW not to be yapping on your cell in there.  You can feel comfortable and feel like you can disappear for a few hours.  Good, solid espresso drinks, free WiFi.  If you live in the area, you should definitely be a patron and support this local spot (as opposed to Starbucks down the street on Lola up the street).    I dig it.

1Rj3DFVp4NiN_dGYq6Rgjw.text: My second favorite coffee shop in Phoenix. I went here after visiting Pane Bianco for a sandwhich and thought I would grab a nice coffee. Not only was the coffee amazing but the vibe was right on! Would highly recommend.

ciSe3FjCjXV0eqXZlQt-6Q.text: Very chill environment where coffee and good vibes abound. Go for the java, stay for the cozy seating and temporary escape from everything else.

dIWLwNVjHbee4HYvQHepkQ.text: I would be lying if I said I didn't miss their original location and the vibe/service received there but I will always have an affection for Lux. Great drinks and sniggity snacks. They support local art not only on the walls but also musically. Fresh flowers, seating outside or inside on funky chairs. Lux is definitely unique and fun.

SyXyYU9SANnGHLX-2Ho5-Q.text: We visit Lux regularly.  It's as super place for breakfast especially.  Great atmosphere and an eclectic menu.  The coffee is outstanding.

GEbyEHn_bAnblP8FvFXwyg.text: my 3rd place, hands down. find me here at least three times a week & I actually live 30 minutes away... but it's totally worth it. love the vibe, love the coffee, & especially love the mac n cheese

4HSdZW8uLDWmeZAJxs7kcQ.text: Ok.  Let me start by saying that even though I'm a pretty confident guy, I don't consider myself to be "cool" or "hip" in any way.  I wear far too much plaid for that to be the case.  I was looking for a place in the area for a nice chai latte before heading to rehearsals, and this place had the highest / most reviews, figured I had to give it a shot.  I actually went in three different businesses looking for this one, so right off the bat I feel like an idiot.  I ordered my chai, even though I wasn't sure they had it - because there really is no menu displaying what your options are (I'm certain this is in an effort to be cool).  The beverage was ok, nothing special, but ended up costing me almost six bucks.  I will give them this - the ambiance is pretty amazing.  There are many places to sit and chill, lots of nooks and funky chairs, including a pretty cool back patio.  Outside of that, I just felt out of place and uncomfortable - despite the great soundtrack and pretty people.  So - I'm sure if I were cooler, or younger, I'd dig this joint, but it's just not my cup o' tea.

CaFr8cT7XeXCKOubBVpCKg.text: In my search for a legitimate Chai Latte that embraces the spiciness of the traditional product, Lux has been my answer until I can find a better place. They make their Chai from scratch every morning and it is simply delightful. My other drink of choice here is their fresh squeezed lemonade which could be a hair cheaper but is simply delightful.  The people working here are great and now how to do their job well. Since I spend most of my time in Chicago I only get out here a couple of times a year and some recognize my face after a long absence and try to remember my name. Don't think they have ever gotten it right when they guess but the fact that they try and know I get an extra spicy chai is nothing short of impressive.  You will either love or hate the decor in here but personally I love it. Forget what the style is called but basically if it was 1970 and you wanted to design a futuristic place I think you'd get close to this. Always busy but I have never not been able to find a seat if I needed to stay for a bit.  All in all, this is my favorite cafe I have ever been to right now and I am confident you won't be disappointed. One thing I ask though is that you don't get your coffee "to go" when there is open seating. Bring a book and relax for a bit while you enjoy your drink in a "for here" cup with beautiful latte art on top.

C5UDu5FtdPZK1ZCeE94v6Q.text: I am not a coffee drinker but LOVE the pomegranate green tea. I am here about twice a week for meetings. Haven't made it for cocktails yet. I give it a 4 because it is always a cluster to order.

l5Fy_GrKoYTKV-yF-PPBdg.text: I went back to this place a couple years later and a LOT has changed! The atmosphere is pretty cool, we sat outside. I didn't actually eat anything, but the drinks were pretty good. I really liked it mainly for the atmosphere, but I'll have to go back and try out some food. Glad I gave them a 2nd chance. This might become our new Saturday morning spot.

aEFidbYlkkyqJjB7y3CiPw.text: I am a hot chocolate and whipped cream afficionado.  I make my own whipped cream and have a nitrous-charged gourmet dispenser.  This is the best whipped cream and hot chocolate I have found in Phoenix.  It is next to Pane Bianco, if you haven't noticed from the 155 reviews of each place.  They complement each other very well.  Order at Bianco's and get a drink at Lux while waiting.    Then, rock on with yo bad sef.

4ld5OxK0TtJCGeIfusY8RQ.text: Very addicted.  This place has become a weekend staple breakfast spot for my wife and I.  We love trying their wide range of fresh bake pastries.  The dutch pancake is always a favorite too.

JdT4Egm5KaHUnk6lThHknw.text: I had the hot chocolate but...as much as I love chocolate, sometimes for me, too much richness in hot chocolate i don't like. I asked the server to please make mine not too rich. She knew what I meant, and it was very ,very good!  She did look at me a little funny though LOL.!!!

CTqDfr8frun-oCBn-uif4A.text: I haven't reviewed Lux yet, because so many of you have already got after it.  But the time has come and I must make my comment.  There isn't much to say.  Lux simply makes the best coffee in Phoenix.  I dare someone to challenge me on this fact.  It's a Saturday morning, and I have some work to do, but don't feel like staying home or heading into the office, you will find me sipping a great cup of joe and snipping some FREE WIFI!!  The only issue I have is this has become such a hot spot for everyone.  Why can't people keep secrets??????

EsnOjPrFQyotECTY7N5zQQ.text: This is definitely one of my favorite spots to spend a lazy Saturday or Sunday afternoon. And especially it's right next to Pane Bianco!  Lux has a very cozy deco, nice atmosphere, regular tables for who come with laptops, and comfy couches for who just want to relax and enjoy the day. And did I mention free Wi-Fi?!   I enjoy my coffee to the strong side, and Lux definitely brings that natural flavor to every single cup. I always order the Hazelnut Latte (hot), it's my fav! The presentation is very pretty , just like the picture, the barista always draws the leave pattern with the form. The coffee taste is very bold, with a light hazelnut flavor, delicious! (if you're comparing the sweetness level with Starbucks, this is no where close to that sweet!)

cLyrSkNAuCoV_qmjpaclTg.text: Lux is one of my favorite places. The ambiance is pretty fun, good music playing, their iced vanilla lattes are delish and their breakfast hash is so yummy! Everyone is friendly. Have only been to Lux on weekend mornings, fyi.

uh_83S14D5VDLqAAi-7x0Q.text: No one has commented on the mixology part of Lux recently. Even though I wasn't wearing fake glasses, an asymmetric hair cut, nor had an apple laptop, I was given the best drink I've ever had. After a few questions about my 'liquor palate', the bartender spent nearly five minutes making a quad gin fizz and then some other thing that had fire as an ingredient. It was excellent and really fun!

6Yv6AZy49qGCBcPHEq8b3Q.text: Walmart on Dunlap, just west of Central Ave  Phoenix, AZ.  The store has some really nice employees that go the extra but the management sucks.  I went in today and purchased less than 10 items, mostly meat and some odds and ends I forgot to get.  There was one check out clerk.  There were all kinds of people waiting in line and several with very large (shopping carts full).  I first tried to get the cashier's attention but either the man literally ignored me or was deaf.  I waved my arms and yelled, nothing.  OK so I go up to the front where a very nasty attitude young man responded to my complaint to use the self service line.  I told him I never have and never will use the self service line and I don't intend to start now.  Open another line the place is backed up.  He ignored me.  A lady employee saw I was really getting irate and asked me if I wanted her to help me use the self serve line and I replied NO I want you to keep having a job.  With this I again asked the young man to open another line or I was going to FRY's and he responded, fine have a nice day.  This happened around 3pm 2/26/15.  I have no intentions of being a cashier and if a store wants my money the least they can do is not FORCE FEED ME SELF SERVE.  I really don't give a dam about greedy stores wanting to get rid of more employees.  I walked out and I really think that we should stop being puppets and allow stores to dictate to us but to cater to us or the he** with the store and go to stores that still have customer service.  Get a grip.

cNMSSfQma7T04a2lVS2m5w.text: I went to Lux for a change of studying atmosphere the other evening.  I was lucky enough to find a seat at a table to get down to business.    This is my second visit to Lux and both times I truly enjoyed the pastry I treated myself to and my coffee.  My soy latte was perfect.  The staff is friendly and the crowd is diverse.  I enjoyed the music and atmosphere.  Lux always seems to be a busy spot and I can see why.  While everyone seems to love Lux, I'm not in love with it, but then again, I'm very picky.  ;)

5qgKs-gOpuveegRLqpxHpw.text: The tea is yummy and the environment is chill and very laid-back (they've done a good job decorating the place on a small budget with unique thrifted items).

-78z7wVq1a8GwKwnYgJtNg.text: This is the type of place I imagine litters Seattle and Portland. Very artsy, trendy, for hipsters. There were old type writers, design show furniture and a DJ in the corner armed with a Mac full of electronica. I didn't feel cool enough to be in there.  They're building on a porch which will be nice in the cooler months. Hopefully they don't pipe the music out.  However, the ice coffee was very good - very strong and fresh tasting. I also got a small bag of chocolate chip cookies which were awesome and soft.  I wouldn't go out of my way for this place but it was fun to try.

x7aYlAtSz0axKkG4zgFCSA.text: This place is one of the cutest little coffee shops I've ever seen! I came here on a random weekday night and it was mostly just filled with college students. I can only imagine how busy it is in the mornings! I got a hot chai and a pumpkin scone and they were both perfect, The only flaw is the parking and it is kind of hard to find. I will most definitely come back!

dHc0xOx6TPEuSU-2BAUXIw.text: Perfect for the run of the mill gentrification experience of Central Ave. Pretentious.  But, great atmosphere (once you walk through the Macbook convention).

3VNPLcIy_hDXFTWAsWjEmA.text: Dear lux. I love your food, drinks, and service. Etc. You re the best. BUT   When dinner starts. Please reserve certain tables for coffee and laptops and a few for dinner. This will calm some of the chaos for parties larger than two.

22QWyJ7K_MaJxNrmNn9jDA.text: I love the coffee here, I've been drinking Lux coffee for over 5 years now and to this day I am still in love with their coffee. I usually buy a few bags of beans when I'm there and hook friends up with bags when they come from out of town. Great gift to a co. Worker or family member who enjoys coffee. Staff is very friendly and Sammy is a good guy who helps run the place. Thanks for opening your doors Lux.

Fm3c9ETKYJDxjX-ddhbC-g.text: Best man bun, hole in the ear, tight jean, ironic t-shirt, chuck-tee, bow-tie coffee spot in Phoenix.

oM_2v2lff_75GorcqdJaxA.text: Lux has recently become one of my favorite places in Phoenix. I always find myself craving their coffeee and if I lived closer I would be there probably every day. The type of customers who go to Lux greatly varies depending on the time of day. I showed up one day at 8 am and the line was to the door with mostly middle age- older customers. But then you get there at 9 pm and it's 100% full of hipsters. The drinks at the bar are great. I usually have no idea what I want but the bartenders are wonderful about creating something I never knew I loved. My only issue is that it can be difficult to find a seat sometimes. Also, their macaroni is fantastic. Don't think, just order.

jJdQpV7TX7SUfVwrpiztxA.text: Never had a coffee served so fancy w drawings on the top ha.. I'll take it though. Very chic and contemporary (if you're into that) they also have a liquor bar :)

gpIicwAltqHvyba-MRz_tQ.text: Great coffee. Cool people. The mac and cheese is to die for. Sometimes it's difficult to find a spot to study. Definitely stop in for alcoholic beverages, to study, or for a simple coffee date.

AC8LtzpVDy82HXHHjCYUmg.text: i'm a night owl so i definitely love the hours and they make an awesome latte!

bSQaumK9w7MCHCKYiodmnA.text: Thought i'd update my review, with the new locale being open;  coffee, pastries, and environment all maintain their top-shelf qualities. inside seating room was always an issue, but not near as much anymore. And the places to sit are all very hip, cool set-ups - not just 10 look-a-like tables and chairs.   My only problem? How they've laid out their customer flow. One prob at the old place was there was always an awkward bottleneck of people waiting for their drinks... and to my amazement, they've cloned the problem at their new place! Unreal! Whoever space-planned the new layout should be shot! "i have an idea - because this place gets really busy, lets direct the long line of people into a little circle in front of the register, make this the same spot people wait for / pickup their drinks, and also the same place people use the condiment bar, and we'll have everyone awkwardly climbing over each other. Perfect!"  That said, their coffee is still the best in town. So there's that too.

ShAzyJvQlBtWZK_v6OyOsw.text: Great place to just kick back and relax! I come here all the time to study and get my mind off of things. 5 STARS

cVgJm08W64CQwwhAY0eLnw.text: The brewed coffee is okay, depending on the roast. The espresso drinks are disgusting. Their "house blend" used for their espresso drinks is WAYYY too roasted. Honestly, I think they scorch their coffee beans that they use for their espresso drinks. Additionally, they don't rinse the espresso spoons so each drink has burnt espresso residue.  ALSO, their chai is fucking horrible. Worst chai I think I have ever tasted in my life. I basically payed 4.75 for iced milk. Not strong at all. If I want espresso drinks, I usually go to Citizen or Grinders.   Their food is pretty pricey as well and their portion sizes are pretty small. 10 dollars for an overdressed salad? No thank you.   Other than that, if you can over their hipster vibe and the non prescription glasses (which is fucking annoying, did you not graduate from high school???) , the atmosphere is great to crank out homework and it's the only coffee shop that's open late in Central Phoenix.   I'm not old enough to drink at their bar yet, but from what I've seen, it looks pretty nice and they have a variety of alcohol.   Oh and the brown haired girl, I think her name is Sasha, looks pissed off all the time(she is pretty hot though) And the tall white guy, I think his name is Sammy, is pretty bi-polar. Sometimes he is nice; other times he's an asshole.

37-qpYAZYueIS8zPmB5cpQ.text: I spent a good 6 hours of reading a book and reviewing it! I had a very productive time there with the accompaniment of a nice atmosphere, beautiful display, good music and of course delicious coffee. I ordered the velvet mocha to start. It was rather sweet, but sweetness isn't always a bad thing. By lunch time I was famished so I ordered the pulled pork plate. I was happy to see veggies mixed into the meal as well as good sourdough bread sliced thinly to complement pork. The pork was very tender and the portion size was enormous. I had a lot of eyes gravitating towards my meal. Oh so delish. After a few more hours, I ordered the hibiscus tea and must I mention there are free refills so before departure, I got a refill of tropical iced tea with a touch of the organic orange blossom honey made available on the side bar. I was rather impressed with the space availability even if I shared a 6 seater table with another person. He was nice himself and inquired my whereabouts. I thoroughly enjoyed this place. I even took the light rail which was literally on the same street of the cafe. Convenience at best with a touch of lux-ury.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Someone left good bathroom advice
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious pulled pork with a velvet mocha

1F2XXDfgpNI9LijTMiDrIQ.text: I like meeting up with friends for a little study session here. Good coffee, good food (especially the macaroni!) and just the right amount of noise for me. I didn't give a full five stars because I've encountered unfriendly staff more than once and because the line for food and drinks has always been really long when I've gone. Still, I would recommend it and will keep going back.

YZUktXetk6bSKx_QU_AtnA.text: I can't believe I waited this long to try Lux. I'm new to Phoenix and had just about given up on trying to find a place to go and sit and work around creative people AND get good coffee while I'm there. As an academic, I've kind of built my life around working in good coffee shops. So when I moved here I figured I'd have to rethink all of that. Not so! Lux is my new fave.   The coffee is real: espresso drinks are made by hand, not machine. I agree with others here that the beans aren't that great though. Even though it's not the absolute best coffee I've ever had (I'm a lifelong Peet's fan), it's certainly not reason to skip going here.   On the other hand, the service is AMAZING. They remembered my name, made sure I got stamps on my frequent buyer card, and offered to heat my croissant in a REAL TOASTER and not some lameass microwave. I got a nice little pot of jam and a smear of real butter, too. They seemed to know I was new there, which indicates to me that they have a ton of regulars and make a sincere effort to get to know them.  There are plugs and free wifi and I don't feel pressured to leave before I'm ready. Lots of great people-watching, too. (Last time I was there, a woman in her mid-30s wearing a Slint t-shirt came in with her kid-- very cool.) There's nothing dirty about this place and I don't feel like I'm sitting in someone's basement, drinking coffee off of thrift store furniture. It's very much an adult coffee shop that encourages you to hang out for a while, either indoors or out. (FYI, there are nice benches and grassy spots around the building in addition to the tables under the awning out front.)  I only wish it were bigger, a little quieter, and much closer to where I live. I also wish it opened before 7 but that's just because I need something to make me want to get up earlier and get working.   To be honest, since I moved to Phoenix 6 weeks ago I thought I was doomed to a life of grading my students' papers from any number of commercial or mediocre coffee shops. I have also had a hard time finding places to go where my people are at. You can imagine what a sigh of relief I expressed when I settled in with my cappuccino at Lux. So nice to be there.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uVimyohpwq-DE9dvF-EzSQ.text: I love coming to new cities and trying non-chain coffee shops. I've read all of the previous reviews and didn't encounter any of that. I come to coffee shops to just chill and usually work. I don't need my ego to be stroked as I order my complicated coffee drink and pastry. Just let me order, give me my drink and leave me alone. I got all of that here! Friendly, without being fake. Prompt without anxiety. Seating is great! Parking is tough on busy days it seems but you get what you get. Overall, I'd come back just to sip and watch the people.

vcCXNloeg2EAfdnrXB7mJQ.text: If you want to wait in a long line for a mediocre cup of coffee, go for it.  This place is jam packed with every hipster in the city.

wspiO9br77O9v-bdYTCSaw.text: What can I say?  I've been going for years.......Adore the coffee, the food, the music, and most of all the atmosphere of Lux.  I moved to Scottsdale for a while, and so glad Lux is back in my life.

5cGdbQAwb1hGA_v07WOvMQ.text: 2+ years ago this place was excellent. Not sure what has happened but I've been 3 times within a 6 week period & quality & service has just seemed to have gone downhill.  In the past they seemed to have taken great pride & care in everything from coffee drinks to oatmeal & everything in between. Now it appears they are all robotic & going through the motions to just get drinks & food cranked out.  Oatmeal is just another blob crammed in a mug. Served cold and tasteless with apples or berries and walnuts.  I hesitate taking out of town guests there anymore.

_jQOiy6BTmTlYVFcaTY9HQ.text: Hidden Gem!! Fantastic Coffees & Teas and amazing baked goods. Great place to eat & chill.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hidden Jem

f8jnY8CbD2RGgKQPX_S1JA.text: I was pretty surprised at how "poppin'" it was for the day of the week that we had decided to come, none the less the service was great and I was very impressed with their chicken plate and their side of mashed potatoes and veggies. Also I grabbed a dessert on my way out by the cafe.   Would come back again!

6-b5cfLQFGu06aa7VJ-RtQ.text: No better place in this city to find the perfect urban hipster vibe, a clientele of cool creative young folk, and more than plenty options of delectable  pastries, meals, and drinks. You can really get creative with your lattes here and their selection of desserts is always interesting and changing.   The space itself is what really makes Lux a winner. The place is surprisingly huge with plenty of seating, but it gets crowded quickly, especially at peak hours so be wary of this if youre coming in with a big group or to study. That being said, Lux boasts one of the most homey and earthy, yet diverse interiors of any local downtown coffee shop, which makes even the large crowds worth bearing. Come in the fall or early winter time for some lovely outdoor seating or come in the evenings to enjoy a DJ and watch this place transform into a chill late night hangout spot.   Parking here can be a bit of a strain and even trying to find it when driving down central. I always seem to miss it the first time. But alas, maybe that's more my incompetence.   Things I would recommend here besides the coffee? The jalapeno Mac and cheese definitely. The coffee crumble cake is also an unexpected delight. I'll be returning to try some more of their wide assortment of pastries so more reviews of Lux must-haves coming soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cUCfCgcqLZctNhEiXUwdTw.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere here. Great WiFi and lots of outlets to charge your electronics. I like that they also have food in addition to great coffee which you don't see at most coffee places. It's a huge plus that they're open pretty late too! They have a great latte and I'm looking forward to trying their other drinks here!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Xfu9Q3pNK0w1QJ2ESD4Xag.text: Has the BEST house coffee and the pastry selection is amazing!! The coffee cake and vanilla bean cheesecake is by far my favorite

XQowehA-9_t6NndfKk_kHg.text: Hipster vibes, great coffee which is a little pricey (rival to Starbucks), pastry section is awesome! Definitely a local spot, tucked away in the heart of Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rgP9fbQpiRoUD30HaUYPJA.text: This place is amazing, the owners are amazing and the cocktails are incredible!!!!!! Check out the Flagstaff location too!!!

4H5KF-9QdyfkRKCDAPazQA.text: Chill cafe that serves food, pastries, drinks, etc. You order at the register, and when I came around 8am on a Wednesday, there was barely a line. But the cafe already had plenty of people working on their laptops, reading, sippin on drinks, and catching up with friends. So many early birds! I recommend the strawberry pistachio muffin. Good place to study, work, and catch up with friends. Good background noise level and plenty of outlets/tables/chairs/sofas. There's also outdoor seating (not much protection from the sun/heat)!

VIAT5iuiGLbQy7nKoDOTCA.text: I'm only reviewing Lux Central now because I was waiting for the breakfast sandwich to digest. It took 2 weeks, and I'm not kidding.   We stopped here on our way to the airport. We were looking for some good coffee after mediocre cups all week long, and chose Lux Central based on the reviews that raved about their coffee.   This place is hard to find. To find parking, you have to turn down the side of the building, and you'll see their lot. When we got there, the lot was full, so we ended up parking down one of the side streets. Luckily, someone was leaving. This all happened before 11am on a Friday morning.   Their coffee was not good, it was watery and lacked taste. Sure, I'm a bit of a coffee snob, but I was sure anything would taste better than the hotel and resort coffee I had during the week. I was wrong. So wrong. Disappointing.   We ordered 3 breakfast egg sandwiches, 2 without bacon. They forgot one of them, and we had to spend another 10 minutes waiting for it, on top of the 20 we had already waited because it was so crowded. Boo. They only had 1 cook working?  The sandwiches were hot, but they were soaked in cheese and left a rock in my stomach for 2 weeks. My girlfriend couldn't even finish hers.   They have a pretty extensive breakfast menu. Perhaps the other menu items are better, but I think it's pretty hard to screw up a breakfast sandwich.   If you're looking for some good coffee and a breakfast sandwich in a hurry, look elsewhere.

hd1MEWWyr6YTQbXV80Ea5Q.text: Everything was delicious, the service was great, the place always looks clean, and the most amazing thing was the desert and coffee great place to get together with friends or family I totally recommend it

u11frsEw_VpZx3A9vegzQQ.text: I love this place. It's so interesting, but it's also a really great place to study. Can't wait to spend sometime drinking cocktails and Cabernets here over the summer rather than coffee...but the coffee is pretty bomb, so I will likely continue drinking that, too. Definitely worth a visit if you are a tourist, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

arryGg5fp5Q0FZ8eZXn1DA.text: I had the Mac and Chesse and Orange Juice delicious and can't wait to come back. It was my second time to Lux Central and it is always a good time to be there.

8CsNna0zWmZ7TjATOgauNg.text: Back in high school, my friends and I would walk here for coffee after school, and it was always THE hangout spot on Friday nights and weekends. Several years later, I still love this place, and live and die by their house-made chai. I love that it's not artificially sweet, isn't too heavily cinnamon-flavored- it's a good spice blend, and pairs well with alternative milks (they have almond, soy, and coconut!!). The coffee is roasted in-house and even a simple latte is beautiful and perfectly balanced! The drip coffee is also delicious and is a screaming deal considering the quality of the coffee, plus you get free refills! The WiFi is strong, the vibes are good, and the music is super chill. Some yelpers have complained about the music being too loud, but I think it's just the right volume so you won't overhear your neighbor's conversation, and can work without your thoughts drifting too much.  The food is also amazing, and they have great pastries that they bake in-house with options for gluten-free, paleo, and vegan. My one suggestion is to make sure you charge your phone and/or laptop before coming to do your work here because many seating areas are not near outlets so if you plan to spend a few hours here, you might run out of juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

t3BPIavJ2OMCgyid5L_4mw.text: I gave 2 stars purely based on my experience, not on the quality of food and coffee. Baked goods are great. For whatever reason, most of the time that I come in and hear loud talking, it's coming from the staff in the bar area. Today was no exception. but not just loud, but using inappropriate language. I get that the music is loud and you guys are striving for a cool vibe but I don't need to hear you're personal conversation and foul language. I was not sitting at the bar but well across from it, where you order the food. Initially, I thought it was a loud group and then when I looked up it was the staff.  I know I have to deal with public customers, but staff should be held to a different standard. The other reason for two stars is because every time I'm here there are flies all over the place. I'm constantly flicking them away from my hair. Maybe it's my shampoo but it's really annoying.

bmv10MMAXotvSWMBMAtQSA.text: This was one of my favorite spots in Phoenix! What's not to love? It's unique in the fact that it's part coffee spot, part bakery, part bar, and part restaurant, all rolled into one! So versatile! I can say that I participated in all of the above.   The coffee is delish and their pastries are great! They make everything right there which is always a bonus. The mac n cheese is TO DIE FOR! Seriously, don't go without trying! Their alcoholic drinks were also unique and super tasty.   The environment is super fun, sometimes they even have a DJ there mixin' some beats! There's tons of amazing art on the walls, and they even have a projector and put games and whatnot up to watch. You can tell that the staff is proud to be a part of something so special. They were also so friendly and willing to make a suggestion.   Whether you have work to do, want to grab a bite to eat, or wind down with a nice drink, stop by Lux, they got it all!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FV1b3BOZco6stI4RVx0X0g.text: Best expresso ever!  Tasty treats, craft cocktails, yummy food. Place to people watch. Take your laptop (and headphones). Very friendly, high energy, always busy.

pWgwQMAIKZpmaYQ8pOOSdw.text: My wife and I have been looking for a coffee shop without the banker hrs. When we found this place recommended by this site, we weren't expecting much. But when we found it and saw it! We loved it. Trying to find it at night was a little tricky because there wasn't a huge sing or any real life in the front. Everything was in the back including the entrance. This place is very relaxed and every part of this coffee shop has its own little taste of individuality. The major plus was in the back where the big screen tv is at... friendly staff, great music, free WiFi and it was just an AWESOME experience. My wife and I will coming back to this place and we don't live close to here either, but the food and coffee is worth the 25 minute drive here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h71WHyPJzB3C0wNqyRIIEg.text: This cafe is complex beast. It is bustling, offers interesting seating arrangements, and a list of unique concoctions/food items - all of which would make this cafe a wonderful place to go with a group of friends. I will say their home-made cream is AMAZING! With all that aside. This location has become a tourist attraction which means it floods with people during the weekends. Parking is a challenge and seating can also be scarce. This is not your hide-in-a-corner-and-study cafe. The music and ambiance forces those interested in studying/reading to put on headphones and escape. Overall - good for those looking to socialize in a busy cafe but no so great for those interested in being productive.

TozoDlzzFxjo33-lF3ZKCw.text: I love Lux. I've been coming for two years, the coffee has always been amazing. The whip cream is homemade and so delicious. I love the pops of color and artsy/urban look it embodies inside. But really I LOVE LOVE LOVE the pesto & chicken mac and cheese. SO delicious!! the vegan donuts are amazing too. Nothing bad to review yet.

jYFFn31pR-zdS6BmUtPUng.text: I have so much to say about this place but I would rather you just go. It's very unassuming to the point you may think you are walking into an old abandoned warehouse or somewhere but once inside you find some of the best home grown coffees, fresh baked pastries and desserts and best bar with the coolest bartenders. The vibe is hang all day and anyone is welcome with a sometimes dj even during the day and free WiFi.  I come for breakfast and get the quiche they always have at least 3 options that's my fav breakfast dish but they have a bunch of hot stuff. The macaroni is the best in town. That's my word. And if your feeling fancy fancy add veggies to it. I sometimes just stop in and grab a macaroni it's a healthy portion too so you can share. Yesterday I popped in for afternoon cocktails and had the Black Manhattan it was delish. I'm just always satisfied. The playlist was on point yesterday too. I'm never here less than 2 hours because it's a vibe!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-cMZiTi3kHA0FBTsV4ukrg.text: THIS PLACE IS GREAT!!! Food is really good. Place is pretty busy in the morning but it's busy for one reason... They do turn their A/C ON so the temperature is perfect :) you can enjoy a coffee or breakfast. I like it. It was my First visit

eGXd3YAo_BkHSjDZ0vskzQ.text: I've been here a couple times now and I love the ambiance and people are always friendly and social. Seating isn't gauranteed so keep that in mind if you go on a busy night. It has different areas which keeps the intimate feeling despite being a larger place. Drinks are good and there are two patio areas if the weather is nice. It is hard to flag down a bartender and can get pretty crowded when it's busy, also the bathrooms are singles so the line build up on busy nights.

f-pVvUTq-dfUH0ilzfJt4g.text: Honestly I don't understand why the Mac and Cheese is as raved as it is. It's good but I've had better. The real items that stole the show are the cinnamon roll, cookies, and the Velvet Latte. I would get those everyday if it wasn't so much sugar but they taste incredible and both go perfectly together. They have so much variety of menu items and the place is such a unique and spacious cafe. I'll happily go back here as often as I am able to try out more.

zfqrcKYNW5GobtPqztvusA.text: First impression: there was dust bunnies all over the ceilings. Immediately walked out.

aV_jauBPygh5vago55j26w.text: I came to AZ for a wedding from LA and was looking for some delicious breakfast. Other than going around in circles looking for the main entrance, this place is delicious. I had the savory Dutch pancake and honestly, one of my FAV breakfasts ever. This pancake was uuhmazing. The vegetables were sauteed perfectly and the pancake was soft and crispy. Absolutely amazing.

8xixvG2alfuaFrQajurZiw.text: I used to work in walking distance to Lux so I'd frequent it often to grab my morning coffee.  Mornings are insanely busy there and sometimes the line would be long but they keep it moving.  I've only had a few of the bakery items and they don't disappoint.  A bit on the pricey side but still worth a try.    Other Yelpers have mentioned this place being "hipster" and yes, it's soooooooooooo hipster - it's intimidating.  Like I said, I have frequented Lux, almost daily, yet they have not offered me a "punch card" -- the only reason I knew about it was a co-worker told me about it (buy 10, get 1 free, or something along those lines).  Kinda bummed me out cause I like saving money and I've been a frequent customer...  I also order the exact same drink every time yet they don't remember nor do they remember my name (or how to spell it correctly) - which is cool, I get that they aren't mind readers or are supposed to remember who you are or whatevers but still, maybe more customer engagement would be nice.  Just sayin'.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside the bag is a bacon cheddar scone!

dls0uMEKqRn8GdqTT5HQ-A.text: Lux was pretty hard to find at night. The place isn't well lit from the outside and I could not find any large signs to locate this place easily. The parking lot is small and is located at he back so you'll be entering through the back. There are two fairly large dips going from the street to the parking and back to the street so lowered cars should park on the street. It was even hard to clear with a standard car going at parking speed.   The place was packed with lots of students when I visited. There were no empty tables or seats. The line for drinks was about 6 ppl deep but it moved fast. This place serves a wide variety of food and drinks from coffee to wine and from cakes/pastries to cooked meals. This place is a one stop wonder. Get your breakfast lunch or dinner at the same spot.  The handcrafted coffee drinks selection is bigger than many places so you get lots of interesting choices. I had the velvet latte drink in a large size. I love the fact that you can pick larger sizes for a little bit more as opposed to other shops who don't give you that option. The velvet was fairly sweet tasting. I think it'll be better with a little less sweetness or probably an additional shot in this drink would do the trick. The drink tasted ok, not among the best lattes I've had but it was good enough.   3 stars for the drink, 1 star for parking, 5 stars for a wide variety of offerings, and 5 stars for opening real real late. No other places gives you high quality coffee at midnight. Overall 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The coffee zone
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Full kitchen
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The environment

t7ECAthW1mZo-Wz4qeoGuw.text: Had the best Irish coffee here. I am normally not a whipped cream fan, but they make it in house and it was delicious. There was a long line at the coffee bar, and they had a guy coming through the line to get orders started so everyone could be served quicker. The place is pretty big, bigger than I expected, and packed. It's a very hipster/Portland vibe, and I will be going back to try some food and get another Irish coffee!

CeybHbzHbpt8IiBeI4DSxg.text: I've come here often over the years but haven't been for 3 years and checked it out again today. The vibe was less of the impassioned conversation and music I remembered and more like the basement of a college memorial union. This was all fine but the service was not good. The guy at the register was really struggling. He was not friendly or attentive to my questions and kinda flung the tea selection at me. When I chose one, he said they were out of it but looked just a little harder and found it. Next I asked that my gallette (quiche type pie) be heated and he put it in the oven and looked right at me and said, "what can I get you?". When he realized it was still me, he rung me up the wrong amount. I had to correct him and then he dropped some change before giving it to me. Several customers got helped and still no acknowledgement of me waiting for my food. I finally asked someone else and she got me the gallette and she was very nice. It took me a bit to find a seat but then I tried the gallette and it was cold, like the guy at the register forgot to turn it on. I asked the girl who got it for me and she "heated" it again and brought it to me and it was only slightly above room temperature. At this point, I just ate it. It was tasted fine and the girl was nice but overall, the place was struggling.

sUqOvbrDHk85upTn2y8U1A.text: I am upgrading my review of this place after having a caramel latte that was excellent and finding a pink leather couch. Not hot pink, but the color pink of the Caddies that Mary Kay "winners" drove back in the day.  On top of that, the baristas are really nice even if they might be laughing internally, they never let their emotions be seen on their faces, just genuinely sincere baristas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seriously, how do they do it? The latte art is still there and I&#39;m drunk. I mean, I have drunk almost all of it!

LLdj8FitQQ8M_BV4vio3KA.text: I've heard a lot about this place, so I decided to make the trek out to Lux Coffeebar and get some work done. There's a parking lot right next to it with ~15 or so spots. Or, you could street park for free, but it seemed a  bit packed bc the nearby apt residents park there I think. It's in the same vicinity as a pizza place as well.  I slipped inside and it was darker than I imagined it would be. Fairly full - and I went at noon on a Friday. There were tons of pastries and baked goods [~$1.50-4] behind a glass barrier - leading up to a line of people ordering at the cash register. All the workers were so friendly.  I just ordered hot coffee to stay [$2], which comes in a ceramic coffee cup and free refills! The coffee tasted very smooth and not bitter at all.   The seating/table arrangement is very interesting - a combination of regular tables and just armchairs w/ coffee tables and a bar. Lux was also louder than I expected it would be - the music was playing fairly loud in the background, which made everyone else speak over that.  But overall, I would love to come back and try their actual food and sweets.

PZZ2aHaQGNmZvXyu89OQAQ.text: The velvet, their speciality drink was super yummy. My husband tried the quiche and really liked it as well!

8TiYotFwvOMSIRAbwPX6wA.text: When my wife and I are feeling particularly crusty, we like to make the drive to Lux.    Any given time you go to Lux you should expect a few things:  First, an insane amount of people crammed in to every nook and cranny of this eclectic space. People from all walks of life line up to get their coffee.  Seats are insanely difficult to come by.  People smell bad many times, and everyone is very occupied with what they are doing. The DJ in the corner is playing some strange granola-y music that you've never heard but makes you feel cool just listening to it.  Atmosphere is ON POINT and LIT and all that.   Whoops, what really should have been first was the insane parking situation.  There are rarely spots in the lot, so you might have to park on the street, which, really I would recommend first since the lot is a bit toxic (last time I squeezed into a spot there I was greeted with a nice note filled with expletives from my parking neighbor talking about how he should have scratched my door, etc. for parking so close to him).   Really, these two first points just add to the appeal of Lux, because it makes it feel that much more urban.  The coffee is great here.  The light roast is on point.  However, you haven't lived until you've asked for some "whip" in your coffee.  Just do it.  (My aunt always asks for a "'skosh of whip" and is known as the skosh lady for that reason).  My only gripe with this part Lux is the fact that an "iced coffee" costs like $4 or something insane like that.  I think they just pour a double shot of espresso over ice, but really that is an insane price.  It's tasty, but I'd almost rather get hot coffee and ask for a cup of ice.....  The pastries and baked goods are great and there is always an assortment to choose from.  They also have a full breakfast and lunch menu and everything I've had is great. I've vowed to my wife that one day I will splurge and spend my savings account on the NY Strip and eggs menu item.   Anyways, Lux is awesome, and if you don't like it you're probably wrong, because it's the type of place that you should like even if you don't like it.  Mostly because they have identity and understand what they are.  I think that's cool.

Hy-TJSSP8uVnHWlIWMMv_w.text: Favorite place for coffee and breakfast! The Carmel Latte with Almond Milk is Amazeballs and the vanilla yogurt with fruit and granola is great too if you're in to that sort of thing.

JAUXSyt2KSZHhDLRwaNLoQ.text: 1500 reviews...I don't know what I can say that hasn't already been said.  Excellent biscuits and gravy and I crave their light roast with whipped cream. Wonderful pastry selection...I haven't had anything that I wasn't impressed with.  Parking lot is small so if you must park on the street, please pay attention to the street signs.

N_vabpUgcqk02qRVrH4iVw.text: Lux is my favorite breakfast/coffee shop in Phoenix. Everything on the menu is super delicious and filling!  For coffee I love sweet and milky, so I get an iced velvet with extra velvet (basically an extra sweet white mocha). I love them so much I wish their iced cups were even bigger! But another large to go works too  ;) Oh and don't ever forget to ask for their homemade whipped cream!! SO GOOD!  The ambience inside varies on where you sit (couch, bar, back rooms), but either way you'll feel so relaxed and hip. They do get pretty busy, and although it has never happened to me, I imagine sometimes there isn't anywhere to sit.  For breakfast, I typically order the Aunt Gladys. It is SO much value on one plate!! One big stack of hash browns, scrambled eggs, bacon, topped with some delicious salsa! It's super filling and I can't rave enough about the quality of the bacon. It's a tender belly pork bacon and once you try it TRUST ME you'll want to find out where to buy for home!  I have yet to try enough of their famous case items but I'm working on that ;) Lookout for updated reviews!  Bottom line -- if you're anywhere near central, or are like my friends who are willing to take a 30 + minute drive, definitely come in here for a coffee, pastry, or full on meal! You can never go wrong with Lux!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Left: Biscuits &amp; Gravy + Sausage. Right: Aunt Gladys {Breakfast Only}
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced Velvet {Extra Velvet}. The best!!!

VFjF9wP4rOIvC0ioKJzB-w.text: best spot in phoenix, almost entire staff is under 25 and they kill it! always got Pellegrino stocked up. If you're looking for a nice place to hangout, do homework, read a book, meet new people, this is the place to be.

NG454PMyxWSPN6oNlYxgDg.text: Being my first time back in years I was expecting mind blowingly good coffee. My first time I ordered a large hot Americano and it was delicious, just done to perfection, this was 3 years ago when I went 5 miles out of my way to try this place out. Today, I went back with a good friend of my who raves about this place all the time!! And ordered  a large hot White raspberry mocha, it just tasted like every other WRM I've tried before. It was pretty good and I will be back just to try different things if I'm in the area  but I wouldn't go out of my way to get coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White Raspberry mocha! It&#39;s good, but definitely not one of the best, or even close to being the best.

tFQoULxc9wQsYPkUu8JvBA.text: LOVE LUX!  This is one of my favorite breakfast and coffee restaurants! My friend and I love coming to LUX catch up and enjoy the atmosphere. The service is great and the drinks/food is fresh. The first time I ordered the biscuits and gravy with an iced velvet...AMAZING! I haven't been to another breakfast restaurant that makes biscuits and gravy to literally perfection, and I am very critical on biscuits and gravy! The second time I visited Lux I ordered the biscuits and gravy again with a fried egg on top and a hot velvet. Once again...so amazing! While we were eating they were squeezing oranges and the smell encouraged me to get an orange juice to go. And that is how orange juice is supposed to taste! I can't wait to go back for mimosas next!! This is one of my favorite places and I will keep coming back...and so should you! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy with a fried egg on top and the hot velvet! Yes please!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh squeezed orange juice. This is how OJ is supposed to taste!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy with the iced velvet! Mmm!

1F_f1U52Ufdf67XM0-DxLA.text: Great Place! Unique!  Fun Too! The cocktails are so pretty and delicious and their food is the best comfort food!!!!  I make time to go every time I'm in Phoenix!!!!

yaBf0rVDrzqCk6M-ZXnuhg.text: When in Cenpho it's definitely a must go! It's not often I'm in central Phoenix but when I am Lux is my go to coffee spot! Open until 2am, serving coffee until midnight, morning, noon or night this is the place to be! It's relaxed atmosphere makes it the perfect place to grab a corner, sip a coffee or tea, have a cocktail, a bite to eat, a quick treat, work, study, or to just hang out with friends. The coffee is made to order served and designed with flare, feels like a toasty warm hug in a cup! The black and white is my absolute favorite! Even when ordering the to go cups they've taken time to add their foam design flowers or hearts, good to the last drop it's coffee made with love! Add one of their delicious baked goods with plenty of varieties to choose from(loved the blueberry white chocolate cookies) including vegan & gluten free and you're tastebuds will be in hipster heaven! I have yet to really eat their food, except for the amazing Mac N Cheese with jalapenos & bacon, it's comfort food with a kick! I love everything about this place, I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful day in Cenpho
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Double the Love!
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A little Lux love to go!

jMzqaRXrhwup6w8DBRs9Cw.text: This is a place I come to every time I'm in Phoenix. They have pink couches when you first walk in and I would steal them in a heartbeat. You wait in line to order your drink, then food if you'd like any. There are pastries, donuts, breakfast items, etc. There's a bar in the back where you can order mimosas (or anything really), which are gorgeous and worth the $9. You can snake your way around back if you'd like a more quiet atmosphere.

37AEhDoOLvwuwlYhQLfmAg.text: Found this place on Yelp and fell in love. I always go at least once on the weekend. I love stopping here before or after a show at the crescent ball room. Mac n Cheese is good and so are the desserts . Love the mix-logistic , I usually avoid mix drinks but will drink them all day long here. The type writer are extra cute to.   I always bring anyone visiting from out of state here and coworkers.

PTd1DtEL57qs9PrtuO_fIw.text: Lux is my favorite place to go drink a coffee, enjoy a fresh pastry and write away on my computer. It has a pretty retro-Hipstery feel to it. I've been going here since I was in High school, since it was across the street from my school, ha! Love it.

kTf6upu1iOkztLJedXctBQ.text: By far one of the best local coffee shops I have visited in the valley. Their mocha was creamy and flavorful, and left me wanting more. I have permanently added this coffee shop to my favorites list.  Thank you!

sPBnc6vm7AfUeROcwk0evQ.text: I tried to write this review several times and it was declined. Bottom line: dirty dishes/silverware/glassware. Food was not up to par even when compared with Denny's food. Service is inconsistent, the service I received didn't meet any of my expectations. Came in with a date and had to leave due to the experience. Never again.

3tEKKM-dNTJZNAbONxJYgg.text: Lux Central, literally the place to check out! Even if you aren't into coffee pastries or cool study places or even need a quick run to the bathroom! Lux central has it all an amazing bakery and barista team and also fabulous cocktail drinks by there wonderful bartenders! All craft beer and never before heard specialty top shelf spirits! Lux provides quality service and food for the locals and visitors coming thru Phoenix. I have not tried any main dishes but they are well known and yes I have only tried the Mac and cheese with jalapeno bacon! It's the best Mac and cheese ever, therefore I might say! Coffee is wonderful, pastries are fantastic also fan favorite is the pop tarts all homemade! So let's talk about the interior it's a very dim and may look like it's packed and cluttered but they do also have different rooms, wifi everywhere so for all your exploring needs! It is in a hidden street but your gps will definitely lead the way! But if you are in central Phoenix, make sure you come by! Stay hungry and cool Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac n Cheese x Bacon x Jalapeños *9.00*
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cucumber Gin Drink
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Specialty Gin Drink

lQrihUWWxPKdsk_17Hii5Q.text: Lux, lux, lux. What can be said that hasn't been said by *checks the count* haha, 1000+ folks!?   Well, not much I suppose. It is not a coffee shop you go to for \just\ coffee. The ambiance and quality of the place seeps into every choice made here. They serve hot food, amazing pastries, great coffee and bespoke adult beverages. The staff are friendly [though admittedly some don't come across that way; more a consequence of the insane business and crushing throng they have to deal with].

sgxzoVyGP_DlcMy_1J1rkA.text: I felt like I was in an episode of Portlandia.  We headed here on a Friday night for coffee/drinks after dinner at Panne Bianco.  I headed to the bar, hoping for a fancy drink.  When I asked for a menu, I was told that they did mixology style drinks.  I still waited for something else...but that was all I was going to be told.  After about 10 more minutes of discussion and questions regarding whether or not I would drink raw eggs (I don't even usually cook eggs, let alone drink a raw one, but sure, I'll try something new...), the mixologist had an idea of what she could make for me.  Overall, the drink was fine.  I wouldn't want to order another and was glad when it was finished so I could stop drinking it.  It kind of tasted like a Christmas tree & pine sol.  And had raw egg yolk in it.  I'd skip the bar portion here - or just get wine/beer.    On another note, the coffee & cookies were great!

XWhB3a45dTfk1BDHAs6QfQ.text: Looooove it!!! Just go, get anything, you'll be happy! It's always packed but they get through the line quick.  The baked goods are phenomenal!

xJ2kzI_xB_qkPg_lg__lvA.text: Very eclectic place to get an artisan cup of coffee in downtown Phoenix. Once you walk in, you see a barrage of students with laptops and cups of coffee. The place is usually packed when I go, so I opt for the patio on most visits. I normally get a black coffee and add the half and half myself. The menu has a lot of options--from espresso served 4 ways to an Arnold Palmer--so options are endless. Customer service is attentive and fast for Phoenix.   I'm also a sucker for packaging and branding and I love the cute design of their menus. Will be trying their breakfast next time.

r8l-LnfYgopm25OfUUDiOw.text: This has been my go to coffee shop since moving here. But after this afternoon, I'm compelled to leave a review all because of Sammy.   Sammy, oh Sammy. He has been amazing to my friends & me. Not stingy with cocktail ingredients, knows how to have a GENUINE conversation, basically makes you feel like you're the only person in the world that matters.   My friends were craving Micheladas & he made it flawlessly. & theeeen, he proceeded to make a Thirsty Crow that exceeded any of my expectations. Because we're from the Bay, my sister was craving a Philz mint mojito. He didn't know what that was & when we gave him the basic idea, LAWD HAVE MERCY. This guy can mix.   For lack of better terms, I.can't.even.

FBnWHktvuWl27YFRqvbiJw.text: There aren't many of us out there, but I'm Luxy enough for this to be my neighborhood coffee stop.  Now don't go telling people my dirty little secret; but truthfully, coffee isn't really my 'cup of tea'. You know what is my cup of tea? Tea! and Earl Grey takes top billing. Earl really knows his tea, and Lux has that too. With a few minute walk, bike, or scooter ride from my front door to Lux, the wife and I like making this a frequent stop for a hot beverage or cold, people watching, dessert, or snack outing.   While here, I wouldn't be surprised to see one of the top billed Yelping regulars, out of town coffee pilgrims, or Juan Valdez himself. I'm told by my buddies and my girl the coffee here is just that good.  Lux has a menu of fresh baked pastries, goodies, and other breakfasty items, like eggs, veggies, and bacon. There's also a full bar back there for those of you who venture past the coffee and pastry line. Careful though, 'cause Lux can get packed during morning, lunch and evening hours with most of the prime spots filled up already by gaggles of laptopians doing a work from "home" type of thing.  Now I've not personally worked from a coffee shop before, but I sometimes wonder how much 'work' is actually getting done. Maybe people just claim to work and are really just hanging out for the uber cool ambiance or the free wifi. I think Mr. Valdez did have is iPhone out the other day trying to connect up to the Yelp app.   The walls here are spotted with local artistry that is on a seemingly endless rotation. Come back in a week or so and you might find something new hanging up there. If your a light rail fan, pop off at Campbell and Central and stop on in!  Happy Yelping Phoenix! It's time for today's caffeine fix.

qOigka0HhsFdRxD9PwS7nQ.text: YES. I come to phoenix on business often and every time I HAVE to stop here. They have really good lattes. perfect foam. perfect flavor. not too bitter, not too watery. just right!

g_zRnlbBM3k7UKJChW0xfw.text: Overhyped hipster place. No where to sit and it wasn't even that great. Coffee sucked

KpsoCsHNSLHHsPVWdxXQEg.text: Tried this place out for drinks and dinner. My Moscow Mule came in its own Moscow Mule cup! It was super delicious and hard to resist a second one, so I didn't!   Dinner menu isn't extensive however the burger I ordered (minus onions) was unbelievably awesome. It bursted with flavor and made it difficult to resist a second one, which this time I did resist :)   Our servers were very gracious and accommodating.   I purchased a blonde brownie on the way out. It was pretty tasty but would have been better  if I had waited til I got home to eat it. I needed a glass of milk and it needed about 20 seconds in the micro!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moscow Mule cup!

3A6bJIvD9nRI4zdZiQCN7w.text: Excellent space to relax, reflect, read, talk. As chip as it gets. Excellent coffee and specialty coffee. The service is relaxed but shows fantastic attention to detail. Hats off to the baristas.  The pastry options are numerous and delectable.   Wifi works pretty well while you lounge in the varied spaces and listen to the music, occasionally manned by a DJ.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalapeño bacon mac and cheese! Tasty and spicy!

2YxTBziBx2Dnkn9j-qPqew.text: I was in love with Lux since they opened. Over the past year it has taken a nosedive. The coffee is outstanding and food is good but, breakfast is much better then dinner. The menu used to be imaginative but is now dull. They used to employ a chef now there are just cooks (who try extremely hard). The cooks are great but need guidance. With that said, the mixed drinks are outstanding (along with the beer selection). The staff work their hearts out and appear to enjoy their jobs. Very friendly folks.   The real disappoint is the appearance. The furniture is falling apart, upholstery shredded and it has a dirty feel.  I mean OMG a homeless shelter is in better shape!!!!!! They use the walking space to store food. If you are in a wheelchair forget it. They have packed the tables, chairs and logs so close together that even on crutches you are risking additional injury. If there is a fire your life is in serious danger because one fire exits is blocked and the large heavy door to the "patio" maybe locked. And, I believe, at times, it far exceeds legal occupancy. The ADA and the City should send inspectors.  Come on owners, I realize profit is king. However, please don't fall into the typical pattern of a great and amazing start followed a year or so later by mediocre dinners and no concern about keeping the place in at least good condition. With the money you appear to be making I think you can afford an upholsterer.

myq0XGG8mDo12rCDhpqUmg.text: I went for my first visit to Lux on a Wednesday morning at 8am.  Apparently I'm one of the few who had never been.  The place is packed.   But even with a line, the service was efficient.   Seating is "family style" - you sit a shared tables.  My latte was great and came with a leaf illustrated in the foam.  (Now these barista's deserve a tip jar!)   I ordered a breakfast sandwich and...I couldn't resist...I also tried their cranberry biscotti (I loved it!).  Careful...finding Lux is a bit confusing.   I actually drove by the store-front the first time.   Lux is located NEXT to Paine Bianco and Lux shares their parking lot.

YwyqZg1FYkTXoYBr5tyN5w.text: Very Uniquely Great!!!  Very calming and friendly, I had the vanilla latte, and oh boy was that good!! Fully bold and perfect body!!! I loved the foamy top and the nice leafy design to it!! A Must try!!

xJ8YzboHRijA3Lq-JLxrKA.text: Lux is almost too cool for me, as if it were a club only for the initiated. But once past that, this place is everything a coffee joint and cocktail lounge should be: completely unique, and serious about their business.  I told the bartender I was looking for an interesting cocktail, he asked me what I usually like to drink, and then he told me to take a seat--he would bring me something I would like. That's confidence, from a guy who knows his craft.  My cocktail and coffee were excellent, and though I didn't fit in to the crowd very well, I did not feel rushed or unwelcome. One of my very favorite places.

R92BDao6MdGvCe3xqY9t0g.text: I have been here too many times to count ...the seating can sometimes be limited but every pastry, drink and food plate I have had has been delicious. The iced coffee is one of my favorites and they have a table set up with different sweetners and half & half to make the taste to your liking!

DsB66g-PPD5NMXNLUl09pQ.text: Price point was a little bit high for what it was (portion to price ratio).  Food was delicious though and the drinks were good and the the bartender really knew her shit.  It was packed and everybody there was oh so cool and hip.  I'd go back if I was in the area (maybe).

V9ppdEhPxmWvifwT6r2bzw.text: Baked eggs are beyond delicious. Seriously, try them.

YTb1R6ZUzuMv7cGFyGxcWw.text: Swung by here while waiting for a late afternoon flight. Good iced coffee, plenty of fresh ingredients by the look of the grill (surrounded by fresh vegetables). Eclectic atmosphere - reminded me of one of our coffee bars in Austin. Free wifi was very fast and the service was friendly. Seating was limited but other than that, no complaints!

kDx2-qMmIwUvehdSz6_6Ow.text: Fun, urban atmosphere.  The coffee drinks are great, but my favorite is the chai latte is my favorite!  The treats and snacks are always good!  Lots of great seating and different areas for getting work done, relaxing with a book, catching up with friends, watching a big game, or falling in love!  My fiance took me here for our first coffee/tea date, and we have a few other friends whose relationship sparked talking over coffee at Lux!!

4zBDo3etE37zEm0EeZAa5Q.text: My friend and I woke up this morning craving croissants and she suggested I stop by the Lux to and buy three.   I stood in line and looked over the baked goods but did not see any croissants. As I waited, I watched a young, skinny, hipster wearing a trucker hat taking a middle-aged woman's drink order. His eyes rolled several times as he scribbled on the paper cup. As he set it on the back counter for the barista he turned around and faced me. It was my turn to order.    I went to college in Portland, Oregon and live near Hawthorne and 39th where hipsters run the streets like rats in a Mumbai sewage ditch. All the cliches, the tights jeans, smoking Lucky strikes, bicycling everywhere. The predictable clothes and messy hair? Fine. What I can not handle and the reason I am sitting here writing this review (with croissant crumbs all over my shirt) is the attitude.  I know hipsters and the games the play.   I asked the guy if they had croissants and he looked quizzically at me. After a pause he told me that they did have them earlier in the morning. Another pause and he told me he would check to see if there were more.   He then stood there staring at me for maybe 8 seconds. I decided to play the game and stared back. We were locked in eye contact for maybe 8 seconds. He then sneered and found the croissants.   He was very questioning of taking them to-go and seem very confused and disgusted while putting them in the to-go box.   The young woman at the cash register never made eye contact and, like the croissant guy, looked befuddled and annoyed by my standing at the counter and ordering croissants.
