Swiping my card was a a chore for her and handing it back to looked arduous for her.   As I drove home I felt judged, deflated, and angry. The only thing that made me feel better was the croissant. I warmed it up in the oven and covered it in butter.   Good croissants. A-hole staff.

kQRyDFdC253uP50wTyuHlw.text: Lux is great. My drink of choice is the Iced Velvet and it's always good. You can chill out here by yourself or meet up with a group and it's awesome either way. I'm not super familiar with the food but anything that I've ordered in the past has been fine. Personally, I cannot study or work here because I get too distracted with how many people come in and out but that's just me. The staff here but they are all nice enough and they make consistently good stuff.   One thing that seems to annoy me every time, however, is their stamp card promotion, or lack-thereof (you get a free drink after buying 10). It is totally worth it if you go there often. It might sound dumb, but I always feel like I'm inconveniencing someone to either stamp my card or get a new one. Then, when I get my free drink, it seems like I'm a horrible person for using a system that they have available. If you're a frequent patron of Lux and had no idea they even had these cards available, I'm not surprised. They don't advertise it for some reason. I was going there for years before I found out it was even available. I just happened to be eavesdropping on the the guy in front of me in line. Then when I asked the cashier how long they'd been doing it for, the condescending, teenage, hipster cashier said, "Uhh, like, forever. It's been years or something. Where have you been?" Hey, thanks. I've actually been here. Cool response though. That was super helpful. Maybe it's a stupid pet peeve of mine, but I feel like you should let your customers know if you have something to help them out. Maybe I'm just not cool enough though.

BWBgBnKxa2dV812m0QCCrA.text: Long gone are the days when Lux would have something called Tango Tuesdays, which were Argentine tango lessons being taught right in this here coffeeshop.  That's right. Tango lessons.   A bunch of chairs and tables would be moved back to create an ideal milonga space. Depressed Mode would fade out  for the dramatic strains of Astor Piazzolla. And this random couple would appear out of nowhere and start dancing in the middle of the room while the other 4 people sitting around (me included) would continue working on their laptops or studying. This would go on for about an hour. Every Tuesday.   That was circa 5 years ago, and I never saw anyone else ever get up to tango. Which is probably why it eventually stopped. A missed opportunity, in hindsight. I could have made major headway in Phoenix's numerous tango halls. Alas.  Today, Lux is even more bustling than it used to be (sometimes overly so). A full-on Apple army on every table and couch inside, while actual human interaction (aka talking to your friend) is mostly reserved for the outdoor tables.   But long gone are the days of being treated by an oftenly complained about surly cooler-than-thou barista. Don't get me wrong. There are still cool baristas working there. But service has been consistently excellent and friendly for quite a while now to every customer that walks in. They also still make great coffee product (caffeinated soy lattes and decaffed Americanos are my usuals nowadays - and apart from one bad mishap years ago, the espresso is always done just right and the soy is never curdled or burnt).  Doing work or studying here - well, that more or less depends on you and whether you can shut out the loud music and continuous cacophony. For me, at times it gets to be too much and I eventually pack up and move to somewhere quieter, and yet other times it all just clicks and I plow right through my work despite all the noise. So take that for what you will.  But as for the music, regardless of the noise level, there's always great stuff on board. And sometimes the most random. Most recent example: a steady stream of Hot Chip tracks followed by "Party All The Time" by one Eddie Murphy. Sadly, I was the only one in the entire place old enough to recognize and truly appreciate this unexpected masterpiece. But it served its purpose.  As Lux continuously does, a longstanding gem of a coffeehouse in the expanses of the Arizona desert.   It may no longer have a lone couple awkwardly dancing tango in its midst, but it does serve a pre-bust and pre-Pluto Nash Eddie Murphy crooning overhead for your listening pleasure.  It's the important things.

62wzWFtPW7__Agqlr8WhBw.text: This place is incredible. The coffee is great but the bar in the back does not just serve drinks. They are mixologists and take time to make you a PERFECT mixed drink. This bar is not about the alcohol but the education. I learned a lot just from ordering one cocktail. You will not be dissapointed!

_y23nLQcnHN_ZBLn6vZT8g.text: I've been here so many times, and I continue to come back often. The only way I can write a review now having been here so many times is with pros and cons.  Pros:  -The bakery items- The fresh croissants, cookies, pies and all sorts of tasty morsels are always made form scratch and will satisfy any sweet tooth craving. -The food- at 5:30 every night the dinner menu goes up. There are always a few staples like the mac and cheese, and also new and local daily creations that are every bit as delicious. I have never had a meal here that I didn't thoroughly enjoy.  -The bar- Prices are average, but they do know how to make some damn good drinks. Also they have a decent wine selection. -Coffee and tea- they hand roast all their beans in house. Coffee and espresso are yummy and strong. They have large cups for drinks and have a great selection of hot teas. I'd recommend the toasty almond one.    Cons: -The space- I love the cool hodgepodge/industrial look about the place but a coffee bar, restaurant, and bar all together makes the place seemed a little cramped with storage in all the halls and nooks. Trying to scoot by people without hitting them with your bag is normal.  -The crowds- Avoid coming on the weekends or at dinner time if you are not by yourself. There WILL be HUGE lines and no seats for groups. I have stopped bringing people here for brunch, its just not worth it. Thats how crowded it can get. This is not as big of a problem is you are just coming alone, there will always be a single seat somewhere.  -The seating- there is so much furniture in this place as they try to accommodate more patrons. The bar seats are shoulder to shoulder. And you could be sitting on anything from a super low looks like its from the 50's couch, to a upright plastic reading chair, or a picnic table bench. And all of the furniture is becoming dilapidated from all of the traffic: torn, stained, sagging. Its not that appealing. Outlets are scarce.   Overall I still love the food and drink, and that keeps me coming after work, but I avoid the high traffic times. I like their late hours but find it more crowded. I would still definitely recommend checking the place out, on your own, on a weekday, around happy hour, and you should have no problem finding a seat/outlet, and enjoying some food and beverages.

K5ONFPR-5WNNWXqipmQJmw.text: I don't know where to begin! Everything is so yummy ! It's just a tad bit pricey so I do not recommend as an every day coffee shop more of twice a month treat!   I feel like royalty when I eat breakfast here

bkNGAxR2BO9tAZL7ty5NZg.text: I'm a huge fan of Lux, Great hipster atmosphere, everything on the menu is great.  Make sure you bring your MacBook or iPad and you'll fit right in.  The place is not very big and its usually busy so you might not be able to find a place to sit right away.

tJM0MiuQDnePx4cKfYuDeA.text: Total Northwest vibe. Soft woods mixed with industrial metal, high quality coffee drinks, pastries, quiche and hot food that are high quality and last but least a well-dressed, friendly, and professional staff.  We sat and had coffee and various breakfasts, and hung out w/ no pressure to leave. Looking around I am already planning on heading back for a cocktail and/or glass of win later because the selection behind the bar looks nice.

aTg7yB0dP5T6lafLOcwb3w.text: Why I (initially) gave Lux 2 stars:  -Definitely not the most intuitively arranged coffee shop I've ever been to. The space offered for your 5 minute wait for your cup of coffee is cramped. -I've only been there four times, but three of those four were unpleasant experiences. They either messed up my drink, forgot to give me my food, or served me improperly prepared (very bitter) coffee. The last time I visited (my 4th time, in total) I ordered a decaf americano, and I was pleasantly surprised. After last time, I'm going to give them another chance. -Parking. Is. A. Nightmare.  On the plus side, they have really good dinner foods (mac n cheese) and an (overpriced) wine bar, if you're into that scene/old enough to enjoy that.  Why I updated my review to include a third star:  I visited an old friend for coffee, and she insisted we go to Lux, because she really likes it there. So, we went, and I got a simple cup of their light roast coffee (only $2. Not horribly expensive.) and was, once again, pleasantly surprised. It was smooth enough to drink without cream, milk or sugar.  It was a Friday at lunch time, and it wasn't so busy. There was room to sit down, room to talk, room to wait for my cup of coffee without worrying about stepping on others' toes. It was my first actual /nice/ experience at Lux, and I'm happy about it.

KiK5DsaBnMf_4BE0e5rX5A.text: Lux continually makes some of the best espresso drinks in the Valley in my opinion. Their lattes and mochas are something I drive over 15 miles for every week.   There are a lot of other options when it comes to Phoenix, but Lux has a great pastry case to match the coffee. Their lemon tarts, coffee cakes and giant cookies are always good. Only problem is that sometimes the place can get really busy on the weekends and there's nowhere to sit inside. That can be a problem when its 110 F out, but if you go at night there's generally seating available.  As for everyone talking about the "hip" scene it attracts...ya there is a lot of that sometimes but everyone is friendly and it's a fun place to people watch at the very least.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ylkuX8hUwFn7ac-DPwWCuQ.text: Best coffee shop in Phoenix, hands down. Food is excellent, coffee is great, atmosphere is perfect for the variety of needs one coffee-goer might have and the bar has a great selection of  well thought-out beverages. This is where you go to enjoy quality food/beverages, so if you don't appreciate that (and aren't willing to spend a couple of extra bucks for it) this is not your place. The decor is fabulous and I love that they show all the soccer games in the back room. Try their breakfast & a mimosa- it won't disappoint.

VXyKTReAXmy1lWjT7APd4A.text: I have been coming here for six years and i have to say I'm not as impressed as I used to be. It seems that Everytime I come in my coffee is more and more. A large latte is now 5.75, which is almost as much as a cocktail which is 10. The coffee has become so overpriced I do not see myself coming back unless it changes. Furthermore the owner is incredibly arrogant and only ever greets those who are drinking alcohol. Kinda rude considering their coffee cost more than some of their drinks. I will stay that for a coffee shop it's way overpriced. As for food. The breakfast is good, but again overpriced and not as great as places like postinos. Where they thrive is their drinks and pastries. The pastries are, overpriced, but delicious and the bar service is incredibly during nights. You go in and say what you enjoy drinking and they'll often make you a custom drink according to your likes and dislikes. They almost always give drinks on the house and they are fairly priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two whiskey derby drinks custom made to our preference
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs  Aunts breakfast  Breakfast sandwich

FSPuy_iV2rC9mV1ZEXVuiQ.text: This place is amazing. Everyone I bring loves the electic style and thoughtful segments of the place. There's a bakery, coffee shop, bar, study room, and multiple lounge areas.   The staff is friendly and helpful. They even make custom baked goods for you within 24 hours. Really cool place with cool people.

103H90nvuPgx054KaUP7YQ.text: Thank you Yelp! Fell into this place after reviews.... Want to pack it in my suitcase to bring it home. Great coffee and bake gods to die for! Glad I still have a few days here

oMuaoB8vokhkR4pN3WRSBg.text: Fantastic customer service with quick response to our emails was wonderful.  The BMW drivers that picked us up at the airport and hotel were very professional, warm and welcoming.  We felt right at home.  The car was beautiful and had 2 cold bottles of water awaiting us with the airport pickup.  Also a nice touch since we had flown in from AZ.  We would not hesitate at all to use this company again when we go back to CA

osHZc_Vhy2zhvkZMHoQVvA.text: I think the experience has hugely improved since they expanded. Staff are much more friendly and helpful, too.

1hXZvIg-v6-O5b-KtfMBkQ.text: One of the best places in Phoenix to do...anything.  Date night?  Studying?  Catching up with old friends?

VLw-SCEN7IFiLEL0kX-MCA.text: Went to Streets of New York for the first time and was very impressed.  Service was excellent......our server was delightful.  The A/C was on and my food stayed very hot until the very last bite and it was delicious...I had the appetizer of meat balls.   Can hardly wait to go back.

uhKcwdMKby4OTyaUlx3ofA.text: Just absolutely love this place.  Everything that I have eaten here is delicious.  I highly recommend the sweet Dutch pancake that is filled with fresh berries and whipped cream.  Service is always spot on and the bartenders there always can recommend a great cocktail.

fJMTnlOp7-9dyiydiaTv5A.text: As a reviewer below said: "As much as I love Lux, I'm kinda glad that it's not closer to my house, otherwise they might have all of my money."  So far it is the BEST coffeebar I've been to in the Sun Valley, not just the atmosphere or their chic and comfy couches, but because of the coffee bean quality. Sipping their aromatic coffee (either Velvet aka White Mocha, Latte, or just black coffee) is enough to make the rest of my day better!

Z8R0uUearaAV2dOxfKdLsg.text: Fly to the Northwest and get some lessons. You don't have to sacrifice customer service for cool. Being new here from Seattle I know my standards are probably too high but the coffee shop is the 21st century pub. The idea that a cross section of community could be in one place is the value a coffee shop adds to community. That old, young, and all the other things that make humans different could come to one place is a pretty great and NOT new idea. I travel a lot, so my kids (15,13, 12) and I have a tradition that has become a pretty important time in their life and a great experience for us. Before I leave on a long business trip we go out late (on purpose) cause my kids think its cool to go out late, to a coffee shop, they usually get a hot chocolate or something and a get a drink, we laugh, drink our favorites, tell stories, I teach some valuable life lesson that they probably don't catch, we post some instagrams, then we go home, they sleep in and I'm gone providing for my family when they wake up.  I am not bothered that this "coffee shop" doesn't serve coffee after midnight. I don't care that its a little hard to find (it added to the adventure) or that it was a little confusing when we walked in where to go or who to talk to (felt like we entered somones private club). What spun me is how we were treated. Lets start with - there was someone who worked there folding napkins who I walked past 3 times and finally had to stop her from what she was doing to find out who to order from, she then gave me a dirty look like I was bothering her and when she saw my kids with me she looked at me like "what the hell are you doing here?" I knew this was True when I OVER HEARD HER TALKING TO A COWORKER ABOUT US, AND MY KIDS BEING THERE!  Lux if you don't want kids there, hang a sign. And if your going to talk crap about your customers at least text and and take my money so I don't know it. And if you don't like your job, get a different one.  The only positive, and the reason I gave this 2 stars instead of 1 is I finally got some help from the bartender who was pretty kind.  Terrible first impression.

-XIfCrY5Zybl_j7LuvhC5A.text: Love this place. Best to hang and enjoy a cup of coffee while reading a book.

BG2X7b3LtNxMLv8C46VwMw.text: One of the only coffee bars and speak-easy places that actually works and could fit in phoenix. I love the ability to work here on a Thursday early morning with a fresh cappuccino and a couple days later I can come back on a Saturday night and ask my awesome bartenders (Sasia and or Ben) to make a drink including ingredients I like or dislike, the True sign of a mixologist. The layout is  maze like and you will always find your nook and place to sit and study or sip on that delicious cocktail. More so, their beer selection and wine is on par! I was so surprised, as a vino lover, they had the coveted LIOCO chardonnay, this winery is notorious for only distributing to high quality local places, the only other places in Arizona I know of that have this wine? Are Binkleys (fancy!) and Postinos. The food here is also served late and that is key for someone who is out of work late and needs to do some tidy up work but also catch a delicious dinner (vegetarian friendly as well!). I am so happy to see this place transform form the former next door little coffee shop into something this extrinsic and delicious place on all counts.

Lk1whleRzrT_Kz5zeRvhmw.text: Super relaxed place...Framboise for $7 - sweet and the sweet dutch pancake was tasty!  Loved that the music played homage to the Beastie Boys today...nice touch!

5LaEBvZgANP-WA2LGn1WNg.text: Everything is delicious here, but often just completely overrun--no parking, no place to sit or stand, no internet connection. It's got a strange vibe sometimes, with the coffee shop/ restaurant/ bar thing happening all at once, which can make the place feel like a zoo but provides great people watching.

M6Suq__QXOc_DmRoMa2_Sw.text: You say you want outstanding coffee close to downtown Phoenix?!  Do Ya!---Well let me tell you about this terrific little place called Lux Coffeebar....Just between Indian School and Camelback on Central... This place has what I would like to think the word 'Panache' was named after!  You walk through a very modest door into a world of peace.  Where the people sitting at their laptops (throughout), are the plumage of contentment.  Typing away at cyberworld, and sipping some of the BEST Coffee that is probably brewed in this part of the region of Phoenix!  The beans are roasted on-site, and the flavor of the latte' I had was beyond belief!  So was the texture!---Like silk!  WOW!  I was so bummed that I came during my work lunch-break and couldn't stay longer than 20 minutes or so for my first visit...Not the way I like to roll with such terrific coffee.  I like to chill out and take it all in...Oh well...I will be back! The setting is very comfortable for the lounger that wants to just sit and sip a cup of java and carouse the cyber connections out there.  There are cubby places to sit for all tastes, and the folks there filled most of them!  The motif is very earthy and the lighting is just right.  I gave it four stars instead of five because with such a gift as they have for making and serving some of the best in the industry, they need to have a larger sit-down area or areas to welcome and bless even more guests...+++

ZkTqZJFTTCw0J9uWIobEUw.text: Alright, I can't be too detailed here because I only stayed for about 45 minutes, but I'll do my best.  I don't pretend to be an expert on coffeebars especially since I don't drink coffee, but after living up the street for this place for a few months and always seeing it packed when I'd drive by, I jumped at the chance to check it out when some friends were there earlier today.  I gotta be honest, this place was nuts.  I was confused upon arrival and had to look at my watch to check the time because I thought I'd just walked into a nightclub.  This place was PACKED.  I mean not a seat open at 5:00 on a Tuesday.  Music was blaring inside!  My boss called me from NYC and literally asked me if he was interrupting my bar time because it was so loud.  Anyways, loud (bad) music aside, I still had a good time.  The people watching was fantastic.  Such a wide variety.  I mean you had so many different angles covered.  You had your hipsters typing away on their laptops trying to look very important, the tortured artist at the table next to me feverishly writing in his journal, the section that I can only call the hairdresser's corner because all of their hair was immaculately coiffed and standing about 3 feet high, to my friends who were doing actual work at a table, sending out invoices believe it or not.  And then there was me, jaw gaping open the entire time, obnoxiously staring at everyone around me trying to get my bearings.  Since I did not eat or drink anything, I should probably point out that I will be returning to Lux for the people watching alone.  It was that good.  I'd imagine it would be mildly difficult for me to work here with the loud electronica music blaring in the background, but that's alright, I'm willing to sacrifice work for just a little while longer : )

t0DapN8JfAcneKkgjQfsDQ.text: Went here for a friends birthday! It was pretty casual and a really cool place. They have awesome Jalapeno and Bacon Mac & Cheese! Their lattes were really great too!

Z_Zb82Vsly0JZawB0ucxHQ.text: i love, love, love lux coffee.  can't drink it there as the place is always too packed.  could sit on the front patio but it's tooooo hot right now.  so i take it with me which is fine.  their coffee is the best in the valley as far as i'm concerned (ok the LGO spanish latte is also dang good).    i have learned to embrace the multiple body piercings as part of the extreme coffee deluxe picture.   that coffee, it's enough to melt a girls heart.  the chocolate chip cookies were incredible at one time.  don't know if they still are.  the woman who used to make them had her mother or grandmothers receipe.  as for the rest of their heavenly offerings, haven't had a bad calorie laden snack there yet.

wnIRxUthxu2axOAjXQa8-g.text: When I first discovered Lux I was blown away by the caliber of their coffee, and the really cool building they are located in.  What blew my coffee buzz was the staff informed me that the owner wanted nothing to do with Free Wifi because "he didn't want a bunch of bums mooching on the internet and wasting their seats".  I haven't been here for a year or two. I will definitely check this out again soon, and hopefully they have come to their senses and installed internet access.  UPDATE: A deafening roar of Yelp users has informed me that FREE WIFI does indeed exist at Lux now. We might just have to kick it up a star once I have revisited.

oWzO-dV38-Yz1656Jfw0fw.text: I'm going to skip past the obvious topic of coffee and tell you why the dessert selection at Lux Coffeebar is the best in town.  I almost didn't write this review since I'm at this Phoenix hot spot all the time.  However, I realized something earlier Saturday when I went inside a competitor's store searching for something to satisfy my sweet tooth.    I walked in competitor x, scanned my choices, and walked out.    That's when I made a beeline for Lux.  Hands down, Lux has the best dessert selection around.  Not only is everything made from scratch at this locally owned business, but the quality is outstanding, and in most cases the portions are generous.      Wanna know the best part?  Sometimes the desserts have those crusty edges, you know, like homemade! The chain coffee houses might see this as a flaw - but at Lux the imperfections make this coffee bar perfect.  Lux is across the street from Central High School, just south of the Campbell and Central light rail station,

Xjpi8lqhi3MI1gT51mzIBQ.text: All the points go toward the decor and neighboring shops, really. Service was smile-less each and every time, perhaps because I was dressed like I was, which I hate at coffee shops. F- on soy milk... I can't believe baristas deign to serve something with chunks at the bottom. I know it isn't "bad," but no one customer should incur the penalty of the baristas not having shaken the product properly in the first place. That's a Starbuck's move.   I like the ice water station. Nice idea.

2tsKHPTI3TdKbtYjmvy-7g.text: Visiting our son in Cave Creek and ended up here on a Groupon.  We love Korean and any kind of Asian.  This place has everything we can't get and everything we tried, was awesome.  One thing for sure, these folks aim to please.  Was very happy to find the foods we ate in Okinawa, Korea, and the Kimchee was just like Korea.  Mr J, from Korea seemed very proud of his restuarant.  I ate here 4 times, beacause I wanted some of my friends to try it.  Yakisoba, Pork Bulbogi, Yakimondo (Gyoza) was a great memory of my tours overseas.  This is a must stop when North Phoenix/Scottsdale.  Thanks for the great food Mr J!  I shall return!

WK8riXYTJz5FCveKW5a_VQ.text: Lux is the place in Phoenix (I prefer Cartel in Tempe). Their espresso is excellent, and the majority of their baristas really know how to work it.  Most of them are super nice, too (most notably the very cute Jane who may or may not still work there).    Marked off a star because of the occasional totally indifferent barista (one of the guys in particular, though I refuse to name names), as well as the annoying clientele.  I have attempted to start conversations with fellow customers here, but they just are not having it.  I've decided that I just don't want to spend time in such an unfriendly place, even if the baristas ARE fantastic and cute.

65A_QDh_cVtHLT9IUVmhPg.text: Hipsters, Hipsters, Hipsters everywhere and not a drop of decent coffee. The coffee was mediocre at best. One of the worst iced carmel/vanilla lattes I've ever had. It was in a 16oz cup that costed more then a venti at Starbucks. Was this because of superior quality? Hardly. Hipsters can't make decent cup of joe. Its too mainstream for them. I was in the area, and remember seeing it, so I wanted to give it a try. The atmoshpere was crowded and cluttered. Overall just messy. I feel like I walked into a sweat shop. OH did I mention hipsters? The pastries looked good. But i'd never purchese anything from greasy hipsters without it being FDA approved. And these bitches were making cupcakes in plain view. If I ever were to come back, it would be to simply take pictures of all the patrons and post them at LATFH.com

KwhaxtM_qKdr5ostaRWbDA.text: Super good coffee! Classic yet modern atmosphere. It gets crowded fast on the weekends so get hear early to get a table! Chia tea latte isn't the best I've had but the classic coffee is great! Free wifi makes it easy to study! It's my study spot for sure! Super nice staff and everyone looks like they are having a good time!

KnUWUC2nPZBRKxy5XKQXCw.text: So I have a bit of a crush on this place.  Lux happens to be about 20 miles away from home passed about just as many coffee shops but I find myself making the trek here several times a week.    I find Lux to be a bit of a love hate kind of place.  Parking can be  a battle because even though there are a lot of spots and on street parking, it can still be a battle finding a place to tie up your horse.  With free wifi and plenty of seating, Lux is a place you WANT to plop down for a while and do whatever it is you have to do but here it's "coolness" works against it as even with plenty of seating, It can be a bit like the 101 freeway at rush hour trying to find a place to sit.    I wish I could say the coffee was what brought me in but to be honest, it's average at best.  The SERVICE is pretty good and the staff friendly and attentive.  The food items i've had both baked and prepared freshly have all been adequate (the Mac n Cheese with bacon and Jalapeno was tasty, served in a large portion for the money and well executed but fire roasting the japapenos prior to adding them in would have elevated this dish to excellence!)  So what keeps me coming?  Well, I can't think of anyplace i'd rather to go hang-out, MacBook in hand, to get some work done and people watch.  The atmosphere here is GREAT!  A mixture or modern and retro furniture, exposed beam ceilings, varied work spaces, and locally produced art are on par with and in my opinion rival similar concepts in NYC, Seattle or San Francisco.  Did I mention the full bar?  Fancy an adult beverage to take the edge off of that paper you need to write or the power point you're putting together for the "big proposal" at work?  You're in the right place.  The bartenders here will gladly mix you up anything from a classic coctail to a trendy CenPho treat to whet your whistle.  I'd give Lux 4 stars if it were a bar that served food and happened to have coffee.  If your looking for great coffee i'd recommend Press Coffee Roasters, Cartel Coffee Lab or Echo Coffee. Lux is definitely my choice if you're looking for a place to socialize, sit and get a little work done, plow through homework or just hang out and people watch.  If the coffee were better i'd rate it 4 stars but as it stands, they only get the third from me because the whole package is so appealing.

9MBeaZ09-yqt1bQ2aeIsfg.text: Wildflower Bread Company at Arcadia Commons, 44 St and Indian School. I have frequented this restaurant  a number of times and repeatedly the tables are sticky and dirty.  The manage today, Karen, was rude when I had to send the food back twice.  When I told her I thought the grill was too hot because the pancakes continued to  be burned, she was rude saying it is always the  same temperature.  She walked  away and then handed me money and walked away without a word.  Don't eat here unless you want burned food and treated badly!

BXEZuBD2YlFrayCIHwDkzg.text: This is one super cool cafe/lounge.  They serve coffee, cocktails, and some quick bites that can go along great with your drinks.  There are several rooms you can choose from to sit and relax.  Art decor surrounds this stylish joint and just had a great time here sipping on coffee and chatting with a friend who recommended this coffee shop to me.  I noticed a younger adult crowd here but it doesn't matter.  Wi-Fi friendly, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. interior
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kAueum2h-N9YZkkrFwiESg.text: The coffee is great, the chai even better, and the pastries are fantastic.   Warm, laid-back, and welcoming. Plenty of room, but in almost every available seat sat a college kid with a MacBook. Isn't that the norm at a good coffee shop though?   Easy to miss if you don't know it's there.

YomyCHZiai7uk3SfyP014Q.text: Love this place! Wish Phoenix  had more places like these. Lux is a chill place where I can enjoy a good cup of joe while I get lost in my book. Their quiche is scrumptious and pastries/cookies are heavenly. I brought my sister and she loved Lux!   Subtracted 1 star for the parking. Space is  limited in the back

kDCUTtJQrFycNbi8BX5HEA.text: Love this place. My friend recommended me this place and I loved it from the first step inside. Food is awesome. Environment cozy and easygoing. Super!

vZo307hD6AOnF6oz3e0B-Q.text: After cartel in Tempe this is one of my favorite coffee shops in Phoenix! The staff is great! And the owner is often there so quality is always at the top.  The only real problem with the place is it's so popular it's often very crowded, if you want to meet someone there make sure to show up early so that you will have a spot. Outlets are plentiful and it's a great place to get work done. The food is delicious (and if you don't like it pane bianco is next door) and the pastries are dangerously good. The coffee is excellent and roasted in house. They're also surprisingly affordable, except for the meals and alcohol which aren't cheap but Aren't too expensive either.

pHxZ1OyoeSNdukOFCWzZTw.text: One of the best places in phoenix to have coffee. The atmosphere is always is always great.  A lot of very nice and hip people. The music is always good and the coffee is always spot on. They have a good variety of pastries. I have always had a great experience every time I visit Lux. By far one of the best and favorite places to lay back and relax with a cup.

l23u593OnnhnKvbKYJHyjw.text: Pastries and coffee are great.......everything freshly made and delicious.  The only drawback is that parking is a real b@#%* so many times I just don't go because it's too crowded.

bPgdM7a7fzQFi-OBy7bTrg.text: I love the food, the setting, all of it! Sometimes the staff is a little too lax, but for the most part, it's a great, yummy place to enjoy, have a meeting, or just chill.

8SMQIw60BpQVIrnuGRRM-A.text: Have been Lux several times now and each time our experience has been consistently the same....fantastic!!!  Their chai latte and coffee are great.  Their baked goods are tasty.  The service is friendly and energetic.  The only downside...lots of others apparently think the same SO it's crowded.  Expect to wait during peak times and it is crowded!

GswGaxnREFOu5NyeLgW1tQ.text: Good coffee. I bought 4 bags and all my friends were asking where I got those. I tried their pastry every bite was delicious. Their fruit omelet was light & delicious. I will try their pulled pork sandwich next time. The girl next to me ordered it and it looked so yummy. Be prepared to stand in line though cuz they obviously have many loyal customers.

q6kssDIoYefgOnReiBxlLA.text: These reviews are great, so mine is short.  The best coffee in Phoenix. Very good pastries and other food. The wine bar people get annoying when I'm having a study night. It gets too busy sometimes, which is a mixed blessing. Seating is either very comfortable or it hurts my back. Ambience is nearly perfect, except for the wine bar people. The music is very good. If it's too busy, I'll go to Lola or Copper Star. You can easily spend $10 on a latte and pastry, so it's a bit expensive.

wELS3biYxiQ4XIAwC1P0Sw.text: Of course you can get almond milk in your iced latte. Of course the waitress is 90 lbs and wearing a plaid headband with a pixie haircut. Of course everyone who needs to be seen working publicly is there with a laptop, and naturally there are no menus and everyone knows to go in the back...  But, fear not the Eau de Hipster that emanates from this lovely place!  There's also a gym buddy group drinking tea, my mom and I on a couch in the corner drinking coffee, parents ordering pastries for their toddlers, a husband and wife sharing a scone, and random dudes at the bar chatting up smiling strangers.  Just because it's a hipster joint, doesn't mean it's not an everyone else joint, too. And besides, almond milk is the shiznit in iced lattes, so let's just embrace it.

E485sseQ1m5gifO9-HLIig.text: Lux is just great for any occasion. Open late, they have great Mac and cheese the Yorkshire Burger is also delicious. Great coffee perfect ice tea( and I don't even like ice tea)  and cool bike racks . If you haven't been here come and try it. The atmosphere is also a plus.

at8WYeR43oEV7krCEo6OFw.text: This place is awesome.  I've been here no less than 50 times in the last couple years.  It's great for getting a beer/cocktail, great for dinner, great for lunch, and they have amazing/quick breakfast options.  I sometimes work from here for half a day on the free/fast wifi (there's plenty of power outlets in the back room area.  Highly recommend this place.  Well done, Jeff Fischer!

Jmkbdk0iOdmguMbBspil5Q.text: Lux is the coffee shop I go to when I find myself in phoenix on Wednesday nights. I always happen to go on the late nights, so this review may not be accurate for other times of the day.  The place feels crowded, especially with a wall right in the middle splitting the shop into two major rooms. Late at night, they will never have enough parking in their lot. This coffee shop and bar is always bustling with activity, making for a noisy atmosphere. They are very busy. This makes service and food prep times slow occasionally. But it's always worth the wait. The food and drinks are delicious.   Overall, the staff is friendly. But there have been a night or two when they let their exhaustion eat away at their good moods, and all they really want to do is get your order out and move along.  I have only ever ordered take out, but each time has been satisfying. Would definitely recommend if you are just going for the food.

_3arBMqGlJod-bZ7LPDESQ.text: I have a love/hate relationship with Lux.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE the coffee, but I absolutely HATE the atmosphere.  If you are a hipster sporting apple products and don't want to look anyone in the eye while walking around with a superiority complex, then this place is for you.  The service was not that great.  The baristas seem to think that they are doing me a favor by even looking at me, let alone serving me coffee.  That being said, I will still continue to come here.  The coffee is THAT GOOD!

OXfzCuCAqWN1OHfm6XBfpQ.text: Sadly, I only discovered Lux Central on my last full day in Phoenix. Happily, I discovered Lux Central while in Phoenix!  Enter via the door around back and be prepared for an amazing surprise. An eclectic clientele fills the eatery, so finding a seat at times may be difficult. We did come across the room in back where there are sofas and The like for sitting. Freshly-squeezed juices, hand made pastries, gluten-free and vegan options abound. My Americano was perfect, and my blueberry maple scone was a delicious taste of home.   Free wifi, amazing staff (Monica at the bar is a treasure), great food. What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iGAAoNJC_kd-fAl02D5RQg.text: Cool spot! Loved how they had a little bit of everything -coffee bar, pastries, real food, and real drinks (alcohol).  Lots of different areas to sit chat or do work! Coffee was good I got the mocha latte- wasn't biter at all! Will defiantly be back to try some of the other goodies

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee bar area
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mocha late! Perfect sweetness
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu options

jCMKisBNFsPqGSIiiHHWnA.text: I was visiting Phoenix on a work trip and a friend from there told me I had to try Lux. I stopped in straight from the airport for a second breakfast and to finish some work. 1) if you're going to need a quiet space this isn't it. 2) the music was good. 3) the people were nice. 4) they have bottomless coffee!!! 5) it's huge with plenty of seating. 6) my farmer market dish was awesome. 7) great people watching.  I recommend it and will be back.

2XySE0WNPrEOfh2Y6d4iBQ.text: DINNER. I debated all the way from Chandler where I could grab a bite to eat before the game I was attending. I didn't want to deal with waiters or waiting. I'm mainly a morning Lux patron but today I decided on dinner. I've already had the burger, steak, Mac and cheese etc. today I decided on the Tender Pork Belly BLT and mixed greens.  It was the perfect blend. To start, the artisan bread had flavor. Too often restaurants take for granted sides or basic ingredients. At LUX, if it doesn't improve the dish, they don't use it. No microwave here. Just the right amount of Bacon, Lettuce and Tomato with some type of aoli. This is so important. Some places don't focus on the taste but go for a big huge sandwhich filled with one ingredient over all the others. Well.... my big huge sandwhich blended perfectly without trying to pile it on for looks instead of taste. The vinagarette for the mixed greens is outstanding.  I wasn't in a particularly happy mood upon arrival but the down to earth cashier broke out a smile when he greeted me and changed my demeanor. And a double chocolate chip cookie for dessert.  Overall, I am glad I stopped in and am adding dinner at Lux to my options.  Oh and the cocktails!!!! Excellent. This is a unique place you will not find anywhere else

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sfs3qCV3pD_BC_iz_zTmsg.text: Lux is one of my favorite places to park and work for a few hours! I love ordering a  coffee and breakfast or a pastry! Their baked goods are out of this world and they always have seasonal treats! Sometimes, i'll meet a friend for one of their drinks by dialect (they literally make you a drink based on your favorite ingredients!). I have loved every drink that they have made for me! Their ingredients are so unique and fresh.   Lux has a super trendy/cozy atmosphere and it is right near the light rail and heart of Downtown Phoenix. I know that i'll be back soon to park and work for the morning/afternoon or to catch up with a friend!

44H5TWuWI40bEiAVzqsy5w.text: Interesting place. Vibe was weird, service was rather rude and coarse. Coffee was good, although as a coffee aficionado and an avid coffee shop adventurer there are far more entertaining and friendlier coffee shops in the valley. At the end of the day my experience was not terrible, but sub par to say the least. If you're looking for a good alternative to this place I would suggest Altitude Coffee Lab or Cartel Coffee.

to9SgR_643Mmh1Ay-vZQDA.text: Needed a pick me up.  Ordered a large ice latte.  Coffee was okay.  The chocolate cookie with salt on top was really good.  Soft, how I like my cookies . Great place to hang out and stay out of this 100 degree heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mvctg6KSq2ck0rgFfrD7_A.text: The desserts? They are everything. I've come here quite a few times, always trying a new pastry, and not once have I been dissapointed. Their Iced Chai is pretty great and their Passion Tea is really nice (charged, but not cloyingly so).  The only reason I give this 4 stars instead of five is because their floors are hard to maneuver if you have a disability like I do. The furniture is somewhat cramped and while it adds to the ~vibe~ it's embarrassing to be slowly and gently leading myself along a very careful path. Also, the stones set into the ground of their outside seating area--Don't get me started on what a minefield those are.  BUT seriously, this place is great. Food, atmosphere, drinks are all 10/10.

1a4SlluJQbmlbt4LlR-WMw.text: This spot is definitely hipster. I was recommended by a friend that used this place to study at. The place is pretty small and kind of anxiety-inducing because it was so packed and loud (definitely a younger crowd). There was no seating indoors so I sat outside at the picnic tables, near the parking lot.  The coffee was alright and the ordering process was confusing and lacked proper direction. There also wasn't really a waiting area for your coffee so I felt in-the-way most of the time.

8N28Oyk4TbbkSlYPmBsyng.text: I go to this place on Sundays and it's always really good! The place is lightly packed, but it's for a pretty good reason. The food is nice and healthy! They use veggies that are in season and the pastries are to die for. Never really had their coffee (not a huge coffee drinker), but their food and pastries are good. They have an area to do homework and huge TV in the back.

b4_ihizr77uEXA6JNvUQ8g.text: An unexpected find in the desert! I asked for an espresso-based sweet drink and the barista hooked me up with their black and white with house made whipped cream. Perfect balance of smooth and sweet. Right up there with the best I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House made whipped cream!

BhRV5z2IbV0GD0-XFa7iUQ.text: To be completely and brutally honest, Lux always sounds like a good idea, and it always disappoints. It's always way too busy to be comfortable, you can't really find seating even though it's a huge space. Good for them, though. Always packed, always making money. The food and drinks here are pretty mediocre. I love their mojitos but what's the point when you can't even enjoy it comfortably.

7yXkVJunKX--tGe2S7lNlQ.text: I started coming here when they opened. It has changed a lot! For anyone returning after a long time, you'll noticed they  moved into the cooler, larger building next door and gave their old area to Pane Bianco. The current building has an open sitting area but there are also 2 other rooms if you need it, but sometimes it's occupied so plan ahead.  Menu isn't the biggest I've seen but there is still a lot to choose from. They keep fresh food and a full staff on hand at all times so they can handle whatever is needed. You may think the staff comes across as "too cool for school" at first glance, but when you talk to them they come across as familiar, approachable and attentive.  Their famous coffee and other drinks are priced how you'd expect. When they were in the old building, I fell in love with the pastries. I was delighted to find that they had expanded on the amount of pastries available. The first thing I bought was a lemon cookie. Then I came back twice for those cinnamon rolls TWICE. I had to come back because they almost always sell out. The good news is, they sometimes make them twice a day. If you have something specific in mind(only if you are specific), just call ahead to see if your favorite item is up or not.  They have a full menu now, which is nice when you want to bring your laptop to do business and then stay for lunch. The meals and are a little expensive but I had a beautiful BLT with the most epic macaroni, which made both worth the price. I enjoyed it so much, I came back the next week with family and we ate breakfast with that same tender belly bacon kissed with a delicious char that was in my BLT.  Yea, everyone knows the atmosphere is trendy, but there are other points to bring out. The buy fresh flowers from the nursery next door sometimes, they keep local art on the wall, and the outdoor seating is great if you bring your well-behaved pet. Interestingly,just like a good Trader Joe's store, they have their own resident artist who keeps things hip and fresh. I would love a gig like that!  Last, I don't know why I like this, but I am in love with their eclectic interior design. Mid-century-modern furniture in an industrial style building with a rustic exterior. They even have industrial-style bathrooms. Someone pointed out to me the bathrooms usually have Charmin toilet paper, which may not matter, but it's the little things that count sometimes.

x0K5wdfpJHd54r3I5LRBvQ.text: LOVE THIS PLACE! Great atmosphere, food and coffee! Great place to go to study, or to hangout and relax with friends and family. If you have never been...GO! GO NOW! You wont be disappointed.

7dTfpdIKUfOHMAUJFh97uQ.text: This place is usually very over-crowded and tough to get to the service counter. The food is decent, but over priced in my opinion. The cold brew is delicious and a great deal for the price. I like the outdoor seating area a lot.

dVCeDsOxZNqjOcKywfaG5Q.text: Very hiiiiiiiiiiipsteeeer. I'm not much of a hipster but I still loved the laidback ambience. They have coffee, tea, adult drink and food, so whatever you feel like! Their grilled cheese is pretty awesome!

qLQl5v5ekNU0pMofnwFnpg.text: This modern Cafe is awesome! Very metro so don't have a bubble if you're going to study

OGp2ym4DsCYzXT6eiIVRng.text: I love the coffee, and location, design but customer service is everything to me (being a barista myself) but I came here a few times, the blonde girl was extremely rude and it makes me not want to come back..

8t_yExC9xQTP2Ue2kKAWXQ.text: Lux is one of THE BEST coffee houses in Arizona. From the friendly staff, to delicious handmade locally grown food, to the mouthwatering coffees and teas. I religiously order the red velvet latte hot or iced- both amazing. (When ordering ask for whip cream, they make it by hand.) Their mac & cheese is also to die for. They always have a different assortment of desserts & baked goods. If you ah want heard of this place or haven't been, please go. You won't regret it.

ZUdkL3Ny5_vAaFqlIH7Esg.text: This place used to be so awesome now there are always flies around the pastries and the couches are horrible, for Christ sake we pay 7$ for a latte and 5$ for a scone im sure this place can afford some new couches if i was homeless wouldn't even sleep on them they are all tore up and dirty and the ones in the back smell like Goodwill.

AVQYJn5sV5jG2ViZGFw_zg.text: Cool ambiance and the quiche was really good! The coffee cake was a little dry.   My mom and I went and got 2 quiches, coffee cake and coffee and it was $13. Very reasonable!

vAHPVKqTUbtoZ71U7tP7kg.text: Absolutely love this place. So happy this place has vegan pastries and they are so delicious overall had a great experience at lux also love the location !

muuRtxLzfQ5r2g7-K5OqsA.text: Wow! Great breakfast. No signs outside at all. So if you an find it, definitely eat here. The pork belly was delicious.  Great coffee.

L21do_99e2ifAQoD7akx2w.text: Traveled to Phoenix with my boyfriend and wanted to find a nice coffee spot to stop and relax a bit, so we found this establishment on Yelp.   We both ordered a hot latte and they were tasty and I would come back for another. Unfortunately, it was rather busy and the music was SO LOUD. Next time, I will just order my coffee to go or go to Be Coffee to enjoy their quieter atmosphere instead.

qUVn2nRVFJssgKvmnyLLng.text: Great coffee and great pastries. The place is really small so there is not a lot of room to seat but if you are grabbing coffee on your way to work then this is a good spot. Do make sure to be patient since their system is not as sophisticated as Starbucks or other mainstream coffee spots. They like to do it their way and sometimes it can take a little. Nonetheless, the wait is worth it.

fxUtxSeZfLr6lFh13aLu6g.text: I came here to have a meeting and I couldn't believe how difficult it was too find.  It sure would be nice to have a sign that faces the street, but that's probably too "commercial" for this place.  The tiny parking lot was full so I had to park a couple blocks down the street and walk; not a huge deal.  The inside was soooo loud and the music was blaring; I couldn't believe this was a coffee shop.    To be fair I did not taste any food or their coffee, so I'm sure there is room for improvement and I thought the outside space was quaint.  I will come here again with my friend who swears by this place and give the food and drink a try.  This places seems like more of a cool place to be seen then a coffee shop; I couldn't imagine trying to get any work done.

IFHMBAwMrKD2Pg7SQqts_A.text: By far one of my favorite spots for coffee.  My vanilla latte is always a subtle mix between coffee & sweet.  Their breakfast sandwiches are to die for, as well as all their bakery items.  Love the atmosphere, so many great places for some nice coffee pictures! A little crowded but definitely worth it!

yNGQFqxNUhQGxawDyS2GPg.text: Some of the best espresso beans! I have a semi manual espresso machine and these beans are always fresh and pull amazingly. This place is great for a quick pastry/coffee and hanging. Nice vibe as long as you don't go during rush hour. Not always the friendliest staff but LOVE their espresso.

DiVgwegOAf8VYwogpThJCw.text: Amazing little coffee joint. I came here on a brunch date with some friends a few years ago and fell in love with their caramel latte. The quality is great! Worth a visit!  Amazing atmosphere!

xSyJpUqgQLlvawAs2xJmww.text: Arguably the best iced soy mochas in Arizona. Perhaps beyond Arizona but my taste testing of mochas is somewhat geographically limited. I would hate to overstate.   This place has really tapped the arse of every possible stream of revenue. Coffee... fancy coffee... freshly squeezed juice, homemade pastries, sweet and savory, packaged cookies, breakfast lunch and dinner, cocktails  If you are lucky. Chocolate chip almond paleo cookies- but if you are GF, make sure to ask them to use a different spatula to avoid cross contamination!  My only gripe - (gosh even typing that word I sound grouchy!)... is that it seems they ALWAYS run out of gluten free baked goods EVERYDAY, VERY EARLY. AGHH! .... Seems like quite the missed opportunity for them. They do a great job at creating what they do, but golly, make MORE. If people ask you all day for these things, and you are always out at 10:00am. hmmm...   Anyways. When out of GF fresh goodies, you will be directed to bagged peanut butter cookies. Blah. No thanks.   Alright enough grouchy lady this morning! I do LOVE this place, love the vibe, the dutch pancake (savory) is crazy good etc.   Every Phoenician should know this place. Just saying..

EUJcsD_SbMXiOB1IefPmIQ.text: Nice coffee shop for those located in the area. Super  assortment of baked goods. Yummy breakfast food. Very bohemian-ish. Reminded me of the coffee shop in Friends. :)  Good place to meet up for social or business.

34FXr5mrw_scV0r0mWLjVw.text: I loved this place.  They have really good drinks with an awesome ambiance and great music.  They don't have many things to eat in the vegan department but it's a nice little cafe/bar.    Today I went for a meeting and the place was jam packed as usual.  I had just sat down in a corner spot and was setting up my laptop, notebook etc. when a very abrasive man asks if we're holding the two seats next to us.  We were not but it was a very tight space so I had my laptop bag and notebook there.  He answers for me and says no, you're not, takes the two seats and then a woman with an infant and one or two other kids join him.  He left us no choice but to pick up our things and move to another table.  He was so entitled and unapologetic.  I kept seeing him throughout the restaurant engaging with the staff so I figured he worked there.  After a quick google search I found out that the rude man was the owner.  I cannot believe that an owner would be so rude to customers.  I hate that this happened because I will not return to a once favorite neighborhood spot.

Tx_bB-nC5oPjt-GWRm9I2A.text: Employees are condescending a**holes, was told that I'm not "allowed" to down a cup of wine and instead, have to sip it. Absolutely idiotic.

Cvk7XdPNHkl-_Xo8ZA9Ycg.text: Holy cow I love this place! As crowded as they get, they still run like a well oiled machine. These people know how to handle crowds and do it well. Super amazing service, great DJ, fantastic breakfast and yummilicuos coffee drinks. My new go-to place during the week.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee + the World Cup.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch with the fambly.
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee before work with the Bean.

iseHdQMFXIDJ5EHE4mLxFA.text: I've only been here a few times, but each time it gets better and better. Staff is friendly and welcoming. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a fun coffee shop & study spot.

nzBAT-7a-APup0OeuL9A-g.text: Grabbed a quick breakfast here before our flight back to Seattle. After asking about options without egg, they told me I could order the oatmeal. While I wasn't particularly enthralled with the idea of oatmeal that morning, I went with it since breakfast with an egg allergy is often a difficult - so one option is better than none.  Holy hell, was I glad I opted for the oatmeal!! This might have been one of the best oatmeals I've had served to me yet! Served in a giant coffee mug, it was covered with a generous pile of warm toasted pecans and juicy raspberries, with a mingling of raspberry juice and (I think) maple syrup to sweeten the oats underneath. It was filling, it was simple, it was delicious, it was heavenly.   As I board my flight back to my home hundreds of miles away, I don't know whether I love or hate them for setting the oatmeal bar so high when I can't go back every time I'm craving this decadent bowl of oatmeal. :)  Coffee was also good!

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal was phenom!

Sv9WX1E2FzbYzIyGErL0tQ.text: All around nice experience with tasty treats and smooth coffee blends. The decor is laid back just like the atmosphere. I recommend it to anyone who wants chat or just kick back and chill!

TQdlQ_Mnpe7XiJ_C_Kk1nw.text: This place is very different from what I am used to going to. That have very interesting decorations and furniture around the place. I got my food and drink and was able to eat it in 10 minutes and be out. Keep in mind there was at least 10 people in front of me and every employee that I saw there definitely deserves their paycheck. I ordered the bacon, egg and tomato sandwich and was very satisfying. I had this strong coffee and decided to get another one on the go. Both drinks were very good and I am really impressed with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States

BRY2a4f-AfhuKcV3ZC54jw.text: Eclectic atmosphere  Java, Wine, Music, Wifi  & many places to lounge and sit comfortably. Great place to meet friends or just relax.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cafe Latte

pTubRX1EOtJpkRcmVnqH5w.text: Delicious baked goods. The salted chocolate chip cookies were ridiculously delicious & good brownies.  Service was fast & friendly. There was no where to sit & relax which is a good sign, so brought my goodies home to enjoy. Parking can be difficult as you enter right off central ave. But it's free, so that's good.

zNQvT2gEAsfXhEiZWMmmSg.text: I can overcome the hipster sneer and accept that I am an uncool blemish in a world full of cut-off corduroys and patterned leggings. What I cannot and will not get over is an unapologetic staff whose epic error led to me breaking 5 years of meatless eating because of an order mishap.  I ordered the red pepper tomato quiche. After 20 minutes waiting for the quiche to warm in what appeared to be a 200 degree oven, I double checked to make sure my name was on the plate at the counter. When I dug in for the first bite, a wave of nausea and panic washed over my after realizing this was a piece of the bacon spinach quiche. I returned to the counter and explained that I had ordered the vegetarian quiche, and the chic who took my order asked the chic behind the counter which one she served, because she was sure she got it right. The chic in the kitchen said she put them out in the order she got them. Then they spent some time looking around in confusion and murmuring a bit,  meanwhile all the quiche had been sold. So the counter chic simply turned to me and send, "well we don't have anymore of that one."  Thanks. I told her I was more upset about the fact that I had just put bacon in my mouth after 5 years of no meat than there being no more quiche. She did give me my money back, but no one apologized or offered me any recompense. I'm over you being cooler than me, but I'm not over you having no soul.

ie7VXSMs2G38N2D8pv3h3w.text: Love this place. Great atmosphere great coffee. Good music on weekends with DJ spinning house.

wguV9bilP6wdnb3_PGgQ6A.text: Dear Lord, this place is awesome. In fact, the only reason I didn't give it the full five stars is because, Dear Lord, is every seat in the place uncomfortable. Although, now that I think about it, you have to be EXTREMELY awesome to have this place packed on a daily and nightly basis when you know everyone's gluteus is miserable. Coffee A+, Food A++, The ability to make me feel like I'm not cool enough to be here A+++. But hey, I'll live... and go back frequently I might add.

-MT6fwfDmoTYZ1AqE9N6lA.text: Was introduced to this place by a friend, it seems as though this is where you can find all the hipsters of Arizona. :P  I do have to admit their coffee is damn good.  Two times I've been here I've had the cappuccino and it's been great.  The second time I went, I took some "Starbucks" drinkers and they enjoyed their cappuccinos straight up; sans a gallon of syrup and chocolate sauce.

8d_y86io679-gC1oKg-eEg.text: Excellent atmosphere, good seating and fast enough wifi for a cafe. Rush hour starts at 3pm, so arrive before.

ss_0lgAG6rFLifBdfZc1rQ.text: I'm torn on how to rate them. Four stars? Five? It's in between the two options, but I think just slightly closer to four. The food, especially the pasteries are excellent, the coffee is always perfect just as it is. I don't have to modify my order ever. The music is just a weird mix which is easy (usually) to tune out. My main complaint is theyre always busy so the service is always rushed and never friendly. I mean they're not rude, far from it. It's just that no one there is personable or warm.  I love the location though. It's walking distance from me, so I am there with my dog at least once a week.

w1321FnrkRntCOXaNP35nQ.text: Love this place. Awesome spot to get great drinks (booze and caffeine) as well as some grub. Open till 2am and cool decor. Def one of the "hipsterish" spots in town but not as bad as Cartel in Tempe and great place to work--just be prepared for crowds.

3-1MtWc4W6-UJ3lZVVPUEw.text: Make sure you don't have any conversation at 6:30 in the afternoon. Stay someplace else.. Not worth the money or time.

ywA65BIuivFFpmuY6xK43g.text: The staff seemed friendly enough but overall an out right terrible experience. To start the line is absurd. The place is packed shoulder to shoulder with your typical hippy/trendy mid to late twenties types. After waiting for what seems like an eternity you get to the front to place an order only to find out their out of almost every thing on the menu. At $4 for a single cup of sub par black coffee and 20+ min wait times, unless you're tied up in trying to be one of the 'cool' kids there's no reason to visit this establishment.

t7sHz7E7Hn-pw61OBV2L4A.text: As a coffee addict, I can say that I have tried them all and Lux is at the top of the totem pole for a good cup of joe in the Phoenix area. People come for the trendy atmosphere but they stay for the great coffee, delicious baked goods and many outlets if you're the 'work in a coffee shop' type!   I've been there many times and that's saying a lot considering I don't live particularly close to the downtown area. I always say that no date night is complete without a visit- it's the type of place where you can plop down on one of their comfy couches, order endless shots of espresso and stay up all night talking. The staff is very friendly. In fact, I came in on a particularly busy night (weekends get crowded but I've never seen it like THIS) and a worker stopped and had a good ten minute conversation with me, just chatting. Sometimes, great customer service really does say it all. Also, remember those scrumptious baked goods that I mentioned? They are AMAZING. I tried their flourless chocolate cake and it absolutely knocked my socks off. One last suggestion? Hungry or not, try their mac and cheese, you won't regret it!

hixpxvM788Nr9C7aDkllcg.text: Best coffee in Phoenix or anywhere.  4 star casual environment.  If I want a truly top shelve cup of coffee Lux is always at the top of my the list.

Iaz9HPK8Z7MzQ1Tt8XIdiA.text: Lux is one of the best coffee shops I have ever been to. Their baked goods are my favorite: delicious vegan donuts, French macarons, etc. Their coffee is also very good, the velvet is my absolute favorite coffee drink that I've come across. Also, I love how they have a breakfast, lunch, and dinner menu that is not only usually very appetizing, but it also changes every day.

Gen7xotGeuiXkX56gxIBeQ.text: Stopped here for our first morning in Phoenix cup of coffee, ordered a slice of walnut bread to go. This may be a hipster spot but could use a few soft spots to sit where the ugly grey stuffings not popping out,,,these seats look like germ city; tables look like they could use a good scrubbing; in the bakery area, toddlers walking around with bare feet and mommy is weaving thru the baked goods with her hair flying freely over to-be-baked-scones. Walnut bread was just right and they don't skimp on the walnuts.

1e1qKXmDNvlhHBbE-EguDw.text: I absolutely adore this place! It is so vintage and kinda rustic without being too hipster! Almost every piece of furniture in the place is unique and it has a very chill appearance. Every time I visit, the place is packed with students, artists, and business people.  The coffee is out-of-this-world good... and don't get me started on the whip cream, HOLY CRAP!!! My drink of choice is the Velvet latte. It's way better than Starbucks and I think the prices are the same or better. I would love to visit everyday, but sadly I live too far away.  They also have homemade pastries and treats that look delicious, some are even vegan and gluten free. Oh, and a bar!  If you haven't been yet, do so in the near future! And don't forget to hit up Pane Bianco next door!!!

AQhkpxONqvSNRsQkcKzFYQ.text: I'm usually a fan of ultra him snooty coffee places but this one was over the top. The service was downright rude on multiple interactions with them and the layout was disorganized and confusing.

8BuDmWCF-DJ20eTgXpfmZg.text: I had the tropical tea the first time I went and I was impressed. I live off tea. I'm not much of a coffee drinker but I was craving a good iced coffee this morning. The caramel black and white did not disappoint. I loved it!!!! Also, I tried a croissant because I love a good croissant and I had to stop myself from going back for another. New favorite place, and I'm excited that I work down the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tropical tea iced
Photo of Lux Central - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caramel black and white iced

eENICPKYM84Ni7vufAK0rQ.text: Love this place. Coffee, ambiance, and customers are all amazing food is pretty good too

15sM-cr4uCPu9ENgeqog1w.text: First time customer this week and it was very cool! I like the vibe and the crowd it brings in. You definitely don't see this type of places to often and I was pleased. The freshly brewed ice tea was delicious and the bakery items look phenomenal! I shall be back!

GbkpCzuUq-50rPvz3tOVUg.text: Lux is great. Set up with all the features than many-an-establishment might use to send off a douchey hipster vibe, Lux is as inviting as any other coffee shop I've visited. The staff is always friendly, the coffee is excellent, and, as an avid people watcher, it has a great atmosphere.  Seating can get restrictive but, generally, they've utilized their space well so I can't fault them for their popularity. The only knock would be that the music is sometimes turned up a bit loud -- but if that's the worst it has going for it, then I guess it truly is...."as good as it gets [five stars]"

Y3E7rJarjXbxiauQj04eiQ.text: This is a nice place, but it's constantly busy. It's difficult to get a comfortable seat to work. It's hard to concentrate because of the noise. The food and drinks (coffee and alcohol) are great though. I do like that it's open late.

IAu7gpY5GvCN88rhR17jlg.text: If I ever need a place to have a great coffee and work somewhere other than the hotel (I visit Phoenix often) or the office, this is a great place that is fun with good coffee, free wi-fi, and surrounded by a pleasant crowd which is a great cross-section.  Prices are reasonable, coffee and snacks are fabulous, and the staff seems generally happy to help you out, happy to be there, and enjoy what they're going it.  Even though the music is a bit loud to be "background" music, it's quite relaxing just when that's what's needed....especially on a sunny afternoon.  PS...if you ever want to smell what heaven smells like, walk down the back hallway.  The baked goods smell is AMAZING.

QlWLo6mK-MOVStpQYTzzlg.text: Lux is one of the best places to have a cup of coffee in central Phx.  The drinks are pretty good; they used to be better a couple years ago.  Maybe they changed there espresso, who knows?  I love their new location: it's designed so well.  I love mid-century furniture, so it's still a pretty nice spot to have a cup of coffee with my girl.  I haven't had the food yet, but I will soon.  Since they now serve food and drinks, there is more of a reason to go to Lux.

m-XstMN9lEOuHBFiRrjE5Q.text: Great customer service and Great Coffee! The owner knows what he's doing by hiring friendly baristas and bakers and providing quality pastries!  If the other coffee shops around town took notes and adopted similar ways of doing business, they would soon find their businesses to be booming, just like Lux!

O5VzUKdKH7SmRHyz_0QdlQ.text: From the coffee to the decor- I'm a big fan. Friendly & fast staff got me an iced latte quicker than you can say Swiss Miss.

w78Yst8Rcf6MlqFZwPtrTQ.text: A fantastic spot to land on a night when you can't seem to focus on getting that assignment done. Lots of little places to hide and be productive... with a great soundtrack to go along with it. I don't know, this place just makes me happy :)Thank you always being my late night study buddy - Love you, Lux xoxoxo

6cdH9RVc7bY-0hrm3G2dZg.text: Depends what you're looking for, but Lux is killing it.  They attract alot of people!  Coffee is good.  Its a little busy for me... food, pastries, wine, beer, big screen tv.  Not really my ideal coffee shop.  However, the patio SUCKS. Its pitiful, and a bummer when the weather is nice.

HgdHKGBCJ9hcVtanv7IWdw.text: I was just told they stop serving coffee at 10pm, not good, I am sorry it makes no sense to me I am curious how long the policy will last.  I love the coffee and the atmosphere

Gr_2y6giat5AcKt9c7UZmA.text: Iced vanilla latte was okay.  Not stellar but ok.  The cherry pistachio scone, now that was spectacular.

zGm-IfIfTPS45jTiH9iSZA.text: I went to Lux a few years back and had a really bad experience that made me not want to go back. In short, I'm a friendly guy and the owner was behind the bar and while he pulled my coffee I tried to chat with him a bit. I found him to be such a rude douchebag that internally I said 'This place will not last.' I took my coffee and left and figured I'd try the next place to open in this spot.  Well, Lux is still around. And so am I. And Monday night we met again And I was very pleasantly surprised.  The coffee was not that great - a bit too acidic. But that's a personal taste issue, so I'm not going to spend any time on that. The place itself is great. The couches and chairs have a very pleasant lived-in feel. There were MANY people in there, but it felt cozy, not crowded. I have driven by and seen when the patio is full and people are spilling out, and I would probably stay away at those times.  I have read reviews that said basically 'the place is full of hipster douchebags' but that's just bigoted nonsense. Yeah, the place is full of hipsters, but I found the ones I chatted with to be quite nice. Everybody seemed to be having a good time, or studying and smiling.  It's a great place. Loses a star for the poor coffee, and loses another star for that experience I had a few years ago (no Yelp then)

X3DrLvumyw4CFKhag6SPuw.text: Their music is too loud, I can't study! Also they need more gluten free items. I am a fan, and I love the owner. He is really nice and very helpful. There are a couple of workers that are a bit rude...maybe it's cause their young or something. ;)

8nsKuwkukRdjzfiwib4gJw.text: I love the atmosphere at Lux.  It is a great place to hang out, with a good vibe and interesting people.  I go to Lux regularly and will continue doing so.  Two dings: (1) sometimes the staff is standoffish and a little "too cool"; and (2) the baked goods are not very good.  I have ordered a brownie, cookie, cake, whatever, countless times and I am always a little disappointed.  If the baked goods were better I'd be here twice as often...then it would be the perfect coffee house/dessert place.

1mcMSjQILyDSV0nO6b92_Q.text: I love Pita Jungle chains, but I went to the one on Val Vista in Gilbert only to find out it is franchised and not the same.  I went for Happy Hour like I have done at all the others I have visited. Happy Hour menu was not offered.  I had to ask for it.  Then the waiter told me some items on the menu were not available at that location. He said all he had was a "corporate menu" which made no sense to me.  Then why give it to a customer?  I asked for a glass of the happy hour wine.  Guess what, that too was not available at that location.  I ordered the chicken with pine nuts and the falafel off the tapas menu. The chicken was awful--very dry and guess what--no pine nuts. Falafel was way overdone.  I sent both back.  I ordered a flatbread which was burned on the bottom.  I was done at that point. The waiter was very apologetic and said they had been having complaints about the happy hour.  He also said there had been lots of complaints about the chicken being dry. There is obviously management issues at this location. I will not be back.  There other locations in town that are much better.

h0Okj8YQONSeFMkyBC07QA.text: I really like this coffee bar, if you are driving north on central if you aren't careful you will most likely drive right by this place.  You have to make a U turn about a quarter mile from the actual entrance to the place.  Their hibiscus tea is my drink of choice and I do rather enjoy their pastries.  I go here quite often to study, but it definitely can be a little bit noisy in here.  There is free wifi and free refills on tea drinks.  I've had their mushroom soup and it was quite delicious.  From what I've been told, their lunch menu items are pretty good.  They also don't mind if you bring outside food when you come.

0gA2j3-OqDkIkiMjm11y_A.text: Great coffee shop, free wi-fi, great service! Can't ask for much more. Atmosphere is nice and cozy, and quiet.  Lots of people studying here I think.  Not me though. :o)  Has outdoor seating too.  Too hot in summer maybe, but great in winter.

i6OPxgEdPkBbHR6hxhKEyA.text: Very friendly folks, I used to feel that one had to get all dressed up to go there, but being as how I live right behind the place, I don't feel like getting all dressed up to get my morning fix, so I go in in sweats and a tshirt and no one says anything lol. Great Velvet, awesome homemade whipped cream, great experience! Oh, and guys it's cheaper than Starbucks, and way way way better, so give it a try!

EbJ5Iew64WtrUwzcX4-i-Q.text: Fantastic coffee.  TFG, I was beginning to worry that there was absolutely no coffee culture here in the valley.

308zACGwBczb5CZIiCvWGQ.text: What can you say about a place that hits all the right notes?  It is charming...funky...cool...fun.  There are several rooms and within those rooms, nooks and crannies so you can choose solitude or conviviality, depending on your mood.     The food is A+++++.   All the old favorites are there -- great coffee and melt-in-your-mouth pastries.   I personally have only been there for coffee...yet.    But I heard ooooohs and ahhhhhhs over the rest of the menu items.   You know it's good when people are planning what they will have on their next visit before they have even finished their meal.  There is a bar now and what looks like a very well chosen wine collection.   Enjoy!!!!

cpzHlLKLAv8giXzoPGPYVg.text: Whip cream .. red velvet .. yeah im going here tomorrow

bHGEaLVxDFD22RuVFUekPQ.text: This is one of my favorite hangouts. The staff is always friendly and have great memories and social skills. It is nice to always be greater with a smile and warm greeting no matter who is working. This coffee shop has amazing pastries made from scratch daily with a good variety. I have never had a problem finding an available outlet, which is pretty rare in a coffee house so centrally located and that does good business. You wont be disappointed. Cute and has a lot of character!

9qEepV0j6x4JdGnWSJU4yg.text: My wife goes here ever chance she get, but I refuse to go with her. Coffee deserves 5 stars but the chick behind the counter is so rude. I refuse to spend money at a place that lets it indie hipster staff treat regular Joe's like my self rudely.
